The Washington Post


June 8, 2003 Sunday  
Final Edition


Southern Maryland Crime Watch


SECTION: SOUTHERN MARYLAND EXTRA; Pg. T16


LENGTH: 249 words


The following are among reports received recently by the St. Mary's County sheriff's office and the Maryland State Police.  

For more information, call 301-475-8008, or the Crime Solver's Line, 301-475-3333.

The Leonardtown Barrack of the Maryland State Police operates a 24-hour crime tip line on which citizens may anonymously report information about crimes and related matters at 301-475-2936.

SEXUAL ASSAULT 

PARKVIEW DR., May 27. A man, 40, assaulted and attempted to rape a woman, 25, after he had stayed at a residence after a social gathering. He was charged with attempted second-degree rape and second-degree assault.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

QUIET ACRE LANE, 6:15 a.m. to 5 p.m. June 3. A telephone and duffel bag were stolen from a residence.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

FLINTLOCK CT., Sept. 20 to May 24. License plates were stolen from a vehicle parked at a residence.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

LEONARDTOWN, 6:15 p.m. June 2. A man, 36, assaulted another man, 39, at the St. Mary's Technical Center. He was charged with second-degree assault.

ROUTE 5, 6 p.m. May 18 to 7 p.m. May 19. Stereos were stolen from four vehicles at Leonardtown Ford.

DESTRUCTION OF PROPERTY

YORKTOWN DR., 8:30 a.m. May 25. Three male youths, ages 14, 14 and 13, punctured tires on four vehicles in the neighborhood. They were charged with malicious destruction of property.

ASSAULT

FRIENDSHIP SCHOOL RD., 10:48 p.m. May 28. A man, 35, assaulted a woman, 34, at a residence. He was charged with second-degree assault.

-- Bonnie Smith


LOAD-DATE: June 8, 2003

Prince William County crime report Prince William County crime report


SECTION: METRO; Pg. T22


LENGTH: 1006 words


Prince William County

These were among incidents reported by Prince William County police. For information, call 703-792-7245.

BRISTOW AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Vint Hill Rd., 12000 block, 11 a.m. to 2 p.m. Nov. 5. A stereo was stolen from a residence entered by forcing a back door.

DUMFRIES AREA

ROBBERIES

Dumfries Shopping Plaza, 17900 block, 6:51 p.m. Nov. 9. A group of males, one with a pellet gun, threatened two male teenagers and robbed one of a pair of shoes.

Quantico Terrace Dr., 3600 block, 5:57 p.m. Nov. 6. A man threatened a pizza deliveryman and demanded cash, then fled empty-handed when the victim got back inside his vehicle.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Tebbs Lane, 18200 block, 1:14 a.m. Nov. 7. A man broke into an occupied residence by cutting a screen to an unlocked window, then fled empty-handed when confronted. A neighbor, a 23-year-old man, was arrested. 

GAINESVILLE AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Virginia Oaks Dr., 7900 block, 12:23 a.m. Nov. 10. An attempt was made to steal a golf cart from a garage. A 26-year-old man was arrested.

MANASSAS AREA

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Manassas Mall area, Nov. 6. A man sexually assaulted an acquaintance. A 21-year-old Manassas man was arrested.

ASSAULTS

Coverstone Dr., 10900 block, 4:08 a.m. Nov. 11. A man struck a police officer responding to a report of a fight at a residence. A 20-year-old Manassas man was arrested on two counts of assault and for resisting arrest.

ROBBERIES

Community Dr., 8200 block, 11:26 a.m. Nov. 9. Four men threatened a pedestrian and robbed him of a wallet, then fled on foot.

INDECENT EXPOSURE INCIDENTS

Ashland Ave., 8000 block, 9:41 p.m. Nov. 12. A man standing near a window outside of a residence exposed himself to an occupant who confronted him.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Shallow Creek Loop, 9800 block, 7:30 to 8 a.m. Nov. 6. Cash was stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked front door.

TRIANGLE AREA

ASSAULTS

Purvis Dr., 18000 block, 3:22 p.m. Nov. 9. Two male juveniles threatened a male juvenile and chased him to his residence, where he was pushed to the ground.

ROBBERIES

Purvis Dr., 18100 block, 7:32 p.m. Nov. 9. A group of males, one with a pellet gun, demanded cash from a male pedestrian. After firing the weapon one time, the group fled empty-handed.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Kilmer Lane, 18100 block, 9 a.m. to 7:45 p.m. Nov. 9. A TV, a laptop computer and a bag were stolen from a residence.

WOODBRIDGE AREA

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Hamill Mill Park area, 6:40 p.m. Nov. 8. A man sexually assaulted an acquaintance in a vehicle after she had given him a ride to his residence. A 52-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

Lake Omiscol area, 12:41 a.m. Nov. 10. A man sexually assaulted an acquaintance. A 48-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

ASSAULTS

Castle Hill Dr., 3400 block, 3:59 p.m. Nov. 9. During an argument, a man prevented a female acquaintance from leaving a residence. An 18-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

Kolman Ct., 13000 block, 8:19 p.m. Nov. 9. During an argument with an acquaintance, a male was stabbed. He was taken to a hospital for treatment. A 25-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

WEAPONS OFFENSES

Brook Dr., 14400 block, 11:17 p.m. Nov. 6. Several gunshots were heard.

ROBBERIES

Crossfield Way, 14500 block, 8:01 p.m. Nov. 8. Two males demanded cash from a pizza-delivery person at gunpoint. When she said she had no cash, they robbed her of the food.

Minnieville Rd. and Savannah Dr., 8:49 p.m. Nov. 12. Three men robbed a male pedestrian of cash at knifepoint. The victim sustained a cut during the incident.

Stallion Ct., 12000 block, 6:56 p.m. Nov. 10. A man wearing a mask entered a residence through an unlocked door. After confronting an occupant who confronted him in the basement of the home, he fled empty-handed.

INDECENT EXPOSURE INCIDENTS

Veterans Dr., 14300 block, 1:08 p.m. Nov. 8. A man in a vehicle followed a pedestrian walking into a park, then got out and approached her. When she turned around to walk in another direction, he exposed himself, then ran away.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Choctaw Ridge Ct., 3000 block, 8 a.m. to 6:30 p.m. Nov. 9. A laptop computer, a tablet computer, a video game system, a camera and jewelry were stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked basement door.

Dillingham Sq., 12300 block, 9:53 a.m. Nov. 6. A woman being detained for stealing merchandise from a store kicked and spit at a police officer. A 52-year-old Woodbridge woman was arrested.

Eden Lane, 12400 block, 11:04 a.m. Nov. 6. A man tried to enter a residence through a basement door. He fled empty-handed when confronted.

Edgemoore Ct., 11200 block, 8 to 11:09 a.m. Nov. 7. Two video game systems were among property stolen from a residence entered by forcing a back door.

Evansdale Rd., 4500 block, 8:30 a.m. to 6:30 p.m. Nov. 12. An attempt was made to enter a residence by damaging a window. Nothing was reported missing.

Kraft Ct., 4900 block, 11:55 a.m. to 2:05 p.m. Nov. 7. A handgun and jewelry were among property stolen from a residence entered by forcing a back door.

Mapledale Ave., 14100 block, 8:30 a.m. to 6:20 p.m. Nov. 6. Two laptop computers, a video game system, video games and jewelry were stolen from a residence entered by forcing a side door.

Photo Dr., 13400 block, 8:30 a.m. to 12:30 p.m. Nov. 12. Jewelry was stolen from a residence entered by forcing a back door.

Photo Dr., 13500 block, 4:25 to 7:20 p.m. Nov. 11. A TV was among property stolen from a residence entered by forcing a back door.

Simmons Lane, 14400 block, 3 to 8:51 p.m. Nov. 10. Cash, a TV, a cellphone and jewelry were stolen from a residence entered by forcing the front door.

Tadworth Pl., 12600 block, 2:30 to 3:30 p.m. Nov. 11. Cash was stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked door.

Manassas

No report was received from Manassas police for this edition of Local Living. For information, call 703-257-8000.

Manassas Park

This was among incidents reported by Manassas Park police. For information, call 703-361-1136.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Conner Dr., 8200 block, 12:51 p.m. Nov. 3 to noon Nov. 7. License plates were stolen from two vehicles.

- Compiled by Sarah Lane

Crime Report


SECTION: EXTRAS; Pg. VA24


LENGTH: 3296 words


Fairfax County 

The following incidents were recently reported by the Fairfax County Police Department. For more information, call 703-246-2253.

Fair Oaks District

ROBBERIES

LEE JACKSON MEMORIAL HWY., 13000 block, 1:15 a.m. July 29. A man with a gun demanded wallets from two 20-year-old men. The men did not move, and the gunman walked away. No injuries were reported.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

LEE JACKSON MEMORIAL HWY., 12300 block. A BlackBerry was stolen from a residence.

MEADOWLAND DR., 10800 block. Jewelry was stolen from a residence. 

SCOTCH HAVEN DR., 9600 block. A wallet and an iPod were stolen from a vehicle.

SCOTSMORE WAY, 13300 block. A skateboard was stolen from a business.

SUGAR LANE, 3000 block. A watch was stolen from a residence.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

FAIRFAX TOWNE CENTER, 12200 block. A 2001 Nissan Pathfinder was stolen.

WHITTEMORE PL., 4500 block. A 2006 Mercedes-Benz was stolen.

Franconia District

SEXUAL ASSAULTS 

BARRETT RD., 6700 block, July 24. A 17-year-old girl agreed to meet a man she had met online for dinner and a movie, and the man allegedly abducted her and sexually assaulted her. An investigation led to the arrest of a 27-year-old Falls Church man, who was charged with abduction, rape, object sexual penetration and malicious wounding.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

AMESBURY CT., 7500 block. Cash and a folding knife were stolen from a vehicle.

BACKLICK RD., 5200 block. Cash and two cellphones were stolen from a business.

EDGEBROOK DR., 6900 block. A bag and a passport were stolen from a residence.

FLEET DR., 6700 block. A Global Positioning System device was stolen from a vehicle.

FRONTIER DR., 6500 block. An all-terrain vehicle was stolen from a business.

HEMING AVE., 5200 block. A lawn mower was stolen from a residence.

SIGNATURE CIR., 6800 block. Tires were stolen from a vehicle.

SPRINGFIELD MALL, 6500 block. Cash was stolen from a business.

WOODSIDE LANE, 7500 block. A 2006 Nissan Sentra was stolen.

FRYE RD., 8400 block, 7:55 p.m. July 26. A man with a flare gun attempted to rob a 17-year-old boy. A 42-year-old man of no fixed address was charged with robbery, possession of a firearm by a convicted felon, possession of a firearm in the commission of a felony, destruction of property and public drunkenness. No injuries were reported.

Fairfax City

The following incidents were recently reported by the Fairfax City Police Department. For more information, call 703-385-7809.

ASSAULTS

JERMANTOWN RD., 3900 block, 12:15 a.m. July 22. A man in his vehicle outside a convenience store reported that a male cursed him, sprayed him with a chemical and fled. The man was treated at the scene for the spray exposure.

ROBBERIES

FAIRFAX BLVD., 9500 block, 4:04 a.m. July 25. A male grabbed gold necklaces from a man's neck, then fled. Police found a 27-year-old Sterling man in the area and charged him with robbery and public drunkenness.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

CHAIN BRIDGE RD., 3900 block, 1:15 p.m. July 18. Cash was stolen from a briefcase in a vehicle in a parking garage.

FAIRFAX BLVD., 10300 block, 11 p.m. July 22. A purse containing cash, a check and prescription medication was stolen from an unlocked vehicle.

FAIRFAX BLVD., 10800 block, 7:41 p.m. July 24. A man and a woman consumed food in a restaurant, then left without paying the bill. A 31-year-old man and a 30-year-old woman were located in the area and charged with defrauding an innkeeper and public drunkenness.

FAIRHAVEN CT., 11100 block, 6 p.m. July 22 to 11:37 a.m. July 23. Two unlocked vehicles were ransacked, and several items, including a DVD player, an iPod, a wallet and a GPS device, were stolen.

FAIRVIEW DR., 3900 block, 1 a.m. to 12:01 p.m. July 25. Side mirrors were stolen from a parked vehicle.

JENNY LYNN LANE, 3700 block, PROVIDENCE WAY, 10500 block, STRATFORD AVE., 10400 block, DALE DR., 10200 block, 7 p.m. July 23 to 9:27 a.m. July 24. Twelve unlocked vehicles were entered, and items, including cash, tools and a GP System device, were stolen from eight of the vehicles.

LITTLEBROOK LANE, 11100 block, 12:30 to 11:37 a.m. July 23. An iPod was stolen from an unlocked vehicle, and a second vehicle was ransacked.

MOSBY WOODS DR., 10100 block, 9 p.m. July 20 to 12:18 p.m. July 21. Two motor scooters in front of a residence were stolen.

SPRING ST., 3100 block, 2:45 a.m. July 27. Three men attempted to steal copper from a utility storage yard, then fled as police arrived. Three Maryland men, 27, 21 and 23, were located in the area and charged with attempted grand larceny and possession of burglary tools.

WILLARD WAY, 10300 block, 11:47 a.m. July 27. A store employee stopped a male who had concealed two DVDs and had left the business without paying. A 26-year-old Herndon man was charged with petty larceny.

WILLARD WAY, 10300 block, 2:44 p.m. July 27. A store employee stopped a man from leaving the business with beer he had concealed in his clothing. A 40-year-old Fairfax City man was charged with petty larceny.

WILLARD WAY, 10300 block, 5:54 p.m. July 26. A male stole two packs of cigarettes from a pharmacy.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

PROVIDENCE WAY, 10500 block, 10 p.m. July 23 to 6 a.m. July 24. A 2002 Chevrolet Silverado pickup was stolen from a residence's driveway. The keys had been left in the unlocked vehicle.

VANDALISM

FAIRFAX BLVD., 9500 block, 10:02 a.m. July 21. The front door of a business was damaged.

FARMINGTON DR., 10100 block, 2:32 a.m. July 24. An unlocked vehicle was entered, and the glove box was ransacked. Nothing was reported missing.

KEITH AVE., 3900 block, 2 to 4 p.m. July 20. A window of a vehicle in the driveway of a residence was broken.

LOCUST LANE, 4100 block, 9:45 a.m. July 25. A window of a vehicle was broken.

MAIN ST., 9500 block, 7 p.m. July 24 to 9:35 a.m. July 25. Graffiti were spray-painted on a rear wall of a building.

UNIVERSITY DR., 3900 block, 10 a.m. to 1:16 p.m. July 26. The windshield of a vehicle was cracked.

WOODHAVEN DR., 10900 block, 3:30 a.m. July 23. Eggs were smashed on a door and the roof of a residence.

 Falls Church

The following incidents were recently reported by the Falls Church Police Department. For more information, call 703-248-5056.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

BROAD ST. E., 1000 block, 7:17 a.m. July 24 to 7 a.m. July 25. Two written prescriptions were stolen from the center console of a vehicle being serviced at an auto dealership.

HIGHLAND AVE., 700 block, 8:55 a.m. to 3:15 p.m. July 26. Two laptop computers, a Wii console with games, a camera, a ring and a bracelet were stolen from a residence.

ROOSEVELT BLVD., 500 block, April 15 to July 23. A Smith & Wesson revolver was stolen from a residence.

WASHINGTON ST. N., 300 block, 11:40 a.m. July 18 to 9:42 a.m. July 20. Two women entered a church and stole an employee's wallet containing cash, credit cards and a driver's license.

WASHINGTON ST. N., 500 block, 7:30 p.m. July 20 to 8 a.m. July 21. Cash was stolen from a business entered by force.

MISSOURI AVE., 300 block, midnight July 20 to 12:30 p.m. July 22. A plant holder was stolen from a residence's yard.

WILSHIRE DR., 1200 block, 4:44 p.m. July 19. A purse was stolen.

WILSHIRE DR., 1200 block, 9 p.m. July 22 to 5 a.m. July 23. A laptop computer was stolen from a vehicle.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

PALMER DR., 700 block, 4:43 a.m. July 20. A vehicle was stolen.

VANDALISM

ALABAMA DR., 1000 block, 9:50 a.m. July 25. A taillight of a parked vehicle was damaged.

CENTER ST., 700 block, 7 to 10 p.m. July 23. Outdoor artwork was damaged.

CYPRESS TREE PL., 1100 block, 8:28 p.m. July 21. Graffiti were found in the area.

ELDEN ST., 200 block, 12:26 p.m. July 22. An ATM was damaged with a hammer.

ELDEN ST., 1000 block, 7 a.m. July 21. Graffiti were found in the area.

ELDEN ST., 1200 block, 1:27 p.m. July 19. Graffiti were found in the area.

ELDEN ST., 1200 block, 2:57 p.m. July 20. A person threw bottles of nail polish inside a business.

ELDEN ST., 1200 block, 9:35 a.m. July 21. Graffiti were found in the area.

VAN BUREN ST., 800 block, 2:07 a.m. July 25. A man was arrested in connection with destruction of property and public drunkenness.

Vienna

The following incidents were recently reported by the Vienna Police Department. For information, call 703-255-6396.

INDECENT EXPOSURE

MAPLE AVE. W. AND THE OLD DOMINION TRAIL, 6:40 p.m. July 24. A male bicyclist rode past a woman, then removed his shorts and made a statement to draw her attention, then fled. A short time later, he rode by again and apologized. Police were unable to locate the man.

ASSAULTS

GLYNDON ST. SE, 400 block, 2:54 a.m. July 24. A plainclothes bicycle patrol officer was suspicious about a male and questioned him. The male pushed the officer and fled. Police were unable to locate him.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

MAPLE AVE. E., 200 block, 12:22 p.m. July 23. A set of keys and earphones were stolen.

PLUM ST. SW, 700 block, June 29 to July 28. A bicycle was stolen from a garage of a residence.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

CEDAR LANE SE, 200 block, 3 to 7 a.m. July 27. Two mopeds were stolen from a parking area.

VANDALISM

MAPLE AVE. W., 500 block, 11:30 p.m. July 24. Beer was poured on a parked vehicle after people were asked to remove their beer bottles in front of a business.

Charles Crime


SECTION: SOUTHERN MARYLAND EXTRA; Pg. T20


LENGTH: 257 words


The following are among reports received recently by the Charles County sheriff's office and the Maryland State Police. For more information, call 301-932-2222 or 301-870-3232.  

 Crime Solvers will pay a reward for information leading to an arrest and an indictment in connection with these and any other felony crimes. Call the 24-hour hotline at 800-673-2777. Callers may remain anonymous.

The Charles County sheriff's office Web site is at www.ccso.us. Included at the site are daily news releases, Crime Watch neighborhood statistics, community services, crime prevention programs and career opportunities.

SEXUAL ASSAULT 

BRYANS ROAD, midnight-1 a.m. April 14. A man picked up a woman, 39, in Southeast Washington and drove to the Bryans Road area where he sexually assaulted her. He left the woman in a parking lot of a townhouse complex and fled. He was driving a late model teal Buick Skylark.

ROBBERY

MARSHALL HALL RD., 3100 block, 8:23 p.m. April 15. Two men robbed and assaulted another man, 45. The suspects fled the scene on bicycles.

ASSAULT

HANOVER CT., 2400 block, 12:38 a.m. April 17. A woman, 21, assaulted a man at a residence. She was charged with second-degree assault.

THEFT/BREAK-INS

FESTIVAL WAY, 2900 block, 10 p.m. April 19 to 6 p.m. April 20. A safe with undetermined contents, a small refrigerator, a microwave oven and other property were stolen from the Factory Card Outlet.

VEHICLE THEFT

ACTON LANE, 11900 block, 9 to 9:45 a.m. April 19. A 1989 Chevrolet Suburban was stolen from a parking lot.

-- Bonnie Smith

Prince William County

These were among incidents reported by Prince William County police. For information, call 703-792-7245.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Dunstable Loop, 8700 block, 4:45 to 8 p.m. Nov. 24. Cash was stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked window.

Whinney Ford Ct., 13300 block, 9:21 p.m. Nov. 24. A safe containing jewelry and prescription medicine was stolen from a residence entered by damaging a window. 

DUMFRIES AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Four Seasons Dr., 17600 block, 6 p.m. Nov. 17 to 11:57 a.m. Nov. 20. Jewelry was stolen from a residence.

GAINESVILLE AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

John Marshall Hwy., 14200 block, 6:15 p.m. Nov. 19 to 5:55 a.m. Nov. 20. Copper wire was stolen from a warehouse entered by forcing a door.

Prices Cove Pl., 7200 block, 1:15 to 5:15 p.m. Nov. 18. Jewelry was stolen from a residence entered by forcing a window.

Senea Dr., 13700 block, 5 p.m. Nov. 21 to 7 a.m. Nov. 24. Two condensers and two furnaces were stolen from a residence.

MANASSAS AREA

SEXUAL ASSAULT

Royal Fern Circle area, 3:54 a.m. Nov. 22. During an argument, a man sexually assaulted a female acquaintance. A 34-year-old Chantilly man was arrested.

ASSAULT

Coverstone Dr., 10900 block, 4:34 p.m. Nov. 25. During an argument, two male juveniles stabbed a male acquaintance and attempted to take his necklace. The acquaintance was treated for injuries. Two Manassas males, 15 and 17, were arrested.

ROBBERY

Sudley Rd., 8200 block, 10:51 p.m. Nov. 25. Three males chased a man from a restaurant. They assaulted him and robbed him of a cellphone.

THEFT/BREAK-IN

Nodi Ct., 7900 block, 7:40 a.m. to 3:30 p.m. Nov. 24. Cash was stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked basement window.

TRIANGLE AREA

THEFT/BREAK-IN

Kilmer Lane, 18100 block, 6 a.m. Nov. 21 to 4:47 p.m. Nov. 22. A TV and a video game system were stolen from a residence entered by forcing a front door.

WOODBRIDGE AREA

SEXUAL ASSAULT

Hope Ct. area, August to Nov. 20. A man had a sexual relationship with a female juvenile. A 24-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

ROBBERIES

Jefferson Davis Hwy., 14400 block, 1:22 p.m. Nov. 24. A male grabbed a cellphone from a male pedestrian and fled.

Old Bridge Rd., 1300 block, 6:16 p.m. Nov. 23. Three men robbed a gas station store of cash at gunpoint.

Potomac Heights Pl., 14700 block, 9:09 p.m. Nov. 25. Two gunmen in a residential parking garage demanded property from a woman and a man. The man fled, and one of the gunmen chased him. The other gunman took the woman to a residence. The first gunman returned with another woman. The gunmen took cash and a wallet from the women, then fled.

INDECENT EXPOSURE

Gideon Dr. and Smoketown Rd., 11:58 a.m. Nov. 17. A male motorist exposed himself to a female motorist stopped next to his vehicle. A male motorist exposed himself to another woman earlier in the day at Old Bridge Road and Mohican Drive. A 49-year-old Fredericksburg man was arrested.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Alliance Lane, 2900 block, 9 a.m. Nov. 22 to 8 a.m. Nov. 23. Cash and jewelry were stolen from a residence entered by forcing a bathroom window.

Bentley Cir., 13500 block, 8:50 a.m. to 2:40 p.m. Nov. 14. Two video game systems, an MP3 player and jewelry were stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked window.

Daniel Stuart Sq., 1900 block, 2 to 11:30 a.m. Nov. 23. Cash was stolen from a business entered by breaking a front glass door.

Featherstone Rd., 1500 block, 5 a.m. to 6:30 p.m. Nov. 22. A residence was entered by forcing a front door. Nothing was reported stolen.

Walnut St., 1500 block, noon to 12:12 p.m. Nov. 20. A residence was entered by forcing a rear door. A safe was pried open. Nothing was reported stolen.

Wentwood Lane, 15200 block, 2:08 p.m. Nov. 20. An attempt was made to enter a residence by forcing a door.

Manassas

No reports were received from Manassas police for this edition of Local Living. For information, call 703-257-8000.

Manassas Park

No reports were received from Manassas Park police for this edition of Local Living. For information, call 703-361-1136.

Prince William County crime report


SECTION: METRO; Pg. T20


LENGTH: 902 words


Prince William County

These were among incidents reported by Prince William County police. For information, call 703-792-7245.

DUMFRIES AREA

ASSAULT

Chesapeake Dr., 3100 block, 10:52 a.m. Aug. 6. During an argument, a woman cut a male acquaintance with a knife. The man was treated for injuries. A Dumfries woman, 61, was arrested.

WEAPONS

Fettler Park Dr., 3700 block, 5:30 p.m. Aug. 7 to 7 a.m. Aug. 11. Someone fired a weapon at a building. A bullet went through a second-floor window and lodged in an interior wall. 

GAINESVILLE AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Lee Hwy., 14400 block, 8:07 p.m. Aug. 8. A business was entered. Several windows were broken, and several doors were damaged. A 38-year-old man was arrested.

Newbern Loop, 14300 block, 8 a.m. to 11 p.m. Aug. 8. Food was stolen from a residence.

MANASSAS AREA

ROBBERY

Coverstone Dr., 10900 block, 8:58 p.m. Aug. 7. Two males entered a residence and demanded money from a male occupant, who refused. They assaulted the man and robbed him of a wallet. When police responded, a female juvenile hit an officer in the face. A 20-year-old man and a 17-year-old female, both of Herndon, and a 17-year-old male of Woodbridge were arrested.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Browns Lane, 8300 block, 11:30 p.m. Aug. 5 to 5 p.m. Aug. 6. A business was entered, and an interior door was damaged. Nothing was reported stolen.

General Longstreets Line, 3 to 6:30 a.m. Aug. 9. A GPS device, a branch trimmer, a leaf blower and two chain saws were stolen from a garage entered by using a door opener from a vehicle parked in a driveway.

Golden Leaf Cir., 11300 block, 10 a.m. to 12:20 p.m. Aug. 9. Documents were stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked window.

TRIANGLE AREA

SEXUAL ASSAULT

White Oak Dr. area, 1:30 a.m. Aug. 9. A man sexually assaulted a female juvenile acquaintance. The man then took a black 2006 Dodge Ram 1500 from the 17400 block of Isle Royal Terrace in Dumfries.

ROBBERY

Jurgensen Dr., 3600 block, 12:18 a.m. Aug. 10. Two gunmen demanded money from a man. They assaulted him and robbed him of a wallet, cellphone and keys.

WOODBRIDGE AREA

SEXUAL ASSAULT

York Dr., 2200 block, 3:15 a.m. July 12. Through a car transportation service, a man picked up two women in Arlington and drove them to a destination. He got out of the vehicle and inappropriately touched one woman. An Annandale man, 58, was arrested.

ASSAULTS

Berkshire Dr., 14300 block, 6:48 p.m. Aug. 5. During an argument, a woman with a knife chased a male juvenile acquaintance through a residence. The juvenile hit the woman in the face. A Woodbridge woman, 38, was arrested.

Farm Creek Dr., 15100 block, 11:35 p.m. Aug. 5. During an argument, a man assaulted a male acquaintance by cutting his arm with a knife. The acquaintance was treated for injuries. A Dumfries man, 50, was arrested.

Golansky Blvd., 3000 block, 2:30 a.m. Aug. 8. During an argument, a woman stabbed a female acquaintance several times with a box cutter. A Woodbridge woman, 23, was arrested.

Granada Way, 12200 block, 5:30 p.m. Aug. 5. During an argument, a man hit a male acquaintance, who was treated for injuries. A Woodbridge man, 22, was arrested.

WEAPONS

Minnieville Rd., 14400 block, 6:22 p.m. Aug. 9. During an altercation about a parking space, a male motorist pointed a firearm at another male motorist, who fled. The first motorist followed him on a motorcycle. When they stopped at a light, the first male approached the other man's vehicle and kicked it several times.

Strickland Ct., 1800 block, 1:12 a.m. Aug. 11. Several bullets were fired at a residence, breaking a window.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Bountiful Lane, 3400 block, 6 p.m. Aug. 5 to 5 p.m. Aug. 6. A business was entered, and an interior door was damaged. Nothing was reported stolen.

Dale Blvd., 4900 block, 2 p.m. Aug. 5 to noon Aug. 6. An attempt was made to enter a school by cutting screens of two windows.

Hayes Lane, 16000 block, 3 p.m. Aug. 4 to 3 p.m. Aug. 5. An attempt was made to enter a residence through a basement door.

Iowa Ct., 1700 block, 7:34 a.m. Aug. 5. Someone entered an occupied residence by damaging a rear door. Nothing was reported stolen.

Knoll Dr., 4500 block, 3:30 a.m. July 31 to 8 p.m. Aug. 9. Cash, ammunition, a video game system and clothes were stolen from a residence entered by breaking a window.

McIntire Dr., 12400 block, 12:50 to 1:10 a.m. Aug. 6. Three male juveniles forcibly entered the rear of a pool house. They fled with a TV and a camera.

Potomac Mills Cir., 2700 block, 7:25 a.m. Aug. 8. A male entered a restaurant by damaging a front door. He took money from a cash register and fled through a rear door.

Roeburn Ct., 4300 block, 6 p.m. Aug. 4 to 5 p.m. Aug. 5. An attempt was made to enter a residence through a second-floor window.

Westminster Lane, 14300 block, 7:30 a.m. to 4:45 p.m. Aug. 6. Cash and jewelry were stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked window.

Manassas

These were among incidents reported by Manassas police. For more information, call 703-257-8000.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Jayhawk Terr., 9500 block, 9 p.m. Aug. 7 to 5 p.m. Aug. 9. A black handgun was stolen from a vehicle.

Peabody St., 9400 block, 5 p.m. July 31 to 1:10 p.m. Aug. 5. Thirty-eight 30-pound cylinders of refrigerant were stolen from a shed.

Manassas Park

No incidents were reported by Manassas Park police for this edition of Local Living. For information, call 703-361-1136.

Howard County Crime Watch


SECTION: HOWARD EXTRA; Pg. T14


LENGTH: 756 words


The following were among crime reports recently received by the Howard County Police Department. For more information call 410-313-2236.

REWARDS FOR INFORMATION

Metro Crime Stoppers, a nonprofit organization, will pay up to $ 2,000 for information leading to an arrest and indictment in connection with these and any other felonies. Call the 24-hour hotline at 410-276-8888. Callers may remain anonymous.  

 SEXUAL ASSAULTS 

GREEN MOUNTAIN CIR., 5000-5500 block, 5:15 to 10:31 a.m. June 28. A man at a residence sexually assaulted a female resident who had been asleep on a sofa. The resident grabbed a phone, fled to a neighbor's residence and called police. Police found a man inside the residence. A man, age 42, was arrested.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

BARCHINK PL., 6400 block, 8:23 p.m. July 2. A person entered and ransacked a residence of an acquaintance.

COTTONWOOD WAY, 10700 block, 7:35 p.m. July 1. A bicycle was stolen from a residential garage.

COTTONWOOD WAY, 10700 block, 7:30 p.m. July 1. Two bicycles were stolen from a residential garage.

GUILFORD RD., 9100 block, 3 p.m. July 1 to 7 a.m. July 2. Electronic equipment was stolen from a business.

LITTLE PATUXENT PKWY., 11600 block, 11:30 p.m. June 27 to 11:20 a.m. June 28. A neighborhood pool area was entered. An attempt was made to enter the snack area. Nothing was reported missing.

RIVERPARK RD., 9400 block, 7:30 a.m. to 8 p.m. June 22. A vehicle, electronic equipment and jewelry were stolen from a residence.

SNOWDEN RIVER PKWY., 9000 block, 4:29 a.m. June 30. A restaurant was entered. Nothing was reported missing.

WEATHER WORN WAY, 7500 block, 5:35 p.m. July 1. A residence was entered and ransacked. Nothing was reported missing.

WILLOW BOTTOM DR., 11000 block, 10:46 p.m. June 29 to 6:15 a.m. June 30. Several bottles of alcohol were stolen from a bar.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

COLLEGE SQ., 10300 block, 1:51 p.m. June 26. A 1995 Ford Mustang was stolen.

HARPERS FARM RD., 5300 block, 7:51 a.m. June 27. A silver 2000 Honda Civic was stolen.

HAYSHED LANE, 8500 block, 4:06 a.m. June 28. A silver 2002 Mazda was stolen.

WILD LILAC, 5400 block, 1 p.m. June 30 to 6 p.m. July 2. A white 1988 Honda Accord was stolen.

ROBBERIES

CRITTER CT., 5800 block, 9:22 p.m. June 29. Two males robbed a 16-year-old boy of a cell phone.

DORSEY RD., 6700 block, 12:50 a.m. June 27. A female armed with a handgun in a hotel robbed a clerk of cash.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

MEADOW ROSE CT., 5900 block, 9 p.m. June 27 to 10 a.m. June 28. A green 1995 Acura Integra was stolen.

WASHINGTON BLVD., 6100 block, 4:56 a.m. July 2. A 1994 Toyota Camry was stolen.

INDECENT EXPOSURE

BALTIMORE NATIONAL PIKE, 10000 block, 6:09 p.m. June 26. A male standing under a tree was seen taking his pants off.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

CORPORATE CT., 3200 block, 5:09 p.m. July 2. Electronic equipment was stolen from an apartment.

EMILY FOX CT., 10000 block, 7:10 a.m. June 25. Lawn equipment was stolen from a garage. A person was seen leaving the area in a blue pickup truck.

MORNING RIDE CT., 4600 block, 10:35 p.m. June 25 to 6:30 a.m. June 26. Electronic equipment was stolen from a residence.

MOUNT IDA DR., 3600 block, 6:45 a.m. to 6:30 p.m. June 27. A VCR and several cans of beer were stolen from a residence.

WHEATFIELD WAY, 8500 block, 7:30 to 11 p.m. June 28. A man was found asleep in an upstairs bedroom at an otherwise unoccupied residence of an acquaintance. A 26-year-old man was arrested.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

MAYFAIR CIR., 7800 block, 11 p.m. June 27 to 6 a.m. June 28. An attempt was made to steal a red 1997 Ford van.

WASHINGTON BLVD., 9900 block, 11:30 p.m. July 1 to 2 p.m. July 2. A gray 2000 Chevrolet truck was stolen.

WOOD PARK LANE, 7600 block, 9 p.m. June 28 to 7 a.m. June 29. A green 2001 Toyota Highlander was stolen.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

LOVAT RD., 9400 block, 8:22 p.m. July 1. A bicycle was stolen from a residential garage.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

STAYTON DR., 8200 block, 1:42 p.m. June 28. A white 1994 53-inch utility trailer was stolen.

ROBBERIES

ALL SAINTS RD., 9200 block, 11:40 p.m. June 28. A man pulled a handgun on a person in a vehicle, ordered the person out, then drove away with the vehicle. Police saw the vehicle and stopped it. A 33-year-old man was arrested.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

RIDINGS WAY, 9300 block, 10 a.m. to 6:30 p.m. June 26. Alcoholic beverages and soft drinks were stolen from a residence.

INDECENT EXPOSURE

RIVER ISLAND DR., 8900 block, 11 p.m. July 1. A male exposed himself to a person.

Prince William County crime report Prince William County crime report


BYLINE: Compiled by Sarah Lane


SECTION: Metro; Pg. T22


LENGTH: 605 words


Prince William

These were among incidents reported by Prince William County police. For information, call 703-792-7245.

DUMFRIES AREA

ROBBERIES

Kilpatrick Pl., 2400 block, 8:55 p.m. May 3. A person assaulted a male pedestrian and robbed him of cash.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS 

Jefferson Davis Hwy., 17400 block, 11 p.m. May 2. A business was entered by breaking glass in a front door.

Live Oaks Ct., 4900 block, 6:40 a.m. to 6:30 p.m. April 29. Cash was stolen from a residence.

GAINESVILLE AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Sedge Wren Dr., 8500 block, Dec. 11 to April 16. A woman used funds from a school's Parent Teacher Organization for personal purchases. A 35-year-old Gainesville woman was arrested.

WOODBRIDGE AREA SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Evansdale Rd., 4600 block, 9:58 p.m. May 2. A man sexually assaulted a female juvenile relative. A 32-year-old Orlando man was arrested.

ASSAULTS

Culpeper Dr., 2100 block, 6:02 p.m. May 5. During an argument, a woman hit a male acquaintance in the head with a tire iron. A 23-year-old Woodbridge woman was arrested.

Gableridge Turn, 1900 block, 10:40 p.m. May 6. A woman forcibly entered a residence and assaulted a female acquaintance. A 26-year-old Woodbridge woman was arrested.

Jefferson Davis Hwy., 13900 block, 7:27 p.m. May 5. A man hit a male pedestrian in the face and fled. The pedestrian was treated for injuries.

Pomander Lane, 13400 block, 10:07 p.m. May 3. During an argument, a man assaulted a female acquaintance. A 28-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

CHILD NEGLECT

Foulgers Sq., 13700 block, 12:36 p.m. May 4. A woman left two young girls unattended in a vehicle. A 36-year-old Lorton woman was arrested.

ROBBERIES

Old Bridge Rd., 1300 block, 9:28 a.m. May 3. A gunman robbed a business of cash and a purse.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Barksdale St., 14700 block, 10:24 p.m. May 2. A man entered a residence through a front door. A female resident and a man were able to get the intruder to leave. A 21-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

Bismark Ave., 14300 block, 12:45 to 9 p.m. May 2. An attempt was made to enter a residence by damaging a front door.

Manassas

These were among the incidents reported by Manassas police . For more information, call 703-257-8000.

ROBBERIES

Digges Rd., 8400 block, 9:30 p.m. April 26. During an argument in a convenience store, a man took property from another man. A 31-year-old Burke man was arrested.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Amberleigh Ct.,10000 block, midnight to 9 a.m. May 2. A trailer was stolen from a residence.

Devonshire Ct., 8600 block, midnight May 6. One of two men forcibly entered a residence through a sliding-glass door. A 31-year-old Remington man and a 30-year-old Manassas man were arrested.

Fernwood Ct., 9300 block, May 1 to May 2. Power tools and change were stolen from a shed and two unlocked vehicles.

Mathis Ave., 9000 block, 11:30 a.m. April 29. A man took cash from a business.

Wakeman Ct., 10700 block, 4 p.m. May 2 to 9 a.m. May 3. Power tools were stolen from a storage container.

Manassas Park

These were among the incidents reported by Manassas Park police. For more information, call 703-361-1136.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Centreville Rd., 8500 block, 2:55 p.m. May 4. A man attempted to take merchandise from a store at a gas station. A 32-year-old man was arrested.

October 18, 2007 Thursday

Crime Report


SECTION: EXTRAS; Pg. PW33


LENGTH: 1511 words


Prince William

These incidents were reported by Prince William County police. For more information, call 703-792-7245.

Dale City Area

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

EDGEWATER DR., 14800 block, 5:30 p.m. Oct. 2. A man tried to enter a residence through a front door. A resident heard a noise and saw him drive away in a silver vehicle.

FERNDALE RD., 1400 block, 10 p.m. Oct. 2 to 7 a.m. Oct. 3. Cash and documents were stolen from church offices entered by forcing doors. The offices were ransacked.

FORESTDALE AVE., 3400 block, 11 p.m. Oct. 8 to 6:30 a.m. Oct. 9. Two saws, two generators, a compressor, a saw stand, a drill and an air gun were stolen from work vans. 

KENWOOD DR., 4600 block, 6:30 a.m. Oct. 2 to 1 a.m. Oct. 4. Cash, a laptop computer, a Global Positioning System device, golf clubs and a chainsaw were stolen from a building entered by breaking a window.

Dumfries Area

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

JOHN ROBINSON LANE, 3200 block, 6 a.m. to 4 p.m. Oct. 8. A black 2007 Honda Civic was stolen.

Gainesville Area

ROBBERIES

NEWBERN LOOP AND LEGEND DRIVE, 2:05 a.m. Oct. 5. A man attacked a woman and tried to take a car key from her. When she fell to the ground, he fled empty-handed.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

HEATHCOATE BLVD., 15100 block, 1:45 p.m. Oct. 4. An air gun was stolen from a construction site.

OLD CAROLINA ROAD AND JAMES MADISON HIGHWAY, midnight to 6 a.m. Oct. 3. A 2007 Bobcat excavator was stolen from a construction site.

Manassas Area

SEXUAL ASSAULTS 

TOWN LANE, 9800 block, Oct. 1. A man sexually assaulted a girl. A 25-year-old Manassas man was arrested. .

WEAPONS OFFENSES

MAXFIELD CT., 5900 block, 5:26 p.m. Oct. 3. Police investigating a report of a domestic argument heard shots being fired in a residence. After family members had vacated the home, officers talked the gunman into walking out, then arrested him without incident. A 58-year-old Manassas man was charged with reckless handling of a firearm.

ROBBERIES

CUB RUN CT., 10200 block, 11:06 p.m. Oct. 4. Two juvenile males assaulted a pedestrian and robbed her of a purse.

KING GEORGE DRIVE AND STRASBURG STREET, 2:50 p.m. Oct. 1. A woman got out of a tan vehicle, assaulted a pedestrian and took her book bag. Two other women got out of the vehicle and punched and kicked the victim, knocking her to the ground. The assailants fled in the vehicle.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

ASHTON AVENUE AND WILLOUGHBY LANE, 8 p.m. Sept. 30 to 6 a.m. Oct. 1. A paint sprayer was stolen from a van entered by breaking a window.

CENTREVILLE RD., 7500 block, 4:30 p.m. Oct. 1 to 8 a.m. Oct. 2. A Global Positioning System device and a stereo were stolen from a vehicle entered by breaking a window.

SHOPPERS SQ., 8200 block, 10:05 p.m. Oct. 4. Cash and a purse were stolen from an unlocked vehicle.

SUDLEY RD., 7300 block, 9 p.m. Oct. 3 to 5:18 a.m. Oct. 4. A safe box containing cash was stolen from a restaurant.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

ALLEGHANY RD., 7500 block, 9 p.m. Oct. 2 to 5 a.m. Oct. 3. A black 2000 Honda Civic was stolen.

BALLS FORD RD., 10300 block, 7 p.m. Oct. 2 to 1 p.m. Oct. 3. A burgundy 2000 Ford F150 truck was stolen from a car dealership.

GOLD ACADEMY DR., 10200 block, noon Sept. 30. A blue 1999 Jeep Cherokee was stolen.

WHITEHALL DR., 7500 block, midnight to 6:30 a.m. Oct. 2. A red 1997 Honda Civic was stolen.

Woodbridge Area

ASSAULTS

ALLERTON CT., 3400 block, 1:50 a.m. Oct. 6. During a fight, a man was stabbed and hit in the head and three woman suffered cuts. The man was treated for life-threatening injuries, and the women were treated for non-life-threatening injuries. Two Woodbridge women, ages 22 and 18, were arrested.

OLD BRIDGE AND MINNIEVILLE ROADS, 6:38 p.m. Oct. 4. A rock was thrown at a moving vehicle, breaking its windshield.

PAXTON ST., 2400 block, 11 a.m. Oct. 6 to 4 p.m. Oct. 8. A rock thrown at a residence broke a rear window.

ROBBERIES

DALE BLVD., 2800 block, 11:20 p.m. Oct. 4. A man robbed two men at gunpoint of a bag they were taking to a night-deposit box.

FEATHERSTONE RD., 1700 block, 6:15 p.m. Oct. 4. A person wearing a black ski mask demanded money from a man at knifepoint. The robber fled empty-handed.

FOREST GLEN ROAD AND WOODVALE COURT, 1 p.m. Oct. 4. A man hit a man in the face with a gun and robbed him of cash and a cellphone. The assailant fled with male accomplices in a silver vehicle.

FOWKE LANE, 13600 block, 4:11 p.m. Oct. 6. A man test-driving a gold 1995 Mercedes Benz threatened a salesman with a handgun, then forced him from the vehicle and drove away.

JEFFERSON DAVIS HWY., 13800 block, 10:48 p.m. Oct. 5. A man robbed a gas station of cash at gunpoint.

POTOMAC MILLS RD., 14500 block, 10:05 p.m. Oct. 9. A man in a restaurant parking lot demanded money from a man, then hit him in the head with a gun. The assailant fled empty-handed.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

BUFFALO CT., 3500 block, 7 p.m. Oct. 4 to 8:49 a.m. Oct. 5. A stereo was stolen from a vehicle.

EXPRESS DR., 10300 block, 6:45 p.m. Oct. 2. A Global Positioning System device and two stereos were stolen from two vehicles in a commuter parking lot. Both vehicles were entered by breaking windows.

FEATHERSTONE RD., 1800 block, 5:30 p.m. Oct. 1 to 8:30 a.m. Oct. 2. An attempt was made to enter a business by tampering with a front door.

FINCASTLE DR., 5700 block, 12;15 p.m. Oct. 5. A man stopped residents who had just returned to their garage and asked for their vehicle. He then pushed a male resident and entered the residence. The victim followed the man into the house and then forced him outside. The intruder fled.

FORESTDALE AVE., 3800 block, 7:15 p.m. Oct. 2 to 5:25 a.m. Oct. 3. A business was entered by forcing a side door. Nothing was reported missing.

KENWOOD DR., 4400 block, 9 p.m. Oct. 2 to 2 p.m. Oct. 3. A residence was entered through a back door. Nothing was reported missing.

MARINA WAY, 13100 block, 12:30 a.m. to 2:20 p.m. Oct. 9. Liquor was stolen from a business entered by forcing a gate.

MINNIEVILLE RD., 13900 block, 11:30 p.m. Oct. 7 to 6:30 a.m. Oct. 8. Cash was stolen from a church entered by breaking glass in a door. Several offices were ransacked.

OCCOQUAN RD., 12900 block, 9 p.m. Oct. 8 to 9:55 a.m. Oct. 9. Cash was stolen from a business entered by breaking a window.

OPITZ BLVD., 2200 block, 11 a.m. Oct. 2. Cash and a wallet were stolen from a woman's purse after she had set it on the floor to help a man who was claiming that his hand was stuck in an elevator. The victim said that another man had been standing behind her when she set down her purse.

POTOMAC MILLS CIR., 2700 block, 8:50 p.m. Oct. 5. A woman took merchandise from a store. A 35-year-old Dale City woman was arrested.

VALLEY STREAM DR., 15200 block, 11:30 p.m. Oct. 3 to 8 a.m. Oct. 4. An MP3 player and a purse were stolen from a vehicle entered by breaking a window.

WOODMARK DR., 2800 block, 7:30 p.m. Oct. 9 to 5 a.m. Oct. 10. A Global Positioning System device was stolen from a vehicle entered by breaking a window.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

BELLEVILLE AVE., 14300 block, 1 to 4 a.m. Oct. 3. A silver 2001 Ford Windstar was stolen. A DVD player, an MP3 player, tools and other property were stolen from a second vehicle.

BIG CREST LANE, 14000 block, 11:30 a.m. Sept. 29. A blue 2005 Chevrolet Silverado truck containing a handgun and cash was stolen.

COLCHESTER RD., 1500 block, 5 p.m. Oct. 1 to 6 p.m. Oct. 3. A red 1989 Toyota Corolla was stolen.

GEMSTONE DR., 14400 block, 9 p.m. Sept. 30 to 5 a.m. Oct. 1. A purple 1998 Dodge Grand Caravan was stolen.

HORNER RD., 1300 block, 7 to 11 p.m. Oct. 7. A black 1995 Honda Accord was stolen.

HUNTERBROOK DR., 12700 block, 11:30 p.m. Oct. 6 to 3:07 p.m. Oct. 7. A red 2000 Pontiac Montana van was stolen.

SYLVIA LOOP, 12700 block, 8 p.m. Oct. 6 to 8 a.m. Oct. 7. A blue-and-black 2004 Suzuki GSX-R600 motorcycle was stolen.

Manassas

These incidents were reported by Manassas police. For more information, call 703-257-8000.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

COCKRELL RD., 9900 block, 10 p.m. Oct. 5 to 5:30 a.m. Oct. 6. Three rolls of copper wire were stolen from three construction trucks.

SCHOOL ST., 9500 block, 7 a.m. to 4 p.m. Oct. 4. Cash was stolen from a residence entered by forcing a door.

SHADY GROVE CIR., 8300 block, 9 a.m. Oct. 6 to 9:30 a.m. Oct. 7. Cash, two laptop computers and a digital camera were stolen from a residence entered by forcing a rear sliding-glass door.

STONEWALL RD., 8300 block, 9 p.m. Oct. 4 to 5 a.m. Oct. 5. An air compressor was stolen from a truck.

Manassas Park

These incidents were reported by Manassas Park police. For more information, call 703-361-1136.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

CABBEL DR., 200 block, 4:30 a.m. to 4:30 p.m. Oct. 1. Cash, checks, a TV and a DVD player were stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked kitchen window.

SWANN CT., 8600 block, 7:01 p.m. Oct. 3. An extension ladder was stolen from the back yard of a residence.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

CABBEL DR., 100 block, 12:30 to 4:30 a.m. Oct. 3. A blue 2000 Honda Civic was stolen.

MANASSAS DR., 200 block, 5:01 to 5:30 a.m. Oct. 3. A red 2000 Honda Civic was stolen.

VANDALISM

MANASSAS DR., 9100 block, 4 p.m. Oct. 1 to 7 a.m. Oct. 2. Six tires of two trailers were slashed.

Prince William County crime report Prince William County crime report


SECTION: Metro; Pg. T24


LENGTH: 811 words


Prince William

These were among incidents reported by Prince William County police. For information, call 703-792-7245.

DUMFRIES AREA ASSAULTS

Cherry Hill Rd., 1800 block, 5:52 p.m. July 21. A man knocked on the front door of an acquaintance's residence. As he was talking to the acquaintance, two other males approached and assaulted the acquaintance. The three fled in a vehicle with a fourth male. Three Dumfries men, ages 18, 22 and 26, were arrested.

Kearsarge Dr., 1100 block, 9:17 p.m. July 17. During an argument on a basketball court, a man stabbed a male in the abdomen. The injured male was taken to a hospital. 

MANASSAS AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Centreville Rd., 7200 block, 2 to 3 a.m. July 21. Cash and cigarettes were stolen from a gas station entered by breaking a glass front door.

Hornbaker Rd., 9000 block, 6:30 to 8:15 p.m. July 23. A business was entered by prying a rear door.

Humphrey Lane, 8200 block, 3 to 4 p.m. July 22. A video game system, a cellphone and clothes were stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked door.

WOODBRIDGE AREA SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Ferndale Rd., 14300 block, December to July. A man sexually assaulted a female juvenile acquaintance several times. A 37-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

WEAPONS

Minnieville Rd. and Silverdale Dr., 6:13 p.m. July 17. A male motorist who was driving aggressively pulled in front of another motorist, stopped his vehicle, retrieved a handgun from the trunk and approached the other male motorist. A 25-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

ROBBERIES

Dale Blvd. and Forestdale Ave., 12:30 a.m. July 21. Three males assaulted a male pedestrian, knocking him to the ground. They took cash and a cellphone from his pockets.

INDECENT EXPOSURE

Spriggs and Minnieville roads, 9:42 a.m. July 22. A male motorist exposed himself and made inappropriate gestures to two female motorists in separate incidents. A 36-year-old Fredericksburg man was arrested.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Bath Ct., 3500 block, 11:45 p.m. July 23. A male juvenile entered a residence and fled empty-handed when a resident saw him.

Berwick Pl., 4200 block, 9 a.m. to 6:30 p.m. July 18. A laptop computer was stolen from a residence.

Boatswain Cir., 16300 block, 2:30 p.m. July 20 to 9:20 p.m. July 21. A residence was entered by forcing a kitchen door, then a bronze 2006 Honda Accord was stolen.

Gardenview Loop, 1000 block, 10 a.m. to 6;30 p.m. July 21. A laptop computer was stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked door.

Madrigal Dr., 14100 block, 7:15 a.m. July 20 to 6:30 p.m. July 23. Tools, jewelry and other items were stolen from a residence.

Potomac Mills Cir., 2700 block, April to July 19. A female employee stole jewelry from a jewelry store. Several pieces were recovered. A 26-year-old Woodbridge woman was arrested.

Prince William Pkwy., 2900 block, 11 p.m. July 19 to 9 a.m. July 20. Jewelry was stolen from a business entered through the roof.

Royal Ct., 16500 block, 4:05 a.m. July 18. An attempt was made to enter a residence through a rear window.

Tilletson Pl., 1800 block, 4:20 p.m. July 18 to 2:58 a.m. July 19. A TV and a video game system were stolen from a residence entered by forcing a basement door.

Tilletson Pl., 1800 block, 9 a.m. to 4 p.m. July 20. A residence was entered by forcing a basement door.

Manassas

These were among the incidents reported by Manassas police. For more information, call 703-257-8000.

ASSAULTS

Main St., 9400 block, 1:15 a.m. July 18. A man hit another man in the head with an unknown object. The injured man was treated.

ROBBERIES

Centreville Rd., 9200 block, 4:10 a.m. July 16. A man robbed a pharmacy of prescription medicine and fled on a bike.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Gooseberry Dr., 9300 block, 2:45 a.m. July 18. A glass door at a residence was broken.

Hood Rd. and Calypso Dr., 10 a.m. to 2 p.m. July 13. A bag containing tools was stolen from a vehicle.

Hood Rd., 9300 block, Buckner Rd., 9800 block, Hampton Rd., 9900 block, Aspen Pl., 9700 block and Witch Hazel Way, 9300 block, 1:30 a.m. July 16. Windows of five vehicles and two residential doors were broken.

VANDALISM

Shady Grove Cir., 8300 block, July 14 to 15. A hood of a vehicle was keyed and a tire was flattened.

Manassas Park

These were among the incidents reported by Manassas Park police. For more information, call 703-361-1136.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Kent Village Sq., 100 block, 3:25 a.m. July 19. A man stole beer from a convenience store.

- Compiled by Sarah Lane

St. Mary's Crime


SECTION: SOUTHERN MARYLAND EXTRA; Pg. T12


LENGTH: 456 words


The following are among reports received recently by the St. Mary's County sheriff's office and the Maryland State Police. For more information, call 301-475-8008, or the Crime Solver's Line, 301-475-3333.  

The Leonardtown Barrack of the Maryland State Police operates a 24-hour crime tip line on which citizens may anonymously report information about crimes and related matters at 301-475-2936.

THEFT/BREAK-INS

MORRIS POINT RD., July 13 to 14. Money and a necklace were stolen from a vehicle parked at a residence.

DESTRUCTION OF PROPERTY

JOY CHAPEL RD., 10 to 11:30 p.m. July 19. Eggs were thrown at a vehicle parked at a residence.

SEXUAL OFFENSE

LEONARDTOWN, May to June. A man, 19, engaged in sexual relations with two female youths, ages 12 and 14. He was charged with second-degree rape, three counts of third-degree sex offense, second-degree assault and child abuse.

ROBBERY

LEXINGTON PARK, 7:30 p.m. July 19. A man, 25, was assaulted by three suspects, two of them armed with knives. They demanded personal property and fled the scene.

LEXINGTON PARK, July 10. A man armed with a gun, 26, robbed another man, 49. He was charged with armed robbery and theft over $ 500.

ASSAULT

LEXINGTON PARK, 6:50 a.m. July 22. A man, 32, was arrested in connection with the June 13 assault of a woman, 29, at Butler's Place.

RONALD DR., 12:52 a.m. July 21. Two male youths, 13 and 15, assaulted each other at a residence. The 13-year-old left the residence but returned with a baseball bat and damaged a fence. The youths were charged with second-degree assault. The 13-year-old was additionally charged with malicious destruction of property.

THEFT/BREAK-INS

KIMBERLY CT., 9:30 p.m. July 15 to 6:30 a.m. July 16. Two CDs and money were stolen from a vehicle parked at a residence.

THREE NOTCH RD., July 14. Skateboards, wheels and wheel brackets were stolen from Power Mountain Ski Shop. Entry was gained by smashing glass in the front door.

VEHICLE THEFT

OXFORD CT., 2:15 to 2:30 a.m. July 12. A 1999 Yamaha motorcycle was stolen from a residence. The motorcycle was later located in the woods off Pegg Lane.

ASSAULT

BAPTIST CHURCH AND OLD VILLAGE ROADS, 5:50 p.m. July 17. A man, 19, approached another man, 20 and a woman, 36, stopped in their vehicle at a stop sign. He wielded a wooden baton at them in a threatening manner. He was charged with two counts of second-degree assault.

THEFT/BREAK-INS

MECHANICSVILLE, July 4 to 9. A youth burglarized a residence and stole several items. The suspect has been charged with two counts of first-degree burglary, theft under $ 500 and malicious destruction of property.

DESTRUCTION OF PROPERTY

HILLS DR., 4 p.m. July 14 to 3 p.m. July 15. A home's mailbox and post were taken.

-- Bonnie Smith

Crime Report


SECTION: EXTRAS; Pg. GZ19


LENGTH: 2234 words


Montgomery County 

These were among incidents reported by Montgomery County police. For information, call 240-773-5030.

REWARDS FOR INFORMATION

Crime Solvers of Montgomery County, a nonprofit community organization, will pay up to $1,000 for information leading to an arrest and indictment in connection with these and other felony crimes. Call the 24-hour hotline at 800-673-2777. Callers may remain anonymous.

District 1 Rockville Station Telephone: 240-773-6070

SEXUAL ASSAULTS 

RANDOLPH RD., 4700 block, 2:20 p.m. Sept. 16. A person inappropriately touched a person at a physical therapy office.

ROCKVILLE PIKE, 800-1200 block, 7:19 p.m. Sept. 22. A man sexually assaulted an acquaintance. A man, 21, was arrested at the scene. 

ASSAULTS

LONGWOOD DR., 700 block, 10:57 p.m. Sept. 18. An assault occurred. Police said it was a domestic incident. A man, 47, of no fixed address was charged with aggravated assault.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

ASHLEY DR., 11200 block, 12:01 to 8 a.m. Sept. 17. Coins were stolen from a vehicle entered by force.

BRADLEY AVE., 300 block, Sept. 13 to 15. An attempt was made to break into a residence.

CONESTOGA WAY, 9900 block, 1:50 a.m. Sept. 21. A navigational device and coins were stolen from an unlocked vehicle.

DARNESTOWN RD., 13200 block, 8:30 to 11:30 a.m. Sept. 21. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

GAINSBOROUGH RD., 10700 block, 11:15 a.m. to 12:15 p.m. Sept. 19. A wallet was stolen from a vehicle entered by force at a tennis club.

HAISLIP CT., 11000 block, Sept. 22 to 23. A garage at a residence was entered. Nothing was reported missing.

HEATHERWOOD CT., 8900 block, 6 p.m. Sept. 16 to 7 a.m. Sept. 17. A navigational device and auto parts were stolen from an unlocked vehicle.

OUTPOST DR., 11000 block, 8 a.m. to 1:45 p.m. Sept. 18. A residence was entered by force. Nothing was reported missing.

TROY RD., 11100 block, 8 p.m. Sept. 16 to 8:30 a.m. Sept. 17. Two navigational devices, cash and a charger were among items stolen from two vehicles entered by force.

WADE AVE., 800 block, 4 p.m. Sept. 18 to 5 a.m. Sept. 19. Property was stolen from a residence.

District 2 Bethesda Station Telephone: 301-652-9200

SEXUAL ASSAULTS 

BETHESDA METRO CENTER PLAZA, 4:40 p.m. Sept. 16. A person was sexually assaulted in public restroom at a hotel. A 23-year-old Boyds man was arrested.

ASSAULTS

DEMOCRACY BLVD., 7100 block, 5:30 p.m. Sept. 14. A customer in a retail store threatened an employee at knifepoint.

OLD GEORGETOWN RD. AND CHESHIRE DR., 8:30 p.m. Sept. 15. An assault occurred. Police said that it was a domestic incident. A man, 43, was charged with aggravated assault.

OLD GEORGETOWN RD. AND WISCONSIN AVE., 2:10 a.m. Sept. 19. Two men attacked two male pedestrians. A 22-year-old Rockville man and a man, 21, of no fixed address were charged with aggravated assault.

ROCKVILLE PIKE, 11300 block, 9:45 p.m. Sept. 20. Four men tried to rob a male pedestrian at knifepoint. The assailants fled empty-handed when a security officer approached.

SHALER AND LANTERN DRIVES, 2:30 a.m. Sept. 20. During a party at a residence, a homeowner was stabbed after confronting a guest over a theft of cutlery. A 22-year-old Gaithersburg man was arrested.

ROBBERIES

BETHESDA METRO CENTER PLAZA, 7 p.m. Sept. 17. A person robbed an acquaintance.

WESTERN AVE., 5300 block, 9:45 p.m. Sept. 17. A domestic strong-arm robbery occurred. A 27-year-old District man was arrested.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

CARRIAGE RD., 9600 block, 11:40 p.m. Sept. 21. A man entered an occupied residence, then fled empty-handed when confronted.

EDSON PARK PL., 11200 block, Sept. 15 to 16. An attempt was made to break into a residence. Nothing was reported missing.

RANDOLPH RD., 5500 block, Sept. 19 to 20. Property was stolen from a fitness center.

MASSACHUSETTS AVE., 5900 block, 1 p.m. Sept. 16. A man entered an occupied residence, then fled when confronted. A Virginia Beach man, 34, was arrested.

UNIVERSITY BLVD. W., 3300 block, 4 p.m. Sept. 18 to 1:30 p.m. Sept. 19. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

BROOKLAWN TERR., 3100 block, 12:30 to 6:45 a.m. Sept. 18. A 2003 Toyota Highlander was stolen.

BROOKLAWN TERR., 3200 block, 6:30 p.m. Sept. 17 to 6:20 a.m. Sept. 18. A 2000 Volkswagen Passat was stolen.

District 3 Silver Spring Station Telephone: 301-565-7740

SEXUAL ASSAULTS 

DOWNTOWN SILVER SPRING AREA, 10:30 p.m. Sept. 14. A woman was sexually assaulted by an acquaintance.

INDECENT EXPOSURE

ASSAULTS

ROBBERIES

GEORGIA AVE., 8600 block, 2:48 p.m. Sept. 18. A man tried to rob a bank by passing a note to a teller. When the teller refused the request, the man fled empty-handed.

SOUTHAMPTON DR., 400 block, 11 p.m. Sept. 17. Two men attacked a pedestrian from behind and robbed him of a wallet at gunpoint.

SPRING ST., 1300 block, 11:45 a.m. Sept. 16. A man attacked a woman who had just left a bank and robbed her of cash. Passersby who tried to help also were assaulted. The assailant fled in a waiting maroon Chevrolet.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

BALLINGER CT., 1 to 100 block, 7:30 a.m. to 4:40 p.m. Sept. 17. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

HEATHER HOLLOW CIR., 1500 block, 8:25 a.m. Sept. 17 to 11:59 p.m. Sept. 20. Property was stolen from a residence. There was no sign of forced entry.

HEATHER HOLLOW CIR., 1500 block, Sept. 21. Property was taken from a residence entered by force. A man was seen fleeing the area in a black 2009 Mitsubishi. A Suitland man, 40, was arrested.

LAMBERTON SQUARE RD., 3700 block, 7:30 a.m. to 3:30 p.m. Sept. 15. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

ASSAULTS

ROBBERIES

BUCKNELL DR., 11500 block, 3:21 p.m. Sept. 20. Six teenagers forced their way into the apartment of an acquaintance, then attacked a woman inside. Four females from Silver Spring, ages 15, 15, 16 and 19, and two 17-year-old girls from Greenbelt were arrested nearby.

GEORGIA AVE., 11100 block, 4:39 a.m. Sept. 20. A man robbed a man at a bus stop of property at gunpoint, then fled on foot.

POSTGATE TERR., 4000 block, 9:50 p.m. Sept. 19. A man attacked a deliveryman walking toward a residence and robbed him of food, then fled with a male acquaintance. The delivery order had been a fake.

ASTRID CT., 2400 block, 12:30 p.m. Sept. 18. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

Rockville

These were among incidents reported by the Rockville Police Department. For information, call 240-314-8922.

WEAPONS ARRESTS

PARK RD. AND SOUTH STONESTREET AVE., 2:11 a.m. Sept. 26. A 22-year-old District man was arrested during a traffic stop. He was charged with possession of a concealed and dangerous weapon.

ASSAULTS

The Washington Post


April 12, 1984, Thursday, Final Edition


CRIME WATCH


BYLINE: Compiled by Washington Post correspondents Jill Hodges, Chris Rose and Caroline Johnston.


SECTION: Virginia Weekly; Neighborhood Report; Va. 4


LENGTH: 301 words



Arlington

Arlington County police received the following crime reports from March 29 to April 4. For more information, call 558-2267.
 
Sexual Offenses

COLUMBIA PIKE, midnight March 30. A woman unlocking the rear door to her apartment was pushed from behind by a man who had followed her from the parking lot. The man threw her to the floor of the stairwell and grabbed her. She screamed for help and the man fled when a tenant responded. 

CRYSTAL CITY, 7:30 a.m. March 31. A man entered a woman's motel room while she was sleeping, held a screwdriver to her neck, and raped her.
 
Robberies

ARLINGTON RIDGE RD. S., 2900 block, 10:30 a.m. April 2. A man grabbed a purse from a woman walking down the street, then fled.

FOUR MILE RUN DR. S., 4600 block, 11:15 p.m. April 3. A man walking down the street noticed that he was being followed, and as he neared a parking lot a suspect grabbed him and the two started wrestling. Three other men appeared and the four beat him, knocked him to the ground and fled with his wallet. The victim did not require hospital treatment.
 
Thefts/Break-ins

QUEBEC ST. N., 2300 block, 5:30 to 7:40 p.m. April 3. A woman returned to her home and found a man standing in her kitchen. She screamed and ran out the front door, and the intruder fled without taking anything. Entry was by forcing open a kitchen window.

FOURTH ST. S., 2000 block, 7 to 10:30 a.m. April 3. Audio equipment and a 13-inch color television set were taken from a residence. Entry was through a ground-floor window.

24TH RD. S., 2300 block, 5 to 6:30 p.m. March 28. A 19-inch color television set was taken from a residence.

26TH ST. N., 10:30 a.m. to 9:24 p.m. A necklace and $2 were taken from a residence. Entry was by cutting open a screen door and breaking a window.


LANGUAGE: ENGLISH


GRAPHIC: Map, CRIME WATCH

Washingtonpost.com


March 20, 2014 Thursday 1:14 AM EST 


Montgomery County crime report


SECTION: Metro; Pg. T30


LENGTH: 1945 words


Montgomery County crime report

Among incidents reported by police in Montgomery County, Rockville and Takoma Park.

Montgomery County

These were among incidents recently received by the Montgomery County Police Department. For information, call 240-773-5030.

REWARDS FOR INFORMATION

Crime Solvers of Montgomery County, a nonprofit organization, pays up to $1,000 for information leading to an arrest and indictment in connection with felonies. Call the 24-hour hotline at 800-673-2777. Callers may remain anonymous.

DISTRICT 1ROCKVILLE STATIONTELEPHONE: 240-773-6070 ROBBERIES

Traville Commons Dr., 9800 block, 1:16 a.m. March 1. Two males assaulted and robbed a person. 

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Centurian Way, 11800 block, 3 p.m. March 1 to 12:30 p.m. March 2. A residence was entered and searched. There was no sign of forced entry.

Ridgemont Ave.,Piccard Dr., Gaither Rd., Dover Rd. and Maryland Ave., Feb. 24 to March 4. Property was stolen from several unlocked vehicles.

Rockville Pike, 1000 block, March 1 to 3. Parts were stolen from a vehicle.

Seven Locks Rd., 11300 block, 1:50 to 3:27 a.m. March 2. Property was stolen from a gas station. There was no sign of forced entry.

Gainsborough Rd., 10000 block, 6:15 a.m. Feb. 24. A vehicle was stolen.

DISTRICT 3SILVER SPRING STATIONTELEPHONE: 301-565-7740 ASSAULTS

Broadmore Rd., 12900 block, Feb. 28. A 24-year-old woman was arrested in connection with the assault of an acquaintance.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

The Washington Post


June 14, 1984, Thursday, Final Edition


CRIME WATCH


BYLINE: Compiled by Washington Post special correspondents Barbara Blechman, Annie Koch, Caroline Johnston, Bernhart, Mingia, Chris Rose and Mark Suttson.


SECTION: Virginia Weekly; Neighborhood Report; Va. 4


LENGTH: 347 words



Arlington

Arlington County police received the following crime reports from May 30 to June 7. For more information, call 558-2267.
Sexual Offenses

GLEBE RD. S., 2:15 a.m. June 2. A woman was raped by a man after she fell asleep on his bed. The woman had gone to the man's house with friends. 

WASHINGTON BLVD., 6:25 p.m. May 31. A man exposed himself to a young girl. A suspect has been arrested in the case.

21ST ST. N., 7:10 p.m. June 4. A young girl was raped when she went to visit a friend. A suspect has been arrested in the case.
Robberies

COLUMBIA PIKE, 4300 block, 12:55 a.m. May 31. A woman was entering her apartment building when a man came up behind her, grabbed her bag and fled.

GLEBE RD. S., 2900 block, 7 p.m. May 30. A man approached the counter at a bowling alley and grabbed money that an attendant was putting in a cash register. The attendant held on to the cash and grabbed the robber with his other hand. The robber was able to break free, and got away with $20. Thefts/Break-ins

GLEBE RD. N., 700 block, 6 p.m. June 1 to 7:45 a.m. June 2. $140 in cash was taken from a business. Entry was gained by throwing a brick through a glass side door.

JEFFERSON DAVIS HWY., 2300 block, 8 a.m. to 5:50 p.m. May 31. Camera equipment was taken from a residence. There was no sign of forced entry.

ORNE ST. S., 900 block, 7:45 p.m. June 4. A woman reported that a hotel bellman had locked himself in her room for two minutes. When he came out, she discovered that her purse had been dumped out and $60 was missing.

VEITCH ST. S., 400 block, 8 a.m. to 5 p.m. May 31. $20 was taken from a residence. Entry was through an unlocked rear door. A suspect has been apprehended.

WASHINGTON BLVD. N., 2700 block, 7:30 p.m. May 29 to 9 a.m. May 30. Computer equipment was taken from a business. Entry was through a rear basement door.

17TH ST. N., 1700 block, 12:30 a.m. June 4. A woman was lying in bed when a man entered her room through an open window. He lunged at her and grabbed her. The woman screamed and attempted to bite the man, who then fled.

CRIME REPORT


SECTION: SOUTHERN MARYLAND EXTRA; Pg. T15


LENGTH: 300 words


The following are among reports received recently by the Calvert County sheriff's office and the Maryland State Police. Anyone with information about these crimes should call the Criminal Investigations Section, 410-535-2800 or 301-855-1194, or the Crime Solver's Line, 410-535-2880. You can also call the Prince Frederick barracks of the State Police at 410-535-1400.  

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

LONG GUN DR., 10:30 to 11:30 p.m. April 23. A purse was stolen from an unlocked residence.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

JOHNSON RD., April 11. A Yamaha Banshee four-wheeler was stolen from a residence.

DESTRUCTION OF PROPERTY

WILSON RD., April 22. Two brass lanterns at the gated entrance to a residence were smashed.

ASSAULTS

ROUSBY HALL RD., 3 p.m. April 29. While walking along the road, a female youth, 15, was approached by an older man, with white or gray hair, in a vehicle. He asked her personal questions and tried to grab her arm. She broke free and the man drove off.

SEXUAL OFFENSE

PRINCE FREDERICK, April 27. A man, 28, was charged with the Aug. 31, 2000, rape of a woman, 20. The man had met the woman through an Internet chat room. He was charged with second-degree rape, third-degree sex offense, fourth-degree sex offense and second-degree assault.

DESTRUCTION OF PROPERTY

PRINCE FREDERICK, April 27 to 28. Phone lines to the Pizza Oven Restaurant were cut.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

GLASCOCK FIELD, 7 p.m. to midnight April 20. Softball equipment, speakers, a CD player, CDs and other property were stolen from a Jeep.

LORE PINES LANE, 9 p.m. April 25 to 7:30 p.m. April 26. A canvas cover and the cabin door lock of a boat were damaged. A half-gallon of vodka was stolen.

SOLOMONS, 10:30 p.m. April 30 to 7:23 a.m. May 1. The front door of the Island Tanning Salon was forced open and money was stolen.

-- Bonnie Smith

Southern Maryland crime reportSouthern Maryland crime report


SECTION: METRO; Pg. T24


LENGTH: 661 words


Calvert County

These were among reports received by the Calvert County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. Anyone with information about these crimes should call the Criminal Investigation Division, 410-535-2800 or 301-855-1194, or the Crime Solvers line, 410-535-2880. You can also call the Prince Frederick Barrack of the state police at 410-535-1400.

CHESAPEAKE BEACH AREA

ARSON

G St., July 6. The interior of a two-story residence was set on fire. Three males, 11, 12 and 14, were charged with first-degree arson and malicious destruction of property.  

DUNKIRK AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Shields Dr., June 30. Property was stolen from a residence.

LUSBY AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Ropeknot Rd., June 28 to June 29. An iPod was stolen from a vehicle at a residence.

Sachem Dr., 3:32 p.m., July 4. Copper wire was stolen from a utility pole. A man, 35, was charged with theft.

NORTH BEACH AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Ninth St., June 30 to July 1. A GPS and a camera were stolen from a vehicle.

PORT REPUBLIC AREA

VANDALISM

Miles Way, July 9 to July 10. A vehicle was damaged at a residence.

ST. LEONARD AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Hill Side Rd., July 9 to July 10. An anchor was stolen from a boat in a driveway at a residence.

Charles County

These were among reports received by the Charles County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. For information, call 301-932-2222 or 301-870-3232. Crime Solvers will pay a reward for information leading to an arrest and an indictment in connection with these and other crimes. Call the 24-hour hotline at 866-411-8477. Callers may remain anonymous. The Charles County Sheriff's Office Web site iswww.ccso.us. Included at the site are daily news releases, Crime Watch neighborhood statistics, community services, crime prevention programs and career opportunities.

BRYANS ROAD AREA

ARSON

Hampton Ct., 1:50 a.m., July 5. A 2006 Saturn Ion was set on fire.

INDIAN HEAD AREA

Adelphi Lane, June 24 to July 1. Property was stolen from a residence.

WALDORF AREA

ARSON

Brewster Ct., 2800 block, 10:10 a.m., July 9. A 2004 Toyota Matrix was set on fire.

WELCOME AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Port Tobacco Rd., 4:15 to 10:30 p.m., July 4. Property was stolen from a residence entered by kicking in the front door.

St. Mary's County

These were among reports received by the St. Mary's County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. For information, call 301-475-8008, or the Crime Solvers line, 301-475-3333. The Leonardtown Barrack of the Maryland State Police operates a 24-hour tip line: Information may be anonymously reported at 301-475-2936.

CHARLOTTE HALL AREA

ROBBERIES

Three Notch Rd., July 3. Two men tried to rob pizza-restaurant employees at gunpoint. Two men, 22 and 33, were arrested. Charges included conspiracy to commit armed robbery and attempted armed robbery.

LEXINGTON PARK AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Three Notch Rd., 3:05 p.m., June 29. Cash was stolen from a cash register at a department store. A 26-year-old woman, an employee, was charged with theft less than $1,000.

LEXINGTON PARK AREA

ASSAULTS

Lexington Park, July 8. During an argument at a residence, a man struck an acquaintance. A man, 48, was charged with second-degree assault.

ARSON

Castaway Cir., 3:59 a.m., July 5. A 2001 Ford F-250 truck was set on fire.

MECHANICSVILLE AREA

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Lexington Park, July 7. A man was arrested at his residence in connection with the sexual abuse of two children. A man, 35, was charged with two counts of child sexual abuse and two counts of continuing course of conduct with a child.

ASSAULTS

Woodburn Hills Rd., July 1. During an argument at residence, a woman struck an acquaintance in the head. A woman, 24, was charged with second-degree assault.

HOLLYWOOD AREA

ASSAULTS

McIntosh Rd., July 1. During a dispute at a residence, a man with a rifle threatened an acquaintance. A man, 60, was charged with first-degree assault.

ST. JAMES AREA

ARSON

Bay Forest Rd., 11:48 p.m., June 30. A 2005 BMW was set on fire.

Anne Arundel Crime Watch


SECTION: ANNE ARUNDEL EXTRA; Pg. T06


LENGTH: 1819 words


The following were among crime reports recently received by the Anne Arundel County Police Department. For more information, call 410-222-8050.

REWARDS FOR INFORMATION

Metro Crime Stoppers, a nonprofit group, will pay up to $ 2,000 for information leading to an arrest and indictment in connection with felonies. Call the 24-hour hot line at 410-276-8888. Callers may remain anonymous.

 SEXUAL ASSAULTS 

GORMAN STREET, June 30. A man grabbed a female pedestrian in a sexual manner. A 39-year-old Baltimore man was arrested and charged with sexual assault. The man was also charged with sexual assault in cases involving five different women, each on five different occasions.  

ASSAULTS

MADISON ST., 1100 block, 12:29 a.m. July 17. Annapolis police received a report of shots being fired at the above location. An officer found a man bleeding profusely with multiple gunshot wounds. The 19-year-old Annapolis man was flown to a shock-trauma unit.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

GENERALS HWY., 2000 block, 2:30 a.m. July 14. A business was entered by forcing a side window. Nothing was reported stolen.

GATEWATER CT., 300 block, midnight to 1 a.m. July 9. Firearms were stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked rear door.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

HILLVIEW DR., 400 block, July 14. A black 1991 Ford was stolen.

MOUNTAIN RD., 1-100 block, July 13. A black 1998 Ford was stolen.

WARWICKSHIRE LANE, 100 block, July 10. A black 1999 Pontiac was stolen.

 SEXUAL ASSAULTS 

PARKWAY DR., 7300 block, 7 p.m. July 15. A man picked up a woman in South Baltimore and when they arrived at the above location, the man forced the woman to the ground and choked her until she fell unconscious. When the woman woke up, she discovered her underwear had been removed. The 25-year-old woman was transported to the hospital for bruises to her face.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

RIDGE RD., 7200 block, 1 to 3 p.m. July 12. A gun and a TV were stolen from a residence entered by forcing a front door.

PARK CIRCLE DR., 7200 block, 10 to 10:15 p.m. July 8. Computer equipment was stolen from a business entered through a front door.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

BAY FRONT AVE., 1000 block, 11 a.m. to 4 p.m. July 10. A residence was entered through a rear window. Nothing was reported stolen.

ROBBERIES

LAUREL-FORT MEADE RD., 3400 block, 12:27 a.m. July 17. Two masked men entered a hotel room and demanded money from a male occupant. The occupant did not give the men money and they assaulted him. The occupant escaped from the room and the men fled with the occupant's cell phone. A 20-year-old District man and an 18-year-old Upper Marlboro man were arrested and charged with robbery.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

CENTERHILL AVE., 300 block, 4:45 a.m. July 9. Sporting goods and a radio were stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked front door.

ELKRIDGE LANDING RD., 800 block, 8 to 10 p.m. July 13. Computer equipment was stolen from a business entered by forcing a front door.

ELKRIDGE LANDING RD., 800 block, 8:30 p.m. July 13 to 7:30 a.m. July 14. Computer equipment was stolen from a business entered by forcing a front door.

WINTERSON RD., 1100 block, 7 to 9 p.m. June 26. A telephone was stolen from a business.

HOMICIDES

MCKENDREE RD., 6200 block, 8:30 a.m. July 14. Wilbur Francis Washington, 42, of 1600 block of Shepherd St. NW, Washington, was found by the Anne Arundel County Fire Department after responding to a brush fire at this location. The chief medical examiner's office in Baltimore determined the cause of death to be trauma. Washington was identified through fingerprints. A 27-year-old District man, a relative of Washington's, was arrested and charged with murder.

ASSAULTS

MILLWRIGHT CT., 600 block, 1 a.m. July 17. A man was stabbed in the chest with a butcher knife after an argument outside a residence. A 24-year-old Odenton man was arrested. A 29-year-old Millersville man was transported to a shock-trauma unit.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

REGINA CT., 300 block, 5:15 to 5:20 a.m. July 8. A residence was entered through an unlocked front door. Nothing was reported stolen.

WILLIAMSTOWNE CT., 12:15 to 1:45 p.m. July 9. Cash, silverware, a telephone and a radio were stolen from a residence entered by breaking a rear window.

ASSAULTS

TRAVIS POINT CT., 2000 block, July 14. A woman stabbed a male acquaintance twice in the shoulder. A 21-year-old Odenton woman was arrested and charged with assault.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

BRIGADIER BLVD., 2000 block, 6:16 p.m. July 14. A purse was stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked front door.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

CEDAR DR., 7600 block, March 1 to July 12. Auto parts were stolen from a residence entered by forcing a front door.

MAGOTHY RD., 6 a.m. to 6:55 p.m. July 12. Cash was stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked window.

OLD MILL RD., 8200 block, 11 a.m. to 10 p.m. July 12. Cash was stolen from a residence entered by forcing a rear door.

RITCHIE HWY. S., 8000 block, July 9. A business was entered by forcing a rear door. Nothing was reported stolen.

RITCHIE HWY. S., 8000 block, 6 p.m. June 29 to 9 a.m. July 2. A business was entered by forcing a front door. Nothing was reported stolen.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

STAGS LEAP COURT AND BALTIMORE-ANNAPOLIS BOULEVARD, July 11 or July 12. Tools, a camera and miscellaneous items were stolen from a construction site entered by forcing a side window.

STAGS LEAP COURT AND BALTIMORE-ANNAPOLIS BOULEVARD, July 13 or July 14. Industrial equipment was stolen from a construction site entered by forcing a front door.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

AUTUMN LAKE CT., 8200 block, June 11 or June 12. A purple 1997 Toyota was stolen.

ROBBERIES

RITCHIE HWY., 500 block, 2:03 p.m. July 13. A man in a bank handed an envelope to a teller with written instructions. The teller complied with the instructions and filled the envelope with cash, then the robber fled.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

OWENS WAY, 500 block, 7 a.m. to 2:30 p.m. July 12. A residence was entered through an unlocked front door. Nothing was reported stolen.

RIGGS AVE., 100 block, June 14 to June 28. A bicycle and sporting goods were stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked upper door.

SCOTT AVE., 1-100 block, 11:45 a.m. July 12. Furniture was stolen from a residence entered by forcing a front door.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

CHALK POINT RD., 5100 block, July 9 or July 10. A vehicle was stolen.

The following were among crime reports recently received by the Annapolis Police Department. For more information, call 410-268-9000.

REWARDS FOR INFORMATION

 Crime Solvers of Annapolis Inc., a nonprofit organization, will pay up to $ 1,000 for information leading to an arrest and indictment in connection with these and any other felonies. Call the 24-hour hot line at 410-267-8888. Callers may remain anonymous.

 SEXUAL ASSAULTS 

MONUMENT AND W. WASHINGTON STREETS, 1:30 p.m. July 7. A rape occurred.

ROBBERIES

BOWMAN DR., 1800 block, July 10. Cash and a diamond ring were taken during a robbery.

WEST ST., 1-100 block, 8:10 p.m. July 7. Cash was taken during a robbery with a gun.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

GREEN AND GLOUCESTER STREETS, 4 p.m. July 12. A stereo was stolen from a vehicle.

MAIN ST., 100 block, 3:41 p.m. July 15. Candy bars were stolen from a store during a robbery. An arrest was made.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

STATE ST., 400 block, 12:30 a.m. July 8. A 1997 Honda Accord was taken.

-- Ria Manglapus

and Eileen Rivers

LANGUAGE: ENGLISH
