Washingtonpost.com


May 23, 2013 Thursday 8:13 PM EST 


Prince William County crime report Prince William County crime report


BYLINE: Compiled by Sarah Lane


SECTION: Metro; Pg. T30


LENGTH: 859 words


Prince William

These were among incidents reported by Prince William County police. For information, call 703-792-7245.

DUMFRIES AREA ROBBERIES

Corwin Pl., 15800 block, 3:30 p.m. May 11. After making arrangements through a Web site to buy a laptop, two women demanded the laptop from a man at gunpoint. They struggled, and the women fled empty-handed.

GAINESVILLE AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS  

Davis Store Lane, 14100 block, 5 p.m. May 6 to 6 a.m. May 7. A safe containing cash was stolen from a business entered by forcing open a rear door.

MANASSAS AREA SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Community Dr., 8100 block, 4:01 p.m. May 7. A man sexually assaulted a female acquaintance. A 34-year-old man was arrested.

ASSAULTS

Postern Ct., 10900 block, 11:30 p.m. May 8. During an argument, a man assaulted a male acquaintance. A 22-year-old Manassas man was arrested.

WEAPONS

Liberia Ave., 9500 block, 12:52 a.m. May 11. A man in a restaurant parking lot pointed a handgun at employees leaving the restaurant. The employees fled and called police.

Ridgeway Dr., 7200 block, 4:20 a.m. May 11. During an argument between a woman and a male acquaintance, the woman retrieved a shotgun. The man and another person disarmed her. A 22-year-old Manassas woman was arrested.

WOODBRIDGE AREA SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Potomac Mills Rd. and Town Center Dr., 4:11 a.m. May 13. A man at a homeless camp entered a female acquaintance's tent and raped her. A 46-year-old man was arrested.

ASSAULTS

Daniel Stuart Dr., 2000 block, 12:10 a.m. May 11. During an argument between two groups of men, one man stabbed another with a knife. The injured man was taken to a hospital.

Potomac Mills Rd. and Town Center Dr., 8:41 p.m. May 12. During an argument at a homeless camp, a man stabbed another man in the upper body. A third man attempted to intervene and was cut in the face. A 42-year-old Alexandria man was arrested.

WEAPONS

Darlington Loop, 1900 block, 3:12 a.m. May 12. Several gunshots were heard.

Jefferson Davis Hwy. and Delaware Dr., 5:21 p.m. May 11. After a road rage incident, a male motorist brandished a weapon at a female motorist.

Nationville Lane, 13300 block, 5:50 p.m. May 13. During an argument at a residence, a man brandished a weapon at a male relative. A 61-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

ROBBERIES

Gardenview Loop and Summerland Dr., 8 a.m. May 12. After arranging to meet an unknown man, a woman and a man with a knife robbed the unknown man of cash, a cellphone and his vehicle, a black 2006 Toyota 4Runner. Later that afternoon, in the 13300 block of Occoquan Road, another man got into a vehicle, believed to be the stolen vehicle, with an unknown woman. They drove to the area of Devils Reach Road and Carolyn Forest Drive, where a man who had been hiding in the back seat of the vehicle robbed the man of a wallet and cellphone at knifepoint. They forced the man from the vehicle.

Lodge Ter. and Old Kings Rd., 10:30 p.m. May 6. Two men robbed another man of cash, a backpack, two cellphones and a pair of shoes after one of the men arranged to meet the third man, an acquaintance, through social media.

Occoquan Rd., 13100 block, 9:09 a.m. May 12. A gunman robbed a female pedestrian of a purse.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Alton Hotel Ct., 2700 block, 7:55 a.m. to 3 p.m. May 7. Two laptops, a cellphone, a video game system and jewelry were stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked door.

Cheshire Station Plaza, 4500 block, 10:49 p.m. May 9. Several cellphones were stolen from a business entered by breaking a front door.

Forge Dr., 4000 block, 6:30 to 8 p.m. May 11. Cash was stolen from a residence.

Gideon Dr., 14400 block, 9 p.m. May 11 to 2:30 p.m. May 12. Cash was stolen from a business entered by cutting a hole through a ceiling.

Horizon Ct., 2000 block, 1:40 to 11:30 p.m. May 10. Two laptops and a TV were stolen from a residence entered by forcing a bedroom window.

Jefferson Davis Hwy., 15700 block, 3 p.m. May 5 to 7 a.m. May 6. Electrical wiring was stolen from a business entered by cutting a lock on a rear door.

Oakwood Dr., 11900 block, 10:41 a.m. May 10. Two juvenile males stood outside of a rear door of a residence. They fled empty-handed when a resident confronted them.

Tilletson Pl., 1800 block, 9 a.m. to 4 p.m. May 9. A TV was stolen from a residence entered by breaking a basement door.

Valleywood Dr., 12800 block, 1:03 p.m. May 8. An attempt was made to enter a residence by breaking a rear window.

Manassas

No reports were received from Manassas police for this edition of Local Living. For information, call 703-257-8000.

Manassas Park

These were among the incidents reported by Manassas Park police. For more information, call 703-361-1136.

VANDALISM

Kirby St., May 8. A vehicle was scratched and damaged.

- Compiled by Sarah Lane

Prince William County crime report 


SECTION: METRO; Pg. T20


LENGTH: 1244 words


Prince William County

These were among incidents reported by Prince William County police. For information, call 703-792-7245.

DUMFRIES AREA

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

River Ridge Golf Course area, Feb. 13. A 38-year-old Dumfries man was arrested in connection with an April 2010 assault of a juvenile acquaintance.

ASSAULTS

Old Triangle Rd. and Sigel Ct., 10:44 p.m. Feb. 10. A woman was struck by shot from a gun fired from a moving vehicle. She was treated for a minor head injury. A 19-year-old Maryland man was arrested Feb. 11. He is a suspect in an incident that took place a short time earlier at Heth Court and Old Triangle Road, near Dumfries Plaza, during which a gun was fired by a man involved in a fight following a high school basketball game. No injuries were reported in that incident.

GAINESVILLE AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Song Sparrow Dr., 8800 block, 7:30 a.m. to 3:20 p.m. Feb. 9. An attempt was made to break into a business by forcing a rear door.

MANASSAS AREA

HOMICIDES

Parkland St. and Old Centreville Rd., 9:18 p.m. Feb. 12. During an argument with an acquaintance, Edwin Noe Enamorado Matute, 22, of the 7600 block of Somerset Lane, Manassas, was stabbed several times. He was taken to a hospital, where he died. A 21-year-old man was arrested. 

ASSAULTS

Porter Ridge Lane, 8100 block, 3:08 p.m. Feb. 8. During an argument, a woman cut a man with a knife. He was treated for a shoulder injury. A 28-year-old Manassas woman was arrested.

ROBBERIES

Blendia Lane, 10600 block, 9:49 p.m. Feb. 10. Three men robbed a man of cash and a jacket at gunpoint. The victim said that the incident took place during a meeting to discuss the sale of shoes.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Hoadly Rd., 7500 block, 5 p.m. Feb. 5 to 11 a.m. Feb. 6. Copper and brass wire were stolen from a shed at a residence. A 24-year-old Manassas man was arrested.

Perdue Ct., 7500 block, 8:15 a.m. to 3:30 p.m. Feb. 7. Two TVs, two video game systems and jewelry were among property stolen from a residence entered by forcing a back door.

Shallow Creek Loop, 9800 block, 4 p.m. Feb. 1 to 9 a.m. Feb. 7. A residence was vandalized. There was no sign of forced entry.

WOODBRIDGE AREA

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Forest Park Dr., 15700 block, Feb. 1. A man sexually assaulted a juvenile in a school parking lot, then attacked her again on Feb. 3 in Dumfries. The two, who met online, were scheduled to meet again on Feb. 7. A 36-year-old Palmyra, Va., man was arrested at the arranged location.

Minnieville area, Feb. 13. A 24-year-old Beltsville man was arrested in connection with the sexual assaults of two juvenile acquaintances at a residence. The incidents took place in August and Jan. 13.

Veterans Memorial Park area, A 56-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested in connection with the sexual assault of a juvenile acquaintance on several occasions from Oct. 1 to Jan. 3.

ASSAULTS

Indiana Ave., 1500 block, 2:04 a.m. Feb. 8. During an argument, a woman attacked a male acquaintance at knifepoint. A 20-year-old Woodbridge woman was arrested. No injuries were reported.

Village Dr., 14400 block, 10:12 p.m. Feb. 11. During an argument, a man attacked a male with a shovel. A 48-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested. The victim was treated for an arm injury.

WEAPONS OFFENSES

Frishman Ct., 4900 block, 6:30 p.m. Feb. 8. During an argument, a man threatened a male acquaintance at gunpoint. A 32-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

Grayson Rd., 14100 block, 10:55 p.m. Feb. 7. An unoccupied vehicle was struck by gunfire. An unoccupied vehicle was struck by a white coupe that sped away from the scene. No injuries were reported.

ROBBERIES

Eames Lane, 4400 block, 7:09 p.m. Feb. 7. A group of men threatened an acquaintance at knifepoint and robbed him of cash. Three Woodbridge men, age 24 and two age 18, and a 19-year-old Manassas man were arrested.

Grayton Lane, 2600 block, 9:10 p.m. Feb. 9. Three males demanded cash from a deliveryman at knifepoint, then fled empty-handed when the victim ran to a vehicle.

INDECENT EXPOSURE INCIDENTS

Kitty Hawk Way, 13600 block, 3:35 a.m. Feb. 9. A man naked from the waist down followed a pedestrian, then fled when she confronted him.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Dawson Beach Rd., 13800 block, noon Feb. 11 to 10:45 a.m. Feb. 12. Tools and other equipment were stolen from a business.

Emberdale Dr., 14800 block, 8 to 9:23 p.m. Feb. 11. An attempt was made to enter a residence by forcing a rear window.

Granby Rd., 4100 block, 9 p.m. Feb. 10 to 8 p.m. Feb. 11. Cash, a video game system and medicine were stolen from a residence entered by breaking a kitchen window.

Gustus Dr., 4200 block, 7:56 a.m. Feb. 8. A man knocked on a bathroom window at a residence, then fled when confronted.

Kentland Dr., 4400 block, 4 p.m. Jan. 7 to noon Feb. 1. Copper piping was stolen from a vacant residence entered through an unlocked window.

Minnieville Rd., 14100 block, 4:09 p.m. Feb. 8. A church was entered by forcing a rear door. Nothing was reported missing.

Quinn Lane, 5400 block, 8 p.m. Feb. 7 to 11 a.m. Feb. 8. Tools were stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked door.

Warbler Ct., 15200 block, 4:55 p.m. Feb. 7. A rifle and a handgun were stolen from a residence entered by breaking a rear window. Two males fled with the property when confronted.

Wyndale Ct., 3300 block, 6:28 p.m. Feb. 9. A man entered a residence through an unlocked front door, then fled empty-handed when confronted.

Manassas

These were among incidents reported by Manassas police. For information, call 703-257-8000.

ASSAULTS

Azalea Grove Dr., 10000 block, 1:25 a.m. Feb. 10. A man was stabbed during a fight. A 30-year-old Manassas man was arrested. No serious injuries were reported.

Fairview Ave., 9500 block, 12:45 a.m. Feb. 13. During an argument, a man attacked a female acquaintance. A 26-year-old Manassas man was arrested. No serious injuries were reported.

Woodlea Ct., 9300 block, 4:50 p.m. Feb. 9. A man attacked an acquaintance. A Manassas man was arrested. No serious injuries were reported.

ROBBERIES

Byrd Dr., 9200 block, Feb. 2. A teenager threatened a male juvenile and demanded cash. A 13-year-old male was arrested.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Centreville Rd., 9000 block, 12:01 to 6:45 a.m. Feb. 12. Cash was stolen from a restaurant.

Ditmars Ct., 8700 block, 7:30 p.m. Feb. 14 to 5 a.m. Feb. 15. A navigator was stolen from an unlocked vehicle.

Dumfries Rd., 10400 block, 10:45 p.m. Feb. 1 to 9 a.m. Feb. 14. A catalytic converter was stolen from a rental truck. A nearby truck was damaged during an unsuccessful attempt to steal a similar device

Fairfax St., 8500 block, Feb. 13. A video game system was stolen from a residence.

Godwin Dr., 8900 block, 2:45 p.m. Feb. 8. A camera that had been left behind by a motorist was stolen from a car wash.

Sudley Rd., 8500 block, 10:43 a.m. Feb. 12. A motorist drove away from a gas station without paying for a fuel purchase.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Centreville Rd., 9100 block, Jan. 23. An attempt was made to buy a used vehicle using fraudulent checks. A 41-year-old Upper Marlboro woman was arrested. Police suspect her in the fraudulent purchase of two other vehicles in the area.

VANDALISM

Bragg Lane, 9700 block, 7 p.m. Feb. 14 to 4 a.m. Feb. 15. A vehicle's tires were cut.

Oliver Ct., 8800 block, 6 p.m. Feb. 10 to 6 a.m. Feb. 11. A vehicle's tires were cut.

Tudor Oaks, 8800 block, 2 to 4 p.m. Feb. 10. A vehicle's tires were cut.

Manassas Park

No report was received from Manassas Park police for this edition of Local Living. For information, call 703-361-1136.

Prince William County crime report Prince William County crime report


SECTION: Metro; Pg. T20


LENGTH: 935 words


PrinceWilliam

These were among incidents reported by Prince William County police. For information, call 703-792-7245.

DUMFRIES AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Higgins Dr., 5000 block, 11:22 a.m. July 1. A recreation center was entered through the roof. Sinks were clogged, and water was left running, flooding the building. Several fire extinguishers were discharged.

MANASSAS AREA ASSAULTS  

Willow Pond Ct., 7700 block, 4:52 p.m. July 5. A man banged on an interior garage door of a residence, then assaulted a male acquaintance when he answered the door. A Manassas man, 47, was arrested.

CHILD NEGLECT

Chadds Landing Way, 7600 block, 2:08 p.m. July 6. Two young girls were left unattended at a residence. A man and a woman, both 31, of Manassas, were arrested.

Winfield Loop, 10500 block, 8:15 p.m. July 8. A young boy was found walking outside unsupervised. His mother was found at a residence unresponsive and intoxicated. A 25-year-old Manassas woman was arrested.

ROBBERIES

Kinship Ct., 11000 block, 1:18 a.m. July 6. A man forcibly entered a residence and robbed a female acquaintance of property at knifepoint. A 21-year-old man was arrested.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Olga Lane, 6600 block, 12:30 p.m. June 29 to 12:30 p.m. July 6. Cash and a safe containing jewelry were stolen from a residence.

Remington Rd., 7500 block, 11 a.m. June 30 to 11:30 p.m. July 8. A video game system and games were stolen from a residence entered through a rear door.

NOKESVILLE AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Classic Lakes Way, 8800 block, 10:30 a.m. to 2:30 p.m. July 3. Jewelry and clothes were stolen from a residence entered by forcing a rear basement door.

TRIANGLE AREA SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Potomac Crest Dr., 19000 block, July 4. A man sexually assaulted a female acquaintance. A 45-year-old Triangle man was arrested.

WOODBRIDGE AREA SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Gideon Dr., 14500 block, 4:30 a.m. July 6. A man in a hotel room sexually assaulted a man and a woman. A 35-year-old Fort Belvoir man was arrested. During the investigation, the Fort Belvoir man said he was assaulted by three unknown men while smoking a cigarette outside the hotel.

Gordon Blvd., 13300 block, 3 to 4 a.m. July 4. A man in a hotel room sexually assaulted a woman.

ASSAULTS

Berlin Ct., 3200 block, 7:21 p.m. July 5. During an argument, a man cut a male acquaintance's face with a fork. The acquaintance was treated for injuries. A 38-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

Kellogg Dr., 4800 block, 11:08 a.m. July 7. During an argument, a man assaulted a female acquaintance. A 20-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

Kingsman Rd., 13600 block, June 22 to June 23. During an argument, a man handcuffed two acquaintances, a man and a woman. He kicked the man, knocking him to the ground. A 27-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

PROSTITUTION

Crossing Pl., 14300 block, 8 p.m. July 5. A 25-year-old Lorton woman was arrested at a hotel and charged with prostitution and possession of marijuana. A 29-year-old Citrus Heights, Calif., man was arrested and charged with aiding prostitution and possession of marijuana.

ROBBERIES

Jefferson Davis Hwy., 13900 block, 3:39 p.m. July 7. Two masked men robbed a business of a cash register and other property at gunpoint. The business owner attempted to chase the men who fired the gun at him.

Kaplan Ct., 4600 block, 4:43 p.m. July 6. Three masked men forcibly entered a residence and robbed a man of cash at gunpoint.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Gemstone Dr., 14400 block, 7 to 10 p.m. July 7. Cash was stolen from a residence.

Lockleven Lane, 12700 block, 2 p.m. July 3 to 6 p.m. July 6. A laptop computer, a video game system, jewelry and clothes were stolen from a residence entered by prying a rear door.

Moon Way, 3500 block, 1:09 p.m. July 2. An attempt was made to enter a residence through a rear door.

Occoquan Rd., 12700 block, 6 p.m. July 8 to 2:15 a.m. July 9. A laptop computer, a cellphone, jewelry and other property were stolen from a residence entered through a basement door.

Potomac Mills Cir., 2700 block, 2:30 p.m. July 4. A man took merchandise from a store, then sprayed two store employees with pepper spray when they followed him to the parking lot. The man dropped the merchandise and fled in a vehicle. A 27-year-old District man was arrested.

Potomac Mills Cir., 2700 block, 2:14 p.m. July 7. A woman pepper-sprayed a store employee when the employee confronted the woman about shoplifting. The woman grabbed merchandise and fled the store. A second employee followed the woman to the parking lot, where she also pepper-sprayed him. A 33-year-old Windsor Mill, Md., woman was arrested.

Manassas

No reports were received from Manassas police for this edition of Local Living. For information, call 703-257-8000.

Manassas Park

These were among the incidents reported by Manassas Park police. For more information, call 703-361-1136.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Cougar Ct., 10:30 p.m. June 28 to 6:33 a.m. June 30. A 1970 trailer with a 1984 John boat attached was stolen.

Jessica Dr., 3 p.m. July 3 to 8 p.m. July 4. A cellphone was stolen.

VANDALISM

Evans St., 6 p.m. July 2 to 11:03 a.m. July 3. A tomato plant was damaged.

Crime Report


SECTION: EXTRAS; Pg. 15


LENGTH: 864 words


Calvert County 

These were among reports received recently by the Calvert County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. Anyone with information about these crimes should call the Criminal Investigation Division, 410-535-2800 or 301-855-1194, or the Crime Solvers line, 410-535-2880. You can also call the Prince Frederick Barrack of the state police at 410-535-1400.

Dunkirk Area

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

ROUTE 4, 12:35 p.m. Jan. 19. A wallet was stolen from a purse in a shopping cart at a Giant store. 

Huntingtown Area

DESTRUCTION OF PROPERTY

HUNTING CREEK ROAD, 4:30 to 4:45 a.m. Jan. 19. Two mailboxes were damaged and a streetlight was broken.

Prince Frederick Area

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

BUGEYE SQUARE, Jan. 19 to Jan. 21. Equipment was stolen from a work truck.

ROUTE 2/4, Jan. 21. Property was stolen from a vehicle parked at Jasper's American Grille. A window on the vehicle was smashed to gain entry.

ROUTE 2/4, Jan. 21. A cellphone was stolen from an unlocked vehicle parked in the Fox Run Shopping Center.

Sunderland Area

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

BARRINGTON LANE, Jan. 16. Property was stolen from a vehicle.

VEHICLE THEFTS

ROUTE 2, 6:30 a.m. to 4:42 p.m. Jan. 18. A 2001 Jeep Cherokee was stolen from a Park and Ride lot.

Charles County 

The following are among reports received recently by the Charles County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. For further information, call 301-932-2222 or 301-870-3232. Crime Solvers will pay a reward for information leading to an arrest and an indictment in connection with these and other crimes. Call the 24-hour hotline at 866-411-8477. Callers may remain anonymous. The Charles County Sheriff's Office Web site is: http://www.ccso.us. Included at the site are daily news releases, Crime Watch neighborhood statistics, community services, crime prevention programs and career opportunities.

Indian Head Area

SEXUAL OFFENSES

INDIAN HEAD, Jan. 7. A boy, 16, was sexually assaulted. A man, 44, was charged with third-degree sex offense, fourth-degree burglary, perverted practices, sexual solicitation of a minor and possession of child pornography.

Waldorf Area

ASSAULTS

CRAIN HWY., 3300 block, 8:25 p.m. Jan. 9. A woman attempted to ram her vehicle into another vehicle. The vehicle was occupied by a man, 19, and a woman, 22. A woman, 42, was charged with first- and second-degree assault.

ROBBERIES

FESTIVAL WAY, 3000 block, 1:35 p.m. Jan. 17. A man, pretending to buy a pair of shoes at Modell's Sporting Goods, brandished a handgun, took the shoes and fled.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

ADDISON CT., 1200 block, 1:15 p.m. Jan. 18. A man forcibly entered a family member's home to steal a TV set. A man, 27, was charged with first-degree burglary and attempted theft.

CLAYTON RD., 4600 block, Nov. 21 to Nov. 22. Credit cards were stolen from a residence and later used at a Denny's restaurant on Crain Highway.

HOLLINS LANE, 3000 block, 1:40 p.m. Jan. 22. Two men offered to sell a man iPhones, then fled when he gave one of the men money. Two men, 21 and 23, were charged with theft of more than $500 and conspiracy to commit theft of more than $500.

HUSK PLACE, 2:40 a.m. Jan. 23. Three tires were stolen from a 1999 Ford Escort. A man, 29, was charged with theft of more than $500.

LEONARDTOWN RD., 3700 block, 3:26 a.m. Jan. 18. Cash was stolen from a vending machine at Thomas Stone High School. A window in a door on the machine was shattered to gain entry.

St. Mary's County 

The following are among reports received recently by the St. Mary's County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. For further information, call 301-475-8008, or the Crime Solvers line, 301-475-3333. The Leonardtown Barrack of the Maryland State Police operates a 24-hour crime tip line on which people may anonymously report information about crimes and related matters at 301-475-2936.

Abell Area

ASSAULTS

ABELL RD., 1 a.m. Jan. 18. A resident awoke to find a man in the kitchen of his residence. The resident fired a shotgun in the direction of the intruder, who fled on foot.

California Area

THEFT/BREAK-INS

MERCEDES DRIVE, 1:20 p.m. Jan. 18. Property was stolen from two vehicles at Two Guy Collision. A rock was thrown through one of the vehicle's window to gain entry.

Leonardtown Area

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

POINT LOOKOUT ROAD, 10:31 a.m. Jan. 19. A hunting blind and decoys were stolen.

Lexington Park Area

ASSAULTS

GREAT MILLS RD., 5 a.m. Jan. 19. A woman was shot in the back with an arrow as she walked on the sidewalk. A man, 43, was charged with first-degree assault.

Mechanicsville Area

ASSAULTS

MECHANICSVILLE, 9:19 p.m. Jan. 19. During an argument at a residence, a woman hit a person with a loaded pistol. A struggle ensued and the person gained control of the weapon. The woman then grabbed another pistol and pointed it at the person. A woman, 42, was charged with first-degree assault.

THOMPSON'S CORNER RD., 1 p.m. Jan. 22. Two men entered a residence and confronted two people in a bedroom. A man was forced to the floor and hit in the head. The two men ransacked the room, took property and fled.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

WIDOW LANE, Jan. 18. A garage was burglarized. A man, 20, was charged with second-degree burglary and theft.

-- Compiled by BONNIE SMITH

The Washington Post


June 12, 2008 Thursday

Crime Report


SECTION: EXTRAS; Pg. VA11


LENGTH: 732 words


Alexandria

These were among incidents reported by the Alexandria Police Department. For more information, call 703-838-4636 or visit http://www.alexandriava.gov/police.

ROBBERIES

WAYNE STREET AND EAST MONROE AVENUE, 1:15 a.m. June 3. Two males robbed an Alexandria man, 29, of cash.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

FORD AVE., 4400 block, 5 p.m. May 30 to 6:55 a.m. June 2. Property was stolen from a business entered by force. 

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

ASCOT CT., 5500 block, 3 p.m. June 1 to 5:20 p.m. June 2. A green 1995 Toyota Corolla was stolen.

CENTURY DR., 100 block, 8 a.m. May 15 to 2 p.m. May 27. A tan and silver 1999 Chrysler LHS was stolen.

FILLMORE AVE., 5200 block, 3:15 to 6:05 p.m. A silver 1990 Subaru Legacy station wagon was stolen.

GROVES AVE., 1-99 block, noon to 2 p.m. June 3. A silver 2002 Chrysler Voyager was stolen.

NORTH FAIRFAX AND ORONOCO STREETS, 6 to 6:45 a.m. June 2. A white 2001 Dodge Caravan was stolen.

Arlington

These were among incidents reported by the Arlington County Police Department. For more information, call 703-228-4050 or visit http://www.arlingtoncrimesolvers.org.

ATTEMPTED HOMICIDES

THOMAS ST. S., 1200 block, 10:18 a.m. June 3. Investigating a report, police officers found a 26-year-old woman lying on a bedroom floor with injuries to her head and neck. She was treated at the scene by medics and taken to a hospital. An Arlington man, 28, was charged with attempted murder.

SEXUAL ASSAULTS 

MOORE ST. N., 1800 block, 6:30 p.m. June 2. A man touched a female acquaintance inappropriately. An Annandale man, 51, was charged with sexual assault.

ASSAULTS

KEMPER RD. S., 3700 block, 6:15 p.m. May 30. Police observed a man stumbling repeatedly. He ran away when an officer approached him. The officer chased the man, who struck the officer in the face and attempted to grab his gun. An Arlington man, 30, was charged with assaulting an officer , attempting to disarm an officer, resisting arrest and illegal drug possession.

INDECENT EXPOSURE

QUINCY ST. S., 1300 block, 7:33 p.m. June 1. After exposing himself to a 45-year-old female pedestrian, a man fled when the woman threatened to scream. An Arlington man, 22, was charged with indecent exposure.

ROBBERIES

FERN S., 2100 block, 11:35 a.m. May 29. A man robbed a 77-year-old female pedestrian of a purse.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

DANVILLE ST. N., 1600 block, 10:30 p.m. June 1. A CD player was stolen from a residence.

HAYES ST. S., 1100 block, 7:19 p.m. May 28 to 7:45 a.m. May 29. A computer monitor and clothing were stolen from a storage room of a business.

HAYES ST. S., 1100 block, 6:56 a.m. May 30. Clothing was stolen from a store's storage room. A Mount Rainier, Md., man, 58, was charged with burglary, grand theft, possession of burglary tools and theft with intent to distribute in connection with this incident and a similar break-in at the same location on May 29.

LEE HWY N., 6900 block, 10 p.m. May 27 to 8 a.m. May 28. Automotive parts were stolen from a parking lot of a business.

OAKLAND ST. S., 1600 block, 9 a.m. to 1:30 p.m. May 28. Two bedrooms were ransacked. Nothing was reported missing.

SHIRLINGTON RD., 2300 block, 8:30 p.m. May 30 to 8:30 pm May 31. Cash, electronics and clothing were stolen from a residence.

TAYLOR ST. S., 1300 block, 5:30 a.m. to 1 p.m. May 27. A laptop computer was stolen from a residence.

WAKEFIELD ST. N., 100 block, 11 a.m. May 26. An attempt was made to enter a residence by slashing a screen door and a window screen and breaking two panes of glass.

14TH ST. N., 2300 block, 3:01 a.m. June 1. Responding to a report of three males attempting to break into vehicles in an apartment building garage, police officers located one man. A Laurel man, 19, was charged with possession of burglary tools.

23RD ST. S., 700 block, 10:30 p.m. May 31 to 1:30 p.m. June 1. Cash was stolen from a business.

S. 27TH RD., 4800 block; S. BUCHANAN ST., 2800 block; and S. 28TH ST., 4800 block, 8 p.m. May 27 to 7 a.m. May 28. Cash and electronic devices were stolen from seven vehicles.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

CAMPBELL AVE., 4000 block, May 29. A green 2001 Toyota Sequoia was stolen.

WILSON BLVD. N., 1100 block, May 28. A white 2000 Chevrolet Astro van was stolen.

WILSON BLVD., 6100 block, June 2. A silver Honda Civic was stolen.

FOUR MILE RUN DR. S., 4600 block, May 31. A teal 1995 Nissan Altima was stolen.

12TH RD. S., 4300 block, June 2. A gold Honda Accord was stolen.

-- Compiled by RIA MANGLAPUS

Washingtonpost.com


November 22, 2012 Thursday 8:12 PM EST 


Anne Arundel County and Howard County crime report Anne Arundel County and Howard County crime report


SECTION: Metro; Pg. T22


LENGTH: 2081 words


Anne Arundel

These were among incidents reported by Anne Arundel County police. For information, call 410-222-8050.

ANNAPOLIS AREA ROBBERIES

Defense Hwy., 100 block, 1:55 a.m. Nov. 10. A man robbed a convenience store of cash at gunpoint.

BROOKLYN PARK AREA ASSAULTS

Ritchie Hwy., 6000 block, 12:30 p.m. Nov. 12. During an argument in a wooded area, a man dragged a female acquaintance through a bonfire. She was taken to a hospital, where she was reported to be in stable condition. A 29-year-old man of no fixed address was arrested on attempted murder and assault charges.

CROWNSVILLE AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Bacon Ridge Rd., 1200 block, Nov. 9. During the execution of a search-and-seizure warrant, police arrested two Crownsville men, ages 20 and 22, in connection with a Sept. 4 burglary in the 700 block of North Riverside Drive, Crownsville. A TV and a DVD player stolen during that incident were recovered, as was property traced to three other burglaries. Charges against the two men included burglary, theft, possession of an altered shotgun and possession of a firearm by a convicted felon. 

EDGEWATER AREA SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Wakefield Rd., 1400 block, Nov. 14. An Edgewater man, 66, was arrested in connection with the sexual assaults of two juveniles from 2000 to 2008.

GLEN BURNIE AREA ROBBERIES

Marley and Glen Oak Avenues, 4:15 p.m. Nov. 14. Two male teenagers knocked down a pedestrian and fled with her purse. No serious injuries were reported.

Ritchie Hwy., 6800 block, 8:32 p.m. Nov. 12. Two males robbed a pedestrian of a wallet at gunpoint. During a struggle, the victim was slightly injured. He was taken to a hospital.

LAUREL AREA ARSON

Barbersville Rd., 400 block, Nov. 10. A man using a Skype video transmission said that he was going to injure himself and others by detonating a bomb that he was constructing. Police traced the computer to a residence, where they confronted a man inside a shed. After explosives experts determined that the alleged bomb was a fake, a 24-year-old Laurel man was arrested on arson-threat and destructive-device charges.

ROBBERIES

Russett Green E., 3500 block, 4:17 a.m. Nov. 14. A male wearing a mask entered a store and robbed it of cash at gunpoint, then forced an employee to accompany him to the parking lot, where he shot him in the upper body. The victim, a 28-year-old man, was taken to a hospital for treatment of injuries that were not considered life-threatening.

LINTHICUM AREA ASSAULTS

Fourth Ave. SW, 100 block, 7:15 p.m. Nov. 8. During an argument at a residence, a man was stabbed. He was taken to a local hospital for treatment of injuries that were not considered life-threatening. A 30-year-old Linthicum man was charged with first- and second-degree assault and reckless endangerment.

Annapolis

These were among incidents reported by the Annapolis Police Department. For information, call 410-268-9000.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Copeland St., 1900 block, 9:30 p.m. Oct. 31 to 6:30 a.m. Nov. 1. A bag containing a laptop computer, two watches, a camera and a monitor was stolen from an unlocked vehicle.

Forest Dr., 1700 block, 3:30 to 3:40 p.m. Nov. 4. A laptop computer was stolen from an unlocked vehicle.

Harwood Pl., 400 block, 11 p.m. Nov. 6 to 5:30 p.m. Nov. 8 Cash was stolen from a residence entered by forcing a back door.

Madison St., 1200 block, 11 a.m. to 8 p.m. Nov. 9. A video game system was stolen from a residence. A tile floor inside the home was damaged by an unidentified liquid.

Spa View Ave., 100 block, Nov. 14. Responding to a report of a group of people acting suspiciously near houses, police saw four juveniles running from the back of a residence, which had been entered through a door. The four were detained at the scene and charged with burglary.

First St., 300 block, 5:30 p.m. Nov. 13 to 6:30 a.m. Nov. 14. A bicycle was stolen from a back deck, where it had been locked with a cable lock.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Bank St., 900 block, Oct. 8 to Nov. 8. A red 1986 Porsche 911 was stolen.

Newtowne Dr., 700 block, 10 p.m. Nov. 10 to 8 a.m. Nov. 11. A blue 2000 Dodge Intrepid was stolen from a parking lot. It was recovered before it was reported stolen. An arrest was made.

Howard County

These were among incidents reported by the Howard County Police Department. For information, call 410-313-2236.

CLARKSVILLE AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Ballymore Lane, 6500 block, 2 to 6:30 a.m. Nov. 13. Cash and a wallet were stolen from a residence entered through a garage and an unlocked interior door.

Clarksville Pike, 12100 block, 9:36 p.m. Nov. 12 to 8:12 a.m. Nov. 13. Using a skid mover stolen from a church parking lot in the 12100 block of Linden-Linthicum Lane, a safe was stolen from a garden center entered by breaking glass in a front door. The safe, which was slightly damaged during an unsuccessful attempt to open it, was recovered in the 10700 block of Scaggsville Road. Two trucks at the garden center later were found to have been vandalized during the incident.

Linden Chapel Rd., 11800 block, 9:30 a.m. to 1:50 p.m. Nov. 13. Jewelry and a laptop computer were stolen from a residence entered by breaking a kitchen window.

COLUMBIA AREA INDECENT EXPOSURE INCIDENTS

Snowden Square, 9000 block, 12:58 p.m. Nov. 4. Police responded to a report of a man performing a lewd act in a vehicle in a parking lot. A man was questioned at the scene.

ROBBERIES

Fair Oaks, 10400 block, 6:05 p.m. Nov. 14. Three males near a community mailbox robbed a man of his wallet at gunpoint.

Little Patuxent Pkwy., 10700 block, 8:27 p.m. Nov. 9. Two males armed with guns and wearing ski masks tied up two employees at a dry-cleaning business and robbed them of wallets and the business of cash. One of the wallets was recovered near Broken Land and Snowden River parkways.

Little Patuxent Pkwy., 10200 block, 9 a.m. Nov. 12. Two males threatened a pedestrian on a footbridge and robbed the victim of a cellphone and a wallet.

Monarch Mills Way, 7500 block, 5:43 p.m. Nov. 8. Two teenagers forced their way into an acquaintance's apartment and robbed him of two pairs of shoes at gunpoint. Two Columbia males, ages 16 and 17, were arrested on charges that included armed robbery, assault, use of a firearm in commission of a felony, burglary and theft.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Audubon Dr., 6200 block, 1:58 p.m. Nov. 12. Two juveniles entered a garage at a residence. When confronted by an occupant of a vehicle in the garage, they fled empty-handed. A short time later, two arrests were made.

Blade Green Lane, 8900 block, 9:30 a.m. to 8:20 p.m. Nov. 14. A residence was entered through a sliding-glass door. Nothing was reported missing.

Centre Park Dr., 8800 block, 12:07 a.m. Nov. 5. An attempt was made to enter a restaurant by smashing glass in a front door. Nothing was reported missing.

Daring Prince Way, 6300 block, 4:25 a.m. Nov. 9. An occupied residence was entered through an open garage. Two intruders carrying a flashlight fled empty-handed when confronted.

McGaw Rd., 8900 block, 3:34 a.m. Nov. 11. Ten spools of copper were stolen from an auto-repair shop entered by breaking a front window.

Old Annapolis Rd., 9100 block, 7:30 p.m. Nov. 13. A laptop computer, a tablet computer and cash were stolen from a nail salon entered by breaking a side window.

Swift Stream Pl., 10300 block, 1 a.m. to 6:50 p.m. Nov. 8. Jackets and shoes were stolen from one of two storage lockers entered by force.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Hickory Ridge Rd., 10200 block, 9:12 a.m. Nov. 14. A black 2008 Ford Taurus was stolen. It was recovered in a parking lot a short time later.

DAYTON AREA MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Ten Oaks Rd., 4100 block, 8:59 a.m. Nov. 14. A 2005 Ford F-350 truck was stolen.

ELKRIDGE AREA ROBBERIES

Autumn Spell, 5900 block, 4:10 p.m. Nov. 13. Two males threatened a motorist they had approached in Baltimore, then forced him to drive them to his home in Elkridge. After robbing him of cash, they fled in the man's vehicle. The victim sustained a minor injury when he was struck in the eye during the incident.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Highland Ave., 6600 block, 6 a.m. to 5:45 p.m. Nov. 8. A residence was entered through the unlocked front door. Nothing was reported missing.

Water Oak Rd., 7100 block, 9:24 p.m. Nov. 11. An attempt was made to enter a residence by removing a screen from a window. Nothing was reported missing.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Rowanberry Dr., 5700 block, 1:36 a.m. Nov. 14. The ignition of a Jeep Cherokee was damaged during an attempted theft.

ELLICOTT CITY AREA ROBBERIES

Town and Country Blvd., 8700 block, 12:40 a.m. Nov. 11. Two males wearing masks approached a female on the front steps of an apartment building and demanded property at knifepoint. When she refused and ran into the building, the assailants fled empty-handed. No injuries were reported.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Brian Ct., 2800 block, 11 p.m. Nov. 10 to 6 a.m. Nov. 11. Two global positioning system devices and a rechargeable drill were stolen from an open garage.

Stonehouse Dr., 8600 block, 2:30 to 2:40 p.m. Nov. 8. Cash was stolen from a box in a closet at a residence. An occupant of the home said that he was in the residence when the theft occurred.

Town and Country Blvd., 8700 block, 8:23 p.m. Nov. 11. A vacant apartment was entered through an unlocked sliding-glass door. Evidence of drug use was found, but nothing was reported missing.

FULTON AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Reservoir Rd., 8300 block, 5:30 p.m. Nov. 6 to 4:45 p.m. Nov. 8. A window was broken at a residence. Nothing was reported missing.

GLENELG AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Snow Chief Rd., 3500 block, 6:30 a.m. to 10:30 p.m. Nov. 13. An attempt was made to enter a residence by breaking glass in a back door. Nothing was reported missing.

JESSUP AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Twelve Sons Ct., 8900 block, 10:30 a.m. to 1:40 p.m. Nov. 13. An attempt was made to enter a residence by breaking glass in a door. Nothing was reported missing.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Assateague Dr., 7400 block, 4:13 p.m. Nov. 12. A trailer was stolen.

LAUREL AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Canterbury Riding, 9300 block, 9:50 p.m. Nov. 9. An attempt was made to enter a residence by forcing a sliding-glass door. Three people fled empty-handed when they were confronted.

Graeloch Rd., 10600 block, 10:03 p.m. Nov. 12. A residence was entered through an open garage and an unlocked back door. An occupant confronted the intruders, who fled empty-handed.

Light Moon Way, 8500 block, 11:10 p.m. Nov. 8 to 10 a.m. Nov. 10. A bicycle was stolen from an open garage.

Old Scaggsville Rd., 9200 block, 10:40 a.m. Nov. 12. An attempt was made to enter a residence by cutting window screens. An intruder fled empty-handed when confronted by an occupant.

Washington Blvd., 9900 block, 6 p.m. Nov. 3 to 8 a.m. Nov. 4. Two trailers were damaged during attempted break-ins. Nothing was reported missing.

Washington Blvd., 7300 block, 1:54 a.m. Nov. 14. Police responding to an alarm at an electronics company made a traffic stop of a vehicle driving away from the scene. Several spools of copper and communications wire were found in the vehicle. Two Camp Springs men, ages 20 and 25, were charged with several counts of burglary and theft, and with malicious destruction of property.

Woodsong Ct., 9400 block, 2:20 to 6 p.m. Nov. 12. A video game console was stolen from a residence. There was no sign of forced entry.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Bridle Path Lane, 9200 block, 9:59 a.m. Nov. 14. A 2004 Acura was stolen.

Scaggsville Rd., 10500 block, 12:21 a.m. Nov. 14. A motorcycle was stolen from a garage.

WEST FRIENDSHIP AREA MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Old Frederick Rd. and Route 32, 1:46 p.m. Nov. 13. A white Ford F-350 pickup was stolen from a commuter parking lot.

- Compiled by Carrie Donovan

December 8, 2002 Sunday

Charles County Crime Report


SECTION: SOUTHERN MARYLAND EXTRA; Pg. T24


LENGTH: 478 words


The following are among reports received recently by the Charles County sheriff's office and the Maryland State Police. For more information, call 301-932-2222 or 301-870-3232.

The Charles County sheriff's office will pay a reward for information leading to an arrest and an indictment in connection with these and any other felony crimes. Call the 24-hour hotline at 800-673-2777. Callers may remain anonymous.  

The Charles County sheriff's office Web site is at www.ccso.us. Included at the site are daily news releases, Crime Watch neighborhood statistics, community services, crime prevention programs and career opportunities.

VEHICLE THEFTS

BEL ALTON, 11:53 a.m. Nov. 20. A man, 26, stole a 1995 Dodge Van. He was charged with theft of a motor vehicle.

VEHICLE THEFTS

OLD CREEK RD., 2300 block, 5 p.m. Nov. 23 to 5 p.m. Nov. 26. A 1986 14-foot Fisher boat was stolen. The trailer, a dozen decoys and a boat motor were also stolen.

ASSAULTS

CARMELITE DR., 5200 block, 8:23 p.m. Nov. 25. A man entered a residence to use the restroom. After exiting the restroom he struck a woman, 74, with an unknown object and fled the scene. The woman is at Washington Hospital Center and is listed in critical but stable condition.

CARJACKING

CHARLESTON CT., 200 block, 7:07 a.m. Dec. 2. A man, 25, was getting into his vehicle. A suspect approached him and demanded money, property and his vehicle. The man complied and the suspect fled the area in the vehicle. It was found a short time later on Glen Albin Road at Jazz Place, and had been involved in a single-vehicle accident.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

RIPLEY RD., 6200 block, 9 a.m. to 3 p.m. Nov. 26. Money was stolen from a residence.

ASSAULTS

OVERCUP OAK CT., 1700 block, 2:30 a.m. Dec. 2. Two suspects approached a man, 44, brandished a gun and forced him into his vehicle. The suspects then forced him to drive them to different locations in Charles and Prince George's counties. They also stole money from the man before fleeing.

RENNER RD. AND ROUTE 5, 10:13 a.m. Dec. 1. A man, 31, shot a man, 26, during an argument. The victim was flown to Prince George's Hospital Center with injuries that were not life-threatening. The suspect was charged with attempted first-degree murder and first-degree assault.

SEXUAL OFFENSE

WALDORF, 12:37 p.m. Nov. 30. A man, 39, sexually abused a female youth, 11. He was charged with two counts of child abuse.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

BERRY RD., 9400 block, 9:45 a.m. Dec. 2. A man, 42, was stopped for speeding and it was discovered that his vehicle's license plates were stolen. He was charged with theft less than $ 500.

VANDALISM

ACTON LANE, 12200 block, 8:30 p.m. Nov. 26 to 5:04 a.m. Nov. 27. Racial remarks and other graffiti were spray-painted on heavy equipment at Waldorf Asphalt. Tires were also slashed on several work trucks and material in a trash bin was set on fire.

-- Bonnie Smith

June 10, 2001 Sunday

Charles County Crime Report


SECTION: SOUTHERN MARYLAND EXTRA; Pg. T11


LENGTH: 505 words


The following are among reports received recently by the Charles County sheriff's office and the Maryland State Police. For more information, call 301-932-2222 or 301-870-3232.

The Charles County sheriff's office will pay a reward for information leading to an arrest and an indictment in connection with these and any other felony crimes. Call the 24-hour hot line at 800-673-2777. Callers may remain anonymous.  

The Charles County sheriff's office Web site may be accessed at www.charlescountysheriffsoffice.org. Included at the site are daily news releases, Crime Watch neighborhood statistics, community services, crime prevention programs and career opportunities.

ASSAULTS

HAMMOCK CT., 2700 block, 9:50 p.m. May 28. A man, 44, threw a woman, 47, to the ground during an argument. He was charged with second-degree assault.

SEXUAL OFFENSE

INDIAN HEAD, noon May 31. A man, 32, was accused of sexually assaulting a preteen girl from 1994 to 1996. He was charged with sexual child abuse and second-degree rape.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

IVANHOE DR., 14000 block, 3 p.m. June 1 to 9 a.m. June 2. Kitchen cabinets and appliances were stolen from a house under construction.

ROBBERIES

CRAIN HWY., 6000 block. 8:45 p.m. May 31. A man with a gun got into a vehicle in a parking lot and demanded the driver take him to a location in La Plata. When they arrived in the area, the man stole cash from the driver and fled on foot. He is described as being in his late thirties, about six feet tall, and weighing 220 to 230 pounds. He may go by the nickname "Easy."

ASSAULTS

WHITE FIR CT., 3200 block, 9 p.m. June 6. A man, 26, assaulted a woman, 23. He was charged with second-degree assault.

ROBBERIES

LEONARDTOWN RD., 10:21 a.m. June 1. A man, 41, entered SunTrust Bank, handed a teller a note demanding money and implying that he had a gun. The teller gave him money, and the man fled on foot. He was apprehended on June 2 with assistance from the Montgomery County Police Department and charged with armed robbery. He was wanted in connection with eight other robberies in six different jurisdictions.

SMALLWOOD RD., 12:33 a.m. June 6. A man approached another man in a parking lot, displayed a handgun and demanded money. The robber fled on foot.

WALDORF, 11:48 p.m. May 31. Two men assaulted two other men and ordered them to empty their pockets. One victim had a pack of cigarettes and the other victim had nothing. The two attackers fled on foot.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

CRAIN HWY., 2800 block, 12:58 a.m. June 6. The front door of a business was open and money was missing when officers answered an alarm. There was no sign of forced entry.

ELDERBERRY PLACE, 3400 block, 2 to 6:30 p.m. June 6. Thirty CDs were stolen from a residence. There were no signs of forced entry.

RIDGE RD., 2000 block, May 28 to June 2. Two Yamaha four-wheelers and one motorcycle were stolen from a padlocked shed.

DESTRUCTION OF PROPERTY

MIDDLETOWN RD., 3300 block, midnight to 5:55 a.m. June 6. Eight windows at Westlake High School were broken.

-- Bonnie Smith

CRIME REPORT


SECTION: SOUTHERN MARYLAND EXTRA; Pg. T13


LENGTH: 381 words


The following are among reports received recently by the St. Mary's County sheriff's office and the Maryland State Police. For more information, call 301-475-8008, or the Crime Solver's Line, 301-475-3333.  

The Leonardtown barracks of the Maryland State Police operates a 24-hour crime tip line on which citizens may anonymously report information about crimes and related matters at 301-475-2936.

ASSAULTS

CALIFORNIA, 9:30 p.m. Jan. 22. A man, 36, assaulted a female employee of Kmart. He was charged with second-degree assault.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

CALIFORNIA, Nov. 19 to Dec. 14. A woman, 46, an employee of Giant Food Store, used her employee status to cash 47 worthless checks. She was charged with theft scheme more than $ 500.

ASSAULTS

CALLAWAY, 1:25 a.m. Jan. 28. A man, 27, became disorderly when troopers responded to P&P Sports Bar for a report of shots being fired. The man yelled profanities and charged toward a trooper and attempted to strike him. He was charged with second-degree assault, disorderly conduct, hindering and resisting arrest.

ASSAULTS

CHARLOTTE HALL, Jan. 23. A man, 27, assaulted another man, 25, at the Hills Club Bar. He was charged with second-degree assault.

ASSAULTS

ST. JOHN'S RD., 11:45 p.m. Jan. 15. A female youth, 17, assaulted a man and woman at a residence. She was charged with second-degree assault and destruction on property.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

HOLLYWOOD, 2 p.m. Jan. 19. A woman, 18, stole four checks from a residence on Nov. 22 and cashed them. She was charged with theft less than $ 500.

ASSAULTS

CARTWRIGHT RD., 9:32 p.m. Jan. 13. A man, 52, and another man 22, assaulted each other. They were charged with second-degree assault.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

LEONARDTOWN, 4:59 p.m. Jan. 22. An undisclosed amount of money was stolen from a residence.

ASSAULTS

BAPTIST CHURCH RD., 7:41 p.m. Jan. 24. A man, 41, assaulted a woman at a residence and fled. He was charged with second-degree assault.

SEXUAL OFFENSE

REDGATE DR., Jan. 28. A man, 27, was arrested in connection with the Oct. 22 rape of two women, 30 and 24. He was charged with two counts of second-degree and first-degree sex offenses.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

MECHANICSVILLE, 6:30 p.m. Jan. 17. Maryland license tags were stolen from a vehicle parked at a residence.

-- Compiled by Bonnie Smith

The Washington Post


March 29, 1984, Thursday, Final Edition


CRIME WATCH


SECTION: Virginia Weekly; Neighborhood Report; Va. 5


LENGTH: 820 words



Arlington

Arlington County police received the following crime reports from March 15 to March 21. For more information, call 558-2267.
 
Sexual Offenses

BARTON STREET, 2 to 3:15 a.m. March 17. A woman was raped by a man armed with a knife who had entered her apartment through an unlocked window. 

JEFFERSON DAVIS HWY. S., 1700 block, 8:30 a.m. March 16. A man followed a woman into an elevator and exposed himself in the elevator. A second woman reported that a man followed her into the elevator and exposed himself at 8:40 a.m.

JEFFERSON DAVIS HWY. S., 1900 block, 9 a.m. March 16. A man exposed himself to a woman in a parking garage.
 
Robberies

ARMY NAVY DR. S., 1600 block, 6:30 p.m. March 18. A man grabbed a purse from a woman who was walking down the street, then fled.

ARMY NAVY DR. S., 2400 block, 11:10 p.m. March 18. Two women walking to their cars in a parking lot were approached by a man who asked for the time and then grabbed one of the women. The woman struggled as the man tried to take her purse and the other woman poked him in the eye. He then released the first woman and tried to take the second woman's purse. The first woman kicked the man and he fled.

EADS ST. S., 1600 block, 4:21 p.m. March 17. A purse was taken from a woman in an underground parking lot. A police officer and a resident chased the suspect to a Metro subway station and stopped a train headed for the District. They searched the train and found the suspect with the purse. A 24-year-old Washington man was arrested and charged with robbery.

FOUR MILE RUN DR. S., 4200 block, 9 to 9:15 p.m. March 19. Two men grabbed a purse from a woman walking down the street, then fled.

WILSON BLVD., 3300 block, 2:55 to 3 a.m. March 18. A man armed with a revolver took $20 and a bank bag containing an undetermined amount of money from a hotel clerk, then fled.

31ST ST. S., 4600 block, 10:55 p.m. March 20. A woman walking down the street was approached by two men in a car who asked her for directions. She kept walking. One of the men got out of the car and punched her, knocking her to the ground, and told her to take off her jewelry. He then took her rings, watch, necklace and purse, and fled in the car.
 
Thefts/Break-ins

GEORGE MASON DR. N., 3200 block, 1 to 4 p.m. March 15. Cufflinks and $10 were taken from a residence. Entry was through a rear basement window.

GRANT ST. S., 2700 block, March 15. Several cameras and jewelry were taken from a residence. Entry was gained by breaking a pane of glass on a dining room door.

JEFFERSON DAVIS HWY. S., 1700 block, 9 p.m. March 14 to 7:45 a.m. March 15. $900 was taken from a business.

JEFFERSON DAVIS HWY. S., 1700 block, 7 p.m. March 14 to 11 a.m. March 15. $216 was taken from a business.

JEFFERSON DAVIS HWY., 2300 block, March 19. $864 was taken from a business.

KING ST. S., 4700 block, March 19. A Sanyo portable minicomponent system and 13 Sanyo video cassette recorders were taken from a business. Entry to the storage area was gained by breaking through a cinder-block wall.

LANG ST. S., 2700 block, 9:10 to 9:50 a.m. March 15. Pearls, a key and Irish coins were taken from a residence. Entry was through an unlocked rear window.

LEE HWY. N., 600 block, March 14. Coins and jewelry were taken from a residence. Entry was by kicking open a basement door.

LYNN ST. N., 1800 block, 6:30 p.m. March 19 to 6 a.m. March 20. $110 was taken from a home. Entry was by prying open the front door.

QUEENS LA. N., 1800 block, 6:30 p.m. to midnight March 18. A videotape recorder and $20 were taken from residence.

ROLFE ST. S., 900 block, 7:30 to 9:30 p.m. March 15. $32 was taken from a residence. Entry was by prying open a rear sliding glass door.

TUCKAHOE ST. N., 2200 block, noon to 8:30 p.m. March 17. A 19-inch RCA televison set was taken from a residence. Entry was gained by breaking a window pane in a patio door.

NINTH ST S., 2300 block, 7:15 a.m. to 9:15 p.m. March 19. Silver bullion, cash and whiskey were taken from a residence. Entry was by breaking a window, concealed by shrubbery, near the front door.

11TH ST. N., 2300 block, 10 a.m. to 3 p.m. March 20. A 15-inch color television set and a Panasonic radio were taken from a residence.

22ND ST. S., 5000 block, noon March 16. Stereo equipment worth $13,000 was taken from a residence. Entry was gained by forcing open the basement door.

24TH ST. S., 1800 block, March 14. Audio equipment, cash and three silver cups were taken from a residence. Entry was gained by breaking a window on a basement door.

28TH ST. S., 1500 block, 8 a.m. to 6:30 p.m. March 15. A Sears 19-inch color television set and a woman's diamond ring were taken from a residence.

31ST ST. S., 4200 block, 4 to 8:40 p.m. March 20. Jewelry and a 35mm camera were taken from a residence.

31ST ST. S., 4200 block, March 20. A Sanyo AM/FM stereo receiver was taken from a residence.

Montgomery County crime report


SECTION: METRO; Pg. T30


LENGTH: 1691 words


Montgomery County crime report

Among incidents reported by police in Montgomery County, Rockville and Takoma Park.

Montgomery County

These were among incidents recently received by the Montgomery County Police Department. For information, call 240-773-5030.

REWARDS FOR INFORMATION

Crime Solvers of Montgomery County, a nonprofit organization, pays up to $1,000 for information leading to an arrest and indictment in connection with felonies. Call the 24-hour hotline at 800-673-2777. Callers may remain anonymous.

DISTRICT 1ROCKVILLE STATIONTELEPHONE: 240-773-6070

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

McCormick Rd., 2300 block, Feb. 23. A person was sexually assaulted by an acquaintance.

ROBBERIES

Autre Ct., 1200 block, 2 to 2:15 a.m. Feb. 23. A person assaulted and robbed someone. 

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Rockville Pike, 12200 block, 5:24 p.m. Feb. 19. An attempted fraud occurred at a business. Two College Park males, ages 46 and 17, and two Baltimore men, ages 20 and 47, were arrested.

Gude Dr. E., 800 block, 7 p.m. Feb. 23 to 10 a.m. Feb. 24. Property was stolen from a storage facility entered by force.

Prince William County crime report Prince William County crime report


SECTION: METRO; Pg. T17


LENGTH: 956 words


Prince William County

These were among incidents reported by Prince William County police. For information, call 703-792-7245.

DUMFRIES AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Jurgensen Dr., 3600 block, 2:30 p.m. Aug. 3 to 12:50 a.m. Aug. 4. A DVD player and jewelry were stolen from a residence entered by prying a front door.

Mills Spring Dr., 15000 block, 8 p.m. July 29 to 8 p.m. Aug. 1. Someone attempted to enter a residence through several rear windows and a rear door. 

Wintercress Ct., 15000 block, 9:30 to 10:45 a.m. Aug. 2. A camera and jewelry were stolen from a residence entered by forcing a rear door.

GAINESVILLE AREA

ROBBERIES

McGraws Corner Dr., 14300 block, 3:16 p.m. Aug. 1. A man implying he had a weapon robbed a pharmacy of medicine. A 22-year-old Rixeyville, Va., man was arrested.

HAYMARKET AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Washington St., 15100 block, 5 p.m. Aug. 3 to 11:30 a.m. Aug. 4. Several items were stolen from a store entered through an unlocked rear door.

MANASSAS AREA

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Browns Lane, July 31. A man sexually assaulted a female juvenile acquaintance. A 28-year-old Manassas man was arrested.

New Market Ct., 7200 block, 8:32 p.m. Aug. 6. A man at a hotel took nude photos of a girl and encouraged her to prostitute herself in return for food and shelter. A 23-year-old Manassas man was charged with contributing to the delinquency of a minor and using a communication system to facilitate certain offenses with a minor.

ASSAULTS

Gregory Ct., 7800 block, 12:32 a.m. Aug. 4. During an argument, a man drove his vehicle and hit a male acquaintance. The acquaintance was treated for injuries. A 37-year-old Manassas man was arrested.

ROBBERIES

New Market Ct., 7200 block, 8:36 p.m. Aug. 3. A man knocked on a hotel room door, then demanded money from a male acquaintance at gunpoint. The man hit the acquaintance on the head with the gun, which fired a bullet, striking the acquaintance in the shoulder. The gunman fled with a wallet and cash. The acquaintance was treated for injuries.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Campaign Ct., 10900 block, 11:30 a.m. to 4:45 p.m. July 31. Cash and a TV were stolen from a residence entered by breaking a basement window.

Omega Lane, 6000 block, 4:44 a.m. Aug. 6. A man entered a residence through an unlocked garage door. He fled empty-handed when a resident saw him.

WOODBRIDGE AREA

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Cotton Mill Dr., 12300 block, 10 p.m. Aug. 6. A man met a female juvenile through social media, and he was found in possession of nude photos of her. A 29-year-old Manassas Park man was charged with contributing to the delinquency of a minor, possession of child pornography and using a communication system to facilitate certain offenses with a minor.

ASSAULTS

Kellogg Dr., 4800 block, 8:05 p.m. Aug. 4. During an argument, a man attempted to hit a male acquaintance with a vehicle. The motorist parked the vehicle, then hit the acquaintance on the arm with a metal stick. A 27-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

ARSON

Park Shore Ct., 12100 block, 9:32 a.m. July 31. Someone entered a vacant residence through a rear basement window and started a fire, damaging the basement.

WEAPONS

Dale Blvd. and Minnieville Rd., 10:19 p.m. Aug. 5. Someone fired a BB gun at a moving vehicle, breaking a rear window.

Kingsman Rd., 13500 block, 1:58 a.m. Aug. 5. Someone in a vehicle fired a weapon several times. A bullet hit a parked vehicle.

ROBBERIES

Kenwood and Kenmar drives, 9:50 p.m. Aug. 7. A male with a shotgun robbed a man and a woman of cash and cellphones.

Potomac Mills Rd., 14600 block, 3:35 a.m. Aug. 7. A gunman robbed a hotel of cash.

Tacketts Mill Dr., 2200 block, 9:28 p.m. Aug. 3. A male in a parking lot put his arm around the neck of a man and demanded money. He fled on foot with cash.

INDECENT EXPOSURE

Dale Blvd., 5800 block, 2:26 p.m. Aug. 5. A man in a store made inappropriate gestures in front of a woman. A 51-year-old Providence, R.I., man was arrested.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Belvedere Dr., 14400 block, 7 a.m. to 6:30 p.m. Aug. 1. Cash and jewelry were stolen from a residence entered by forcing a rear door.

Briton Ct., 4400 block, 5:38 a.m. Aug. 1. A man was inside a garage when a resident saw him. The man fled empty-handed.

Felmore Ct., 3600 block, noon Aug. 1. A man knocked on a front door of a residence. When a resident did not answer, the man attempted to enter the residence by breaking a rear window. He did not enter.

Foothill St., 3200 block, 10 a.m. to 8 p.m. Aug. 2. A laptop computer, two video game systems, games and other items were stolen from a residence.

Frishman Ct., 4900 block, 9 a.m. to 6:30 p.m. Aug. 1. Two bikes were stolen from a residence entered through an open garage door.

Mayflower Dr., 2100 block, 11:30 p.m. Aug. 3 to 4:30 a.m. Aug. 4. Cash, a laptop computer, a video game system and jewelry were stolen from a residence entered by breaking a rear window.

Rivanna Ct., 3100 block, 12:10 p.m. Aug. 2 to 3:49 p.m. Aug. 4. Three TVs and other electronics were stolen from a residence.

Samantha Ct., 14200 block, 10:45 a.m. to 1:10 p.m. Aug. 1. Jewelry was stolen from a residence entered by breaking a side window.

Vestal St., 700 block, 10 a.m. to 3 p.m. Aug. 1. Cash and purses were stolen from a residence.

Manassas

No reports were received from Manassas police for today's Local Living section. For information, call 703-257-8000.

Manassas Park

The following incident was reported by Manassas Park police. For information, call 703-361-1136.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Andrew Dr., 9:16 p.m. July 31. A bike was stolen from the front area of a business.

Industry Dr., 6 p.m. July 29 to 7 a.m. July 30. Computers, computer equipment, tools, a sump pump, a photocopier and other items were stolen from two businesses entered by breaking side glass doors. A truck was spray-painted.

Montgomery County Crime Watch


SECTION: MONTGOMERY EXTRA; Pg. T32


LENGTH: 1040 words


The following were among crime reports recently received by the Montgomery County Police Department.

REWARDS FOR INFORMATION

Crime Solvers of Montgomery County Inc., a nonprofit community organization, will pay up to $ 1,000 for information leading to an arrest and indictment in connection with these and any other felonies. Call the 24-hour hot line at 800-673-2777. Callers may remain anonymous.  

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

FREDERICK AVE., 10000 block, May 10 or May 11. A rear sliding glass door at a residence was pried. Nothing was reported stolen.

GROSVENOR LANE, 6000 block, 1 to 5 p.m. May 11. Jewelry was stolen from a residence entered by prying a rear kitchen window.

VENTNOR RD., 5300 block, 2:50 to 3:30 p.m. May 10. Jewelry was stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked back door while a resident was outside working in the yard.

INDECENT EXPOSURES

ROUTE 118 AND BOWMAN MILL ROAD, near Walter Johnson Drive, a person reported seeing a man wearing only sunglasses, shoes and socks sitting in a culvert.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

CIRCLE GATE DR., 19300 block, 8:15 p.m. May 11. A pit bull was stolen from a residence entered by breaking through a front door.

CRYSTAL HILL CIR., 20100 block, 9:20 a.m. to 1:45 p.m. May 14. A rear window at a residence was broken.

SHAKESPEARE DR., 20900 block, 5:15 to 6 p.m. May 11. A residence was entered by forcing a front door. Nothing was reported stolen.

 SEXUAL ASSAULTS 

WATKINS MILL RD., 19300 block, 4:30 p.m. May 12. A man tried to talk to a 16-year-old girl who was walking down an asphalt path between Montgomery Village Middle School and Stedwick Elementary School. She indicated she was deaf and the man pushed the girl to the ground and sexually assaulted her. After the attack, the girl ran home.

ROBBERIES

FREDERICK RD., 20500 block, 12:26 a.m. May 13. Two youths outside a gas station assaulted and robbed a 27-year-old man as he was talking on a public telephone.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

APPLERIDGE RD., 10500 block, 11 a.m. to 9 p.m., May 14. An attempt was made to enter a residence by kicking in a rear door.

N. FREDERICK AVE., 100 block, 9:30 p.m. May 13 to 5:30 a.m. May 14. Cash was stolen from a dry-cleaning business entered by cutting through a glass front window.

W. DEER PARK RD., 1-100 block, 2:40 a.m. May 12. A vacant apartment was entered and the interior was sprayed with paint.

W. DEER PARK RD., 1-100 block, May 13 or May 14. A mattress was stolen from a residence entered by prying a basement door.

ASSAULTS

JOHNSON DR., 120 block, 3:30 p.m. May 12. A boy threatened to stab four family members with a steak knife. A 13-year-old boy was arrested and charged with four counts of first-degree assault.

ROBBERIES

COLLEGE PKWY., 400 block, May 3. A man used a handgun to rob a resident. A search and seizure warrant was issued and Rockville City Police, assisted by Montgomery County Police, executed the warrant on May 11 and arrested. An 18-year-old Rockville man was arrested May 11 and charged in the incident with one count each of armed robbery, use of a handgun in the commission of a felony and first-degree assault. A handgun was recovered along with evidence from the May 3 robbery.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

COACHWAY DR, 4600 block, noon May 9 to 7:30 p.m. May 14. A moped was stolen from a garage at a residence.

ELMCROFT BLVD., 700 block, 8:30 a.m. to 5:30 p.m. March 26. An apartment was entered and a female Siberian husky service dog was stolen, along with the dog's braided leather leash and a leather dog harness. A 31-year-old Columbia man was arrested May 10 at Logan International Airport, Boston, and released on bond. He returned to Montgomery County where he was arrested May 14 and charged with first-degree burglary, fourth-degree burglary, theft over $ 500 and theft under $ 500.

FREDERICK RD., 16000 block, 6:50 p.m. May 9 to 7:15 a.m. May 10. An auto-repair business garage was entered by kicking in a garage bay door. Nothing was reported stolen.

MONROE ST., 200 block, 3:30 to 4:40 p.m. May 14. Property was stolen from the above location.

S. STONESTREET AVE., 700 block, 8 p.m. May 10. A residence was entered through a window. Nothing was reported stolen.

SENECA RD., 14600 block, midnight May 6 to 11 a.m. May 11. Auto parts were stolen from an unlocked garage at a residence.

WOOTTON PKWY., 2100 block, 9 p.m. May 11 to 10:30 a.m. May 12. Candy was stolen from a high school concession stand, entered by prying a door frame.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

DEBENHAM CT., 4100 block, 3 to 3:30 a.m. May 13. Property was stolen from vehicles inside a garage at a residence, entered by using a garage-door opener.

ROSETREE CT., 14300 block, May 9, May 2 and April 30; BALLOWS WAY, 2000 block, Feb. 9 and Feb. 5; LAYHILL SQUARE AREA, Feb. 9. A 14-year-old boy was arrested May 9 and charged with five counts of first-degree burglary in connection with thefts at the above locations. He was released into the custody of his father pending a court date.

The following were among crime reports recently received by the Takoma Park Police Department. For more information, call 301-270-8724.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

FLOWER AVE, 8700 block, 11:53 p.m. May 13. Property was stolen from a parked car. A male was seen breaking one of the vehicle's windows.

GLAIZEWOOD DR., 11 p.m. May 14 to 6:30 a.m. May 15. An ECM computer module for a vehicle was stolen from a 1990 Honda Civic, entered by breaking a window.

LARCH AVE., 900 block, May 12. A man broke into a shed and stole a lawn mower. A man was arrested and charged with theft and third-degree burglary.

NEW HAMPSHIRE AVENUE AND UNIVERSITY BOULEVARD, May 11. A man drove a vehicle with license tags that had been reported stolen. A man was arrested and charged with theft.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

ALLEGHENY AVE., 6400 block, 8 p.m. May 9 to 9:30 a.m. May 10. The steering column and ignition of a 1992 Jeep Cherokee were damaged and a vent window was broken during an attempt to steal the vehicle.

BOSTON AVE., 500 block, 9 p.m. May 12 to 8:30 a.m. May 13. A 1994 Dodge Van was stolen.

NEW YORK AVE., 500 block, 9:30 p.m. May 9 to 7 a.m. May 10. A 1995 Dodge Caravan was stolen.

PINEY BRANCH RD., 7600 block, 7 to 10 p.m. May 16. A 1992 Dodge Caravan was stolen.

-- Christine Swerda

August 13, 2015 Thursday 1:04 AM EST 


Prince William County crime report


SECTION: Metro; Pg. T23


LENGTH: 1113 words


Prince William County

These were among incidents reported by Prince William County police. For information, call 703-792-7245.

DUMFRIES AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Mountain Laurel Loop, 3200 block, 3:28 a.m. Aug. 2. Two unlocked vehicles parked in a driveway were entered. A wallet and keys were stolen. A residence was entered through a front door using a key. Nothing was reported stolen from the residence.

GAINESVILLE AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Tall Timber Dr., 8100 block, 3:15 a.m. Aug. 1. An attempt was made to enter a residence through a rear door. 

Yountville Dr., 7300 block, 7 a.m. to 6 p.m. July 28. A video game system was stolen from a residence.

Yountville Dr., 7300 block, noon July 30 to 10:20 a.m. Aug. 1. A laptop computer, a camera and other items were stolen from a residence.

MANASSAS AREA SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Ashland Ave. area, 2 a.m. July 20 to 2 a.m. July 21. A man sexually assaulted a female acquaintance. A Manassas man, 26, was arrested.

ASSAULTS

Williamson Blvd., 7300 block, 1 a.m. Aug. 2. During an argument, a man hit a male acquaintance in the face. The acquaintance was treated for injuries. A Four Oaks, N.C., man, 19, was arrested.

ROBBERIES

Granite Lane, 8400 block, 9:05 p.m. July 30. A man implying he had a knife robbed another man of a bike.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Ashland Ave., 7900 block, noon July 26 to noon July 28. A residence was entered by damaging a rear door. Several windows, interior walls and fixtures were also damaged. Nothing was reported stolen.

Irongate Way, 10100 block, 9 p.m. July 31 to 8:30 a.m. Aug. 1. Items were stolen from a residence entered by forcing a rear door.

Linblake Ct., 8200 block, 5 a.m. to 7 p.m. July 24. Rolls of coins and other items were stolen from a residence entered through a basement window.

TRIANGLE AREA

ROBBERIES

Quantico Terr. Dr., 3600 block, 12:56 p.m. July 23. A man asked a female acquaintance for a ride. The woman complied and drove the man to a destination. The man got out of the vehicle, then returned with a handgun. He demanded the woman's cellphone and that she get out of the vehicle. The man drove away in the vehicle.

WOODBRIDGE AREA SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Jefferson Davis Hwy., 13900 block, 8:39 p.m. Aug. 3. A man in front of a convenience store inappropriately touched a woman.

ASSAULTS

Densmore Ct., 12200 block, 11:30 p.m. July 29. During an argument, a man assaulted a female acquaintance. An Upper Marlboro man, 27, was arrested.

CHILD-CARE INCIDENTS

Worchester Dr., 4400 block, 9:11 p.m. July 31. During an argument, a woman assaulted a female juvenile acquaintance, repeatedly hitting her with an electrical cord. A man also hit the girl with an electrical cord. A man, 26, and a woman, 25, both of Woodbridge, were arrested.

WEAPONS

Bel Air and Stevens roads, 3:07 a.m. July 30. Several gunshots were heard, and two cars were seen leaving the area. A man was treated at a hospital for a gunshot wound to his hand.

ROBBERIES

Brook Dr., 14600 block, 11:23 p.m. July 28. A group forced a man into a pickup truck, and they struggled. Several gunshots were fired, and someone took cash from the man. He escaped from the vehicle.

INDECENT EXPOSURE

Gideon Dr., 14300 block, noon Aug. 3. A man in a vehicle at a gas station exposed himself to a woman.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Clipper Dr., 12500 block, 8 p.m. July 29 to 10:47 a.m. July 30. Cash was stolen from a community pool area.

Frisco Ct., 13600 block, 5 p.m. July 26 to 5 p.m. July 29. A mountain bike was stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked porch door.

Ripple Creek Ct., 12700 block, 11:20 a.m. to 8:10 p.m. Aug. 1. A laptop computer was stolen from a residence.

Sophia Ct., 3500 block, 2 p.m. July 24. Two bikes were stolen from a residence entered through an open garage door.

Whistling Swan Way, 1600 block, midnight to 9:30 a.m. July 28. A wallet containing cash was stolen from a residence entered through an open garage door.

Manassas

These were among incidents reported by Manassas police. For more information, call 703-257-8000.

ASSAULTS

Dumfries Rd., 10100 block, 9:50 p.m. July 23. A female juvenile stole items from a grocery store. When an employee confronted her, the girl hit the employee several times. A Manassas girl, 16, was arrested.

WEAPONS

Greengate Ct., 9000 block, July 27. A man fired a weapon, damaging exterior and interior walls of a residence. No one was reported injured.

ROBBERIES

Stonewall Rd., 4:30 p.m. July 28. Two men demanded money from a female pedestrian, who refused. The men forced her to the ground and robbed her of cash.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Centreville Rd., 9000 block, July 19 to 25. A video game system, speakers and an air-conditioning unit were stolen from a shed.

Garnet Ct., 9200 block, 12:40 a.m. July 21. Two males searched three vehicles. They fled when a resident confronted them.

Metcalf Blvd., 8400 block, July 22. A wallet was stolen from an unlocked vehicle.

Richmond Ave., 9600 block, 10 p.m. July 22 to 9:30 a.m. July 23. Cash was stolen from a vehicle.

Stonewall Rd., 8900 block, 10 p.m. July 26 to 9 a.m. July 27. A vehicle was entered and searched. Items were stolen from a wallet.

Weems Rd., 8600 block, July 27 to July 30. A residence was entered through a rear door. Nothing was reported stolen.

7th Regiment Dr., 10300 block, 2:30 to 6:30 p.m. July 20. A handgun and two watches were stolen from a residence entered by prying open a front door.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Centreville Rd., 9000 block, 3 p.m. July 26 to 8:30 a.m. July 27. A 2006 Ford F-550 truck was stolen from a dealership.

VANDALISM

Clover Hill Rd., 9500 block, 10 p.m. July 24 to 11 a.m. July 25. Someone fired an airsoft gun, damaging a window of a vehicle and the side of a residence.

Fairview Ave., 9600 block, 5:15 a.m. July 26. Someone fired several shots from an airsoft gun. No one was reported injured.

Georgian Ct., 8300 block, 7:15 a.m. July 29. Tires of a vehicle were punctured and flattened.

Plantation Lane, 8700 block, 1:30 to 3:30 a.m. July 28. A speed-limit sign and a mailbox were damaged.

Manassas Park

No incidents were reported by Manassas Park police for this edition of Local Living. For information, call 703-361-1136.

Prince William County crime report 


SECTION: METRO; Pg. T22


LENGTH: 959 words


Prince William County

The following incidents were reported by Prince William County police. For information, call 703-792-7245.

BRISTOW AREA

ROBBERIES

Hazel Circle Dr., 11800 block, 11:46 p.m. Dec. 7. Two male juveniles, one armed with a box cutter, robbed a male resident of two laptops and other electronics at a residential school facility. Two 17-year-old residents of the facility were arrested.

DUMFRIES AREA

ASSAULTS

Wexford Loop, 17200 block, 8:39 p.m. Dec. 7. During an argument, a man assaulted a female acquaintance in a room and prevented her from leaving. A 33-year-old Dumfries man was arrested. 

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Belleplain Ct., 3400 block, 9 a.m. to 1 p.m. Dec. 2. A laptop, a video game system and other property were stolen from a residence entered by forcing open a rear basement door.

Holleyside Dr., 15100 block, 7:45 a.m. to 3:15 p.m. Someone entered a residence by forcing open a rear window. Nothing was reported stolen.

GAINESVILLE AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Bearhurst Dr., 8400 block, 7 p.m. Dec. 6 to 9 a.m. Dec. 7. A TV and other property were stolen from a vacant residence entered through an unlocked door.

MANASSAS AREA

ASSAULTS

Coverstone Dr., 10900 block, 7:26 p.m. Dec. 7. During an argument, a woman swung a knife at a male acquaintance. He was cut when attempting to defend himself. He grabbed the knife from the woman, who then stabbed him with a long-prong fork. A 33-year-old Manassas woman was arrested.

INDECENT EXPOSURE

Soldiers Ridge Cir., 11200 block, 10:10 a.m. Dec. 5 and 11:58 a.m. Dec. 11. A man exposed himself to two male juveniles.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Mountwood Dr., 9500 block, 12:01 to 5:15 a.m. Dec. 8. Property was stolen from seven vehicles entered by breaking windows.

Peakwood Ct., 8100 block, 7 a.m. to 3:30 p.m. Dec. 5. Two TVs and jewelry were stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked window.

NOKESVILLE AREA

ASSAULTS

Fleetwood Dr., 13600 block, 9:51 p.m. Dec. 7. During an argument, a woman stabbed a male acquaintance with a knife. A 29-year-old Nokesville woman was arrested.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Kettle Run Rd., 11000 block, noon Nov. 28 to 4 p.m. Dec. 4. Copper piping, a computer, other electronics and tools were stolen from a residence under construction. The residence was entered by breaking a side window.

TRIANGLE AREA

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Barnette Forest area, 5:39 p.m. Dec. 7. A man had a sexual relationship with a female juvenile. A 21-year-old Triangle man was arrested.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Fuller Heights Rd., 19000 block, 5 p.m. Nov. 29 to 9 a.m. Nov. 30. Someone entered a residence and searched several rooms. Nothing was reported stolen.

Fuller Heights Rd., 19100 block, 11:12 p.m. Dec. 6. A man entered a building through an unlocked rear door to charge a drill. A 31-year-old Triangle man was arrested.

Oakdale Cir., 3900 block, 5:07 a.m. Dec. 5. Two men stole a TV from a shed. When chased, they dropped the TV.

Riverview Dr., 3200 block, 11 p.m. Dec. 9 to 9 a.m. Dec. 10. Cash was stolen from a residence.

WOODBRIDGE AREA

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Jefferson Davis Hwy., 9:10 p.m. Dec. 7. A man sexually assaulted a woman. A 66-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

ASSAULTS

Wilson St., 17400 block, 12:51 a.m. Dec. 10. During an argument, a man hit a female acquaintance with a small table, then waved a pocketknife at her. A 53-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

ROBBERIES

Apollo Dr., 12600 block, 10:43 a.m. Dec. 8. A man robbed a bank of cash.

Fox Lair Dr., 2900 block, 9:30 p.m. Dec. 9. Two gunmen robbed a woman of a purse containing cash.

Geddy Ct., 16600 block, 2:29 p.m. Dec. 9. One of two male juveniles hit a woman with an object and attempted to grab her purse. The juveniles fled empty-handed.

Jefferson Davis Hwy., 14000 block, 5:49 p.m. Dec. 10. A group of males assaulted a male pedestrian and robbed him of a cellphone.

Old Bridge Rd., 1400 block, 10:45 p.m. Dec. 9. A man implied he had a weapon and robbed a convenience store of cash.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Adams St., 2800 block, 3:29 a.m. Dec. 6. A male attempted to enter a residence through a window. He fled when a female resident confronted him.

Cantania Pl., 2700 block, 5 a.m. to 2:30 p.m. Dec. 12. Someone entered a residence by breaking a rear window. Nothing was reported stolen.

Cummings Ct., 14900 block, Nov. 29 to Dec. 3. Someone attempted to enter a residence by prying a window.

Gableridge Turn, 1900 block, 4 p.m. Dec. 8 to 12:30 a.m. Dec. 9. Someone attempted to enter a residence by prying a front door.
