Crime Report


SECTION: EXTRAS; Pg. PW18


LENGTH: 1430 words


Prince William

The following incidents were reported by Prince William County police. For information, call 703-792-7245.

Bristow area

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

GENERAL COOKE DR., 11700 block, 9 a.m. to 5 p.m. June 24. Property was stolen from a residence. Items in a garage were damaged.

Dale City area

SEXUAL ASSAULTS 

BELLEVILLE AVE., 11:20 a.m. June 25. A man allegedly inappropriately touched two female acquaintances, ages 6 and 5. A 31-year-old Dale City man was arrested.

Haymarket area

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

JAMES MADISON HWY., 3500 block, 2 a.m. June 25. A business was entered by breaking a rear window. A 25-year-old McLean man, a 22-year-old Montgomery Village man and a 23-year-old man were arrested.

Manassas area

SEXUAL ASSAULTS 

CHATTERLY LOOP, 11:30 p.m. June 24. A man allegedly dragged a female acquaintance inside her residence, held her at knife point and attempted to sexually assault her. The woman distracted the assailant and fled to a neighbor's residence. A 42-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested. 

ASSAULTS

ALLEGHANY RD., 7500 block, 4:22 a.m. June 29. A man pointed a gun at a male resident who was leaving his residence. The resident closed the door and called police. The resident's vehicle was damaged.

PRINCE WILLIAM PKWY. AND BALLS FORD RD., 11 p.m. June 25. During a traffic altercation, a motorist driving a vehicle hit a man's vehicle. No injuries were injured.

SUDLEY RD., 8200 block, 12:20 p.m. June 26. During an argument involving three women, one of the women allegedly hit the other two. A 26-year-old Chantilly woman was arrested.

ROBBERIES

SUDLEY RD., 8000 block, 2:20 a.m. June 26. Three men demanded money from a male employee at a business. When the employee attempted to flee, one of the men hit his finger with a knife, and another man hit his hand with a baseball bat. The employee was treated for injuries.

INDECENT EXPOSURE

OLD BRIDGE RD., 2200 block, 8:10 p.m. June 29. A man exposed himself while driving a green vehicle.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

CHAMPLAIN DR., 13000 block, 10:30 a.m. June 19 to 9 p.m. June 20. Property was stolen from a residence entered through a garage door.

Montclair area

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

BACKWATER CT., 4900 block, 11 a.m. June 22 to 4:30 p.m. June 24. Someone attempted to enter a residence through a rear window and door.

BRANDYWINE RD., 15700 block, 1 to 6 a.m. June 24. Cash was stolen from a residence entered through a dog door.

Triangle area

ASSAULTS

GRAHAM PARK RD., 3900 block, 6:09 p.m. June 23. Officers responding to a report of a fight allegedly saw a woman try to strike another woman with a razor. The other woman was not injured. The armed woman was treated for injuries from an earlier fight. A 40-year-old Woodbridge woman was arrested.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

PURVIS DR., 18100 block, 5:30 p.m. June 22 to 8:30 a.m. June 23. Equipment was stolen from a business, and graffiti were found inside.

SOUTHWAY LANE, 4100 block, 10 p.m. June 24 to 8:30 a.m. June 25. Someone attempted to enter an apartment building through a laundry room.

Woodbridge area

ASSAULTS

BOTTS AVE., 13800 block, 9:21 p.m. June 23. During an argument, a woman allegedly stabbed a male relative in the chest. The man was treated for injuries. A 21-year-old Woodbridge woman was arrested.

FALLBROOK LANE, 14000 block, 1:09 p.m. June 23. During an argument, a man allegedly hit a male acquaintance on the shoulder with a hammer. A 39-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

FEATHERSTONE RD., 14700 block, 6:34 p.m. June 28. During an argument at a residence, a man allegedly pointed a gun at a male relative and fired a warning shot in an attempt to persuade the relative to leave. No injuries were reported. A 52-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

HEDGES RUN DR., 12400 block, 3:55 a.m. June 27. People in a vehicle fired BBs at four businesses. No injuries were reported.

HYLTON AVE., 1500 block, 11 p.m. June 25. A male driving a vehicle allegedly struck an unoccupied, parked vehicle on Alison Street. He then parked nearby on Hylton Avenue. Two men confronted the motorist on Hylton and demanded compensation for damage to the parked vehicle, then reportedly forced the motorist into a vehicle. The motorist was driven to the parked vehicle and assaulted. A witness, who had seen the confrontation on Hylton, helped the motorist escape from the men. A 30-year-old Woodbridge man and a 26-year-old Greenbelt man were arrested.

JEFFERSON DAVIS HWY., 14300 block, 9:25 a.m. June 26. Two males at a grocery store assaulted a man, who was treated for injuries.

OCCOQUAN RD., 13300 block, 10:10 p.m. June 26. Four men assaulted a male juvenile, and the juvenile was stabbed. The juvenile was treated for injuries.

OLD BRIDGE RD., 3500 block, 11:20 p.m. June 27. A man tried to hit a male employee in the face at a store.

SUTTON PL., 16600 block, 10:11 a.m. June 24. During an argument involving a woman and a male acquaintance, the woman got into a vehicle. As she was driving away, she allegedly hit the man, pinning him under the vehicle. He was treated for injuries.

WEAPONS

MILLWOOD DR., 13400 block, 12:09 a.m. June 27. A gun was fired during a party. No injuries were reported.

ROBBERIES

JEFFERSON DAVIS HWY., 13900 block, 11:51 p.m. June 24. Three men entered a hotel room and robbed two men of cash and a wallet at gunpoint.

OLD BRIDGE RD., 3200 block, 10:51 p.m. June 29. A gunman robbed a store of cash.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

BAYSIDE AVE., 1300 block, 12:26 a.m. June 29. A man entered a residence by breaking a lock on a sliding-glass door. When a resident opened a bedroom door, the intruder fled empty-handed.

DALE BLVD., 1400 block, 2:45 a.m. June 24. Property was stolen from a business entered by breaking a front window with a rock.

DELANEY RD., 13500 block, 8 p.m. June 19 to 8 p.m. June 21. Property was stolen from a residence entered through a front door.

EAGLE RIDGE DR., 3200 block, 5 to 9 p.m. June 23. Property was stolen from a residence entered through a rear basement window.

FOULGERS SQ., 13700 block, 7:53 p.m. June 25. A man and a woman allegedly took merchandise from a store. A 22-year-old man and a 26-year-old woman, both from Woodbridge, were arrested.

MARQUIS PL., 3800 block, 9:30 a.m. to 5:30 p.m. June 25. Someone attempted to enter a residence through a front door.

MINNIEVILLE RD., 13400 block, 3 a.m. June 25 to 5:45 a.m. June 26. Property was stolen from a business entered through a side door.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Manassas Park

August 6, 2009 Thursday

Crime Report


SECTION: EXTRAS; Pg. PW09


LENGTH: 1195 words


Prince William

The following incidents were reported by Prince William County police. For information, call 703-792-7245.

Dale City Area

ROBBERIES

BROOK DR., 14400 block, 8:50 p.m. July 26. Three males and a female assaulted two brothers and robbed them of cash and a pair of shoes. One of the assailants was armed with a knife. One of the brothers was treated for injuries.

DALE BLVD., 4300 block, 5:08 p.m. July 25. A man grabbed a purse from a female juvenile pedestrian, hit her on the head and fled.

WELSH LANE, 4300 block, 8:48 p.m. July 25. Two males at an apartment building advertised a flat-screen TV for sale. The males then allegedly robbed a man who replied to the ad of a car key and a cellphone. One of the robbers had a rifle. 

Gainesville Area

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

EARLY MARKER CT., 7300 block, 1:22 a.m. July 25. A man armed with a knife entered a residence. He fled empty-handed when a resident found him in a hallway and screamed.

HERITAGE VALLEY WAY, 13700 block, 4:30 to 6 a.m. July 17. Golf clubs and a Global Positioning System device were stolen from an unlocked garage.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

JOHN MARSHALL HWY., 14100 block, 5:35 a.m. July 19. A white 2002 Bobcat skid loader was stolen.

Haymarket Area

SEXUAL ASSAULTS 

CULLEN PL., July 17. A 33-year-old man was arrested in connection with the alleged rape of a female juvenile in September.

Lake Ridge Area

ASSAULTS

WINONA DR., 12000 block, 3:40 a.m. July 26. Someone fired a BB at a residence, breaking a window. No injuries were reported.

Manassas Area

ASSAULTS

CUB RUN CT., 10200 block, 6:15 p.m. July 16. During a basketball game, a ball hit one of the players in the leg. The player became upset, grabbed a shovel and argued with the group. Another man grabbed a bigger shovel and confronted the player and another man. The two ran into their residence and locked the door. The man with the bigger shovel kicked open a door, but the two prevented him from entering. A 20-year-old Manassas man was arrested and charged with entering a dwelling with the intent to assault.

IRONGATE WAY, 10100 block, 10:44 p.m. July 24. A male juvenile was allegedly handling a gun in a reckless manner and fired the weapon, hitting a female juvenile in the arm. The girl was treated for injuries.

IRONGATE WAY AND FARRAGUT CT., 11:42 p.m. July 24. A man allegedly fired a weapon at a male acquaintance. No injuries were reported. A 20-year-old Manassas man was arrested.

LAFAYETTE AVE., 9800 block, 7:50 p.m. July 26. Police investigating a noise complaint asked an intoxicated male to turn down loud music at a residence. The resident refused and allegedly began to act disorderly. After he was notified that he was under arrest, relatives allegedly attempted to interfere with the arrest. A 55-year-old Manassas man was arrested and charged with public drunkenness and resisting arrest. A 25-year-old woman was arrested and charged with assaulting an officer, obstruction of justice and resisting arrest. The arresting officer used a stun device on the man and woman to take them into custody.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

BARBADOS LANE, 7400 block, 7 p.m. July 19 to 8 a.m. July 20. A laptop computer, a video game system, video games, jewelry and a pair of athletic shoes were stolen from a residence.

PORTSMOUTH RD., 10300 block, 8:45 a.m. July 24. A man allegedly stayed in the storage room of a store overnight. Police officers found the man hiding in the storage area. A 47-year-old Manassas man was arrested.

STREAMWALK LANE, 7400 block, 1:30 p.m. July 17. A man allegedly took DVDs from a store. A 36-year-old Baltimore man was arrested.

SUDLEY RD., 8000 block, 6 p.m. July 18 to 1 p.m. July 19. A gray 2000 U-Haul trailer was stolen from a business.

Woodbridge Area

ASSAULTS

DEVILS REACH RD., 1300 block, 4:50 p.m. July 20. A boy in a hallway allegedly grabbed a woman from behind, picked her up and carried her. He covered her mouth when she called for help. The boy then dropped the woman and ran into a doctor's office. A 12-year-old boy was arrested.

ROBBERIES

ARKANSAS ST., 14700 block, 5:15 p.m. July 17. A male juvenile allegedly punched another male juvenile and took his bike. A 16-year-old Woodbridge boy was arrested. The bike was returned to its owner.

GINA PL., 3200 block, 8:45 p.m. July 26. Three male juveniles ordered two male juvenile pedestrians to get on the ground at knifepoint, threatening to kill them. They robbed the two of cash and a backpack.

JEFFERSON DAVIS HWY., 13400 block, 9:10 a.m. July 24. A woman in a bank allegedly implied she had a gun and gave a note to a teller demanding money. She fled in a vehicle with cash. A 46-year-old Lorton woman was arrested.

INDECENT EXPOSURE

SLIPPERY ELM CT. AND MOONBEAM DR., 6:30 p.m. July 17. A man in a blue pickup exposed himself to a group of six juveniles who were playing outside.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

DILLON AVE., 14800 block, 12:55 a.m. July 21. A purse and documents were stolen from an unlocked vehicle.

FOULGERS SQ., 13700 block, 6:45 p.m. July 17. A woman allegedly attempted to leave a store with concealed merchandise. A 38-year-old Woodbridge woman was arrested.

MARQUIS PL., 3800 block, 4 to 10:30 p.m. July 20. A video game system and accessories were stolen from a residence.

POTOMAC MILLS CIR., 2700 block, 7:29 p.m. July 20. A woman allegedly took merchandise from a store. A 36-year-old District woman was arrested.

QUELL CT., 5000 block, 11 p.m. July 19 to 8 a.m. July 20. Two Global Positioning System devices were stolen from two vehicles. A third vehicle was entered, but nothing was reported stolen.

SHOPPERS BEST WAY, 14000 block, 2:33 a.m. July 18. A night deposit bag containing cash was stolen from a restaurant.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

RIPPLE CREEK CT., 12700 block, 5:30 to 10 a.m. July 20. A red 2007 Chevrolet Prism, cash, bank cards, a laptop computer and a cellphone were stolen from a residence.

Manassas

The following incidents were reported by Manassas police. For information, call 703-257-8000.

ROBBERIES

GRANT AVE., 9600 block, 10:44 a.m. July 25. Five males assaulted four pedestrians with pipes and sticks and robbed one of the pedestrians of a wallet. Two pedestrians were taken to a hospital.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

MAIN ST., 9400 block, 11 p.m. July 21 to 6 a.m. July 22. Someone broke a soda vending machine and stole cash.

MATHIS AVE., 8900 block, 12:05 to 7:30 a.m. July 19. Cash was stolen from a business entered by forcing open a window.

SUDLEY RD., 8600 block, 2:08 a.m. July 26. A cash register containing money was stolen from a business entered by breaking a front window. An unsuccessful attempt was made to enter another business by breaking a window. The cash register was recovered.

Manassas Park

The following incidents were reported by Manassas Park police. For information, call 703-361-1136.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

ENGLEWOOD CT., 8500 block, 5 to 6:15 p.m. July 20. Jewelry and DVDs were stolen from a residence entered through a rear door. Several DVDs and jewelry were located on a path near the residence.

MARKET ST., 100 block, 1:30 to 11:30 a.m. July 19. A surfboard was stolen from the top of a vehicle.

WHITEPINE DR., 8200 block, 3 to 7:24 p.m. July 27. License plates were stolen from a vehicle.

-- Compiled by SARAH LANE

Montgomery County crime report


SECTION: METRO; Pg. T30


LENGTH: 3017 words


Among incidents reported by police in Montgomery County, Rockville and Takoma Park.

Montgomery County

These were among incidents recently received by the Montgomery County Police Department. For information, call 240-773-5030.

REWARDS FOR INFORMATION

Crime Solvers of Montgomery County, a nonprofit organization, pays up to $1,000 for information leading to an arrest and indictment in connection with felonies. Call the 24-hour hotline at 800-673-2777. Callers may remain anonymous.

DISTRICT 1ROCKVILLE STATIONTELEPHONE: 240-773-6070

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Halpine Rd., 8:30 to 11:30 p.m. Dec. 25. A person sexually assaulted an acquaintance.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Beall Ave.,Bickford Ave., Bradford Dr., Carr Ave., Forest Ave., Grayson Ct., Great Falls Rd., Montgomery Ave. and Smallwood Rd., Dec. 16 to 17. Cash and coins were stolen from 11 vehicles. Most were entered by force. 

Crabbs Branch Way, 15800 block, 1:02 p.m. Dec. 18. Property was stolen from a vehicle. A 24-year-old man of unknown address was found in possession of the property and arrested.

Halesworth Dr., 1100 block, 7 to 8 p.m. Dec. 17. Property was stolen from a vehicle in a garage. A 16-year-old Rockville male was arrested.

Southern Maryland crime reportSouthern Maryland crime report


SECTION: Metro; Pg. T24


LENGTH: 780 words


Calvert County

These were among reports received by the Calvert County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. Anyone with information about these crimes should call the Criminal Investigation Division, 410-535-2800 or 301-855-1194, or the Crime Solvers line, 410-535-2880. You can also call the Prince Frederick Barrack of the state police at 410-535-1400.

CHESAPEAKE BEACH AREA ARSON  

G St., July 6. The interior of a two-story residence was set on fire. Three males, 11, 12 and 14, were charged with first-degree arson and malicious destruction of property.

DUNKIRK AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Shields Dr., June 30. Property was stolen from a residence.

LUSBY AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Ropeknot Rd., June 28 to June 29. An iPod was stolen from a vehicle at a residence.

Sachem Dr., 3:32 p.m., July 4. Copper wire was stolen from a utility pole. A man, 35, was charged with theft.

NORTH BEACH AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Ninth St., June 30 to July 1. A GPS and a camera were stolen from a vehicle.

PORT REPUBLIC AREA VANDALISM

Miles Way, July 9 to July 10. A vehicle was damaged at a residence.

ST. LEONARD AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Hill Side Rd., July 9 to July 10. An anchor was stolen from a boat in a driveway at a residence.

Charles County

These were among reports received by the Charles County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. For information, call 301-932-2222 or 301-870-3232. Crime Solvers will pay a reward for information leading to an arrest and an indictment in connection with these and other crimes. Call the 24-hour hotline at 866-411-8477. Callers may remain anonymous. The Charles County Sheriff's Office Web site is www.ccso.us. Included at the site are daily news releases, Crime Watch neighborhood statistics, community services, crime prevention programs and career opportunities.

BRYANS ROAD AREA ARSON

Hampton Ct., 1:50 a.m., July 5. A 2006 Saturn Ion was set on fire.

INDIAN HEAD AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Adelphi Lane, June 24 to July 1. Property was stolen from a residence.

WALDORF AREA ARSON

Brewster Ct., 2800 block, 10:10 a.m., July 9. A 2004 Toyota Matrix was set on fire.

WELCOME AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Port Tobacco Rd., 4:15 to 10:30 p.m., July 4. Property was stolen from a residence entered by kicking in the front door.

St. Mary's County

These were among reports received by the St. Mary's County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. For information, call 301-475-8008, or the Crime Solvers line, 301-475-3333. The Leonardtown Barrack of the Maryland State Police operates a 24-hour tip line: Information may be anonymously reported at 301-475-2936.

CHARLOTTE HALL AREA ROBBERIES

Three Notch Rd., July 3. Two men tried to rob pizza-restaurant employees at gunpoint. Two men, 22 and 33, were arrested. Charges included conspiracy to commit armed robbery and attempted armed robbery.

LEXINGTON PARK AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Three Notch Rd., 3:05 p.m., June 29. Cash was stolen from a cash register at a department store. A 26-year-old woman, an employee, was charged with theft less than $1,000.

LEXINGTON PARK AREA ASSAULTS

Lexington Park, July 8. During an argument at a residence, a man struck an acquaintance. A man, 48, was charged with second-degree assault.

ARSON

Castaway Cir., 3:59 a.m., July 5. A 2001 Ford F-250 truck was set on fire.

MECHANICSVILLE AREA SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Lexington Park, July 7. A man was arrested at his residence in connection with the sexual abuse of two children. A man, 35, was charged with two counts of child sexual abuse and two counts of continuing course of conduct with a child.

ASSAULTS

Woodburn Hills Rd., July 1. During an argument at residence, a woman struck an acquaintance in the head. A woman, 24, was charged with second-degree assault.

HOLLYWOOD AREA ASSAULTS

McIntosh Rd., July 1. During a dispute at a residence, a man with a rifle threatened an acquaintance. A man, 60, was charged with first-degree assault.

ST. JAMES AREA ARSON

Bay Forest Rd., 11:48 p.m., June 30. A 2005 BMW was set on fire.

- Compiled by Bonnie Smith

The Washington Post


October 26, 2003 Sunday  
Final Edition


Charles County Crime


SECTION: Southern Maryland Extra; T06


LENGTH: 313 words


The following are among reports received recently by the Charles County sheriff's office and the Maryland State Police. For more information, call 301-932-2222 or 301-870-3232.

 Crime Solvers will pay a reward for information leading to an arrest and an indictment in connection with these and any other felony crimes. Call the 24-hour hotline at 800-673-2777. Callers may remain anonymous.  

The Charles County sheriff's office Web site is at www.ccso.us. Included at the site are daily news releases, Crime Watch neighborhood statistics, community services, crime prevention programs and career opportunities.

DESTRUCTION OF PROPERTY

PARK AVE., 15000 block, 10 p.m. Oct. 10 to 8 a.m. Oct. 11. A cat was shot and killed with a pellet gun in the yard of a residence.

ASSAULT

BRENT RD., 200 block, 2:30 p.m. Oct. 13. A man, 25, sexually assaulted a woman, 22. He was charged with second-degree assault and fourth-degree sex offense.

ROBBERY

CRAIN HWY., 2800 block, Sept. 29. A man, 50, robbed the Top Gun Exxon in the 300 block of St. Charles Parkway and the Waldorf Exxon in the 3100 block of Leonardtown Road. He was charged with two counts of armed robbery, two counts of use of a handgun in commission of a felony or crime of violence and two counts of attempted armed robbery.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

COUNCIL OAK DR., 12500 block, 8:30 a.m. to 4:30 p.m. Oct. 14. Two residences were entered by force.

HACKNEY LANE, 2800 block, 10:20 a.m. Oct. 16. Three suspects forced their way into a residence. An intrusion alarm sounded, and the suspects fled. Nothing was reported missing.

PATCHWORK PL., 11000 block, Oct. 9. A Honda Z-50R minibike was stolen from a garage at a residence.

ARSON

ELGIN CT., 7:44 p.m. Oct. 20. A rag soaked in gasoline was stuffed into the gas tank of a vehicle and ignited. The resulting fire was quickly extinguished by a local fire department.

-- Bonnie Smith

Washingtonpost.com


March 13, 2014 Thursday 12:44 AM EST 


Montgomery County crime report


SECTION: Metro; Pg. T30


LENGTH: 1847 words


Montgomery County crime report

Among incidents reported by police in Montgomery County, Rockville and Takoma Park.

Montgomery County

These were among incidents recently received by the Montgomery County Police Department. For information, call 240-773-5030.

REWARDS FOR INFORMATION

Crime Solvers of Montgomery County, a nonprofit organization, pays up to $1,000 for information leading to an arrest and indictment in connection with felonies. Call the 24-hour hotline at 800-673-2777. Callers may remain anonymous.

DISTRICT 1ROCKVILLE STATIONTELEPHONE: 240-773-6070 SEXUAL ASSAULTS

McCormick Rd., 2300 block, Feb. 23. A person was sexually assaulted by an acquaintance.  

ROBBERIES

Autre Ct., 1200 block, 2 to 2:15 a.m. Feb. 23. A person assaulted and robbed someone.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Rockville Pike, 12200 block, 5:24 p.m. Feb. 19. An attempted fraud occurred at a business. Two College Park males, ages 46 and 17, and two Baltimore men, ages 20 and 47, were arrested.

Gude Dr. E., 800 block, 7 p.m. Feb. 23 to 10 a.m. Feb. 24. Property was stolen from a storage facility entered by force.

Kohlhoss Rd., 17600 block, 1:08 to 2:30 p.m. Feb. 23. Two males attempted to enter a residence by force. The males fled empty-handed in a blue minivan.

Ranch Ct., unit block, 4:34 p.m. Feb. 23. Property was stolen from a residence. There was no sign of forced entry. A 23-year-old Silver Spring man was arrested.

The Washington Post


March 11, 2001 Sunday  
Final Edition


CRIME REPORT


SECTION: SOUTHERN MARYLAND EXTRA; Pg. T18


LENGTH: 450 words


The following are among reports received recently by the Calvert County sheriff's office and the Maryland State Police. Anyone with information about these crimes should call the Criminal Investigations Section, 410-535-2800 or 301-855-1194, or the Crime Solver's Line, 410-535-2880. You can also call the Prince Frederick barracks of the State Police at 410-535-1400.  

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

28TH ST., 2:30 p.m. Feb. 15 to 3 p.m. Feb. 22. An extension ladder, an extension cord and two hammers were stolen from a garage at a residence.

ROBBERIES

DUNKIRK, 8:50 p.m. March 1. A man carrying a butcher knife and described as being in his late twenties to early thirties, about 6 feet tall, weighing about 175 pounds and wearing a dark jacket and brown pants, approached a man outside R & J Liquors and demanded money. The victim attempted to flee but slipped on the pavement. The attacker threatened to cut the man's throat, but the man was able to flee. The attacker was last seen fleeing on foot eastbound on Route 260.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

DUNKIRK, Feb. 20 to March 2. A soda machine in front of R & J Liquors was broken into and money was stolen.

SEXUAL OFFENSES

H.G. TRUEMAN RD., 9 a.m. March 7. A man, 26, sexually assaulted a woman, 21, on Feb. 25. He was charged with rape, second-degree sex offense and perverted sex practices.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

ROUSBY HALL RD., 6:30 a.m. to 5:30 p.m. Feb. 15. Six vehicles were forcibly entered and property was stolen.

SIDEWINDER LANE, 7:45 a.m. to 5:10 p.m. Feb. 13. Property was stolen and damage was caused at a residence.

DESTRUCTION OF PROPERTY

CHESAPEAKE AND BAY AVENUES, March 5 to 6. Several buildings in the Town Center Apartments and a strip of buildings along Bay Avenue were spray-painted.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

TIFFANY PARK DR., 1 p.m. March 4. Two men, 20 and 21, stole lumber from a house under construction. They were charged with theft less than $ 500.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

ROUTE 2/4, 9:30 to 11:30 p.m. Feb. 27. A man, 26, took money from the purse of a woman, 19, at a McDonald's restaurant. He was charged with theft more than $ 500.

ROUTE 2/4, 1:25 p.m. Feb. 22. A man, 32, attempted to use a stolen and forged check to purchase items at Food Lion. The check was one of several stolen in Silver Spring, and two had been used earlier on Feb. 20. The suspect was charged with three counts of theft, forgery and passing/uttering a forged document.

ASSAULTS

ROUTE 4, 10:45 p.m. March 5. Two men, both 19, fired two shots at a car traveling southbound, hitting its trunk and a tire. They were charged with first-degree assault, attempted first-degree murder, use of a handgun during a commission of a felony and reckless endangerment.

-- Compiled by Bonnie Smith


LOAD-DATE: April 2, 2002


LANGUAGE: ENGLISH


DOCUMENT-TYPE: LIST

Prince William County crime report


SECTION: METRO; Pg. T28


LENGTH: 936 words


Prince William County

These were among incidents reported by Prince William County police. For information, call 703-792-7245.

BRISTOW AREA

ASSAULTS

Hazel Circle Dr., 11800 block, 4 a.m. May 6. Five female juvenile residents at a youth facility assaulted a woman and destroyed several pieces of property before fleeing from the dormitory. Three of the youths assaulted another female juvenile resident. Five Bristow females - a 15-year-old, a 14-year-old and three 16- year-olds - were arrested.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Chianti Terr., 8900 block, 3 p.m. May 5 to 9:30 a.m. May 6. A bike was stolen from a residence entered through an open garage door. 

Open Meadow Lane, 12100 block, 3:30 to 6:30 p.m. May 1. A tablet PC, an MP3 player and other property were stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked door.

GAINESVILLE AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Paddock Ct., 13600 block, midnight May 4 to 6 p.m. May 5. Cash was stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked garage door.

Pensacola Pl., 7400 block, 4:30 p.m. May 2 to 6:30 a.m. May 3. Appliances were stolen from a residence under construction that had been entered by breaking a rear basement window.

MANASSAS AREA

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Ashland Ave., April 29. A man forced a female juvenile acquaintance to take inappropriate photographs of herself and attempted to sexually assault her. A 39-year-old man and a 32-year-old woman, both of Manassas, were arrested.

ASSAULTS

Cannonball Ct., 10100 block, 4:35 p.m. May 7. During an argument, a man pulled out a handgun and assaulted a female acquaintance. A 40-year-old Manassas man was arrested.

WEAPONS

St. Johns Ct., 7200 block, 9:46 p.m. May 1. A woman who was cleaning a firearm in a residence accidentally fired a bullet, which ended up outdoors. No injuries were reported. A 31-year-old Manassas woman was arrested.

ROBBERIES

Shoppers Sq., 8200 block, 7:22 p.m. May 2. A gunman robbed a restaurant of cash and fled in a vehicle.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Chatsworth Dr., 8200 block, 5 p.m. May 3 to 8 a.m. May 4. Tools were stolen from storage units at a business that was entered by cutting locks.

Gwendolyn Dr., 6200 block, 1 to 6 a.m. May 3. Medicine was stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked basement door.

NOKESVILLE AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Greenwich Rd., 9600 block, 5:30 a.m. to 7 p.m. May 5. Medicine was stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked window.

WOODBRIDGE AREA

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Richmond Ave., 6:52 p.m. May 1. A man sexually assaulted a female acquaintance several times between August 2009 and April 2012. A 46-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

ASSAULTS

Ruxton Dr., 5800 block, 7:39 p.m. May 5. During an argument at a residence, an intoxicated woman hit a male acquaintance several times in the face. The woman then kicked a vehicle and also broke the windshield and a rear window of another vehicle. A 23-year-old woman was arrested.

ROBBERIES

Gran Deur Dr., 13700 block, 11:25 p.m. May 4. Three males wearing ski masks forcibly entered a residence and robbed a male resident of cash at gunpoint.

Tacketts Mill Dr., 2200 block, 8:56 p.m. May 4. Two males demanded money from a restaurant deliveryman at gunpoint. One of the males sprayed the deliveryman with fluid from a fire extinguisher, and both males fled with cash.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Bayside Ave., 1200 block, 8:15 a.m. to 8:30 p.m. May 5. Cash was stolen from a residence.

Dillon Ave., 14800 block, noon May 3. A man knocked on a front door of a residence. When no one answered, he attempted to enter by breaking a rear window. He fled when he saw a resident.

Elmwood Dr., 14800 block, 1:16 a.m. April 4. Someone entered a residence through an unlocked front door, then fled empty-handed after being confronted by a resident.

Horner Rd., 1400 block, 9 a.m. May 3 to 10 a.m. May 7. Someone attempted to enter a residence by tampering with a rear door.

Jefferson Davis Hwy., 14200 block, 5 to 10 a.m. May 6. Someone entered a business through a maintenance door and attempted to pry open a safe.

Kempair Ct., 4800 block, 8:30 p.m. May 4 to 2 p.m. May 5. A washer and dryer were stolen from a residence entered through a rear utility room window.

Kendall Dr., 4500 block, 6 to 8 p.m. May 1. A video game system, games and jewelry were stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked front door.

Opitz Blvd., 1800 block, 7 p.m. May 5 to 7 a.m. May 6. Cash was stolen from a business entered by forcing open an interior office door.

Tecumseh Ct., 3000 block, 12:21 p.m. May 3. Two male juveniles attempted to enter a residence through a rear glass door. When a resident saw them, the two fled through the back yard, damaging a fence. Two Woodbridge males, 16 and 17, were arrested.

Manassas

The following incidents were reported by Manassas police. For information, call 703-257-8000.

ROBBERIES

Liberia Ave., 8600 block, 8 p.m. May 3. A man armed with a box cutter approached a man selling ice cream from a cart and robbed him of cash.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Grant Ave., 9600 block, 10:20 p.m. May 5. A male juvenile stole bottles of beer from a store.

Liberia Ave., 9000 block, 4 to 6:15 p.m. May 6. Prescription medicine, tools and a cellphone were stolen from an unlocked vehicle.

Wellington Rd., 9900 block, 4:50 p.m. May 5. Three females stole hair products from a store.

VANDALISM

Buckner Rd., 9800 block, 5:55 p.m. May 5. A male juvenile stood on a fence and broke it.

Manassas Park

The following incidents were reported by Manassas Park police. For information, call 703-361-1136.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Manassas Dr., 2 to 7:30 a.m. May 6. A laptop was stolen from a residence.

VANDALISM

Kirby St., 5:30 p.m. May 3 to 6:10 a.m. May 4. A vehicle's tire was cut.

- Compiled by Sarah Lane

June 2, 2011 Thursday

Southern Maryland crime reportSouthern Maryland crime report


BYLINE: - Compiled by Bonnie Smith


SECTION: METRO; Pg. T22


LENGTH: 761 words


Calvert County

These were among reports received by the Calvert County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. Anyone with information about these crimes should call the Criminal Investigation Division, 410-535-2800 or 301-855-1194, or the Crime Solvers line, 410-535-2880. You can also call the Prince Frederick Barrack of the state police at 410-535-1400.

CHESAPEAKE BEACH AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Elizabeth Ct., May 10 to May 18. A leaf blower was stolen from a shed at a residence.  

DUNKIRK AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Dunkirk, 4:01 a.m. May 22. Tobacco products were stolen from a liquor store entered by forcing the front door.

LUSBY AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Olivet Rd., 9 a.m. to 3 p.m., May 20. Diamond earrings were stolen from a residence.

VANDALISM

Ridge Terrace, May 14 to May 20. A Yamaha Waverunner and a boat dock were damaged.

PORT REPUBLIC AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Broomes Island Rd., 5:30 p.m., May 17. A chopper-style bicycle was stolen from a shed.

PRINCE FREDERICK AREA

ROBBERIES

Commerce Lane, 11:46 p.m., May 20. Two males wearing masks robbed a restaurant of cash at gunpoint. Employees were forced into a freezer and the manager was attacked during the incident. No serious injuries were reported.

ST. LEONARD AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Flag Harbor Blvd., May 19 to May 20. A 2001 Ford E-250 truck was stolen.

Charles County

These were among reports received by the Charles County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. For information, call 301-932-2222 or 301-870-3232. Crime Solvers will pay a reward for information leading to an arrest and an indictment in connection with these and other crimes. Call the 24-hour hotline at 866-411-8477. Callers may remain anonymous. The Charles County Sheriff's Office Web site iswww.ccso.us. Included at the site are daily news releases, Crime Watch neighborhood statistics, community services, crime prevention programs and career opportunities.

BRYANS ROAD AREA

ASSAULTS

HAMPTON CT., 4:11 p.m., May 19. A police officer was attacked while responding to a report of a domestic assault. A man, 42, was charged with several counts of assault.

INDIAN HEAD AREA

ASSAULTS

Livingston Rd., 4400 block, 8:04 p.m., May 22. A man at a residence stabbed an acquaintance in the arms. No serious injuries were reported.

PORT TOBACCO AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Port Tobacco, May 21 to May 22. Motors, steering columns, generators and batteries were among equipment stolen from boats at a marina.

WALDORF AREA

ARSON

Vivian Adams Dr., 11:20 a.m., May 20. An accelerant was poured on the floor of a classroom and set on fire. A 13-year-old male was charged with second-degree malicious burning.

ASSAULTS

Lewisham Pl., 11600 block, 4:07 p.m., May 22. A man forced his way into an apartment and attacked an occupant. Police said that the man was looking for an acquaintance, who lives elsewhere in the building. A man, 33, was charged with burglary and assault.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Berry Rd., 4:47 p.m., May 23. Responding to a report of a person in a vehicle displaying a handgun, police made a traffic stop and found in the vehicle three global positioning system units, six tennis rackets, phone jacks, fuses and other property that had been reported stolen from area stores. Three teenagers were arrested. Charges include illegal possession of a handgun, theft, burglary and possession of burglary tools.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Berry Rd., 11:50 p.m., May 20. During a traffic stop, a man fled a vehicle that had been reported stolen in Prince George's County. After a brief foot chase, a 19-year-old man was arrested. Charges included motor vehicle theft and fleeing and eluding.

St. Mary's County

These were among reports received by the St. Mary's County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. For information, call 301-475-8008, or the Crime Solvers line, 301-475-3333. The Leonardtown Barrack of the Maryland State Police operates a 24-hour tip line on which people may anonymously report information at 301-475-2936.

GREAT MILLS AREA

ASSAULTS

Jay Dee Ct., May 23. A man at a residence struck an acquaintance in the face. A man, 21, was charged with second-degree assault.

LEONARDTOWN AREA

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Leonardtown, May 24. A 22-year-old man was charged with sexually assaulting a 12-year-old.

LEXINGTON PARK AREA

ASSAULTS

Castaway Cir., 21000 block, 8:19 p.m., May 21. A boy struck a girl in the face. A 10-year-old was charged with second-degree assault.

MECHANICSVILLE AREA

ASSAULTS

Wolfe Dr., May 23. A woman at a residence struck an acquaintance with a thrown object. A woman, 31, was charged with second-degree assault.

- Compiled by Bonnie Smith

Washingtonpost.com


December 4, 2014 Thursday 11:26 PM EST 


Prince William County crime report


SECTION: Metro; Pg. T25


LENGTH: 749 words


Prince William County

These were among incidents reported by Prince William County police. For information, call 703-792-7245.

BRISTOW AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Dunstable Loop, 8700 block, 4:45 to 8 p.m. Nov. 24. Cash was stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked window.

Whinney Ford Ct., 13300 block, 9:21 p.m. Nov. 24. A safe containing jewelry and prescription medicine was stolen from a residence entered by damaging a window. 

DUMFRIES AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Four Seasons Dr., 17600 block, 6 p.m. Nov. 17 to 11:57 a.m. Nov. 20. Jewelry was stolen from a residence.

GAINESVILLE AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

John Marshall Hwy., 14200 block, 6:15 p.m. Nov. 19 to 5:55 a.m. Nov. 20. Copper wire was stolen from a warehouse entered by forcing a door.

Prices Cove Pl., 7200 block, 1:15 to 5:15 p.m. Nov. 18. Jewelry was stolen from a residence entered by forcing a window.

Senea Dr., 13700 block, 5 p.m. Nov. 21 to 7 a.m. Nov. 24. Two condensers and two furnaces were stolen from a residence.

MANASSAS AREA SEXUAL ASSAULT

Royal Fern Circle area, 3:54 a.m. Nov. 22. During an argument, a man sexually assaulted a female acquaintance. A 34-year-old Chantilly man was arrested.

ASSAULT

Coverstone Dr.,10900 block, 4:34 p.m. Nov. 25. During an argument, two male juveniles stabbed a male acquaintance and attempted to take his necklace. The acquaintance was treated for injuries. Two Manassas males, 15 and 17, were arrested.

ROBBERY

Sudley Rd., 8200 block, 10:51 p.m. Nov. 25. Three males chased a man from a restaurant. They assaulted him and robbed him of a cellphone.

THEFT/BREAK-IN

Nodi Ct., 7900 block, 7:40 a.m. to 3:30 p.m. Nov. 24. Cash was stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked basement window.

TRIANGLE AREA THEFT/BREAK-IN

Kilmer Lane, 18100 block, 6 a.m. Nov. 21 to 4:47 p.m. Nov. 22. A TV and a video game system were stolen from a residence entered by forcing a front door.

WOODBRIDGE AREA

SEXUAL ASSAULT

Hope Ct. area, August to Nov. 20. A man had a sexual relationship with a female juvenile. A 24-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

ROBBERIES

Jefferson Davis Hwy., 14400 block, 1:22 p.m. Nov. 24. A male grabbed a cellphone from a male pedestrian and fled.

Old Bridge Rd.,1300 block, 6:16 p.m. Nov. 23. Three men robbed a gas station store of cash at gunpoint.

Potomac Heights Pl., 14700 block, 9:09 p.m. Nov. 25. Two gunmen in a residential parking garage demanded property from a woman and a man. The man fled, and one of the gunmen chased him. The other gunman took the woman to a residence. The first gunman returned with another woman. The gunmen took cash and a wallet from the women, then fled.

INDECENT EXPOSURE

Gideon Dr. and Smoketown Rd.,11:58 a.m. Nov. 17. A male motorist exposed himself to a female motorist stopped next to his vehicle. A male motorist exposed himself to another woman earlier in the day at Old Bridge Road and Mohican Drive. A 49-year-old Fredericksburg man was arrested.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Alliance Lane, 2900 block, 9 a.m. Nov. 22 to 8 a.m. Nov. 23. Cash and jewelry were stolen from a residence entered by forcing a bathroom window.

Bentley Cir., 13500 block, 8:50 a.m. to 2:40 p.m. Nov. 14. Two video game systems, an MP3 player and jewelry were stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked window.

Daniel Stuart Sq., 1900 block, 2 to 11:30 a.m. Nov. 23. Cash was stolen from a business entered by breaking a front glass door.

Featherstone Rd., 1500 block, 5 a.m. to 6:30 p.m. Nov. 22. A residence was entered by forcing a front door. Nothing was reported stolen.

Walnut St., 1500 block, noon to 12:12 p.m. Nov. 20. A residence was entered by forcing a rear door. A safe was pried open. Nothing was reported stolen.

Wentwood Lane, 15200 block, 2:08 p.m. Nov. 20. An attempt was made to enter a residence by forcing a door.

Manassas

No reports were received from Manassas police for this edition of Local Living. For information, call 703-257-8000.

Manassas Park

No reports were received from Manassas Park police for this edition of Local Living. For information, call 703-361-1136.

- Compiled by Sarah Lane

SECTION: Metro; Pg. T21


LENGTH: 705 words


Prince William County

These were among incidents reported by Prince William County police. For information, call 703-792-7245.

MANASSAS AREA ASSAULTS

Winchester Ct., 10200 block, 1:07 a.m. Oct. 28. During an argument, a man struck a man in the face with a beer bottle. The victim was taken to a hospital for treatment.

WEAPONS OFFENSES  

River Forest Dr., 6100 block, 5:05 p.m. Oct. 23. A man came out of a residence and shot a rifle at a squirrel while a man was walking a dog nearby. A 41-year-old Manassas man was arrested.

ROBBERIES

Quail Run Lane, 7500 block, 10 p.m. Oct. 24. A man snatched a purse from a woman.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

McLean St., 7800 block, Sept. 27 to Oct. 27. A residence was entered by forcing the front door. Nothing was reported missing.

TRIANGLE AREA ASSAULTS

Triangle St., 18500 block, 3:46 a.m. Oct. 28. During an argument, a male was cut in the forehead with a knife. An acquaintance of the victim's, a 61-year-old Triangle man, was arrested.

WOODBRIDGE AREA SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Old Bridge Rd., 3900 block, 2 p.m. Oct. 24. A registered sex offender was determined to have been at a church during school and day-care hours. A 63-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

ASSAULTS

Brookville Lane, 3400 block, 8:12 a.m. Oct. 24. During an argument, a man threatened a female acquaintance with a kitchen knife. A 28-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

Chadwick Ct., 2500 block, 4:49 p.m. Oct. 24. During an argument, a man attacked a female acquaintance. When the dispute moved to a parking lot, passersby intervened. The woman sustained minor injuries. A 28-year-old Prince George's County man was arrested.

Colby Dr., 12700 block, 2:13 p.m. Oct. 28. A man walking a dog argued with a pedestrian, then unleashed the pet, which chased the pedestrian and tried to bite him. The dog eventually returned to its owner.

Fontaine Ct., 14300 block, Oct. 23. During an argument at a residence, a man attacked an acquaintance and prevented her from leaving. A 20-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

WEAPONS OFFENSES

Birchdale Ave., 14500 block, 10 p.m. Oct. 24 to 7 a.m. Oct. 25. A shot was fired into a residence, striking an interior wall.

Prince William Pkwy. and York Dr., 2:30 p.m. Oct. 26. The driver of a vehicle that had pulled up next to a motorist waved a handgun at her and fired a shot.

ROBBERIES

Berlin Ct., 3200 block, 9:17 p.m. Oct. 26. Three males threatened a man in a vehicle and robbed him of a cellphone.

Whitmer Dr., 4300 block, 12:44 p.m. Oct. 29. A gunman robbed a male pedestrian of cash.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Antietam Rd., 12300 block, 11 a.m. Oct. 26. An attempt was made to enter a residence through a rear window. Nothing was reported missing.

Birchdale Ave., 14700 block, 5 p.m. Oct. 24 to 10:50 a.m. Oct. 26. Cash was stolen from a business entered by forcing a side door.

Prince William Pkwy., 4200 block, 10:50 a.m. Oct. 24. A video game system, games and equipment were stolen from a day-care center entered by cutting a screen to an unlocked window. A van at the facility was stolen and set on fire.

Tyler Cir., 1500 block, noon to 10:30 p.m. Oct. 27. Cash was stolen from a residence entered by forcing the front door.

Manassas

These were among incidents reported by Manassas police. For information, call 703-257-8000.

Crime Report


SECTION: EXTRAS; Pg. PW15


LENGTH: 1000 words


Prince William

The following incidents were reported by Prince William County police. For information, call 703-792-7245.

Dale City Area

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

BOUNTIFUL LANE, 3400 block, 7 p.m. Oct. 4 to 3:30 a.m. Oct. 5. Tires were stolen from a vehicle.

SERENDIPITY RD., 3600 block, 11:16 a.m. Oct. 2. Someone attempted to enter a residence by breaking a window.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

CORONA LANE, 3800 block, 11 p.m. Oct. 4 to 2:10 a.m. Oct. 5. A blue 1998 Acura Integra was stolen.

Dumfries Area

ASSAULTS

OLD STAGE RD., 16900 block, 3:20 a.m. Oct. 2. A man allegedly called the county's Office of Public Safety Communications Center and said a bomb was in a hotel. Explosives were not found. A 35-year-old South Carolina man was arrested. 

ROBBERIES

PINE BLUFF DR., 3200 block, 11:50 a.m. Oct. 3. Three males hit a male cyclist on the head, knocking him unconscious. The three robbed him of cash, a wallet, bank cards and a bike.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

DRY POWDER CIR., 3400 block, 8:30 p.m. Oct. 3 to 7:10 p.m. Oct. 4. A stereo was stolen from a vehicle entered by forcing open a door.

Gainesville Area

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

SHARPSHINNED DR., 14400 block, 3 p.m. Sept. 27 to 7 a.m. Sept. 28. Two refrigerators, two ovens and two microwave ovens were stolen from two houses under construction.

Manassas Area

SEXUAL ASSAULTS 

COVERSTONE DR., 10900 block, 6:20 to 6:30 a.m. Oct. 6. A male grabbed a female pedestrian, punched her and attempted to sexually assault her. The woman was treated for injuries.

ASSAULTS

CLEMSON CT., 7500 block, 9 p.m. Oct. 6. A man punched a woman who was sitting in a vehicle and attempted to drag her out of the vehicle. The woman fought the man, who fled.

ROBBERIES

ASHTON AVE. AND SUDLEY MANOR DR., 6:30 a.m. Sept. 28. A man attacked a female jogger, knocking her to the ground. The jogger resisted, and the man took her MP3 player.

Triangle Area

ASSAULTS

PURVIS DR., 18100 block, 10:10 p.m. Oct. 1. A man allegedly forcibly entered a residence and assaulted a woman and another person. The man also allegedly broke the windshield of a vehicle. A 20-year-old Triangle man was arrested.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

KERILL RD., 18700 block, 11:20 a.m. Oct. 2. A male entered the basement of a residence and fled empty-handed when a police officer approached.

QUANTICO TERR., 3600 block, 8 p.m. Oct. 1 to 6 a.m. Oct. 2. A power washer was stolen from an unlocked vehicle.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

BARNETTE CIR., 18900 block, 1:59 a.m. Oct. 2. Two people tied an all-terrain vehicle to their vehicle and drove away.

Woodbridge Area

SEXUAL ASSAULTS 

MARQUIS PL., 5:30 p.m. Oct. 1. A man allegedly inappropriately touched a female juvenile relative. A 43-year-old man was arrested.

ASSAULTS

OREGON AVE., 1400 block, 2:33 a.m. Sept. 26. Someone threw an object at a residence, breaking a living room window. A window of a vehicle was scratched. No injuries were reported.

ROBBERIES

OCCOQUAN RD., 13300 block, 1:32 a.m. Oct. 5. A vehicle, occupied by a woman, a male acquaintance of hers and two other males, was driven to Woodbridge. When the vehicle was driven behind a restaurant, one of the males demanded property from the female's acquaintance at gunpoint. The two males and the woman then robbed her acquaintance of a wallet, a cellphone and a jacket, ordered him out of the vehicle and fled in the vehicle.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

BEALE CT., 3400 block, Sept. 28 to Oct. 4. A woman left her cellphone in an acquaintance's vehicle, and he allegedly refused to return it.

COTTONWOOD CT., 1400 block, 8:57 p.m. Oct. 1. During an argument, a man allegedly took a cellphone from an acquaintance. A 21-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

DINING WAY, 14800 block, 2:45 p.m. Oct. 4. A man allegedly took merchandise from a grocery store. A 29-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

FOULGER SQ., 13700 block, 7:30 p.m. Sept. 27. Six men in a department store allegedly removed price tags from clothes and attempted to conceal them. Six Stafford men, 23, 22, 21, 20 and two 19-year-olds, were arrested.

ROLLING BROOK DR. AND TUMBLING BROOK LANE, 9 p.m. Oct. 2 to 9 a.m. Oct. 3. Seven unlocked vehicles were searched. Two Global Positioning System devices, two digital cameras, two MP3 players, a stereo and cash were stolen from several of the vehicles.

WOOD DUCK CT., 1500 block, 7 a.m. Sept. 28 to 5 p.m. Oct. 3. A handgun and a holster were stolen from a vehicle.

VANDALISM

PRINCE WILLIAM PKWY., 2600 block, 9:07 p.m. Oct. 2. A man allegedly scratched the hood of a vehicle with a key. A 22-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

Manassas

The following incidents were reported by Manassas police. For information, call 703-257-8000.

ROBBERIES

LIBERIA AVE., 9800 block, 10 p.m. Oct. 4. Two males in a vehicle that was parked in front of a bank asked a man for help. When the man approached, two other males got out of the vehicle, slammed the man against the vehicle and ordered him to withdraw cash from an ATM. The man complied, and the four fled with cash.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

NANTUCKET CT., 10200 block, 7:30 a.m. to 5 p.m. Oct. 2. Someone entered a residence by prying open a rear sliding door. Nothing was reported stolen.

WATERBURY CT., 10200 block, 10:30 a.m. to 4:40 p.m. Oct. 2. Cash, coins and a laptop computer were stolen from a residence entered through a rear sliding door.

Manassas Park

The following incidents were reported by Manassas Park police. For information, call 703-361-1136.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

ENTERPRISE CT., 9200 block, 5:30 p.m. Sept. 23 to 10:30 a.m. Sept. 24. A CD player and other items were stolen from a vehicle entered by breaking a window.

GARY CT., 9300 block, 7:30 p.m. Oct. 1 to 8 a.m. Oct. 2. A CD player was stolen from an unlocked vehicle.

MARTIN DR., 100 block, 12:01 to 6 a.m. Sept. 28. A CD player was stolen from a vehicle entered by prying open a window.

VANDALISM

MANASSAS DR., 200 block, 4 to 4:30 p.m. Sept. 30. Someone fired BBs at a vehicle, breaking a window.

MANASSAS DR., 300 block, 4:20 to 4:59 p.m. Sept. 30. Someone threw a ball bearing at a residence, breaking a window.

Prince William County

These were among incidents reported by Prince William County police. For information, call 703-792-7245.

BRISTOW AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Lanier Overlook Ct., 8400 block, 12:15 to 1:48 p.m. March 19. Two handguns, a laptop, two guitars and jewelry were stolen from a residence entered by breaking a basement window.

Linton Hall Rd., 8700 block, 10 to 11 p.m. March 15. Tools and other items were stolen from an unlocked vehicle inside an unlocked garage.

DUMFRIES AREA

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Masthead Trail, March 15. A man raped a female juvenile within August and September. A 34-year-old Largo man was arrested. 

ROBBERIES

Main St., 17700 block, 10:30 p.m. March 16. Two men robbed a male pedestrian of cash at gunpoint.

River Ridge Blvd. and Wayside Dr., 11:55 a.m. March 16. A group of male juveniles assaulted two male juvenile pedestrians and robbed one of a cellphone and shoes.

HAYMARKET AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Berkeley Dr., 16000 block, 4 p.m. Feb. 16 to 1:30 p.m. March 14. Cash and jewelry were stolen from a residence.

MANASSAS AREA

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Damascus Dr., 9500 block, 5:54 p.m. March 14. A man sexually assaulted a female juvenile acquaintance within June and July. A 26-year-old Manassas man was arrested.

ASSAULTS

Ashton Ave., 7900 block, 3 p.m. March 19. A man in an office threw a rock at a glass partition, breaking the glass near two employees sitting on the other side of the window. A 20-year-old Manassas man was arrested.

Sudley Rd., 8100 block, 9:37 p.m. March 18. During an argument, a woman used a pocketknife to stab a male acquaintance in the chest. The man was treated for injuries. A 43-year-old woman was arrested.

ROBBERIES

Sudley Rd., 8100 block, 8:20 p.m. March 14. A gunman entered a restaurant through an open rear door and demanded money. He fled on foot with cash.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Hiram Ct., 11000 block, 9 a.m. to 5 p.m. March 15. Two TVs, two video game systems, a cellphone and other items were stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked window.

Mace Ct., 8100 block, 5:41 p.m. March 13 to 3 p.m. March 15. A tablet PC was stolen from a residence.

Sage St., 7500 block, 9:30 a.m. to 2:20 p.m. March 16. Cash, a TV, a video game system and video games were stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked door.

Sudley Manor Dr., 10600 block, 11:45 p.m. March 15 to 9:30 a.m. March 16. Liquor was stolen from a restaurant entered by breaking a side window.

Walcott Ct., 8600 block, 2:20 a.m. March 19. A man attempted to enter a residence by removing a screen from a rear window.

WOODBRIDGE AREA

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Jefferson Davis Hwy., 13900 block, 7:41 a.m. March 16. A man sexually assaulted two female acquaintances in a hotel room. A 28-year-old man was arrested.

Lost Canyon Ct., 15000 block, March 16 and 12:20 a.m. March 19. During an argument in a residence, a man sexually assaulted a female acquaintance, broke her cellphone and prevented her from leaving. She was able to leave the next morning and call police. The woman returned to the residence a few days later with another male acquaintance. The man met the two in a parking lot and assaulted the male acquaintance. Police arrived, and a 42-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

ASSAULTS

Cara Dr., 12800 block, 10 p.m. March 17. During an argument, a man grabbed a kitchen knife and struggled with a male acquaintance. The man held the knife to the acquaintance's neck, who escaped. No injuries were reported.

WEAPONS

Tazanari Way, 13100 block, 5:16 p.m. March 14. After an argument between a woman and a male acquaintance earlier in the day, the woman fired a weapon inside a residence, then pointed the weapon at the acquaintance. The woman followed the male acquaintance into a parking lot, where he took the weapon from her. A 21-year-old Woodbridge woman was arrested.

ROBBERIES

Dale Blvd., 4100 block, 10:10 p.m. March 16. Two men assaulted an employee behind a restaurant and robbed him of cash at gunpoint.

Harbor Dr., 12600 block, 9:39 p.m. March 14. A gunman robbed a male pedestrian of cash and a wallet.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Patamon Way, 13000 block, 8:45 a.m. to 3:15 p.m. March 16. A laptop, an MP3 player and other items were stolen from a residence.

Quebec Pl., 5200 block, 9 a.m. March 10 to noon March 17. Someone attempted to enter a residence by tampering with a rear window.

Stockholm Way, 2900 block, 11 a.m. to 2 p.m. March 14. Three video game systems, other electronics and jewelry were stolen from a residence entered by breaking a rear glass door.

Sutton Pl., 16600 block, 11:35 a.m. March 19. Someone entered a residence by breaking a rear window. Property was moved, but nothing was reported stolen.

Manassas

The following incidents were reported by Manassas police. For information, call 703-257-8000.

ASSAULTS

Aspen Pl., 9700 block, 4:10 p.m. March 17. Two men assaulted a male, who was treated for injuries.

Brent St., 9700 block, 1:40 a.m. March 14. Two males attempted to pet a resident's dog in front of his residence. When the resident asked the two males to leave, one threatened to kill the resident's dog, assault his family and burn his house. A 25-year-old man was arrested.

Byrd Dr. and Aspen Pl., 11:15 p.m. March 13. During an argument, a man grabbed a female acquaintance, injuring her arm. A 29-year-old Manassas man was arrested.

Dumfries Rd., 10200 block, 10:30 p.m. March 17. During an argument, a man got into a vehicle occupied by a female and drove away. When the woman attempted to get out, the man assaulted her. The man also broke her cellphone. The woman eventually got out and attempted to flee near an apartment building. The man dragged her back to the vehicle. An acquaintance of the man separated the two, and the man walked away. A 25-year-old man was arrested. The woman was treated for injuries.

George St., 6 to 6:30 p.m. March 19. A man near a hospital told a police officer he had been shot. He had two gunshot wounds in his left armpit and a third in his left arm. He said a man had attempted to rob him as he was attempting to buy narcotics.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Lake Jackson Dr., 8 p.m. March 17 to 9:10 a.m. March 19. Equipment was stolen from a construction site.

Park Ave., 12:10 to 2 p.m. March 13. Jewelry was stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked garage door.

Willow Glen Ct., 8500 block, 7 p.m. March 13. A man took cash from the pocket of a female juvenile acquaintance. When she asked for it back, he pushed her to the ground and damaged her cellphone.

VANDALISM

Piney Point Ct., 8400 block, 9:25 p.m. March 16. Someone fired a BB gun at a residence, breaking a rear window.

Manassas Park

The following incidents were reported by Manassas Park police. For information, call 703-361-1136.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Englewood Ct., 8000 block, 11:15 a.m. to 2:30 p.m. March 16. A computer notebook, an MP3 player, a portable hard drive, jewelry, a handbag and other items were stolen from a residence.

Signal View Dr., 9300 block, 7:59 p.m. March 16. Someone attempted to enter a vehicle by damaging a window.

Venture Ct., 9200 block, 8 p.m. March 17 to 3:02 p.m. March 18. A business was entered by prying open a rear door. Computers and walls were spray-painted. Cabinets and drawers were ransacked, and a fire extinguisher was discharged.

Montgomery County crime report Montgomery County crime report


SECTION: METRO; Pg. T34


LENGTH: 1779 words


Montgomery County

These were among incidents recorded by the Montgomery County Police Department. For information, call 240-773-5030.

Rewards for information

Crime Solvers of Montgomery County, a nonprofit community organization, pays up to $1,000 for information leading to an arrest and indictment in connection with these and any other felony crimes. Call the 24-hour hotline at 800-673-2777. Callers may remain anonymous.

DISTRICT 1ROCKVILLE STATION240-773-6070

North Bethesda area, 5:18 p.m. Nov. 3. A person was sexually assaulted by an acquaintance.

Brook Run Ct., unit block, 5 to 9 p.m. Oct. 31. Property was stolen from a residence. There was no sign of forced entry.

375 of 507 DOCUMENTS




The Washington Post


May 6, 2004 Thursday  
Final Edition


Crime in Prince William Drops for 2nd Year


BYLINE: Ian Shapira, Washington Post Staff Writer


SECTION: Prince William Extra; T01


LENGTH: 490 words


Serious crime in Prince William County dropped for the second consecutive year, according to 2003 statistics released this week by the county police department.

Although 13 killings occurred last year -- almost tying the decade-high of 14 reached in 1999 -- the number of all major crimes in the state's third-largest jurisdiction fell by about 2.7 percent.

The number of crimes such as murder, rape and burglary dropped from 8,025 to 7,805, while the overall crime rate dipped from nearly 26 crimes per 1,000 residents to about 24 crimes per 1,000 residents, the report said.  

Police Chief Charlie T. Deane said the statistics represent the lowest recorded rate in the 34-year-old department's history, but that the rate will inevitably rise again because of growth in the county, which now has a population of 332,500. No single factor explains the unpredictable rise and fall of crime rates, Deane said, but active neighborhood watch groups and the department's aggressive crackdown on gangs have put potential offenders on alert.

"This can't last forever. There's a point that the crime rate will not go below [because] the juvenile population is very high," Deane said. "But I see results almost daily. [Gangs] know they're going to be held accountable. A lot of them are in jail today."

Most of last year's crimes -- more than 93 percent -- were related to property, and about 6.7 percent were violent, police said. The county's 13 homicides last year -- including a triple homicide -- were more than double the number (five) that occurred in 2002, but Deane said those figures have always fluctuated.

In 1999, for example, there were 14 homicides; in 2000, there were six; and in 2001, the figure jumped back to 13.

"We have to keep these statistics in perspective," Deane said.

The only major increase in crime occurred in the number of motor vehicle thefts, which jumped from 665 to 755. Deane described the growing problem as a "regionwide issue" and added that there also has been a rise in heavy equipment thefts at construction sites.

Domestic assaults, which soared in 2001 with 1,680 reported incidents, have gradually declined, dropping to 1,451 last year. The report showed only a tiny percentage of those are aggravated assaults such as shootings or stabbings.

Deane said the declining overall crime rate was even more notable given the amount of time some officers spent on other work, such as analyzing terrorism threat levels and concentrating on last year's trial of sniper John Allen Muhammad in Virginia Beach. "We had five of our most experienced detectives and supervisors commit to that investigation," he said. "It's hard to replace that experience."

As for gang activity, Deane and Maj. Ray Colgan said gangs continue to proliferate and break into smaller groups, threatening to raise the crime level.

"Different cliques are emerging and we're seeing new [gang] names we haven't seen before," Colgan said.


LOAD-DATE: May 6, 2004


LANGUAGE: ENGLISH


PUBLICATION-TYPE: Newspaper



Copyright 2004 The Washington Post

Calvert County

These were among reports received by the Calvert County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. Anyone with information about these crimes should call the Criminal Investigation Division, 410-535-2800 or 301-855-1194, or the Crime Solvers line, 410-535-2880. You can also call the Prince Frederick Barrack of the state police at 410-535-1400.

CHESAPEAKE BEACH AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS  

Elizabeth Ct., May 10 to May 18. A leaf blower was stolen from a shed at a residence.

DUNKIRK AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Dunkirk, 4:01 a.m. May 22. Tobacco products were stolen from a liquor store entered by forcing the front door.

LUSBY AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Olivet Rd., 9 a.m. to 3 p.m., May 20. Diamond earrings were stolen from a residence.

VANDALISM

Ridge Terrace, May 14 to May 20. A Yamaha Waverunner and a boat dock were damaged.

PORT REPUBLIC AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Broomes Island Rd., 5:30 p.m., May 17. A chopper-style bicycle was stolen from a shed.

PRINCE FREDERICK AREA ROBBERIES

Commerce Lane, 11:46 p.m., May 20. Two males wearing masks robbed a restaurant of cash at gunpoint. Employees were forced into a freezer and the manager was attacked during the incident. No serious injuries were reported.

ST. LEONARD AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Flag Harbor Blvd., May 19 to May 20. A 2001 Ford E-250 truck was stolen.

Charles County

These were among reports received by the Charles County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. For information, call 301-932-2222 or 301-870-3232. Crime Solvers will pay a reward for information leading to an arrest and an indictment in connection with these and other crimes. Call the 24-hour hotline at 866-411-8477. Callers may remain anonymous. The Charles County Sheriff's Office Web site is www.ccso.us. Included at the site are daily news releases, Crime Watch neighborhood statistics, community services, crime prevention programs and career opportunities.

BRYANS ROAD AREA ASSAULTS

HAMPTON CT., 4:11 p.m., May 19. A police officer was attacked while responding to a report of a domestic assault. A man, 42, was charged with several counts of assault.

INDIAN HEAD AREA ASSAULTS

Livingston Rd., 4400 block, 8:04 p.m., May 22. A man at a residence stabbed an acquaintance in the arms. No serious injuries were reported.

PORT TOBACCO AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Port Tobacco, May 21 to May 22. Motors, steering columns, generators and batteries were among equipment stolen from boats at a marina.

WALDORF AREA ARSON

Vivian Adams Dr., 11:20 a.m., May 20. An accelerant was poured on the floor of a classroom and set on fire. A 13-year-old male was charged with second-degree malicious burning.

ASSAULTS

Lewisham Pl., 11600 block, 4:07 p.m., May 22. A man forced his way into an apartment and attacked an occupant. Police said that the man was looking for an acquaintance, who lives elsewhere in the building. A man, 33, was charged with burglary and assault.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Berry Rd., 4:47 p.m., May 23. Responding to a report of a person in a vehicle displaying a handgun, police made a traffic stop and found in the vehicle three global positioning system units, six tennis rackets, phone jacks, fuses and other property that had been reported stolen from area stores. Three teenagers were arrested. Charges include illegal possession of a handgun, theft, burglary and possession of burglary tools.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Berry Rd., 11:50 p.m., May 20. During a traffic stop, a man fled a vehicle that had been reported stolen in Prince George's County. After a brief foot chase, a 19-year-old man was arrested. Charges included motor vehicle theft and fleeing and eluding.

St. Mary's County

These were among reports received by the St. Mary's County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. For information, call 301-475-8008, or the Crime Solvers line, 301-475-3333. The Leonardtown Barrack of the Maryland State Police operates a 24-hour tip line on which people may anonymously report information at 301-475-2936.

GREAT MILLS AREA ASSAULTS

Jay Dee Ct., May 23. A man at a residence struck an acquaintance in the face. A man, 21, was charged with second-degree assault.

LEONARDTOWN AREA SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Leonardtown, May 24. A 22-year-old man was charged with sexually assaulting a 12-year-old.

LEXINGTON PARK AREA ASSAULTS

Castaway Cir., 21000 block, 8:19 p.m., May 21. A boy struck a girl in the face. A 10-year-old was charged with second-degree assault.

MECHANICSVILLE AREA ASSAULTS

Wolfe Dr., May 23. A woman at a residence struck an acquaintance with a thrown object. A woman, 31, was charged with second-degree assault.

These were among incidents reported by Prince William County police. For information, call 703-792-7245.

Hudson River Ct., 4200 block, 12:35 p.m. Aug. 16. Several gunshots were heard.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Chimney West Dr., 4400 block, noon Aug. 14 to 7 p.m. Aug. 17. Someone entered an unlocked vehicle and used a garage door opener to enter a garage of a residence. Nothing was reported stolen.

Alleghany Rd., Aug. 15. A man sexually assaulted a female juvenile relative on several occasions. A 47-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

WEAPONS

Quail Run Lane, 7500 block, 7:47 p.m. Aug. 10. A man left a BB gun on a bed at a residence. A 2-year-old boy found the gun and shot himself in the foot. The boy was treated for injuries. A 19-year-old Manassas man was charged with child abuse and neglect.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Vernon St., 8200 block, 2:50 p.m. Aug. 13. A man attempted to enter a residence through a window. He fled when a resident saw him.

WOODBRIDGE AREA IMPERSONATING A POLICE OFFICER

Dale Blvd. and Ridgefield Rd., noon to 1 p.m. Aug. 13. A man driving a brown Buick with a white-and-blue flashing light on the dashboard stopped a female motorist. He displayed a gold badge and asked for her identification. He then told the woman to drive more slowly.

ROBBERIES

Dale Blvd., 5300 block, 9:08 p.m. Aug. 16. A man in a vehicle demanded money at gunpoint from a male acquaintance. The two struggled, and the acquaintance grabbed the gun and fled. The man took the acquaintance's keys and cellphone. A 22-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

Old Bridge Rd., 1400 block, 2:15 a.m. Aug. 17. A gunman robbed a convenience store of cash.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Barksdale St., 14700 block, 8:15 to 9 p.m. Aug. 15. Several pairs of sneakers were stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked basement door.

Cressida Pl., 4100 block, 7 a.m. to 5 p.m. Aug. 12. A laptop computer, a camera and other property were stolen from a residence entered by forcing a rear door.

Nassau Dr., 13200 block, 10 a.m. Aug. 13 to 1:30 p.m. Aug. 15. A camera and jewelry were stolen from a residence entered by forcing a rear basement door.

Scotch Ct., 2200 block, 1:45 p.m. Aug. 18. A man attempted to enter a residence through a door. He fled when a resident confronted him.

St. Mary's Way, 13600 block, 1 to 10 a.m. Aug. 19. Someone attempted to enter a residence by prying a front door.

Manassas

The following incidents were recently reported by Manassas police. For information, call 703-257-8000.

ASSAULTS

Center St., 9000 block, 11:10 a.m. Aug. 17. A male motorist's vehicle struck the vehicle of another motorist. After the drivers stopped, the first motorist assaulted the other and fled.

Deblanc Pl., 8700 block, 4 p.m. Aug. 19. An intoxicated woman assaulted two men and threatened to kill them. A 47-year-old Manassas woman was arrested.

Prescott Ave., 9200 block, 2 to 4 p.m. Aug. 19. Jewelry was stolen from a case at an antiques store.

Manassas Park

The following incident was recently reported by Manassas Park police. For information, call 703-361-1136.

INDECENT EXPOSURE

Denver Dr. and Rugby Rd., 2:53 p.m. Aug. 18. A man stood in the middle of the road with his pants around his ankles. A 51-year-old Manassas man was arrested.

- Compiled by Sarah Lane

Southern Maryland crime report


SECTION: METRO; Pg. T23


LENGTH: 827 words


Calvert County 

These were among reports received by the Calvert County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. Anyone with information about these crimes is asked to call the Criminal Investigation Division at 410-535-2800 or 301-855-1194, the Crime Solvers line at 410-535-2880 or the Prince Frederick Barrack of the state police at 410-535-1400.

HUNTINGTOWN AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Holland Cliffs Rd., Jan. 29 to March 3. AT&T batteries were stolen from three housing units.  

LUSBY AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Mills Creek Dr., 2:30 p.m. March 2. A boat and trailer were stolen from a house's yard.

VANDALISM

Pardoe Rd., Feb. 27. Three lights atop utility poles were shot out.

OWINGS AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Skinners Turn Rd., 11:15 a.m. March 2. Outgoing mail was stolen from a mailbox.

PRINCE FREDERICK AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Adelina Rd., 5:28 p.m. March 3. A handgun and ammunition were stolen from a residence.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Route 4, 6:46 p.m. March 2. During a police traffic stop of a rental vehicle, an investigation revealed that the operator had a suspended driver's license and that the vehicle had been reported stolen in Montgomery County. A Lusby man, 34, was arrested.

Charles County

These were among reports received by the Charles County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. For information, call 301-932-2222 or 301-870-3232. The sheriff's Web site, www.ccso.us, has news releases, local crime statistics, crime prevention programs and career opportunities.

REWARDS FOR INFORMATION

Crime Solvers will pay a reward for information leading to an arrest and an indictment in connection with crimes. Call the 24-hour hotline at 866-411-8477. Callers may remain anonymous.

INDIAN HEAD AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Bicknell Rd., 5700 block, 7:11 a.m. March 11. Two men who were trying to push a motorcycle out of a residential shed fled after an owner of the home chased them.

Indian Head Ave., 400 block, noon to 11:30 p.m. March 11. Jewelry and other items were stolen from a home.

LA PLATA AREA

ASSAULTS

Charles St., 9:06 a.m. March 12. A man assaulted another man outside a courthouse entrance. A responding police officer was grabbed by the arm and forced to the ground. A stun gun was used when the assailant refused to surrender. He was taken to a hospital for evaluation.

PORT TOBACCO AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Poorhouse Rd., 9800 block, 5 p.m. March 7 to 8:15 a.m. March 8. An all-terrain vehicle was stolen .

WALDORF AREA

ASSAULTS

Post Office Rd., 600 block, 10:41 a.m. March 9. A man punched a female acquaintance. A Waldorf man, 21, was charged with second-degree assault, possession of marijuana with intent to distribute and possession of drug paraphernalia.

ROBBERIES

Bluebird Dr., 7:17 p.m. March 8. A female pedestrian was struck on the head with a gun and robbed by two men.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Ell Lane, 12100 block, 12:40 a.m March 7. Cash was stolen from a business.

Mattawoman Beantown Rd., 12:51 p.m. March 11. Windows of several vehicles at a park-and-ride were broken; two stereos were stolen.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Leonardtown and Post Office roads, noon March 9. During an investigation of a hit-and-run accident, it was discovered that the vehicle had been reported stolen in Montgomery County. Police were searching for a suspect.

St. Mary's County

These were among reports from the St. Mary's County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. For information, call 301-475-8008. To submit a tip, call Crime Solvers at 301-475-3333. The Leonardtown Barrack of the State Police has an anonymous tip line, 301-475-2936.

AVENUE AREA

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Lucca Way, March 6. A man was found touching an acquaintance's body in a sexual manner while the person was sleeping. An Avenue man, 35, was charged with second-degree assault and a fourth-degree sexual offense.

CLEMENTS AREA

ASSAULTS

Yates Rd., 9:28 a.m. March 5. A man assaulted a female acquaintance. A Clements man, 42, was charged with second-degree assault.

GREAT MILLS AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Great Mills Rd., March. An owner of a food shop reported that an employee had stolen from the business.

Great Mills Rd., Feb. 14 to March 7. A battery-operated cooler was stolen from a home.

LEONARDTOWN AREA

ASSAULTS

Goddard Ct., March 3. During an argument, a woman hit an acquaintance with a hammer and punched the person. A Leonardtown woman, 30, was charged with second-degree assault.

LEXINGTON PARK AREA

ROBBERIES

Great Mills Rd., 9:06 p.m. March 9. A convenience store was robbed at gunpoint. The robber assaulted a clerk as he fled.

ASSAULTS

Altman Ct., March 4. A man at a home grabbed an acquaintance by the throat and attempted to strangle the person. A Lexington Park man, 29, was charged with second-degree assault.

CHILD-CARE INCIDENT

Midway Dr., March 8. A woman left three children, ages 8 months, 2 and 4, alone the night of Feb. 28. A Lexington Park woman, 23, was charged with four counts of neglecting a minor.

- Compiled by Bonnie Smith
