The Washington Post


February 23, 1984, Thursday, Final Edition


CRIME WATCH


SECTION: Virginia Weekly; Neighborhood Report; Va. 4


LENGTH: 972 words



Arlington County

Arlington County police received the following crime reports from Feb. 9 through 15. For more information, call 558-2267.
Assault

GLEBE RD. S., 100 block, 11:30 p.m. Feb. 14. A man driving on the Glebe Road exit ramp from Rte. 50 was forced to the side of the road by two men in a Datsun, who pulled him out of his car, assaulted him and drove off. Shortly after, while the victim was waiting at a stoplight on Rte. 50, the Datsun pulled up in front of him and a Mustang stopped behind him. Four occupants of the two cars got out, assaulted the man, robbed him and drove off. The man was assaulted a third time and notified the police. He was treated at Fairfax Hospital and released. 
Sexual Assaults

WAYNE STREET, 10:05 a.m. Feb. 14. A man approached a woman in a laundry room, exposed himself and pulled out a knife. The woman screamed and ran, and the man fled from the building.

10TH STREET, 11:45 p.m. Feb. 11. A woman driving down the street noticed a man lying on the side of the road and stopped to see if he was sick or injured. When she approached him, the man cut her several times with the razor he was holding, then raped her. She was treated at Arlington Hospital and released.

23RD STREET, 5:36 a.m. Feb. 11. A woman was waiting for a cab in front of a night club and a man grabbed her and forced her into the basement of the club. He then exposed himself and attempted to assault her, but released her when she began to scream. A 23-year-old Arlington man was arrested later in the day and charged with abduction and attempted rape.
Robberies

FOUR MILE RUN DR., 8:50 p.m. Feb. 13. A man with a shotgun took $300 from a man and a woman waiting for an elevator in an underground parking lot.

GREENBRIER ST., 600 block, 1:45 a.m. Feb 14. A man with a knife broke into a man's house, took $45 from the resident and fled.

LEE HWY., 5600 block, 3:30 a.m. Feb. 14. Two suspects wearing ski masks and gray sweatsuits and armed with a knife took $80 from a gas station attendant and fled.

NASH ST. N., 1100 block, 7:55 p.m. Feb. 8. A man with a gun took $110 and a watch from a man approaching the entrance of a Rosslyn skywalk, then fled.

WALTER REED DR. S., 900 block, 11:14 p.m. Feb. 13. Two men apparently armed with a gun took $380 from a store cash register, then fled.

21ST ST. S., 800 block, noon Feb. 8. Two men knocked over a woman walking down the street, took her purse and fled.
Thefts/Break-ins

ARLINGTON BLVD. S., 1500 block, Feb. 8. Jewelry was taken from a residence.

ARMY-NAVY DR. S., 1300 block, Feb. 12. Video equipment, jewelry and silverware were taken from a residence.

BEDFORD ST. N., 100 block, Feb. 13. A General Electric stove and refrigerator were taken from a house under construction. Entry was by breaking a front window.

COLUMBIA PIKE S., 1800 block, 5:10 a.m. Feb. 14. A woman was awakened by a crashing noise on her balcony and found the glass door smashed and a man lying on the balcony. She went to call the police and the man fled. The police stopped a car leaving the apartment complex and arrested a 25-year-old Alexandria man fitting the intruder's description. The man was charged with breaking and entering and destruction of property.

GEORGE MASON DR. N., 3400 block, 6 to 6:50 p.m. Feb. 13. A Sony 19-inch color television set and a Hitachi 19-inch color television set were taken from a residence. Entry was by breaking a pane of glass in a bathroom window.

JEFFERSON DAVIS HWY. S., 1700 block, 10:40 a.m. Feb. 9. A man who had apparently taken a key from a motel room while the occupants were in the sauna later tried to enter the room with the key when the occupants were inside. A 19-year-old Arlington man was later arrested and charged with breaking and entering.

RANDOLPH ST. N., 1100 block, 9 a.m. to 3 p.m. Feb. 14. Cash, checkbooks and a watch were taken from a residence. Entry was gained by forcing open a window that was holding an air conditioner.

WALTER REED DR. S., 2400 block, 8 a.m. to 4:50 p.m. Feb. 14. Money, stereo equipment and a watch were taken from a residence. Entry was gained by breaking a rear basement window.

WILLIAMSBURG BLVD. N., 6500 block, 8:45 a.m. to 6:45 p.m. Feb. 13. Jewelry, a camera and video equipment were taken from a residence. Entry was by removing the glass from a rear basement window.

18TH ST. N., 3100 block, 8 p.m. to midnight Feb. 12. Two watches and jewelry were taken from a residence. Entry was gained by forcing open a kitchen door.

20TH ST. S., 1200 block, 7:25 a.m. to 5:30 p.m. Feb. 13. Money, a Panasonic tape recorder and some beer were taken from a residence. Entry was by breaking a window.

22ND ST. S., 1600 block, 6 p.m. Feb. 8 to 6:30 a.m. Feb. 9. Two Sony Betamax videocassette recorders were taken from a residence. Entry was gained by prying open a sliding glass door.
 
Falls Church

Falls Church Police received the following crime reports from Feb. 9 through Feb. 15. For more information, call 241-5003.
Homicide

LINCOLN AVE., 809, 2:20 p.m., Feb. 11. A 55-year-old woman, Dorothy M. Willis, was found dead in a rear room of the family home and her son, Martin V. Willis, 23, was arrested and charged with homicide. The victim's husband, Vaine Willis, found the body. A preliminary autopsy showed she died of asphyxiation by strangulation. A preliminary hearing for Martin Willis is scheduled for Feb. 24 in General District Court.
Robberies

WILSON BLVD., 6000 block, 8:59 p.m., Feb. 10. An armed man robbed a gas station of about $100. The suspect fled on foot.

WILSON BLVD., 6000 block, 8:40 p.m., Feb. 11. An armed man robbed an ice cream store of about $40. Money also was taken from customers.
Thefts/Break-ins

ROOSEVELT BLVD., 500 block, 7:30 a.m., Feb. 12. A 1978 Harley Davidson motorcycle was taken from a parking lot.

Montgomery County crime report Montgomery County crime report


SECTION: Metro; Pg. T34

Montgomery County

These were among incidents recorded by the Montgomery County Police Department. For information, call 240-773-5030.

Rewards for information

Crime Solvers of Montgomery County, a nonprofit community organization, pays up to $1,000 for information leading to an arrest and indictment in connection with these and any other felony crimes. Call the 24-hour hotline at 800-673-2777. Callers may remain anonymous.

The Washington Post


May 15, 2008 Thursday  
Every Edition


Crime Report


SECTION: EXTRAS; Pg. VA16


LENGTH: 681 words


Alexandria

These were among incidents reported by the Alexandria Police Department. For more information, call 703-838-4636 or visit http://www.alexandriava.gov/police.

ASSAULTS

DUKE ST., 4200 block, 9:30 to 10 p.m. May 2. Two males knocked a man to the ground, then punched and kicked him. A medic unit treated the victim for eye and face injuries at the scene.

ROBBERIES

BEAUREGARD ST. N., 1400 block, Two males threw an Arlington woman, 33, to the ground and robbed her of property. She suffered minor injuries. 

COMMONWEALTH AVE., 3200 block, 9:21 p.m. April 30. Three males assaulted a 29-year-old man and robbed him of property at gunpoint. No injuries were reported.

MASON AVE. E., 1-99 block, 10:10 p.m. May 2. Six armed males robbed an Alexandria man, 29, of property. No injuries were reported.

NEWTON ST. N., 1600 block, 8:35 p.m. May 5. Three armed males robbed an Alexandria man, 24, of property. No injuries were reported.

PRINCESS AND BUCHANAN STREETS, 9:50 p.m. April 30. Two males on a bike path assaulted an Alexandria man, 59, and robbed him of property. No serious injuries were reported.

VANDALISM

CAMERON MILLS RD., 3700 block, 6:30 to 7:30 p.m. May 1. Swastikas were sprayed on three vehicles and an apartment building.

 Arlington

These were among incidents reported by the Arlington County Police Department. For more information, call 703-228-4050 or visit http://www.arlingtoncrimesolvers.org.

SEXUAL ASSAULTS 

GEORGE MASON DR. S., 1400 block, 10 p.m. May 6. A man groped a pedestrian and tried to force her to the ground. When the victim yelled, the assailant fled.

INDECENT EXPOSURE

THOMAS ST. N., 200 block, 9 p.m. May 3. A police officer saw a man exposing himself. An Arlington man, 23, was charged with obscene sexual display.

ROBBERIES

GLEBE RD. N., 700 block, 10:30 p.m. May 6. Two men in a vehicle asked a pedestrian for a dollar. When the victim took cash from his pockets, one of the men grabbed it from his hand and the car sped away.

RANDOLPH ST. N., 800 block, 9 a.m. May 6. A male robbed a bank.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

COLUMBIA PIKE, 3400 block, 7:45 a.m. April 30. Inspection stickers were stolen from four vehicles at a car dealership. Employees tried to stop a man, who ran away when confronted.

CRYSTAL DR. S., 1500 block, 5:30 p.m. May 3. An attempt was made to enter an apartment.

FILLMORE ST. N., 1200 block, 5:30 p.m. May 2 to 8:30 a.m. May 5. Property was stolen from a business.

MCKINLEY ST. N., 1600 block, 2:30 a.m. May 5. Two men were seen taking construction material from a school. The men fled from police on foot, but one was captured. A 47-year-old Mineral, Va., man was charged with grand larceny, possession of burglar tools and trespassing.

MOORE ST. N., 1700 block, 7 p.m. May 2 to 10:30 a.m. May 6. Property was stolen from a business.

WALTER REED DR. S., 1300 block, 2 p.m. May 5. Property was stolen from a storage room.

WILSON BLVD. N., 1500 block, 6 p.m. May 3 to 9:30 a.m. May 5. Property was stolen from an apartment.

20TH ST. S., 200 block, 1 to 1:30 p.m. May 3. Property was stolen from a construction trailer.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

CRYSTAL DR., 2000 block, May 3. A maroon 2000 Plymouth Voyager was stolen.

EDISON ST. N., 500 block, May 6. A blue 1991 Honda Civic was stolen.

FAIRFAX DR. N., 2500 block, May 5. A silver 2000 Chrysler Sebring was stolen.

FOUR MILE RUN DR. S., 4100 block, May 5. A 1995 Toyota Camry that had been reported stolen was recovered.

GEORGE MASON DR. S., 1700 block, April 30. A 1995 Toyota Camry that had been reported stolen was recovered.

GEORGE MASON DR. S., 900 block, April 30. A 1993 Honda Civic that had been reported stolen was recovered.

HUDSON ST. N., 500 block, May 1. A maroon 1983 Oldsmobile Cutlass Supreme was stolen.

KENT ST. N., 1600 block, May 3. A 2000 Saturn that had been reported stolen was recovered.

WILSON BLVD., 3900 block, May 6. A 1999 Toyota Camry that had been reported stolen was recovered.

WILSON BLVD., 5100 block, May 2. A 2007 Toyota Camry that had been reported stolen was recovered.

23RD ST. S., 600 block, May 4. A black 2008 Cadillac Escalade was stolen.

-- Compiled by RIA MANGLAPUS

Crime Report


SECTION: EXTRAS; Pg. VA18


LENGTH: 743 words


Alexandria

These were among incidents recently reported by the Alexandria Police Department. For more information, call 703-838-4636 or visit http://www.alexandriava.gov/police.

ROBBERIES

EDSALL RD., 6000 block, 2:15 a.m. Feb. 10. A 49-year-old Alexandria woman tried to run away when two men approached as she was getting out of her car. She fell, and the robbers took her purse, which contained cash and other property.

ST. ASAPH ST. N., 700 block, 3:20 a.m. Feb. 1. Three men, one of whom had a handgun, took a wallet containing cash and other property from a 54-year-old Alexandria man. 

WHITING ST. S., 300 block, 8:40 to 9 p.m. Feb. 12. A man with a handgun took cash and other property from a 30-year-old Alexandria male pedestrian. The robber fled on foot.

WYTHE ST., 1200 block, 12:40 p.m. Feb. 6. A man with a handgun demanded money and tried to force his way into the residence of an 18-year-old Alexandria man and a 38-year-old Alexandria woman. No injuries were reported, and nothing was reported taken.

PEEPING TOM INCIDENTS

ESSEX CT., 5300 block, 9 to 10:45 p.m. Feb. 7. A man looked into an apartment.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

IVERSON ST. N., 900 block, 1:25 a.m. Feb. 11. A man smashed a glass door, entered an apartment and attacked a 32-year-old woman and a 33-year-old man. The residents reportedly received minor injuries. A 27-year-old Alexandria man was charged with burglary, felonious assault and possession of burglary tools.

Arlington

These were among incidents recently reported by the Arlington County Police Department. For more information, call 703-228-4050 or visit http://www.arlingtoncrimesolvers.org.

ASSAULTS

WILSON BLVD., 3900 block, 9:21 p.m. Feb. 9. An intoxicated man discharged a fire extinguisher in a crowded restaurant. The man sprayed dry chemicals on people and floors, tables and chairs. A 21-year-old Arlington man was charged with malicious wounding with a caustic substance and destruction of property.

SEXUAL ASSAULTS 

UTAH ST. N., 1000 block, 5:30 a.m. Feb 6. A 30-year-old woman awoke in a residence after hearing a noise. When she went to check on it, she was confronted by an intruder. The man implied he had a gun and sexually assaulted her. He then forced the woman to drive to a bank and withdraw money. Then they went to Fairfax County, where he forced her to withdraw more money from an ATM. The woman dropped the man at a motel on Route 1.

ROBBERIES

HENDERSON RD. N., 4100 block, 7 p.m. Feb. 7. A man demanded money from a clerk in a business. The robber fled when the clerk called police.

HIGHLAND ST. S., 1300 block, 1:07 a.m. Feb. 10. Three men demanded money from a 30-year-old male pedestrian. The robbers struck the man, took cash and his cellphone and fled on foot.

SEVENTH ST. S., 5300 block, 11:25 to 11:37 p.m. Feb. 11. Two men demanded money from a 42-year-old woman waiting at a bus stop. The robbers implied they had a weapon and tried to wrestle a suitcase away from her. A witness intervened, and the men fled on foot.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

COLUMBIA PIKE, 4600 block, 3:08 a.m. Feb. 6. Someone tried to pry open a door at a business, which apparently was not entered.

FAIRFAX DR. N., 4600 block, 6:35 a.m. Feb. 7 to 9:30 a.m. Feb. 8. A laptop computer and a candy jar were stolen from an office entered by prying a door.

LEXINGTON ST. N., 2200 block, 8 a.m. to 8 p.m. Feb. 8. A laptop computer and a camera were stolen from a residence.

25TH ST. S., 3600 block, 7 p.m. Jan. 23 to 9 p.m. Feb. 7. Someone broke into a residence, ransacked it and left water running. Nothing was reported stolen.

OAKLAND ST. N., 900 block, 1 p.m. Feb. 10 to 5:30 a.m. Feb. 12. Three copper downspouts were stolen from a church.

QUEBEC ST. N., 1700 block; 19TH ST. N., 4300 block; LEE HWY., 4300 block; GLEBE RD. N., 2300 block; and 24TH ST. N., 4600 block, 11 p.m. Feb. 5 to 7:16 a.m. Feb. 6. Several vehicles were broken into. A Global Positioning System device, a purse, two satellite radio systems and several portable DVD players were stolen.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

CLARENDON BLVD., 1500 block. A silver 2001 Acura Integra was stolen.

COLUMBIA PIKE, 1900 block. A silver 1998 Nissan Maxima was stolen.

EADS ST. S., 2000 block. A gold 1995 Honda Accord was stolen.

VEITCH ST. S., 2700 block. A silver 1996 Ford Taurus was stolen.

WASHINGTON BLVD., 2300 block. A beige 1991 Nissan Maxima was stolen.

VANDALISM

FREDERICK ST. S., 800 block, 12:01 to 5 a.m. Feb. 11. Four vehicles in a parking lot were scratched.

-- Compiled by KATHY ORTON

Prince William County crime report


SECTION: METRO; Pg. T27


LENGTH: 1002 words


Prince William County

These were among incidents reported by Prince William County police. For information, call 703-792-7245.

BRISTOW AREA

WEAPONS

Spindle Foot Ct. and Hoppers Lane, 2:30 a.m. July 9. Several gunshots were heard. No one was reported injured.

DUMFRIES AREA

SEXUAL ASSAULT

Jefferson Davis Hwy., 17000 block, 10:22 a.m. July 10. A man in a store rubbed against a woman and inappropriately touched her. 

ASSAULT

Old Stage Rd., 16900 block, 8:10 p.m. July 6. A man in a hotel room hit a female acquaintance several times and took her cellphone. An Arlington man, 30, was arrested.

MANASSAS AREA

ASSAULT

Urbana Rd., 8000 block, 5:50 p.m. July 11. A man and two other males assaulted a male acquaintance and robbed him of property. An 18-year-old man was arrested.

WEAPONS

Harnsberger Barn Ct., 6000 block, 11:30 p.m. June 19 to midnight June 20. A weapon was fired at a residence, damaging a garage.

Three Otters Pl., 15500 block, 9:30 p.m. July 7. During an argument, a man threatened a female acquaintance and four other people with a rifle. The man later posted a threatening message on the woman's Web social media page. No one was reported injured. A Fredericksburg man, 28, was arrested.

ROBBERY

Irongate Way and Community Dr., midnight to 12:30 a.m. July 13. Three males hit a male pedestrian, knocking him unconscious. They robbed him of cash and a passport.

INDECENT EXPOSURE

Rixlew Lane, 8500 block, 8:30 p.m. July 7. A naked man was seen lying on grass. A Manassas man, 20, was arrested.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Ashland Ave., 7900 block, noon July 8 to 6:30 p.m. July 9. A vacant residence was entered by damaging a rear door. Nothing was reported stolen.

Hinson Mill Lane, 11400 block, 1 to 7 a.m. July 8. Several pairs of shoes and other items were stolen from a residence.

Streamwalk Lane, 7700 block, 8 a.m. July 6 to 4 p.m. July 7. An attempt was made to enter a business by damaging a rear door.

TRIANGLE AREA

WEAPONS

Jurgensen Dr., 3600 block, 11:54 p.m. July 14. A weapon was fired, injuring a man in the arm.

WOODBRIDGE AREA

SEXUAL ASSAULT

Wigglesworth Way, 1800 block, May to June. A man used his cellphone to expose himself to and solicit inappropriate images from a female juvenile. A Woodbridge man, 34, was arrested.

ASSAULTS

Featherstone Rd., 1500 block, 11:30 p.m. July 12. During an argument, a man prevented a female acquaintance from leaving a residence and struck her on the hand. A Woodbridge man, 22, was arrested.

Piccolo Lane, 14500 block, 7:44 p.m. July 13. During an argument, a man assaulted a female acquaintance. A Woodbridge man, 24, was arrested.

Wetherburn Ct., 2900 block, 2:31 p.m. July 7. During an argument between a man and a female acquaintance, the acquaintance entered her residence. The man entered the residence through a kitchen window, then hit the woman on the arm when she attempted to leave. A 32-year-old man was arrested.

WEAPONS

Arum Pl., 15100 block, 5 p.m. July 13 to 5 p.m. July 14. A weapon was fired, damaging a rear window and rear seat of a vehicle.

Commitment Ct., 15300 block, 9:30 p.m. July 4. A weapon was fired at a residence, damaging a bedroom ceiling.

Luckland Way, 2500 block, 1 to 1:30 a.m. July 12. A rear door and upper-floor window of a residence were hit by a projectile.

Oak Tree Lane, 2500 block, 1:31 a.m. July 12. Several bullets were fired as an uninvited group was leaving a party at a residence. No one was reported injured.

CHILD-CARE INCIDENT

Potomac Mills Cir., 2700 block, 2:50 p.m. July 12. A man left a 5-year-old boy locked inside a vehicle. A witness was able to get the boy to unlock the vehicle. He was evaluated by medical personnel and found to be uninjured. A Woodbridge man, 39, was arrested.

ROBBERIES

Bowes Lane, 2800 block, 2:30 a.m. July 7. A man assaulted a male acquaintance who was sitting outside a residence and took his cellphone.

Opitz Blvd., 2700 block, 7:45 p.m. July 14. Two males assaulted a male acquaintance and robbed him of cash and marijuana.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Glendale Rd., 4100 block, midnight June 29 to 6:29 p.m. July 12. An attempt was made to enter a residence by damaging a basement window.

Hemingway Dr., 4300 block, 5 p.m. July 7 to 7:10 p.m. July 14. Two air conditioners were stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked window.

Kingsman Rd., 13500 block, 1 p.m. July 9 to 2:30 p.m. July 10. An attempt was made to enter a residence by damaging a basement window.

Lost Canyon Ct., 15000 block, 4 a.m. July 10. Someone attempted to enter a residence through a rear door, then pounded on a window, waking a resident.

Omisol Rd., 2600 block, 9 a.m. July 2 to 10:07 p.m. July 12. A 2004 Honda motorcycle, power tools and other items were stolen from a residence entered by damaging a rear door. A tire was stolen from a vehicle.

Sandy Ridge Ct., 16300 block, 12:30 to 7:30 a.m. July 9. An attempt was made to enter a residence by cutting several window screens.

Sandy Ridge Ct., 16300 block, 10 p.m. July 8 to 8 a.m. July 9. An attempt was made to enter two residences by cutting several window screens.

Manassas

These were among incidents reported by Manassas police. For more information, call 703-257-8000.

THEFT/BREAK-IN

Fort Dr., 8900 block, midnight July 5 to 6 p.m. July 6. Bikes, speakers, construction boxes and other items were stolen from a garage of a residence.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFT

Fountain Cir., 10200 block, July 1. A 2005 gray Infiniti G35 Coupe.

VANDALISM

Mathis Ave., 8600 block, July 6. A front window of a business was broken.

Shady Grove Cir., 8300 block, 5:30 a.m. July 4 to 10:30 a.m. July 5. A vehicle was damaged. Firework debris was found near the vehicle.

Wellington and Hampton roads, 4:30 p.m. July 2. Two male juveniles hid behind a tree, and one threw a cup containing liquid at a moving vehicle. The driver swerved. Nothing was reported damaged, and no injuries were reported.

Manassas Park

No incidents were reported by Manassas Park police for this edition of Local Living. For information, call 703-361-1136.

Crime Report


SECTION: EXTRAS; Pg. GZ32


LENGTH: 2285 words


Montgomery County 

These were among incidents reported by Montgomery County police. For information, call 240-773-5030.

REWARDS FOR INFORMATION

Crime Solvers of Montgomery County, a nonprofit community organization, will pay up to $1,000 for information leading to an arrest and indictment in connection with these and other felony crimes. Call the 24-hour hotline at 800-673-2777. Callers may remain anonymous.

District 1 Rockville Station 240-773-6070

SEXUAL ASSAULTS 

ROCKVILLE PIKE, 12200 block, 3 p.m. April 9. A man at a business inappropriately touched a woman who was using the services of that business.

ASSAULTS

ROCKING HORSE DR., 12000 block, 10:07 a.m. April 13. Police, responding to call about burglary in progress, confronted a man who was attacking an occupant of the home about which the call had been placed. A Silver Spring man, 19, was arrested. 

WAINWRIGHT AND ATLANTIC AVENUES, 3:20 p.m. April 9. A man followed a young male pedestrian, then threatened him with a knife. The victim ran. No injuries were reported.

ROBBERIES

PINEWOOD RD., 500 block, 3:25 a.m. April 14. A cab driver was robbed of cash at gunpoint by two men who were standing outside an address to which the driver had driven to pick up a fare.

VEIRS MILL RD., 12200 block, 5:40 p.m. April 10. A man attacked a man in front of a restaurant and robbed him of cash.

WEAPONS OFFENSES

BROADWOOD DR., 1100 block, 9:40 a.m. April 11. Responding to a call about a domestic dispute, police confronted a man outside on a deck at his residence acting irrationally and making threats with a knife and what was later determined to be a stun gun. While taking the man into custody, police found drug paraphernalia. He was taken to a hospital for treatment. Charges are pending.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

BLAINE DR., 2700 block, 7 p.m. April 5 to 1:45 a.m. April 6. Property was taken from a residence. Four males were seen leaving the premises with the property. There was no sign of forced entry.

CAPTAINS WALK CT., 11100 block, 10:30 p.m. April 5 to 6 a.m. April 7. A GPS device and other electronic equipment were stolen from a vehicle entered by force.

CAPTAINS WALK CT., 11100 block, 10:30 p.m. April 5 to 6 a.m. April 7. An unlocked vehicle was entered. There was no sign of forced entry.

CERVANTES AVE., 14200 block, 8:45 a.m. April 13. An attempt was made to break into a residence by forcing windows. Nothing was reported missing.

GUDE DR. E., 1600 block, 8:40 p.m. April 7. Tools and a wheel were stolen from a 1999 Toyota Corolla parked at an auto-body shop. A man was seen fleeing with the property in white pickup.

LELAND ST., 4200 block, April 11. A man was seen breaking a window at a residence. Nothing was reported missing. A Montgomery Village man, 26, was arrested at a nearby Metro station.

LEONARD DR., 8800 block, April 9 to 10. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

LYTTONSVILLE RD., 2400 block, 2 to 11:30 p.m. April 8. Property was stolen from a residence. There was no sign of forced entry.

MONTGOMERY AVE. W., 400 block, MARYLAND AVE., 100 block, LUCKETT ST., 200 block, and NELSON ST., 900 block, April 5 to 13. GPS devices, cellphones, radios, DVDs, cameras, credit cards and cash were among property stolen from four vehicles, two of which were entered by force.

ROLLINS AVE., 200 block, 5 a.m. to 4 p.m. April 12. Property was stolen from a residence. Two men were seen fleeing the premises with the property. There was no sign of forced entry.

SELFRIDGE RD., 12100 block, April 10 to 12. A residence was entered by force. Nothing was reported missing.

STONERIDGE VIEW DR. and ROLLING GREEN WAY, 6:30 to 8 p.m. April 9. A wallet was stolen from a vehicle entered by force.

16TH ST., 8600 block, April 8 to 12. Two residences were entered. Nothing was reported missing. There was no sign of forced entry in either incident.

District 2 Bethesda Station 301-652-9200

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

BEECH AVE., 5400 block, 8:30 a.m. to 3:30 p.m. April 9. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

DEMOCRACY BLVD., 7100 block, 1:45 to 5:15 p.m. April 11. Property was stolen from a vehicle. There was no sign of forced entry.

DEMOCRACY BLVD., 7100 block, 8 to 9 p.m. April 7. Property was stolen from a vehicle at a mall. Two males and a female were seen fleeing in a 2003 Cadillac.

MAPLE AVE., 4300 block, 4:53 a.m. April 6. Cash was stolen from a vehicle. There was no sign of forced entry.

PRESTON PL., 8700 block, PRESTON CT., 3500 block, and WOODLAWN RD., 3900 block, April 9 to 10. GPS devices, cash and CDs were among property stolen from three unlocked vehicles.

ROSEDALE AVE., 4300 block, 4:53 a.m. April 6. A vehicle was entered. Nothing was reported missing.

The Washington Post


June 28, 1984, Thursday, Final Edition


CRIME WATCH


BYLINE: Compiled by Washington Post reporters and special correspondents Barbara Blechman, Caroline Johnston, Anne Koch, Lisa McAllister, Bernhart Mingia and Mark Sutton


SECTION: Virginia Weekly; Neighborhood Rerport; Va. 4


LENGTH: 372 words



Fairfax County

Fairfax County police received the following crime reports from June 15 through June 21 in the Mason Police District and portions of the McLean District. For more information, call 691-4959.
 
McLEAN DISTRICT
Robberies

PIMMIT RUN LA., 2200 block. A man approached a 25-year-old Falls Church woman walking along a path and attempted to grab her purse. After a struggle, the suspect emptied the victim's purse and took her wallet, then fled on foot. 
Thefts/Break-ins

GALLOWS CT., 7900 block. An IBM computer unit was stolen from a business. Entry was through the storage room door.

GUILFORD CT., 1100 block. An Alpine stereo cassette was stolen from a parked car.

LEE LA., 8300 block. A Sony Walkman, 12 tapes, $40 in cash and assorted clothing were taken from a home.

LEESBURG PIKE, 8400 block. An AM/FM stereo radio was taken from a parked car.

OLD DOMINION DR., 6800 block. A Sears microwave oven and a push-button telephone were stolen from an office.
 
MASON DISTRICT
Sexual Assault

MERRIFIELD AREA--A 34-year-old woman was raped after she was awakened by a man in her bedroom. The man, who had a gun, fled after the assault.
Thefts/Break-ins

BLAIR RD., 3400 block. A Zenith video cassette recorder, a Sony television set, two credit cards and assorted change were taken from a home.

CHAMBLISS ST. N., 4700 block. $168 in cash was stolen from a restaurant. Entry was through the front door.

COSTNER RD., 6600 block. $160 in cash was taken from a church. Entry was through a window.

FRENCHMANS DR., 6300 block. A Sony television set was stolen from an apartment. Entry was through the front door.

LAKEVIEW DR., 6200 block. A 70-piece silverware set and a gold necklace were taken from a home. Entry was through a basement window.

NEWCASTLE DR., 7600 block. An undetermined amount of cash and a checkbook were taken from a church.

OREANA DR., 7800 block. Twelve rings, a jewelry box and paints were taken from a home.

ROGERS DR., 2800 block. Two underwater cameras, four deep-sea watches, two lenses and two regulators with pressure gauges were taken from a business. Entry was through a window.

ROUGE CT., 4700 block. A Sony television set was stolen from an apartment.

Southern Maryland crime reportSouthern Maryland crime report


SECTION: METRO; Pg. T20


LENGTH: 778 words


Calvert County

These were among reports received by the Calvert County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. Anyone with information about these crimes should call the Criminal Investigation Division, 410-535-2800 or 301-855-1194, or the Crime Solvers line, 410-535-2880. You can also call the Prince Frederick Barrack of the state police at 410-535-1400.

HUNTINGTOWN AREA

VANDALISM

Huntingtown Rd., May 26 to May 27. A hayfield was damaged by a vehicle. 

LUSBY AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Deer Dr., May 8 to May 27. An attempt was made to break into a residence. Nothing was reported missing.

Monterey Rd., April 23 to May 28. A red-and-orange kayak and an orange kayak were stolen from a residence.

NORTH BEACH AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Atlantic Ave., 9:15 p.m., May 27. A blue-and-white bicycle was stolen from a porch at a residence.

OWINGS AREA

VANDALISM

Flint Hill Rd. N., May 28. A truck was damaged while parked at a residence.

PRINCE FREDERICK AREA

ASSAULTS

PATUXENT BEACH DR., 5:10 a.m. May 29. A man at a residence attacked a woman, 56, and a police officer responding to the incident. A man, 29, was arrested. Charges included second-degree assault, resisting arrest, and illegal drug possession.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Hallowing Point Rd., 2:53 p.m., May 26. A sign advertising seafood sales was stolen from in front of a residence.

SOLOMONS AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Holiday Dr., 8:20 p.m., May 27. A radar detection device was stolen from an unlocked vehicle.

WHITE SANDS AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

White Sands, 8:08 a.m., May 28. A satellite radio receiver and antenna were stolen from an unlocked vehicle.

Charles County

These were among reports received by the Charles County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. For information, call 301-932-2222 or 301-870-3232. Crime Solvers will pay a reward for information leading to an arrest and an indictment in connection with these and other crimes. Call the 24-hour hotline at 866-411-8477. Callers may remain anonymous. The Charles County Sheriff's Office Web site iswww.ccso.us. Included at the site are daily news releases, Crime Watch neighborhood statistics, community services, crime prevention programs and career opportunities.

LA PLATA AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Valley Rd., 6900 block, 11 p.m., May 26 to 3 a.m., May 27. A lawn tractor was stolen from a shed.

INDIAN HEAD AREA

ASSAULTS

Raymond Ave., 11:30 p.m., May 29. A woman stabbed a man in the leg. A woman, 36, was charged with first-degree assault.

WALDORF AREA

ASSAULTS

Light Arms Pl., 3800 block, 11:45 p.m., May 30. During her arrest for disorderly conduct, a woman tried to remove a gun from an officer's holster and struck the officer in the chest with her elbow. A woman, 63, was charged with attempt to disarm a police officer, assault and disorderly conduct.

ROBBERIES

Mall Cir., 8:23 p.m., May 24. A man robbed a jewelry store of two trays of diamonds at gunpoint.

Reeves Pl., 4300 block, 5:50 p.m., May 26. A man armed with a weapon took a backpack from a male teenager walking on a foot path. Charges of strong-arm robbery are pending against a 26-year-old man.

St. Mary's County

These were among reports received by the St. Mary's County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. For information, call 301-475-8008, or the Crime Solvers line, 301-475-3333. The Leonardtown Barrack of the Maryland State Police operates a 24-hour tip line on which people may anonymously report information at 301-475-2936.

CALLAWAY AREA

ASSAULTS

Route 249 and Happyland Rd., May 29. During an argument, a man punched a person in the head. A man, 37, was charged with second-degree assault.

CLEMENTS AREA

VANDALISM

Banerjee Lane, May 26. Metal siding was damaged at a barn. A man, 23, was arrested at the scene and charged with destruction of property.

LEONARDTOWN AREA

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Leonardtown, May 26. A man sexually assaulted a motorist in his vehicle. The victim is described as physically disabled. A man, 61, was charged with sexual abuse of a vulnerable adult.

LEXINGTON PARK AREA

ASSAULTS

Saratoga Dr., May 29. A woman struck an acquaintance with an ashtray and inflicted scratch wounds. A woman, 49, was charged with second-degree assault.

PINEY POINT AREA

ASSAULTS

PINEY POINT, 2:40 a.m., May 29. A man at a campground attacked a camp employee and two guests. A man, 24, was arrested. Charges included assault, failure to obey a lawful order of a police officer, and disorderly intoxication and conduct.

ST. INIGOES AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

South Snow Hill Manor Rd., 10:59 a.m., May 28. A 54-year-old man found sleeping at a residence was arrested at the scene and charged with burglary. Food had been consumed and items in the home had been damaged.

Southern Maryland crime report


SECTION: Metro; Pg. T27


LENGTH: 967 words


Calvert County

These were among reports received by the Calvert County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. Anyone with information about these crimes should call the Criminal Investigation Division, 410-535-2800 or 301-855-1194, or the Crime Solvers line, 410-535-2880. You can also call the Prince Frederick Barrack of the state police at 410-535-1400.

DUNKIRK AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS  

Route 4, 3:06 p.m. Feb. 27. Surveying equipment was stolen.

Route 4,3:29 a.m. Feb. 24. A flat-screen television and several phones were stolen from a store.

HUNTINGTOWN AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Holland Cliff Rd., 9:40 a.m. Feb. 28. Jewelry was stolen from a home.

LUSBY AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Cove Point Rd., 7:30 a.m. to 4 p.m. Feb. 28. Coins were stolen from a home.

Tongue Cove Dr.,7:58 p.m. Feb. 24. A handgun, a safe, credit cards, prescription medication and cash were stolen from a home.

OWINGS AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Lake Shore Dr.,March 3 to March 4. A window of a vehicle was broken, and a wallet was taken.

PRINCE FREDERICK AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Duke St., Feb. 28 to March 3. A shed was broken into. Nothing was reported missing.

Charles County

These were among reports received by the Charles County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. For information, call 301-932-2222 or 301-870-3232. The sheriff's office's Web site, www.ccso.us, has news releases, neighborhood crime statistics, community services, crime prevention programs and career opportunities.

REWARDS FOR INFORMATION

Crime Solvers will pay a reward for information leading to an arrest and an indictment in connection with these and other crimes. Call the 24-hour hotline at 866-411-8477. Callers may remain anonymous.

INDIAN HEAD AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Jameson Ct.,8 p.m. March 2. An attempt was made to kick open the front door of a house.

WALDORF AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Crain Hwy.,3300 block, 2:45 a.m. March 4. Glass in the front door of a store was broken.

Paul Mellon Ct.,100 block, March 3 to March 4. A window was broken at a business, which was ransacked. Nothing was reported missing.

Tahoe Pl.,4000 block, 2:49 a.m. March 6. Wheels and rims were stolen from a vehicle.

St. Mary's County

These were among reports received by the St. Mary's County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. For information, call 301-475-8008 or the Crime Solvers line, 301-475-3333. The Leonardtown Barrack of the Maryland State Police has a 24-hour anonymous tip line at 301-475-2936.

CALIFORNIA AREA ASSAULTS

California,Feb. 22. A woman bit an acquaintance. A California woman, 34, was charged with second-degree assault.

California, Feb. 22. During an argument, a man punched an acquaintance in the face. A Leonardtown man, 40, was charged with second-degree assault.

CALLAWAY AREA ASSAULTS

Callaway,12:14 a.m. March 4. A man assaulted an acquaintance at a tavern. A Lexington Park man, 41, was charged with second-degree assault and violation of a protective order.

CHAPTICO AREA VANDALISM

Aviation Yacht Club Rd., Feb. 28. A sign at a golf course was damaged with spray paint.

GREAT MILLS AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Coronado Dr.,March 2. Several window screens at a home were removed.

Leonardtown, Feb. 21. An inmate at a detention center assaulted another inmate. A Brandywine man, 37, was charged with second-degree assault.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Leonardtown,Feb. 28. Cash was stolen from a fast-food restaurant.

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Black Creek Rd., March 1. During an investigation of a traffic accident, it was learned that a driver had reportedly been sexually assaulted before the accident. The investigation was continuing.

LEXINGTON PARK AREA ASSAULTS

Lexington Park,Feb. 28. During an argument, someone choked an acquaintance.

Lexington Park,March 1. During an argument, a woman assaulted an acquaintance.

Lexington Park,March 3. During an argument, a man hit an acquaintance on the head with a metal trash can. A Lexington Park man, 42, was charged with second-degree assault.

Lexington Park,March 5. During an argument, a woman assaulted an acquaintance. A Lexington Park woman, 30, was charged with second-degree assault.

VANDALISM

Mayfair Lane,Feb. 25 to Feb. 28. A vehicle was damaged with spray paint.

LOVEVILLE AREA ASSAULTS

Parson's Mill Rd.,March 2. During an argument, a man forced an acquaintance onto a couch and strangled the person. A Loveville man, 45, was charged with second-degree assault.

MECHANICSVILLE AREA ASSAULTS

Jones Rd.,March 3. During an argument, a woman hit an acquaintance in the face with a piece of wood. A Mechanicsville woman, 37, was charged with second-degree assault.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Mechanicsville, Feb. 27. A side door at a home was forced open. Nothing was reported missing.

Mechanicville,Feb. 28. A vacant house was forcibly entered.

ST. MARY'S CITY AREA ASSAULTS

Point Lookout Rd., Feb. 28. A man assaulted an acquaintance at a home. A St. Mary's City man, 53, was charged with second-degree assault.

WILDEWOOD AREA VANDALISM

Larkspur St., 4 p.m. Feb. 27. Someone shot a window at a house in a subdivision.

BYLINE: Compiled by Sarah Lane


SECTION: Metro; Pg. T25


LENGTH: 716 words


Prince William

These were among incidents reported by Prince William County police. For information, call 703-792-7245.

BRISTOW AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Iona Sound Dr., 13300 block, 8:30 to 10 p.m. April 24. Two bicycles were stolen from a residence entered through an open garage.

DUMFRIES AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS  

Streamside Ct., 15200 block, noon April 21 to 3:15 p.m. April 27. An attempt was made to enter a residence by tampering with a rear door.

GAINESVILLE AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Foal Ct., 8500 block, 9 p.m. April 25 to 5 a.m. April 26. A DVD player was stolen from an unlocked vehicle inside a garage.

Filly Ct., 10 p.m. April 25 and 1:45 p.m. April 26. A firearm was stolen from an unlocked vehicle. A 17-year-old Gainesville male was arrested.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFT

Cleveland Bay Ct. 8400 block, 9 p.m. April 25 to 5 a.m. April 26. A vehicle was stolen. During an investigation, police officers heard an explosion and found the vehicle in flames.

MANASSAS AREA SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Yorkshire Lane, 8300 block, Feb. to April. A man had a sexual relationship with a female juvenile acquaintance. An 18-year-old Manassas man was arrested.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Coopers Lane, 11800 block, 6 a.m. to 6:30 p.m. April 25. Cash and jewelry were stolen from a residence.

Crestwood Dr., 10500 block, 4 p.m. April 21 to 8 a.m. April 22. A business was entered by forcing a front door.

Wellingford Dr., 7900 block, 2 a.m. April 25 to 11:30 a.m. April 26. Machinery was stolen from a business.

TRIANGLE AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Cabin Rd., 18300 block, 2 to 3 p.m. April 24. A video game system and other property were stolen from a residence entered by forcing a rear door.

Opitz Blvd., 2300 block, 8:25 p.m. April 25. During an argument in a vehicle, a man assaulted a female acquaintance. A 22-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

WOODBRIDGE AREA ASSAULTS

Quince Ct., 5200 block, 1:04 a.m. April 26. During an argument, a man assaulted a female acquaintance. A 29-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

WEAPONS

Winslow Cir., 1900 block, 12:53 a.m. April 25. Several gunshots were heard.

ROBBERIES

Jefferson Davis Hwy., 13900 block, 3:57 a.m. April 26. While a man made a purchase at a convenience store, a second man took cash from the open register. Both men fled on foot.

Jefferson Davis Hwy., 16800 block, 3:41 a.m. April 25. A gunman robbed a convenience store of cash.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Barksdale St., 14700 block, 9:16 p.m. April 26. A residence was entered through a rear door.

Elm Farm Rd., 3400 block, 9:45 to 11 a.m. April 24. Three firearms were stolen from a residence entered by forcing a rear door.

Grosbeak Ct., 1500 block, 2:30 p.m. April 22 to 11:26 p.m. April 26. Two TVs, three video game systems, other electronics and jewelry were stolen from a residence.

Kerrydale Rd., 13300 block, April 16 to 5:45 p.m. April 19. A firearm, a laptop computer, a video game system and jewelry were stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked rear door. Two men, 21 and 24, and a 27-year-old woman, all of Woodbridge, were arrested.

VANDALISM

Occoquan Rd., 12900 block, 9 p.m. April 26 to 11 a.m. April 29. A bullet was fired at a school, breaking a window and damaging a SmartBoard.

Manassas

No reports were received from Manassas police for this edition of Local Living. For information, call 703-257-8000.

Manassas Park

These were among the incidents reported by Manassas Park police. For more information, call 703-361-1136.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Centreville Rd., 8500 block, 11:22 p.m. April 26. A man took candy from a gas station. A 36-year-old Manassas Park man was arrested.

Centreville Rd., 8500 block, 8:48 p.m. April 28. A man at a gas station took a set of keys left on a counter.

VANDALISM

Andrew Dr., 9100 block, 9:59 p.m. April 27. Graffiti were spray-painted on the side of a building.

Prince William County crime report Prince William County crime report


SECTION: Metro; Pg. T17


LENGTH: 1046 words


Prince William County

These were among incidents reported by Prince William County police. For information, call 703-792-7245.

DUMFRIES AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Jurgensen Dr., 3600 block, 2:30 p.m. Aug. 3 to 12:50 a.m. Aug. 4. A DVD player and jewelry were stolen from a residence entered by prying a front door.

Mills Spring Dr., 15000 block, 8 p.m. July 29 to 8 p.m. Aug. 1. Someone attempted to enter a residence through several rear windows and a rear door. 

Wintercress Ct., 15000 block, 9:30 to 10:45 a.m. Aug. 2. A camera and jewelry were stolen from a residence entered by forcing a rear door.

GAINESVILLE AREA ROBBERIES

McGraws Corner Dr., 14300 block, 3:16 p.m. Aug. 1. A man implying he had a weapon robbed a pharmacy of medicine. A 22-year-old Rixeyville, Va., man was arrested.

HAYMARKET AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Washington St., 15100 block, 5 p.m. Aug. 3 to 11:30 a.m. Aug. 4. Several items were stolen from a store entered through an unlocked rear door.

MANASSAS AREA SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Browns Lane, July 31. A man sexually assaulted a female juvenile acquaintance. A 28-year-old Manassas man was arrested.

New Market Ct., 7200 block, 8:32 p.m. Aug. 6. A man at a hotel took nude photos of a girl and encouraged her to prostitute herself in return for food and shelter. A 23-year-old Manassas man was charged with contributing to the delinquency of a minor and using a communication system to facilitate certain offenses with a minor.

ASSAULTS

Gregory Ct., 7800 block, 12:32 a.m. Aug. 4. During an argument, a man drove his vehicle and hit a male acquaintance. The acquaintance was treated for injuries. A 37-year-old Manassas man was arrested.

ROBBERIES

New Market Ct., 7200 block, 8:36 p.m. Aug. 3. A man knocked on a hotel room door, then demanded money from a male acquaintance at gunpoint. The man hit the acquaintance on the head with the gun, which fired a bullet, striking the acquaintance in the shoulder. The gunman fled with a wallet and cash. The acquaintance was treated for injuries.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Campaign Ct., 10900 block, 11:30 a.m. to 4:45 p.m. July 31. Cash and a TV were stolen from a residence entered by breaking a basement window.

Omega Lane, 6000 block, 4:44 a.m. Aug. 6. A man entered a residence through an unlocked garage door. He fled empty-handed when a resident saw him.

WOODBRIDGE AREA SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Cotton Mill Dr., 12300 block, 10 p.m. Aug. 6. A man met a female juvenile through social media, and he was found in possession of nude photos of her. A 29-year-old Manassas Park man was charged with contributing to the delinquency of a minor, possession of child pornography and using a communication system to facilitate certain offenses with a minor.

ASSAULTS

Kellogg Dr., 4800 block, 8:05 p.m. Aug. 4. During an argument, a man attempted to hit a male acquaintance with a vehicle. The motorist parked the vehicle, then hit the acquaintance on the arm with a metal stick. A 27-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

ARSON

Park Shore Ct., 12100 block, 9:32 a.m. July 31. Someone entered a vacant residence through a rear basement window and started a fire, damaging the basement.

WEAPONS

Dale Blvd. and Minnieville Rd., 10:19 p.m. Aug. 5. Someone fired a BB gun at a moving vehicle, breaking a rear window.

Kingsman Rd., 13500 block, 1:58 a.m. Aug. 5. Someone in a vehicle fired a weapon several times. A bullet hit a parked vehicle.

ROBBERIES

Kenwood and Kenmar drives, 9:50 p.m. Aug. 7. A male with a shotgun robbed a man and a woman of cash and cellphones.

Potomac Mills Rd., 14600 block, 3:35 a.m. Aug. 7. A gunman robbed a hotel of cash.

Tacketts Mill Dr., 2200 block, 9:28 p.m. Aug. 3. A male in a parking lot put his arm around the neck of a man and demanded money. He fled on foot with cash.

INDECENT EXPOSURE

Dale Blvd., 5800 block, 2:26 p.m. Aug. 5. A man in a store made inappropriate gestures in front of a woman. A 51-year-old Providence, R.I., man was arrested.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Belvedere Dr., 14400 block, 7 a.m. to 6:30 p.m. Aug. 1. Cash and jewelry were stolen from a residence entered by forcing a rear door.

Briton Ct., 4400 block, 5:38 a.m. Aug. 1. A man was inside a garage when a resident saw him. The man fled empty-handed.

Felmore Ct., 3600 block, noon Aug. 1. A man knocked on a front door of a residence. When a resident did not answer, the man attempted to enter the residence by breaking a rear window. He did not enter.

Foothill St., 3200 block, 10 a.m. to 8 p.m. Aug. 2. A laptop computer, two video game systems, games and other items were stolen from a residence.

Frishman Ct., 4900 block, 9 a.m. to 6:30 p.m. Aug. 1. Two bikes were stolen from a residence entered through an open garage door.

Mayflower Dr., 2100 block, 11:30 p.m. Aug. 3 to 4:30 a.m. Aug. 4. Cash, a laptop computer, a video game system and jewelry were stolen from a residence entered by breaking a rear window.

Rivanna Ct., 3100 block, 12:10 p.m. Aug. 2 to 3:49 p.m. Aug. 4. Three TVs and other electronics were stolen from a residence.

Samantha Ct., 14200 block, 10:45 a.m. to 1:10 p.m. Aug. 1. Jewelry was stolen from a residence entered by breaking a side window.

Vestal St., 700 block, 10 a.m. to 3 p.m. Aug. 1. Cash and purses were stolen from a residence.

Manassas

No reports were received from Manassas police for today's Local Living section. For information, call 703-257-8000.

Manassas Park

The following incident was reported by Manassas Park police. For information, call 703-361-1136.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Andrew Dr., 9:16 p.m. July 31. A bike was stolen from the front area of a business.

Industry Dr., 6 p.m. July 29 to 7 a.m. July 30. Computers, computer equipment, tools, a sump pump, a photocopier and other items were stolen from two businesses entered by breaking side glass doors. A truck was spray-painted.

Crime Report


SECTION: EXTRAS; Pg. 07


LENGTH: 728 words


Calvert County 

These were among reports received recently by the Calvert County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. Anyone with information about these crimes should call the Criminal Investigation Division, 410-535-2800 or 301-855-1194, or the Crime Solvers line, 410-535-2880. You can also call the Prince Frederick Barrack of the state police at 410-535-1400.

Lusby Area

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

H.G. TRUEMAN ROAD, Jan. 10. Two copper welding wires were stolen. 

DESTRUCTION OF PROPERTY

LAKE LARIAT, 8:50 a.m. Jan. 10. Pickets on a railing were kicked out, and an eight-foot railing was knocked off a fence along a walkway leading from a parking lot to the lake.

Owings Area

DESTRUCTION OF PROPERTY

ARBOR WAY, 11:21 p.m. Jan. 14. Two 50-gallon plastic trash cans were set on fire.

LAKESHORE DRIVE, 11:21 p.m. Jan. 14. Two mailboxes were set on fire.

Port Republic Area

DESTRUCTION OF PROPERTY

HANCE ROAD, Jan. 7. Two boats were pulled off a rack at a boat ramp and thrown into the water. An electric meter was smashed.

Prince Frederick Area

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

FAIRGROUND ROAD, Jan. 9. A catalytic converter was stolen from a vehicle at the Park and Ride lot.

ROUTE 2/4, Jan. 10. Two women and a man burglarized a residence. A man, 48, and two women, 55 and 65, who lived at the residence, were charged with fourth-degree burglary.

VEHICLE THEFTS

HALLOWING POINT ROAD, Jan. 7. A vehicle was reported stolen. The date of the theft is unknown; the vehicle was parked at the location for approximately three months.

Charles County 

The following are among reports received recently by the Charles County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. For further information, call 301-932-2222 or 301-870-3232. Crime Solvers will pay a reward for information leading to an arrest and an indictment in connection with these and other crimes. Call the 24-hour hotline at 866-411-8477. Callers may remain anonymous. The Charles County Sheriff's Office Web site is: http://www.ccso.us. Included at the site are daily news releases, Crime Watch neighborhood statistics, community services, crime prevention programs and career opportunities.

La Plata Area

ASSAULTS

CRAIN HIGHWAY, 7:30 p.m. Jan. 9. A girl kicked a police officer at the La Plata district station when he attempted to serve her with a juvenile arrest warrant. A girl, 17, was charged with assaulting a police officer and served a warrant.

Waldorf Area

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

LANCASTER CIR., 4700 block, 10:10 a.m. Jan. 15. A man forced entry into a residence through a back door. A woman at the residence fled. The man then left through a front door. Nothing was reported missing.

INDUSTRIAL PARK DRIVE, 11 p.m. Jan. 16 to 5 a.m. Jan. 17. Fifty spools of copper wire were stolen from a fenced area behind Verizon. Copper wire was also stolen from several vehicles parked in the lot. A hole had been cut in the fence.

White Plains Area

ASSAULTS

CRAIN HWY., 4600 block, 1:40 a.m. Jan. 13. A man at Rednecks Saloon and Grill attempted to start a fight in the parking lot. When officers arrived, the man hit an officer and continued acting aggressively. The officer used a stun gun to immobilize the man. A man, 29, was charged with second-degree assault, disorderly conduct and failure to obey a lawful order.

St. Mary's County 

The following are among reports received recently by the St. Mary's County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. For further information, call 301-475-8008, or the Crime Solvers line, 301-475-3333. The Leonardtown Barrack of the Maryland State Police operates a 24-hour crime tip line on which people may anonymously report information about crimes and related matters at 301-475-2936.

Compton Area

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

POTOMAC AVENUE, 2:50 p.m. Jan. 15. Electronics were reported stolen between Dec. 6 and Jan. 15 from a residence entered by damaging back doors.

Leonardtown Area

ASSAULTS

LEONARTOWN, Jan 10. A man grabbed a girl, 14, by her arms and violently shook her. A man, 42, was charged with second-degree assault and child abuse.

Lexington Park Area

SEXUAL ASSAULTS 

LEXINGTON PARK, Jan. 10. A man raped a woman, 20, at a residence. A man, 53, was charged with second-degree rape.

ASSAULTS

LEXINGTON PARK, 8 a.m. Jan. 12. During an argument, a woman at a residence grabbed a knife and chased someone. A woman, 19, was charged with second-degree assault.

The Washington Post


March 22, 2012 Thursday  
Every Edition


Montgomery County crime report Montgomery County crime report


SECTION: METRO; Pg. T26


LENGTH: 2056 words


Montgomery County

These were among incidents received by the Montgomery County Police Department. For information, call 240-773-5030.

Rewards for information

Crime Solvers of Montgomery County, a nonprofit community organization, pays up to $1,000 for information leading to an arrest and indictment in connection with these and any other felony crimes. Call the 24-hour hotline at 800-673-2777. Callers may remain anonymous.

DISTRICT 1ROCKVILLE STATION240-773-6070

Prince William County crime report


SECTION: METRO; Pg. T27


LENGTH: 1191 words


Prince William County

These were among incidents reported by Prince William County police. For information, call 703-792-7245.

DUMFRIES AREA

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Fuller Heights and Mockingbird Heights roads, 10 p.m. Oct. 18. A gunman demanded property from three female pedestrians, then forced one of them to accompany him a short distance, where he sexually assaulted her.

GAINESVILLE AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

John Marshall Hwy., 14300 block, 7:30 a.m. Oct. 19 to 6:30 a.m. Oct. 22. A residence was entered by breaking a rear window. Nothing was reported stolen.

Sudley Rd., 4400 block, 7:30 a.m. to 1:30 p.m. Oct. 19. Jewelry and ammunition were among property stolen from a residence entered by breaking glass near the front door. 

Trek Way, 7000 block, 4:30 p.m. Oct. 19 to 6:30 a.m. Oct. 22. A dishwasher was stolen from a residence under construction.

MANASSAS AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Boar Run Ct., 15500 block, 6 p.m. Oct. 18 to 11:27 a.m. Oct. 19. Three mountain bikes were stolen from an open garage at a residence.

Botsford Rd., 9800 block, 10 a.m. Oct. 19 to 7:30 a.m. Oct. 22. Three firearms and a TV were stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked back door.

Dumfries Rd., 10600 block, Oct. 11. Horse saddles, a computer, a gas grill and a bicycle were among property stolen from two storage units entered by cutting locks.

Ellis Rd., 10000 block, 10 a.m. to 3 p.m. Oct. 22. Several firearms were stolen from a residence entered by forcing a window.

Roxbury Ave., 7400 block, 6:30 p.m. Oct. 18 to 8:30 p.m. Oct. 21. Three TVs, a laptop computer, two video game systems and jewelry were among property stolen from a residence.

Vic Pl., 8300 block, 9 p.m. Oct. 19 to 5 p.m. Oct. 21. Property was stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked door.

NOKESVILLE AREA

ASSAULTS

Nokesville Rd., 13000 block, 4:01 a.m. Oct. 21. During an argument at a party at a residence, a group of men attacked a man. A 19-year-old Nokesville man was arrested.

TRIANGLE AREA

WEAPONS OFFENSES

Graham Park Rd., 3800 block, 6:09 a.m. Oct. 19. Two males tried their way into a residence at gunpoint, then fired several shots into a window.

ROBBERIES

Kilmer Lane, 18100 block, 3:15 p.m. Oct. 16. Two males argued with a juvenile acquaintance about money, then knocked him to the ground and searched his pockets. The assailants fled empty-handed when an acquaintance intervened. Two Triangle males, 15 and 18, were arrested. The victim was treated for minor injuries.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Jurgenson Dr., 3600 block, 12:26 p.m. Oct. 17. Two males tried to force their way into a residence at gunpoint, then fled empty-handed in a vehicle.

WOODBRIDGE AREA

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

River Ridge Golf Course area, 2900 block, Aug. to Oct. 21. A man attacked an acquaintance on several occasions. A 51-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested on sexual assault charges.

ASSAULTS

Cloverdale Rd., 15100 block, 9:35 p.m. Oct. 20. During an argument, a man attacked a female acquaintance. A 25-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested. The victim was treated for minor injuries.

Fontaine Ct., 14400 block, 2:25 a.m. Oct. 20. During an argument, a man attacked an acquaintance, knocking her to the ground. He then attacked a man who intervened. A 47-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

Jefferson Davis Hwy., 13900 block, 6:56 p.m. Oct. 23. During an argument in a parking lot, a man shot a male acquaintance. When the victim ran way, he was struck by a vehicle, which left the scene without stopping. The victim was flown to a hospital for treatment of life-threatening injuries. A 23-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

Old Bridge Rd., 3000 block, 9:30 a.m. Oct. 17. Two males attacked a male in a bathroom at a school. The victim was taken to a hospital. Two Woodbridge males, 15 and 17, were arrested.

WEAPONS OFFENSES

Annapolis Way, 900 block, 12:20 a.m. Oct. 18. Witnesses to a chase involving a silver truck and a blue station wagon said that they heard several gunshots.

Cuddy Loop, 14100 block, 11:57 p.m. Oct. 22. A man tried to enter a residence, then walked away. When an occupant confronted him at his vehicle, the man tried to force him back inside the residence at gunpoint. When another occupant refused to unlock the door, the man fired several shots at the residence, then fled empty-handed in the vehicle.

ROBBERIES

Old Bridge Rd., 1400 block, 10:12 a.m. Oct. 20. A man robbed a store of cash at knifepoint.

INDECENT EXPOSURE INCIDENTS

Perch Branch Way, 4500 block, 8:16 p.m. Oct. 22. A man naked from the waist down approached a pedestrian.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Essex Dr., 14000 block, 9:30 a.m. to 8:50 p.m. Oct. 16. A laptop computer, power tools, cash and jewelry were among property stolen from a residence.

Fairmont Ct., 14300 block, 9 a.m. to 1 p.m. Oct. 16. A laptop computer, a tablet computer and several video games were stolen from a residence.

Fayette Ct., 3600 block, 10 a.m. Oct. 20 to 12:01 a.m. Oct. 21. A break-in occurred at a residence. Cabinets were searched, but nothing was reported missing.

Fellmore Ct., 3600 block, 8:20 to 8:40 p.m. Oct. 17. A TV and shoes were stolen from a residence entered by breaking a side window.

Fern Pl., 16600 block, 6:30 a.m. to 5:15 p.m. Oct. 23. A video game system was among property stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked door.

Hetten Lane, 3700 block, 8:10 a.m. to 3:30 p.m. Oct. 16. An attempt was made to enter a residence by forcing a back door. Nothing was reported missing.

Kenny Ct., 4700 block, 10:30 to 10:45 a.m. Oct. 22. A laptop computer was stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked door.

Kitty Hawk Way, 13600 block, 1 to 2 p.m. Oct. 16. An attempt was made to enter a residence by forcing a forcing the front door. Nothing was reported missing.

Live Oak Ct., 4900 block, 8:10 p.m. Oct. 20. An attempt was made to enter an occupied residence through the front door. The intruder fled empty-handed when confronted.

Stone Lined Cir., 12500 block, 8:50 p.m. Oct. 23. An attempt was made to enter a residence by damaging a garage door. Nothing was reported missing.

Worth Ave., 13000 block, 8 p.m. Oct. 20 to 8 a.m. Oct. 21. An attempt was made to enter a business by damaging a front door.

Manassas

These were among incidents reported by Manassas police. For information, call 703-257-8000.

ASSAULTS

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Taney Rd., 9400 block, 10 a.m. to 1 p.m. Oct. 16. An air compressor and a nail gun were stolen from a shed.

Tyler Ct., 9000 block, 12:30 to 2:50 p.m. Oct. 18. Cash, a tablet computer and jewelry were stolen from a residence entered by forcing a rear window.

VANDALISM

Sudley Rd., 8500 block, Oct. 19 to Oct. 21. The paint finish was damaged on six vehicles at a car dealership.

Manassas Park

No report was received from Manassas Park police for this edition of Local Living. For information, call 703-361-1136.

The Washington Post


October 11, 2007 Thursday

Crime Report


SECTION: EXTRAS; Pg. GZ19


LENGTH: 3096 words


Montgomery County 

These were among incidents recorded by the Montgomery County Police Department's Media Services Division, which may not have received complete reports from all six stations for today's Extra. For more information, call 240-773-5030.

REWARDS FOR INFORMATION

Crime Solvers of Montgomery County Inc., a nonprofit community organization, will pay up to $1,000 for information leading to an arrest and indictment in connection with these and any other felony crimes. Call the 24-hour hotline at 800-673-2777. Callers may remain anonymous.

District 1 Rockville Station Telephone: 240-773-6070

SEXUAL ASSAULTS 

COLLEGE PKWY., 400 to 800 block, Sept. 12. A person reportedly raped an adult female acquaintance.

ASSAULTS

SEVEN LOCKS RD., 9600 block, Sept. 17. A person harassed a person with repeated phone calls, making racial slurs and threats. 

ROBBERIES

MARSEILLE DR., 9200 block, 3:05 to 3:35 p.m. Sept. 18. Three men dressed in blue work uniforms forced their way into a home, bound a resident, took property and fled. The robbers possibly fled in a dark green, older-model pickup truck.

RIDGEWAY AND LEMAY ROADS, 7:50 p.m. Sept. 13. A man wearing a tan knit cap attempted to grab a woman's purse and fled.

VEIRS MILL ROAD AND ATLANTIC AVENUE, 3:45 p.m. Sept. 12. Three men assaulted a person, took property and fled.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

DARNESTOWN RD., 10000 block, 11 p.m. Sept. 16 to 1:30 p.m. Sept. 17. A tutoring center was entered. Nothing was reported missing.

DEVILWOOD DR., 12100 block, noon to 2 p.m., Sept. 18. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

LEMAY RD., 5900 block, 11:30 p.m. Sept. 13 to 3:30 p.m. Sept. 14. A man, 21, took property from a residence and fled.

NELSON ST., 1100 block, 7:47 p.m. Sept. 12. A shoplifting occurred at a market. A male, 14, was arrested nearby and charged with shoplifting.

POTOMAC OAKS DR., 11100 block, Sept. 14. Property was stolen from a construction site.

SCHUYLKILL RD., 11500 block, 3:30 to 9:45 p.m. Sept. 15. Property was stolen from a residence.

MACON RD., 4900 block, time and date unknown. Property was recently reported stolen from two vehicles at the Rocking Horse Road Center. A Global Positioning System device was taken from one of the vehicles.

MONTROSE RD., 5900 block, Sept. 11 to Sept. 12. Airbags were stolen from four Honda vehicles in a parking garage.

SMOKEY QUARTZ LANE, 11100 block, 7:50 a.m. to 5:05 p.m. Sept. 11. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

STONEBRIDGE DR., 14300 block, 8 a.m. to 3:52 p.m. Sept. 11. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

VICARS WAY, 15100 block, 8 a.m. to 5:28 p.m. Sept. 11. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

WADE AVE., 800 block, 12:09 a.m. Sept. 11. Three men took property from a vehicle and fled.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

ROLLINS AVE., 100 block, 10:21 p.m. Sept. 13. A 2002 Lexus RX3 was stolen. A Prince George's County man, 20, was arrested and charged with auto theft.

District 2 Bethesda Station Telephone: 301-652-9200

ASSAULTS

ROCKVILLE PIKE AND EDSON LANE AREA, 4 p.m. Sept. 18. A man with long curly hair, boarded a Metro bus and became irate. He pulled out a knife and tried to assault a person. Passengers intervened and informed the bus driver of the incident. The man fled from the bus.

ROBBERIES

MARYKNOLL AVE., 7600 block, Sept. 17. A masked man gained entrance to a residence, took property and fled.

ROCKVILLE PIKE, 11600 block, 3:10 p.m. Sept. 11. Three males assaulted and robbed a person of property and fled. The assailants were located nearby with the stolen property in their possession.

16TH ST., 8500 block, 4:45 p.m. Sept. 16. Two males entered a market, made unspecified demands at gunpoint, then fled.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

BETHESDA AREA, Sept. 13 to Sept. 14. Property was reported stolen from 25 vehicles. Two of the vehicles were stolen and later recovered. Police consider a 14-year-old male youth to be a suspect.

BROOK LANE N., 8300 block, 1 to 4:45 a.m. Sept. 17. Airbags were stolen from Honda and Toyota vehicles in a parking garage. A police report did not include the number of vehicles entered.

BURDETTE RD., 8300 block, Sept. 14 to Sept. 17. Property was stolen from a construction site.

EDGEFIELD RD., 4600 block, Sept. 12 to Sept. 13. An attempt was made to enter a residence.

HAMPDEN LANE, 4900 block, Sept. 14 to Sept. 15. A theft occurred at a Japanese restaurant. A suspect has been identified in connection with the incident.

HARTSDALE AVE., 8700 block, 4 to 7:30 p.m. Sept. 13. A man entered an elementary school by force. Nothing was reported missing, but two trailers were found with graffiti on them.

KIRKE ST. W., 1 to 100 block, Sept. 14 to Sept. 15. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

MAGNOLIA PARKWAY AND W. KIRKE, AND W. IRVING AND HASKETH STREETS, Sept. 14 to Sept. 15. Property was stolen from seven vehicles entered by breaking windows.

MCCOMAS AVENUE AND ST. PAUL STREET, 2:15 p.m. Sept. 14. A man took property from a vehicle. Police located a man, 54, nearby, allegedly in possession of the stolen property.

WEST LAKE TERRACE AND SPRING LAKE DRIVE, Sept. 16 to Sept. 17. Airbags were stolen from Honda and Toyota vehicles in several parking lots. Police reports did not include the number of vehicles entered.

WISCONSIN AVE., 5500 block. Property was recently reported stolen from several businesses in the Chevy Chase building. A man, 40, of no fixed address, was located nearby and arrested. A second man suspected in the crime was not located.

45TH ST., 7100 block, 5 a.m. Sept. 13. A man was seen at a residence. No entry was gained and nothing was reported missing.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

MAPLE AVE., 11900 block, Sept. 12 to Sept. 13. Three men robbed a car dealership of three vehicles.

District 3 Silver Spring Station Telephone: 301-565-7740

SEXUAL ASSAULTS 

HANOVER AND 16TH STREETS AREA, 2100 block, 11 a.m. to 12:15 p.m. Sept. 15. A man sexually assaulted an acquaintance. A Rockville man, 33, has been identified as a suspect.

ASSAULTS

MOUNT PISGAH RD., 9700 block, 8:30 p.m. Sept. 14. An aggravated assault occurred between acquaintances near the Prince George's County line.

PHILADELPHIA AVE., 900 block, 1:10 p.m. Sept. 17. A man pointed a handgun at a person. A Gaithersburg man, 23, was arrested and charged with aggravated assault.

THAYER AVE, 500 block, 11:40 p.m. Sept. 14. Three men accosted a person, and one of the men attempted to stab the person with a broken bottle. Three District men, ages 21, 22 and 24, were arrested nearby and charged with aggravated assault.

ROBBERIES

BLAIR RD., 7500 block, 3:10 a.m. Sept. 12. Four men assaulted a person, took property and fled.

One of the males put an unidentified object to the pedestrian's neck, demanded his property, searched his pockets and took his bag. The robbers then fled. No injuries were reported.

NEW HAMPSHIRE AVE., 6800 block, 7:15 to 7:25 p.m. Oct. 1. A 1997 Chrysler Sebring, a 1995 Toyota Corolla and a 2004 Dodge Dakota were vandalized. Tires of the three vehicles were punctured.

March 19, 2015 Thursday 11:08 PM EST 


Southern Maryland crime report


SECTION: Metro; Pg. T23


LENGTH: 945 words


Calvert County

These were among reports received by the Calvert County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. Anyone with information about these crimes is asked to call the Criminal Investigation Division at 410-535-2800 or 301-855-1194, the Crime Solvers line at 410-535-2880 or the Prince Frederick Barrack of the state police at 410-535-1400.

HUNTINGTOWN AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS  

Holland Cliffs Rd.,Jan. 29 to March 3. AT&T batteries were stolen from three housing units.

LUSBY AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Mills Creek Dr.,2:30 p.m. March 2. A boat and trailer were stolen from a house's yard.

VANDALISM

Pardoe Rd.,Feb. 27. Three lights atop utility poles were shot out.

OWINGS AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Skinners Turn Rd.,11:15 a.m. March 2. Outgoing mail was stolen from a mailbox.

PRINCE FREDERICK AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Adelina Rd.,5:28 p.m. March 3. A handgun and ammunition were stolen from a residence.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Route 4,6:46 p.m. March 2. During a police traffic stop of a rental vehicle, an investigation revealed that the operator had a suspended driver's license and that the vehicle had been reported stolen in Montgomery County. A Lusby man, 34, was arrested.

Charles County

These were among reports received by the Charles County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. For information, call 301-932-2222 or 301-870-3232. The sheriff's Web site, www.ccso.us, has news releases, local crime statistics, crime prevention programs and career opportunities.

REWARDS FOR INFORMATION

Crime Solvers will pay a reward for information leading to an arrest and an indictment in connection with crimes. Call the 24-hour hotline at 866-411-8477. Callers may remain anonymous.

INDIAN HEAD AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Bicknell Rd.,5700 block, 7:11 a.m. March 11. Two men who were trying to push a motorcycle out of a residential shed fled after an owner of the home chased them.

Indian Head Ave.,400 block, noon to 11:30 p.m. March 11. Jewelry and other items were stolen from a home.

LA PLATA AREA ASSAULTS

Charles St.,9:06 a.m. March 12. A man assaulted another man outside a courthouse entrance. A responding police officer was grabbed by the arm and forced to the ground. A stun gun was used when the assailant refused to surrender. He was taken to a hospital for evaluation.

PORT TOBACCO AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Poorhouse Rd.,9800 block, 5 p.m. March 7 to 8:15 a.m. March 8. An all-terrain vehicle was stolen .

WALDORF AREA ASSAULTS

Post Office Rd.,600 block, 10:41 a.m. March 9. A man punched a female acquaintance. A Waldorf man, 21, was charged with second-degree assault, possession of marijuana with intent to distribute and possession of drug paraphernalia.

ROBBERIES

Bluebird Dr., 7:17 p.m. March 8. A female pedestrian was struck on the head with a gun and robbed by two men.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Ell Lane,12100 block, 12:40 a.m March 7. Cash was stolen from a business.

Mattawoman Beantown Rd.,12:51 p.m. March 11. Windows of several vehicles at a park-and-ride were broken; two stereos were stolen.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Leonardtown and Post Office roads,noon March 9. During an investigation of a hit-and-run accident, it was discovered that the vehicle had been reported stolen in Montgomery County. Police were searching for a suspect.

St. Mary's County

These were among reports from the St. Mary's County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. For information, call 301-475-8008. To submit a tip, call Crime Solvers at 301-475-3333. The Leonardtown Barrack of the State Police has an anonymous tip line, 301-475-2936.

AVENUE AREA SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Lucca Way,March 6. A man was found touching an acquaintance's body in a sexual manner while the person was sleeping. An Avenue man, 35, was charged with second-degree assault and a fourth-degree sexual offense.

CLEMENTS AREA ASSAULTS

Yates Rd.,9:28 a.m. March 5. A man assaulted a female acquaintance. A Clements man, 42, was charged with second-degree assault.

GREAT MILLS AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Great Mills Rd., March. An owner of a food shop reported that an employee had stolen from the business.

Great Mills Rd., Feb. 14 to March 7. A battery-operated cooler was stolen from a home.

LEONARDTOWN AREA ASSAULTS

Goddard Ct.,March 3. During an argument, a woman hit an acquaintance with a hammer and punched the person. A Leonardtown woman, 30, was charged with second-degree assault.

LEXINGTON PARK AREA ROBBERIES

Great Mills Rd.,9:06 p.m. March 9. A convenience store was robbed at gunpoint. The robber assaulted a clerk as he fled.

ASSAULTS

Altman Ct.,March 4. A man at a home grabbed an acquaintance by the throat and attempted to strangle the person. A Lexington Park man, 29, was charged with second-degree assault.

CHILD-CARE INCIDENT

Midway Dr.,March 8. A woman left three children, ages 8 months, 2 and 4, alone the night of Feb. 28. A Lexington Park woman, 23, was charged with four counts of neglecting a minor.

Montgomery County crime report


SECTION: Metro; Pg. T30


LENGTH: 3205 words


Among incidents reported by police in Montgomery County, Rockville and Takoma Park.

Montgomery County

These were among incidents recently received by the Montgomery County Police Department. For information, call 240-773-5030.

REWARDS FOR INFORMATION

Crime Solvers of Montgomery County, a nonprofit organization, pays up to $1,000 for information leading to an arrest and indictment in connection with felonies. Call the 24-hour hotline at 800-673-2777. Callers may remain anonymous.

DISTRICT 1ROCKVILLE STATIONTELEPHONE: 240-773-6070 SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Halpine Rd., 8:30 to 11:30 p.m. Dec. 25. A person sexually assaulted an acquaintance.  

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Beall Ave.,Bickford Ave., Bradford Dr., Carr Ave., Forest Ave., Grayson Ct., Great Falls Rd., Montgomery Ave. and Smallwood Rd., Dec. 16 to 17. Cash and coins were stolen from 11 vehicles. Most were entered by force.

Crabbs Branch Way, 15800 block, 1:02 p.m. Dec. 18. Property was stolen from a vehicle. A 24-year-old man of unknown address was found in possession of the property and arrested.

Halesworth Dr., 1100 block, 7 to 8 p.m. Dec. 17. Property was stolen from a vehicle in a garage. A 16-year-old Rockville male was arrested.

Halesworth Dr., 1200 block, Dec. 17. A vehicle parked in a garage was entered and searched. Nothing was reported missing.

Kings Rant St., 14500 block, Dec. 24 to 28. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

Kohloss Rd., 17500 block, Dec. 18 to 19. A vehicle was entered by force. Nothing was reported missing.

Kohloss Rd., 17500 block, Dec. 29 to 30. Property was stolen from a vehicle. There was no sign of forced entry.

Platinum Dr., 14200 block, 8 a.m. Dec. 26 to 1 a.m. Dec. 27. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

Rockville Pike, 12000 block, 3 to 4 p.m. Dec. 20. A person took property from someone at a grocery store. It was not until later that the shopper realized the theft occurred.

Rockville Pike, 12000 block, 7:10 p.m. Dec. 29. A person took property from someone at a grocery store. It was not until later that the shopper realized the theft occurred.

Wilkins Ave., 12100 block, 4 p.m. Dec. 29. A 38-year-old Silver Spring man was arrested in connection with an attempt to enter a yoga studio by force.

Linganore Way, 3600 block, 8 a.m. to 12:23 p.m. Dec. 17. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

New Hampshire Ave., 12800 block, 2:05 a.m. Dec. 23. Property was stolen from a pharmacy entered by force.

Robey Terr., 3400 block, 10:50 a.m. to 4 p.m. Dec. 17. Property was stolen from a residence. There was no sign of forced entry.

Spring St. and Wayne Ave., Dec. 16 to 30. A purse and a backpack were stolen from two vehicles in parking garages.

Sweet Clover Ct., 2700 block, Dec. 20 to 22. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

Tech Rd., 12200 block, 2:45 a.m. Dec. 20. Property was stolen from an electronics business entered by force.

Rockville

These were among incidents recently reported by the Rockville Police Department. For more information, call 240-314-8922.

Copperstone Ct., 1000 block, 11:30 p.m. Dec. 31 to 2 a.m. Jan. 1. Two iPads, a laptop computer, a video game console, 10 video games, a television and a cellphone were stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked rear door.

Jefferson St. E., 1600 block, noon Jan. 1 to 12:37 p.m. Jan. 2. A front chrome grille and a fog light were stolen from a vehicle.

Southlawn Ct., unit block, 11:40 p.m. Dec. 23 to 10 a.m. Dec. 24. Someone used a key to enter a business through a front door, then took a key from the front desk area. The thief took cash and checks from a cash box in a storage room and fled.

Southlawn Ct., unit block, 1 to 1:20 a.m. Dec. 31. Cash and a tablet computer were stolen from a safe that had been pried open at a business. The business was also entered by force.

WEAPONS

Stonestreet Ave. N., 900 block, 2:05 a.m. Dec. 31. A 51-year-old man was arrested in connection with four counts of possession of concealed weapons (a sword with sheath, two knives and a wooden blunt object), and several traffic citations.

Takoma Park

These were among incidents recently reported by the Takoma Park Police Department. For more information, call 301-891-7102.

ROBBERIES

Hancock Ave., 7400 block, 3:36 a.m. Jan. 5. A male accosted a female pedestrian and snatched her purse.

Pine Ave., unit block, 11:30 p.m. Jan. 8. A male got out of a vehicle and robbed a male pedestrian of property at gunpoint. The robber fled in the vehicle.

Maple Ave., 7600 block, 6:30 p.m. Jan. 4. A male took property from a woman whose groceries he was helping carry.

Fourth Ave., 6400 block, 10:37 p.m. Jan. 8. A 29-year-old woman was arrested in connection with an open warrant for theft, disorderly conduct and resisting arrest.

May 27, 2007 Sunday
