Crime Report


SECTION: EXTRAS; Pg. SM11


LENGTH: 839 words


Calvert County 

These were among reports received recently by the Calvert County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. Anyone with information about these crimes should call the Criminal Investigation Division, 410-535-2800 or 301-855-1194, or the Crime Solvers line, 410-535-2880. You can also call the Prince Frederick Barrack of the state police at 410-535-1400.

Dunkirk Area

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

LYONS CREEK RD., May 13-14. A lawn mower was stolen from behind a residence. 

Huntingtown Area

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

WILSON RD., 7 a.m. to 8:07 p.m. May 8. A video game system, a leather coat and jewelry were stolen from a residence.

Prince Frederick Area

ASSAULTS

ROUTE 2/4, 5 p.m. May 19. A hospital security officer was hit in the face and head while trying to detain a patient. A woman, 24, was charged with second-degree assault.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

PRINCE FREDERICK, May 14. Two tires and two wheels were stolen from two vehicles at Calvert Body Works.

St. Leonard Area

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

HILLSIDE RD., May 12. A bicycle was stolen from a yard at a residence.

FLAG HARBOR BLVD., 1500 block, May 5-7. a fish finder was taken from a boat.

Charles County 

The following are among reports received recently by the Charles County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. For further information, call 301-932-2222 or 301-870-3232. Crime Solvers will pay a reward for information leading to an arrest and an indictment in connection with these and other crimes. Call the 24-hour hotline at 866-411-8477. Callers may remain anonymous. The Charles County Sheriff's Office Web site is: http://www.ccso.us. Included at the site are daily news releases, Crime Watch neighborhood statistics, community services, crime prevention programs and career opportunities.

Bryans Road Area

ASSAULTS

GREENVILLE DR., 5200 block, 10:51 p.m. May 15. A boy, 17, was cut with a kitchen knife during a domestic dispute. A man, 46, was charged with first- and second-degree assault and reckless endangerment.

Newburg Area

ASSAULTS

KINGS FARM RD., 12200 block, 6:27 p.m. May 15. Shots were fired toward two women, 26 and 29, and six children, ages 21 months to 8 years, playing in a yard. A man, 72, was charged with eight counts of first- and second-degree assault and reckless endangerment.

Waldorf Area

SEXUAL ASSAULTS 

RED WOLF PL., 1600 block, 11:50 p.m. May 19. A woman, 19, was sexually assaulted in a vehicle by a man with a gun. The assailant ordered two men who had been in the vehicle with the woman to leave and then assaulted her. The gunman also stole cash from one of the men.

ASSAULTS

LAKEWOOD DR., 10:48 a.m. May 21. During a domestic dispute, a woman was assaulted with a baseball bat. A window and mirror on her vehicle were broken. A man, 42, was charged with first-degree assault and malicious destruction of property.

ROBBERIES

KEEPSAKE PL., 20 block, 9:08 p.m. May 20. Two men with handguns stole cash from a boy, 16. They fled in a Nissan automobile.

PEMBROOK SQUARE, 11300 block, 1:05 p.m. May 16. Cash and several bottles of OxyContin and Percocet were stolen from the Prescription Shop by a man with a gun.

WOODVILLE RD., 14900 block, 1:32 p.m. May 15. A 47-year-old female employee at Moreland's Country Store was struck in the head with a handgun during a robbery.

DESTRUCTION OF PROPERTY

EUTAW FOREST DR., 4:31 a.m. May 20. A vehicle was driven into 11 mailboxes and a parked vehicle. A man, 20, was charged with malicious destruction of property more than $500, malicious destruction of property less than $500, driving while intoxicated, driving under the influence and driving without a license.

White Plains Area

VANDALISM

FOXHALL PL., 3600 block, 8:30 a.m. May 19. "KKK" was spray-painted on a shed at a residence.

St. Mary's County 

The following are among reports received recently by the St. Mary's County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. For further information, call 301-475-8008, or the Crime Solvers line, 301-475-3333. The Leonardtown Barrack of the Maryland State Police operates a 24-hour crime tip line on which people may anonymously report information about crimes and related matters at 301-475-2936.

Avenue Area

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

BOUND RD., 6:54 a.m. May 19. A vehicle's window was broken. Cash was stolen from a purse in the vehicle.

Budds Creek Area

VEHICLE THEFTS

BUDDS CREEK, 9:33 p.m. May 19. A vehicle was stolen from Maryland International Raceway. During an attempt to steal another vehicle, its steering column was damaged.

Leonardtown Area

VANDALISM

DUKE ST., May 21. Racist slurs were spray-painted at Leonardtown Elementary School.

Lexington Park Area

DESTRUCTION OF PROPERTY

THREE NOTCH RD., 19800 block, 4:11 p.m., May 21. The windows of a red Toyota minivan in a parking lot were smashed.

ASSAULTS

LEXINGTON PARK, May 18. A man was stabbed in the neck with a pair of haircutting scissors. A woman, 20, was charged with assault.

LEXINGTON PARK, May 23. A woman was choked by her live-in boyfriend. The man, 26, was charged with assault and resisting arrest.

The Washington Post


June 7, 2007 Thursday

Crime Report


SECTION: EXTRAS; Pg. GZ23


LENGTH: 1912 words


Montgomery County 

These were among incidents recorded by the Montgomery County Police Department's Media Services Division, which may not have received reports from all six stations for today's Extra. For more information, call 240-773-5030.

REWARDS FOR INFORMATION

Crime Solvers of Montgomery County Inc., a nonprofit community organization, will pay up to $1,000 for information leading to an arrest and indictment in connection with these and any other felony crimes. Call the 24-hour hotline at 800-673-2777. Callers may remain anonymous.

District 1 Rockville Station Telephone: 240-773-6070

SEXUAL ASSAULTS 

ROCKVILLE AREA, 3 p.m. May 15. A man reportedly raped a 20-year-old woman at her home when she refused his advances. An adult male acquaintance of the woman has been identified as a suspect.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

HALLER PL., 4600 block, 8:30 p.m. May 10 to 9:30 a.m. May 11. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force. 

JOSHUA TREE RD., 100 block, 6 to 9 p.m. May 18. Property was stolen from a residence.

TRAVILLE GATEWAY DR., 9700 block, 2 a.m. May 19. Property was stolen from a dry cleaning store entered by force.

District 2 Bethesda Station Telephone: 301-652-9200

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

KERRY RD., 8100 block, 1:30 a.m. May 16. A residence was entered by force and property was damaged.

RIVER RD., 5100 block, 11 a.m. May 15 to 10 a.m. May 16. A construction business was entered by force and property was damaged.

District 3 Silver Spring Station Telephone: 301-565-7740

SEXUAL ASSAULTS 

DECEMBER WAY AREA, 3 a.m. May 15. A 20-year-old woman went with a female acquaintance to a man's home. The male homeowner reportedly raped her when the woman went to sleep. The man's identity is not known and an investigation was continuing.

ROBBERIES

ATHERTON ROAD AND ILFORD STREET, 2:30 a.m. May 13. A man tripped an adult male pedestrian, 39, and apparently placed a knife to the pedestrian's chest. The assailant and another man took cash, a watch and a cellphone and ran toward Connecticut Avenue.

BLACKBURN ROAD AREA, 6:15 p.m. May 17. Three men at a park chased a 14-year-old boy they were accompanying, forced him to the ground and punched him in the face. The men shot the boy with a BB gun, slashed him with a knife and dragged him to a creek, where the men put his head under water for a second. Afterward, the men took the boy's jeans and threw rocks at him. The boy was taken to a hospital for treatment of injuries. Police said they think the men are members of a gang.

GEORGIA AVENUE AND HATHAWAY DRIVE, 3 p.m. May 3. Two men in a van pulled over to the side of the road and drew knives on a 19-year-old pedestrian. They demanded cash and took the pedestrian's wallet and cellphone. The robbers got back into the vehicle, a small, light brown van, and drove south on Georgia Avenue.

GILMORE ROAD AND KERWIN ROAD, 4:20 p.m. May 14. Two females and two males followed a 19-year-old woman who had gotten off a bus at the above location. One of the females struck the woman with a stick three times on the back of the head. A struggle ensued and the other female grabbed the woman's backpack and cellphone. The first assailant snatched the woman's purse and fled. The woman chased the robbers and got her purse back.

GRAND PRE ROAD AREA, 9:20 p.m. May 9. A man robbed a taxi driver of company cash and a wallet after the driver brought him from the Glenmont Metro station to the above location. After receiving the cash, the robber fled in an unknown direction.

HAMPSHIRE WEST COURT AREA, 2:30 p.m. May 10. Two men forced their way into the apartment of a 19-year-old woman who was entering her home holding her 2-year-old son and 4-month-old daughter. One of the men held a knife to the boy's head and told the mother not to make any noise. The assailants tied up the woman with duct tape, ransacked the apartment and took cash and jewelry. They fled in an unknown direction.

NEW HAMPSHIRE AVE., 15500 block, 8:50 p.m. May 8. A male youth and two male acquaintances in a wine-and-beer store unsuccessfully attempted to buy beer, left the store, then returned 30 minutes later, jumped over a counter, assaulted a clerk, and took cash. A 15-year-old male was arrested and charged with robbery of a business, theft over $500, theft under $500, and second-degree assault in connection with the incident.

PINEY BRANCH ROAD AREA, 8 p.m. May 2. Three men accosted a man in an alley behind a library, forced him to the ground and took his wallet. One of the men carried a baseball bat. The men then fled on foot.

PINEY BRANCH RD., 8100 block, 4:35 p.m. May 14. A man in a paint store demanded to see a manager, pulled out a gun, pushed the manager and demanded property. The manager realized the robber's gun was a toy and pushed back. The robber fled the store and got into a vehicle driven by another male.

PINEY BRANCH RD., 9300 block, 7:40 p.m. May 3. A man struggled with a 32-year-old female pedestrian and took her purse. A male passerby tried to help the woman, but the robber pulled out a knife, forced him to the ground and took his wallet. The robber then fled and a white vehicle that had been waiting picked him up.

VEIRS MILL AND GRIDLEY ROADS, 4 p.m. May 3. Two men in a wooded area accosted a 25-year-old man and ordered him to empty his pockets. When the man refused, one of the assailants pulled out a knife. The other assailant threw a glass bottle at the man. Cash and papers were taken. Two men were later arrested.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

ANGLETON TERR., 14200 block, 7 to 11:50 p.m. May 19. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

COLESVILLE RD., 8700 block, 11 a.m. May 7 to 11 a.m. May 14. Property was stolen from a residence.

FENTON ST., 8300 block, 11:29 p.m. May 17. Property was damaged at a gas station entered by force.

FENTON ST., 7700 block, noon April 15 to 10 a.m. May 16. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

HAYWOOD DR., 10400 block, 3:20 to 4:22 p.m. May 17. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

HERRINGTON MANOR DR., 12300 block, 3 p.m. May 2 to 5:50 p.m. May 16. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

KINSMAN VIEW CIR., 1 to 100 block, noon May 7 to 7:28 p.m. May 20. Property was damaged at a residence entered by force.

WAYNE AVE E., 1 to 100 block, 1:15 to 3:45 p.m. May 18. Property was damaged at a residence entered by force.

District 4 Wheaton Station Telephone: 240-773-5500

ROBBERIES

VEIRS MILL RD., 11100 block, 6 p.m. May 11. Four people, two of them male youths, in a coffee shop attacked two brothers, ages 12 and 16, and an acquaintance of the brothers. Property was stolen from both brothers. Two people have been identified as suspects, and an investigation was continuing.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

BRIGGS RD., 1800 block, 2 to 5:40 p.m. May 8. A residence was entered by force. Nothing was reported missing.

GEORGIA AVE., 10800 block, 8:25 to 8:50 a.m. May 9. A residence was entered by force. Nothing was reported missing.

GEORGIA AVE., 11700 block, 7 p.m. May 13 to 5:20 a.m. May 14. Property was stolen from a library.

GEORGIA AVE., 14200 block, 7:30 a.m. to 5 p.m. May 10. Property was stolen from a residence.

GREENERY LANE, 2300 block, 2 to 10:30 a.m. May 11. A residence was entered by force. Nothing was reported missing.

ISBELL ST., 4000 block, 9:30 a.m. to 1 p.m. May 13. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

MAGELLAN AVE., 13300 block, 9:30 a.m. May 11 to 1:34 p.m. May 14. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

PEAR TREE CT., 3500 block, 9 a.m. to 12:15 p.m. May 11. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

SISSON ST., 600 block, 3:10 to 3:13 p.m. May 11. A residence was entered by force. Nothing was reported missing.

SMITH VILLAGE RD., 1300 block, midnight to 7 p.m. May 10. A residence was entered by force. Nothing was reported missing.

VALLEYWOOD DR., 12500 block, midnight April 27 to 10:30 a.m. May 12. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

WHISPERING PINES DR., 3100 block, 7:30 a.m. to 8 p.m. May 15. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

WHISPERING PINES DR., 3200 block, noon May 6 to 8 p.m. May 10. A residence was entered by force. Nothing was reported missing.

District 5 Germantown Station Telephone: 301-840-2650

SEXUAL ASSAULTS 

GERMANTOWN AREA, 8 a.m. May 13. A man at a hotel attempted to rape a woman. An acquaintance of the woman, a Clarksburg man, 21, was arrested and charged with first-degree rape and first- and second-degree assault.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

ASHMEADE RD., 18400 block, 4:15 to 11 p.m. May 13. Property was stolen from a residence.

BRINK RD., 11900 block, 6 p.m. May 12 to 2:30 p.m. May 15. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

FESTIVAL DR., 19000 block, 10 a.m. to 4 p.m. May 20. Property was stolen from a residence.

KILMARNOK WAY, 13300 block, 12:01 a.m. May 13 to noon May 14. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

District 6 Gaithersburg Station Telephone: 240-773-5700

SEXUAL ASSAULTS 

KEY WEST AVE., 9800 block, 5 p.m. May 16. A man grabbed a woman as she was leaving a medical facility, made sexual remarks to her and tried to force her to come with him. The woman was able to escape in her car.

Rockville

ADAMS ST. S., 100 block, May 18. Cash was stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked rear window.

Crime Report


SECTION: EXTRAS; Pg. PW26


LENGTH: 925 words


Prince William

The following incidents were reported by Prince William County police. For information, call 703-792-7245.

Dale City area

ROBBERIES

DALE BLVD., 4300 block, 1:50 a.m. March 2. Three men took cases of beer from a store at gunpoint.

WESTWAY LANE, 14300 block, 2:10 p.m. Feb. 26. A male demanded a purse from a woman, who complied. He fled with the purse and documents. 

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

BATH CT., 3500 block, 7 a.m. to 8:05 p.m. March 4. Jewelry was stolen from a residence entered by breaking a kitchen window.

Dumfries area

VANDALISM

NIMES CT. AND STOCKHOLM WAY, 10:25 p.m. Feb. 28. A man jumped on the hood of a vehicle and broke a window.

TOMS RIVER LOOP, 16800 block, 1:30 a.m. March 4. The windshield, a window and headlights of a vehicle were broken. The vehicle's trunk was scratched. A 38-year-old Dumfries man was arrested.

Lake Ridge area

ROBBERIES

OAKWOOD DR. AND DULCINEA PL., 9:05 p.m. Feb. 26. A male got out of a vehicle, approached a male motorist in the vehicle behind his and threatened the motorist with a gun. He took a cellphone and fled.

Manassas area

SEXUAL ASSAULTS 

KING GEORGE DR., 9400 block, 8:30 p.m. March 3. A man allegedly abducted a female acquaintance and raped her. A 39-year-old Manassas man was arrested.

PARKINGTON CT., 10100 block, March 5. A man allegedly exposed himself to a female juvenile and offered her money in exchange for sexual favors. A 38-year-old Manassas man was arrested.

ASSAULTS

LEE AVE., 9300 block, 4:40 p.m. March 5. During a fight at a jail, a male inmate allegedly assaulted another male inmate, who was taken to a hospital. A 21-year-old Woodbridge man was charged with aggravated malicious wounding.

LELAND RD., 8400 block, 6:30 a.m. March 3. During an argument, a woman allegedly assaulted a female relative, who was treated for injuries. An 18-year-old Manassas woman was arrested.

SIGNAL STATION DR., 9300 block, 11 p.m. March 1. Someone fired bullets at a residence and two vehicles, breaking windows. No one injuries were reported.

WILLOUGHBY LANE, 7400 block, 9 p.m. March 2. During an argument, a man allegedly assaulted and bit another man. Both men were treated for injuries. A 29-year-old Manassas man was arrested.

INDECENT EXPOSURE

HOADLY RD., 6300 block, 3:15 p.m. March 3. A man in a parking lot allegedly exposed himself to a woman. A 32-year-old Manassas man was arrested.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

BUTTERFIELD ST., 10300 block, noon to 11 p.m. March 3. A laptop computer, a digital camera, a video camera, an MP3 player, a video game system, DVDs and bottles of liquor were stolen from a residence.

SUDLEY RD., 8200 block, 2:37 a.m. March 6. Cash, a laptop computer and a digital camera were stolen from a business entered by forcing open a door. A window was broken. An attempt was made to enter another business.

VANDALISM

BULLOCH DR., 11200 block, 9:30 p.m. to midnight March 5. Tires of eight vehicles were punctured.

Woodbridge area

ASSAULTS

PAXTON ST., 2400 block, 2:30 p.m. Feb. 22. A man allegedly threatened to burn a relative's residence. A 30-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

QUATE LANE, 13500 block, 11 p.m. March 4. During an argument, a man allegedly threatened to burn a relative's residence. A 40-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

ROBBERIES

DANIEL STUART SQ., 2000 block, 7:16 p.m. March 3. A man opened a door of a vehicle parked in a shopping center lot and attempted to pull a female occupant out. The woman resisted and honked the horn. The robber implied he had a weapon and fled with a purse, an MP3 player and documents.

DILLINGHAM SQ., 12400 block, 12:22 a.m. March 4. Two men ordered a male motorist to get out of his vehicle and demanded money. One of the men threatened the motorist with a gun, and the other punched him in the face. The two fled in a gold vehicle.

TROWBRIDGE CT., 13200 block, 9 p.m. Feb. 26. Two males robbed a store of cash.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

CLEEVE HILL CT., 2800 block, 3 to 8:42 p.m. March 3. Two TVs were stolen from a residence entered by forcing open a kitchen window.

CRIDERCREST PL., 13600 block, 5:30 p.m. Feb. 25 to 8 a.m. Feb. 26. Two computers were stolen from an apartment building leasing office.

TABOR CT., 2500 block, 4:30 to 9:30 p.m. Feb. 26. Someone attempted to enter a residence by throwing a rock through a basement window.

TORRENCE PL., 4500 block, 8:45 a.m. to 5 p.m. March 2. Cash, a video game system and jewelry were stolen from a residence entered by forcing open a basement door.

VANDALISM

SPRIGGS RD., 14000 block, 9:51 p.m. March 2. A vehicle was allegedly driven on a school soccer field, damaging the field. A 19-year-old Woodbridge man, a 20-year-old Mason Neck man and a 20-year-old Spencerville, Ohio, man were arrested.

Manassas

The following incident was reported by Manassas police. For information, call 703-257-8000.

ROBBERIES

DIGGES RD., 8400 block, 6 p.m. March 5. A man robbed a bank of cash.

Manassas Park

The following incidents were reported by Manassas Park police. For information, call 703-361-1136.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

ALPINE ST., 100 block, 4:10 p.m. March 5. A man allegedly entered a residence without permission. A 25-year-old Manassas Park man was arrested.

MANASSAS DR., 100 block, 10:57 a.m. Feb. 27 to 11:30 a.m. March 1. A snowblower was stolen from a porch.

VANDALISM

KIRBY ST., 200 block, 2:43 p.m. March 3. Gang-related graffiti were spray-painted on a fence.

MOSEBY CT., 300 block, March 4. Someone broke a basement window of a vacant residence.

POLK DR., 100 block, 7:20 p.m. March 5. Tires of a vehicle were flattened, and a side of the vehicle was scratched.

-- Compiled by Sarah Lane

Montgomery County crime report


SECTION: METRO; Pg. T28


LENGTH: 4054 words


Montgomery County

The following information, provided by the Montgomery County Police Department, shows only initial calls for service received by the 911 center. Many of these reported incidents could turn out to be classified under a different crime category or determined to be unfounded. And some calls for service could be resolved with no further action needed.

REWARDS FOR INFORMATION

Crime Solvers of Montgomery County, a nonprofit organization, pays up to $1,000 for information leading to an arrest and indictment in connection with felonies. Call the 24-hour hotline at 800-673-2777. Callers may remain anonymous.

May 7, 2015 Thursday 11:48 PM EST 


Montgomery County crime report


SECTION: Metro; Pg. T28


LENGTH: 3991 words


Montgomery County

The following information, provided by the Montgomery County Police Department, shows only initial calls for service received by the 911 center. Many of these reported incidents could turn out to be classified under a different crime category or determined to be unfounded. And some calls for service could be resolved with no further action needed.

REWARDS FOR INFORMATION

Crime Solvers of Montgomery County, a nonprofit organization, pays up to $1,000 for information leading to an arrest and indictment in connection with felonies. Call the 24-hour hotline at 800-673-2777. Callers may remain anonymous.

Washingtonpost.com


June 9, 2011 Thursday 8:11 PM EST 


Southern Maryland crime reportSouthern Maryland crime report


SECTION: Metro; Pg. T20


LENGTH: 897 words


Calvert County

These were among reports received by the Calvert County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. Anyone with information about these crimes should call the Criminal Investigation Division, 410-535-2800 or 301-855-1194, or the Crime Solvers line, 410-535-2880. You can also call the Prince Frederick Barrack of the state police at 410-535-1400.

HUNTINGTOWN AREA VANDALISM  

Huntingtown Rd., May 26 to May 27. A hayfield was damaged by a vehicle.

LUSBY AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Deer Dr., May 8 to May 27. An attempt was made to break into a residence. Nothing was reported missing.

Monterey Rd., April 23 to May 28. A red-and-orange kayak and an orange kayak were stolen from a residence.

NORTH BEACH AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Atlantic Ave., 9:15 p.m., May 27. A blue-and-white bicycle was stolen from a porch at a residence.

OWINGS AREA VANDALISM

Flint Hill Rd. N., May 28. A truck was damaged while parked at a residence.

PRINCE FREDERICK AREA ASSAULTS

PATUXENT BEACH DR., 5:10 a.m. May 29. A man at a residence attacked a woman, 56, and a police officer responding to the incident. A man, 29, was arrested. Charges included second-degree assault, resisting arrest, and illegal drug possession.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Hallowing Point Rd., 2:53 p.m., May 26. A sign advertising seafood sales was stolen from in front of a residence.

SOLOMONS AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Holiday Dr., 8:20 p.m., May 27. A radar detection device was stolen from an unlocked vehicle.

WHITE SANDS AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

White Sands, 8:08 a.m., May 28. A satellite radio receiver and antenna were stolen from an unlocked vehicle.

Charles County

These were among reports received by the Charles County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. For information, call 301-932-2222 or 301-870-3232. Crime Solvers will pay a reward for information leading to an arrest and an indictment in connection with these and other crimes. Call the 24-hour hotline at 866-411-8477. Callers may remain anonymous. The Charles County Sheriff's Office Web site is www.ccso.us. Included at the site are daily news releases, Crime Watch neighborhood statistics, community services, crime prevention programs and career opportunities.

LA PLATA AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Valley Rd., 6900 block, 11 p.m., May 26 to 3 a.m., May 27. A lawn tractor was stolen from a shed.

INDIAN HEAD AREA ASSAULTS

Raymond Ave., 11:30 p.m., May 29. A woman stabbed a man in the leg. A woman, 36, was charged with first-degree assault.

WALDORF AREA ASSAULTS

Light Arms Pl., 3800 block, 11:45 p.m., May 30. During her arrest for disorderly conduct, a woman tried to remove a gun from an officer's holster and struck the officer in the chest with her elbow. A woman, 63, was charged with attempt to disarm a police officer, assault and disorderly conduct.

ROBBERIES

Mall Cir., 8:23 p.m., May 24. A man robbed a jewelry store of two trays of diamonds at gunpoint.

Reeves Pl., 4300 block, 5:50 p.m., May 26. A man armed with a weapon took a backpack from a male teenager walking on a foot path. Charges of strong-arm robbery are pending against a 26-year-old man.

St. Mary's County

These were among reports received by the St. Mary's County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. For information, call 301-475-8008, or the Crime Solvers line, 301-475-3333. The Leonardtown Barrack of the Maryland State Police operates a 24-hour tip line on which people may anonymously report information at 301-475-2936.

CALLAWAY AREA ASSAULTS

Route 249 and Happyland Rd., May 29. During an argument, a man punched a person in the head. A man, 37, was charged with second-degree assault.

CLEMENTS AREA VANDALISM

Banerjee Lane, May 26. Metal siding was damaged at a barn. A man, 23, was arrested at the scene and charged with destruction of property.

LEONARDTOWN AREA SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Leonardtown, May 26. A man sexually assaulted a motorist in his vehicle. The victim is described as physically disabled. A man, 61, was charged with sexual abuse of a vulnerable adult.

LEXINGTON PARK AREA ASSAULTS

Saratoga Dr., May 29. A woman struck an acquaintance with an ashtray and inflicted scratch wounds. A woman, 49, was charged with second-degree assault.

PINEY POINT AREA ASSAULTS

PINEY POINT, 2:40 a.m., May 29. A man at a campground attacked a camp employee and two guests. A man, 24, was arrested. Charges included assault, failure to obey a lawful order of a police officer, and disorderly intoxication and conduct.

ST. INIGOES AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

South Snow Hill Manor Rd., 10:59 a.m., May 28. A 54-year-old man found sleeping at a residence was arrested at the scene and charged with burglary. Food had been consumed and items in the home had been damaged.

- Compiled by Bonnie Smith

405 of 507 DOCUMENTS




The Washington Post


November 20, 2005 Sunday  
Final Edition


Crime Report


SECTION: Southern Maryland Extra; T13


LENGTH: 851 words


The following are among reports received recently by the Calvert County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. Anyone with information about these crimes should call the Criminal Investigation Division, 410-535-2800 or 301-855-1194, or the Crime Solvers line, 410-535-2880. You can also call the Prince Frederick Barrack of the state police at 410-535-1400.

KIM'S WAY, 6:30 p.m. Nov. 11 to 8 a.m. Nov. 14. An oven, a refrigerator and a stove top were stolen from a house under construction.  

BOWIE CT., 1 to 8 p.m. Nov. 8. Items were stolen from a residence.

PINE BLVD., 4 to 4:09 p.m. Nov. 8. A door of a residence was damaged.

ROUTE 2/4, 3:10 to 3:20 p.m. Nov. 9. A door at a Taco Bell restaurant was damaged.

KEITH LANE, Oct. 20. Five people paid deposits to a company called Dexperts for home improvements that were never done. Two men, ages 48 and 52, and the owner and a salesman for the company, were charged with five counts of theft over $500, one count of theft scheme and four counts of failure to perform a contract.

CENTRAL SQUARE DR., Nov. 9. Cash was stolen from two vending machines at a carwash.

HOSPITAL RD., 4:30 p.m. Nov. 10 to 9 a.m. Nov. 11. Property was stolen from Calvert Physical Therapy and Sports Medicine.

The following are among reports received recently by the Charles County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. For further information, call 301-932-2222 or 301-870-3232. Crime Solvers will pay a reward for information leading to an arrest and an indictment in connection with these and other crimes. Call the 24-hour hotline at 800-673-2777. Callers may remain anonymous. The Charles County Sheriff's Office Web site is: www.ccso.us. Included at the site are daily news releases, Crime Watch neighborhood statistics, community services, crime prevention programs and career opportunities.

WOODBRIDGE CT., 15100 block, 12:15 p.m. Nov. 16. Property was stolen from a residence. Two men, both 18, were charged with first-degree burglary.

OAKSIDE LANE, 9:40 p.m. Nov. 11. A man, 23, was shot outside a residence. He was pronounced dead at Fort Washington Hospital.

NORTHWOOD, 8:30 p.m. Oct. 26. A girl, 14, reported that she was sexually assaulted. Three male youths -- ages 15, 16 and 17 -- were charged with first-degree rape, first-degree assault, first-degree burglary and other sex offenses.

IDLEWOOD PARK RD., 12500 block, 6 p.m. Nov. 6. A woman, 33, and a girl, 12, were assaulted at a residence when an attempt was made to run them over with a vehicle. Rocks were thrown at the woman, and either the woman or the girl was threatened with a knife. The woman suffered minor injuries, and a window and a fence at the residence were damaged. A man, 28, was charged with two counts of first- and second-degree assault and malicious destruction of property.

CRAIN HWY., 2200 block, 5:40 a.m. Oct. 28. Alcohol and cigarettes were stolen from Waldorf Liquors.

KNOLEWATER CT., 3100 block, 1:19 p.m. Nov. 15. A residence was entered. When police arrived, the intruder ran to the second-story, jumped out a window and fled into woods.

LYLES PL., 10000 block, 10:25 p.m. Nov. 10. A mobile home was set on fire. A man, 39, was charged with first-degree arson.

JAMBEAU PL., 4200 block, 8 a.m. Nov. 1 to 11 p.m. Nov. 9. Video games and equipment and DVDs were stolen from a residence.

The following are among reports received recently by the St. Mary's County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. For further information, call 301-475-8008, or the Crime Solvers line, 301-475-3333. The Leonardtown Barrack of the Maryland State Police operates a 24-hour crime tip line on which people may anonymously report information about crimes and related matters at 301-475-2936.

ESSEX DR., 9 p.m. Nov. 3. A woman was hit in the face with a cell phone at a residence, her head was pushed into a wall and her vehicle was stolen. A man was charged with second-degree assault.

THREE NOTCH RD., 9:57 a.m. Oct. 28. A teacher at Spring Ridge Middle School alleges being assaulted by a student. After being denied recess, the student allegedly knocked over desks and chairs. When the teacher tried to control the student, he allegedly kicked and pushed the teacher. A boy, 12, was charged with second-degree assault, disorderly conduct and disturbing school activities.

VALLEY ESTATES DR., 7:50 p.m. Nov. 10. A man reported being assaulted at a residence. He said he was hit several times in the face and his shirt ripped. A woman was charged with assault.

LEXINGTON PARK, 10:52 a.m. Nov. 8. The license validation sticker on a bus at United Pentecostal Church was stolen.

SUE DR., 8:45 a.m. Oct. 27. A generator was stolen from a residence under construction.

THREE NOTCH RD., 2:45 a.m. Nov. 1. White crosses, placed in the ground at Immaculate Heart of Mary Catholic Church for an anti-abortion campaign, were pulled up and laid on the ground.

QUEEN TREE RD., 10:11 a.m. Oct. 31. Three chain saws and a power washer were stolen from a shed at a residence.

TRAPP RD., Nov. 12. A portable DVD player was stolen from a residence.

-- Compiled by BONNIE SMITH

Montgomery County crime report


SECTION: METRO; Pg. T26


LENGTH: 1905 words


Montgomery County crime reportAmong incidents reported by police in Montgomery County, Rockville and Takoma Park.

Montgomery County

These were among incidents recently received by the Montgomery County Police Department. For more information, call 240-773-5030.

REWARDS FOR INFORMATION

Crime Solvers of Montgomery County, Inc., a nonprofit community organization, pays up to $1,000 for information leading to an arrest and indictment in connection with these and any other felony crimes. Call the 24-hour hotline at 800-673-2777. Callers may remain anonymous.

DISTRICT 1ROCKVILLE STATIONTELEPHONE: 240-773-6070

SEXUAL ASSAULT

Parklawn Dr., 12300 block, 11:45 p.m. Aug. 6 to 1:30 a.m. Aug. 7. A person sexually assaulted an acquaintance.

PEEPING TOM INCIDENT

Elsdale Ct., 13100 block, 9:30 p.m. Aug. 6. A male was seen peeking into a window at a residence.  

ASSAULTS

Crawford Dr., 5700 block, 11:09 p.m. Aug. 13. Five men assaulted several people.

ROBBERIES

Prince William County crime report Prince William County crime report


BYLINE: Compiled by Sarah Lane


SECTION: Metro; Pg. T24


LENGTH: 895 words


Prince William

These were among incidents reported by Prince William County police. For information, call 703-792-7245.

CATHARPIN AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Pin Oak Dr., 3400 block, 7 a.m. May 10 to 4 p.m. May 17. Cash was stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked door.

DUMFRIES AREA SEXUAL ASSAULTS  

Wilson St., 17400 block, May 18. A man raped a female acquaintance. A 22-year-old Dumfries man was arrested.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Point Pleasant Pl., 16900 block, 7:18 a.m. May 15. A firearm and a cellphone were stolen from a residence entered by breaking a front window.

Sligo Loop, 17300 block, 10:50 a.m. to 1 p.m. May 14. Two TVs, two computer tablets, jewelry and shoes were stolen from a residence entered by forcing a rear door.

Victoria Falls Dr., 17500 block, 11 to 11:30 a.m. May 15. Two male juveniles entered a residence by breaking a rear door and took food.

VANDALISM

Northgate and Edgewood Drives, 2:30 p.m. May 15 to 7:30 a.m. May 16. A window of a county vehicle was broken.

GAINESVILLE AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Logmill Rd., 4500 block, 7:30 p.m. May 15 to 10:20 a.m. May 16. Tools were stolen from a residence entered through a garage window.

MANASSAS AREA ROBBERIES

Sudley Rd., 8400 block, 11 a.m. May 18. A gunman robbed a bank of cash.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Provincial Dr., 10600 block, 8:50 to 11:15 a.m. May 13. Two laptop computers, a TV, two video game systems and two cameras were stolen from a residence.

TRIANGLE AREA ASSAULTS

Potomac Highlands Cir., 4100 block, 6:26 a.m. May 21. During an argument, a man assaulted a female acquaintance and refused to let her leave the residence. A 26-year-old Triangle man was arrested.

WEAPONS

Triangle St., 18500 block, 1:42 a.m. May 20. Several gunshots were heard.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Cardinal Heights Dr., 19200 block, 7 a.m. to 6 p.m. May 14. A residence was entered by forcing a rear door.

Sharon Rd., 18300 block, 9 a.m. to 6:33 p.m. May 14. A firearm and other property were stolen from a residence entered by forcing a rear door.

WOODBRIDGE AREA ASSAULTS

Featherstone Rd. and Sycamore St., 5:31 a.m. May 15. A group of males assaulted a man and searched his pockets. The man was treated for injuries.

ROBBERIES

Marine Way, 13100 block, 2 a.m. May 19. After a woman approached a male sitting in a vehicle, another man entered through the passenger side and demanded money at gunpoint. The motorist ran to a business and called police. The woman and man fled empty-handed.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Gemstone Dr., 14400 block, midnight May 14 to 3 p.m. May 15. Two air-conditioning units were stolen from a vacant apartment building entered through an unlocked window.

Lamar Rd., 14600 block, 7:42 to 8:30 p.m. May 19. A school was entered through an unlocked door. The exterior of the building was damaged.

Moon Way, 3500 block, 10 to 10:45 p.m. May 20. A purse was stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked rear door.

Potomac Mills Cir., 2700 block, 5:16 p.m. May 17. A male juvenile in a parking lot attempted to enter several vehicles. He hit two security guards in the face and spit at a police officer. A 15-year-old Woodbridge youth was arrested.

Wakewater Way, 2800 block, 3 p.m. Feb. 12 to 4:30 p.m. May 17. An attempt was made to enter a residence.

Manassas

These were among the incidents reported by Manassas police. For more information, call 703-257-8000.

ASSAULTS

Bruton Parish Ct., 8600 block, 3:30 p.m. May 16. A female juvenile assaulted another female juvenile, who was treated for injuries.

INDECENT EXPOSURE

Grist Mill Court and Kinsley Mill Park, 9:05 to 9:15 a.m. April 30; Cather Avenue, 5:30 a.m. May 9, 5:30 a.m. May 14 and 6:15 a.m. May 17. A naked man was seen in the area.

Calypso Dr., 10200 block, 11:14 p.m. May 17. A man in a tree was looking at a resident through a bedroom window of a residence. A man was arrested.

VANDALISM

Prince William County crime report Prince William County crime report


SECTION: Metro; Pg. T18


LENGTH: 1348 words


Prince William County

These were among incidents reported recently by Prince William County police. For information, call 703-792-7245.

BRISTOW AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Merrimont Trace Cir., 9400 block, 5:30 p.m. June 10 to 7 a.m. June 11. An oven range and a dishwasher were stolen from a residence under construction.

DUMFRIES AREA ROBBERIES

Milroy Dr., 17900 block, 6:36 a.m. June 18. A man holding a brick demanded money from a male who had left his residence. When the resident said he had no money, the man pulled out a gun and robbed him of a wallet. 

Old Triangle Rd. and Kilpatrick Pl., 12:33 a.m. June 14. A man approached a male motorist leaving a vehicle and robbed him of a wallet at knifepoint.

Old Triangle Rd. and McClellan Ct., 4:39 a.m. June 17. A gunman and a tire iron demanded money from a male resident. When the resident said he had no money, the man hit him with the tire iron and robbed him of a wallet and a cellphone. The resident was treated for injuries.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Holleyside Dr., 15000 block, 8 a.m. June 7 to 5 p.m. June 11. Jewelry was stolen from a residence entered by kicking a basement door.

GAINESVILLE AREA ASSAULTS

Buckland Mill Rd., 8100 block, 3:15 a.m. June 15. During an argument, a man at a residence stabbed a male acquaintance with a knife, then assaulted a female occupant.

TRIANGLE AREA PEEPING TOM INCIDENTS

Melrose Ave., 3500 block, 4:29 a.m. June 18. A man looked into a bathroom window of a residence. He fled when a female resident saw him and screamed.

WOODBRIDGE AREA SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Frances Dr., June 11. A man sexually assaulted a male juvenile acquaintance in February. A 19-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

Gatlin Ct., 11:44 a.m. June 15. A man sexually assaulted a female juvenile relative during the summer of 2008. A 46-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

Pineneedle Ct., 5:36 a.m. June 15. A man sexually assaulted a male juvenile relative. An 18-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

Potomac Vista Dr., 10:56 p.m. June 17. A man asked two male juvenile acquaintances to expose themselves to him. A 73-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

ASSAULTS

Dale Blvd., 4300 block, 12:59 a.m. June 15. During an argument, a man stabbed a male acquaintance in the back. The acquaintance was treated for injuries. A 20-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

Jefferson Davis Hwy., 13900 block, 1:34 p.m. June 16. A man grabbed a male juvenile relative by the arm. The 2-month-old boy was treated for a broken arm. A 29-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

Jefferson Davis Hwy., 14500 block, 2:24 a.m. June 16. During an argument, a man cut another man on the abdomen with a knife. A second man cut two tires of the injured man's vehicle. The injured man was taken to a hospital.

Lindendale Rd. and Dale Blvd., 4 p.m. June 11. During an argument in a school bus, a female bus driver pushed a male student. A 54-year-old Woodbridge woman was arrested.

Marina Way, 13100 block, 2:30 a.m. June 16. After a fight ended, someone hit a man in the face. The man was treated for injuries.

Shotwell Ct., 4500 block, 4:59 p.m. June 16. A man stabbed a male relative in the torso and hit him on the head with a hammer. The relative was taken to a hospital.

CHILD-CARE INCIDENTS

Dara Dr., 12600 block, 1:58 p.m. June 16. Two men locked three female juvenile relatives inside a vehicle. The men left the children in the vehicle for about 10 minutes while they were inside a residence. Two Woodbridge men, 22 and 23, were arrested.

WEAPONS

Carson Dr., 3500 block, 2:13 a.m. June 15. Several gunshots were heard.

Carter Lane and Knowles St., 10:59 p.m. June 16. A man fired a weapon. A 22-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

Opitz Blvd. and Telegraph Rd., 6 p.m. June 15. A male motorist pointed a handgun at a man and a woman in another vehicle after they made facial gestures at him.

INDECENT EXPOSURE

Darbydale Ave., 14700 block, A man exposed himself to a woman.

Jefferson Davis Hwy., 13900 block, 6:15 a.m. June 14. A man exposed himself in front of a woman. A 24-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Bridge View Dr., 2400 block, 5 p.m. June 15 to 9 a.m. June 18. A laptop computer and two cameras were stolen from a construction trailer entered by forcing a door.

Dodson Dr., 14700 block, 4:15 p.m. June 16 to 10:30 a.m. June 17. Someone entered a residence by prying a rear door. Nothing was reported stolen.

Kenmar Dr., 13000 block, 10 a.m. to 1 p.m. June 13. Someone attempted to enter a residence by removing a screen from a rear window.

Kenslow Ct., 13700 block, 2:15 p.m. June 13. Someone attempted to enter a residence by breaking a rear window.

Kentland Dr., 4300 block, 9 a.m. to 2:15 p.m. June 13. Two mountain bikes were stolen from a rear shed entered by breaking a lock, and a residence was entered through an unlocked rear door.

Kentland Dr., 4400 block, 8 a.m. to 3 p.m. June 13. Two cameras, jewelry and a Kindle were stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked window.

Meadow Ct., 7800 block, 3 p.m. June 8 to 8 a.m. June 13. Someone entered a residence through a rear door. Nothing was reported stolen.

Randall Dr., 14200 block, 4:15 a.m. to 4 p.m. June 14. A safe containing cash and medicine was stolen from a residence.

Ripple Creek Ct., 12700 block, 10:30 a.m. June 14 to 3 p.m. June 17. Someone attempted to enter a residence through a front door.

Throwbridge Dr., 13200 block, midnight June 18. Cigarettes and other property were stolen from a business entered by breaking a side glass door.

Manassas

The following incidents were recently reported by Manassas police. For more information, call 703-257-8000.

ASSAULTS

Main St., 9400 block, 10:30 p.m. June 19. A man assaulted a woman, then pulled a phone from a wall to prevent her from calling police. A 47-year-old Manassas man was arrested.

Main St., 9400 block, 12:20 a.m. June 20. A man assaulted a female acquaintance, held a knife to her throat and threatened to kill her. A 49-year-old Manassas man was arrested.

Taney Rd., 9300 block, 4:35 p.m. June 19. Four males assaulted a male ice cream vendor. The vendor was treated for injuries.

ROBBERIES

Braxted Lane, 8500 block, 12:15 a.m. June 16. Three males demanded money from a pizza deliveryman at gunpoint. One of the males hit the deliveryman on the back of the head with an object. The deliveryman threw food at the three and fled. A 20-year-old Manassas man and a 16-year-old male were arrested.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Dumfries Rd., 10100 block, 6:20 p.m. June 18. Two females and a male dressed as a female took food from a grocery store.

Quarry Rd., 8300 block, midnight to 7 a.m. June 20. Thirty tractor-trailer tires were stolen from a business.

Manassas Park

The following incidents were recently reported by Manassas Park police. For more information, call 703-361-1136.

WEAPONS

Euclid Ave., 8200 block, 9:07 a.m. June 14. Two juveniles at a school fired bottle rockets. Two males, 14 and 15, were arrested and charged with possession of fireworks.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Cabbel Dr., 200 block, 12:26 a.m. June 17. A license plate was stolen from a vehicle.

Connor Dr. and Sandstone Way, June 13 to June 16. License plates were stolen from a vehicle.

Euclid Ave., 8400 block, 7:38 p.m. June 12. A male juvenile in a convenience store put beer in his waistband and fled.

Wilcoxen and Carondelet drives, 2:07 p.m. June 11. A license plate decal was stolen from a vehicle.

VANDALISM

Mathew Dr.,Nancy St. and East Carondelet Dr.,5:45 a.m. June 17. Five male juveniles and two female juveniles damaged several mailboxes, stop signs and signposts.

Fairfax County

The following incidents were recently reported by the Fairfax County Police Department. For more information, call 703-246-2253.

FAIR OAKS DISTRICT

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Pender Creek Cir., 12200 block. Cash was stolen from a residence.

Franklin Farm Rd., 13300 block. A lawnmower was stolen from a business.

Grand Commons Ave., 11800 block. Property was stolen from a vehicle.

Grand Junction Ct., 3800 block. A handgun was stolen from a residence.

Lee Jackson Memorial Hwy., 13900 block. A wallet, cash and sport drinks were stolen from a vehicle.  

Melanie Ct., 10800 block. A license plate was stolen from a vehicle.

Moore Rd., 13100 block. A welding machine was stolen from a residence.

Polo Dr., 12100 block. Tools were stolen from a vehicle.

Ruffin Dr. and Weatherington Lane, Tools were stolen from a vehicle.

Santa Clara Dr., 10800 block. A temporary license plate was stolen from a vehicle.

Sayre Rd., 3000 block. A briefcase was stolen from a residence.

Thunderbolt Pl., 14000 block. A radiator cover was stolen from a vehicle.

Wildmere Pl., 3200 block. A laptop computer was stolen from a vehicle.

Centerboro Dr., 2700 block. A 1992 Dodge Caravan was stolen.

Leamore Lane, 9900 block. A 2006 Acura was stolen.

The following incidents were recently reported by the Fairfax City Police Department. For more information, call 703-385-7809.

ASSAULTS

Prince William County crime report


SECTION: Metro; Pg. T20


LENGTH: 970 words


Prince William County

These were among incidents reported by Prince William County police. For information, call 703-792-7245.

DUMFRIES AREA ASSAULT

Chesapeake Dr., 3100 block, 10:52 a.m. Aug. 6. During an argument, a woman cut a male acquaintance with a knife. The man was treated for injuries. A Dumfries woman, 61, was arrested.

WEAPONS  

Fettler Park Dr., 3700 block, 5:30 p.m. Aug. 7 to 7 a.m. Aug. 11. Someone fired a weapon at a building. A bullet went through a second-floor window and lodged in an interior wall.

GAINESVILLE AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Lee Hwy., 14400 block, 8:07 p.m. Aug. 8. A business was entered. Several windows were broken, and several doors were damaged. A 38-year-old man was arrested.

Newbern Loop, 14300 block, 8 a.m. to 11 p.m. Aug. 8. Food was stolen from a residence.

MANASSAS AREA ROBBERY

Coverstone Dr., 10900 block, 8:58 p.m. Aug. 7. Two males entered a residence and demanded money from a male occupant, who refused. They assaulted the man and robbed him of a wallet. When police responded, a female juvenile hit an officer in the face. A 20-year-old man and a 17-year-old female, both of Herndon, and a 17-year-old male of Woodbridge were arrested.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Browns Lane, 8300 block, 11:30 p.m. Aug. 5 to 5 p.m. Aug. 6. A business was entered, and an interior door was damaged. Nothing was reported stolen.

General Longstreets Line, 3 to 6:30 a.m. Aug. 9. A GPS device, a branch trimmer, a leaf blower and two chain saws were stolen from a garage entered by using a door opener from a vehicle parked in a driveway.

Golden Leaf Cir., 11300 block, 10 a.m. to 12:20 p.m. Aug. 9. Documents were stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked window.

TRIANGLE AREA SEXUAL ASSAULT

White Oak Dr. area,1:30 a.m. Aug. 9. A man sexually assaulted a female juvenile acquaintance. The man then took a black 2006 Dodge Ram 1500 from the 17400 block of Isle Royal Terrace in Dumfries.

ROBBERY

Jurgensen Dr., 3600 block, 12:18 a.m. Aug. 10. Two gunmen demanded money from a man. They assaulted him and robbed him of a wallet, cellphone and keys.

WOODBRIDGE AREA SEXUAL ASSAULT

York Dr., 2200 block, 3:15 a.m. July 12. Through a car transportation service, a man picked up two women in Arlington and drove them to a destination. He got out of the vehicle and inappropriately touched one woman. An Annandale man, 58, was arrested.

ASSAULTS

Berkshire Dr., 14300 block, 6:48 p.m. Aug. 5. During an argument, a woman with a knife chased a male juvenile acquaintance through a residence. The juvenile hit the woman in the face. A Woodbridge woman, 38, was arrested.

Farm Creek Dr., 15100 block, 11:35 p.m. Aug. 5. During an argument, a man assaulted a male acquaintance by cutting his arm with a knife. The acquaintance was treated for injuries. A Dumfries man, 50, was arrested.

Golansky Blvd., 3000 block, 2:30 a.m. Aug. 8. During an argument, a woman stabbed a female acquaintance several times with a box cutter. A Woodbridge woman, 23, was arrested.

Granada Way, 12200 block, 5:30 p.m. Aug. 5. During an argument, a man hit a male acquaintance, who was treated for injuries. A Woodbridge man, 22, was arrested.

WEAPONS

Minnieville Rd., 14400 block, 6:22 p.m. Aug. 9. During an altercation about a parking space, a male motorist pointed a firearm at another male motorist, who fled. The first motorist followed him on a motorcycle. When they stopped at a light, the first male approached the other man's vehicle and kicked it several times.

Strickland Ct., 1800 block, 1:12 a.m. Aug. 11. Several bullets were fired at a residence, breaking a window.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Bountiful Lane, 3400 block, 6 p.m. Aug. 5 to 5 p.m. Aug. 6. A business was entered, and an interior door was damaged. Nothing was reported stolen.

Dale Blvd., 4900 block, 2 p.m. Aug. 5 to noon Aug. 6. An attempt was made to enter a school by cutting screens of two windows.

Hayes Lane, 16000 block, 3 p.m. Aug. 4 to 3 p.m. Aug. 5. An attempt was made to enter a residence through a basement door.

Iowa Ct., 1700 block, 7:34 a.m. Aug. 5. Someone entered an occupied residence by damaging a rear door. Nothing was reported stolen.

Knoll Dr., 4500 block, 3:30 a.m. July 31 to 8 p.m. Aug. 9. Cash, ammunition, a video game system and clothes were stolen from a residence entered by breaking a window.

McIntire Dr., 12400 block, 12:50 to 1:10 a.m. Aug. 6. Three male juveniles forcibly entered the rear of a pool house. They fled with a TV and a camera.

Potomac Mills Cir., 2700 block, 7:25 a.m. Aug. 8. A male entered a restaurant by damaging a front door. He took money from a cash register and fled through a rear door.

Roeburn Ct., 4300 block, 6 p.m. Aug. 4 to 5 p.m. Aug. 5. An attempt was made to enter a residence through a second-floor window.

Westminster Lane, 14300 block, 7:30 a.m. to 4:45 p.m. Aug. 6. Cash and jewelry were stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked window.

Manassas

These were among incidents reported by Manassas police. For more information, call 703-257-8000.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Jayhawk Terr., 9500 block, 9 p.m. Aug. 7 to 5 p.m. Aug. 9. A black handgun was stolen from a vehicle.

Peabody St., 9400 block, 5 p.m. July 31 to 1:10 p.m. Aug. 5. Thirty-eight 30-pound cylinders of refrigerant were stolen from a shed.

Manassas Park

No incidents were reported by Manassas Park police for this edition of Local Living. For information, call 703-361-1136.

Montgomery County crime report Montgomery County crime report


SECTION: METRO; Pg. T28


LENGTH: 2422 words


Montgomery County

These were among incidents received by the Montgomery County Police Department. For information, call 240-773-5030.

Rewards for information

Crime Solvers of Montgomery County, a nonprofit community organization, pays up to $1,000 for information leading to an arrest and indictment in connection with these and any other felony crimes. Call the 24-hour hot line at 800-673-2777. Callers may remain anonymous.

DISTRICT 1ROCKVILLE STATION240-773-6070

ASSAULTS

Bentridge Pl., 12100 block, 10 a.m. Sept. 29. A person was attacked. A 17-year-old Potomac female was arrested.

Montrose Rd., 5900 block, 7:30 p.m. Oct. 1. An assault occurred.  

Piccard Dr., 1300 block, 3 a.m. Oct. 2. Seven males threatened a male near a motel and robbed him of property.

WEAPONS OFFENSES

Ferrara Dr., 4200 block, 6:50 p.m. Oct. 4. Responding to a complaint about a weapon being displayed outdoors in a public place, police arrested a 26-year-old Silver Spring man.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Alloway Dr., 10500 block, 1:55 p.m. Oct. 5. A break-in occurred at a residence.

Alta Springs Way, 9900 block, 11:54 a.m. to 12:04 p.m. Sept. 28. A break-in occurred at a residence.

American Way, 15300 block, 9 a.m. to 5 p.m. Sept. 29. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

Crawford Dr., 1300 block, 12:30 to 2:30 p.m. Oct. 3. Property was stolen from a residence.

Deep Trail Terr., 100 block, 7:36 to 8:21 p.m. Sept. 29. A break-in occurred at a residence.

Evans St., 100 block, noon Sept. 28 to 10 p.m. Oct. 2. An attempt was made to enter a residence by force.

Forest Ridge Dr., 14100 block, 11:45 p.m. Sept. 26 to 6 a.m. Sept. 27. Property was stolen from a vehicle in an open garage at a residence.

Halpine Rd., 100 block, 9:35 p.m. Sept. 30 to 2 a.m. Oct. 1. Property was stolen from a residence.

Idlewood Rd., 11700 block, 5:30 to 6:30 p.m. Sept. 27. Property was stolen from a residence.

Julian Pl., 1000 block, 11:30 p.m. Oct. 1 to 10:26 a.m. Oct. 2. Property was stolen from two vehicles, one of which was entered by force.

Crime Report


SECTION: EXTRAS; Pg. VA09


LENGTH: 677 words


Alexandria

These were among incidents reported by the Alexandria Police Department. For more information, call 703-838-4636 or visit http://www.alexandriava.gov/police.

ROBBERIES

BELLEFONTE AVE. E., 1-99 block, 12:05 a.m. July 10. A male robbed an Alexandria woman, 37, of property. On Aug. 27, two Alexandria males, ages 15 and 18, were charged in connection with the incident.

PRINCESS AND BUCHANAN STREETS, 11:15 a.m. July 21. Two males robbed an Alexandria man, 54, of property. On Aug. 27, two Alexandria males, ages 15 and 16, were charged with robbery. 

SOUTH ROYAL AND WILKES STREETS, 9 p.m. Aug. 24. Two males attacked an Alexandria man, 65, and robbed him of property.

UNION ST. S., 400 block, 10:30 p.m. Aug. 27. A man robbed a female pedestrian of cash and property at gunpoint.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

PICKETT ST. N., 500 block, 1:45 to 2:05 p.m. Aug. 28. Property was stolen from a residence.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

COLONIAL AVE., 1000 block, 3 p.m. Aug. 23 to 8:30 a.m. Aug. 24. A gray 1993 Chevrolet Suburban was stolen.

DRAKE CT., 5700 block, 5 p.m. Aug. 26 to 5 p.m. Aug. 27. A gray 2000 Aprilla motor scooter was stolen.

DUKE ST., 6200 block, 8:37 p.m. Aug. 27. A green 1999 Ford Super Duty truck was stolen.

WILSON DR., 3500 block, 1:30 to 3 p.m. Aug. 28. A silver 2000 Ford Windstar was stolen.

 Arlington

These were among incidents reported by the Arlington County Police Department. For more information, call 703-228-4050 or visit http://www.arlingtoncrimesolvers.org.

SEXUAL ASSAULTS 

SECOND RD. N., 4500 block, 5:45 p.m. Sept. 1. A man pushed an elderly pedestrian against a fence, touched her inappropriately, then fled in a vehicle. An Arlington man, 25, was charged with assault and battery.

ASSAULTS

PIEDMONT ST. N., 500 block, 10 p.m. Sept. 2. A man threatened a pedestrian with a knife. The pedestrian suffered a hand injury when he tried to grab the weapon.

35TH ST. S., 4200 block, 6 p.m. Aug. 31. A police officer was assaulted while responding to a domestic disturbance. An Arlington woman, 38, was charged with domestic assault and assault on an officer.

ROBBERIES

EIGHTH RD. S., 5200 block, 6 a.m. Sept. 2. Two males attacked a man and robbed him of cash and property.

PEEPING TOM INCIDENTS

THIRD RD. N., 4100 block, midnight Aug. 28. A male took photographs of a person inside a house while a second male stood lookout. An Arlington man, 35, was charged with trespassing and with being drunk in public. Charges are pending against the second male, a juvenile.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

BURLINGTON ST. N., 2200 block, noon Aug. 30 to 10 p.m. Aug. 31. Property was stolen from three vehicles.

CLARENDON BLVD., 1500 block, 3 to 8:30 a.m. Aug. 31. Electronic items were stolen from five vehicles in a hotel parking garage.

FAIRFAX DR., 5700 block, noon to 1:30 p.m. Aug. 30. A residence was entered by force. Nothing was reported missing.

GLEBE RD. N., 2000 block, 8 p.m. Aug. 29 to 3 p.m. Aug. 31. An attempt was made to enter a residence by forcing a screen door.

LEE HWY., 4400 block, 4 p.m. Aug. 26 to noon Aug. 27. Cash was stolen from a business.

NORWOOD ST. N., 2700 block, 6 p.m. Aug. 28. Property was stolen from a residence entered by forcing a door.

NINTH ST. N., 3000 block, 11 p.m. Aug. 28 to 8 a.m. Aug. 29. A Global Positioning System device was stolen from a vehicle. Another vehicle also was entered, but nothing was reported missing.

36TH ST. S., 4400 block, 12:30 to 7 a.m. Aug. 29. Two vehicles were entered.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

COLUMBIA PIKE S., 4900 block, Sept. 3. A silver 2000 Honda Accord was stolen.

CRYSTAL DR., 2300 block, Aug. 27. A silver 2006 Kawasaki KLR650 motorcycle was stolen.

LEE HWY. N., 4200 block, Aug. 29. A red 1998 Dodge van was stolen.

OLD DOMINION DR., 4300 block, Aug. 30. A silver 2004 Honda motorcycle was stolen.

OLD GLEBE RD. S., 1-99 block, Aug. 29. A blue 2006 Suzuki motorcycle was stolen.

FIRST ST. S., 2600 block, Sept. 2. A 2006 Lexus RX was stolen.

FIFTH ST. N., 4000 block, Sept. 1. A white 1993 Isuzu truck was stolen.

10TH ST. S., 5000 block, Aug. 27. A black 1996 Acura Integra was stolen.

Prince William County crime report Prince William County crime report


SECTION: Metro; Pg. T22


LENGTH: 1110 words


Prince William County

These were among incidents reported by Prince William County police. For information, call 703-792-7245.

BRISTOW AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Vint Hill Rd.,12000 block, 11 a.m. to 2 p.m. Nov. 5. A stereo was stolen from a residence entered by forcing a back door.

DUMFRIES AREA ROBBERIES

Dumfries Shopping Plaza, 17900 block, 6:51 p.m. Nov. 9. A group of males, one with a pellet gun, threatened two male teenagers and robbed one of a pair of shoes. 

Quantico Terrace Dr., 3600 block, 5:57 p.m. Nov. 6. A man threatened a pizza deliveryman and demanded cash, then fled empty-handed when the victim got back inside his vehicle.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Tebbs Lane, 18200 block, 1:14 a.m. Nov. 7. A man broke into an occupied residence by cutting a screen to an unlocked window, then fled empty-handed when confronted. A neighbor, a 23-year-old man, was arrested.

GAINESVILLE AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Virginia Oaks Dr., 7900 block, 12:23 a.m. Nov. 10. An attempt was made to steal a golf cart from a garage. A 26-year-old man was arrested.

MANASSAS AREA SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Manassas Mall area, Nov. 6. A man sexually assaulted an acquaintance. A 21-year-old Manassas man was arrested.

ASSAULTS

Coverstone Dr., 10900 block, 4:08 a.m. Nov. 11. A man struck a police officer responding to a report of a fight at a residence. A 20-year-old Manassas man was arrested on two counts of assault and for resisting arrest.

ROBBERIES

Community Dr., 8200 block, 11:26 a.m. Nov. 9. Four men threatened a pedestrian and robbed him of a wallet, then fled on foot.

INDECENT EXPOSURE INCIDENTS

Ashland Ave., 8000 block, 9:41 p.m. Nov. 12. A man standing near a window outside of a residence exposed himself to an occupant who confronted him.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Shallow Creek Loop, 9800 block, 7:30 to 8 a.m. Nov. 6. Cash was stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked front door.

TRIANGLE AREA ASSAULTS

Purvis Dr.,18000 block, 3:22 p.m. Nov. 9. Two male juveniles threatened a male juvenile and chased him to his residence, where he was pushed to the ground.

ROBBERIES

Purvis Dr., 18100 block, 7:32 p.m. Nov. 9. A group of males, one with a pellet gun, demanded cash from a male pedestrian. After firing the weapon one time, the group fled empty-handed.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Kilmer Lane, 18100 block, 9 a.m. to 7:45 p.m. Nov. 9. A TV, a laptop computer and a bag were stolen from a residence.

WOODBRIDGE AREA SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Hamill Mill Park area, 6:40 p.m. Nov. 8. A man sexually assaulted an acquaintance in a vehicle after she had given him a ride to his residence. A 52-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

Lake Omiscol area, 12:41 a.m. Nov. 10. A man sexually assaulted an acquaintance. A 48-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

ASSAULTS

Castle Hill Dr., 3400 block, 3:59 p.m. Nov. 9. During an argument, a man prevented a female acquaintance from leaving a residence. An 18-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

Kolman Ct., 13000 block, 8:19 p.m. Nov. 9. During an argument with an acquaintance, a male was stabbed. He was taken to a hospital for treatment. A 25-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

WEAPONS OFFENSES

Brook Dr.,14400 block, 11:17 p.m. Nov. 6. Several gunshots were heard.

ROBBERIES

Crossfield Way, 14500 block, 8:01 p.m. Nov. 8. Two males demanded cash from a pizza-delivery person at gunpoint. When she said she had no cash, they robbed her of the food.

Minnieville Rd. and Savannah Dr., 8:49 p.m. Nov. 12. Three men robbed a male pedestrian of cash at knifepoint. The victim sustained a cut during the incident.

Stallion Ct., 12000 block, 6:56 p.m. Nov. 10. A man wearing a mask entered a residence through an unlocked door. After confronting an occupant who confronted him in the basement of the home, he fled empty-handed.

INDECENT EXPOSURE INCIDENTS

Veterans Dr., 14300 block, 1:08 p.m. Nov. 8. A man in a vehicle followed a pedestrian walking into a park, then got out and approached her. When she turned around to walk in another direction, he exposed himself, then ran away.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Choctaw Ridge Ct., 3000 block, 8 a.m. to 6:30 p.m. Nov. 9. A laptop computer, a tablet computer, a video game system, a camera and jewelry were stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked basement door.

Dillingham Sq., 12300 block, 9:53 a.m. Nov. 6. A woman being detained for stealing merchandise from a store kicked and spit at a police officer. A 52-year-old Woodbridge woman was arrested.

Eden Lane, 12400 block, 11:04 a.m. Nov. 6. A man tried to enter a residence through a basement door. He fled empty-handed when confronted.

Edgemoore Ct., 11200 block, 8 to 11:09 a.m. Nov. 7. Two video game systems were among property stolen from a residence entered by forcing a back door.

Evansdale Rd., 4500 block, 8:30 a.m. to 6:30 p.m. Nov. 12. An attempt was made to enter a residence by damaging a window. Nothing was reported missing.

Kraft Ct., 4900 block, 11:55 a.m. to 2:05 p.m. Nov. 7. A handgun and jewelry were among property stolen from a residence entered by forcing a back door.

Mapledale Ave., 14100 block, 8:30 a.m. to 6:20 p.m. Nov. 6. Two laptop computers, a video game system, video games and jewelry were stolen from a residence entered by forcing a side door.

Photo Dr., 13400 block, 8:30 a.m. to 12:30 p.m. Nov. 12. Jewelry was stolen from a residence entered by forcing a back door.

Photo Dr., 13500 block, 4:25 to 7:20 p.m. Nov. 11. A TV was among property stolen from a residence entered by forcing a back door.

Simmons Lane, 14400 block, 3 to 8:51 p.m. Nov. 10. Cash, a TV, a cellphone and jewelry were stolen from a residence entered by forcing the front door.

Tadworth Pl., 12600 block, 2:30 to 3:30 p.m. Nov. 11. Cash was stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked door.

Manassas

No report was received from Manassas police for this edition of Local Living. For information, call 703-257-8000.

Manassas Park

This was among incidents reported by Manassas Park police. For information, call 703-361-1136.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Conner Dr., 8200 block, 12:51 p.m. Nov. 3 to noon Nov. 7. License plates were stolen from two vehicles.

The Washington Post


March 18, 2001 Sunday  
Final Edition


CRIME REPORT


SECTION: SOUTHERN MARYLAND EXTRA; Pg. T20


LENGTH: 335 words


The following are among reports received recently by the Calvert County sheriff's office and the Maryland State Police. Anyone with information about these crimes should call the Criminal Investigations Section, 410-535-2800 or 301-855-1194, or the Crime Solver's Line, 410-535-2880. You can also call the Prince Frederick barracks of the State Police at 410-535-1400.  

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

LUSBY, 2:30 p.m. March 12 to 3 p.m. March 13. A man, 55, stole a Gateway computer monitor, keyboards, a VCR and golf clubs from a residence. He was charged with theft more than $ 500.

LUSBY, 11:45 a.m. to 2:10 p.m. March 11. A wallet was stolen from a purse left in the conference room of St. Paul's United Methodist Church.

ASSAULTS

CHANEYVILLE RD., midnight March 10 to 8 a.m. March 11. A man, 36, shoved a woman, 52, through a bedroom window. She fell to the ground and received a small laceration in her arm. He also pointed a loaded shotgun at her and threatened to kill her. He was charged with second-degree assault and reckless endangerment.

SEXUAL OFFENSE

PRINCE FREDERICK, March 13. A man, 36, raped a girl, 7, on Jan. 5. He was charged with second-degree rape.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

INDUSTRY LANE, Sometime in January to March 9. Engine parts were stolen from a boat.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

SOLOMONS ISLAND RD., 11:45 p.m. March 10. A man, 23, stole $ 80 worth of crabcakes and sandwiches from the Rum Line Inn, dropping several crabcakes as he fled. Police were able to apprehend him because he left his driver's license at the bar when he paid his tab. He was charged with theft less than $ 500.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

ST. LEONARD, Dec. 30-Jan. 9. A woman, 34, opened mail that belonged to another woman, 27, and stole a credit card. She made several transactions and also used the card to make a balance transfer check from Chase Manhattan Bank payable to herself. She endorsed it and signed it over to someone else. She was charged with forgery, theft scheme less than $ 500 and credit card theft.

-- Compiled by Bonnie Smith


LOAD-DATE: March 18, 2001


LANGUAGE: ENGLISH

PUBLICATION-TYPE: Newspaper

Montgomery County crime report Montgomery County crime report


SECTION: Metro; Pg. T28


LENGTH: 2571 words


Montgomery County

These were among incidents received by the Montgomery County Police Department. For information, call 240-773-5030.

Rewards for information

Crime Solvers of Montgomery County, a nonprofit community organization, pays up to $1,000 for information leading to an arrest and indictment in connection with these and any other felony crimes. Call the 24-hour hot line at 800-673-2777. Callers may remain anonymous.

DISTRICT 1ROCKVILLE STATION240-773-6070 ASSAULTS

Bentridge Pl., 12100 block, 10 a.m. Sept. 29. A person was attacked. A 17-year-old Potomac female was arrested.

Anne Arundel County and Howard County crime report Anne Arundel County and Howard County crime report


BYLINE: - Compiled by Carrie Donovan


SECTION: METRO; Pg. T18


LENGTH: 1088 words


These were among incidents reported by the Anne Arundel County Police Department. For information, call 410-222-8050.

Rewards for Information

Metro Crime Stoppers, a nonprofit group, will pay up to $2,000 for information leading to an arrest and indictment in connection with felonies. Tips can be submitted anonymously by telephone or over the Internet , or via text message. Call the 24-hour hotline at 866-756-2587, visit www.metrocrimestoppers.net or text to 274637. For text messages, type the letters "mcs" without the quote marks in the text field, then hit the space key before writing the crime tip. If the text is received, you will receive an acknowledgment.

Ordnance Rd. E., 600 block, 6:42 p.m. Nov. 18. A motorist at a stoplight was approached by two males. They asked for cash and then stabbed the driver repeatedly with a sharp object. The motorist started to drive away and hit a tree. The assailants fled on foot. The motorist was taken to a medical facility and treated for injuries that were not thought to be life-threatening. 

Baltimore and Annapolis Blvd., 7900 block,3:20 p.m. Nov. 18. Three males attacked a pedestrian and tried to rob the man of cash. During a struggle, the victim was cut in the abdomen several times with a knife. The assailants fled on foot. The victim was treated at a hospital for minor cuts.

Meadows Ct., 2300 block, 12:25 a.m. Nov. 22. Three males were seen fleeing from a home under construction and driving away in a truck. A short time later, police stopped a truck containing stolen building materials. Two Severn men, ages 23 and 31, and a Baltimore man, 20, were charged with fourth-degree burglary and theft.

These were among incidents reported by the Annapolis Police Department. For information, call 410-268-9000. To anonymously report non-emergency crime or suspicious activity, call 410-280-2583.

Northwest St., 1-99 block, 6 p.m. Nov. 18. A male forced a woman to the back of a building and sexually assaulted her.

Atwater Dr., 300 block, 8:15 a.m. to 6:10 p.m. Nov. 19. A computer and a TV were stolen from a residence entered by forcing the front door.

Chesapeake Ave., 800 block, 4 p.m. Nov. 17 to noon Nov. 18. A license plate was stolen from a Ford Explorer.

Eastern Ave., 100 block, 5 p.m. Nov. 16. A green BMX Diamondback bike was stolen from a residence's back yard. A damaged bicycle was found on the property. Police say that it was probably left behind by the thief.

Forest Dr., 1800 block, Nov. 20 to Nov. 22. Copper and phone cables were among property stolen from a fenced-in parking lot.

Forest Hills Ave., 1000 block, 6 a.m. to 6:45 p.m. Nov. 19. A residence's front door was kicked in. Nothing was reported missing.

Jackson St., 900 block, 11 p.m. Nov. 17 to 8 a.m. Nov. 18. Clothing and a camera were taken from a Toyota Corolla. There was no sign of forced entry.

Pritchley Run Rd., 300 block, 1 p.m. to 4:45 p.m. Nov. 22. Electronics and jewelry were stolen from a residence. There was no sign of forced entry.

Spa View Cir., 1-99 block, 8:45 a.m. to 7:45 p.m. Nov. 22. A Toyota's rear license plate was stolen.

These were among incidents reported by the Howard County Police Department. For information, call 410-313-2236. To anonymously provide information about these and other felonies, call the Stop Crime tip line: 410-313-7867 (STOP).

Flamepool Way, 9100 block, 1:30 a.m. Nov. 19. Three people wearing masks attacked a male walking to his car. After taking his keys, they took a laptop computer from his vehicle and fled on foot. No injuries were reported.

Painted Cup, 10300 block, 7:30 a.m. to 2:30 p.m. Nov. 18. A laptop computer, coins, cash, gift cards, video game systems, an MP3 player, a watch and alcoholic beverages were among property stolen from a residence entered through a basement window.

Skilift Ct., 11200 block, 6:55 a.m. to 4:10 p.m. Nov. 22. A lighter and a briefcase were stolen from a residence entered by kicking in a window screen.

Skilift Ct., 11200 block, 8:15 a.m. to 7 p.m. Nov. 22. Three TVs, two laptop computers, jewelry, sunglasses, a gift card and an ATM card were stolen from a residence entered by kicking in a front door.

Snowden River Pkwy., 9400 block, 5:09 to 5:14 a.m. Nov. 22. A safe and cash from a cash register were stolen from a restaurant entered by breaking glass in a front door.

Turnabout Lane, 6100 block, 4:44 p.m. Nov. 23. A man entered a residence through an unlocked front door. After falling asleep on a couch, he was confronted by an occupant and refused to leave. A Columbia man, 30, was charged with third- and fourth-degree burglary and disorderly conduct.

Twin Rivers Rd., 10400 block, 1:57 a.m. Nov. 22. Cash was removed from a cash register at a pizza restaurant entered by prying open a front door.

Charter Dr., 10700 block, 12:03 p.m. Nov. 18. A green 1999 Toyota Avalon was stolen.

Softwater Way, 9800 block, 4 p.m. Nov. 18 to 9:37 a.m. Nov. 19. Two people were arrested in connection with the theft of a 2007 Toyota Corolla. The vehicle was recovered.

Stevens Forest Rd., 5600 block, 11:26 a.m. Nov. 20. A white 2001 Oldsmobile was stolen.

Stonecutter Rd., 8600 block, 6:07 a.m. Nov. 22. A black 2009 Mercedes was stolen.

Meadowridge Rd., 6300 block, Nov. 17 to 8 a.m. Nov. 18. Medicine, an air rifle, a dirt bike and cash were stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked front door.

Bonnie Branch Rd., 4400 block, 9:40 p.m. Nov. 21. A basement window was broken at a residence. Nothing was reported missing.

Lee Hollow Pl., 4800 block, 7:30 a.m. to 8:15 p.m. Nov. 22. An MP3 player was stolen from a residence entered by breaking glass in a back door.

Lotus Cir., 4100 block, 9:15 p.m. Nov. 22. An attempt was made to break into a residence by forcing a back door. Nothing was reported missing.

Wheaton Way, 3100 block, Sept. 21 to 5:14 p.m. Nov. 21. Electronics were stolen from an apartment storage area entered by cutting a lock.

Ellington St., 11400 block, 7 a.m. to 6:55 p.m. Nov. 22. Glass in a residence's back door was broken. Nothing was reported missing.

Bristol Ct., 8300 block, 5 p.m. Nov. 19 to 12:25 p.m. Nov. 21. Cash was stolen from a cash register at a deli entered by breaking glass in a front door.

Washington Blvd., 8200 block, 12:01 to 2:08 a.m. Nov. 20. A blue 1995 Isuzu Rodeo was stolen.

Scentless Rose Way, 9700 block, 10 a.m. to 9 p.m. Nov. 21. Property was stolen from a residence entered by prying open a back door.

Larkin Rd., 8700 block, 5 p.m. Nov. 19 to 7:30 a.m. Nov. 21. Cash was stolen from a cash register at a business entered by breaking glass in a front door.

Prince William County crime reportPrince William County crime report


BYLINE: - Compiled by Sarah Lane


SECTION: METRO; Pg. T22


LENGTH: 776 words


Prince William County

The following incidents were recently reported by Prince William County police. For information, call 703-792-7245.

BRISTOW AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Wishing Well Way, 12800 block, noon-6 p.m. March 13. Someone attempted to enter a residence by prying open a front door.

DALE CITY AREA

WEAPONS

Arbor Ct., 3000 block, 2:42 a.m. March 10. Several gunshots were fired. 

ROBBERIES

Westmont Dr., 14400 block, 6:11 p.m. March 10. During an argument, a man damaged a female acquaintance's vehicle and robbed her of a cellphone. A 26-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

GAINESVILLE AREA

ROBBERIES

Lee Hwy. and Linton Hall Rd., 7:54 p.m. March 9. A gunman robbed a male acquaintance of a wallet and a cellphone.

LAKE RIDGE AREA

INDECENT EXPOSURE

Cotton Mill Dr., 12200 block, 5:33 p.m. March 8. A man in a vehicle exposed himself to a female juvenile pedestrian.

MANASSAS AREA

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Blackstone Rd., 9400 block, 2:49 p.m. March 10. A man sexually assaulted a female juvenile acquaintance. A 36-year-old Manassas man was arrested.

ROBBERIES

Cass Pl., 7600 block, 9:56 p.m. March 10. A gunman hit a male pedestrian on the head, knocking him to the ground, then robbed him of a cellphone.

Sudley Rd., 8300 block, 6:13 p.m. March 9. Two males inside a store knocked down a male juvenile and robbed him of cash. The two fled in a bus, which was stopped by police. Two Woodbridge males, 18 and 16, were arrested.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Bull Run Rd., 7300 block, 6:30 a.m. March 1 to 7:30 a.m. March 8. Someone attempted to enter a residence by kicking open a rear basement door.

Sudley Rd., 7100 block, 5 p.m. March 6 to 6 a.m. March 7. Thirty-six tires and chrome rims were stolen from vehicles at a car dealership.

TRIANGLE AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Purvis Dr., 18100 block, 1:38 a.m. March 9. A man attempted to enter a residence by breaking a front-door window, and then ran away.

WOODBRIDGE AREA

ASSAULTS

Bayside Ave., 1200 block, 12:34 a.m. March 14. During a fight, a man hit a male acquaintance in the face. The acquaintance was treated for injuries. A 28-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

Ladino Ct., 3300 block, 11 p.m. March 14. A woman threw an object at a man and bit a male juvenile. Both males are acquaintances of the woman. The two were treated for injuries. A 52-year-old Woodbridge woman was arrested.

Potomac Branch Dr., 14800 block, 9:53 a.m. March 14. During an argument, a woman stabbed a female acquaintance with a kitchen knife. The acquaintance was treated for injuries. A 47-year-old Woodbridge woman was arrested.

WEAPONS

Merchant Plaza, 4100 block, 1:35 a.m. March 11. During a fight, a man showed a handgun. A 20-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Gardenview Loop, 10400 block, 12:07 p.m. March 10. Two males knocked on a front door of a residence, then attempted to pry open the door. They fled when a resident approached the door.

Heather Glen Ct., 1800 block, 10:45 a.m. to 2:30 p.m. March 7. Chrome rims were stolen from a residence entered through a rear basement window.

Jefferson Davis Hwy., 15600 block, 10:50 p.m. March 11 to 8:50 a.m. March 12. Twenty tires and rims were stolen from vehicles at a car dealership. A rear window of another vehicle was broken.

Jonathan Ct. and Vals Way, 11:54 a.m. March 13. Property was stolen from several vehicles, then left in surrounding neighborhoods.

Lockleven Lane, 12900 block, 7:30 a.m. to 7 p.m. March 9. Electronics and jewelry were stolen from a residence entered by prying open a rear basement window.

River Bend Way, 1700 block, 5:48 p.m. March 9. Someone attempted to enter a residence through a rear window.

Manassas

The following incidents were recently reported by Manassas police. For information, call 703-257-8000.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Liberia Ave., 8600 block, noon to 4 p.m. March 12. A residence was entered by forcing open a rear door.

Olde Mill Run, 8800 block, noon March 10 to 4 p.m. March 13. A video game system, video games and a safe containing cash and two vehicle titles were stolen from a residence.

Manassas Park

The following incidents were recently reported by Manassas Park police. For information, call 703-361-1136.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Brian Ct., 8600 block, 9 p.m. March 5 to 6:58 a.m. March 6. A Global Positioning System device, a baseball glove and two baseball hats were stolen from a vehicle.

Brian Ct., 8600 block, 12:40 p.m. March 7. A man entered a residence and was sitting on a couch when a resident returned home. A 30-year-old Manassas man was arrested.

Euclid Ave., 8200 block, 8:30 to 11:30 a.m. March 7. A cellphone was stolen from a vehicle.

Hedgeford St., 9300 block, 10:30 a.m. March 5. A basement window of a residence was broken.
