July 23, 2015 Thursday 10:37 PM EST 


Prince William County crime report


SECTION: Metro; Pg. T27


LENGTH: 1086 words


Prince William County

These were among incidents reported by Prince William County police. For information, call 703-792-7245.

BRISTOW AREA WEAPONS

Spindle Foot Ct. and Hoppers Lane, 2:30 a.m. July 9. Several gunshots were heard. No one was reported injured.

DUMFRIES AREA  

SEXUAL ASSAULT

Jefferson Davis Hwy., 17000 block, 10:22 a.m. July 10. A man in a store rubbed against a woman and inappropriately touched her.

ASSAULT

Old Stage Rd., 16900 block, 8:10 p.m. July 6. A man in a hotel room hit a female acquaintance several times and took her cellphone. An Arlington man, 30, was arrested.

MANASSAS AREA ASSAULT

Urbana Rd., 8000 block, 5:50 p.m. July 11. A man and two other males assaulted a male acquaintance and robbed him of property. An 18-year-old man was arrested.

WEAPONS

Harnsberger Barn Ct., 6000 block, 11:30 p.m. June 19 to midnight June 20. A weapon was fired at a residence, damaging a garage.

Three Otters Pl., 15500 block, 9:30 p.m. July 7. During an argument, a man threatened a female acquaintance and four other people with a rifle. The man later posted a threatening message on the woman's Web social media page. No one was reported injured. A Fredericksburg man, 28, was arrested.

ROBBERY

Irongate Way and Community Dr., midnight to 12:30 a.m. July 13. Three males hit a male pedestrian, knocking him unconscious. They robbed him of cash and a passport.

INDECENT EXPOSURE

Rixlew Lane, 8500 block, 8:30 p.m. July 7. A naked man was seen lying on grass. A Manassas man, 20, was arrested.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Ashland Ave., 7900 block, noon July 8 to 6:30 p.m. July 9. A vacant residence was entered by damaging a rear door. Nothing was reported stolen.

Hinson Mill Lane, 11400 block, 1 to 7 a.m. July 8. Several pairs of shoes and other items were stolen from a residence.

Streamwalk Lane,7700 block, 8 a.m. July 6 to 4 p.m. July 7. An attempt was made to enter a business by damaging a rear door.

TRIANGLE AREA WEAPONS

Jurgensen Dr., 3600 block, 11:54 p.m. July 14. A weapon was fired, injuring a man in the arm.

WOODBRIDGE AREA

SEXUAL ASSAULT

Wigglesworth Way, 1800 block, May to June. A man used his cellphone to expose himself to and solicit inappropriate images from a female juvenile. A Woodbridge man, 34, was arrested.

ASSAULTS

Featherstone Rd., 1500 block, 11:30 p.m. July 12. During an argument, a man prevented a female acquaintance from leaving a residence and struck her on the hand. A Woodbridge man, 22, was arrested.

Piccolo Lane, 14500 block, 7:44 p.m. July 13. During an argument, a man assaulted a female acquaintance. A Woodbridge man, 24, was arrested.

Wetherburn Ct., 2900 block, 2:31 p.m. July 7. During an argument between a man and a female acquaintance, the acquaintance entered her residence. The man entered the residence through a kitchen window, then hit the woman on the arm when she attempted to leave. A 32-year-old man was arrested.

WEAPONS

Arum Pl., 15100 block, 5 p.m. July 13 to 5 p.m. July 14. A weapon was fired, damaging a rear window and rear seat of a vehicle.

Commitment Ct., 15300 block, 9:30 p.m. July 4. A weapon was fired at a residence, damaging a bedroom ceiling.

Luckland Way,2500 block, 1 to 1:30 a.m. July 12. A rear door and upper-floor window of a residence were hit by a projectile.

Oak Tree Lane, 2500 block, 1:31 a.m. July 12. Several bullets were fired as an uninvited group was leaving a party at a residence. No one was reported injured.

CHILD-CARE INCIDENT

Potomac Mills Cir., 2700 block, 2:50 p.m. July 12. A man left a 5-year-old boy locked inside a vehicle. A witness was able to get the boy to unlock the vehicle. He was evaluated by medical personnel and found to be uninjured. A Woodbridge man, 39, was arrested.

ROBBERIES

Bowes Lane, 2800 block, 2:30 a.m. July 7. A man assaulted a male acquaintance who was sitting outside a residence and took his cellphone.

Opitz Blvd., 2700 block, 7:45 p.m. July 14. Two males assaulted a male acquaintance and robbed him of cash and marijuana.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Glendale Rd., 4100 block, midnight June 29 to 6:29 p.m. July 12. An attempt was made to enter a residence by damaging a basement window.

Hemingway Dr., 4300 block, 5 p.m. July 7 to 7:10 p.m. July 14. Two air conditioners were stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked window.

Kingsman Rd., 13500 block, 1 p.m. July 9 to 2:30 p.m. July 10. An attempt was made to enter a residence by damaging a basement window.

Lost Canyon Ct., 15000 block, 4 a.m. July 10. Someone attempted to enter a residence through a rear door, then pounded on a window, waking a resident.

Omisol Rd., 2600 block, 9 a.m. July 2 to 10:07 p.m. July 12. A 2004 Honda motorcycle, power tools and other items were stolen from a residence entered by damaging a rear door. A tire was stolen from a vehicle.

Sandy Ridge Ct., 16300 block, 12:30 to 7:30 a.m. July 9. An attempt was made to enter a residence by cutting several window screens.

Sandy Ridge Ct., 16300 block, 10 p.m. July 8 to 8 a.m. July 9. An attempt was made to enter two residences by cutting several window screens.

Manassas

These were among incidents reported by Manassas police. For more information, call 703-257-8000.

THEFT/BREAK-IN

Fort Dr., 8900 block, midnight July 5 to 6 p.m. July 6. Bikes, speakers, construction boxes and other items were stolen from a garage of a residence.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFT

Fountain Cir., 10200 block, July 1. A 2005 gray Infiniti G35 Coupe.

VANDALISM

Mathis Ave., 8600 block, July 6. A front window of a business was broken.

Shady Grove Cir., 8300 block, 5:30 a.m. July 4 to 10:30 a.m. July 5. A vehicle was damaged. Firework debris was found near the vehicle.

Wellington and Hampton roads, 4:30 p.m. July 2. Two male juveniles hid behind a tree, and one threw a cup containing liquid at a moving vehicle. The driver swerved. Nothing was reported damaged, and no injuries were reported.

Manassas Park

No incidents were reported by Manassas Park police for this edition of Local Living. For information, call 703-361-1136.

Southern Maryland crime report Southern Maryland crime report


SECTION: Metro; Pg. T28


LENGTH: 941 words


Calvert County

These were among reports received by the Calvert County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. Anyone with information about these crimes should call the Criminal Investigation Division, 410-535-2800 or 301-855-1194, or the Crime Solvers line, 410-535-2880. You can also call the Prince Frederick Barrack of the state police at 410-535-1400.

CHESAPEAKE BEACH THEFTS/BREAK-INS  

Chesapeake Beach, 3:19 p.m. Sept. 20. Three bottles of prescription medication were stolen from an unlocked vehicle.

LUSBY AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Waco Ct., 12:34 p.m. Sept. 17. Coins and jewelry were stolen from a residence. During a traffic stop, the stolen property was recovered. A 34-year-old Clinton woman and a 34-year-old Accokeek man were arrested on charges that included first-, third- and fourth-degree burglary, rogue and vagabond and possession of cocaine.

VANDALISM

Lusby Park Lane, 3:53 p.m. Sept. 17. A rock was used to shatter a vehicle window.

NORTH BEACH AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Fifth St., Sept. 18 to Sept. 19. A gift card was stolen from a mailbox at a residence.

PRINCE FREDERICK AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Dawn Dr., 11:58 p.m. Sept. 16. A woman attacked occupants and damaged property inside a residence. A 26-year-old Prince Frederick woman was charged with second-degree assault, first-degree burglary, malicious destruction of property and disorderly conduct.

Terrace Dr., 6 to 8:35 p.m. Sept. 18. An attempt was made to break into a residence by removing a screen from a window. Nothing was reported missing.

VANDALISM

Bayside Forest Beach, Sept. 15 to 25. A picnic table was damaged by spray-paint.

SUNDERLAND AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Dalrymple Rd., Sept. 15 to Sept. 17. Stereo equipment was stolen from a vehicle parked after it became disabled.

Route 2, Sept. 17. A catalytic converter was stolen from a vehicle parked at a commuter lot.

Charles County

These were among reports received by the Charles County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. For information, call 301-932-2222 or 301-870-3232. Crime Solvers will pay a reward for information leading to an arrest and an indictment in connection with these and other crimes. Call the 24-hour hotline at 866-411-8477. Callers may remain anonymous. The Charles County Sheriff's Office Web site is www.ccso.us. Included at the site are daily news releases, Crime Watch neighborhood statistics, community services, crime prevention programs and career opportunities.

INDIAN HEAD AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Cypress Pl., Sept. 24. Prescription medication was stolen from a residence.

POMFRET AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Lowell Rd., 8700 block, Sept. 19. Jewelry was stolen from a residence.

SWANN POINT AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Magnolia and Ivanhoe Courts., Sept. 23 to Sept. 24. Property was stolen from three unlocked vehicles.

WALDORF AREA SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Waldorf area, Sept. 17. A 34-year-old Capitol Heights man was charged with a third-degree sex offense and soliciting a minor. The arrest was made in connection with an incident in August, during which a 14-year-old girl was contacted on a social networking site by a male falsely claiming to be 17 years old.

ROBBERIES

Crain Hwy., 2400 block, 3:06 a.m. Sept. 24. A convenience store was robbed at gunpoint.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Alyssa Lane, 3:04 a.m, Sept. 24. During a traffic stop, four tires and rims that had been reported stolen were found in the back seat of a vehicle. Two Waldorf men, ages 19 and 22, were arrested on theft charges.

Pika Dr., 11700 block, Sept. 24 to Sept. 25. A U-Haul truck was stolen from the parking lot of a business.

Renner Rd., 3800 block, 7:30 a.m. to 11:35 p.m. Sept. 20. Four tires and a spare were stolen from a custom truck.

Waldorf area, Sept. 25. Metal was stolen from several job sites using the same HVAC contractor. A 31-year-old Waldorf man, an employee of the contractor, was arrested on theft charges.

VANDALISM

Bannister Ct. and Milstead Ct., Sept. 22 to Sept. 23. The paint finish of four vehicles was scratched and tires of five vehicles were punctured.

St. Mary's County

These were among reports received by the St. Mary's County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. For information, call 301-475-8008, or the Crime Solvers line, 301-475-3333. The Leonardtown Barrack of the Maryland State Police operates a 24-hour tip line on which people may anonymously report information at 301-475-2936.

LEXINGTON PARK AREA ROBBERIES

Shangri-La Dr. N.,21800 block, 9:20 p.m. Sept. 13. Two men robbed a business of cash and property at gunpoint. A 19-year-old Lexington Park man was charged with armed robbery, first-degree assault and theft valued at more than $1,000. An investigation is continuing.

MECHANICSVILLE AREA ROBBERIES

Three Notch Road,28200 block, 1:20 a.m. Sept. 16. A man threw hot coffee at a clerk, then jumped over the counter of a convenience store. After a brief struggle, he threatened the clerk with a hammer, then fled with cash. A 21-year-old Charlotte Hall man was arrested Sept. 21. Charges included robbery with a dangerous weapon and second-degree assault.

- Compiled by Bonnie Smith

June 5, 2014 Thursday  
Every Edition


Southern Maryland crime report


SECTION: METRO; Pg. T31


LENGTH: 910 words


Calvert County 

These were among reports received by the Calvert County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. Anyone with information about these crimes is asked to call the Criminal Investigation Division, 410-535-2800 or 301-855-1194, or the Crime Solvers line, 410-535-2880. Residents can also call the Prince Frederick Barrack of the state police at 410-535-1400.

CHESAPEAKE BEACH AREA

ASSAULTS

Chesapeake Beach, 8:33 p.m. May 23. During an attempt to stop an intoxicated woman from driving her vehicle near a restaurant, a police officer was almost struck by the vehicle. When the driver stopped, the officer entered the vehicle and placed it in park. A struggle ensued. A Chesapeake Beach woman, 41, was charged with second-degree assault, intoxication, reckless endangerment, disturbing the peace and disorderly conduct.  

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

28th St., overnight, May 21 to May 22. A portable TV, an MP3 player and a battery charger were taken from an unlocked vehicle.

Breezy Point, May 18 to May 24. Four camping trailers were damaged at a campground.

DUNKIRK AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Town Center Blvd., May 15 to May 20. A tractor-trailer's trailer was stolen from a shopping center.

HUNTINGTOWN AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Cherry Hill Lane, April 19 to May 19. Copper piping was stolen.

Lowery Rd., May 16 to May 23. A lock was removed from a storage trailer at a home. A kayak paddle and two life jackets were stolen.

LUSBY AREA

ROBBERIES

Lake Lariat, 1:27 p.m. May 23. During a basketball game involving four males, two players robbed the others at gunpoint of car speakers, cash, cellphones and a wallet.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Harbor Dr., 200 block, 1:30 a.m. May 24. A garage window was broken.

NORTH BEACH AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Seventh St., May 21. A front door was pried open in the daytime. Nothing was reported missing.

PRINCE FREDERICK AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Cambridge Pl., 400 block, 7 p.m. May 23 to 8 a.m. May 24. Property was stolen from a vehicle parked at a home.

Charles County

These were among reports received by the Charles County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. For information, call 301-932-2222 or 301-870-3232. The sheriff's Web site, www.ccso.us, has news releases, local crime statistics, crime prevention programs and career opportunities.

REWARDS FOR INFORMATION

Crime Solvers will pay a reward for information leading to an arrest and an indictment in connection with these and other crimes. Call the 24-hour hotline at 866-411-8477. Callers may remain anonymous.

BRYANS ROAD AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Larissa Ct., 2600 block, May 23. A DVD player was stolen from an unlocked vehicle.

INDIAN HEAD AREA

WEAPONS

Ellerbe Dr., 6000 block, 2:20 p.m. May 28. A man fired a gun. A man, 44, was charged with reckless endangerment.

WALDORF AREA

ROBBERIES

Thoroughbred Ct., 6000 block, 2:20 p.m. May 28. A group of males asked a male pedestrian, 17, for cash. He was assaulted when he attempted to walk away. The group fled in a white pickup.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Eutaw St., 3000 block, May 21 to May 23. A check was stolen from outgoing mail at a home. Someone attempted to change the name on the check and cash it at bank.

St. Mary's County

These were among reports received by the St. Mary's County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. For information, call 301-475-8008. To submit a tip, call the Crime Solvers line at 301-475-3333. The Leonardtown Barrack of the Maryland State Police also has a 24-hour anonymous tip line at 301-475-2936.

CALIFORNIA AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

California, May 27. A vehicle window was broken; property was stolen.

COMPTON AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Lady Baltimore area, May 28. A vehicle was entered; nothing was reported missing.

LEONARDTOWN AREA

ASSAULTS

Leonardtown, May 30. A woman at a hospital said an acquaintance stabbed her during an argument. An arrest warrant was issued for a Lexington Park woman, 45.

LEXINGTON PARK AREA

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Lexington Park, May 24. Someone was sexually assaulted at a home. Warrants were issued for a man in connection with first-degree rape and second-degree assault.

ASSAULTS

Carefree Lane, May 25. A man backed his vehicle into another vehicle to stop the driver and passenger from leaving. A Lexington Park man, 36, was charged with two counts of first- and second-degree assault and two counts of false imprisonment.

Chapman Dr., May 24. A man threw a beer at an acquaintance and pulled her hair. He also broke her phone and threw her purse into woods. A Lexington Park man, 52, was charged with second-degree assault.

Great Mills Rd., 11:35 a.m. May 22. While being arrested, a woman at an apartment complex hit a police officer in the face. After she was placed in a police vehicle, she kicked a window. A Lexington Park woman, 20, was charged with second-degree assault of a law enforcement officer, disorderly conduct, resisting arrest, failure to obey a lawful order and property destruction.

Williams Dr., 3:01 p.m. May 25. During an altercation, a woman assaulted an acquaintance. A Lexington Park woman, 19, was charged with second-degree assault.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Chancellor Run Rd., May 28. Property was stolen from a vehicle.

MECHANICSVILLE AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Yowaiski Mill Rd., 1 p.m. May 21. A man was seen leaving a home with copper wires and other property. A Mechanicsville man, 21, was charged with two counts of second-and fourth-degree burglary, theft, property destruction and trespassing.

-Compiled by Bonnie Smith

March 21, 2013 Thursday 8:13 PM EST 


Anne Arundel and Howard crime report Anne Arundel and Howard crime report


SECTION: Metro; Pg. T26


LENGTH: 1412 words


Anne Arundel

These were among incidents reported by police in Anne Arundel County. For information, call 410-222-8050.

ANNAPOLIS AREA SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Mountain Rd., 3700 block, 1 p.m. March 12. In connection with an investigation of sexually explicit text messages exchanged at a high school in 2011, a 28-year-old Arnold woman was charged with displaying obscene matter to a minor and soliciting child pornography.

GLEN BURNIE AREA ROBBERIES

Ritchie Hwy., 7900 block, 9:58 p.m. March 8. A teenager armed with a gun robbed a male of sneakers in the parking lot at Marley Station Mall. A Millersville male, 16, was arrested. The shoes were recovered. 

Ritchie Hwy., 6600 block, 10 p.m. March 13. A man who had been asked to leave a fast-food restaurant soon returned, then attacked an employee and tried to take cash from a cash drawer. He struck an employee in the face before fleeing empty-handed. A man, 38, of no fixed address was arrested nearby.

Tall Pines Ct., 7800 block, 2:38 p.m. March 7. A male threatened a teenager near a mailbox on the first floor of a residential building, then robbed her of a tablet computer.

ODENTON AREA HOMICIDES

Pine Cove Ave., 100 block, March 14. An Odenton woman, 38, was charged with first-degree murder in connection with the Nov. 6 stabbing death of her husband, Jerome Vorden Wood, 45. Police had found Wood suffering from trauma to the upper body after they received a call about an attempted suicide at a residence at this location.

ROBBERIES

Piney Orchard Pkwy., 8700 block, 8:15 p.m. March 9. Two men robbed a cellphone store of cash and merchandise at gunpoint.

SEVERN AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Burns Crossing Rd., 300 block, 3:30 a.m. March 10. During surveillance of a municipal-truck parking lot at a landfill, police detained a man who had just spent about 45 minutes in the area. An investigation determined that he had removed nine batteries from trucks and had placed them in a wooded area nearby. A Crownsville man, 29, was arrested. An investigation into other recent thefts from vehicles parked at the lot was ongoing.

Annapolis

These were among incidents reported by the Annapolis Police Department. For information, call 410-268-9000.

ROBBERY

Abney Lane near Clay Street, 10:30 a.m. March 13. A male armed with a small knife demanded cash from a man walking to his vehicle. After a brief struggle, the assailant fled empty-handed. The victim drove himself to a hospital for treatment of a stab wound to his arm.

Bens Dr., unit block, 7:45 p.m. March 8. An occupied apartment was entered through an unlocked back door. The intruder struggled with an occupant, then fled with a wallet. The victim was treated at a hospital for a laceration.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Americana Dr., 600 block, 8:45 p.m. March 8 to 9 a.m. March 9. A laptop computer, prescription medication and about 100 CDs were stolen from an unlocked vehicle.

Bay Ridge Ave., 900 block, 5:30 p.m. March 11 to 8 a.m. March 12. An attempt was made to enter a business by forcing a door. Nothing was reported missing.

Boucher Ave., 800 block, 5 p.m. March 6 to 8 a.m. March 8. Sunglasses were stolen from an unlocked vehicle.

Edelmar Dr., 100 block, 12:15 to 7 a.m. March 13. Cash was stolen from an unlocked vehicle.

Genessee St., 600 block, 11 p.m. March 6 to 6:45 a.m. March 7. A global positioning system device was stolen from an unlocked vehicle.

McKendree Ave., 200 block, 5 p.m. March 9 to 11 a.m. March 10. A wallet was stolen from an unlocked vehicle.

Summerfield Ct., unit block, 5 p.m. March 11 to 7:30 a.m. March 12. A cellphone, an MP3 player and a debit card were stolen from an unlocked vehicle.

Tyler Ave., 800 block, 5 p.m. March 8 to 3 p.m. March 10. Cash and a cellphone were stolen from an unlocked vehicle.

Wardour Dr., 200 block, 8 p.m. March 10 to 9:30 a.m. March 11. A purse was stolen from a vehicle entered by breaking a window.

Howard County

These were among incidents reported by the Howard County Police Department. For information, call 410-313-2236.

ANNAPOLIS JUNCTION AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Corridor Rd., 8900 block, 3 p.m. March 9 to noon March 10. An attempt was made to enter a rental-truck yard by cutting a hole in a fence. Nothing was reported missing.

COLUMBIA AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Browsing Deer, 6500 block, Feb. 28 to March 13. Glass was broken in a back door at a residence. Nothing was reported missing.

Green Mountain Cir., 10300 block, 7 a.m. March 2 to 11 a.m. March 3. A laptop computer was stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked dining-room window.

Light House Ct., 5300 block, 7 a.m. March 7 to 7 a.m. March 8. A laptop computer and jewelry were stolen from a residence entered by breaking a front window.

Oakland Mills Rd., 5700 block, 7:27 a.m. March 7. A press box at a park was entered by forcing a side door. Nothing was reported missing.

Quilting Way, 6500 block, 8 p.m. March 9 to 9 a.m. March 10. An attempt was made to enter a residence by breaking a window. Nothing was reported missing.

Rustling Leaf, 9300 block, 6 p.m. March 8 to 8:30 a.m. March 9. Two laptop computers, a bicycle, two cameras, a video game system and video games were stolen from a residence entered by forcing a basement window. The bicycle was recovered.

Winter Rose Path, 7100 block, 11 a.m. to 10 p.m. March 9. A shed was entered by cutting a lock. Nothing was reported missing.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Green Shoot Ct., 12200 block, 12:39 a.m. March 10. A blue 2007 Toyota Camry was stolen.

Little Patuxent Pkwy., 10300 block, 5:14 to 6:14 p.m. March 7. A black 2007 Toyota Camry was stolen from a parking lot at a mall.

ELLICOTT CITY AREA INDECENT EXPOSURE INCIDENTS

West Springs Dr., 3100 block, 3:30 p.m. March 10. A male driving a blue sedan was seen performing a lewd act inside the vehicle.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Berkshire Lane, 10200 block, 6 a.m. March 4 to 8:50 p.m. March 7. Three watches and a diamond ring were stolen from a lock box in a residence entered by breaking glass in a back door.

Bonnie Branch Rd., 4800 block, 8:15 a.m. to 5 p.m. March 11. A laptop computer and a jewelry box were stolen from a residence entered by breaking a kitchen window. An attempt also was made to kick in the front door.

Brady Ct., 5100 block, 8 a.m. to 9 p.m. March 8. A bike was stolen from an open garage at a residence.

Coventry Court Dr., 3300 block, 1:41 a.m. March 8. An attempt was made to enter a residence by damaging a door. A man was seen running away from the premises empty-handed.

Globe Dr., 10200 block, 11 p.m. March 7 to 7 a.m. March 8. An attempt was made to enter a residence by cutting a screen to a back door. Nothing was reported missing.

Globe Dr., 10200 block, 11 p.m. March 7 to 7 a.m. March 8. An attempt was made to enter a residence by cutting a screen to a sliding door. Nothing was reported missing.

Globe Dr., 10200 block, 11 p.m. March 7 to 7 a.m. March 8. An attempt was made to enter a residence by cutting a screen to a sliding door. Nothing was reported missing.

Globe Dr., 10200 block, 11 p.m. March 7 to 7 a.m. March 8. Attempts were made to enter a residence by cutting screens to two back doors. Nothing was reported missing.

Globe Dr., 10200 block, 11 p.m. March 7 to 7 a.m. March 8. Attempts were made to enter a residence by forcing a basement door and by cutting a screen to a porch. Nothing was reported missing.

Globe Dr., 10200 block, 3:31 a.m. March 8. An occupied residence was entered through an unlocked back door. The intruder fled empty-handed when confronted.

GLENELG AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Bison Ct., 14100 block, 10:32 a.m. March 9. Jewelry was stolen from a residence entered through a basement window.

JESSUP AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Pine Tree Rd., 8600 block, 11:30 p.m. March 10 to 11 p.m. March 11. A residence was entered by kicking in the front door. Nothing was reported missing.

LAUREL AREA MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Country Meadows Lane, 9700 block, 5:42 a.m. March 8. A 2012 Suzuki motorcycle was stolen.

Washingtonpost.com


March 22, 2012 Thursday 8:12 PM EST 


Montgomery County crime report Montgomery County crime report


SECTION: Metro; Pg. T26


LENGTH: 2201 words


Montgomery County

These were among incidents received by the Montgomery County Police Department. For information, call 240-773-5030.

Rewards for information

Crime Solvers of Montgomery County, a nonprofit community organization, pays up to $1,000 for information leading to an arrest and indictment in connection with these and any other felony crimes. Call the 24-hour hotline at 800-673-2777. Callers may remain anonymous.

DISTRICT 1ROCKVILLE STATION240-773-6070 ROBBERIES

Dawson Ave., 200 block, 7:55 p.m. Feb. 29. Two men threatened a person, then fled with property. A 24-year-old man of no fixed address and an 18-year-old Rockville man were arrested. 

Rockville Pike, 800 block, 5 p.m. March 4. Three teenagers threatened a person in a fast-food restaurant parking lot, then fled with property. Three Rockville females, ages 14, 15 and 16, were arrested.

Alexandria Arlington Crime Watch


SECTION: ALEXANDRIA - ARLINGTON EXTRA; Pg. T17


LENGTH: 545 words


The following were among crime reports received recently from the Alexandria Police Department. For more information, call 703-838-4636.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

ARMISTEAD ST. N., 400 block, 6:30 p.m. May 9 to 9 p.m. May 10. Cash was stolen from a residence.  

COMMONWEALTH AVE., 1700 block, 2 a.m. May 10. An intruder entered an apartment by forcing open a bathroom window, then fled empty-handed when confronted by a resident.

LEE ST. S., 100 block, 10:30 a.m. May 12 to 5 p.m. May 14. Cash was stolen from a residence entered by forcing open a rear door.

VAN DORN ST. S., 200 block, 8:30 a.m. to 6:35 p.m. May 12. Cash, jewelry and electronic equipment were stolen from a residence.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

BEAUREGARD ST. N., 2200 block, 9:30 p.m. May 13 to 1:20 p.m. May 14. A brown 1982 Chevrolet van was stolen.

BRANCH AVE., 3400 block, 2:30 a.m. to 1:30 p.m. May 9. A gray 1988 Toyota Camry was stolen.

KENWOOD AVE., 1500 block, 9 to 10 p.m. May 9. A black 2000 Cadillac was stolen.

KING ST., 3800 block, 9:30 to 11:30 p.m. May 7. A burgundy 1990 Ford Mustang was stolen.

MERTON CT., 5700 block, 10 p.m. May 11 to 8:45 a.m. May 12. A red 1996 Acura Integra was stolen.

PICKETT ST. S., 800 block, 12:30 to 5:30 a.m. May 10. Four blue-and-white 1998 Mack rental trucks containing furniture were stolen. One of the trucks was recovered the same day in Prince George's County, Maryland.

WYNDHAM CIR., 3300 block, 8 p.m. May 12 to 6:30 a.m. May 14. A black 1997 Harley-Davidson motorcycle was stolen.

The following were among crime reports received recently by the Arlington County Police Department. For more information, call 703-228-4050.

REWARDS FOR INFORMATION

Arlington County Crime Solvers, a nonprofit community organization, will pay up to $ 1,000 for information leading to an arrest in connection with felonies. Call the 24-hour hotline at 703-522-8477. Callers may remain anonymous.

SEXUAL ASSAULTS 

RANDOLPH ST. N., 800 block, 11:25 p.m. May 10. A man grabbed a female pedestrian, 23, and attempted to pull her into nearby bushes. The victim broke away and began to shout. The assailant fled.

ASSAULTS

MOORE ST. N., 1900 block, 12:51 a.m. May 10. A person shouted obscenities at two men, ages 30 and 27, who were leaving a restaurant, then assaulted the older man. When the younger man ordered the assailant to stop, the assailant hit him.

ROBBERIES

CLARENDON BLVD., 3000 block, 10:12 p.m. May 8. A man attempted to grab a bag from a female pedestrian, 29, who pushed away the robber. The victim ran for help, and the robber fled empty-handed.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

WILSON BLVD., 1000 block, 10:30 a.m. to 1:30 p.m. May 9. A laptop computer was stolen from an apartment.

EIGHTH ST. S., 2600 block, 7:40 a.m. to 2:30 p.m. May 8. Cash, keys and a shirt were stolen from an apartment building maintenance room entered by forcing open a door.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

ABINGDON ST. S., 2800 block. A white 1991 Toyota Camry was stolen.

JEFFERSON ST. S., 1000 block. A black 1997 Honda Accord was stolen.

THOMAS ST. N., 200 block. A blue 1981 Pontiac Grand Prix was stolen.

WILSON BLVD., 4200 block. A white 1988 Toyota Camry was stolen.

EIGHTH ST. S., 2800 block. A white 1990 Toyota Camry was stolen.

31ST ST. S., 4200 block. A brown 1989 Toyota Camry was stolen.

-- Sarah Lane

Montgomery County 

These were among incidents recorded by the Montgomery County Police Department's Media Services Division, which may not have received complete reports from all six stations for today's Extra. For more information, call 240-773-5030.

REWARDS FOR INFORMATION

Crime Solvers of Montgomery County Inc., a nonprofit community organization, will pay up to $1,000 for information leading to an arrest and indictment in connection with these and any other felony crimes. Call the 24-hour hotline at 800-673-2777. Callers may remain anonymous.

District 1 Rockville Station Telephone: 240-773-6070

SEXUAL ASSAULTS 

PARKLAWN DR., 12000 block, 12:00 a.m. Sept. 21. A man in a wooded area attempted to rape a person. A male acquaintance of the victim has been identified as a suspect.

ROBBERIES

PLYERS MILL ROAD AND CLARK AVENUE AREA, Sept. 21 to Sept. 23. Several people stopped a pizza deliveryman attempting to make a delivery and demanded his pizza. When the man refused, he was shot with pepper spray. Two days later, another fake pizza delivery was called in. When the driver arrived, he recognized one of the people who had robbed him. A Silver Spring male was arrested and charged with both robberies.

URBANA DR., 2700 block, 12:30 to 7:30 p.m. Sept. 21. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

WELLER RD., 2700 block, 2:30 to 3:30 p.m. Sept. 21. Property was stolen from a residence.

WELLER RD., 3200 block, Sept. 15 to Sept. 20. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

District 5 Germantown Station Telephone: 301-840-2650

ASSAULTS

CINNAMON DRIVE AND GINGER COURT, 10:30 p.m. Sept. 23. Two men, one armed with a knife, assaulted a person and fled.

SMOKE HOUSE CT., 18200 block, 11:23 p.m. Sept. 21. Two men, one of them armed with a handgun, assaulted a person, took property and fled in a black Ford Focus.

ROBBERIES

SAGE TERR., 12800 7:55 p.m. Sept. 19. Five men accosted a person, took property and fled.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

BAILIWICK TERR., 13900 block, 10:45 a.m. to 12:45 p.m. Sept. 19. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

CHINA ASTER CT., 21300 block, 7:30 to 8:30 a.m. Sept. 21. A theft from a vehicle occurred. A man, 29, and a Silver Spring man, 18, were arrested and charged with theft.

DEMETRIOUS WAY, 13300 block, 7:45 p.m. Sept. 25. A man claiming to be an installer for the Department of Homeland Security told a person outside of his residence that he had been selected for a free alarm system and he wanted to come inside to install the alarm. The solicitor persisted and tried to persuade the resident to let him enter the home. Police later identified another victim of the scam, who said the man also asked to inspect their home for installation. The man fled in a small, dark-gray or black "sports car" type vehicle.

GRAND ELM ST., 16900 block, Sept. 21 to Sept. 24. Property was stolen from a construction site.

FREDERICK RD., 24400 block, 7 p.m. April 24 to 7:23 a.m. Sept. 25. A landscaping supply company was entered by force. Nothing was reported missing.

GERMANTOWN AND CLOPPER ROADS, Sept. 18 to Sept. 19. Tires were taken from a commercial vehicle overnight.

GERMANTOWN AND LEAMAN FARM ROADS, Sept. 18 to Sept. 19. Tires were taken from a commercial vehicle overnight.

ROCKINGHAM CT., 1 to 100 block, 12:30 to 7 p.m. Sept. 22. A 17-year-old male attempted to enter a residence. Nothing was reported missing.

ST. PETER CT., 12200 block, 6:52 p.m. Sept. 23. Two men and two women forced their way into a residence. One of the assailants pulled out a gun. The robbers realized they invaded the "wrong" residence and left empty-handed.

STAFFORDSHIRE PL., 13400 block, 7 to 7:30 a.m. Sept. 20. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

TIMBER CREEK LANE, 23100 block, 1 to 6:30 a.m. Sept. 18. Property was stolen from a residence.

VANDER TERR., 13000 block, 10 p.m. Sept. 18 to 9:30 a.m. Sept. 19. A Global Positioning System device was taken from a vehicle entered by force.

VANDER TERR., 13000 block, 7 to 7:45 a.m. Sept. 19. A Global Positioning System device was taken from a vehicle entered by force.

District 6 Gaithersburg Station Telephone: 240-773-5700

ROBBERIES

CENTERWAY AND CLUB HOUSE ROADS, 1 a.m. Sept. 23. A male, armed with a handgun, and a female companion robbed a person of property and fled.

CORAL REEF DR., 500 block, 1:30 a.m. Sept. 23. A group of six people accosted a person, took property and fled.

MUDDY BRANCH RD., 350 block, 8:15 a.m. Sept. 19. A man armed with a handgun robbed a retail store and fled.

OLDE TOWN AVE., 100 block, 9 p.m. Sept. 18. A man at a parking garage took property from a person and fled.

SPICEBERRY CIR., 7900 block, 1 a.m. Sept. 25. Three men armed with handguns forced their way into a residence, took property and fled.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

CLOPPER AND LONGDRAFT ROADS, Sept. 20 to Sept. 21. Thefts from three vehicles occurred.

FREDERICK AVE. N., 400 block, 3:15 a.m. Sept. 24. Property was stolen from an outdoor gear and supplies store entered by force.

GREAT SENECA HIGHWAY, SAM EIG HIGHWAY AND KEY WEST AVENUE AREA, Sept. 19 to Sept. 22. Several thefts from vehicles occurred.

QUINCE ORCHARD RD., 600 block, 9:30 p.m. Sept. 21. Three men snatched a woman's purse, assaulted and robbed a man, then fled.

SHERWOOD GREEN WAY, 19300 block, 11:20 p.m. Sept. 24. An attempt was made to enter a residence.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

STERLING TERR., 10000 block, 7:20 a.m. Sept. 18. A man took a 2002 black four-door Audi A6 with Maryland tags.

 Rockville

These were among incidents reported by the Rockville Police Department. For more information, call 240-314-8922.

ROBBERIES

LEWIS AVENUE AND HALPINE ROAD, 10:20 to 10:40 p.m. Oct. 5. A male, 13, was arrested and charged with attempted robbery, attempted theft, second-degree assault and carrying a concealed deadly weapon (knife) in connection with an incident at the above location.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

COLLEGE PKWY., 800 block, 11:30 p.m. Oct. 5 to 12:15 p.m. Oct. 6. A laptop computer was stolen from an apartment.

GIBBS ST., 100 block, 4:10 to 6:15 p.m. Sept. 21. An address book was stolen from a retail store.

GRUENTHER AVE., 9:30 p.m. Oct. 2 to 9:30 a.m. Oct. 3. Cash was stolen from an unlocked vehicle.

KING FARM BLVD., 900 block, 8 a.m. to 4:15 p.m. Oct. 2. Jewelry was stolen from a hotel room.

MANNAKEE ST., 600 block, noon Sept. 22 to 8 p.m. Sept. 23. A cellphone was taken from a park.

MIDDLE LANE E., 200 block, 5:45 to 5:50 p.m. Oct. 7. A purse and a set of rosary beads were stolen from a restaurant.

RADFORD CT., 1 to 100 block, 1:01 a.m. Oct. 1 to 1:01 a.m. Oct. 2. A video recorder and a digital music player were stolen from a residence.

RICHARD MONTGOMERY DR., 200 block, noon to 12:30 p.m. Oct. 1. A cellphone was stolen from a tote bag in a classroom.

ROCKVILLE PIKE, 1300 block, 6:40 p.m. Oct. 7 to 7:28 a.m. Oct. 8. A bakery was entered by breaking out a glass front door. Nothing was reported missing.

ROCKVILLE PIKE, 1400 block, 8 p.m. Oct. 7 to 8:30 a.m. Oct. 8. Cash was stolen from a market entered by breaking out glass of a front door.

ROCKVILLE PIKE, 1600 block, 5:30 to 5:45 p.m. Sept. 30. Several items of clothing were stolen from a retail store.

SHETLAND ST., 700 block, 9:30 p.m. Oct. 2 to 9:30 a.m. Oct. 3. Cash and a camera were stolen from an unlocked vehicle.

SHETLAND ST., 700 block, 9:30 p.m. Oct. 2 to 9:30 a.m. Oct. 3. A backpack, a radar detector, clothing and a flashlight were stolen from two vehicles.

TWEED ST., 1700 block, 8 p.m. Oct. 2 to 7 a.m. Oct. 3. Cash was stolen from an unlocked vehicle.

VEIRS MILL RD., 2000 block, 3:45 p.m. Sept. 29. A theft occurred. A Rockville man, 23, and a male companion of an unreported age and no fixed address were arrested and charged with shoplifting.

Takoma Park

These were among incidents reported by the Takoma Park Police Department. For more information, call 301-891-7102.

ROBBERIES

CARROLL AVE., 7000 block, 10:04 p.m. Oct. 10. Three men at a bus stop assaulted a male pedestrian, and one of the attackers tried to drag him into the bushes. The pedestrian was struck several times but managed to escape. No injuries were reported. The attackers took the man's backpack and cellphone before they fled on foot.

WEAPONS VIOLATIONS

HOUSTON AVE., 600 block, 5:30 a.m. Oct. 8. A man was arrested and charged with illegal possession of a firearm by a convicted felon, reckless endangerment, obstructing and hindering a police officer and a second weapons-related charge.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

CEDAR AVE., 7400 block, 10 p.m. Oct. 5. A man entered a residence by removing a porch window from its frame. A man was arrested and charged with first-degree burglary.

DAVIS AVE., 900 block, 4:58 p.m. Oct. 10. A theft occurred. A man was arrested and charged with theft under $500.

LARCH AVE., 800 block, 1 to 7 a.m. Oct. 11. Property was stolen from a 1993 Honda Accord entered by prying open a front door.

NEW HAMPSHIRE AVE., 6300 block, 1:30 p.m. Oct. 11. A theft occurred. A man was arrested and charged with theft under $500.

UNIVERSITY BLVD., 1300 block, 7:18 p.m. Oct. 5. A youth was arrested and charged with theft under $500.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

LEE AVE., 1 to 100 block, 1 to 7:43 a.m. Oct. 7. A 2001 Dodge Caravan was stolen.

HOUSTON AVE., 600 block, 9:30 p.m. Oct. 8 to 8 p.m. Oct. 9. A 1999 Acura Integra was stolen.

LINCOLN AVE., 500 block, 9:30 to 11 p.m. Oct. 7. A 1999 Plymouth Voyager was stolen.

TULIP AVE., 300 block, 7 p.m. Oct. 6 to 8:15 a.m. Oct. 7. A 1999 Dodge Caravan was stolen.

Washingtonpost.com


March 15, 2012 Thursday 8:12 PM EST 


Anne Arundel County and Howard County crime report Anne Arundel County and Howard County crime report


SECTION: Metro; Pg. T21


LENGTH: 1682 words


Anne Arundel County

These were among incidents reported by Anne Arundel County police. For information, call 410-222-8050.

Rewards for information

Metro Crime Stoppers will pay up to $2,000 for information leading to arrests and indictments in connection with these and other felonies. Visit metrocrimestoppers.net, call the hotline at 866-756-2587 or text 274637. For text messages, type the letters "mcs" without the quote marks in the text field, then hit the space key before writing the crime tip. If the text is received, you will receive an acknowledgment.

ANNAPOLIS AREA ROBBERIES

Annapolis Mall, 5:04 p.m. Feb. 23. Three males threatened a couple in a parking garage and robbed them of a laptop, then fled in a black BMW. On Feb. 29, a District man, 18, was charged with robbery.  

ARNOLD AREA INDECENT EXPOSURE INCIDENTS

College Pkwy., 100 block, Feb. 16 to Feb. 22. After receiving several reports of a male in a silver vehicle exposing himself at different campus locations, police detained a man driving a 2009 Honda. An Annapolis man, 28, was charged with three counts of indecent exposure and two counts of disorderly conduct.

BROOKLYN PARK AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Charles St., 200 block, 10:08 a.m. March 7. Responding to a report of a break-in, police saw a man jump from the second floor of a residence to the back yard. An Arbutus man, 29, was arrested at the scene. He was charged with several counts of burglary and related violations.

10th Ave.,300 block, 4:45 a.m. March 8. Two males seen carrying property through a yard at a residence were arrested in a nearby area. Two Brooklyn Park men, ages 22 and 25, were charged with first-degree burglary, theft and trespassing.

CROFTON AREA SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Crofton Center, 1600 block, 6:28 p.m. March 1. A male displayed sexually explicit cellphone-photos to a minor at a store.

FORT MEADE AREA ROBBERIES

Clark Rd., 1100 block, 10:48 a.m. Feb. 29. A group of males attacked a teenager in a school hallway and robbed him of a cellphone and a coat. Two Severn men, ages 18 and 19, were charged with first- and second-degree assault, reckless endangerment, robbery, conspiracy to commit robbery and theft. Two Severn males, ages 16 and 17, were charged with robbery, second-degree assault, theft and threatening a student on school property. The victim was treated for his injuries at a hospital.

GLEN BURNIE AREA PEEPING TOM INCIDENTS

Ritchie Hwy., 6600 block, 6:10 p.m. March 4. A male took photos inside a women's restroom at a restaurant.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Southbridge Dr.,100 block, 10:19 p.m. March 7. While responding to a report of a break-in at a vacant apartment, police received a cellphone report of a robbery at a nearby location. That report was false, and a man found inside the apartment was determined to have made that call to divert police. A man, 32, of no fixed address, was charged with third- and fourth-degree burglary and with telephone misuse.

Annapolis

These were among incidents reported by the Annapolis Police Department. For information, call 410-268-9000. To anonymously report non-emergency crime or suspicious activity, call 410-280-2583.

WEAPONS OFFENSES

President St., 1000 block, March 6. A man wielding a handgun was arrested. A Brooklyn man, 44, was charged with possession of a firearm, possession of a controlled dangerous substance and almost a dozen traffic violations.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Admiral Dr., 200 block, 9:30 p.m. March 2 to 10:30 a.m. March 3. A laptop and four chrome hubcaps were stolen from an unlocked vehicle in a driveway.

Bowman Dr., 1800 block, 7:30 p.m. Feb. 28 to 6:30 a.m. Feb. 29. A green Huffy mountain bike was stolen.

Bywater Rd. and Belle Dr., 1:30 p.m. Feb. 21 to 4:30 a.m. March 4. License plates were among property stolen from an unlocked vehicle.

Mooring Point Ct., unit block, 4:30 p.m. Feb. 26 to 7 a.m. Feb. 27. A digital media player and a Global Positioning System device were stolen from an unlocked vehicle. Three other unlocked vehicles parked nearby were searched, with nothing reported missing.

Ridgely Ave., unit block, 9 a.m. to 3 p.m. Feb. 23. A GPS device was among property stolen from a convertible that had been parked with its top down.

Tyler Ave., 1300 block, 9 p.m. March 3 to 2 a.m. March 4. The contents of a piggybank and a bottle containing coins were stolen from a residence entered by forcing a back door.

Woodlawn Ave., 100 block, 3 p.m. March 5 to 8 a.m. March 6. A GPS device was stolen from a vehicle.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Annapolitan Lane, 500 block, 10:30 to 11:59 p.m. March 3. A green 2002 Ford Explorer was stolen.

Greenbriar Lane, 600 block, 8:30 to 8:40 p.m. March 6. A black 1999 Acura four-door sedan was stolen using keys left in the ignition.

Taylor Ave., 600 block, 6:50 p.m. March 1. A vehicle that had been left with its engine running was stolen from behind a store by a man fleeing from a security guard after being confronted while trying to shoplift a case of vodka. The vehicle was recovered a short time later in the 400 block of Captains Circle. Located nearby, an Annapolis man, 49, was arrested.

Howard County

These were among incidents reported by the Howard County Police Department. For information, call 410-313-2236. To anonymously provide information about these and other crimes, call the Stop Crime tip line: 410-313-7867.

CLARKSVILLE AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Running Fence Lane, 12200 block, Jan. 15. A small refrigerator was stolen from a vacant residence. There was no sign of forced entry.

Silent Sun Pl., 5800 block, 9:01 p.m. March 2 to 6:30 a.m. March 3. Cash was stolen from a wallet at a residence entered through an open garage.

COLUMBIA AREA ROBBERIES

Little Patuxent Pkwy., 10300 block, 9:30 p.m. March 2. A male teenager demanded cash from a pedestrian outside a restaurant, then pushed the victim into bushes and fled empty-handed with several accomplices. No injuries were reported.

Little Patuxent Pkwy., 10300 block, 7 p.m. March 3. A group of males at a mall robbed a male of cash at knifepoint.

Little Patuxent Pkwy., 10300 block, 9:08 p.m. March 3. Two males robbed a mall security guard of his cellphone at gunpoint.

Little Patuxent Pkwy., 10300 block, 4:11 p.m. March 4. A male teenager in a mall parking lot grabbed a female from behind and tried to take her cellphone. After a struggle, he fled empty-handed. No injuries were reported.

Little Patuxent Pkwy., 7 p.m. March 7. Three males demanded cash from two pedestrians near a bus stop, then fled empty-handed when the victims said that they had none.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Cloudleap Ct., 8700 block, 2:49 a.m. March 2. A safe was stolen from a dry-cleaning business entered by forcing a front door.

Cloudleap Ct., 8700 block, 2:59 a.m. March 2. An attempt was made to enter a store by forcing a front door. Nothing was reported missing.

Columbia Rd., 5400 block, 7:30 a.m. to 3 p.m. March 5. Jewelry was stolen from a residence. There was no sign of forced entry.

Covered Wagon Dr., 9600 block, 10 a.m. to 5:55 p.m. March 2. A flat-screen TV and laptops were stolen from a residence entered by forcing the front door.

Hickory Ridge Rd., 10700 block, 6:30 a.m. to 10 p.m. March 7. Cash was stolen from an apartment.

Little Foxes Run, 6100 block, 5 to 10:15 p.m. March 2. Computers, cash, jewelry and an identification badge were stolen from a residence entered through a door on the second floor.

Minstrel Way, 7000 block, 4 p.m. March 3 to 6 a.m. March 5. Two generators and a cordless drill were stolen from a construction trailer entered by removing a lock.

Route 175, 6600 block, noon Feb. 26 to 9 a.m. March 6. A shed was entered by kicking in a door. Nothing was reported missing.

Swift Stream Pl., 10400 block, 12:24 p.m. March 1. A computer was stolen from a residence.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Little Patuxent Pkwy., 10300 block, 10:09 p.m. March 5. A green 1999 Honda Accord was stolen.

ELKRIDGE AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Race Rd., 6500 block, Feb. 27 to March 1. A stamp collection, a collection of model cars, sports memorabilia and rare coins were stolen from a storage container in a building accessed by cutting a hole in a fence.

Lark Brown Rd., 8400 block, 7:04 p.m. March 3. Jewelry and cash were stolen from a residence entered by kicking in the front door.

ELLICOTT CITY AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Baltimore National Pike, 8300 block, 2:59 a.m. March 8. A display case of cigars was stolen from a gas station entered by breaking a window.

Dorsey Hall Dr., 4900 block, 9:45 a.m. to 4:45 p.m. March 7. Prescription medication, DVDs, CDs and a computer-docking station were stolen from a residence entered by forcing the front door.

Raleigh Tavern Lane, 10200 block, Feb. 20 to Feb. 25. A set of golf clubs was stolen from a garage entered through a side door.

Waterloo Rd., 5600 block, 12:07 p.m. March 6. Responding to a report of people seen inside a house that had been partially burned down, police arrested two Ellicott City men, ages 19 and 23. Charges included first-, third- and fourth-degree burglary, theft, drug possession, destruction of property and with making a false statement to police.

LAUREL AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Barrel House Rd., 9800 block, noon to 2:30 p.m. March 2. Laptops were stolen from a residence entered by kicking in a front door.

Covered Wagon Dr., 9600 block, 10 a.m. to 5:55 p.m. March 2. A flat-screen TV and laptops were stolen from a residence entered by forcing the front door.

- Compiled by Carrie Donovan

July 17, 2008 Thursday

Crime Report


SECTION: EXTRAS; Pg. VA17


LENGTH: 888 words


Alexandria

These were among incidents reported by the Alexandria Police Department. For more information, call 703-838-4636 or http://www.alexandriava.gov/police.

ASSAULTS

ASCOT CT., 5500 block, 7:10 to 7:30 a.m. July 7. Two males assaulted a 21-year-old Alexandria man. He was taken to a hospital and treated.

ROBBERIES

CHETWORTH CT., 1300 block, 1:05 a.m. July 5. A male robbed an Alexandria man and a District man of property at gunpoint. 

MOUNT VERNON AVE., 3100 block, 1:02 a.m. July 6. After demanding cash from a Fairfax County male car owner, the robber took the vehicle.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

PRINCESS ST., 1600 block, 1:27 p.m. July 7. A residence was entered. Nothing was reported stolen.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

BRECKINRIDGE PL. N., 200 block, 1:30 p.m. July 3 to 9 p.m. July 7. A white 2003 Ford E350 van was stolen.

COMMONWEALTH AVE., 3700 block, 10:30 p.m. July 7 to 9 a.m. July 8. A blue Toyota Corolla was stolen.

MENOKIN DR., 2400 block, 7:15 to 9:15 p.m. July 2. A blue 2007 Honda Accord was stolen.

REYNOLDS ST. S., 100 block, 12:30 a.m. to noon July 3. A green 1997 Honda Accord station wagon was stolen.

Arlington

These were among incidents reported by the Arlington County Police Department. For more information, call 703-228-4050 or visit http://www.arlingtoncrimesolvers.org.

SEXUAL ASSAULTS 

EADS ST. S., 1200 block, 5 p.m. July 6. A man grabbed a female pedestrian on a walkway. Police located an Alexandria man, 20, who was charged with sexual battery.

ASSAULTS

ARLINGTON MILL DR. S., 2500 block, midnight July 7. An object that was thrown from a moving vehicle hit a male pedestrian on the head. The pedestrian was taken to a hospital.

FERN ST. S., 1800 block, 3 a.m. July 6. A woman reported that a man had followed her taxi from a club in the District and approached her when she got out of the cab. The man held a knife to the woman, who freed herself and called police.

GEORGE MASON DR. N., 400 block, 11:30 p.m. July 4. A man tried to take a beer from another man, who refused. The first man then broke a bottle and stabbed the other in the arm. The victim was taken to a hospital. An Arlington man, 22, was charged with malicious wounding.

ABDUCTIONS

GARFIELD ST. S., 500 block, 4 a.m. July 4. After an argument, a man took a 21-month-old child without the mother's consent. When she followed him, she observed him assault the child. The woman ran to a nearby house to call police. The child was located at the man's home and in need of medical attention. The child was taken to a hospital. An Arlington man, 19, was charged with abduction and felony child abuse.

ROBBERIES

CHAIN BRIDGE RD., 100 block, 2:30 p.m. July 6. A woman found a man inside her vehicle, and when she confronted him, the man pushed her and took her car keys.

NELSON ST., 1000 block, 3:30 p.m. July 8. A male robbed a man of medication.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

CLARK ST. S., 1200 block, 7:30 a.m. July 7. A business was entered. Nothing was reported missing.

COLUMBUS ST. S., 900 block, 2 p.m. July 3 to 6 a.m. July 7. Construction material was stolen from a construction site.

COURTHOUSE RD. N., 1200 block, 4 a.m. July 3. A woman awoke in her apartment bedroom and saw a man exposing himself in the room. The woman ran out of the apartment, and the man fled.

EDGEWOOD ST. S., 2000 block, 2 a.m. July 8. A male entered a residence and assaulted a sleeping man.

EDISON ST. N., 1500 block, July 3 to July 5 . Electronic items were stolen from a residence.

GLEBE RD. N., 600 block, 7:45 to 8:20 p.m. July 6. Property of three people was stolen from a locker room in an ice rink.

HAYES ST. S., 1100 block, 8:30 p.m. July 2. Electronic items were stolen from three vehicles entered by breaking windows.

JOHN MARSHALL DR. N., 3000 block, 9 p.m. July 1 to 6:30 a.m. July 2. Property was stolen from nine vehicles in the Rock Spring and Williamsburg neighborhoods.

LONGFELLOW ST. N., 500 block, 6 p.m. July 2 to 10 a.m. July 3. Cash was stolen from a residence.

NELSON ST. S., 2400 block, 1:15 to 4 p.m. July 5. An attempt was made to enter a residence by breaking a window.

NELSON ST. S., 6500 block, 2 a.m. July 8. Police, responding to an alarm at a school, found two broken windows.

SCOTT ST. N., 1800 block, 3:45 to 4:10 a.m. July 7. Property was stolen from four vehicles in a garage.

WILSON BLVD., 2100 block, 5 p.m. July 3 to 8:45 a.m. July 7. Computer equipment was stolen from a business.

WILSON BLVD., 3100 block, 4 a.m. July 2. A man prevented a male from stealing property from his vehicle. A Falls Church man, 28, was charged with possession of burglary tools, receiving stolen property, tampering with an automobile, grand theft, petty theft and assault.

NINTH ST. S., 2700 block, 8:45 a.m. to 8:30 p.m. July 8. Cash was stolen from an apartment.

20TH ST. S., 200 block, 3:30 p.m. July 3 to noon July 7. Electronic equipment was stolen from a construction office.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

CHESTERFIELD RD. S., 5000 block, July 3. A beige 1996 Honda Accord was stolen.

GLEBE RD. S., 3600 block, July 3. A silver 2002 Acura RSX was stolen.

JEFFERSON DAVIS HWY., 2600 block, July 5. A black 2008 Dodge Charger was stolen.

TROY ST. N., 1700 block, July 2. A black 2002 Acura Integra was stolen.

FOUR MILE RUN DR., 3800 block, July 3. A beige 1999 Kia Sophia was stolen.

FOUR MILE RUN DR. S., 3700 block, July 7. A black 1998 Mack truck was stolen.

-- Compiled by RIA MANGLAPUS

The Washington Post


September 17, 2009 Thursday  
Every Edition


Crime Report


SECTION: EXTRAS; Pg. PW14


LENGTH: 828 words


Prince William

The following incidents were reported by Prince William County police. For information, call 703-792-7245.

Dale City Area

SEXUAL ASSAULTS 

FAIRFIELD LANE, 2:30 a.m. Sept. 8. A man allegedly raped a female juvenile relative. A 37-year-old Dale City man was arrested.

ROBBERIES

DALE BLVD., 4300 block, 7 p.m. Sept. 7. Two males asked a man for money. When the man gave them $2, the two demanded more. The man told them he had none, and they punched him and searched his pockets. The man was treated for injuries. 

DARBYDALE AVE., 14800 block, 8:12 p.m. Sept. 1. Two men grabbed a cellphone from a male juvenile and fled. The cellphone was found in a field.

Dumfries Area

ROBBERIES

JURGENSEN DR., 3600 block, 9:10 p.m. Sept. 1. A male approached a man who was sitting in the bed of a truck with another man and hit him in the head with a handgun. The man attempted to run away, and the gunman chased him. The second man punched the gunman and grabbed him. The gunman threatened to shoot the second man, then broke free and chased the first man, demanding his property. The gunman robbed the first man of cash and a wallet.

KILMER LANE, 18100 block, midnight Sept. 2. Two men allegedly assaulted a pizza deliveryman, who fought back. One of the assailants attempted to use a stun device on the deliveryman. No injuries were reported. The two fled with a case containing food. Two Dumfries men, both 21, were arrested.

Gainesville Area

ASSAULTS

POND CIR., 14800 block, 3:27 p.m. Sept. 6. A male juvenile was stabbed in the back with an unidentified object during an argument involving several people. The juvenile was treated at a hospital. Two Gainesville males, 16 and 18, were arrested.

Manassas Area

SEXUAL ASSAULTS 

ALLEGRO DR., 9600 block, 1 p.m. Aug. 31. A male juvenile at a residence allegedly picked up a female juvenile acquaintance, carried her out to a deck and inappropriately touched her. She shouted, but the juvenile would not let her go. When a second youth went to help her, the juvenile reportedly punched him in the face. A 16-year-old male was arrested.

SUNSET DR., 1:40 a.m. Sept. 1. A man allegedly attacked a female juvenile acquaintance in her garage. The man reportedly forced her onto a couch, held her down and covered her mouth. The girl escaped, and the man grabbed her again and forced her onto the couch. The girl broke free a second time and notified a relative, who called police. A 19-year-old Manassas man was arrested.

Woodbridge Area

SEXUAL ASSAULTS 

FOXGLOVE CT., Aug. 27. Three men allegedly had sexual intercourse with a girl. The girl's mother returned home, found the girl and another juvenile intoxicated and took them to a hospital. A 19-year-old Woodbridge man, a 19-year-old Dale City man and an 18-year-old Alexandria man were arrested.

ASSAULTS

HOLLOW WIND WAY, 13900 block, 9:30 a.m. Sept. 6. During an argument outside a residence, a gunman allegedly threatened a female relative. When a police officer arrived, the man held the woman with the gun to her head. The man attempted to force open a door of the residence while holding the woman between himself and the officer. When a resident opened the door, the man and the woman fell into the residence. The woman ran outside, and the man and resident struggled. A bullet was fired, and the two continued to struggle. When a second bullet was fired, the resident was able to kick the gun outside, and police officers entered the residence. A 44-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested. The resident was treated for injuries.

MARSALA CT., 2900 block, 12:28 p.m. Sept. 7. During an argument, a man allegedly stabbed a male acquaintance. The acquaintance was treated at a hospital. A 28-year-old Temple Hills man was arrested.

ROBBERIES

EAST LONGVIEW DR., 1300 block, midnight Sept. 6. Two males punched a man in the face and demanded money. When the man told them he had none, they punched him again and took his cellphone.

GARDENVIEW LOOP, 1000 block, 1:51 a.m. Sept. 2. Three people in an apartment stairwell robbed a man of cash, a wallet and a cellphone at gunpoint. One of the robbers hit the man in the head with the gun.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

FOULGERS SQ., 13700 block, 4:20 p.m. Sept. 4. Two women allegedly took property from a department store. Two Woodbridge women, 18 and 19, were arrested.

Manassas

No report was received from Manassas police for today's Extra. For information, call 703-257-8000.

Manassas Park

The following incidents were reported by Manassas Park police. For information, call 703-361-1136.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

CENTREVILLE RD., 8500 block, 10 p.m. Sept. 3. A male stole a Global Positioning System device and a cellphone from a vehicle.

CONNER DR., 8200 block, July 27 to Aug. 28. Tire rims were stolen from a vehicle. A radio was stolen from another vehicle entered by breaking a window, and an air bag was stolen from a third vehicle.

OLD CENTREVILLE RD., 100 block, 8 p.m. Aug. 25 to 8 a.m. Aug. 26. Tools were stolen from a van.

-- Compiled by SARAH LANE

Southern Maryland crime report


SECTION: METRO; Pg. T28


LENGTH: 838 words


Calvert County

These were among reports received by the Calvert County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. Anyone with information about these crimes should call the Criminal Investigation Division, 410-535-2800 or 301-855-1194, or the Crime Solvers line, 410-535-2880. You can also call the Prince Frederick Barrack of the state police at 410-535-1400.

CHESAPEAKE BEACH

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Chesapeake Beach, 3:19 p.m. Sept. 20. Three bottles of prescription medication were stolen from an unlocked vehicle. 

LUSBY AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Waco Ct., 12:34 p.m. Sept. 17. Coins and jewelry were stolen from a residence. During a traffic stop, the stolen property was recovered. A 34-year-old Clinton woman and a 34-year-old Accokeek man were arrested on charges that included first-, third- and fourth-degree burglary, rogue and vagabond and possession of cocaine.

VANDALISM

Lusby Park Lane, 3:53 p.m. Sept. 17. A rock was used to shatter a vehicle window.

NORTH BEACH AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Fifth St., Sept. 18 to Sept. 19. A gift card was stolen from a mailbox at a residence.

PRINCE FREDERICK AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Dawn Dr., 11:58 p.m. Sept. 16. A woman attacked occupants and damaged property inside a residence. A 26-year-old Prince Frederick woman was charged with second-degree assault, first-degree burglary, malicious destruction of property and disorderly conduct.

Terrace Dr., 6 to 8:35 p.m. Sept. 18. An attempt was made to break into a residence by removing a screen from a window. Nothing was reported missing.

VANDALISM

Bayside Forest Beach, Sept. 15 to 25. A picnic table was damaged by spray-paint.

SUNDERLAND AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Dalrymple Rd., Sept. 15 to Sept. 17. Stereo equipment was stolen from a vehicle parked after it became disabled.

Route 2, Sept. 17. A catalytic converter was stolen from a vehicle parked at a commuter lot.

Charles County

These were among reports received by the Charles County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. For information, call 301-932-2222 or 301-870-3232. Crime Solvers will pay a reward for information leading to an arrest and an indictment in connection with these and other crimes. Call the 24-hour hotline at 866-411-8477. Callers may remain anonymous. The Charles County Sheriff's Office Web site is www.ccso.us. Included at the site are daily news releases, Crime Watch neighborhood statistics, community services, crime prevention programs and career opportunities.

INDIAN HEAD AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Cypress Pl., Sept. 24. Prescription medication was stolen from a residence.

POMFRET AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Lowell Rd., 8700 block, Sept. 19. Jewelry was stolen from a residence.

SWANN POINT AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Magnolia and Ivanhoe Courts., Sept. 23 to Sept. 24. Property was stolen from three unlocked vehicles.

WALDORF AREA

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Waldorf area, Sept. 17. A 34-year-old Capitol Heights man was charged with a third-degree sex offense and soliciting a minor. The arrest was made in connection with an incident in August, during which a 14-year-old girl was contacted on a social networking site by a male falsely claiming to be 17 years old.

ROBBERIES

Crain Hwy., 2400 block, 3:06 a.m. Sept. 24. A convenience store was robbed at gunpoint.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Alyssa Lane, 3:04 a.m, Sept. 24. During a traffic stop, four tires and rims that had been reported stolen were found in the back seat of a vehicle. Two Waldorf men, ages 19 and 22, were arrested on theft charges.

Pika Dr., 11700 block, Sept. 24 to Sept. 25. A U-Haul truck was stolen from the parking lot of a business.

Renner Rd., 3800 block, 7:30 a.m. to 11:35 p.m. Sept. 20. Four tires and a spare were stolen from a custom truck.

Waldorf area, Sept. 25. Metal was stolen from several job sites using the same HVAC contractor. A 31-year-old Waldorf man, an employee of the contractor, was arrested on theft charges.

VANDALISM

Bannister Ct. and Milstead Ct., Sept. 22 to Sept. 23. The paint finish of four vehicles was scratched and tires of five vehicles were punctured.

St. Mary's County

These were among reports received by the St. Mary's County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. For information, call 301-475-8008, or the Crime Solvers line, 301-475-3333. The Leonardtown Barrack of the Maryland State Police operates a 24-hour tip line on which people may anonymously report information at 301-475-2936.

LEXINGTON PARK AREA

ROBBERIES

Shangri-La Dr. N., 21800 block, 9:20 p.m. Sept. 13. Two men robbed a business of cash and property at gunpoint. A 19-year-old Lexington Park man was charged with armed robbery, first-degree assault and theft valued at more than $1,000. An investigation is continuing.

MECHANICSVILLE AREA

ROBBERIES

Three Notch Road, 28200 block, 1:20 a.m. Sept. 16. A man threw hot coffee at a clerk, then jumped over the counter of a convenience store. After a brief struggle, he threatened the clerk with a hammer, then fled with cash. A 21-year-old Charlotte Hall man was arrested Sept. 21. Charges included robbery with a dangerous weapon and second-degree assault.

- Compiled by Bonnie Smith

Prince William County crime report


SECTION: METRO; Pg. T20


LENGTH: 655 words


Prince William County

These were among incidents reported by Prince William County police. For information, call 703-792-7245.

DUMFRIES AREA

ASSAULTS

Whitings Brigade Dr., 3000 block, 10 p.m. April 25. During an argument at a residence, a man armed with a kitchen knife prevented a female acquaintance from leaving. A Dumfries man, 31, was arrested.

WEAPONS

Jefferson Davis Hwy. and Yost Lane, 10:20 p.m. April 23. Several gunshots were heard. An exterior wall and an interior wall of an apartment were hit. No one was reported injured. 

Pointe Center Ct., 3600 block, 6 p.m. April 24 to 8:50 a.m. April 27. Someone fired a weapon, breaking an exterior window of a business. No one was reported injured.

Shell Cast Loop, 17100 block, 10:22 p.m. April 23. Several gunshots were heard. An exterior wall and an interior wall of an apartment were hit. No one was reported injured.

MANASSAS AREA

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Esteppe Dr. area, 11:05 p.m. April 26. During an argument, a man sexually assaulted a female acquaintance. A Manassas man, 60, was arrested.

ASSAULTS

Camfield Ct., 11000 block, 9:08 a.m. April 26. After an argument earlier in the day, a man knocked on a female acquaintance's front door and identified himself as a police officer. When the woman answered, the man assaulted her. A Manassas man, 25, was arrested.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Damascus Dr., 9700 block, 7:45 a.m. to 10 p.m. April 23. Cash, prescription medicine and electronics were stolen from a residence entered through a side door.

Rainwater Cir., 8100 block, 10:37 p.m. April 25. An attempt was made to enter a residence by damaging a front door.

WOODBRIDGE AREA

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Bakersfield St. area, April 24 to 28. A man sexually assaulted a male juvenile acquaintance. A Woodbridge man, 51, was arrested.

ASSAULTS

Bayside Ave., 1400 block, 2:24 a.m. April 30. During an argument, a woman stabbed a male acquaintance in the abdomen with a kitchen knife. A Woodbridge woman, 32, was arrested.

Bronson Ct., 3300 block, 8:53 p.m. April 25. During an argument, a man assaulted a female acquaintance. A Woodbridge man, 34, was arrested.

Fireside Ct., 13200 block, 9:20 a.m. April 28. Two men entered a male acquaintance's residence and stabbed him in the abdomen while he was sleeping. They fled with cash. The acquaintance was transported to a hospital. Two Woodbridge men, 21 and 25, were arrested.

Greenmount Dr., 15000 block, 4:38 p.m. April 25. During an argument, a woman pushed a female acquaintance down a flight of stairs and assaulted her. A Woodbridge woman, 32, was arrested.

CHILD-CARE INCIDENTS

Caton Hill Rd. and Killarney Dr., 12:48 a.m. April 26. Investigating a disabled vehicle, police officers found an intoxicated man transporting three children. An Oxon Hill, Md., man, 29, was arrested.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Blackjack Oak Lane, 16600 block, 5 a.m. to 2 p.m. April 24. A TV and a video game system were stolen from a residence.

Eastbourne Dr., 2400 block, 10 p.m. April 22 to 7 p.m. April 24. A laptop computer was stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked rear door.

Keystone Rd., 13400 block, 6 a.m. to 7 p.m. April 27. A tool and a pair of shoes were stolen from a residence. An interior door was damaged.

Knowles St., 13700 block, 10 a.m. April 28 to 3:30 p.m. April 29. Prescription medicine was stolen from a residence.

Quate Lane, 13500 block, 7:30 a.m. to 7:30 p.m. April 29. A laptop computer, a camera and jewelry were stolen from a residence.

Redwood Ct., 12200 block, April 18 to April 25. An attempt was made to enter a residence by damaging a rear basement door.

Manassas

No reports were received from Manassas police for this edition of Local Living. For information, call 703-257-8000.

Manassas Park

This was among incidents reported by Manassas Park police. For more information, call 703-361-1136.

VANDALISM

Conner Dr. and General Way, 5 p.m. April 24 to 5 a.m. April 25. Vehicle tires were slashed.

SECTION: Metro; Pg. T26


LENGTH: 933 words


Calvert County

These were among reports received by the Calvert County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. Anyone with information about these crimes should call the Criminal Investigation Division, 410-535-2800 or 301-855-1194, or the Crime Solvers line, 410-535-2880. Residents can also call the Prince Frederick Barrack of the state police at 410-535-1400.

CHESAPEAKE BEACH THEFTS/BREAK-INS  

Bristol Dr., 10:32 p.m. Oct. 3. A toolbox was stolen from the bed of a truck parked in the driveway of a home.

VEHICLE THEFTS

Chesapeake Beach, Oct. 2 to Oct. 3. A 2005 silver Hyundai Sonata was stolen from an apartment complex.

HUNTINGTOWN AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Kings Landing Rd., Sept. 24 to Oct. 1. A heating and air conditioning unit was stolen from a residence.

LUSBY AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Bronco Trail, Sept. 22 to Oct. 6. An air conditioner was stolen from a residence.

Garden Way, Sept. 27 to Oct. 1. Two air conditioners were stolen from a residence.

Side Saddle Trail, Sept. 30. Jewelry was stolen from a residence.

Silver Rock Rd., 7:20 a.m. to 6:30 p.m. Oct. 1. Jewelry and prescription medication were stolen from a residence.

Thunderbird Trail, Sept. 1 to 30. Copper pipe was stolen from an air conditioner at a residence.

SOLOMONS AREA ASSAULTS

Solomons, 5:23 p.m. Oct. 7. During a dispute at a gas station, a man tried to force a woman from a vehicle. A Hollywood man, 25, was arrested on charges including assault and illegal drug possession.

SUNDERLAND AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Dalrymple Rd., 1:30 to 10 a.m. Oct. 6. Two cameras were stolen from an unlocked vehicle.

Charles County

These were among reports received by the Charles County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. For information, call 301-932-2222 or 301-870-3232. Crime Solvers will pay a reward for information leading to an arrest and an indictment in connection with these and other crimes. Call the 24-hour hotline at 866-411-8477. Callers may remain anonymous. The Charles County Sheriff's Office Web site is www.ccso.us. Included at the site are daily news releases, Crime Watch neighborhood statistics, community services, crime prevention programs and career opportunities.

Chapel Point Rd., Oct. 8 to Oct. 9. In separate incidents at two residences, a golf cart was stolen from a garage.

MECHANICSVILLE AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Ryceville Rd., Oct. 7 to Oct. 10. Piping was stolen from a vacant residence.

POMFRET AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Guinevere Lane, 4300 block, 4 p.m. Oct. 10. Plumbing piping was stolen from a vacant residence. A man was seen putting the property in a truck and driving away.

WALDORF AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Crain Hwy., 11000 block, 9:54 p.m. Oct. 10. While attempting to make a traffic stop, police determined that a motorcycle had been reported stolen. While being chased, the driver lost control and crashed. A Waldorf man, 20, was charged with the unlawful taking of a motor vehicle, fleeing and eluding, theft, illegal drug possession and multiple traffic violations.

Falcon Pl., Oct. 7 to 8. Property was stolen from two vehicles.

Mattawoman-Beantown Rd., 6 a.m. to 4:45 p.m. Oct. 9. An attempt was made to steal a vehicle in a commuter lot by tampering with the ignition. A stereo system in the vehicle was damaged in the incident.

Merrymount Ct., Sept. 29 to Oct. 7. Property was stolen from a residence.

Poplar Hill Rd., 13000 block, 2:15 p.m. Oct. 6. A home was entered by kicking in a side door. A Capitol Heights man, 31, was arrested at the scene. Charges included burglary and destruction of property.

St. Mary's County

These were among reports received by the St. Mary's County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. For information, call 301-475-8008, or the Crime Solvers line, 301-475-3333. The Leonardtown Barrack of the Maryland State Police operates a 24-hour tip line on which people may anonymously report information at 301-475-2936.

LEXINGTON PARK AREA SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Lexington Park area, Oct. 8. A Lexington Park man, 21, was charged with third-degree sex offense in connection with a relationship with a 15-year-old.

MECHANICSVILLE AREA ASSAULTS

Riverwatch Dr., Oct. 5. During an argument, a woman struck an acquaintance in the mouth and pressed a cigarette against his neck, causing a burn. A Mechanicsville woman, 31, was charged with second-degree assault.

SCOTLAND AREA VANDALISM

Scotland, Sept. 13 to Sept. 14. A monument at a memorial park was damaged by spray-painted graffiti that included swastikas and racial slurs. A rope was found around the neck of a statue.

LENGTH: 1147 words


Prince William

These were among incidents reported by Prince William County police. For information, call 703-792-7245.

DUMFRIES AREA ASSAULTS

Triangle Shopping Plaza, 18000 block, 11:05 a.m. Jan. 5. A bomb threat was called in to a restaurant. The building was evacuated and no bomb was found. A 16-year-old Woodbridge male was arrested.

ROBBERIES

William Johnston Lane, 3300 block, 8:25 p.m. Feb. 28. A man robbed a pedestrian of her purse at gunpoint. 

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Vineyard Pl., 3300 block, 7 to 10:50 a.m. March 3. A vehicle was stolen from a residence.

GAINESVILLE AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Wellington Rd., 5900 block, Feb. 25. Copper piping was stolen from a business. Two Manassas men, ages 29 and 41, were arrested.

MANASSAS AREA ASSAULTS

Gregory Ct., 7800 block, 8:32 p.m. Feb. 27. During an argument, a man swung a machete at a male relative. A 33-year-old Manassas man was arrested.

WEAPONS OFFENSES

Centreville Rd., 8300 block, 1:50 a.m. March 3. A man in a restaurant parking lot fired several gunshots into the air.

ROBBERIES

Blooms Quarry and Granite Lanes, 10:47 p.m. March 4. A man who implied that he had a weapon robbed a pedestrian of her purse.

Portwood Turn, 8100 block, 10:53 a.m. Feb. 27. Two males robbed a man of cash at knifepoint. The victim was found to be in possession of marijuana and other illegal materials. A 20-year-old Centreville man was arrested.

Shoppers Sq., 8300 block, 11:58 a.m. March 1. Two men robbed a business of a cellphone at gunpoint.

WOODBRIDGE AREA SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Metz Wetlands Bank area, Feb. 24. A man sexually assaulted a juvenile acquaintance on several occasions in 2008, 2009 and 2010. A 19-year-old Stafford man was arrested.

Potomac Mills area, Feb. 28. Two males sexually assaulted an acquaintance in a parking lot. A 17-year-old Woodbridge male and a 16-year-old Manassas male were arrested.

ASSAULTS

Georgia Rd., 15100 block, Feb. 22 to 26. A man sent threatening text messages to an acquaintance. A 35-year-old man was arrested.

WEAPONS OFFENSES

Catalpa Ct., 15000 block, 5:39 a.m. March 3. Several gunshots were fired. No injuries were reported.

Keelingwood Cir., 13700 block, 3 to 3:30 a.m. March 3. A weapon was fired at a residence, damaging the front door and a kitchen wall.

ROBBERIES

Dillingham Sq., 12400 block, 4:53 a.m. March 1. A male threatened and robbed a man at an ATM.

INDECENT EXPOSURE INCIDENTS

Greenwood and Gustus drives, 8:25 p.m. March 3. A man was seen walking down the street naked. A 57-year-old Richmond man was arrested.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Ashland Ave., 14800 block, 3:58 a.m. March 2. A residence was entered through a front door.

Farm Creek Dr., 14800 block, 6:30 p.m. March 1 to 6:45 a.m. March 2. Cash was stolen from a business entered by breaking glass in a front door.

Glendale Rd., 4100 block, 8 to 11:45 a.m. Feb. 26. An attempt was made to enter a residence by damaging a back door. Nothing was reported missing.

Harbor Dr., 12800 block, midnight to 7:47 a.m. March 2. Cash was stolen from a business entered by breaking a rear window.

Jennerette Lane, 15100 block, 3 p.m. Feb. 25 to noon Feb. 27. Appliances were stolen from a residence under construction; the residence was entered through an unlocked door.

Labourn Dr., 3300 block, 6:55 a.m. Feb. 25 to 7:56 a.m. Feb. 26. An attempt was made to enter a residence by damaging a garage door.

Luca Station Way, 12900 block, 9:23 p.m. Feb. 27. A man forced his way inside a residence through a porch door. An occupant pushed him back outside. A 22-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

Skipjack Ct., 12000 block, 8 p.m. Feb. 26 to 9 a.m. Feb. 27. A tablet computer, a video game system and jewelry were among property stolen from a residence entered by breaking a basement window.

Trendil Ct., 3400 block, 6:46 p.m. Feb. 27. A man seen in the back yard of a residence fled empty-handed when confronted.

William and Mary Cir., 12000 block, 9 a.m. Feb. 27 to 3 p.m. Feb. 28. A residence was entered by forcing a window. Several rooms were ransacked, but nothing was reported missing.

Manassas

These were among incidents reported by Manassas police. For information, call 703-257-8000.

ASSAULTS

Laurelwood Ct., 9100 block, 8 a.m. Feb. 28. A man threatened acquaintances with a kitchen knife and a chair. A 43-year-old Manassas man was arrested. No injuries were reported.

Tillett Loop, 8300 block, 10 p.m. March 4. A man threatened a man who was fishing in a lake, then pushed and poked him until he walked way from the water. No injuries were reported.

INDECENT EXPOSURE INCIDENTS

Portner Ave., 9200 block, 11:51 p.m. Feb. 27. A man got the attention of a woman inside a building by knocking on a window, then exposed himself.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Liberia Ave., 8500 block, 6 to 8:30 p.m. March 2. A tablet computer was stolen from an unlocked vehicle.

Portner Ave., 9000 block, 8 a.m. to 5 p.m. March 4. A combination washer/dryer was stolen from the back yard of a residence.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

School St., 9500 block, 12:01 to 7:30 a.m. March 3. A tan 1991 Ford F-150 truck was stolen. It was later found in a ditch at Linden Park.

VANDALISM

Sumner Lake Blvd., 9500 block, 4 p.m. March 2 to 5 p.m. March 4. Several clay lawn ornaments were broken and left on the porch of a residence. A threatening note was found with the damaged property.

Manassas Park

These were among the incidents reported by Manassas Park police. For more information, call 703-361-1136.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Adams St., unit block, 4:35 p.m. Feb. 18. A cellphone was stolen.

Centreville Rd., Jan. 25 to Feb. 9. An acquaintance of a gas station employee did not pay for gasoline purchases. An 18-year-old Manassas woman and a 27-year-old man were arrested.

Centreville Rd., Dec. 14 to Jan. 31. Cash was stolen from a gas station cash register. An employee of the business, a 20-year-old Manassas woman, was arrested.

Euclid Ave., 5 p.m. Feb. 28 to 6:27 a.m. March 1. Copper wire was stolen from a business.

Holden Dr., 10 p.m. Feb. 21 to 6:46 a.m. Feb. 22. Tools were stolen from a van entered by cutting a padlock and forcing a door.

Jefferson Ct., 3 p.m. Feb. 24 to 8 a.m. Feb. 25. A washer and dryer were stolen from a residence under construction.

Owens Ct., 11:52 a.m. Feb. 28. Wires were cut and video surveillance cameras were knocked down at a business. Nothing was reported missing.
