LENGTH: 803 words


Calvert County 

These were among reports received by the Calvert County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. Anyone with information about these crimes is asked to call the Criminal Investigation Division, 410-535-2800 or 301-855-1194, or the Crime Solvers line, 410-535-2880. Residents can also call the Prince Frederick Barrack of the state police at 410-535-1400.

CHESAPEAKE BEACH AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Old Bayside Rd., 9:59 a.m. Aug. 7. A padlock on a shed was cut.  

HUNTINGTOWN AREA

VANDALISM

Hoile Lane, Aug. 4. A mailbox was damaged at night.

LUSBY AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Chesapeake Beach Ranch Estates, Aug. 6 to Aug. 8. Two tires were stolen from a camper parked at a campground.

Heron Lane, Aug. 5. A bicycle was stolen from a front porch.

Heron Lane, Aug. 5. Property was stolen from a back yard.

OWINGS AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Mount Harmony Rd., 8:37 p.m. Aug. 5. Items were stolen from an unlocked vehicle.

ST. LEONARD AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Maryland Ave., 3:36 p.m. Aug. 9. A license plate was take from a vehicle.

Charles County

These were among reports received by the Charles County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. For information, call 301-932-2222 or 301-870-3232. The sheriff's Web site, www.ccso.us, has news releases, local crime statistics, crime prevention programs and career opportunities.

REWARDS FOR INFORMATION

Crime Solvers will pay a reward for information leading to an arrest and an indictment in connection with these and other crimes. Call the 24-hour hotline at 866-411-8477. Callers may remain anonymous.

INDIAN HEAD AREA

ROBBERIES

Nelson Point Rd., 5300 block, 12:15 a.m. Aug. 7. A group of men forcibly entered a home and demanded cash. They fled with money, a cellphone and a video game unit. A resident was assaulted. Four suspects were found at a nearby home. Two Waldorf men, 20 and 21, a Pomfret man, 21, and a California man, 22, were charged with robbery.

NEWBURG AREA

ARSON

Mount Victoria Rd., 10:04 p.m. Aug. 17. The interior of a pole barn was set on fire. The barn was destroyed.

WALDORF AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Westdale Ct., 3200 block, Aug. 13 to Aug. 14. Jewelry was stolen from a home.

VANDALISM

Piney Church Rd., Aug. 12 to Aug. 13. Windows of two excavators were shattered.

St. Mary's County

These were among reports received by the St. Mary's County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. For information, call 301-475-8008. To submit a tip, call the Crime Solvers line at 301-475-3333. The Leonardtown Barrack of the Maryland State Police also has a 24-hour anonymous tip line at 301-475-2936.

CALIFORNIA AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

St. Andrew's Church Rd., Aug. 10. A man awoke in his residence after an alarm on one of his two vehicles was triggered. He saw a woman standing between the two vehicles. When he went outside to investigate, the woman followed him into his home and refused to leave. A Clements woman, 33, was charged with fourth-degree burglary, two counts of rogue and vagabond, and disturbing the peace.

Woodlawn Dr., Aug. 13. A go-cart was stolen from a home.

LEONARDTOWN AREA

ASSAULTS

Leonardtown, Aug. 11. During an argument at a detention center, one inmate shoved another. A Great Mills man, 25, was charged with second-degree assault.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Oxen Ct., Aug. 16. Property was stolen from a home.

VANDALISM

Point Lookout Rd., Aug. 9. A woman threw landscaping rocks through windows of a house after she became angry with family members. She also threw bricks at two vehicles, damaging the windshields. A Lexington Park woman, 41, was charged with property destruction and reckless endangerment.

LEXINGTON PARK AREA

ASSAULTS

Eric Rd., Aug. 18. A man was assaulted by two men with whom he had argued that day.

Valley Ct., Aug. 9. During an argument about money, a woman assaulted two acquaintances. A Lexington Park woman was charged with two counts of second-degree assault.

SEXUAL ASSAULTS 

Hilton Dr., Aug. 16. Two women left a bar with three men and went to an apartment. After drinking a glass of wine, one of the women passed out. A friend found her unresponsive and unclothed a short time later. A Lexington Park man, 31, was charged with second-degree rape.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Daisy Lane, Aug. 15. A license plate was stolen from a vehicle.

VANDALISM

Sandstone St., Aug. 17. Windows of a vehicle were broken.

MECHANICSVILLE AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Jennifer Dr., Aug. 15. Property was stolen from a shed.

Tin Top School Rd., Aug. 14. A heat pump was stolen from a home.

VANDALISM

Laurel Grove Rd., Aug. 13. Several mailboxes were damaged.

Persimmon Creek Rd., 11:44 p.m. Aug. 9. Fireworks were placed in a mailbox and ignited, causing damage.

ST. MARY'S CITY AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Indentured Lane, Aug. 13. Property was stolen from a house after it was forcibly entered.

- Compiled by Bonnie Smith

Southern Maryland crime report Southern Maryland crime report


SECTION: Metro; Pg. T20


LENGTH: 947 words


Calvert County

These were among reports received by the Calvert County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. Anyone with information about these crimes should call the Criminal Investigation Division, 410-535-2800 or 301-855-1194, or the Crime Solvers line, 410-535-2880. You can also call the Prince Frederick Barrack of the state police at 410-535-1400.

BROOMES ISLAND AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS  

Patuxent Ave., May 7 to May 11. An attempt was made to enter a residence by damaging a back door. A shed on the property was entered. Nothing was reported missing.

LUSBY AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Seahorse Beach, 7:50 p.m. May 11. A wallet was stolen from an unlocked vehicle.

Stagecoach Trail, May 10 to May 11. Copper tubing was stolen from a crawl space at a residence.

VANDALISM

Laura Lane, May 10 to May 11. A vehicle window was broken.

OWINGS AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Clearview Dr., May 11 to May 12. A jacket was stolen from an unlocked vehicle parked at a residence.

VANDALISM

Barefoot Lane, May 9 to May 10. A vehicle's windshield and two other windows were damaged. Two tires, the hood and a taillight also were damaged.

PORT REPUBLIC AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Howard Dr., May 7 to May 8. A riding mower was stolen from a garage at a residence.

Redberry Dr., 2 a.m. May 9. Property was stolen from an occupied residence.

PRINCE FREDERICK AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Solomons Island Rd., 9 p.m. May 13. Cash was stolen from the counter at a convenience store.

VANDALISM

Abigail Ct., 7:30 p.m. May 12 to 10 a.m. May 13. Mailboxes were damaged.

Sequoia Way, 7:30 p.m. May 12 to 10 a.m. May 13. Mailboxes were damaged.

Whispering Dr., 7:30 p.m. May 12 to 10 a.m. May 13. Mailboxes were damaged.

Charles County

These were among reports received by the Charles County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. For information, call 301-932-2222 or 301-870-3232. Crime Solvers will pay a reward for information leading to an arrest and an indictment in connection with these and other crimes. Call the 24-hour hotline at 866-411-8477. Callers may remain anonymous. The Charles County Sheriff's Office Web site is www.ccso.us. Included at the site are daily news releases, Crime Watch neighborhood statistics, community services, crime prevention programs and career opportunities. CHARLOTTE HALL AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Hillmeade Ct., 13000 block, May 12 to May 13. Cash was stolen from a vehicle.

WALDORF AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Adams Ct., 1200 block, May 13 to May 14. Cash, clothing, jewelry and electronics were stolen from a residence.

Berry Rd., 10000 block, 2:35 a.m. May 15. Cash was stolen from a convenience store entered through a rear door.

Crain Hwy., 2500 block, 2:35 a.m. May 11. Tires were stolen from a tire center. Two men were arrested at the scene.

Mattawoman Beantown Rd., 5:50 a.m. to 4:30 p.m. May 16. During an attempt to steal wheels and tires, lug nuts were removed from the wheels of an SUV parked at a commuter lot. Nothing was damaged or missing.

VEHICLE THEFTS

Heathcote Rd., 3000 block, 8 to 10:50 p.m. May 13. A black 2003 Cadillac DeVille was stolen using keys left in the ignition.

WHITE PLAINS AREA ROBBERIES

Kingsway Dr., 7:55 p.m. May 10. Two people threatened a 16-year-old pedestrian and demanded his shoes. He refused and ran away.

St. Mary's County

These were among reports received by the St. Mary's County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. For information, call 301-475-8008, or the Crime Solvers line, 301-475-3333. The Leonardtown Barrack of the Maryland State Police operates a 24-hour tip line on which people may anonymously report information at 301-475-2936.

CALIFORNIA AREA ASSAULTS

Patuxent Beach Rd. N., 9:20 p.m. May 15. A woman attacked a man at a residence. A 65-year-old California woman was charged with second-degree assault. No serious injuries were reported.

GREAT MILLS AREA ASSAULTS

Chancellors Run Ct., 11:12 p.m. May 15. A man attacked an acquaintance. A 26-year-old Lusby man was charged with second-degree assault. No serious injuries were reported.

LEONARDTOWN AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Leonardtown, May 15. Two 17-year-old males were arrested in connection with a series of thefts from vehicles at Leonardtown High School and the College of Southern Maryland, and during an event at the St. Mary's County Fairgrounds. Charges included multiple counts of theft and being rogue and vagabond. Charges are pending against a Maryland man, and an investigation is continuing into similar incidents in Anne Arundel, Charles and Prince George's counties.

LEXINGTON PARK AREA SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Lexington Park, May 11. A 63-year-old Lexington Park man was arrested in connection with an attack in April. Charges included sexual abuse of a minor as a continuing course of conduct.

ASSAULTS

Valley Drive Estates, May 11. During a fight at a residence, a man stabbed a man several times in the neck and shoulder area. A 32-year-old Lusby man was charged with first- and second-degree assault. The victim was taken to St. Mary's Hospital for treatment of injuries that were not considered life-threatening.

- Compiled by Bonnie Smith

Southern Maryland crime report


SECTION: METRO; Pg. T24


LENGTH: 1194 words


Calvert County

These were among reports received by the Calvert County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. Anyone with information about these crimes should call the Criminal Investigation Division, 410-535-2800 or 301-855-1194, or the Crime Solvers line, 410-535-2880. You can also call the Prince Frederick Barrack of the state police at 410-535-1400.

CHESAPEAKE BEACH AREA

ARSON

Rosemary Dr., 11:40 p.m. Sept. 20. A 2002 Nissan Frontier was set on fire. The investigation was continuing.

HUNTINGTOWN AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Cox Rd., Sept. 21 to Sept. 22. An attempt was made to enter a concession stand at a park.  

Harlequin Ct., 12:10 p.m. Sept. 20. An MP3 player and coins were stolen from an unlocked vehicle.

Monarch Lane, 10:30 p.m. Sept. 19 to 8:30 a.m. Sept. 20. A purse was stolen from an unlocked vehicle parked in front of a home.

Wilson Rd., 3 to 9 p.m. Sept. 16. Cash and binoculars were stolen from a home.

VANDALISM

Huntingtown, September. Flower beds, fencing and lights were damaged in the Plum Point Woods and Wilburn Estates subdivisions.

LUSBY AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Rousby Hall Rd., Sept. 16. Copper piping was stolen from a residence.

Valerie Lane, Aug. 25 to Sept. 15. A door and screen were damaged in an attempt to enter a residence.

VANDALISM

H.G. Trueman Rd., 11:05 a.m. Sept. 21. A SMECO-owned electrical box was spray-painted.

NORTH BEACH AREA

ASSAULTS

North Beach, 4:39 p.m. Sept. 14. Two men assaulted each other in the parking lot of a fire department. A Prince Frederick man, 24, and a Chesapeake Beach man, 26, were charged with second-degree assault.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Frederick Ave., Sept. 12 to Sept. 18. A pressure washer and a 50-foot hose were stolen from a residence.

PRINCE FREDERICK AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Virginia Ave., 6:58 Sept. 21. Prescription medications were stolen from a purse in a home.

ST. LEONARD AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Broomes Island Rd., 5:58 p.m. Sept. 15. An iPad was stolen from a residence.

Charles County

These were among reports received by the Charles County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. For information, call 301-932-2222 or 301-870-3232. Crime Solvers will pay a reward for information leading to an arrest and an indictment in connection with these and other crimes. Call the 24-hour hotline at 866-411-8477. Callers may remain anonymous. The Charles County Sheriff's Office Web site is www.ccso.us, featuring daily news releases, neighborhood statistics, community services, crime prevention programs and career opportunities.

LA PLATA AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Johnsontown Rd., September. Tools were stolen.

WALDORF AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Biltmore St., Sept. 23. Electronic items and coins were stolen from several vehicles, and mailboxes were damaged.

Mattawoman Beantown Rd., 2700 block, 10 a.m. to 1:45 p.m. Sept. 23. Guns and tools were stolen from a shed.

WHITE PLAINS AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

White Plains, 3:20 p.m. Sept. 24. A Pomfret man, 29, was arrested and charged on open warrants with traffic violations and possession of a stolen firearm.

St. Mary's County

These were among reports received by the St. Mary's County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. For information, call 301-475-8008, or the Crime Solvers line, 301-475-3333. The Leonardtown Barrack of the Maryland State Police operates a 24-hour tip line at 301-475-2936, which people can use to anonymously report information.

CALIFORNIA AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Three Notch Rd., Sept. 20. A man and a woman at a business were seen on video surveillance footage removing the magnetic housing on two iPods and placing them in the man's back pockets. A woman, 24, and a man, 25, of Baltimore were charged with theft of less than $1,000.

CHARLOTTE HALL AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Charlotte Hall, Sept. 17. A houseguest stole prescription drugs. A Prince Frederick man, 38, was charged with theft of less than $1,000 and possession of a controlled dangerous substance.

GREAT MILLS AREA

ASSAULTS

Great Mills, Sept. 22. During an argument, a man punched an acquaintance in the back of the head and allegedly attempted to strangle him. A Great Mills man, 24, was charged with second-degree assault.

LEONARDTOWN AREA

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Leonardtown, 5:14 a.m. Sept. 23. A woman allowed an acquaintance to sleep on a couch in her home. She was awakened when the man sexually assaulted her. A man, 38, of no fixed address, was charged with second-degree rape, third- and fourth-degree sex offense and second-degree assault.

ASSAULTS

Leonardtown, Sept. 21. During an argument, a man assaulted an acquaintance. A Leonardtown man, 38, was charged with second-degree assault.

Leonardtown, Sept. 25. During a card game at a detention center, two inmates assaulted each other. A Lexington Park man, 25, and a Leonardtown man were charged with second-degree assault.

Leonardtown, Sept. 25. An inmate at a detention center kicked an officer in the legs and face. A Lexington Park man, 28, was charged with second-degree assault and second-degree assault on a Division of Corrections employee.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Leonardtown, Sept. 26. A Leonardtown man, 31, was arrested in connection with residential burglaries. He was charged with three counts of first-degree burglary and three counts of theft of $1000 to $10,000

LEXINGTON PARK AREA

ASSAULTS

Lexington Park, Sept. 21. During an argument, a woman pushed an acquaintance and struck the person in the face with an object. A half of a Valium pill was found in her wallet during a search at the detention center. A Lexington Park woman, 32, was charged with second-degree assault, possession of a controlled dangerous substance and possession of contraband in a place of confinement.

Lexington Park, Sept. 21. A man standing in front of his home was punched in the face and poked in the chest with a tire iron. A Lexington Park man, 30, was charged with first- and second-degree assault.

Lexington Park, Sept. 24. During an argument, a man hit an acquaintance in the stomach several times with a power strip. When the acquaintance fled to a bathroom, the man kicked the bathroom door and stabbed the door with a kitchen knife. When the acquaintance, who was holding a child, attempted to leave the residence, the man grabbed him. A Lexington Park man, 24, was charged with assault, reckless endangerment, destruction of property, possession of a controlled dangerous substance and possession of paraphernalia.

Lexington Park, 7:55 p.m. Sept. 26. During a fight at a park between two football players, parents became involved, and a man held down the mother of a youth while his wife repeatedly hit the woman in the face with her fist. She also picked up a piece of broken glass from the woman's eyeglasses and cut her face. The youths were charged with second-degree assault. A Park Hall man, 46, was charged with second-degree assault by application and an alcohol violation. A Park Hall woman, 36, was charged with first- and second-degree assault, affray-common law and malicious destruction of property worth less than $500.

ST. INIGOES AREA

ASSAULTS

St. Inigoes, Sept. 25. During an argument, a man assaulted three people. A St. Inigoes man, 24, was charged with three counts of second-degree assault.

- Compiled by Bonnie Smith

Prince William County crime report


SECTION: Metro; Pg. T21


LENGTH: 1067 words


Prince William County crime report Prince William County crime report

Among incidents reported by police in Prince William County, Manassas and Manassas Park.

Prince William

These were among incidents reported by Prince William County police. For information, call 703-792-7245.

DUMFRIES AREA CHILD PORNOGRAPHY  

Dumfries Rd. 1-100 Block, Sept. 4. A man was in possession of child pornography through a social media account. A 42-year-old Dumfries man was arrested.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Wayside Dr., 17100 block, 11:30 a.m. Aug. 27 to 8:30 a.m. Aug. 28. Cash was stolen from a business entered by breaking a glass front door.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Williamstown Dr. and Fraley Blvd., 10:16 a.m. Aug. 29. A vehicle was stolen. When a police officer attempted to stop the vehicle, the driver crashed into a traffic pole and fled on foot.

MANASSAS AREA ASSAULTS

Coverstone Dr., 10900 block, 8:02 p.m. Aug. 30. During an argument, a man assaulted a female acquaintance and held a knife to her neck. A 27-year-old Manassas man was arrested.

Lee Ave., 9300 block, 2:50 p.m. Aug. 29. A man at the Adult Detention Center bit the thumb of an officer. A 26-year-old Oakland, Calif., man was arrested.

Sudley Rd., 8000 block, 6 p.m. Sept. 3. During an argument in a vehicle, a man assaulted a woman and choked her.

ROBBERIES

Battleview Pkwy., 10800 block, 9:42 p.m. Sept. 2. When a woman arranged to buy football tickets from a man in a restaurant parking lot, four males and a second woman assaulted the man and robbed him of a wallet and the tickets.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Charnwood Ct., 8500 block, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. Aug. 29. A laptop computer, a computer tablet and a keyboard were stolen from a residence entered by damaging a rear door.

Hallard Ct., 8600 block, 1:01 p.m. Aug. 26. A residence was entered by forcing a basement door.

Lantern Ct., 8000 block, noon Aug. 25 to 10:15 p.m. Aug. 30. An attempt was made to enter a residence by damaging a front door.

Woodbury Dr., 10100 block, 8:30 a.m. to 1:15 p.m. Aug. 26. An attempt was made to enter a residence by damaging a rear door.

WOODBRIDGE AREA SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Minnieville Rd., 14100 block, 8:20 p.m. Sept. 1. A man in a convenience store sexually assaulted a woman. A 26-year-old man was arrested.

Piccolo Lane, 14500 block, 9:11 p.m. Aug. 28. A man attempted to rape a female acquaintance while she was sleeping. When she woke up, he fled. A 20-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

River Bend Way, 1700 block, 9:59 a.m. Aug. 28. A man entered a residence through an unlocked window and sexually assaulted a female resident.

ASSAULTS

Earlham Ct., 14600 block, 8:36 a.m. Sept. 1. During an argument outside a residence, a man hit a male acquaintance in the face with a golf club. Residents intervened and broke up the fight. As the residents and the injured male entered the residence, the man threw a glass bottle, hitting a resident. A 45-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

ROBBERIES

Bannon Way, 15200 block, 7:25 p.m. Sept. 1. A man arranged to sell a cellphone to another man and a male juvenile. He entered the back seat of their vehicle, pulled out a handgun and demanded money. As the three struggled, the man pulled the trigger, but the gun failed to fire. The other man and juvenile fled and called police. The gunman fled with the car keys and a cellphone chip. A 27-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

F St., 1400 block, 10:57 a.m. Aug. 29. Three males knocked a male pedestrian to the ground and robbed him of a cellphone. The pedestrian was treated for injuries.

Hylton Ave., 1500 block, Aug. 29. Three males assaulted a male pedestrian and searched his pockets. They fled empty-handed.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Bayside Ave., 1300 block, 8:15 a.m. to 7 p.m. Aug. 31. A residence was entered by damaging a front door.

Birchdale Ave., 14200 block, 9 a.m. Aug. 27 to 9:20 p.m. Sept. 1. A video game system, games and DVDs were stolen from a residence.

Edgemoor Ct., 11200 block, 12:20 p.m. Aug. 28. A man attempted to enter a residence through a rear door. When a resident opened the blinds on the door, the man fled.

Kingsman Rd., 13600 block, 5:45 a.m. to 4 p.m. Aug. 27. Three laptop computers, two video game systems, games, other electronics and jewelry were stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked window.

Langley Ct., 13700 block, noon Aug. 30 to 4:30 p.m. Sept. 1. A laptop computer was stolen from a residence.

Misty Lane, 12800 block, 5 a.m. Aug. 27 to 10 a.m. Aug. 28. An attempt was made to enter a residence by damaging a rear window.

Stallion Ct., 12000 block, 5 p.m. Aug. 24 to 9 p.m. Aug. 26. Jewelry was stolen from a residence entered by damaging a rear door.

Woodvale Ct., 13500 block, 2 p.m. Aug. 24 to 7:15 a.m. Aug. 27. An attempt was made to enter a residence by damaging a basement window.

Manassas

These were among the incidents reported by Manassas police. For more information, call 703-257-8000.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Georgian Ct., 8400 block, 7 a.m. to 6:30 p.m. Sept. 3. Two laptop computers, a video game system, a video camera and watches were stolen from a residence entered through a rear window.

Liberia Ave., 9800 block, Aug. 27. An employee took cash and merchandise from a store. A 19-year-old Manassas man was arrested.

Tillet Loop, 8300 block, Aug. 30. Cash and a wallet were stolen from a vehicle inside a garage.

VANDALISM

Stonewall Rd., 8300 block, Sept. 1 to 2. Windows of six vehicles were broken.

Manassas Park

These were among the incidents reported by Manassas Park police. For more information, call 703-361-1136.

VANDALISM

Colfax Ct., 2:30 a.m. Sept. 1. A Honda Civic was damaged.

Conner Dr. and General Way, 11:13 p.m. Sept. 4. Windows of a vehicle were broken.

Southern Maryland crime report


SECTION: METRO; Pg. T26


LENGTH: 832 words


Calvert County

These were among reports received by the Calvert County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. Anyone with information about these crimes should call the Criminal Investigation Division, 410-535-2800 or 301-855-1194, or the Crime Solvers line, 410-535-2880. Residents can also call the Prince Frederick Barrack of the state police at 410-535-1400.

CHESAPEAKE BEACH

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Bristol Dr., 10:32 p.m. Oct. 3. A toolbox was stolen from the bed of a truck parked in the driveway of a home.  

VEHICLE THEFTS

Chesapeake Beach, Oct. 2 to Oct. 3. A 2005 silver Hyundai Sonata was stolen from an apartment complex.

HUNTINGTOWN AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Kings Landing Rd., Sept. 24 to Oct. 1. A heating and air conditioning unit was stolen from a residence.

LUSBY AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Bronco Trail, Sept. 22 to Oct. 6. An air conditioner was stolen from a residence.

Garden Way, Sept. 27 to Oct. 1. Two air conditioners were stolen from a residence.

Red Rock Trail, Sept. A heating and air conditioning unit was stolen from a residence.

San Mateo Trail, 2:55 to 3:30 p.m. Oct. 1. A flat-screen television was stolen from a residence.

Side Saddle Trail, Sept. 30. Jewelry was stolen from a residence.

Silver Rock Rd., 7:20 a.m. to 6:30 p.m. Oct. 1. Jewelry and prescription medication were stolen from a residence.

Thunderbird Trail, Sept. 1 to 30. Copper pipe was stolen from an air conditioner at a residence.

SOLOMONS AREA

ASSAULTS

Solomons, 5:23 p.m. Oct. 7. During a dispute at a gas station, a man tried to force a woman from a vehicle. A Hollywood man, 25, was arrested on charges including assault and illegal drug possession.

SUNDERLAND AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Dalrymple Rd., 1:30 to 10 a.m. Oct. 6. Two cameras were stolen from an unlocked vehicle.

Charles County

These were among reports received by the Charles County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. For information, call 301-932-2222 or 301-870-3232. Crime Solvers will pay a reward for information leading to an arrest and an indictment in connection with these and other crimes. Call the 24-hour hotline at 866-411-8477. Callers may remain anonymous. The Charles County Sheriff's Office Web site is www.ccso.us. Included at the site are daily news releases, Crime Watch neighborhood statistics, community services, crime prevention programs and career opportunities.

LA PLATA AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Chapel Point Rd., Oct. 8 to Oct. 9. In separate incidents at two residences, a golf cart was stolen from a garage.

MECHANICSVILLE AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Ryceville Rd., Oct. 7 to Oct. 10. Piping was stolen from a vacant residence.

POMFRET AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Guinevere Lane, 4300 block, 4 p.m. Oct. 10. Plumbing piping was stolen from a vacant residence. A man was seen putting the property in a truck and driving away.

WALDORF AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Crain Hwy., 11000 block, 9:54 p.m. Oct. 10. While attempting to make a traffic stop, police determined that a motorcycle had been reported stolen. While being chased, the driver lost control and crashed. A Waldorf man, 20, was charged with the unlawful taking of a motor vehicle, fleeing and eluding, theft, illegal drug possession and multiple traffic violations.

Falcon Pl., Oct. 7 to 8. Property was stolen from two vehicles.

Mattawoman-Beantown Rd., 6 a.m. to 4:45 p.m. Oct. 9. An attempt was made to steal a vehicle in a commuter lot by tampering with the ignition. A stereo system in the vehicle was damaged in the incident.

Merrymount Ct., Sept. 29 to Oct. 7. Property was stolen from a residence.

Poplar Hill Rd., 13000 block, 2:15 p.m. Oct. 6. A home was entered by kicking in a side door. A Capitol Heights man, 31, was arrested at the scene. Charges included burglary and destruction of property.

St. Mary's County

These were among reports received by the St. Mary's County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. For information, call 301-475-8008, or the Crime Solvers line, 301-475-3333. The Leonardtown Barrack of the Maryland State Police operates a 24-hour tip line on which people may anonymously report information at 301-475-2936.

CALIFORNIA AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Our Lady's Lane, 3 to 3:30 p.m. Oct. 1. Copper piping, wiring and fittings were stolen from a storage shed.

Our Lady's Lane, 9:30 p.m. Oct. 3 to 1:30 p.m. Oct. 4. Copper piping, wiring and fittings were stolen from a storage shed.

LEXINGTON PARK AREA

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Lexington Park area, Oct. 8. A Lexington Park man, 21, was charged with third-degree sex offense in connection with a relationship with a 15-year-old.

MECHANICSVILLE AREA

ASSAULTS

Riverwatch Dr., Oct. 5. During an argument, a woman struck an acquaintance in the mouth and pressed a cigarette against his neck, causing a burn. A Mechanicsville woman, 31, was charged with second-degree assault.

SCOTLAND AREA

VANDALISM

Scotland, Sept. 13 to Sept. 14. A monument at a memorial park was damaged by spray-painted graffiti that included swastikas and racial slurs. A rope was found around the neck of a statue.

Prince William County crime report


SECTION: METRO; Pg. T34


LENGTH: 453 words


Prince William County

These were among incidents reported by Prince William County police. For information, call 703-792-7245.

GAINESVILLE AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Catbird Dr., 14100 block, 8 a.m. Nov. 13 to 10 p.m. Nov. 14. A handgun was stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked door. 

HAYMARKET AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Mountain Rd., 3700 block, 6:30 p.m. Nov. 10 to 5:30 a.m. Nov. 11. A firearm and crossbows were stolen from a residence. An 18-year-old Haymarket man was arrested.

Old Carolina Rd., 6500 block, 7 p.m. Nov. 9 to 9 a.m. Nov. 11. A video-game system and games were stolen from a residence entered by damaging a rear door.

MANASSAS AREA

SEXUAL ASSAULT

Round Top Rd., 8900 block, Nov. 13. During an argument in a vehicle, a man sexually assaulted a female acquaintance. A 53-year-old Manassas man was arrested and charged with rape.

WOODBRIDGE AREA

HOMICIDE

Keating Dr., 13400 block, 12:09 a.m. Nov. 16. During an argument in front of a residence, a man shot another man and a male juvenile. The gunman fled with a male acquaintance. Both victims were transported to a hospital where Christopher Nathaniel Weaver, 19, died. The juvenile is expected to recover. A 35-year-old Vienna man was arrested.

ASSAULTS

Concord Dr., 15100 block, Nov. 12. During an argument, a woman repeatedly hit a female juvenile relative with a cable and an extension cord. A 33-year-old Woodbridge woman was arrested.

Kramer Estates Dr., 16300 block, 9:07 p.m. Nov. 14. During a party at a clubhouse, a male security guard falsely identified himself as a police officer and turned away attendees, causing a fight. The man stabbed a male juvenile in the chest and cut his face. Gunshots also were heard but no one was reported shot. A 19-year-old Dumfries man was arrested.

ROBBERIES

Old Kings Rd. and Flintlock Terr., 6:06 p.m. Nov. 12. Two gunmen robbed a man and a woman of property as they were sitting in a vehicle.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Anchorstone Dr., 5000 block, 3:45 to 5:45 p.m. Nov. 13. A decorative wall hanging was stolen from a residence.

Bramblewood Lane, 16500 block, 3:40 to 3:50 p.m. Nov. 16. Copper wire was stolen from a residence entered through an open garage door.

Build America Dr., 14800 block, 9 p.m. Nov. 15 to 8 a.m. Nov. 16. Cash was stolen from a business entered by breaking glass in a front door.

Hornet Way, 13600 block, 8 a.m. to 6:30 p.m. Nov. 9. A residence was entered and ransacked. Nothing was reported stolen.

Manassas

No reports were received from Manassas police for this edition of Local Living. For information, call 703-257-8000.

Manassas Park

No reports were received from Manassas Park police for this edition of Local Living. For information, call 703-361-1136.

Crime Report


SECTION: EXTRAS; Pg. SM10


LENGTH: 851 words


Calvert County 

These were among reports received by the Calvert County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. Anyone with information about these crimes should call the Criminal Investigation Division, 410-535-2800 or 301-855-1194, or the Crime Solvers line, 410-535-2880. You can also call the Prince Frederick Barrack of the state police at 410-535-1400.

Chesapeake Beach Area

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

SUMMER CITY BOULEVARD, 3:20 p.m. Aug. 16. A license plate was stolen from a motorcycle. 

Lusby Area

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

COVE POINT ROAD, 9 p.m. Aug. 11 to 5:30 a.m. Aug. 12. Candy and drinks were stolen from a snack bar at a pool. Yellow paint was splashed on a storage shed, and various items near the pool were destroyed. A TV, broken glass and chairs were thrown in the pool. Three men, 18, were each charged with second- and fourth-degree burglary, theft more than $500 and malicious destruction of property more than $500.

RIO GRANDE TRAIL, 11:51 a.m. Aug. 13. A purse was stolen from a vehicle in a driveway at a residence.

North Beach Area

VANDALISM

ERIE AVENUE, 11:55 a.m. Aug. 11. Copper piping was destroyed on an air-conditioning unit.

Owings Area

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

CHESAPEAKE BEACH ROAD E., Aug. 10. An ATV and tools were stolen from a business.

NORFOLK DRIVE, 5 p.m. Aug. 12 to 6:49 a.m. Aug. 13. Tools were stolen from a utility truck.

VANDALISM

MOUNT HARMONY ROAD W., 5:40 p.m. Aug. 17. A vehicle was damaged by being kicked. A boy, 17, was charged with malicious destruction of property.

Solomons Area

ASSAULTS

SOLOMONS, 11:40 p.m. Aug. 17. After an incident at a restaurant, a man, 22, was charged with assault, disorderly conduct and intoxicated endangerment.

VANDALISM

SOLOMONS, 8:45 a.m. to 10:20 p.m. Aug. 13. A fire extinguisher was discharged inside the cabin of a boat docked at a marina.

SOLOMONS, Aug. 14. Tires were cut on several vehicles, two of which were damaged inside.

Charles County 

These were among reports received by the Charles County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. For information, call 301-932-2222 or 301-870-3232. Crime Solvers will pay a reward for information leading to an arrest and an indictment in connection with these and other crimes. Call the 24-hour hotline at 866-411-8477. Callers may remain anonymous. The Charles County Sheriff's Office Web site is: http://www.ccso.us. Included at the site are daily news releases, Crime Watch neighborhood statistics, community services, crime prevention programs and career opportunities.

Bryans Road Area

ASSAULTS

MARSHALL DR., 1400 block, 3:02 p.m. Aug. 16. During a dispute over whether some garden produce had been stolen, a man with a machete attacked a man who had tried to run him down with a vehicle. A man, 57, was charged with first-degree assault. Charges against the other man are pending.

Cobb Island Area

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

POTOMAC RIVER DR., 15000 block, 3:50 p.m. Aug. 19. A residence was entered by removing an air-conditioning unit from a window. Three men, 20 and 21, were charged with first-degree burglary.

Indian Head Area

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

INDIAN HEAD HWY., 4600 block, 7:54 a.m. Aug. 13. A cash register was stolen from a business entered by force. A break-in also occurred at a nearby business. Nothing was reported missing.

PISGAH-MARBURY RD., 4700 block, 8:30 a.m. Aug. 18. Twenty, 15-foot aluminum benches were dismantled and stolen from an elementary school.

Newburg Area

HOME INVASION INCIDENTS

WAVERLY POINT ROAD, 8:25 p.m. Aug. 18. Two gunmen wearing masks entered a garage. One forced a man to go inside a nearby residence, while the other stayed in the garage with a woman. The robbery was interrupted when another male occupant returned home and fired two rounds from a handgun. The intruders fled empty-handed. No injuries were reported.

Waldorf Area

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

PIKA DR., 11700 block, 8:57 a.m. Aug. 17. Tow chains and other property were stolen from vehicles at an automotive-services business.

WOODVILLE RD., 14000 block, 2:50 a.m. Aug. 13. Three bags of potato chips were stolen from a store entered by breaking glass in the front door.

St. Mary's County 

These were among reports received by the St. Mary's County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. For information, call 301-475-8008, or the Crime Solvers line, 301-475-3333. The Leonardtown Barrack of the Maryland State Police operates a 24-hour crime tip line on which people may anonymously report information about crimes and related matters at 301-475-2936.

Lexington Park Area

SEXUAL ASSAULTS 

LEXINGTON PARK, Aug. 16. A man sexually assaulted a woman, 19, who had consumed alcohol and fallen asleep. A man, 21, was charged with second-degree rape and second-degree assault.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

LEXINGTON PARK, 11:46 p.m. Aug. 16. A woman kicked in the front door of residence and assaulted a female occupant. A woman, 37, was charged with burglary and second-degree assault.

Park Hall Area

ASSAULTS

POINT LOOKOUT AND PARK HALL ROADS, 4:36 p.m. Aug. 15. Someone spit on a police officer during a traffic stop. A woman, 45, was charged with second-degree assault on a police officer.

-- Compiled by BONNIE SMITH

Prince William County crime report


SECTION: METRO; Pg. T21


LENGTH: 606 words


Prince William County

These were among incidents reported by Prince William County police. For information, call 703-792-7245.

BRISTOW AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Linton Hall Rd., 8600 block, 11:45 a.m. to 1 p.m. Jan. 20. Cash and jewelry were stolen from a residence entered by breaking a rear window.

DUMFRIES AREA

ASSAULTS

Porters Inn Dr., 16900 block, 11:26 a.m. Jan. 15. Two women assaulted a female acquaintance, who was treated later for injuries. 

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Hudson River Ct., 4200 block, 1:43 p.m. Jan. 21. A male entered a community pool house through a window. A Dumfries male, 16, was arrested.

MANASSAS AREA

SEXUAL ASSAULT

Stagestone Way area , 1:55 p.m. Jan. 12. A man sexually assaulted a male acquaintance between 2004 and 2010. A Culpeper man, 45, was arrested.

ROBBERIES

Launch Cir., 10300 block, 8:52 p.m. Jan. 16. A man demanded money from a man who had arranged to meet a female acquaintance in the area. The second man pulled out a knife, and the robber fled empty-handed. A Manassas woman, 18, was arrested.

Sudley Manor Dr., 11600 block, 2 p.m. Jan. 13. A man and two male juveniles robbed a male juvenile of cash at gunpoint. The juvenile who was robbed had arranged to meet acquaintances for a narcotics transaction in the area.

Sudley Rd., 7400 block, 8:52 p.m. Jan. 21. A gunman robbed a store of cash.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Oak St., 7800 block, 12:01 to 1:30 a.m. Jan. 13. Tools and equipment were stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked door.

TRIANGLE AREA

ROBBERIES

Graham Park Rd. and Kilmer Lane, 11:55 a.m. Jan. 19. A gunman robbed an acquaintance of cash.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Graham Ct., 18200 block, 3:30 to 4:55 p.m. Jan. 20. Electronics were stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked rear window.

WOODBRIDGE AREA

SEXUAL ASSAULT

Lodge Terr. area, Jan. 18. After an argument involving a man and a female acquaintance at a residence, the man left, then returned and continued to argue. When the woman attempted to call police, the man choked her and she lost consciousness. She awoke in a different room, and the man sexually assaulted her. A Woodbridge man, 33, was arrested.

ROBBERIES

Horner Rd., 1100 block, 5:06 p.m. Jan. 15. A gunman robbed a hotel of cash.

Potomac Mills Rd., 14700 block, 2:02 p.m. Jan. 17. A man hit a male with a bat and robbed him of cash. The injured male was transported to a hospital.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Battery Hill Cir., 2300 block, 10:28 a.m. Jan. 20. Two people entered a residence by breaking a rear window. Nothing was reported stolen. A witness saw the two and called police. A boy and a girl, both 16 and from Woodbridge, were arrested.

Pratt St., 14400 block, 10:28 p.m. Jan. 20. A computer tablet, a cellphone and jewelry were stolen from a residence entered by forcing open several rear doors.

Woodhaven Ct., 3600 block, 6 p.m. Jan. 16 to midnight to Jan. 17. Two gunmen entered a residence through an unlocked door and fled with prescription medicine.

Manassas

These were among incidents reported by Manassas police. For more information, call 703-257-8000.

WEAPONS

Mathis Ave., 8900 block, 1:40 a.m. Jan. 17. Gunshots from a parking lot were heard.

ROBBERIES

Wellington Rd., 9900 block, 7:30 p.m. Jan. 14. A gunman robbed a gas station of cash.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Mathis Ave., 8600 block, Jan. 7. A man stole cash and a safe from a restaurant.

Signal Hill Rd., 8700 block, 8:30 a.m to 4 p.m. Jan. 12. Coin boxes were stolen from two washing machines at an apartment complex. The machines were damaged.

Manassas Park

No reports were received from Manassas Park police for this edition of Local Living. For information, call 703-361-1136.

- Compiled by Sarah Lane

Southern Maryland crime report


SECTION: Metro; Pg. T31


LENGTH: 919 words


Calvert County

These were among reports received by the Calvert County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. Anyone with information about these crimes is asked to call the Criminal Investigation Division, 410-535-2800 or 301-855-1194, or the Crime Solvers line, 410-535-2880. Residents can also call the Prince Frederick Barrack of the state police at 410-535-1400.

CHESAPEAKE BEACH AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS  

Old Bayside Rd.,9:59 a.m. Aug. 7. A padlock on a shed was cut.

HUNTINGTOWN AREA VANDALISM

Hoile Lane,Aug. 4. A mailbox was damaged at night.

LUSBY AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Chesapeake Beach Ranch Estates,Aug. 6 to Aug. 8. Two tires were stolen from a camper parked at a campground.

Heron Lane,Aug. 5. A bicycle was stolen from a front porch.

Heron Lane,Aug. 5. Property was stolen from a back yard.

OWINGS AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Mount Harmony Rd.,8:37 p.m. Aug. 5. Items were stolen from an unlocked vehicle.

ST. LEONARD AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Maryland Ave.,3:36 p.m. Aug. 9. A license plate was take from a vehicle.

Charles County

These were among reports received by the Charles County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. For information, call 301-932-2222 or 301-870-3232. The sheriff's Web site, www.ccso.us, has news releases, local crime statistics, crime prevention programs and career opportunities.

REWARDS FOR INFORMATION

Crime Solvers will pay a reward for information leading to an arrest and an indictment in connection with these and other crimes. Call the 24-hour hotline at 866-411-8477. Callers may remain anonymous.

INDIAN HEAD AREA ROBBERIES

Nelson Point Rd., 5300 block, 12:15 a.m. Aug. 7. A group of men forcibly entered a home and demanded cash. They fled with money, a cellphone and a video game unit. A resident was assaulted. Four suspects were found at a nearby home. Two Waldorf men, 20 and 21, a Pomfret man, 21, and a California man, 22, were charged with robbery.

NEWBURG AREA ARSON

Mount Victoria Rd.,10:04 p.m. Aug. 17. The interior of a pole barn was set on fire. The barn was destroyed.

WALDORF AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Westdale Ct.,3200 block, Aug. 13 to Aug. 14. Jewelry was stolen from a home.

VANDALISM

Piney Church Rd.,Aug. 12 to Aug. 13. Windows of two excavators were shattered.

St. Mary's County

These were among reports received by the St. Mary's County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. For information, call 301-475-8008. To submit a tip, call the Crime Solvers line at 301-475-3333. The Leonardtown Barrack of the Maryland State Police also has a 24-hour anonymous tip line at 301-475-2936.

CALIFORNIA AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

St. Andrew's Church Rd.,Aug. 10. A man awoke in his residence after an alarm on one of his two vehicles was triggered. He saw a woman standing between the two vehicles. When he went outside to investigate, the woman followed him into his home and refused to leave. A Clements woman, 33, was charged with fourth-degree burglary, two counts of rogue and vagabond, and disturbing the peace.

Woodlawn Dr.,Aug. 13. A go-cart was stolen from a home.

LEONARDTOWN AREA ASSAULTS

Leonardtown,Aug. 11. During an argument at a detention center, one inmate shoved another. A Great Mills man, 25, was charged with second-degree assault.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Oxen Ct.,Aug. 16. Property was stolen from a home.

VANDALISM

Point Lookout Rd.,Aug. 9. A woman threw landscaping rocks through windows of a house after she became angry with family members. She also threw bricks at two vehicles, damaging the windshields. A Lexington Park woman, 41, was charged with property destruction and reckless endangerment.

LEXINGTON PARK AREA ASSAULTS

Eric Rd.,Aug. 18. A man was assaulted by two men with whom he had argued that day.

Valley Ct.,Aug. 9. During an argument about money, a woman assaulted two acquaintances. A Lexington Park woman was charged with two counts of second-degree assault.

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Hilton Dr., Aug. 16. Two women left a bar with three men and went to an apartment. After drinking a glass of wine, one of the women passed out. A friend found her unresponsive and unclothed a short time later. A Lexington Park man, 31, was charged with second-degree rape.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Daisy Lane,Aug. 15. A license plate was stolen from a vehicle.

VANDALISM

Sandstone St.,Aug. 17. Windows of a vehicle were broken.

MECHANICSVILLE AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Jennifer Dr.,Aug. 15. Property was stolen from a shed.

Tin Top School Rd.,Aug. 14. A heat pump was stolen from a home.

VANDALISM

Laurel Grove Rd.,Aug. 13. Several mailboxes were damaged.

Persimmon Creek Rd.,11:44 p.m. Aug. 9. Fireworks were placed in a mailbox and ignited, causing damage.

ST. MARY'S CITY AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Indentured Lane,Aug. 13. Property was stolen from a house after it was forcibly entered.

Southern Maryland crime report


SECTION: METRO; Pg. T23


LENGTH: 950 words


Calvert County

These were among reports received by the Calvert County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. Anyone with information about these crimes should call the Criminal Investigation Division, 410-535-2800 or 301-855-1194, or the Crime Solvers line, 410-535-2880. You can also call the Prince Frederick Barrack of the Maryland State Police.

HUNTINGTOWN AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Plum Point Rd., 7:54 a.m. Aug. 5. Silver and coins were stolen from a closet at a residence.  

LUSBY AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Sidewinder Ct., Aug. 6. Copper was stolen from a home air conditioner.

NORTH BEACH AREA

ASSAULTS

Greenwood Ave., 1:30 a.m. Aug. 3. Three masked men forced their way into a home and stabbed a man, 26, during an altercation. He declined medical treatment. A Chesapeake Beach man, 20, and a North Beach youth, 17, were charged with first-degree assault and first-degree burglary.

OWINGS AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Doris Dr., 9:30 p.m. Aug. 7. A male intruder fled a garage upon discovery.

Fifth St., Aug. 7 to Aug. 9. Cash was stolen from a residence.

VANDALISM

Scaggs Rd., Aug. 9 to Aug. 10. Greens and a sprinkler at a golf course were damaged.

PRINCE FREDERICK AREA

ARSON

W. Dares Beach Rd., 6:32 p.m. Aug. 14. Property in a shopping cart was set on fire behind a grocery store.

ASSAULTS

Hallowing Lane, 12:48 p.m. Aug. 10. A woman at a vehicle at an intersection saw a man pull a handgun from his waistband and point it at the vehicle. A Prince Frederick man, 21, was charged with first- and second-degree assault, disorderly conduct, concealing a dangerous weapon and reckless endangerment.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Moonlight Lane, 2:34 p.m. Aug. 8. A camera was stolen from the glove compartment of an unlocked vehicle.

Prince Frederick Blvd., 5:14 p.m. Aug. 10. During a police traffic stop, it was discovered that a registration sticker on the vehicle had been stolen from St. Mary's County. A Prince Frederick woman, 39, was charged with possession of Oxycodone and stolen property.

VANDALISM

South Shore Terr., 12:01 p.m. Aug. 10. During a dispute, a Prince Frederick man damaged a tire on an acquaintance's vehicle.

ST. LEONARD AREA

SEXUAL ASSAULTS 

Calvert Beach Rd., Aug. 11. During a party, a man sexually assaulted a Leonardtown woman after she had fallen asleep in a bedroom. The woman awoke and found the man on top of her. She screamed and hit the man on the head with a bottle. A Lexington Park man, 19, was charged with second-degree rape and other offenses.

VANDALISM

Ross Rd., 1:47 p.m. Aug. 9. Firecrackers were ignited in a mailbox.

Charles County

These were among reports received by the Charles County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. For information, call 301-932-2222 or 301-870-3232. Crime Solvers will pay a reward for information leading to an arrest and an indictment in connection with these and other crimes. Call the 24-hour hotline at 866-411-8477. Callers may remain anonymous. The Charles County Sheriff's Office Web site is www.ccso.us, featuring daily news releases, Crime Watch neighborhood statistics, community services, crime prevention programs and career opportunities.

WALDORF AREA

ROBBERIES

St. Patrick's Dr., 100 block, 8:15 p.m. Aug. 9. A woman was pushed to the ground, and her cellphone was taken. During an arrest, a suspect hit a police officer and dislocated his shoulder. A male youth, 17, was charged with robbery and two counts of assault.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Berry Rd., 11700 block, 2 p.m. Aug. 11. A man was detained in a store for stealing a camera. The man fled from the business and was found a short time later hiding in woods. A D.C. man, 20, was charged with robbery, theft, second-degree assault, resisting arrest, disorderly conduct and giving a false name.

WEAPONS

Gadwell Pl., 4600 block, 6:39 a.m. Aug. 9. During a search-and-seizure warrant at a residence in connection with a mail fraud investigation, a man, 23, was armed with a rifle and allegedly threatened officers. Gunshots were fired, and the man was injured. He was taken to a hospital.

St. Mary's County

These were among reports received by the St. Mary's County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. For information, call 301-475-8008, or the Crime Solvers line, 301-475-3333. The Leonardtown Barrack of the Maryland State Police operates a 24-hour tip line on which people may anonymously report information at 301-475-2936.

CALIFORNIA AREA

ASSAULTS

Gross Dr., Aug. 10. During an argument, a woman assaulted an acquaintance at a home. A California woman, 21, was charged with second-degree assault.

VANDALISM

Three Notch Rd., 11:17 p.m. Aug. 14. An improvised explosive device was ignited behind a restaurant. The explosion damaged a vehicle.

LEXINGTON PARK AREA

ASSAULTS

Great Mills Rd., Aug. 9. During an argument, a man allegedly grabbed an acquaintance by the neck and forced her to the ground. A Lexington Park man, 53, was charged with second-degree assault.

MECHANICSVILLE AREA

HOMICIDES

Three Notch Rd., Aug. 13. A Lexington Park man, 31, was charged with first-degree murder, first-degree assault and robbery in connection with the death of Moneta Jo Strickland, 32, who died of blunt-force trauma.

ASSAULTS

Allison Cir., Aug. 8. A man assaulted an acquaintance and damaged a residence in an attempt to enter the home. A Mechanicsville man, 33, was charged with second-degree assault, disorderly conduct and malicious destruction of property.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Three Notch Rd., 8:07 a.m. Aug. 13. A U.S. flag was stolen from an auto parts store. A Loveville man, 50, was charged with theft.

RIDGE AREA

ASSAULTS

Sea Side View, Aug. 8. During an argument, someon ereportedly slapped an acquaintance. A Ridge woman, 51, was charged with second-degree assault.

September 22, 2011 Thursday

Alexandria and Arlington crime report Alexandria and Arlington crime report


SECTION: METRO; Pg. T24


LENGTH: 1259 words


Alexandria

These were among incidents reported by the Alexandria Police Department. For information, call 703-838-4636 or visitwww.alexandriava.gov/police.

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Fayette St. S., 200 block, 12:02 a.m. Sept. 12. A sexual assault was reported.

Slaters Lane, 900 block, 6:18 p.m. Sept. 11. A sexual assault was reported.

Reynolds St. S., 300 block, 5:01 a.m. Sept. 10. A sexual assault was reported.

ASSAULTS

Alfred St. S., 500 block, 6:55 p.m. Sept. 11. An assault was reported.  

Bradford Ct., 5400 block, 4:14 p.m. Sept. 10. An assault was reported.

Eisenhower Ave., 5000 block, 2:10 a.m. Sept. 11. An assault was reported.

Fairfax St. N., 900 block, 9:46 p.m. Sept. 9. A person was allegedly attacked by an acquaintance.

Fillmore Ave., 5100 block, 11 p.m. Sept. 10. An assault was reported.

Four Mile Rd., 500 block, 3:20 a.m. Sept. 9. An assault was reported.

Hopkins Ct., 300 block, 7:03 p.m. Sept. 10. An assault was reported.

Jordan St. N., 100 block, 7:19 p.m. Sept. 13. An assault was reported.

Morgan St., 5500 block, 12:19 a.m. Sept. 10. A man was punched in the face.

Pendleton St., 300 block, 3:26 p.m. Sept. 8. A woman was verbally threatened.

Princess St., 1500 block, 11:35 a.m. Sept. 7. An assault was reported.

Quaker Hill Dr., 1200 block, 6:22 p.m. Sept. 8. An assault with a deadly weapon was reported. An arrest was made.

Sanger Ave., 5800 block, 6:12 a.m. Sept. 8. An assault was reported.

ROBBERIES

Duke St., 4600 block, 9:26 a.m. Sept. 14. A robbery was reported.

King St., 3600 block, 2:39 p.m. Sept. 7. A bank was robbed of cash.

Vermont Ave. and S. Gordon St., 3 p.m. Sept. 9. A robbery was reported.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Cameron St., 6:22 p.m. Sept. 11. A wallet was stolen from a store.

Canal Center Plaza, 11:03 a.m. Sept. 8. A bag was stolen from a business storage area.

Columbus St. S., 400 block, 2:41 p.m. Sept. 9. A firearm was stolen from a vehicle.

Dawes Ave., 5200 block, 9:56 a.m. Sept. 8. A deposit box containing cash and checks was stolen from an office.

Duke St., 3000 block, 9:46 p.m. Sept. 9. A shoplifting incident was reported.

Duke St., 3100 block, 1:53 p.m. Sept. 12. A shoplifting incident was reported. An arrest was made.

Duke St., 4200 block, 10:27 a.m. Sept. 13. A theft was reported.

Duke St., 5300 block, 10:52 p.m. Sept. 11. A theft from a vehicle was reported.

Duke St., 5300 block, 11:25 a.m. Sept. 13. A theft was reported.

Duke St., 5800 block, 1:28 p.m. Sept. 10. Jewelry was stolen from a store.

Fayette St. S., 300 block, 5:48 p.m. Sept. 8. A credit card was used to make fraudulent purchases.

Franklin Ct., 2700 block, 10:57 a.m. Sept. 13. A theft from a vehicle was reported.

Franklin Ct., 2700 block, 2:02 p.m. Sept. 13. A theft from a vehicle was reported.

Gordon St. S., 2:59 a.m. Sept. 11. A theft was reported.

Holmes Run Pkwy., 5300 block, 9:11 a.m. Sept. 11. A bicycle was stolen from a storage area.

Jefferson Davis Hwy., 3400 block, 1:20 p.m. Sept. 7. A shoplifting incident was reported. An arrest was made.

Kenwood Ave., 1500 block, 1:08 p.m. Sept. 12. An auto part was stolen from a vehicle.

Key Dr., 1400 block, 11:53 a.m. Sept. 7. Cash and other property were stolen from a vehicle.

King St., 1000 block, 1:28 p.m. Sept. 7. A shoplifting incident was reported.

Kingston Ave., 1400 block, 1:22 p.m. Sept. 12. A cellphone was stolen from a vehicle.

Madison St., 600 block, 3:06 a.m. Sept. 14. A theft was reported.

Massey Lane, 700 block, 7:56 p.m. Sept. 12. A Global Positioning System device and other property were stolen from a vehicle.

Milan Dr., 3800 block, 9:26 a.m. Sept. 7. A theft from a vehicle was reported.

Mount Vernon Ave., 3000 block, 10:16 p.m. Sept. 13. A bicycle was stolen from a garage.

Overlook Dr. S., 800 block, 10:22 a.m. Sept. 11. A wallet was stolen from a vehicle.

Payne St. N., 1000 block, 1:27 p.m. Sept. 7. Property was stolen from a vehicle left at a garage for repairs.

Pickett St. S., 600 block, 8:04 a.m. Sept. 12. A cash register containing cash was stolen from a business.

Pickett St. S., 900 block, 2:50 p.m. Sept. 8. Checks were stolen from a company and some were cashed.

Prince St., 800 block, 10:16 a.m. Sept. 10. Planters with flowers were stolen from a residence.

Raleigh Ave., 4600 block, 6 p.m. Sept. 11. A theft was reported.

Rayburn Ave., 5600 block, 7:47 p.m. Sept. 9. Wallets and other property were stolen.

Reynolds St. S., 200 block, 1:16 p.m. Sept. 13. Tricycles and other property were stolen.

Taney Ave., 4400 block, 12:30 p.m. Sept. 11. A set of keys and other property were stolen from an apartment.

Taney Ave., 5300 block, 5:50 p.m. Sept. 11. A theft was reported.

Tivoli Parking Garage, 600 block, 6:08 p.m. Sept. 14. A theft was reported.

Van Dorn St. S., 100 block, 11:50 p.m. Sept. 9. A shoplifting incident was reported. An arrest was made.

Van Dorn St. S., 400 block, 3:32 p.m. Sept. 10. A license plate was stolen from a vehicle.

Washington St. S., 400 block, 7:12 p.m. Sept. 10. A shoplifting incident was reported.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Crestwood Dr., 1700 block, 9:20 a.m. Sept. 11. A vehicle was reported stolen.

Four Mile Rd., 800 block, 6:47 p.m. Sept. 13. A golf cart was stolen and smashed against a building.

Grandview Dr., 800 block, 6:40 a.m. Sept. 11. A vehicle was reported stolen.

Henry St. S., 500 block, 9:48 a.m. Sept. 11. A vehicle was reported stolen.

Jefferson Davis Hwy., 3500 block, 10:48 p.m. Sept. 10. A vehicle was reported stolen.

Roanoke Ave., 5400 block, 7:46 p.m. Sept. 11. An attempt was made to steal a vehicle.

Seminary Rd., 5000 block, Sept. 13. A motorcycle was stolen.

Arlington

These were among incidents reported by the Arlington County Police Department. For information, call 703-228-4331 or visitwww.arlingtoncrimesolvers.org.

ASSAULTS

Arlington Blvd., 1000 block, 8 p.m. Sept. 9. A woman assaulted a man after a traffic altercation.

Walter Reed Dr., 1000 block, 2 p.m. Sept. 7. A gym employee allegedly assaulted a co-worker.

Wilson Blvd., 1400 block, 4:50 p.m. Sept. 9. A restaurant employee allegedly assaulted a manager of the business.

Fifth Rd. N., 4000 block, 11:30 p.m. Sept. 7. A woman spat at a female's face during a dispute. A North Carolina woman, 29, was charged with assault.

INDECENT EXPOSURE

Seventh St. N., 3000-3100 blocks, 4:50 p.m. Sept. 7. A man exposed himself to two women after asking them for directions. Police located a suspect. An Arlington man, 29, was charged with indecent exposure.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Brandywine St. N., 2100 block, 10 p.m. Sept. 7 to 7 a.m. Sept. 8. Property was stolen from a vehicle, and another one was entered.

Campbell Ave., 4200 block, 9 a.m. Sept. 8 to 9 a.m. Sept. 9. Several rooms and vending machines in a hotel were entered.

Cameron St. N., 1900-2000 blocks, 9 p.m. Sept. 6 to 7 a.m. Sept. 7. Six vehicles were entered, and property was stolen from some of them.

Jefferson Davis Hwy. S., 1400 block, 5 p.m. Sept. 8 to 8 a.m. Sept. 9. Computers were stolen from an office.

June St. S., 2600 block, 7:30 p.m. Sept. 9 to 12:10 a.m. Sept. 10. A garage was entered through a window.

Venice St. N., 3400 block, noon Aug. 29 to 1 p.m. Sept. 2. Property was stolen from a residence.

10th Pl. S., 5200 block, 1 to 9 a.m. Sept. 10. Electronic items were stolen from a residence.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Fern St. S., 1200 block, Sept. 12. A black 2008 Toyota Corolla was stolen.

Irving St. S., 600 block, Sept. 10. A burgundy 2001 Toyota 4Runner was stolen.

Joyce St. S., 1400 block, Sept. 11. A gray 2006 Toyota Camry was stolen.

VANDALISM

Columbia Pike, 3800 block, 8:30 p.m. Sept. 9 to 9 a.m. Sept. 10. The windshields of four vehicles were broken.

- Compiled by Ria Manglapus

October 4, 2009 Sunday

Crime Report


SECTION: EXTRAS; Pg. SM06


LENGTH: 1034 words


Calvert County 

These were among reports received by the Calvert County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. Anyone with information about these crimes should call the Criminal Investigation Division, 410-535-2800 or 301-855-1194, or Crime Solvers, 410-535-2880. You can also call the Prince Frederick barrack of the state police at 410-535-1400.

Huntingtown Area

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

EVANS RD. AND JUNIPER LANE, Sept. 23-24. Property was stolen from 12 unlocked vehicles.

Lusby Area

ASSAULTS

GREGG DR., 8:35 p.m. Sept. 25. During a fight, a shotgun was fired into the air. A man, 42, was charged with first- and second-degree assault and reckless endangerment. 

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

DELAWARE DR., Sept. 24. A video game system was stolen from a residence.

LUSBY, Sept. 29. A man, 28, was charged with two counts of first-degree burglary and theft of more than $500 in connection with residential burglaries in St. Leonard earlier in the month.

RED CLOUD RD., Sept. 23-29. Two bicycles were stolen from outside a residence.

North Beach Area

VANDALISM

NORTH BEACH, 3 a.m. Sept. 15. Video surveillance recorded four people damaging playground equipment at a beach.

Prince Frederick Area

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

SOUTH SHORE DR. AND DEANE AVE., Sept. 23-25. Property was stolen from several unlocked vehicles.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

DOWELL RD., Sept. 25-26. A golf cart was stolen from a marina.

Charles County 

These were among reports received by the Charles County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. For information, call 301-932-2222 or 301-870-3232. Crime Solvers will pay a reward for information leading to an arrest and an indictment in connection with these and other crimes. Call the 24-hour hotline at 866-411-8477. Callers may remain anonymous. The Charles County Sheriff's Office Web site is: http://www.ccso.us. At the site are daily news releases, Crime Watch neighborhood statistics and information about community services, crime prevention programs and career opportunities.

Dentsville Area

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

DENTSVILLE, Sept. 22-26. Property was stolen from several unlocked vehicles and from other vehicles entered by breaking windows. Police said that most of the thefts occurred late at night.

Indian Head Area

ASSAULTS

JAMESON CT., 6:10 p.m. Sept. 22. A woman was assaulted at a residence. A woman, 23, was charged with third-degree burglary and assault.

La Plata Area

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

MIMOSA DR., 9200 block, 7:30 a.m. to 2:45 p.m. Sept. 25. Property was stolen from a residence.

Waldorf Area

ASSAULTS

ST. THOMAS DR., 2000 block, 5:30 p.m. Sept. 25. A man with cuts on his arm and shoulder said that he was the victim of an attack but refused to provide information about an assailant.

VANDALISM

UNIVERSITY DR., 400 block, 3:30 to 3:45 a.m. Sept. 24. Six industrial air-conditioning units, four cast-iron drains, an air-vent cover, a weather station and 12 roof-walking mats were damaged at an elementary school.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

ROUTES 228 AND 229, 8:52 p.m. Sept. 23. A man on a motorcycle refused to stop for police, then abandoned the bike, which had been reported stolen, in a residential neighborhood. After a brief foot chase, a 32-year-old man was arrested. He was charged with several moving violations and with theft of a motor vehicle.

White Plains Area

ASSAULTS

CRAIN HWY., 4700 block, 5:30 p.m. Sept. 23. A woman struck a 5-year-old girl in the face, causing her nose to bleed, then spit on and punched a male who intervened. A woman, 24, was charged with second-degree child abuse and two counts of assault.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

DUFFIELD RD., 4600 block, 8 p.m. Sept. 26 to 7:30 a.m. Sept. 27. A computer was stolen from a warehouse.

St. Mary's County 

These were among reports received by the St. Mary's County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. For information, call 301-475-8008, or Crime Solvers, 301-475-3333. The Leonardtown barrack of the Maryland State Police operates a 24-hour crime tip line on which people may anonymously report information about crimes and related matters at 301-475-2936.

Bushwood Area

ASSAULTS

UPLAND DR., Sept. 26. A man at a residence hit a female in the face. A man, 35, was charged with second-degree assault.

California Area

ASSAULTS

BARINGER DR., Sept. 30. A man at a residence grabbed a woman by the arm and threw her on a bed. After threatening her with a loaded shotgun, he left the premises. She locked him out, and when he returned he damaged the front door during an attempt to kick it open. A man, 27, was charged with first- and second-degree assault and destruction of property.

Charlotte Hall Area

ROBBERIES

CHARLOTTE HALL, Sept. 24. A male committed an armed robbery during the early-morning hours.

Lexington Park Area

SEXUAL ASSAULTS 

LEXINGTON PARK, 8:45 p.m. Sept. 30. A woman was sexually assaulted at a residence. A man, 22, was charged with sodomy and fourth-degree sex offense.

ASSAULTS

GREAT MILLS RD., Sept. 25. A person was threatened with a knife. A man, 20, was charged with first- and second-degree assault and with making a false statement to a police officer.

GREAT MILLS RD., 5:36 p.m. Sept. 24. A man was assaulted in a liquor store parking lot. A woman, 45, was charged with second-degree assault and public intoxication.

LIBERTY ST., 12:36 a.m. Sept. 26. A woman assaulted a man. A woman, 23, was charged with second-degree assault.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

PEMBROOKE ST., 7:41 a.m. Sept. 25. Five boxes of vinyl siding were stolen from a construction site.

ST. GABRIEL CIR., 12:53 p.m. Sept. 24. Property was stolen from a residence.

Mechanicsville Area

ASSAULTS

CEDAR VIEW CT., Sept. 27. A person was grabbed roughly by the arm during a verbal dispute. A man, 44, was charged with second-degree assault.

CIRCLE RD., Sept. 25. A person was struck in the arm and face during a domestic dispute. A man, 46, was charged with second-degree assault.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

MECHANICSVILLE, Sept. 28. A 21-year-old man was charged with possession of stolen property, theft scheme, two counts of theft of more than $500 and two counts of theft of less than $500.

St. Inigoes Area

ASSAULTS

POINT LOOKOUT RD., Sept. 30. A person's wrist was injured during a dispute. A woman, 46, was charged with second-degree assault.

-- Compiled by BONNIE SMITH

May 3, 2009 Sunday

Crime Report


SECTION: EXTRAS; Pg. SM10


LENGTH: 1135 words


Calvert County 

These were among reports received by the Calvert County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. Anyone with information about these crimes should call the Criminal Investigation Division, 410-535-2800 or 301-855-1194, or Crime Solvers, 410-535-2880. You can also call the Prince Frederick barrack of the state police at 410-535-1400.

Chesapeake Beach Area

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

SUMMER CITY BLVD., April 21 to 22. A video game system and games were stolen from a residence.

Dunkirk Area

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

ROUTE 4, 4 p.m. April 27. Cash was stolen from a vehicle. 

Lusby Area

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

GRAY'S RD., 2 p.m. April 18 to 10:30 a.m. April 19. A residence was damaged during a break-in. Nothing was reported missing.

OVERLOOK DR., 12:30 to 4 p.m. April 25. Cash was stolen from an unlocked vehicle.

North Beach Area

ASSAULTS

BAY AVE., 7:30 p.m. April 25. A woman was attacked on the boardwalk. A man, 19, was charged with second-degree assault.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

SEVENTH ST., 12:21 p.m. April 21. Several items were stolen from a residence. A woman, 60, was charged with theft.

Owings Area

VEHICLE THEFTS

JOURNEY DR., 11:05 a.m. April 23. A 1999 Nissan Sentra was stolen from a driveway at a residence.

Port Republic Area

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

BROOMES ISLAND RD., April 26. A man in a vehicle threatened to stab another man in the vehicle and robbed him of cash. A man, 20, was charged with false imprisonment and robbery.

Prince Frederick Area

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

SOLOMONS ISLAND RD., 10 a.m. April 28. A 1993 Bobcat was stolen from a construction site.

Charles County 

These were among reports received by the Charles County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. For further information, call 301-932-2222 or 301-870-3232. Crime Solvers will pay a reward for information leading to an arrest and an indictment in connection with these and other crimes. Call the 24-hour hotline at 866-411-8477. Callers may remain anonymous. The Charles County Sheriff's Office Web site is: http://www.ccso.us. At the site are daily news releases, Crime Watch neighborhood statistics and information about community services, crime prevention programs and career opportunities.

Indian Head Area

VANDALISM

INDIAN HEAD HWY., 4900 block, 9:30 a.m. April 21. A swastika and other graffiti were written on walls in a school rest room.

Pomfret Area

ASSAULTS

MARSHALL'S CORNER RD., 8300 block, 11:16 p.m. April 23. During a fight, a man was hit in the head with a beer bottle, and another man was threatened with a handgun.

Waldorf Area

ASSAULTS

CHARTER OAK CT., 2:37 a.m. April 22. During an altercation, a man, 23, was cut on the hand. A boy, 15, was charged with first-degree assault.

ELL LANE, 12000 block, 11:32 p.m. April 27. During a fight involving several people in front of an apartment building, a man, 24, was stabbed.

SUGAR MILL CT., 2200 block, 10:32 p.m. April 23. A man with a knife attacked a 35-year-old man. A man, 19, was charged with first-degree assault.

WESTDALE DR., 200 block, 6:12 p.m. April 22. A boy, 15, was threatened and robbed of a watch and cellphone. Two boys, ages 14 and 15, were charged with assault and theft of more than $500.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

GARNER AVE., 300 block, 8:54 a.m. April 29. A man entered a residence through an unlocked window, then fled when confronted by an occupant. A man, 26, was charged with first-, third- and fourth-degree burglary.

MICHAEL RD., 1900 block, noon, April 26. Two males were seen running from the rear of a residence that was later found to have been ransacked. Nothing was reported missing.

ST. PATRICK'S DR., 100 block, 12:50 a.m. April 25. A male in a dental office fled through a window when he was confronted.

WALDORF, 11 p.m. April 26 to 7 a.m. April 27. Eight tires were stolen from two vehicles in the Somerset neighborhood. The vehicles were left sitting on concrete bricks.

St. Mary's County 

These were among reports received by the St. Mary's County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. For further information, call 301-475-8008, or Crime Solvers, 301-475-3333. The Leonardtown barrack of the Maryland State Police operates a 24-hour crime tip line on which people may anonymously report information about crimes and related matters at 301-475-2936.

California Area

ASSAULTS

KINDER LANE, April 24. A person was bitten on the hand during an argument. A woman, 47, was charged with second-degree assault.

TOWN CREEK SHOP LANE, 8:41 a.m. April 27. Windows of two vehicles were broken.

Charlotte Hall Area

SEXUAL ASSAULTS 

CHARLOTTE HALL, April 28. A 47-year-old man who had had temporary care and custody of a child was charged with child sexual abuse, child abuse and child sexual abuse in a continuing course of action.

Great Mills Area

ASSAULTS

INDIAN WAY, April 29. A man scratched and kicked a person at a residence. A man, 28, was charged with second-degree assault.

Leonardtown Area

ASSAULTS

BELVIDERE LANE, 5:26 p.m. April 25. A man threatened an acquaintance with a gun and held her against her will at her residence. She escaped and got in her vehicle, driving a short distance with the man clinging to the hood and wielding the weapon. On April 26, police went to the scene to serve a warrant for first-degree assault. Gunfire was exchanged. The man, 46, was found to have died of a self-inflicted gunshot wound.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

KNIGHT RD., 3:55 a.m. April 28. Forty-five bags of mulch were stolen and three horses were let loose from a barn.

MEDLEY'S NECK RD., 8:55 a.m. April 25. A four-wheel ATV was stolen from a garage.

Lexington Park Area

ASSAULTS

CAREFREE WAY, April 28. During an argument, a man hit a woman in the face. She fled to a residence, but the assailant followed and kicked in the door. After a neighbor intervened, the man left. A man, 24, was charged with second-degree assault.

LEESA CT., April 24. During an argument, a man grabbed a person by the arms. A man, 21, was charged with second-degree assault.

LINCOLN AVE., April 29. A man punched a female in the face. A man, 35, was charged with second-degree assault.

SPINNAKER CT., 1:53 a.m. April 25. A 27-year-old woman was assaulted at a residence. A man, 26, was charged with second-degree assault.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

LIBERTY ST., April 24. A man forced his way into a residence after an occupant answered the door. He was asked to leave, at gunpoint, and did so. He tried to reenter the residence. A man, 28, was charged with fourth-degree burglary.

VANDALISM

LEXINGTON PARK, 10 p.m. April 28 to 6 a.m. April 29. Windows of several vehicles were broken by gunshot. A boy, 17, was charged with five counts of destruction of property and one count of malicious destruction of property valued at more than $500.

Mechanicsville Area

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

THREE NOTCH RD., 7:01 p.m. April 26. A purse was stolen from a vehicle entered by breaking a window.

-- Compiled by BONNIE SMITH

Alexandria and Arlington crime report Alexandria and Arlington crime report


SECTION: METRO; Pg. T24


LENGTH: 1118 words


Alexandria

These were among incidents reported by the Alexandria Police Department. For information, call 703-838-4636 or visit www.alexandriava.gov/police.

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Holmes Run Pkwy., 5000 block, Sept. 28. A sexual assault was reported.

Quaker Lane N., 1200 block, Oct. 1. A sexual assault was reported.

ASSAULTS

Armistead St. N., 500 block, Oct. 1. Two acquaintances fought each other.

Braddock Rd. W., 4400 block, Sept. 29. Two acquaintances fought each other.

Bragg St. S., Sept. 29. An assault was reported.  

Bruce St., 3900 block, Sept. 30. Two acquaintances fought each other.

Four Mile Rd. and Old Dominion Blvd., Sept. 26. Two acquaintances fought each other.

Howard St. N., 700 block, Sept. 28. Two acquaintances fought each other.

King St., 3600 block, Sept. 28. A person pushed an employee at a store during a dispute, then fled.

King St., 4300 block, Sept. 30. Two acquaintances fought each other.

Lincolnia Ave., 6100 block, Sept. 28. An assault was reported.

Nelson Ave. W., Sept. 29. Two acquaintances fought each other.

Quaker Rd. N., 1300 block, Oct. 3. An assault was reported.

Queen St., 1100 block, Oct. 2. An assault was reported.

Taney Ave., 5300 block, Sept. 30. Two brothers fought each other.

Trent Ct., 5500 block, Sept. 29. Two acquaintances fought each other.

Van Dorn St. S., 100 block, Oct. 1. An assault was reported.

Van Dorn St. S., 300 block, Sept. 30. Two acquaintances fought each other.

Van Dorn St. S., 700 block, Sept. 27. Two acquaintances fought each other.

Whiting St. S., 400 block, Sept. 29. An assault was reported.

ROBBERIES

Armistead St. N., 500 block, Sept. 30. A person robbed a pizza deliveryman of cash.

Whiting St. S., 200 block, Oct. 2. A gunman demanded money from a man, then fled when the man said he had no cash.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Alfred St. N., 900 block, Sept. 29. A cellphone was stolen from a residence.

Braddock Rd. W., 3800 block, Sept. 27. A purse was stolen from a vehicle.

Bradford Ct., 5400 block, Sept. 28. Cash and jewelry were stolen from a room.

Business Center Dr., 2900 block, Oct. 2. A theft was reported.

Cameron Station Blvd., 400 block, Oct. 3. A theft was reported.

Cameron St., 100 block, Oct. 1. A copper downspout was stolen from a building.

Century Pl., 200 block, Sept. 27. A laptop computer was among property stolen from an apartment.

Duke St., 5300 block, Sept. 27. Speakers were stolen from the trunk of a vehicle.

Duke St., 5400 block, Oct. 2. An iPhone was among items stolen from a vehicle.

Edsall Rd., 5700 block, Sept. 28. A shoplifting incident was reported.

Edsall Rd., 6000 block, Oct. 1. Tires were removed from a vehicle.

Eisenhower Ave., 2400 block, Sept. 26. A Global Positioning System device and an iPod were stolen.

Fort Williams Pkwy., Sept. 26. A theft was reported.

Franklin St., 800 block, Sept. 29. A theft was reported.

Glebe Rd. W., 1000 block, Sept. 27. A male stole a case of beer from a store while another person prevented a clerk from chasing the male. An arrest was made.

Highview Lane N., 1400 block, Sept. 26. A license plate was stolen from a vehicle.

Jefferson Davis Hwy. and Slaters Lane, Oct. 1. A bicycle was stolen.

King St., 200 block, Sept. 26. Sunglasses were stolen from a store.

King St., 500 block, Sept. 26. A shoplifting incident was reported.

King St., 1200 block, Sept. 30. Jewelry was stolen from a residence.

King St., 1700 block, Sept. 27. A television was stolen from a hotel.

King St., 3200 block, Sept. 27. A laptop computer was among property stolen from two vehicles.

Landover St., 3200 block, Sept. 27. A theft was reported.

Luna Park Dr., 100 block, Sept. 27. A bicycle was stolen from a parking garage.

Luna Park Dr., 100 block, Sept. 28. A bicycle was stolen from a parking garage.

Mason Ave. E., 200 block, Sept. 26. A bicycle was stolen from an apartment.

Notabene Dr., 600 block, Sept. 29. Two gold bracelets were stolen from a bedroom.

Quaker Lane N., 1300 block, Sept. 26. Cash was stolen from a cash drawer at a business.

Quantrell Ave., 5800 block, Sept. 27. Fishing equipment was among property stolen from a storage area of a condominium.

Queen St., 700 block, Oct. 2. Construction equipment was stolen from a construction site.

Reynolds St. S., 300 block, Oct. 1. A theft was reported.

Roanoke Ave., 5400 block, Sept. 29. Four hubcaps were stolen from a vehicle.

St. Asaph St. N., 900 block, Sept. 27. A shoplifting incident was reported.

Seminary Rd., 4900 block, Sept. 27. A shoplifting incident was reported.

Sunset Dr.,Sept. 27. A bicycle was stolen from a residence.

Taylor Run Pkwy. W., Sept. 29. An attempt was made to steal a bicycle.

Van Dorn St. N., 500 block, Sept. 29. A cellphone at a business was stolen.

Van Dorn St. N., 700 block, Oct. 1. A theft was reported.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Carpenter Rd., 1800 block, Sept. 30. A vehicle was reported stolen.

Luna Park Dr., 200 block, Oct. 1. A vehicle was reported stolen.

Martha Custis Dr., 3200 block, Sept. 30. A vehicle was reported stolen.

Portner Rd., 1100 block, Sept. 30. A vehicle was reported stolen.

Taney Ave., 4500 block, Oct. 1. A vehicle was reported stolen.

Vicar Lane, 800 block, Sept. 29. A vehicle was reported stolen.

Arlington

These were among incidents reported by the Arlington County Police Department. For information, call 703-558-2222 or visit www.arlingtoncrimesolvers.org.

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

23rd St. S., 3500 block, 10:58 p.m. Oct. 1. Investigating screams for help, a police officer found a man allegedly attempting to rape a female in a wooded area. A Dumfries man, 34, was charged with attempted rape.

ABDUCTIONS

Pershing Dr. N., 4400 block, 3 to 4 a.m. Sept. 27. A gunman demanded that a person drive him to an apartment complex. The person parked the car and fled while the man stayed in the vehicle.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Clarendon Blvd. N., 1700 block, Oct. 1. License plates were stolen from a vehicle.

Fairfax Dr. N., 4200 block, 6 p.m. Sept. 26 to 8 a.m. Sept. 27. Five laptop computers were stolen from a business.

Lee Hwy. N., 3700 block, Oct. 1. License plates were stolen from a vehicle.

Troy St. N., 1700 block, 2 to 2:17 a.m. Sept. 28. A man kicked an apartment door, assaulted a female acquaintance and robbed her of cash and other property before fleeing. A Gaithersburg man, 25, was charged with burglary.

20th Pl. N. and 21st St. N., 4800 blocks, 3 to 6 p.m. Oct. 2. Property was stolen from several vehicles. A man, 52, of no fixed address was charged with several counts of vehicle trespassing and larceny.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Columbia Pike S., 2100 block, Oct. 1. A green 2006 Kawasaki motorcycle was stolen.

Courthouse Rd. S., 1200 block, Sept. 29. A red and white 2002 Honda XR650 motorcycle was stolen.

28th St. S.,1400 block, Oct. 1. A blue 2003 Dodge Ram was stolen.
