Crime Report


SECTION: EXTRAS; Pg. VA14


LENGTH: 555 words


Alexandria

These were among incidents reported recently by the Alexandria Police Department. For more information, call 703-838-4636.

ASSAULT

WYTHE ST., 1200 block, 10:15 p.m. Jan. 10. Two Alexandria boys, ages 16 and 17, were assaulted with a knife after they were approached by five males. The boys were taken to a hospital.

ROBBERY

DUKE ST., 5100 block, 9:45 p.m. Jan. 4. Three males allegedly assaulted an Alexandria man, 18, an Alexandria girl, 17, and a Fairfax County boy, 14, and robbed them of cash, electronic devices and other property. No injuries were reported. 

Arlington

These were among incidents reported recently by the Arlington County Police Department. For more information, call 703-228-4050 or visit http://www.arlingtoncrimesolvers.org.

ASSAULTS

COLUMBIA PIKE, 5000 block, 11 to 11:15 p.m. Jan. 11. During an argument, a 20-year-old man was stabbed in a restaurant. He was treated at a hospital.

GLEBE RD. N., 600 block, 3:30 p.m. Jan. 11. A group of juveniles pushed a 51-year-old female pedestrian to the ground. She suffered cuts and bruises and an arm injury.

SEXUAL ASSAULT 

NINTH ST. N., 4000 block, 3:15 p.m. Jan. 14. A man grabbed an 18-year-old female pedestrian and attempted to remove her clothing. She fought back, and the man fled.

INDECENT EXPOSURE

QUINCY ST. N., 1000 block, 12:15 p.m. Jan. 12. A man exposed himself to a 40-year-old woman in a library and fled before police arrived.

ROBBERIES

FAIRFAX DR. N., 1400 block, 11:42 p.m. Jan. 15. A man took a purse from a 34-year-old female pedestrian and fled with another man in a vehicle.

FORT MYER DR., 1900 block, 2:41 p.m. Jan. 11. A man entered a bank, gave a teller a note demanding money and fled with cash.

KENWOOD ST. S. AND S. 25TH ST., 10:35 p.m. Jan. 10. Three men got out of a vehicle, assaulted a 53-year-old male pedestrian and robbed him of cash. The male was treated at a hospital.

FOUR MILE RUN DR. S., 4600 block, 3 p.m. Jan. 7. A man attacked a 26-year-old woman from behind, and she fell. He grabbed her purse, then dropped it when she kicked him. The robber fled.

26TH ST. S., 600 block, 9:55 p.m. Jan. 8. A man implied he had a weapon and robbed a 42-year-old male pedestrian of a wallet and a cellphone. The pedestrian was struck in the face, and the robber fled with another male.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

ARMY NAVY DR., 2000 block, 3:30 p.m. Jan. 12 to 3 p.m. Jan. 13. A vacant residence was entered. Nothing was reported missing.

CLARK ST. S., 600 block, 4:40 to 6:20 p.m. Jan. 12. A safe containing cash was stolen from an office.

DICKERSON ST. S., 700 block. A license plate was stolen.

FILLMORE ST. N., 1200 block, 8 p.m. Jan. 13 to 4:30 a.m. Jan. 14. A cash box, tools and other property were stolen from a business.

GEORGE MASON DR. N., 400 block, 6 p.m. Jan. 10 to 6:30 a.m. Jan. 11. Construction material was stolen from a construction site.

KENMORE ST. S., 2000 block, noon Dec. 26 to 7 p.m. Jan. 7. An attempt was made to enter a residence by breaking a window.

KENTUCKY ST. N., 1100 block, 6;30 a.m. to 11:35 p.m. Jan. 15. A TV, two computers and other property were stolen from a residence.

FOUR MILE RUN DR. S., 4600 block. A license plate was stolen.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

BARTON ST. S., 1000 block. A green 1994 Ford Mustang was stolen.

BARTON ST. S., 800 block. A green 1997 Ford Thunderbird was stolen.

Prince William crime report


SECTION: METRO; Pg. T24


LENGTH: 872 words


Prince William

These were among incidents reported by Prince William County police. For information, call 703-792-7245.

BRISTOW AREA

ROBBERIES

Braemar Village Plaza, 12800 block, 4:09 p.m. March 7. A man threatened a bank employee and fled with cash. A 20-year-old Bristow man was arrested.

DUMFRIES AREA

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Montclair area, 15700 block, March 6. A male sexually assaulted two acquaintances. A 15-year-old from Dumfries was arrested. 

ASSAULTS

Chesapeake Dr., 3100 block, Feb. 26. A woman caused a burn by pressing salt and ice against the arm of a female acquaintance. A 21-year-old Dumfries woman was arrested.

INDECENT EXPOSURE INCIDENTS

Wayside Dr., 17200 block, 1:49 p.m. March 10. A naked man ran out of a wooded area, then went back into the woods when seen by three passersby. A short time later, the man, fully dressed, was seen leaving the area in a vehicle.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Fraley Blvd., 17700 block, 6:33 p.m. March 5 to 5:30 a.m. March 6. Cash was stolen from a business entered by forcing a bay door.

GAINESVILLE AREA

ASSAULTS

Artemus Dr., 5700 block, 3:25 a.m. March 8. A man entered a residence by kicking in a back door, then threatened a female acquaintance. A 32-year-old Manassas man was arrested.

Great Dover St., 7600 block, 9:15 p.m. March 8. During a party at a residence, a man attacked a man.

MANASSAS AREA

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Manassas Park area, March 10, An 18-year-old man was arrested in connection with the sexual assault of two juvenile acquaintances in February and March.

ASSAULTS

Fenwood Ct., 7400 block, 10:20 p.m. March 10. During an argument, a man attacked a female acquaintance. A 39-year-old Manassas man was arrested.

ROBBERIES

Community Dr., 8200 block, 10:33 p.m. March 10. A man threatened a person standing outside a residence and robbed him of a cellphone.

Rosemary Dr. and Sudley Rd., 7:11 p.m. March 8. A male approached a pedestrian from behind and robbed her of a purse.

WOODBRIDGE AREA

ASSAULTS

Colonial Dr., 1500 block, 1:24 p.m. March 7. During an argument at a residence, a woman fell and hit her head on a table. She then attacked an acquaintance, striking him with a shovel. A 44-year-old woman and a 52-year-old man, both of Woodbridge, were arrested.

Dale Blvd., 4100 block, 1:16 p.m. March 7. A man with a knife attacked an employee in a store, then fled in a vehicle. A 20-year-old Dumfries man was arrested. The victim was treated for stab wounds.

Jefferson Davis Hwy., 13900 block, 1:53 a.m. March 9. A man forced an acquaintance into a vehicle and threatened her at knifepoint. He then drove to her residence, where he pushed her from the vehicle. A 31-year-old Arlington County man was arrested.

ROBBERIES

Smoketown Rd., 14200 block, 9:21 p.m. March 6. Three men got into a vehicle and demanded cash from the motorist at gunpoint. After a brief struggle, during which a handgun was discharged, damaging the dashboard, the men fled empty-handed in a vehicle driven by an accomplice. Three Woodbridge men, ages 18, 18 and 19, and a 21-year-old Arlington County man were arrested.

Shoppers Best Way, 14000 block, 12:54 p.m. March 4. A man with a knife threatened grocery-store employees who had seen him conceal merchandise. A 58-year-old Cheverly man was arrested.

Worth Ave., 13300 block, 10:35 p.m. March 7. A male a bat demanded cash from a person leaving a store with a night deposit. After a brief struggle, the assailant fled empty-handed.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Gloucester Ct., 2800 block, 8:20 a.m. to 3 p.m. March 5. Two laptop computers, two tablet computers, two cellphones, a camera and a video game system were stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked door.

Harbor Dr., 12800 block, 8:15 to 8:22 p.m. March 7. Cash was stolen from a business entered by breaking a rear window.

Industry Ct., 14700 block, 4:30 a.m. March 8 to 5:25 a.m. March 9. Cash and T-shirts were stolen from a business entered by removing a deadbolt from a front door.

Taverner Loop, 13100 block, 12:10 to 1:20 p.m. March 5. An attempt was made to enter a residence by damaging the front door. Nothing was reported missing.

Uppsala Ct., 15900 block, 8 a.m. March 1 to 10 a.m. March 4. Credit cards, a TV, jewelry and prescription medication were stolen from a residence entered by breaking a basement window.

Village Dr., 14400 block, 1:35 a.m. March 10. A man entered a residence by forcing a back door, then fled empty-handed when confronted by an acquaintance. A 37-year-old man was arrested.

Woodvale Ct., 13500 block, 7:30 a.m. to 12:06 p.m. March 5. Two TVs were stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked door.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Ladue Ct., 1600 block, 5:25 p.m. March 6. After an altercation with an acquaintance at a residence, a man stole a food-delivery vehicle that had been left with its engine running. After crashing into a tractor-trailer, he abandoned the vehicle. A 21-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

Manassas

No report was received from Manassas police for this edition of Local Living. For information, call 703-257-8000.

Manassas Park

These were among the incidents reported by Manassas Park police. For information, call 703-361-1136.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Colburn Dr., 6:39 a.m. March 11. A camera, an MP3 player and sunglasses were stolen from an unlocked vehicle.

- Compiled by Sarah Lane

CORRECTION-DATE: March 22, 2012 Thursday


CORRECTION:

CORRECTION

A crime report listing in the March 1 Alexandria-Arlington Local Living incorrectly said that a sexual assault was reported in the Winkler Botanical Preserve area on Feb. 15. The incident was reported in the North Van Dorn Street area.

August 22, 2013 Thursday 8:13 PM EST 


Southern Maryland crime report


SECTION: Metro; Pg. T23


LENGTH: 1069 words


Calvert County

These were among reports received by the Calvert County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. Anyone with information about these crimes should call the Criminal Investigation Division, 410-535-2800 or 301-855-1194, or the Crime Solvers line, 410-535-2880. You can also call the Prince Frederick Barrack of the Maryland State Police.

HUNTINGTOWN AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS  

Plum Point Rd., 7:54 a.m. Aug. 5. Silver and coins were stolen from a closet at a residence.

LUSBY AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Sidewinder Ct., Aug. 6. Copper was stolen from a home air conditioner.

NORTH BEACH AREA ASSAULTS

Greenwood Ave., 1:30 a.m. Aug. 3. Three masked men forced their way into a home and stabbed a man, 26, during an altercation. He declined medical treatment. A Chesapeake Beach man, 20, and a North Beach youth, 17, were charged with first-degree assault and first-degree burglary.

OWINGS AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Doris Dr., 9:30 p.m. Aug. 7. A male intruder fled a garage upon discovery.

Fifth St., Aug. 7 to Aug. 9. Cash was stolen from a residence.

VANDALISM

Scaggs Rd., Aug. 9 to Aug. 10. Greens and a sprinkler at a golf course were damaged.

PRINCE FREDERICK AREA ARSON

W. Dares Beach Rd., 6:32 p.m. Aug. 14. Property in a shopping cart was set on fire behind a grocery store.

ASSAULTS

Hallowing Lane, 12:48 p.m. Aug. 10. A woman at a vehicle at an intersection saw a man pull a handgun from his waistband and point it at the vehicle. A Prince Frederick man, 21, was charged with first- and second-degree assault, disorderly conduct, concealing a dangerous weapon and reckless endangerment.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Moonlight Lane, 2:34 p.m. Aug. 8. A camera was stolen from the glove compartment of an unlocked vehicle.

Prince Frederick Blvd., 5:14 p.m. Aug. 10. During a police traffic stop, it was discovered that a registration sticker on the vehicle had been stolen from St. Mary's County. A Prince Frederick woman, 39, was charged with possession of Oxycodone and stolen property.

VANDALISM

South Shore Terr., 12:01 p.m. Aug. 10. During a dispute, a Prince Frederick man damaged a tire on an acquaintance's vehicle.

ST. LEONARD AREA SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Calvert Beach Rd., Aug. 11. During a party, a man sexually assaulted a Leonardtown woman after she had fallen asleep in a bedroom. The woman awoke and found the man on top of her. She screamed and hit the man on the head with a bottle. A Lexington Park man, 19, was charged with second-degree rape and other offenses.

VANDALISM

Ross Rd., 1:47 p.m. Aug. 9. Firecrackers were ignited in a mailbox.

Charles County

These were among reports received by the Charles County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. For information, call 301-932-2222 or 301-870-3232. Crime Solvers will pay a reward for information leading to an arrest and an indictment in connection with these and other crimes. Call the 24-hour hotline at 866-411-8477. Callers may remain anonymous. The Charles County Sheriff's Office Web site is www.ccso.us, featuring daily news releases, Crime Watch neighborhood statistics, community services, crime prevention programs and career opportunities.

WALDORF AREA ROBBERIES

St. Patrick's Dr.,100 block, 8:15 p.m. Aug. 9. A woman was pushed to the ground, and her cellphone was taken. During an arrest, a suspect hit a police officer and dislocated his shoulder. A male youth, 17, was charged with robbery and two counts of assault.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Berry Rd., 11700 block, 2 p.m. Aug. 11. A man was detained in a store for stealing a camera. The man fled from the business and was found a short time later hiding in woods. A D.C. man, 20, was charged with robbery, theft, second-degree assault, resisting arrest, disorderly conduct and giving a false name.

WEAPONS

Gadwell Pl.,4600 block, 6:39 a.m. Aug. 9. During a search-and-seizure warrant at a residence in connection with a mail fraud investigation, a man, 23, was armed with a rifle and allegedly threatened officers. Gunshots were fired, and the man was injured. He was taken to a hospital.

St. Mary's County

These were among reports received by the St. Mary's County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. For information, call 301-475-8008, or the Crime Solvers line, 301-475-3333. The Leonardtown Barrack of the Maryland State Police operates a 24-hour tip line on which people may anonymously report information at 301-475-2936.

CALIFORNIA AREA ASSAULTS

Gross Dr., Aug. 10. During an argument, a woman assaulted an acquaintance at a home. A California woman, 21, was charged with second-degree assault.

VANDALISM

Three Notch Rd., 11:17 p.m. Aug. 14. An improvised explosive device was ignited behind a restaurant. The explosion damaged a vehicle.

LEXINGTON PARK AREA ASSAULTS

Great Mills Rd., Aug. 9. During an argument, a man allegedly grabbed an acquaintance by the neck and forced her to the ground. A Lexington Park man, 53, was charged with second-degree assault.

MECHANICSVILLE AREA HOMICIDES

Three Notch Rd., Aug. 13. A Lexington Park man, 31, was charged with first-degree murder, first-degree assault and robbery in connection with the death of Moneta Jo Strickland, 32, who died of blunt-force trauma.

ASSAULTS

Allison Cir., Aug. 8. A man assaulted an acquaintance and damaged a residence in an attempt to enter the home. A Mechanicsville man, 33, was charged with second-degree assault, disorderly conduct and malicious destruction of property.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Three Notch Rd., 8:07 a.m. Aug. 13. A U.S. flag was stolen from an auto parts store. A Loveville man, 50, was charged with theft.

RIDGE AREA ASSAULTS

Sea Side View, Aug. 8. During an argument, someon ereportedly slapped an acquaintance. A Ridge woman, 51, was charged with second-degree assault.

- Compiled by Bonnie Smith

Prince William County crime report


SECTION: METRO; Pg. T21


LENGTH: 940 words


Prince William County crime report Prince William County crime reportAmong incidents reported by police in Prince William County, Manassas and Manassas Park.

Prince William

These were among incidents reported by Prince William County police. For information, call 703-792-7245.

DUMFRIES AREA

CHILD PORNOGRAPHY

Dumfries Rd. 1-100 Block, Sept. 4. A man was in possession of child pornography through a social media account. A 42-year-old Dumfries man was arrested. 

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Wayside Dr., 17100 block, 11:30 a.m. Aug. 27 to 8:30 a.m. Aug. 28. Cash was stolen from a business entered by breaking a glass front door.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Williamstown Dr. and Fraley Blvd., 10:16 a.m. Aug. 29. A vehicle was stolen. When a police officer attempted to stop the vehicle, the driver crashed into a traffic pole and fled on foot.

MANASSAS AREA

ASSAULTS

Coverstone Dr., 10900 block, 8:02 p.m. Aug. 30. During an argument, a man assaulted a female acquaintance and held a knife to her neck. A 27-year-old Manassas man was arrested.

Lee Ave., 9300 block, 2:50 p.m. Aug. 29. A man at the Adult Detention Center bit the thumb of an officer. A 26-year-old Oakland, Calif., man was arrested.

Sudley Rd., 8000 block, 6 p.m. Sept. 3. During an argument in a vehicle, a man assaulted a woman and choked her.

ROBBERIES

Battleview Pkwy., 10800 block, 9:42 p.m. Sept. 2. When a woman arranged to buy football tickets from a man in a restaurant parking lot, four males and a second woman assaulted the man and robbed him of a wallet and the tickets.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Charnwood Ct., 8500 block, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. Aug. 29. A laptop computer, a computer tablet and a keyboard were stolen from a residence entered by damaging a rear door.

Hallard Ct., 8600 block, 1:01 p.m. Aug. 26. A residence was entered by forcing a basement door.

Lantern Ct., 8000 block, noon Aug. 25 to 10:15 p.m. Aug. 30. An attempt was made to enter a residence by damaging a front door.

Woodbury Dr., 10100 block, 8:30 a.m. to 1:15 p.m. Aug. 26. An attempt was made to enter a residence by damaging a rear door.

WOODBRIDGE AREA

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Minnieville Rd., 14100 block, 8:20 p.m. Sept. 1. A man in a convenience store sexually assaulted a woman. A 26-year-old man was arrested.

Piccolo Lane, 14500 block, 9:11 p.m. Aug. 28. A man attempted to rape a female acquaintance while she was sleeping. When she woke up, he fled. A 20-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

River Bend Way, 1700 block, 9:59 a.m. Aug. 28. A man entered a residence through an unlocked window and sexually assaulted a female resident.

ASSAULTS

Earlham Ct., 14600 block, 8:36 a.m. Sept. 1. During an argument outside a residence, a man hit a male acquaintance in the face with a golf club. Residents intervened and broke up the fight. As the residents and the injured male entered the residence, the man threw a glass bottle, hitting a resident. A 45-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

ROBBERIES

Bannon Way, 15200 block, 7:25 p.m. Sept. 1. A man arranged to sell a cellphone to another man and a male juvenile. He entered the back seat of their vehicle, pulled out a handgun and demanded money. As the three struggled, the man pulled the trigger, but the gun failed to fire. The other man and juvenile fled and called police. The gunman fled with the car keys and a cellphone chip. A 27-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

F St., 1400 block, 10:57 a.m. Aug. 29. Three males knocked a male pedestrian to the ground and robbed him of a cellphone. The pedestrian was treated for injuries.

Hylton Ave., 1500 block, Aug. 29. Three males assaulted a male pedestrian and searched his pockets. They fled empty-handed.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Bayside Ave., 1300 block, 8:15 a.m. to 7 p.m. Aug. 31. A residence was entered by damaging a front door.

Birchdale Ave., 14200 block, 9 a.m. Aug. 27 to 9:20 p.m. Sept. 1. A video game system, games and DVDs were stolen from a residence.

Edgemoor Ct., 11200 block, 12:20 p.m. Aug. 28. A man attempted to enter a residence through a rear door. When a resident opened the blinds on the door, the man fled.

Kingsman Rd., 13600 block, 5:45 a.m. to 4 p.m. Aug. 27. Three laptop computers, two video game systems, games, other electronics and jewelry were stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked window.

Langley Ct., 13700 block, noon Aug. 30 to 4:30 p.m. Sept. 1. A laptop computer was stolen from a residence.

Misty Lane, 12800 block, 5 a.m. Aug. 27 to 10 a.m. Aug. 28. An attempt was made to enter a residence by damaging a rear window.

Stallion Ct., 12000 block, 5 p.m. Aug. 24 to 9 p.m. Aug. 26. Jewelry was stolen from a residence entered by damaging a rear door.

Woodvale Ct., 13500 block, 2 p.m. Aug. 24 to 7:15 a.m. Aug. 27. An attempt was made to enter a residence by damaging a basement window.

Manassas

These were among the incidents reported by Manassas police. For more information, call 703-257-8000.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Georgian Ct., 8400 block, 7 a.m. to 6:30 p.m. Sept. 3. Two laptop computers, a video game system, a video camera and watches were stolen from a residence entered through a rear window.

Liberia Ave., 9800 block, Aug. 27. An employee took cash and merchandise from a store. A 19-year-old Manassas man was arrested.

Tillet Loop, 8300 block, Aug. 30. Cash and a wallet were stolen from a vehicle inside a garage.

VANDALISM

Stonewall Rd., 8300 block, Sept. 1 to 2. Windows of six vehicles were broken.

Manassas Park

These were among the incidents reported by Manassas Park police. For more information, call 703-361-1136.

VANDALISM

Colfax Ct., 2:30 a.m. Sept. 1. A Honda Civic was damaged.

Conner Dr. and General Way, 11:13 p.m. Sept. 4. Windows of a vehicle were broken.

Crime Report


SECTION: EXTRAS; Pg. VA13


LENGTH: 990 words


Alexandria

These were among incidents reported by the Alexandria Police Department. For information, call 703-838-4636 or visit http://www.alexandriava.gov/police.

ASSAULTS

COMMONWEALTH AVE., 3300 block, 5:55 a.m. Dec. 20. An assault was reported.

GLEBE RD. W., 1000 block, 2:23 a.m. Dec. 20. An assault was reported.

LAVERNE AVE., 400 block, 5:32 a.m. Dec. 21. An assault was reported.

LYNHAVEN DR., 100 block, 11:13 p.m. Dec. 21. An assault was reported. 

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

BEAUREGARD ST. N., 1900 block, 5:26 p.m. Dec. 23. A theft was reported.

BRADDOCK RD. E., 400 block, 1:15 a.m. Dec. 21. A theft was reported.

DUKE ST., 4100 block, 8:05 a.m. Dec. 20. A theft was reported.

JEFFERSON DAVIS HWY., 1:30 p.m. Dec. 19. A theft was reported.

JEFFERSON DAVIS HWY., 7:09 p.m. Dec. 23. An embezzlement was reported.

KING ST., 3600 block, 4:24 p.m. Dec. 18. A theft was reported.

MOUNT VERNON AVE., 3400 block, 2:03 p.m. Dec. 18. A theft was reported.

MOUNT VERNON AVE., 3800 block, 3:01 p.m. Dec. 20. A theft was reported.

OAKCREST DR., 1600 block, 5:14 p.m. Dec. 23. A theft was reported.

SEMINARY RD., 4600 block, 7:04 a.m. Dec. 19. A theft from a vehicle was reported.

SEMINARY RD., 5000 block, 8:46 a.m. Dec. 19. A theft from a vehicle was reported.

TANEY AVE., 4400 block, 12:42 a.m. Dec. 18. A theft was reported.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

BUCHANAN ST., 300 block, 4:10 p.m. Dec. 22. A vehicle was reported stolen.

HOLLY ST., 2700 block, 4 p.m. Dec. 20. A vehicle was reported stolen.

STRUTFIELD LANE, 4500 block, 9 a.m. Dec. 18. A vehicle was reported stolen.

Arlington

These were among incidents reported by the Arlington County Police Department. For information, call 703-228-4331 or visit http://www.arlingtoncrimesolvers.org.

SEXUAL ASSAULTS 

HAYES ST. S., 1100 block, 8:30 p.m. Dec. 20. Four boys approached a woman on an escalator, and one of the boys grabbed the woman's buttocks. She shouted, and they fled on foot.

JEFFERSON DAVIS HWY. S., 2600 block, 9:30 p.m. Dec. 19. A man allegedly kissed and fondled a female co-worker. A 38-year-old Milford, N.M., man was charged with sexual battery.

ASSAULTS

ARMY NAVY DR. S., 800 block, 1:30 p.m. Dec. 22. A man assaulted another man in connection with a disagreement about a parking space.

GLEBE RD. N., 600 block, 10:30 p.m. Dec. 17. A man assaulted another man and his girlfriend outside a movie theater. When the woman tried to separate the men, the attacker pushed her to the ground and kicked her repeatedly. A 30-year-old Arlington man was charged with two counts of assault.

JOYCE ST. S., noon Dec. 18. A man allegedly pushed an Arlington County employee who was writing a traffic ticket and threw the ticket in the employee's face. A 32-year-old Alexandria man was charged with assault.

LEE HWY., 2500 block, Dec. 22. A maintenance worker found a man getting dressed in a boiler room. The man assaulted the worker and searched his pockets before fleeing.

LEXINGTON ST. N., 1800 block, 6:30 p.m. Dec. 17. A man told another man to stop bothering a female at a library. The man assaulted the bystander. A 20-year-old Arlington man was charged with assault.

INDECENT EXPOSURE

GLEBE RD. S., 2000 block, 10 p.m. Dec. 19. A woman saw a man standing in front of a window exposing himself.

ROBBERIES

CRYSTAL DR., 2100 block, 9:45 a.m. Dec. 20. A woman handed a note to a teller in a bank and left with cash.

GLEBE RD. N., 1900 block, 7 p.m. Dec. 18. A man pushed a woman to the ground and tried to take her bag. The woman resisted until the robber said he had a gun. The woman let go of her bag, and the robber fled in a dark blue vehicle.

GLEBE RD. S., 2700 block, 10:30 p.m. Dec. 19. The driver of a vehicle stopped beside a male pedestrian. One of the occupants displayed a weapon and took the man's cellphone.

PARK DR. N., 2:30 p.m. Dec. 21. A man displayed a knife and demanded money from another man. The man threatened to call police, and the robber fled.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

ARMY NAVY DR. S., 800 block, 6 p.m. Dec. 18. Several items were stolen from two vehicles.

COLUMBIA PIKE S., 3800 block, midnight to 8:30 a.m. Dec. 19. Various items were stolen from a vehicle, and its ignition was damaged.

CRYSTAL DR., 2200 block, 3 p.m. Dec. 17. Wallets were stolen from several lockers at a gym.

CRYSTAL DR., 2200 block, 3 p.m. Dec. 22. A man discovered that his wallet and credit cards had been stolen from his gym locker. When he called his credit card company, authorities located where his card had been used most recently. A 23-year-old Woodbridge man was charged with credit card theft and credit card fraud.

EMERSON ST. N., 800 block, 4 p.m. Dec. 16 to 1 p.m. Dec. 17. Items were stolen from a business entered by breaking a window.

GARFIELD ST. N., 1200 block. A gray 2006 Acura TSX was stolen.

HARRISON ST. N., 600 block, 4 p.m. Dec. 19 to 1:30 p.m. Dec. 23. The door and lock of a garage were damaged.

JOYCE ST. S., 1200 block, 6 to 7 p.m. Dec. 22. Items were stolen from several lockers at a gym.

MOORE ST. N., 1700 block, 2 p.m. Dec. 17. Items were stolen from several desks at an office.

ROLFE ST. N., 1200 block, 6:30 a.m. Dec. 19. A window was opened in an apartment.

TAFT ST. N., 1400 block, 4 p.m. Dec. 20 to 5 p.m. Dec. 21. Several items were stolen from three vehicles.

TAFT ST. N., 1400 block, 11:30 p.m. Dec. 20 to 9 a.m. Dec. 22. Two vehicles in a parking garage were broken into.

WASHINGTON BLVD., 3500 block, 5:30 p.m. Dec. 16 to 5 p.m. Dec. 17. Several items were stolen from a residence.

25TH PL. N., 5200 block, 2:30 a.m. Dec. 21. A man tried to enter a house by breaking a window pane in a door. The owner called police. An 18-year-old Arlington man was charged with unlawful entry, destruction of property and public drunkenness.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

TROY ST. N., 1700 block. A red 1990 Honda Civic was stolen.

WILSON BLVD., 3000 block. A white 2000 Ford Focus was stolen.

VANDALISM

NINTH ST. N., 3800 block, 6 p.m. Dec. 11 to 5 p.m. Dec. 18. The windows of three vehicles were broken.

-- Compiled by KATHY ORTON

Alexandria

Washingtonpost.com


October 3, 2013 Thursday 8:13 PM EST 


Southern Maryland crime report


SECTION: Metro; Pg. T24


LENGTH: 1322 words


Calvert County

These were among reports received by the Calvert County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. Anyone with information about these crimes should call the Criminal Investigation Division, 410-535-2800 or 301-855-1194, or the Crime Solvers line, 410-535-2880. You can also call the Prince Frederick Barrack of the state police at 410-535-1400.

CHESAPEAKE BEACH AREA ARSON

Rosemary Dr., 11:40 p.m. Sept. 20. A 2002 Nissan Frontier was set on fire. The investigation was continuing.  

HUNTINGTOWN AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Cox Rd., Sept. 21 to Sept. 22. An attempt was made to enter a concession stand at a park.

Harlequin Ct., 12:10 p.m. Sept. 20. An MP3 player and coins were stolen from an unlocked vehicle.

Monarch Lane, 10:30 p.m. Sept. 19 to 8:30 a.m. Sept. 20. A purse was stolen from an unlocked vehicle parked in front of a home.

Wilson Rd., 3 to 9 p.m. Sept. 16. Cash and binoculars were stolen from a home.

VANDALISM

Huntingtown, September. Flower beds, fencing and lights were damaged in the Plum Point Woods and Wilburn Estates subdivisions.

LUSBY AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Rousby Hall Rd., Sept. 16. Copper piping was stolen from a residence.

Valerie Lane, Aug. 25 to Sept. 15. A door and screen were damaged in an attempt to enter a residence.

VANDALISM

H.G. Trueman Rd., 11:05 a.m. Sept. 21. A SMECO-owned electrical box was spray-painted.

NORTH BEACH AREA ASSAULTS

North Beach, 4:39 p.m. Sept. 14. Two men assaulted each other in the parking lot of a fire department. A Prince Frederick man, 24, and a Chesapeake Beach man, 26, were charged with second-degree assault.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Frederick Ave., Sept. 12 to Sept. 18. A pressure washer and a 50-foot hose were stolen from a residence.

PRINCE FREDERICK AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Virginia Ave., 6:58 Sept. 21. Prescription medications were stolen from a purse in a home.

ST. LEONARD AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Broomes Island Rd., 5:58 p.m. Sept. 15. An iPad was stolen from a residence.

Charles County

These were among reports received by the Charles County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. For information, call 301-932-2222 or 301-870-3232. Crime Solvers will pay a reward for information leading to an arrest and an indictment in connection with these and other crimes. Call the 24-hour hotline at 866-411-8477. Callers may remain anonymous. The Charles County Sheriff's Office Web site is www.ccso.us, featuring daily news releases, neighborhood statistics, community services, crime prevention programs and career opportunities.

LA PLATA AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Johnsontown Rd., September. Tools were stolen.

WALDORF AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Biltmore St., Sept. 23. Electronic items and coins were stolen from several vehicles, and mailboxes were damaged.

Mattawoman Beantown Rd., 2700 block, 10 a.m. to 1:45 p.m. Sept. 23. Guns and tools were stolen from a shed.

WHITE PLAINS AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

White Plains, 3:20 p.m. Sept. 24. A Pomfret man, 29, was arrested and charged on open warrants with traffic violations and possession of a stolen firearm.

St. Mary's County

These were among reports received by the St. Mary's County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. For information, call 301-475-8008, or the Crime Solvers line, 301-475-3333. The Leonardtown Barrack of the Maryland State Police operates a 24-hour tip line at 301-475-2936, which people can use to anonymously report information.

CALIFORNIA AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Three Notch Rd., Sept. 20. A man and a woman at a business were seen on video surveillance footage removing the magnetic housing on two iPods and placing them in the man's back pockets. A woman, 24, and a man, 25, of Baltimore were charged with theft of less than $1,000.

CHARLOTTE HALL AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Charlotte Hall, Sept. 17. A houseguest stole prescription drugs. A Prince Frederick man, 38, was charged with theft of less than $1,000 and possession of a controlled dangerous substance.

GREAT MILLS AREA ASSAULTS

Great Mills, Sept. 22. During an argument, a man punched an acquaintance in the back of the head and allegedly attempted to strangle him. A Great Mills man, 24, was charged with second-degree assault.

LEONARDTOWN AREA SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Leonardtown, 5:14 a.m. Sept. 23. A woman allowed an acquaintance to sleep on a couch in her home. She was awakened when the man sexually assaulted her. A man, 38, of no fixed address, was charged with second-degree rape, third- and fourth-degree sex offense and second-degree assault.

ASSAULTS

Leonardtown, Sept. 21. During an argument, a man assaulted an acquaintance. A Leonardtown man, 38, was charged with second-degree assault.

Leonardtown, Sept. 25. During a card game at a detention center, two inmates assaulted each other. A Lexington Park man, 25, and a Leonardtown man were charged with second-degree assault.

Leonardtown, Sept. 25. An inmate at a detention center kicked an officer in the legs and face. A Lexington Park man, 28, was charged with second-degree assault and second-degree assault on a Division of Corrections employee.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Leonardtown, Sept. 26. A Leonardtown man, 31, was arrested in connection with residential burglaries. He was charged with three counts of first-degree burglary and three counts of theft of $1000 to $10,000

LEXINGTON PARK AREA ASSAULTS

Lexington Park, Sept. 21. During an argument, a woman pushed an acquaintance and struck the person in the face with an object. A half of a Valium pill was found in her wallet during a search at the detention center. A Lexington Park woman, 32, was charged with second-degree assault, possession of a controlled dangerous substance and possession of contraband in a place of confinement.

Lexington Park, Sept. 21. A man standing in front of his home was punched in the face and poked in the chest with a tire iron. A Lexington Park man, 30, was charged with first- and second-degree assault.

Lexington Park, Sept. 24. During an argument, a man hit an acquaintance in the stomach several times with a power strip. When the acquaintance fled to a bathroom, the man kicked the bathroom door and stabbed the door with a kitchen knife. When the acquaintance, who was holding a child, attempted to leave the residence, the man grabbed him. A Lexington Park man, 24, was charged with assault, reckless endangerment, destruction of property, possession of a controlled dangerous substance and possession of paraphernalia.

Lexington Park, 7:55 p.m. Sept. 26. During a fight at a park between two football players, parents became involved, and a man held down the mother of a youth while his wife repeatedly hit the woman in the face with her fist. She also picked up a piece of broken glass from the woman's eyeglasses and cut her face. The youths were charged with second-degree assault. A Park Hall man, 46, was charged with second-degree assault by application and an alcohol violation. A Park Hall woman, 36, was charged with first- and second-degree assault, affray-common law and malicious destruction of property worth less than $500.

ST. INIGOES AREA ASSAULTS

St. Inigoes, Sept. 25. During an argument, a man assaulted three people. A St. Inigoes man, 24, was charged with three counts of second-degree assault.

- Compiled by Bonnie Smith

Loudoun County crime report Loudoun County crime report


SECTION: METRO; Pg. T24

Loudoun County

These were among incidents reported by the Loudoun County Sheriff's Office and the Leesburg, Middleburg and Purcellville police departments. For information, contact your police or sheriff's department.

ALDIE AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Natalie Terr., 44100 block, 2:30 p.m. to 9 p.m. Oct. 8. A laptop computer was stolen from an unlocked apartment.

VANDALISM

Autumn Oak Lane, 40400 block, noon Oct. 12 to noon Oct. 13. The roof of a residence was damaged by gunshot. No injuries were reported. 

ASHBURN AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Pickerelweed Terr., 21000 block, 8 p.m. Oct. 8 1 p.m. Oct. 9. CDs and a video camera were stolen from a vehicle.

VANDALISM

Chickacoan Trail Dr., 21400 block, 9 p.m. Oct. 7 to 8 a.m. Oct. 8. A mailbox was damaged.

LEESBURG AREA

ASSAULTS

Catoctin Cir., 1 to 100 block, 11:30 a.m. Oct. 8.

Prosperity Ave., 100 block, 11:37 p.m. Oct. 11.

Shenandoah St., 200 block, 5:23 p.m. Oct. 8.

York Lane, 600 block, 12:19 a.m. Oct. 11.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Candlewick Sq., 43000 block, 3 p.m. Oct. 8 to 5 a.m. Oct. 9. A navigator, a cellphone cash and sunglasses were among property stolen from a vehicle.

Harrison St., 300 block, 11:35 a.m. Oct. 9.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Hirst Rd., 200 block, 2 p.m. Oct. 4. Cash was stolen from a business.

STERLING AREA

Rock Hill Rd., 23100 block, 3:20 p.m. Oct. 8. A man groped a female customer in a convenience store.

ASSAULTS

Holly Ave. E., 1100 block, 1:44 a.m. Oct. 9. After he allegedly displayed a knife at a party, a male was forced to the ground. The male was taken to Inova Fairfax Hospital for treatment of injuries that were not life-threatening.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Branchwood Way, 21000 block, 9 p.m. Oct. 9 to 7:30 a.m. Oct. 10. A purse was among property stolen from three vehicles.

Cameon St. N., 200 block, 10:30 p.m. Oct. 7 to 11 a.m. Oct. 8. A navigator was stolen from a vehicle entered by breaking a window.

Elm Tree Lane, 100 block, 8 to 9 p.m. Oct. 12. Two laptop computers and a navigator were stolen from an unlocked vehicle.

Frederick Dr. and Rockwood Terr., 8:29 p.m. Oct. 8. Two chargers were stolen from a vehicle.

Livingston Station St., 45600 block, 9 p.m. Oct. 8 to 10 a.m. Oct. 9. A navigator and cash were stolen from a vehicle.

Morning Way, 21100 block, 8 p.m. Oct. 9 to 7 a.m. Oct. 10. Cash was stolen from two vehicles. Three other vehicles were entered, but nothing was reported missing.

Quiet Brook Pl., 20800 block, 3 a.m. Oct. 8. An MP3 player and a tablet reader were stolen from a vehicle.

Southfork Ct., 42300 block, 3 p.m. Oct. 7 to 8 a.m. Oct. 10. Materials were stolen from a construction site.

Stanford Sq., 21000 block, 10:30 p.m. Oct. 9 to 6 a.m. Oct. 10. Two patio chairs were stolen from a residence.

Towncenter Plaza, 21800 block, 11:59 p.m. Oct. 7. A cellphone was stolen from a person at a restaurant.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Markwood Dr.,200 block, 4:30 p.m. Oct. 7 to 3:14 p.m. Oct. 8. A burgundy 2005 Nissan Altima was stolen from a driveway at a residence.

VANDALISM

Countryside Blvd. and Minor Rd., Oct. 6 to Oct. 7. Playground equipment was marked with graffiti.

McPherson Cir., 1 to 100 block, Oct. 6 to Oct. 7. A utility box was marked with graffiti.

St. Johns Sq., 100 block, 7 a.m. to 5:45 p.m. Oct. 10. Glass was damaged in a door.

Thomas Jefferson and Hillcrest drives, noon Oct. 8 to 7:30 a.m. Oct. 10. A vehicle window was damaged.

Young Cliff Rd., 19300 block, 6 a.m. to 4:30 p.m. Oct. 11. A break-in occurred at a horse shed. Nothing was reported missing.

Crime Report


SECTION: EXTRAS; Pg. GZ29


LENGTH: 2917 words


Montgomery County 

These were among incidents reported by Montgomery County police. For information, call 240-773-5030.

REWARDS FOR INFORMATION

Crime Solvers of Montgomery County, a nonprofit community organization, will pay up to $1,000 for information leading to an arrest and indictment in connection with these and other felony crimes. Call the 24-hour hotline at 800-673-2777. Callers may remain anonymous.

District 1 Rockville Station 240-773-6070

SEXUAL ASSAULTS 

SHADY GROVE AREA, 6:30 a.m. Jan. 21. Two men sexually assaulted an acquaintance and robbed her of property.

ASSAULTS

MIDDLE RD., 12300 block, 9 p.m. Jan. 23. During a fight, a person stabbed an acquaintance. No serious injuries were reported. 

VEIRS MILL RD., 2000 block, 4 a.m. Jan. 23. A man attacked two men outside a restaurant. After striking one man with a bottle, the assailant fled in a Nissan Xterra. No serious injuries were reported.

ROBBERIES

CREEK SHORE DR., 4800 block, 9:25 p.m. Jan. 23. A man near a shopping center asked a pedestrian for a small amount of cash, threatened him and robbed him of cash and personal property.

LEWIS DR. AND ROCKLAND AVE., 10:10 p.m. Jan. 24. Two men robbed a male pedestrian of property from his pockets at gunpoint.

TWINBROOK AREA, 2 to 3 p.m. Jan. 25. A male motorist giving a female acquaintance a ride to a bank picked up a man, who robbed the woman of property at gunpoint and forced her from the vehicle, a black 2001 Lexus.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

DARNESTOWN RD., 14100 block, 7:24 to 11:35 a.m. Jan. 21. Copper cable and wire were stolen from a telephone-utility shed. There was no sign of forced entry.

DEGAS CT., 12500 block, 8:17 a.m. Jan. 25. A break-in occurred at a residence's garage. Nothing was reported missing. There was no sign of forced entry.

DERWOOD CIR., 1 to 100 block, 7:02 a.m. Jan. 25. A tree-service business office was entered. Nothing was reported missing. There was no sign of forced entry.

HALPINE RD., 100 block, Jan. 19 to 22. Property was stolen from a vehicle entered by force.

IVY LEAGUE LANE, 700 block, 12:15 a.m. Jan. 18 to 9:30 a.m. Jan. 20. A GPS device was stolen from a vehicle entered by force.

JEFFERSON ST. E., 1000 block, 9:30 a.m. Jan. 20. Four wheels and a wallet were stolen from a 2005 Toyota entered by force. The vehicle was parked in a garage.

JEFFERSON ST. E., 1600 block, Jan. 19 to 22. Property was stolen from a vehicle entered by force.

PARKLAWN DR., 12500 block, 11:45 a.m. Jan. 23. A construction business was entered by force. Nothing was reported missing.

ROCKVILLE PIKE, 1300 block, 2:30 to 3:15 p.m. Jan. 25. A wallet was stolen from a purse in a grocery store. The victim said that she had been bumped by a woman while she was shopping.

ROCKVILLE PIKE, 1700 block, 12:40 p.m. Jan. 26. Wheels were removed from an Acura parked in a hotel garage. Two people were seen running away from the scene, carrying tools.

SETTLERS LANDING CT., 8:45 a.m. to 5:36 p.m. Jan. 22. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

SOUTHLAWN LANE, 14600 block, 2:03 to 2:15 a.m. Jan. 18. Copper wiring was stolen from three vehicles. There was no sign of forced entry.

FIRST ST., 100 block, 10:45 p.m. Jan. 24 to 6:50 a.m. Jan. 25. A residence was entered by force. Nothing was reported missing.

District 2 Bethesda Station 301-652-9200

ASSAULTS

16TH ST., 8500 block, 7:45 p.m. Jan. 18. During a fight between two groups of people, a man cut a person with a knife, then fled with accomplices in a silver-colored Chevrolet Impala. No serious injuries were reported.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

ALBA RD., 5500 block, Jan. 21 to 22. A GPS device was stolen from an unlocked vehicle.

CHEVY CHASE DR., 4700 and 4800 blocks, Jan. 20 to 22. GPS devices and other property were among items stolen from two vehicles entered by force.

DANVILLE DR., 11600 block, Jan. 22 to 23. Property including a vehicle was stolen from a residence entered by force.

EAST-WEST HWY., 2600 block, 12:30 a.m. Jan. 22. A vehicle break-in occurred. A man fled the area empty-handed when confronted while inside the vehicle.

JAMESTOWN RD., 4900 block, 3:45 to 9 a.m. Jan. 18. Two vehicle break-ins occurred on a residential street. One of the vehicles had been left unlocked. Nothing was reported missing.

MASSACHUSETTS AVE., 5600 block, 3:30 to 7:30 p.m. Jan. 25. Property was stolen from a church. There was no sign of forced entry.

MONTROSE RD., 6400 block, Jan. 19 to 20. An attempt was made to break into a business. Nothing was reported missing.

PEARL ST., 7500 block, Jan. 21 to 22. Property was stolen from a church. There was no sign of forced entry.

SENTINEL DR., 5100 block, 8 a.m. to 7 p.m. Jan. 20. A GPS device was stolen from a vehicle entered by force.

STRATHMORE AVE., 4700 block, 8:40 a.m. to 4:40 p.m. Jan. 23. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

WESTWOOD DR., 5200 block, 2:45 a.m. Jan. 23. Loose change was stolen from an unlocked vehicle. A male was seen fleeing toward a wooded area.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

DEMOCRACY BLVD., 7100 block, 7 to 9:30 p.m. Jan. 19. Ignitions of a 1998 Dodge SUV, a 1999 Ford SUV and a 1996 Honda Accord were damaged. Two District males, ages 15 and 19, were arrested.

District 3 Silver Spring Station 301-565-7740

SEXUAL ASSAULTS 

GEORGIA AVE., 7900 block, 3:38 p.m. Jan. 26. A man who implied that he had a handgun sexually assaulted a woman on college property. An arrest was made nearby.

NEW HAMPSHIRE AVE., 11200 block, 11:35 a.m. Jan. 20. A woman was sexually assaulted in a parking lot at a shopping center. Two men were arrested at the scene, and a third was arrested a short time later. The men, ages 25, 47 and 47, were described as homeless.

INDECENT EXPOSURE

FLOWER AVE. AND E. SCHUYLER RD., 3:54 p.m. Jan. 21. Police arrested a woman who was walking around naked.

GEORGIA AVE., 9500 block, 5:15 p.m. Jan. 23. A motorist sitting in a gray Nissan exposed himself to a passerby.

ASSAULTS

NEW HAMPSHIRE AVE., 11100 block, 5:30 p.m. Jan. 22. Two males in the parking lot of a fast-food restaurant threatened several people and attacked one of them. When a victim noticed a weapon in the hands of one of the assailants, the males fled.

NORTHAMPTON DR., 600 block, 10:30 to 11:30 p.m. Jan. 21. Two men attacked a man and threatened him with a gun. After a struggle, the assailants fled empty-handed. No injuries were reported.

ROBBERIES

FOREST GLEN RD. AND GEORGIA AVE., 1:10 p.m. Jan. 18. A male stole a cellphone from a women's hand as she was leaving a train at a Metro station.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

CAPLINGER RD., 11800 block, 8 to 10:58 a.m. Jan. 18 to 26. A residence was entered by force. Nothing was reported missing.

CASTLE BLVD., 13900 block, 11:30 a.m. to 1:30 p.m. Jan. 23. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

COLUMBIA PIKE, 11400 block, 9 a.m. to 3:40 p.m. Jan. 19. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

CURRAN RD., 9400 block, 12:01 a.m. Jan. 19 to 9:30 a.m. Jan. 22. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

EDGEWOOD and DALLAS AVENUES, E. UNIVERSITY BLVD. and LOXFORD TERR., Jan. 18 to 19. Several vehicle break-ins occurred. Nothing was reported missing.

HEARTFIELDS DR., 1100 block, 12:04 to 3:47 p.m. Jan. 22. A residence was entered by force. Nothing was reported missing.

KATHRYN RD., 1000 block, 4 to 6:30 p.m. Jan. 22. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

MILESTONE DR., 1300 block, 11:17 a.m. Jan. 22. A break-in occurred at a residence. Nothing was reported missing. Two Largo males were arrested.

QUEBEC TERR., 1000 block, Jan. 19 to 24. Property was stolen from two residences entered by force.

RUSTIC AVE., 10200 block, 8:05 a.m. to 3 p.m. Jan. 19. An attempt was made to break into a residence. Nothing was reported missing.

SOUTHAMPTON and DEVERE DRIVES, BEACON, MOUNTAIN QUAIL, DUNNON and MOUNT PISGAH ROADS, NEW HAMPSHIRE AVE. and KINSMAN VIEW CIR., Jan. 18 to 24. Electronic equipment, tools, cellphones and clothing were among property stolen from several vehicles, some of which had been left unlocked.

District 4 Wheaton Station 240-773-5500

ASSAULTS

LAYHILL RD., 13000 block, 4 p.m. Jan. 24. Two acquaintances fought with each other. A 43-year-old man was charged with aggravated assault.

UNIVERSITY BLVD., 5:30 p.m. Jan. 20. Two females and a male attacked a woman at a bus stop and tried to rob her. During a struggle, the victim was cut with a sharp object. The assailants fled empty-handed. No serious injuries were reported.

UPTON DR., 11200 block, 2:30 p.m. Jan. 19. Two male acquaintances fought with each other.

ROBBERIES

HEWITT AVE., 3300 block, 2:10 p.m. Jan. 22. A person robbed a woman of a purse as she entered an apartment.

OLNEY-LAYTONSVILLE RD., 3400 block, 9:45 p.m. Jan. 21. A man robbed a beer-and-wine store at gunpoint.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

AMBERLEIGH DR., 200 block, 4 p.m. Jan. 23 to 2:26 a.m. Jan. 24. Property was stolen from a residence. There was no sign of forced entry.

APPLEWOOD LANE, 17500 block, 5 a.m. to 9 p.m. Jan. 20. Property was stolen from a residence. There was no sign of forced entry.

BEL PRE RD., 3000 block, Jan. 19 to 24. Property was stolen from a residence. There was no sign of forced entry.

ELMONT ST., 2600 block, 9 to 10:30 a.m. Jan. 22. Property was stolen from a residence. There was no sign of forced entry.

LADD ST., 1500 block, INWOOD AVE., 10800 block, and GEORGIA AVE., 11100 block, Jan. 18 to 19. Clothing, toiletries, electronic equipment, sports equipment, tools, GPS devices, credit cards, and cash were among property stolen from four vehicles, two of which were entered by force.

NORBECK RD., 5500 block, 9 p.m. Jan. 20 to 5:55 a.m. Jan. 21. Property was damaged in a gas station entered by force. Nothing was reported missing.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

District 5 Germantown Station 240-773-6200

ASSAULTS

FREDERICK RD., 20000 block, 10:21 p.m. Jan. 24. A man was attacked in his apartment by two male acquaintances, who hit him with a bottle and rifled through his pockets. The assailants fled empty-handed.

GUNNERS BRANCH RD., 19600 block, 6:30 p.m. Jan. 21. Two males attacked a pedestrian and tried to rob him of a wallet. When a passerby yelled, the assailants fled empty-handed.

GUNNERS BRANCH RD., 19600 block, 10:43 a.m. Jan. 24. A masked gunman tried to rob a fast-food restaurant. He fled empty-handed after talking with the manager, who said he did not have access to cash.

Takoma Park

These were among incidents reported by the Takoma Park Police Department. For information, call 301-891-7102.

CIRCLE AVE., 300 block, 9:41 a.m. Feb. 1. In what police said was the result of a domestic incident, a woman was charged with first-degree assault, second-degree assault, reckless endangerment, trespassing and fourth-degree burglary.

HOLLY AVE., 7100 block, 2:15 a.m. Jan. 29. Two men were charged with three counts of theft over $500, destruction of property, one count each for conspiracy to commit destruction of property and conspiracy to commit theft.

Prince William County crime report


SECTION: METRO; Pg. T25


LENGTH: 962 words


Prince William

These were among incidents reported by Prince William County police. For information, call 703-792-7245.

BRISTOW AREA

ASSAULTS

Dodsworth Dr., 13500 block, 6:31 p.m. April 8. During an argument, a man fired an air pistol at a juvenile relative, hitting him in the abdomen. A 19-year-old Bristow man was arrested.

Linton Hall Rd., 8700 block, 8:51 p.m. April 7. During an argument, a man chased a male acquaintance with a large knife. The acquaintance locked himself inside a vehicle. The man attempted to enter and damaged the vehicle. 

DUMFRIES AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Blowing Leaf Pl., 3700 block, 8 p.m. April 3 to 5 a.m. April 4. A GPS device, a tool set and other items were stolen from a residence entered through an open garage door.

Fort Henry Ct., 1700 block, 9:37 p.m. April 8. Three armed, masked males entered a residence through an unlocked front door. A fourth male stayed outside. When a resident called police, they fled. One of the males fired a weapon at the residence. Two Triangle males, 13 and 16, and two Dumfries males, 15 and 17, were arrested.

GAINESVILLE AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Yellowthroat Ct., 8800 block, noon April 2 to 3 p.m. April 9. An attempt was made to enter a residence by kicking and prying a basement door.

HAYMARKET AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Heathcote Blvd., 15100 block, 7 p.m. April 2 to 8:30 p.m. April 4. Cash was stolen from a business entered by prying a rear door.

Heathcote Blvd., 15100 block, 3:30 p.m. March 28 to 6:30 p.m. March 29. Cash was stolen from a business entered by forcing a front door.

MANASSAS AREA

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Mountwood Dr., March. A man sexually assaulted a female juvenile acquaintance and a male juvenile. An 18-year-old Manassas man was arrested.

ASSAULTS

Portsmouth Rd., 10000 block, 9:40 p.m. April 7. A man grabbed a pedestrian from behind and attempted to drag her to a nearby alley. The woman fought back, and the man fled.

Portwood Turn, 8100 block, 8:47 a.m. April 3. During an argument, a man assaulted a female acquaintance. A 23-year-old Manassas man was arrested.

ROBBERIES

Cub Run Ct. and Irongate Way, 10:28 a.m. April 4. A man robbed a female pedestrian of her purse at gunpoint. When the man fled, the woman chased him, and he assaulted her.

NOKESVILLE AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Maplewood Dr., 8100 block, 4:17 a.m. April 9. A man attempted to enter a residence by pushing on a basement door. He fled when a resident yelled at him.

Schaeffer Lane, 10400 block, March 29 to April 5. Miscellaneous items were stolen from a residence.

WOODBRIDGE AREA

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Radford Ct., 14200 block, 10:27 p.m. April 6. During a party at a residence, a man sexually assaulted a woman. When another man confronted the assailant, the assailant hit the man in the head with the flat part of a machete. A 22-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

ASSAULTS

Bayside Ave., 1300 block, 1:30 a.m. April 9. During an argument, a man stabbed a male acquaintance with a knife. A 33-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

Dale Blvd., 2900 block, 12:29 a.m. April 9. After an argument between a woman and a male acquaintance, the acquaintance drove away with another person. The woman followed the vehicle and ran her vehicle into theirs several times. When the first vehicle pulled over, the woman hit their vehicle again, then exited and spray-painted the trunk. A 21-year-old Stafford woman was arrested.

Tarpon Lane, 5000 block, 1:11 a.m. April 10. A man entered a residence and assaulted a male acquaintance.

WEAPONS

Elm Farm Rd., 3400 block, 1:10 a.m. April 6. Several gunshots were heard.

Red Wing Dr. and Blue Jay Ct., 1:25 a.m. April 5. Several gunshots were heard.

ROBBERIES

Dale Blvd., 2800 block, 10:50 p.m. April 5. A man in a fast-food restaurant pushed a woman to the ground and robbed her of a cellphone.

Dillingham Sq., 3300 block, April 4. A person knocked a male pedestrian to the ground and robbed him of a wallet.

Keating Dr., 13400 block, 12:05 a.m. April 6. Two men and a third person restrained a man and a woman in a residence and robbed them of cash at gunpoint.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Creekview Cir., 12200 block, 11 a.m. to 9:30 p.m. April 4. Two TVs and a video-game system were stolen from a residence.

Jefferson Davis Hwy., 14400 block, 4:05 a.m. April 7. Cartons of cigarettes were stolen from a business.

Manassas

These were among the incidents reported by Manassas police. For more information, call 703-257-8000.

WEAPONS

Signal Hill Dr. and Richmond Ave., 5:53 p.m. April 5. After nearly colliding with another vehicle, a motorist exited his vehicle, pointed a handgun at the other driver and told him to get back in his car. They both drove away.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Bruton Parish Ct., 8600 block, 9 to 9:20 a.m. April 8. A laptop, a tablet and a purse were stolen from a residence entered by breaking glass in a door.

Centreville Rd., 9200 block, 12:35 a.m. April 7. A man demanded narcotics from a pharmacy. He fled on a bike with the drugs.

Oliver Ct., 8800 block, noon to 2 p.m. April 3. Cash, a laptop, a video-game system, video games and electronic accessories were stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked front door.

Portner Ave., 8900 block, 10:20 a.m. April 5. A laptop, a black bag and hand tools were stolen from a church entered by breaking a basement window.

Manassas Park

These were among the incidents reported by Manassas Park police. For more information, call 703-361-1136.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Crozet St., March 31 to 11:02 a.m. April 7. A chainsaw, a weed whacker and a blower were stolen from storage cabinets on a truck.

VANDALISM

Centreville Rd., 8400 block, 7:09 p.m. April 8. A man kicked the door of a business, breaking the glass. A man was arrested.

Yost St., 3 a.m. April 6 to 8:30 a.m. April 7. A soft top of a vehicle was pulled away. A glove box and a center console were damaged.

Crime Report


SECTION: EXTRAS; Pg. VA13


LENGTH: 1003 words


Alexandria

These were among incidents reported by the Alexandria Police Department. For information, call 703-838-4636 or visit http://www.alexandriava.gov/police.

SEXUAL ASSAULTS 

MADISON ST., 200 block, 7:51 a.m. Feb. 13. A sexual assault was reported.

ASSAULTS

DUKE ST., 3100 block, 10:06 p.m. Feb. 13. An assault was reported.

MADISON ST., 1300 block, 7:36 p.m. Feb. 14. An assault was reported.

MONTGOMERY ST., 900 block, 12:38 p.m. Feb. 14. An assault was reported. 

ROBBERIES

MADISON ST., 1300 block, 7:36 p.m. Feb. 14. A robbery was reported.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

DUKE ST., 3100 block, 10:06 p.m. Feb. 13. A theft was reported.

FLEET ST., 100 block, 5:48 p.m. Feb. 13. A theft was reported.

MOUNT VERNON AVE., 1000 block, 12:01 p.m. Feb. 13. An iPod and a BlackBerry were stolen from a locker.

PORTNER RD., 1200 block, 10:16 a.m. Feb. 14. A theft was reported.

ST. ASAPH ST. N., 100 block, 5:03 p.m. Feb. 15. A theft was reported.

WASHINGTON ST., 400 block, 6:31 p.m. Feb. 13. A theft was reported. An arrest was made.

FIRST ST., 600 block, 8:06 p.m. Feb. 12. A theft was reported.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

EISENHOWER AVE., 2000 block, 8:34 a.m. Feb. 17. A vehicle was reported stolen.

FAIRFAX ST. N., 900 block, 2:06 a.m. Feb. 17. A vehicle was reported stolen.

FAYETTE ST. N., 1200 block, 5:27 p.m. Feb. 17. A vehicle was reported stolen.

Arlington

The following were among incidents reported by the Arlington County Police Department. For information, call 703-228-4331 or visit http://www.arlingtoncrimesolvers.org.

HOMICIDES

EDISON ST. N., 1800 block, 12:15 p.m. Feb. 12. Mona Alister, 51, was found lying on a sidewalk. She died from a stab wound. A District man, 53, was charged with murder.

ASSAULTS

WASHINGTON BLVD., 5800 block, 2:15 p.m. Feb. 14. A police officer went to a store to investigate a report and was assaulted by a female shoplifter. An Arlington woman, 51, was charged with assaulting an officer and petty theft.

WILSON BLVD., 2900 block, 10:30 p.m. Feb. 14. A man punched a male acquaintance.

FERN ST. S., 1200 block, 2:30 p.m. Feb. 17. A man assaulted a business's employee who would not validate a parking pass. An Alexandria man, 33, was charged with assault.

SEVENTH ST. S., 3900 block, 6:30 p.m. Feb. 11. A male threatened another man with a knife and damaged the man's vehicle. An Arlington man, 48, was charged with assault and destruction of property.

INDECENT EXPOSURE

ARLINGTON BLVD., 1100 block, 7:30 a.m. Feb. 14. A man exposed himself to a woman in a lobby of an apartment building. An Arlington man, 60, was charged with indecent exposure.

ROBBERIES

HAYES ST. S., 1200 block, 6:30 p.m. Feb. 12. A male juvenile snatched a man's cellphone while he was using it.

LEE HWY., 3700 block, 12:30 p.m. Feb. 11. A man attempted to rob a woman of a purse.

21ST ST. N., 2000 block, 9:30 p.m. Feb. 12. A man grabbed a purse from a female pedestrian.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

ARMY NAVY DR., 800 block, 8:30 a.m. to 5 p.m. Feb. 12. Property was stolen from three vehicles.

BARTON ST. N., 900 block, 11 p.m. Feb. 11 to 7 p.m. Feb. 12. A vehicle was entered, and the steering wheel was tampered with.

COLUMBIA PIKE, 2800 block, 8 a.m. to 2 p.m. Feb. 11. Property was stolen from a locker in a business.

COLUMBIA PIKE, 5500 block, 3 to 5 p.m. Feb. 14. Electronics were stolen from an apartment.

DANVILLE ST. N., 1000 block, 1:45 a.m. Feb. 15. An attempt was made to enter a residence by breaking a window. When the residents woke up, the burglar fled.

FAIRFAX DR., 1500 block, midnight Feb. 13. Police found a man in a condemned building. A man, 34, of no fixed address was charged with unlawful entry.

FAIRFAX DR., 4000 block, 11 p.m. Feb. 10 to 6:30 a.m. Feb. 11. Property was stolen from two businesses in a building.

FORT SCOTT DR. S., 2700 block, 7 a.m. to 4 p.m. Feb. 17. Property was stolen from a residence.

HAYES ST. S., 1100 block, 9:30 p.m. Feb. 14 to 10 a.m. Feb. 15. Property was stolen from a mall kiosk.

HIGHLAND ST. S., 700 block, 6:30 p.m. Feb. 14. Police, responding to an alarm at a school, found four male juveniles inside playing basketball.

PERSHING DR. N., 4400 block, 1:30 p.m. Feb. 12. A man posing as a maintenance worker entered an apartment. Nothing was reported missing.

POTOMAC AVE. S., 3500 block, 8 p.m. Feb. 14 to 3:30 p.m. Feb. 15. Property was stolen from three vehicles.

S. TAFT AND S. SCOTT STREETS, 1400 blocks, 8 p.m. Feb. 10 to 5:30 a.m. Feb. 11. Two vehicles in parking garages were entered.

SCOTT ST. N., 1200 block, 7:30 p.m. Feb. 10 to 7:30 a.m. Feb. 11. A computer was stolen from a residence entered by force.

VEITCH ST. N., 1200 and 1300 blocks, 9 p.m. Feb. 9 to 4 p.m. Feb. 11. Global Positioning System devices were stolen from two vehicles.

WASHINGTON BLVD., 2800 block, 3 a.m. Feb. 12. Two men entered a business and stole a vehicle.

WILSON BLVD., 2800 block, 2:30 a.m. to 1 p.m. Feb. 12. Cash was stolen from a business.

WILSON BLVD., 4200 block, 4 to 6 p.m. Feb. 11. Property was stolen from six lockers in a men's locker room at a gym.

Alexandria

These were among incidents reported by the Alexandria Police Department. For information, call 703-838-4636 or visit www.alexandriava.gov/police.

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Holmes Run Pkwy., 5000 block, Sept. 28. A sexual assault was reported.

Quaker Lane N., 1200 block, Oct. 1. A sexual assault was reported.

ASSAULTS

Braddock Rd. W., 4400 block, Sept. 29. Two acquaintances fought each other.

Bruce St., 3900 block, Sept. 30. Two acquaintances fought each other.

Van Dorn St. S., 700 block, Sept. 27. Two acquaintances fought each other.

Whiting St. S., 400 block, Sept. 29. An assault was reported.

ROBBERIES

Armistead St. N., 500 block, Sept. 30. A person robbed a pizza deliveryman of cash.

Alfred St. N., 900 block, Sept. 29. A cellphone was stolen from a residence.

20th Pl. N. and 21st St. N., 4800 blocks, 3 to 6 p.m. Oct. 2. Property was stolen from several vehicles. A man, 52, of no fixed address was charged with several counts of vehicle trespassing and larceny.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Columbia Pike S., 2100 block, Oct. 1. A green 2006 Kawasaki motorcycle was stolen.

Courthouse Rd. S., 1200 block, Sept. 29. A red and white 2002 Honda XR650 motorcycle was stolen.

28th St. S.,1400 block, Oct. 1. A blue 2003 Dodge Ram was stolen.

Crime Report


SECTION: EXTRAS; Pg. VA17


LENGTH: 876 words


Alexandria

These were among incidents recently reported by the Alexandria Police Department. For more information, call 703-838-4636.

ASSAULTS

GIBBON ST., 900 block, 11:18 p.m. Oct. 11. During an argument inside a vehicle, a male stabbed a 25-year-old male acquaintance. The acquaintance was taken to a hospital.

GLEBE RD. W., 800 block, 11:25 p.m. Oct. 14. Two males fired bullets at an Alexandria man, 29, outside an apartment building. The injured man was taken to a hospital. 

ROBBERIES

BRAGG ST. S., 1-99 block, 5:40 a.m. Oct. 17. A man implied he was armed with a gun and robbed a business of cash.

COMMONWEALTH AVE., 2000 block, 10:35 p.m. Oct. 9. A man grabbed an Alexandria woman, 32, from behind and took her purse. The woman reportedly received minor injuries.

 Arlington

These were among incidents recently reported by the Arlington County Police Department. For more information, call 703-228-4050 or visit http://www.arlingtoncrimesolvers.org.

SEXUAL ASSAULTS 

COLUMBUS ST. S., 900 block, 9:38 to 9:53 a.m. Oct. 13. A man punched, strangled and sexually assaulted a woman, 46, in the laundry room of an apartment building. The woman escaped. An Arlington man, 27, was charged with rape.

WILSON BLVD. N., 4100 block, 10:45 a.m. Oct. 14. A man grabbed a female pedestrian from behind, touched her inappropriately and fled.

ASSAULTS

LOWELL ST. S., 2400 block, 6 p.m. Oct. 16. A male stabbed a man, 23, during a fight.

21ST ST. N., 1600 block, 1:45 a.m. Oct. 14. A man, 22, left an apartment and was struck with a metal baton by one male and threatened with a gun by another. The man ran back to the apartment, and the males fled.

INDECENT EXPOSURE

VEITCH ST. N., 1300 block, 6:45 to 11:20 p.m. Oct. 15. A man entered a vacant apartment and exposed himself next to a window.

ROBBERIES

COLUMBIA PIKE S., 1800 block, 8:54 a.m. Oct. 14. Three males on bicycles demanded a purse from a woman, 42, at a bus stop. The woman refused, and after a struggle, one of the males punched the woman repeatedly and took her purse and cellphone. All three males fled. The woman reportedly suffered minor injuries.

COLUMBIA PIKE S., 5100 block, 12:10 to 12:20 a.m. Oct. 14. Three males robbed a male pedestrian, 24, of a wallet and a set of keys at gunpoint and struck him in the face.

COLUMBUS ST. S., 1000 block, 3:25 to 3:35 a.m. Oct. 14. About five men forced a 26-year-old male pedestrian to the ground, kicked him in the face and abdomen and robbed him of a wallet, a set of keys and a cellphone. The male reportedly suffered minor injuries.

12TH ST. S., 2200 block, 9 a.m. Oct. 14. Three males punched a man, 26, robbed him of cash and a cellphone and fled on bicycles. The man reportedly suffered minor injuries.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

CAMPBELL AVE. S., 4100 block, 11 p.m. Oct. 12 to 5:33 a.m. Oct. 14. Cash was stolen from a safe in an office.

CHESTERFIELD RD. S., 4900 block, 3 p.m. Oct. 5 to 8 a.m. Oct. 9. Office equipment was stolen from a building.

CLARENDON BLVD. N., 2200 block, 5 p.m. Oct. 12 to 7:30 p.m. Oct. 14. An attempt was made to enter an apartment by forcing a door.

CLARK ST. S., 1200 block, 5:30 p.m. Oct. 11 to 6:15 a.m. Oct. 12. Six laptop computers were stolen from a business entered by forcing a door.

CLARK ST. S., 600 block, 7 to 11 p.m. Oct. 11. Windows of four vehicles were smashed, and the vehicles were ransacked. Property was stolen from one vehicle.

FORT MYER DR. N., 1200 block, 2 to 6:30 a.m. Oct. 10. Cash and a safe were stolen from a business.

GREENBRIER ST. N., 2700 block, 9 p.m. Oct. 13 to 9 a.m. Oct. 14. Beverages and food were stolen from a concession stand entered by forcing a door. The items were recovered nearby.

ODE ST. N., 1300 block, 8:30 a.m. to 5:30 p.m. Oct. 11. An attempt was made to enter a residence.

QUINN ST. N., 1200 block. A license plate was stolen.

RHODES ST. N., 1500 block, 2:37 p.m. Oct. 16. A man entered a residence, then fled after he was confronted by a homeowner.

TAYLOR ST. N., 3100 block, Oct. 15. A vacant house was entered. Nothing was reported missing.

WALTER REED DR. S., 1000 block, 7 p.m. Oct. 10 to 5 a.m. Oct. 11. Construction material was stolen from a construction site.

FOUR MILE RUN DR. S., 4600 block, 6:45 a.m. to 9:30 p.m. Oct. 15. A residence was entered by forcing a door. Nothing was reported missing.

FIFTH ST. N., 3900 block, 4:07 a.m. Oct. 14. An attempt was made to enter an apartment by forcing a window.

SEVENTH RD. S., 5000 block, 4:30 p.m. Oct. 14 to 4:30 p.m. Oct. 15. A tool was stolen from a residence entered by breaking a window.

SEVENTH RD. S., 5600 block. License plates were stolen.

25TH ST. S., 9 a.m. to 3:15 p.m. Oct. 16. Cash, CDs, DVDs and clothing were stolen from a residence.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

COLUMBIA PIKE S., 5500 block. A red 1996 Honda Civic was stolen.

COLUMBIA PIKE, 3000 block. A dark blue 2000 Ford truck was stolen.

EADS ST. S., 1900 block. A black 1995 Nissan Pathfinder was stolen.

FERN ST. S., 1200 block. A red 2006 Chrysler Pacifica was stolen.

GREENBRIER ST. S., 800 block. A black 1999 Honda Accord was stolen.

HAYES ST. S., 1700 block. A burgundy 2000 Dodge van was stolen.

VANDALISM

GREENBRIER ST. S., 600-700 blocks; ABERDEEN ST. S., 100 block; ARLINGTON BLVD., 4700 block, Oct. 14 to Oct. 15. Graffiti was written on nine vehicles.

July 19, 2012 Thursday 8:12 PM EST 


Alexandria and Arlington crime report Alexandria and Arlington crime report


SECTION: Metro; Pg. T21


LENGTH: 1296 words


Alexandria

These were among incidents reported by the Alexandria Police Department. For information, visit www.alexandriava.gov/police or call 703-838-4636. SEXUAL ASSAULTS Old Town, 3:01 p.m. July 11. An arrest was made in connection with a sexual assault. ASSAULTS

Cambridge Rd., 200 block, 8:21 p.m. July 10. Two acquaintances fought with each other.

Duke St., 3500 block, 3:09 a.m. July 7. An assault was reported.

Duke and Sweeley streets,12:01 a.m. July 6. Two acquaintances fought with each other. 

Eisenhower Ave., 4800 block, 1:01 p.m. July 6. A person armed with a weapon threatened an acquaintance. No injuries were reported.

Executive Ave., 3800 block, 2:19 p.m. July 8. A person threatened an acquaintance with a handgun. No injuries were reported.

Executive Ave., 3800 block, 7:01 p.m. July 8. A fight occurred among several acquaintances.

Executive Ave.,3800 block, 9:11 p.m. July 9. Two acquaintances fought with each other.

Henry St. N., 1000 block, 12:31 p.m. July 7. Two workers at a business fought with each other.

Jordan St. N., 500 block, 11:37 p.m. July 9. A person attacked an acquaintance at a residence. An arrest was made.

Mount Vernon Ave., 4100 block, 9:39 p.m. July 8. Several people fought with each other at a ballgame.

ROBBERIES

Reynolds St. S., 200 block, 11:52 p.m. July 7. Two people threatened a deliveryman and tried to rob him of food, then fled empty-handed.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Alfred St. N., 800 block, 8:30 p.m. July 10. A theft was reported.

Ballenger Lane, 1900 block 3:50 p.m. July 11. A theft was reported.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Cameron St., 11:01 p.m. July 6. Two arrests were made in connection with the theft of a moped earlier that day.

Arlington

These were among incidents reported by the Arlington County Police Department. For information, call 703-558-2222 or visit www.arlingtoncrimesolvers.org.

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Wilson Blvd., 3100 block, 8:10 a.m. July 5. A man groped a pedestrian. A 59-year-old man of no fixed address was charged with sexual battery.

ROBBERIES

Columbia Pike, 5500 block, 3:45 p.m. July 6. A man robbed a person of several pieces of jewelry at gunpoint.

IMPERSONATION OF A POLICE OFFICER

Arlington Blvd., 1700 block, 2:15 a.m. July 6. During a traffic stop, a motorist told police that he was a law enforcement officer and was wearing a bulletproof vest. An investigation determined that he was carrying false identification and wearing a baseball-catcher's chest protector. A 37-year-old District man was arrested. Charges included impersonating a police officer, possession of an altered driver's license and traffic violations.

PEEPING TOM INCIDENTS,

Glebe Rd. N., 600 block, 6:32 p.m. July 7. A man found in the women's restroom at a grocery store fled when confronted.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Dinwiddie St. N., 1800 block, 8 p.m. July 5 to 5:30 p.m. July 8. Handguns were stolen from a residence.

Jefferson Davis Hwy. S., 1700 block, 6:30 a.m. to 11 p.m. July 4. Prescription medication was stolen from a motel room.

Utah St. N., 1100 block, 2 p.m. July 1 to noon July 6. A flat-screen TV, a computer and 1,500 comic books were stolen from a residence. There was no sign of forced entry.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Arlington Blvd., 1500 block, July 6. A black 2012 Chrysler 200 was stolen.

Columbia Pike, 2500 block, 7 p.m. July 3 to 5 a.m. July 5. A vehicle was stolen from a dry-cleaning business using a key stolen during a break-in through an unlocked window.

Columbia Pike,3100 block, July 9. A blue 1992 Honda Civic was stolen.

Jefferson Davis Hwy., 3100 block, July 7. A black 2009 BMW 650i was stolen.

Van Buren Ct. N., 2300 block, July 9. A green 1997 BMW 328is was stolen.

10th St. N., 3200 block, July 5. A black 2008 Chevrolet Suburban was stolen.

May 29, 2003 Thursday

Alexandria Arlington Crime Watch


SECTION: ALEXANDRIA - ARLINGTON EXTRA; Pg. T14


LENGTH: 850 words


The following were among crime reports received recently from the Alexandria Police Department. For more information, call 703-838-4636.

KIDNAPPINGS

JEFFERSON DAVIS HWY., 3300 block, 8:20 a.m. May 16. A man got out of a black pickup truck, grabbed a woman, 44, who was waiting for a bus, and forced her into the truck. As he was driving into Arlington, the woman escaped by jumping from the moving truck.  

ROBBERIES

BEAUREGARD ST. N., 2200 block, 11:58 p.m. May 17. Two men robbed a male pedestrian, 22, of cash and a cell phone at gunpoint.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

BRADDOCK RD. E., 400 block, 1:58 a.m. May 20. A man took cigarettes from a business entered by breaking a front glass door.

CALVERT AVE., 400 block, noon to 10:50 p.m. May 20. Electronic equipment was stolen from a business entered by forcing open a rear bay door.

CAMERON ST., 1500 block, 11:58 p.m. May 17. A school trailer was entered by forcing open a front door. Four males were seen running from the school. A male, 16, was arrested and released to his parents.

VASSAR RD., 300 block, 10:15 to 11:06 p.m. May 16. A residence was entered by forcing open a side window. Nothing was reported missing.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

ALFRED ST. N., 200 block, 8 p.m. May 19 to 7:30 a.m. May 20. A black 1998 Volkswagen Jetta was stolen.

JEFFERSON DAVIS HWY., 2800 block, 5 to 6 p.m. May 17. A silver 1997 Honda Civic was stolen.

NELSON AVE. E., 100 block, 5 p.m. May 16. A dark green 1997 Dodge Caravan was stolen.

The following were among crime reports received recently by the Arlington County Police Department. For more information, call 703-228-4050.

REWARDS FOR INFORMATION

Arlington County Crime Solvers, a nonprofit community organization, will pay up to $ 1,000 for information leading to an arrest in connection with these and any other felonies. Call the 24-hour hotline at 703-522-8477. Callers may remain anonymous.

SEXUAL ASSAULTS 

JEFFERSON DAVIS HWY., 2100 block, 6:50 p.m. May 13. A male forcibly entered an apartment as a female resident, 34, was closing her door. The intruder knocked her down and fled when she fought back.

INDECENT EXPOSURE

CLARENDON BLVD., 2800 block, 1:40 p.m. May 21. A man exposed himself in a bookstore and left when he was told to leave.

HARRISON ST. S., 300 block, 11:50 a.m. May 14. A man in a park exposed himself to a woman, 29, who was walking her dog.

18TH ST. S., 700 block, 9:40 p.m. May 14. Responding to a report, police found a man lying on a park bench exposing himself. A man, 51, was arrested and charged with indecent exposure.

ROBBERIES

ADAMS ST. S., 2500 block, 5:51 a.m. May 14. A man standing by a vehicle in a parking garage grabbed a male, 37, as he was walking toward his vehicle. A second man took the victim's wallet and cell phone, and both robbers fled with a third man in a Toyota Corolla.

GEORGE MASON DR. S., 1100 block, 3:27 p.m. May 20. A man at a store became angry when a money order machine malfunctioned. When a store clerk advised the man that the machine did not belong to the store, the man went around the counter and ordered the clerk to give him a refund. The clerk gave him cash. A man, 35, was arrested and charged with robbery.

LEE HWY., 500 block, 11:55 p.m. May 18. Two males, one armed with a shotgun, confronted a male employee, 30, when he opened a rear door of the business. The victim quickly closed the door and called police. Nothing was reported taken.

MILITARY RD., 2500 block, 6:35 a.m. May 16. A male grabbed two purses from a woman, 69, at a bus stop.

TAYLOR ST. S., 1300 block, 7:50 p.m. May 16. Two men robbed a pizza deliveryman, 45, of cash at gunpoint.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

JEFFERSON DAVIS HWY., 1700 block, 5:30 p.m. April 10 to 11 a.m. May 16. An unsuccessful attempt was made to enter a business by prying a rear door.

RANDOLPH ST. S., 3000 block, 1:53 a.m. May 20. A man entered an apartment through a sliding glass door, then fled empty-handed when a resident screamed.

24TH ST. N., 2400 block, 8:22 to 8:56 p.m. May 17. A park building was entered by removing a door from its hinges. Nothing was reported missing.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

ARLINGTON BLVD., 2100 block. A maroon 1986 Toyota Corolla was stolen.

COLUMBIA PIKE, 2300 block. A red 1990 Toyota Camry was stolen.

COLUMBIA PIKE, 4200 block. A gray 1988 Jeep Cherokee was stolen.

EADS ST. S., 2200 block. A teal 1992 Chevrolet G20 was stolen.

GLEBE RD. N., 200 block. A green 1994 Cadillac DeVille was stolen.

GLEBE RD. N., 200 block. A black 1990 Jeep Cherokee was stolen.

JOYCE ST. S., 1200 block. A maroon 2003 Dodge Stratus was stolen.

JOYCE ST. S., 1300 block. A white 2002 GMC Safari was stolen.

OLD GLEBE RD. S., 100 block. A white 1995 Buick Century was stolen.

QUEBEC ST. S., 1000 block. A maroon 1991 Toyota Camry was stolen.

RANDOLPH ST. S., 2200 block. A black 1996 Mercury Grand Marquis was stolen.

WALTER REED DR. S., 1300 block. A gray 1988 Toyota Corolla was stolen.

11TH ST. N., 2300 block. A white 1984 Nissan Sentra was stolen.

16TH ST. S., 4300 block. A gray 1990 Toyota Camry was stolen.

23RD ST. S., 400 block. A silver 2003 Mitsubishi Lancer was stolen.

-- Sarah Lane
