Crime Report


SECTION: EXTRAS; Pg. GZ20


LENGTH: 1889 words


Montgomery County 

These were among incidents reported by the Montgomery County Police Department. For more information, call 240-773-5030.

REWARDS FOR INFORMATION

Crime Solvers of Montgomery County Inc., a nonprofit community organization, will pay up to $1,000 for information leading to an arrest and indictment in connection with these and any other felony crimes. Call the 24-hour hotline at 800-673-2777. Callers may remain anonymous.

District 1 Rockville Station Telephone: 240-773-6070

SEXUAL ASSAULTS 

ROCKVILLE AREA, 5:30 p.m. Feb. 21. A man met a 23-year-old Washington woman over the Internet, and made plans to pick her up at the Rockville Metro Station. When she arrived, he took her to a residence in Rockville where they met with another man, who the woman also met on the Internet. She reported that the second male tried to rape her.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

ARTIC CT., 13300 block, 5:45 to 5:49 a.m. March 11. A residence was entered by force. Nothing reported missing. 

BRAXFIELD CT., 12200 block, 10:15 to 10:32 p.m. March 13. A residence was entered by force. Nothing reported missing.

INDIANOLA DR., 15900 block, 9:20 p.m. March 10 to 11 a.m. March 11. Property was stolen from an auto center entered by force.

LITTLETON ST., 12400 block, 5 p.m. Feb. 23 to 10 a.m. Feb. 28. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

PARAMOUNT DR., 15800 block, 8:55 to 9 a.m. March 12. Property was stolen from a construction business entered by force.

RIVER RD., 9500 block, 2 p.m. March 6 to midnight March 11. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

STONESTREET AVE., 600 block, 3:32 p.m. March 10. Property was stolen from a market entered by force.

District 2 Bethesda Station Telephone: 301-652-9200

No reports from the Bethesda Station were available for today's Montgomery Extra.

District 3 Silver Spring Station Telephone: 301-565-7740

ASSAULTS

CASTLE TERRACE AND CASTLE BOULEVARD, 8:45 p.m. March 10. A large group of males got into an argument with a 17-year-old Olney female, a 14-year-old Silver Spring female, and another person who were walking in the area. One of the males in the group picked up a metal table frame and threw it at the girls, hitting the 17-year-old in the face. She was transported to a local hospital for medical attention.

COLUMBIA PIKE, 6:12 p.m. March 9. Two males jumped an 18-year-old Burtonsville man while he was walking on Columbia Pike in Burtonsville. One male restrained him while the other searched the man's pockets and took cash. Both robbers fled.

ROBBERIES

ADELPHI RD., 9500 block, 9:30 p.m. March 9. A male punched the face of a 20-year-old female pedestrian of Hyattsville. The woman fell to the ground, and the assailant took her purse and fled toward Sierra Street, turning south onto New Hampshire Avenue.

COLESVILLE RD., 8400 block, 1:30 p.m. March 11. A man argued with a female acquaintance from Bladensburg over a car. The man allegedly took the woman's cellphone and reportedly threatened to punch her. He fled in a car, a late-model 1990s Nissan, with another male.

INDIAN SPRING DR. E., 100 block, 5:28 p.m. March 9. Three male youths robbed a pizza delivery man and were chased by police from Maryland into the District, where they tried to elude police in a stolen car, crashing into two vehicles. Three male youths of Washington were arrested and charged with unauthorized use of a motor vehicle.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

BAILIWICK PL,13800 block, 1:45 to 2 p.m. Feb. 21. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

BLUERIDGE AVE., 2700 block, 7:10 to 8:30 a.m. March 6. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

CABINWOOD DR., 13200 block, 9:30 a.m. to 4 p.m. March 7. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

CASTLE BLVD., 13800 block, 1:05 p.m. to 7:38 p.m. March 12. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

CHERRY HILL RD., 11700 block, 5:07 p.m. March 9 to 9:30 a.m. March 10. A construction dump site was entered by force. Nothing was reported missing.

FENTON ST., 7800 block, noon Oct. 1 to noon Jan. 30. Property was stolen from a public storage facility.

FOREST GLEN PL., 1400 block, 5 p.m. March 3 to 9:04 a.m. March 5. Property was stolen from a business.

FRANWELL AVE., 2000 block, 7 to 10:30 p.m. March 11. Property was stolen from a residence.

GEORGIA AVE., 9300 block, 5:34 to 5:35 p.m. March 11. A gas station was entered by force. Nothing was reported missing.

GLENALLEN AVE., 2300 block, 8:30 to 8:37 p.m. March 4. A residence was entered by force. Nothing was reported missing.

IVYDALE ST., 2900 block, 8 a.m. to 5:15 p.m. March 7. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

JANET RD., 3400 block, 8:15 to 8:21 p.m. March 9. A residence was entered by force. Nothing was reported missing.

LYDIA ST., 13400 block, 7 to 7:07 p.m. March 10. A residence was entered by force. Nothing was reported missing.

KEMP MILL RD., 11600 block, 2 p.m. Feb. 24 to 9 a.m. Feb. 26. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

OLD COLUMBIA PIKE, 11700 block, 7 a.m. to 6 p.m. March 13. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

District 6 Gaithersburg Station Telephone: 240-773-5700

SEXUAL ASSAULTS 

RUSSELL AVE., 700 block, 11 p.m. Feb. 22. A 34-year-old Frederick woman contacted a man through an online dating service, and the man met her at Lakeforest Mall for dinner, then went to her car, where the man raped her.

INDECENT EXPOSURE

BICKERSTAFF WAY AND SHARPSTEAD LANE, 5:50 p.m. March 10. A bald male youth approached three female teenage girls who were walking near an intersection. The male dropped his pants, exposed himself and ran toward Diamondback Drive.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

CHADBURN PL., 9300 block, 9:30 a.m. to 7 p.m. March 14. A residence was entered by force. Nothing was reported missing.

DIAMOND AVE. E., 100 block, 8:43 p.m. March 8 to 8:16 a.m. March 9. Property was stolen from a check-cashing business entered by force.

DIAMONDBACK DRIVE AND SAM EIG HIGHWAY, March 9 to March 12. Construction materials were stolen from a construction site. A construction tractor on the site was used to steal the materials.

OAKTON RD., 100 block, 8:30 to 10:27 a.m. March 15. Property was stolen from a residence entered by force.

PUEBLO RD., 12100 block, 8:30 a.m. to 1:30 p.m. Feb. 23. Property was seized from a residence entered by force.

Rockville

These were among incidents reported by the Rockville Police Department. For more information, call 240-314-8922.

ASSAULTS

ROCKVILLE PIKE, 1500 block, 6:50 to 7:05 p.m. March 11. A 36-year-old Oxon Hill man was arrested and charged with domestic assault in connection with an incident at the above location.

VEIRS MILL RD., 2000 block, Feb. 23. A 27-year-old man was arrested and charged with aggravated assault in connection with an earlier incident at the above location.

THEFTS

FALLSGROVE DR., 700 block, 9 a.m. to 2:45 p.m. March 13. A laptop computer was stolen from a residence entered by prying open a front door of an apartment.

GRANDIN AVE., 1600 block, 3:20 p.m. March 13. A 19-year-old man was arrested and charged with first-degree burglary, theft and malicious destruction of property in connection with a Feb. 8 incident.

GUDE DR. W., 1 to 100 block, 5 p.m. March 9 to 1 p.m. March 12. Cash, a camera, a company credit card, a projector and a laptop computer were stolen from an office building.

HUNGERFORD DR., 400 block, 2:13 to 3 a.m. March 16. Cash and an ATM were stolen from a bar.

MCAULIFFE DR., 2300 block, 5:20 to 8:11 p.m., March 13. An attempt was made to break into a residence by prying a front door lock.

ROCKVILLE PIKE, 1500 block, 9:30 to 10 a.m. March 12. Cash was stolen from an unsecured desk.

ROCKVILLE PIKE, 1600 block, 5:30 to 5:50 p.m. March 16. A 22-year-old man from Brooklyn, N.Y., was arrested and charged with credit card fraud in connection with an incident at the above location.

STONESTREET AVE. N., 200 block, 2 p.m. March 7 to 7:30 a.m. March 8. A shotgun, four air guns, two air ratchets, an air hammer and two air drills were stolen from a retail store entered by prying open a side door.

TAFT ST., 1000 block, 5 p.m. March 9 to 2 p.m. March 12. A car dolly was stolen from a parking lot.

VEIRS MILL RD., 1900 block, 4:08 p.m. March 18. A 29-year-old man was arrested and charged with shoplifting in connection with an incident at the above location.

VEIRS MILL RD., 2000 block, March 9. A 25-year-old man was arrested and charged with shoplifting in connection with an incident at the above location.

VEIRS MILL RD., 2200 block 5 to 5:30 p.m. March 11. A wallet was stolen from a retail store.

Takoma Park

These were among incidents reported by the Takoma Park Police Department. For more information, call 301-891-7102.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

HOLTON LANE, 1300 block, 5:18 p.m. March 17. A male youth wearing a black hooded jacket and sunglasses in a business jumped over a counter and entered an employee area through an unlocked door. He demanded cash from a lone employee, who ran to an office area in the back of the store. The employee refused to give the robber money, and the robber fled.

UNIVERSITY BLVD., 1100 block, 4:05 p.m. March 17. A male youth was arrested and charged with theft under $500 in connection with a shoplifting incident.

June 5, 2014 Thursday 11:57 PM EST 


Southern Maryland crime report


SECTION: Metro; Pg. T31


LENGTH: 1024 words


Calvert County

These were among reports received by the Calvert County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. Anyone with information about these crimes is asked to call the Criminal Investigation Division, 410-535-2800 or 301-855-1194, or the Crime Solvers line, 410-535-2880. Residents can also call the Prince Frederick Barrack of the state police at 410-535-1400.

CHESAPEAKE BEACH AREA ASSAULTS  

Chesapeake Beach, 8:33 p.m. May 23. During an attempt to stop an intoxicated woman from driving her vehicle near a restaurant, a police officer was almost struck by the vehicle. When the driver stopped, the officer entered the vehicle and placed it in park. A struggle ensued. A Chesapeake Beach woman, 41, was charged with second-degree assault, intoxication, reckless endangerment, disturbing the peace and disorderly conduct.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

28th St.,overnight, May 21 to May 22. A portable TV, an MP3 player and a battery charger were taken from an unlocked vehicle.

Breezy Point,May 18 to May 24. Four camping trailers were damaged at a campground.

DUNKIRK AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Town Center Blvd., May 15 to May 20. A tractor-trailer's trailer was stolen from a shopping center.

HUNTINGTOWN AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Cherry Hill Lane,April 19 to May 19. Copper piping was stolen.

Lowery Rd.,May 16 to May 23. A lock was removed from a storage trailer at a home. A kayak paddle and two life jackets were stolen.

LUSBY AREA ROBBERIES

Lake Lariat, 1:27 p.m. May 23. During a basketball game involving four males, two players robbed the others at gunpoint of car speakers, cash, cellphones and a wallet.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Harbor Dr.,200 block, 1:30 a.m. May 24. A garage window was broken.

NORTH BEACH AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Seventh St.,May 21. A front door was pried open in the daytime. Nothing was reported missing.

PRINCE FREDERICK AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Cambridge Pl.,400 block, 7 p.m. May 23 to 8 a.m. May 24. Property was stolen from a vehicle parked at a home.

Charles County

These were among reports received by the Charles County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. For information, call 301-932-2222 or 301-870-3232. The sheriff's Web site, www.ccso.us, has news releases, local crime statistics, crime prevention programs and career opportunities.

REWARDS FOR INFORMATION

Crime Solvers will pay a reward for information leading to an arrest and an indictment in connection with these and other crimes. Call the 24-hour hotline at 866-411-8477. Callers may remain anonymous.

BRYANS ROAD AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Larissa Ct.,2600 block, May 23. A DVD player was stolen from an unlocked vehicle.

INDIAN HEAD AREA WEAPONS

Ellerbe Dr.,6000 block, 2:20 p.m. May 28. A man fired a gun. A man, 44, was charged with reckless endangerment.

WALDORF AREA ROBBERIES

Thoroughbred Ct.,6000 block, 2:20 p.m. May 28. A group of males asked a male pedestrian, 17, for cash. He was assaulted when he attempted to walk away. The group fled in a white pickup.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Eutaw St.,3000 block, May 21 to May 23. A check was stolen from outgoing mail at a home. Someone attempted to change the name on the check and cash it at bank.

St. Mary's County

These were among reports received by the St. Mary's County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. For information, call 301-475-8008. To submit a tip, call the Crime Solvers line at 301-475-3333. The Leonardtown Barrack of the Maryland State Police also has a 24-hour anonymous tip line at 301-475-2936.

CALIFORNIA AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

California, May 27. A vehicle window was broken; property was stolen.

COMPTON AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Lady Baltimore area,May 28. A vehicle was entered; nothing was reported missing.

LEONARDTOWN AREA ASSAULTS

Leonardtown,May 30. A woman at a hospital said an acquaintance stabbed her during an argument. An arrest warrant was issued for a Lexington Park woman, 45.

LEXINGTON PARK AREA SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Lexington Park,May 24. Someone was sexually assaulted at a home. Warrants were issued for a man in connection with first-degree rape and second-degree assault.

ASSAULTS

Carefree Lane,May 25. A man backed his vehicle into another vehicle to stop the driver and passenger from leaving. A Lexington Park man, 36, was charged with two counts of first- and second-degree assault and two counts of false imprisonment.

Chapman Dr.,May 24. A man threw a beer at an acquaintance and pulled her hair. He also broke her phone and threw her purse into woods. A Lexington Park man, 52, was charged with second-degree assault.

Great Mills Rd.,11:35 a.m. May 22. While being arrested, a woman at an apartment complex hit a police officer in the face. After she was placed in a police vehicle, she kicked a window. A Lexington Park woman, 20, was charged with second-degree assault of a law enforcement officer, disorderly conduct, resisting arrest, failure to obey a lawful order and property destruction.

Williams Dr.,3:01 p.m. May 25. During an altercation, a woman assaulted an acquaintance. A Lexington Park woman, 19, was charged with second-degree assault.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Chancellor Run Rd.,May 28. Property was stolen from a vehicle.

MECHANICSVILLE AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Yowaiski Mill Rd.,1 p.m. May 21. A man was seen leaving a home with copper wires and other property. A Mechanicsville man, 21, was charged with two counts of second-and fourth-degree burglary, theft, property destruction and trespassing.

-Compiled by Bonnie Smith

The driver possessed other fraudulent law enforcement credentials, a stun gun and a firearm. A Manassas man, 32, was arrested and charged with impersonating a law enforcement officer, possession of fictitious identifications, possession of a firearm by a felon and possession of a stun gun by a felon.

Fairfax City

These were among incidents reported by the Fairfax City Police Department. For information, call 703-385-7809.

ASSAULTS

First St., 10800 block, 3:22 p.m. March 11. During an altercation at a church, a man struck a male. The man fled in a vehicle but was later apprehended when he returned to the church. A 57-year-old man was arrested in connection with assault. The male was treated for injuries at a medical facility.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Fairfax Blvd. , 10400 block, 5:56 p.m. March 15. An unattended iPad was stolen at a used car dealership. A 27-year-old Burke man, an employee of the dealership, was arrested in connection with grand larceny.

Fairfax Blvd., 10600 block, 3:45 p.m. March 14. A male attempted to purchase a vehicle online with two fraudulent credit card transactions and had it shipped to Florida. The manager at a local car dealership reported the fraud.

Fairfax Blvd. , 10800 block, 8 p.m. to 6 a.m. March 11. A refrigerant line was damaged during an attempt to remove copper pipe from a school. Earlier in February, three copper downspouts were stolen from the school.

Fairfax Sq., 3800 block, 5:09 a.m. An intoxicated man attempted to enter an apartment. A 21-year-old man from the same apartment complex was arrested for unlawful entry and public drunkenness.

Old Lee Hwy., 3200 block, 1:30 p.m. March 15. Prescription medication drugs were stolen from an unattended purse in the restroom of a counseling center.

Sager Ave., 10300 block, 6:31 p.m. March 18. A backpack containing rock-climbing equipment was stolen from an unlocked parked vehicle.

Vanderbilt Ct., 4100 block, midnight to 11:15 a.m. March 18. Two skateboards, a helmet and a winter jacket were stolen from a parked vehicle.

VANDALISM

Copper Lane, 3700 block, 12:30 to 2:15 p.m. March 12. A rear window of a vehicle was smashed.

Lyndhurst Dr., March 8 to March 15. Paint was scratched on a parked vehicle.

Falls Church

These were among incidents reported by the Falls Church Police Department. For information, call 703-248-5056.

ASSAULTS

Meridian St., 500 block, March 15. A 22-year-old man was arrested for assaulting a family member.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

W. Broad St., 100 block, March 11. Batteries were reported stolen from a public messaging board.

N. Maple Ave., 400 block, March 15. An 18-year-old man was arrested for habitual petit larceny and trespassing.

Herndon

These were among incidents reported by the Herndon Police Department. For information, call 703-435-6846.

ASSAULTS

Bond St., 1200 block, 3:39 p.m. March 10. A simple assault was reported.

Elden St., 1000 block, 3:34 a.m. March 10. A simple assault was reported.

Herndon Pw., 1100 block, 4:42 p.m. March 12. A simple assault was reported.

ROBBERIES

Wintrol Ct., 1100 block, 6:21 p.m. March 11. A robbery was reported.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Birch St., 700 block, 1:24 p.m. March 15. A fraud was reported.

Elden St., 100 block, 12:37 p.m. March 15. Shoplifting was reported.

Elden St., 400 block, 6:04 p.m. March 15. A credit card/ATM fraud was reported.

Ferndale Ave., 800 block, 12:41 p.m. March 12. A fraud was reported.

Missouri Ave., 200 block, 10:51 a.m. March 13. Theft from a vehicle was reported.

Montalto Dr., 400 block, 6:06 p.m. March 3. A fraud was reported.

Raven Tower Ct., 2100 block, 10:37 a.m. March 15. A theft was reported.

Springdale Pl., 1200 block, 10:35 a.m. March 16. A fraud was reported.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Vienna

These were among incidents reported by the Vienna Police Department. For information, call 703-255-6396.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Beulah Rd. NE, 500 block, 6 p.m. March 18 to 6 a.m. March 19. Copper downspouts were stolen from the exterior of a church.

Cedar Lane SE, 200 block, 4:34 p.m. March 19. A resident reported that she received a call from someone who said that if she did not come up with money, her son would be harmed. She called her son, who assured her that he wasn't in danger.

Elmar Dr. SE, 100 block, 6:15 p.m. March 14. An IRS fraud was reported.

Moore Ave. SE, 200 block, noon March 6 to 4 p.m. March 12. A bike was reported stolen from a residential garage.

Walker St. SW, 5:09 p.m. March 19. A fraud was reported.

Prince William County crime report Prince William County crime report


SECTION: METRO; Pg. T33


LENGTH: 1107 words


Prince William County

The following incidents were recently reported by Prince William County police. For information, call 703-792-7245.

DUMFRIES AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Eclipse Dr., 15100 block, 10:30 p.m. Oct. 24 to 4 a.m. Oct. 25. A wallet and a watch were stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked side door.

Lotus Ct., 18400 block, 11 a.m. Oct. 20 to 9 p.m. Oct. 21. A TV and a microwave oven were stolen from a residence.

HAYMARKET AREA

ASSAULTS

Dominion Valley Dr., 15500 block, An unidentified object hit a moving vehicle, breaking a window. No injuries were reported. 

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Gaines Mill Cir., 15100 block, Oct. 22. A dishwasher and speakers were stolen from a house under construction.

Stoney Creek Ct., 14500 block, Oct. 22. Cabinets were stolen from a house under construction.

MANASSAS AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Bank Beaver Ct., 12000 block, 11 a.m. to 2:30 p.m. Oct. 23. Someone attempted to enter a residence by breaking a rear window.

Lady Jane Loop, 11200 block, 1:43 a.m. Oct. 22. A man opened a front door of a residence and shouted at a resident and her guests. When the resident attempted to close the door, the man blocked it with his foot. The man left, then returned a short time later with a large metal object. A 21-year-old Manassas man was arrested.

Moore Dr., 11300 block, 6:30 a.m. to 5:30 p.m. Oct. 18. Jewelry was stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked window.

Vermont Pl., 8200 block, 10 a.m. to 6:15 p.m. Oct. 21. A laptop, jewelry and coins were stolen from a residence.

NOKESVILLE AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Fitzwater Dr., 12800 block, 10 p.m. Oct. 20 to 6 a.m. Oct. 21. Cash was stolen from a restaurant entered by breaking a front glass door.

TRIANGLE AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Belleau Woods Dr., 19300 block, Oct. 13 to Oct. 23. A video game system and games were stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked rear door.

WOODBRIDGE AREA

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Carter Lane, 12:15 p.m. Oct. 21. A man sexually assaulted two female juvenile relatives. A Woodbridge man was arrested.

ASSAULTS

Georgetown Rd. and Geddy Ct., 9:01 p.m. Oct. 24. A rear passenger in a vehicle fired BBs at a male juvenile pedestrian, who was later treated for injuries.

Kentucky Ave., 1500 block, 2:32 a.m. Oct. 26. During an argument, a woman threw a glass at a male acquaintance, hitting him in the face. The man was treated for injuries. A 31-year-0ld Woodbridge woman was arrested.

Occoquan Rd., 13300 block, 11:14 p.m. Oct. 21. A woman entered a vehicle parked at a convenience store and ordered a female passenger to get out. When the passenger refused, the woman assaulted her. The passenger took the key from the ignition, and the assailant fled with another woman. Two Woodbridge women, ages 28 and 45, were arrested.

Pilgrim Dr., 2000 block, 6:50 a.m. Oct. 19. During an argument, a man assaulted a female acquaintance, knocked her down and kept her in a basement room. A 33-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

WEAPONS

Candlewood Ct., 14700 block, 1:27 a.m. Oct. 23. During an argument, a man pointed a handgun at a male acquaintance. No injuries were reported. A 32-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

Potomac Mills Rd., 2700 block, 3:25 p.m. Oct. 20. During a fight, a man with a knife threatened a male acquaintance. A 19-year-old Silver Spring, Md., man was arrested.

ROBBERIES

Lost Canyon Ct., 15000 block, 8:24 p.m. Oct. 19. Two men robbed a pizza deliveryman of a wallet and pizzas at gunpoint.

Old Bridge Rd., 3500 block, 11:49 p.m. Oct. 21. A man implied he had a handgun and robbed a gas station of cash. He then took off outer clothing he had been wearing and ignited it behind a carwash at the service station. The fire damaged the business. No injuries were reported. A 33-year-old man was arrested in the area.

Prince William Pkwy., 2800 block, 3:09 p.m. Oct. 21. A man implied he had a weapon and robbed a jewelry store of two rings.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Arum Pl., 15000 block, 8 a.m. to 7 p.m. Oct. 17. Someone attempted to enter a residence by breaking a fence door lock and opening a rear door.

Cara Dr., 12800 block, noon to 3 p.m. Oct. 21. A laptop was stolen from a residence.

Delano Dr., 14600 block, 9 a.m. Oct. 15 to 3 p.m. Oct. 18. Copper piping was stolen from a vacant residence entered by forcing open a rear door.

Dillon Ave., 14800 block, 6 p.m. Oct. 7 to 8 a.m. Oct. 16. Copper piping was stolen from two residences.

Fullerton Rd., 14300 block, noon Sept. 20 to 10 a.m. Oct. 18. A refrigerator and copper piping were stolen from a vacant residence entered by breaking a rear window.

Horner Rd., 1700 block, 9 a.m. to 9 p.m. Oct. 21. A cellphone was stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked front door.

Iowa Ct., 1700 block, 12:47 p.m. Oct. 21. Someone attempted to enter a building by forcing a rear door.

Lodge Terr., 15200 block, 8:30 p.m. Oct. 18 to 5:30 a.m. Oct. 19. A purse containing cash and other property was stolen from a residence.

Thenia Pl., 1600 block, 6 a.m. to 4 p.m. Oct. 19. Someone attempted to enter a residence by removing a screen from a front window.

Wentwood Lane, 15200 block, 10:40 a.m. to 10 p.m. Oct. 22. Cash and other property were stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked rear door.

VANDALISM

Welsh Lane, 4400 block, 10:30 p.m. Oct. 22 to 7:42 a.m. Oct. 23. Someone fired BBs at a law enforcement vehicle parked at a residence. A rear window was broken.

Manassas

The following incidents were recently reported by Manassas police. For information, call 703-257-8000.

ROBBERIES

Beech Place and Byrd Drive, 9:15 p.m. Oct. 21. Two men robbed a male pedestrian of cash at gunpoint.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Brackets Ford Cir., 10400 block, 8 p.m. Oct. 21 to 8 p.m. Oct. 23. Cash and jewelry were stolen from a residence.

Cockrell Rd., 9800 block, noon Oct. 9 to 8 a.m. Oct. 10. Property was stolen from a business.

Grant Ave., 10100 block, 3 to 3:40 a.m. Oct. 20. Cash and a wallet were stolen from a vehicle.

Stonewall Rd., 8500 block, 5 p.m. Oct. 17 to 3 p.m. Oct. 19. An MP3 player and a phone-battery charger were stolen from an unlocked vehicle.

Tapok Dr., 9500 block, 6:30 to 11:40 p.m. Oct. 22. Cash, a TV, a laptop, a video game system, an MP3 player and clothes were stolen from a residence.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Mathis Ave., 9100 block, A 2003 Ford truck was stolen.

VANDALISM

Bayberry Ave., 9200 block, 1:25 a.m. Oct. 23. A male hit a vehicle several times with an object, damaging the vehicle.

Manassas Park

The following incident was recently reported by Manassas Park police. For information, call 703-361-1136.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Centreville Rd., 8500 block, 7:22 p.m. Oct. 18. A man stole merchandise from a store. A 23-year-old Manassas Park man was arrested.

March 1, 2012 Thursday 8:12 PM EST 


Anne Arundel County and Howard County crime report Anne Arundel County and Howard County crime report


SECTION: Metro; Pg. T15


LENGTH: 1541 words


Anne Arundel County

These were among incidents reported by Anne Arundel County police. For information, call 410-222-8050.

Rewards for information

Metro Crime Stoppers will pay up to $2,000 for information leading to arrests and indictments in connection with felonies. Visit metrocrimestoppers.net, call the hotline at 866-756-2587 or text 274637. For text messages, type the letters "mcs" without the quote marks in the text field, then hit the space key before writing the crime tip. If the text is received, you will receive an acknowledgment.

ANNAPOLIS AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Harker Pl., 200 block, Feb. 18. Gym employees called police when a man, who bore a resemblance to a suspect described in a string of thefts, entered the facility. An Annapolis man, 43, was charged with theft at that gym and is being investigated in connection with at least five thefts at other gyms. 

BROOKLYN PARK AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Second Ave., 100 block, 3:36 a.m. Feb. 21. A flat-screen TV was stolen from a residence. Shortly after the theft was reported, police officers saw a man walking down Marshall Road carrying a TV. A Baltimore man, 19, was arrested.

GAMBRILLS AREA ASSAULTS

Route 3 North and Churchview Road, 4 p.m. Feb. 20. A motorist got out of a Ford Explorer at Route 3 and Riedel Road and exchanged words with a man riding in a Chrysler PT Cruiser, who then stabbed the motorist. The Chrysler sped off, and the motorist, who was not seriously injured, returned to his vehicle and followed northbound on Route 3. The vehicles collided a short distance away. All five occupants of the two vehicles were treated at hospitals for injuries that were not life-threatening. A Baltimore man, 23, was charged with first- and second-degree assault, reckless endangerment, and carrying a dangerous weapon with intent to injure.

GLEN BURNIE AREA ROBBERIES

Juneberry Way, 300 block, 9:32 p.m. Feb. 22. Two men robbed a woman getting into a vehicle of cash and property at gunpoint. A Glen Burnie man, 19, was charged with armed robbery, assault and theft.

PASADENA AREA SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Riding Woods Neighborhood, 3:30 p.m. Feb. 14. A man sexually assaulted a student walking near a wooded area.

ROBBERIES

Fort Smallwood Rd., 8500 block, 8:45 p.m. Feb. 21. A man robbed a gas station of cash at gunpoint, then fled in a vehicle.

WEAPONS OFFENSES

Montrose and Fort Smallwood roads, 7:45 a.m. Feb. 19. A driver went off the road, struck a street sign and broke through a wooden fence at a residence. The driver took off, leaving behind a bumper with a license plate. Police stopped the vehicle near its owner's address and saw that the motorist was wearing a holster. A search of the vehicle turned up a handgun. A Glen Burnie man, 26, was charged with weapons and traffic violations.

Annapolis

These were among incidents reported by the Annapolis Police Department. For information, call 410-268-9000. To anonymously report non-emergency crime or any suspicious activity, call 410-280-2583.

WEAPONS OFFENSES

Hilltop Lane near Boxwood Road, 12:20 a.m. Feb. 19. Responding to the sound of gunfire, police found a male in a vehicle suffering from gunshot wounds. He was taken to a hospital for treatment. An investigation is continuing.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Admiral Dr., 200 block, 11 p.m. Feb. 18 to 9 a.m. Feb. 19. A blue-and-white Magna mountain bike was stolen from a back yard.

Bowman Dr., 1800 block, 7:15 to 7:30 p.m. Feb. 19. A tablet computer was stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked window.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Second St., 300 block, 4:30 to 10 p.m. Feb. 19. A purse was stolen from a vehicle entered by breaking a window.

Howard County

These were among incidents reported by the Howard County Police Department. For information, call 410-313-2236. To anonymously provide information about these and other felonies, call the Stop Crime tip line: 410-313-7867.

ANNAPOLIS JUNCTION AREA MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Dorsey Run Rd., 9000 block, 6:15 to 8 p.m. Feb. 16. A white 1997 Toyota Tercel was stolen.

CLARKSVILLE AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

MacBeth Farm Lane, 12800 block, 3:30 to 9:55 p.m. Feb. 19. Jewelry was stolen from a residence entered by forcing a back door. Police think the break-in is related to other thefts of jewelry from residences in the area.

COLUMBIA AREA ROBBERIES

Executive Park Dr., 4900 block, 10:16 p.m. Feb. 20. A person was robbed of a cellphone that two juveniles had arranged to buy. Two arrests were made.

Harpers Farm Rd., 5400 block, 10:30 p.m. Feb. 17. Three people attacked a male and robbed him of cash. The victim was treated for minor injuries at a hospital.

Little Patuxent Pkwy., 10300 block, 12:26 a.m. Feb. 18. Three men threatened a pedestrian at knifepoint in a parking lot. The victim suffered minor injuries.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Berger Rd., 9500 block, 10:05 a.m. Feb. 19 to 7 a.m. Feb. 20. A front window was broken at a business. Nothing was reported missing.

Cradlerock Way, 7200 block, 12:48 to 5:50 a.m. Feb. 19. Cash was stolen from an ATM and a safe at a gas station entered by forcing a side door.

Gramercy Pl., 10600 block, 10:47 a.m. Feb. 22. An attempt was made to enter a residence by forcing a door lock. Nothing was reported missing.

Little Patuxent Pkwy., 10200 block, 8:20 a.m. Feb. 20. A generator was stolen from a construction site.

Parallel Lane, 6200 block, 3:25 p.m. Feb. 22. Alcoholic beverages were stolen from a residence entered by cutting a porch screen. Two people were seen fleeing the residence.

Watercress Pl., 5400 block, 4:20 to 8:56 p.m. Feb. 16. Laptop computers, a digital media player and jewelry were stolen from a residence entered through a kitchen window.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Minstrel Way, 7000 block, 2:17 a.m. Feb. 19. A burgundy-colored Lexus SC400 was stolen.

Murray Hill Rd., 7500 block, 11:43 p.m. Feb. 18. A Hyundai Sonata was stolen. A Columbia man, 19, was charged with motor vehicle theft.

Silver Trumpet Dr., 8300 block, 8 a.m. to 1:28 p.m. Feb. 16. A purple-and-burgundy 1999 Dodge Caravan was stolen.

ELKRIDGE AREA ROBBERIES

Old Waterloo Rd., 6400 block, 1:48 a.m. Feb. 18. A man robbed a pharmacy of cash and cigarettes at gunpoint.

Old Waterloo Rd., 6500 block, 9:57 p.m. Feb. 18. A man robbed a convenience store of cash and cigarettes at gunpoint.

ELLICOTT CITY AREA ROBBERIES

Montgomery Rd., 4800 block, 10:55 a.m. Feb. 19. A gunman robbed a convenience store of cash and cigarettes. An Aberdeen man, 34, was charged with armed robbery, robbery, first-degree assault and theft. He is also a suspect in two armed robberies in Elkridge on Feb. 18.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Chapel Manor Lane, 8100 block, 10 a.m. to 12:15 p.m. Feb. 16. Cash and jewelry were stolen from a residence entered by breaking glass in a back door.

Crestwood Lane, 5100 block, 9:20 a.m. Feb. 22. An attempt was made to enter an occupied residence by breaking glass near the front door. The intruder fled empty-handed when confronted.

Roundhill Rd., 4600 block, 12:25 p.m. Feb. 22. A tablet computer and jewelry were stolen from a residence entered by breaking glass in a back door.

Hunting Horn Dr., 5500 block, 7:30 a.m. to 5:45 p.m. Feb. 16. Jewelry was stolen from a residence entered by breaking glass in a back door.

Huntley Dr., 4600 block, 7:45 a.m. to 2:35 p.m. Feb. 22. A tablet computer was stolen from a residence entered by forcing a back door.

Oak Lea Ct., 9900 block, 5:47 p.m. Feb. 17. An attempt was made to break into a residence. Nothing was reported missing.

River Terrace Ct., 2200 block, 8:45 a.m. to 7:25 p.m. Feb. 16. Jewelry was stolen from a residence entered by breaking glass in a back door.

Turf Valley Rd., 2700 block, noon Feb. 15 to 10:20 a.m. Feb. 17. A concession stand was broken into at a resort. Property was vandalized, but nothing was reported missing.

LAUREL AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Kings Grant Rd., 9400 block, 8:24 a.m. Feb. 18. Keys were stolen from a residence entered by forcing the front door. A Baltimore man, 32, was charged with first-degree burglary, theft and malicious destruction of property.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Livery Lane, 9200 block, 9:21 to 9:31 p.m. Feb. 19. A green 1995 Toyota Corolla was stolen.

WOODSTOCK AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Red Dahlia Dr., 10700 block, 7 a.m. to 6:30 p.m. Feb. 16. Jewelry and cash were stolen from a residence entered by forcing a back door.

Birmingham Way, 10700 block, 1:49 p.m. Feb. 17. A cash bag was stolen from a gas-station office entered by prying open a door. A clerk said that three people had been in the gas station and that two of them had created a distraction.

- Compiled by Carrie Donovan

Prince William County crime report Prince William County crime report


SECTION: METRO; Pg. T22


LENGTH: 1696 words


Prince William County

These were among incidents reported by Prince William County police. For information, call 703-792-7245.

DUMFRIES AREA

ROBBERIES

Sedgewick Pl., 2500 block, 2:15 a.m. July 29. A man demanded property from a male pedestrian, then hit him on the head with a handgun and robbed him of a cellphone and a wallet containing cash.

Waterway and Country Club drives, 1:45 a.m. July 28. A gunman demanded money from a male pedestrian, who fled.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Chesapeake Dr., 3100 block, 10:52 a.m. July 28. Two men entered a residence by breaking a rear window. Nothing was reported stolen. A 27-year-old Dumfries man and a 20-year-old Fairfax man were arrested. 

HAYMARKET AREA

ASSAULTS

Heythorpe Ct., 13600 block, 4:10 a.m. July 26. A male intruder was in the back yard of a residence when two residents saw him. The man entered a neighbor's open garage, and the residents confronted and attempted to detain him. The man assaulted them and fled on foot. A 25-year-old man and a 19-year-old Gainesville woman were arrested.

MANASSAS AREA

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Golden Leaf Cir. area, July 24. A man sexually assaulted a female juvenile acquaintance during the past two years. A 31-year-old Manassas man was arrested.

Sharpsburg Ct. area, July 22. Two men sexually assaulted a female juvenile acquaintance over several years. One of the men also sexually assaulted a woman. A 42-year-old Woodbridge man and a 34-year-old Manassas man were arrested.

WEAPONS

Juliet Lane, 8000 block, 3:55 a.m. July 28. Several gunshots were heard.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Automotive Dr., 10600 block, 9 p.m. July 28 to 10:30 a.m. July 29. Cash was stolen from a business entered by forcing a side door and several interior doors.

WOODBRIDGE AREA

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Dillingham Sq., 12400 block, 4:40 p.m. July 28. A man in a parking lot grabbed a woman's chest, then fled in a vehicle.

Lexington Ct. area, July 28. A man sexually assaulted a female acquaintance while she was sleeping. A 25-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

Rainbow Court and Bancroft Lane area, July 25. A man sexually assaulted a female acquaintance when she was a juvenile in the 1990s. A 50-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

ASSAULTS

Belleville Ave., 14300 block, 11 p.m. July 23. During an argument, two women assaulted another woman, who was hit in the face and torso with a metal pipe. The woman was treated for injuries. Two Woodbridge women, 33 and 34, were arrested.

Jefferson Davis Hwy., 13700 block, 2:27 a.m. July 28. During a fight in a parking lot, a man attempted to drive away. Someone fired a weapon at the vehicle, injuring the man in the head. He drove himself to a hospital, where he was treated for injuries.

Potomac Mills Rd., 14300 block, 1:06 a.m. July 29. During a fight, a man stabbed another man with a knife. The injured man was taken to a hospital. A 22-year-old Manassas man was arrested.

Sutton Pl., 16600 block, 7:36 p.m. July 22. A group of men assaulted a male acquaintance and a woman who had attempted to intervene. Two Woodbridge men, 22 and 24, and a 22-year-old Springfield man were arrested.

WEAPONS

Gina Pl., 3200 block, 1:40 a.m. July 26. Someone fired a weapon at a residence, damaging a kitchen cabinet.

INDECENT EXPOSURE

G St., 12:04 a.m. July 31. A man exposed himself to a female juvenile acquaintance.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Aztec Pl., 12300 block, 2:29 a.m. July 29. A man entered a residence through an unlocked front door. He fled with a laptop computer when a resident found him in the kitchen.

Cardin Pl., 15100 block, 3 to 4:30 p.m. July 23. A handgun and a laptop computer were stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked door.

Dyers Mills Ct., 2600 block, 5:30 a.m. to 1:50 p.m. July 30. Items were stolen from a residence entered by prying a front door.

Emberdale Ct., 14800 block, 2 to 8 p.m. July 23. Someone attempted to enter a residence by tampering with a front door.

Island House Loop, 12800 block, 3:57 a.m. July 29. A man attempted to enter a residence by forcing a rear door. He fled when a resident saw him.

Mayflower Dr., 2000 block, 12:45 to 2:30 a.m. July 26. A handgun was stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked rear door.

Rockinghorse Dr., 14100 block, 3 p.m. July 18 to 3:45 p.m. July 23. A video game system and equipment were stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked basement window.

Woodside Dr., 1600 block, 10:13 p.m. July 26. Cash was stolen from a business.

York Dr., 2000 block, 11:30 a.m. July 24. Jewelry was stolen from a residence entered by forcing a rear door. Three men fled from the residence when a resident returned home.

VANDALISM

Darbydale Ave., 14800 block, 3:30 p.m. July 26 to 8 a.m. July 27. A sign in front of a school was damaged.

Manassas

No reports were received from Manassas police for today's Local Living section. For information, call 703-257-8000.

Manassas Park

The following incident was recently reported by Manassas Park police. For more information, call 703-361-1136.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Owens Dr., 9100 block, 5 p.m. July 20 to 1:30 p.m. July 23. Welding equipment was stolen from two vehicles in a fenced area of a business.

- Compiled by Sarah Lane

Prince William County

These were among incidents reported by Prince William County police. For information, call 703-792-7245.

DUMFRIES AREA

ROBBERIES

Waterway and Country Club drives, 1:45 a.m. July 28. A gunman demanded money from a male pedestrian, who fled.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Chesapeake Dr., 3100 block, 10:52 a.m. July 28. Two men entered a residence by breaking a rear window. Nothing was reported stolen. A 27-year-old Dumfries man and a 20-year-old Fairfax man were arrested.

HAYMARKET AREA

ASSAULTS

Heythorpe Ct., 13600 block, 4:10 a.m. July 26. A male intruder was in the back yard of a residence when two residents saw him. The man entered a neighbor's open garage, and the residents confronted and attempted to detain him. The man assaulted them and fled on foot. A 25-year-old man and a 19-year-old Gainesville woman were arrested.

MANASSAS AREA

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Golden Leaf Cir. area, July 24. A man sexually assaulted a female juvenile acquaintance during the past two years. A 31-year-old Manassas man was arrested.

Sharpsburg Ct. area, July 22. Two men sexually assaulted a female juvenile acquaintance over several years. One of the men also sexually assaulted a woman. A 42-year-old Woodbridge man and a 34-year-old Manassas man were arrested.

WEAPONS

Juliet Lane, 8000 block, 3:55 a.m. July 28. Several gunshots were heard.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Automotive Dr., 10600 block, 9 p.m. July 28 to 10:30 a.m. July 29. Cash was stolen from a business entered by forcing a side door and several interior doors.

WOODBRIDGE AREA

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Dillingham Sq., 12400 block, 4:40 p.m. July 28. A man in a parking lot grabbed a woman's chest, then fled in a vehicle.

Lexington Ct. area, July 28. A man sexually assaulted a female acquaintance while she was sleeping. A 25-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

Rainbow Court and Bancroft Lane area, July 25. A man sexually assaulted a female acquaintance when she was a juvenile in the 1990s. A 50-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

ASSAULTS

Belleville Ave., 14300 block, 11 p.m. July 23. During an argument, two women assaulted another woman, who was hit in the face and torso with a metal pipe. The woman was treated for injuries. Two Woodbridge women, 33 and 34, were arrested.

Jefferson Davis Hwy., 13700 block, 2:27 a.m. July 28. During a fight in a parking lot, a man attempted to drive away. Someone fired a weapon at the vehicle, injuring the man in the head. He drove himself to a hospital, where he was treated for injuries.

Potomac Mills Rd., 14300 block, 1:06 a.m. July 29. During a fight, a man stabbed another man with a knife. The injured man was taken to a hospital. A 22-year-old Manassas man was arrested.

Sutton Pl., 16600 block, 7:36 p.m. July 22. A group of men assaulted a male acquaintance and a woman who had attempted to intervene. Two Woodbridge men, 22 and 24, and a 22-year-old Springfield man were arrested.

WEAPONS

Gina Pl., 3200 block, 1:40 a.m. July 26. Someone fired a weapon at a residence, damaging a kitchen cabinet.

INDECENT EXPOSURE

G St., 12:04 a.m. July 31. A man exposed himself to a female juvenile acquaintance.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Aztec Pl., 12300 block, 2:29 a.m. July 29. A man entered a residence through an unlocked front door. He fled with a laptop computer when a resident found him in the kitchen.

Cardin Pl., 15100 block, 3 to 4:30 p.m. July 23. A handgun and a laptop computer were stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked door.

Dyers Mills Ct., 2600 block, 5:30 a.m. to 1:50 p.m. July 30. Items were stolen from a residence entered by prying a front door.

Emberdale Ct., 14800 block, 2 to 8 p.m. July 23. Someone attempted to enter a residence by tampering with a front door.

Island House Loop, 12800 block, 3:57 a.m. July 29. A man attempted to enter a residence by forcing a rear door. He fled when a resident saw him.

Mayflower Dr., 2000 block, 12:45 to 2:30 a.m. July 26. A handgun was stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked rear door.

Rockinghorse Dr., 14100 block, 3 p.m. July 18 to 3:45 p.m. July 23. A video game system and equipment were stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked basement window.

Woodside Dr., 1600 block, 10:13 p.m. July 26. Cash was stolen from a business.

York Dr., 2000 block, 11:30 a.m. July 24. Jewelry was stolen from a residence entered by forcing a rear door. Three men fled from the residence when a resident returned home.

VANDALISM

Darbydale Ave., 14800 block, 3:30 p.m. July 26 to 8 a.m. July 27. A sign in front of a school was damaged.

Manassas

No reports were received from Manassas police for today's Local Living section. For information, call 703-257-8000.

Manassas Park

The following incident was recently reported by Manassas Park police. For more information, call 703-361-1136.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Owens Dr., 9100 block, 5 p.m. July 20 to 1:30 p.m. July 23. Welding equipment was stolen from two vehicles in a fenced area of a business.

Prince William County crime report


BYLINE: - Compiled by Sarah Lane


SECTION: METRO; Pg. T24


LENGTH: 667 words


Prince William

These were among incidents reported by Prince William County police. For information, call 703-792-7245.

DUMFRIES AREA

WEAPONS

Dumfries Rd., 17300 block, 11:49 p.m. June 9. Several gunshots were heard.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Pine Bluff Dr., 3300 block, 2:07 a.m. June 10. Two men attempted to enter a restaurant by breaking a side window. They fled when an employee yelled at them.

GAINESVILLE AREA

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Braemar Village Plaza, 12800 block, 4:23 p.m. June 4. A motorist picked up a female juvenile acquaintance, drove her to the location and sexually assaulted her. A 26-year-old Gainesville man was arrested. 

MANASSAS AREA

ASSAULTS

Whitehall Dr., 7500 block, 3 a.m. June 8. During an argument, a woman hit a female acquaintance in the head with a bottle. A 43-year-old Manassas woman was arrested.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Keara Ct., 7700 block, 11:05 to 11:50 a.m. June 3. Cash and shoes were stolen from a residence entered through a window.

NOKESVILLE AREA

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Par Dr. and Vint Hill Rd., June 8. A man raped an acquaintance at gunpoint after she picked him up and drove him to the area. A 21-year-old Manassas man was arrested.

TRIANGLE AREA

ASSAULTS

Graham Park Rd., 3800 block, 1:47 a.m. June 8. During an argument, a woman threw a bottle at a female acquaintance, cutting her head. A 48-year-old Woodbridge woman was arrested.

WEAPONS

Katie Pl. and Kyle Lane, 3700 block, 12:26 a.m. June 9. Responding to a report of a loud party, officers heard several gunshots.

Kilmer Lane, 18100 block, 2 p.m. June 6. Three males pointed a handgun at a man cleaning out his vehicle. The man confronted them, and they fled empty-handed.

WOODBRIDGE AREA

ROBBERIES

Bel Air and Jeffries Roads, 10:05 p.m. June 9. A man accompanied by a woman assaulted a male pedestrian and robbed him of a bag containing food.

Jefferson Davis Hwy., 14000 block, 9:33 p.m. June 10. A gunman robbed a man and a woman of a purse and cellphone.

Old Bridge Rd., 3500 block, 11:21 p.m. June 9. Three gunmen robbed a gas station of cash and a customer of a wallet and cellphone.

Reardon Lane, 5600 block, 12:58 a.m. June 6. A man demanded narcotics from a male acquaintance at gunpoint. The acquaintance assaulted the man, who fired the gun at him. The man took the acquaintance's car keys and sunglasses and fled on foot. The acquaintance called a female acquaintance before calling police and put marijuana in her vehicle. A 21-year-old man and a 20-year-old woman, both of Woodbridge, were arrested.

INDECENT EXPOSURE

Donald Curtis Dr., 15900 block, 10:51 a.m. June 5. A man in a building exposed himself to a woman and propositioned her for sex. A 44-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Armstead St., 13100 block, 6 a.m. to noon. June 6. Several firearms and a laptop computer were stolen from a residence entered by breaking a rear window.

Barksdale St., 14700 block, 3:25 p.m. June 5. A group of men entered a residence by breaking a rear door and ransacked the interior while a resident hid.

Canada Goose Loop, 15900 block, 4:30 a.m. June 6. A gold chain was stolen from a residence.

Grady Lane, 3200 block, 8 a.m. to 4:20 p.m. June 6. Jewelry was stolen from a residence entered by forcing a rear door.

Manchester Way, 12300 block, noon to 5:45 p.m. June 6. A laptop computer and jewelry were stolen from a residence entered by breaking a rear door.

Shallow Ct., 14800 block, 5 to 7:30 p.m. June 10. Cash and a computer tablet were stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked door.

Sunny Brook Ct., 3900 block, 10:45 a.m. June 7 to 2:30 p.m. June 8. Two rugs were stolen from a residence.

Woodmark Dr., 2800 block, 7:15 a.m. to 6:30 p.m. June 7. Cash and a computer tablet were stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked window.

Manassas

No reports were received from Manassas police for this edition of Local Living. For information, call 703-257-8000.

Manassas Park

No reports were received from Manassas Park police for this edition of Local Living. For information, call 703-361-1136.

Prince William County crime report


SECTION: Metro; Pg. T34


LENGTH: 509 words


Prince William County

These were among incidents reported by Prince William County police. For information, call 703-792-7245.

GAINESVILLE AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Catbird Dr., 14100 block, 8 a.m. Nov. 13 to 10 p.m. Nov. 14. A handgun was stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked door. 

HAYMARKET AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Mountain Rd., 3700 block, 6:30 p.m. Nov. 10 to 5:30 a.m. Nov. 11. A firearm and crossbows were stolen from a residence. An 18-year-old Haymarket man was arrested.

Old Carolina Rd., 6500 block, 7 p.m. Nov. 9 to 9 a.m. Nov. 11. A video-game system and games were stolen from a residence entered by damaging a rear door.

MANASSAS AREA SEXUAL ASSAULT

Round Top Rd., 8900 block, Nov. 13. During an argument in a vehicle, a man sexually assaulted a female acquaintance. A 53-year-old Manassas man was arrested and charged with rape.

WOODBRIDGE AREA HOMICIDE

Keating Dr., 13400 block, 12:09 a.m. Nov. 16. During an argument in front of a residence, a man shot another man and a male juvenile. The gunman fled with a male acquaintance. Both victims were transported to a hospital where Christopher Nathaniel Weaver, 19, died. The juvenile is expected to recover. A 35-year-old Vienna man was arrested.

ASSAULTS

Concord Dr., 15100 block, Nov. 12. During an argument, a woman repeatedly hit a female juvenile relative with a cable and an extension cord. A 33-year-old Woodbridge woman was arrested.

Kramer Estates Dr., 16300 block, 9:07 p.m. Nov. 14. During a party at a clubhouse, a male security guard falsely identified himself as a police officer and turned away attendees, causing a fight. The man stabbed a male juvenile in the chest and cut his face. Gunshots also were heard but no one was reported shot. A 19-year-old Dumfries man was arrested.

ROBBERIES

Old Kings Rd. and Flintlock Terr., 6:06 p.m. Nov. 12. Two gunmen robbed a man and a woman of property as they were sitting in a vehicle.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Anchorstone Dr., 5000 block, 3:45 to 5:45 p.m. Nov. 13. A decorative wall hanging was stolen from a residence.

Bramblewood Lane, 16500 block, 3:40 to 3:50 p.m. Nov. 16. Copper wire was stolen from a residence entered through an open garage door.

Build America Dr., 14800 block, 9 p.m. Nov. 15 to 8 a.m. Nov. 16. Cash was stolen from a business entered by breaking glass in a front door.

Hornet Way, 13600 block, 8 a.m. to 6:30 p.m. Nov. 9. A residence was entered and ransacked. Nothing was reported stolen.

Manassas

No reports were received from Manassas police for this edition of Local Living. For information, call 703-257-8000.

Manassas Park

No reports were received from Manassas Park police for this edition of Local Living. For information, call 703-361-1136.

Prince William County crime report Prince William County crime report


SECTION: Metro; Pg. T19


LENGTH: 1270 words


Prince William County

These were among incidents reported by Prince William County police. For information, call 703-792-7245.

DUMFRIES AREA WEAPONS OFFENSES

Oak Tree Lane, 2500 block, 3:48 p.m. Jan. 13. During an argument, a man discharged a firearm in the direction of an acquaintance's residence. A bullet hit an adjacent residence. No injuries were reported.

ROBBERIES

Point Pleasant Lane, 16900 block, 6:53 p.m. Jan. 15. Three males attacked a pizza deliveryman from behind, knocking him to the ground. The assailants fled with cash and food. No serious injuries were reported. 

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Chesapeake Dr., 3100 block, 9:30 a.m. to 8 p.m. Jan. 13. A video game system, games and equipment were stolen from a residence.

Chesapeake Dr., 3100 block, 9:30 a.m. to 8 p.m. Jan. 13. Jewelry was stolen from a residence.

Terri Ct., 17400 block, 7:30 a.m. to 4:45 p.m. Jan. 12. Two handguns, a laptop computer, a video game system, games and jewelry were stolen from a residence entered by forcing a back door.

GAINESVILLE AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Mercury Ave., 7100 block, 12:01 a.m. Dec. 1 to 3 p.m. Jan. 7. An attempt was made to enter a residence through a window. Nothing was reported missing.

HAYMARKET AREA ASSAULTS

Malvern Hill Ct., 5800 block, 8:45 p.m. Jan. 15. A man attacked a juvenile female, then attacked a male acquaintance who intervened, knocking him to the ground. A 23-year-old Haymarket man was arrested. The male victim was treated for injuries.

MANASSAS AREA SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Buckhall area, 12:01 a.m. Jan. 11. A man attacked a female acquaintance. An 18-year-old Manassas man was charged with sexual assault of a juvenile.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Lyceum Lane, 5900 block, 7:45 a.m. to 3:20 p.m. Jan. 11. A video game system, a camera, jewelry and games were stolen from a residence entered by forcing a rear window.

Robertson Dr., 11400 block, 5 p.m. Jan. 11 to 7 a.m. Jan. 12. Copper piping was stolen from a business entered by forcing a rear door.

Sudley Rd., 8000 block, 7:21 a.m. Jan. 10. Clothes were stolen from a store. A 51-year-old man was arrested.

TRIANGLE AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Purdue Ct., 7500 block, 5:30 a.m. to 6 p.m. Jan. 13. A handgun was among property stolen from a residence.

Rosing Way, 18900 block, 6:56 p.m. Jan. 14. An attempt was made to break into a residence through the front door. A black truck was seen leaving the area at high speed.

Stagestone Way, 11100 block, 6:30 to 8:30 a.m. Jan. 13. A video game system and shoes were stolen from a residence entered by breaking glass in a front door.

WOODBRIDGE AREA ASSAULTS

Larry Ct., 5000 block, 7:21 p.m. Jan. 12. During an argument at a residence, a woman threatened a female acquaintance at knifepoint. A 27-year-old Woodbridge woman was arrested.

WEAPONS OFFENSES

Bayside and E. Longview avenues, 3:25 p.m. Jan. 10. After a vehicle had pulled to a stop, a male passenger got out and grabbed a pedestrian, and the male motorist fired a handgun. The male returned to the vehicle and sped away. No injuries were reported.

Prince William Pkwy. and Old Bridge Rd. 9:35 p.m. Jan. 10. A motorist followed a male motorist into a parking lot, got out and threatened him with a handgun. A 22-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

ROBBERIES

Foulgers Sq., 13600 block, 9 p.m. Jan. 11. Two men threatened a pedestrian in a parking lot and robbed him of a wallet.

Sandra Dr. and Basin St., 9:53 p.m. Jan. 13. A man robbed a pedestrian of cash and his cellphone at gunpoint.

Smoketown Dr., 14300 block, 9:35 p.m. Jan. 15. A motorist in a parking lot demanded a purse from a pedestrian, who resisted. During a struggle, the motorist struck her several times, took the purse and drove away. A 34-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested. No serious injuries were reported.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Brahms Dr., 3300 block, 6:42 a.m. to 3:40 p.m. Jan. 11. A TV, laptop computer, DVD player and other electronics were stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked door.

Build America Dr., 14800 block, 6:16 a.m. Jan. 14. An attempt was made to enter a business by damaging a front door.

Dale Blvd., 4100 block, 5 p.m. Jan. 9 to 6:30 a.m. Jan. 10. Cash was stolen from a restaurant entered by breaking a front window.

Del Mar Dr., 3800 block, Jan. 9 to 6 p.m. Jan. 12. Copper piping was stolen from a vacant residence entered by forcing a back door.

Eisenhower Cir., 1300 block, 10 a.m. Jan. 11 to 1:30 p.m. Jan. 12. A vacant residence was entered by forcing the front door. The premises were damaged; nothing was reported missing.

Farm Creek Dr., 14800 block, 5 p.m. Jan. 12 to 6:10 a.m. Jan. 13. Cash was stolen from a restaurant entered by breaking a window.

Jefferson Davis Hwy., 13900 block, 8:32 a.m. Jan. 15. An attempt was made to enter a business by breaking a front window. Nothing was reported missing.

Jefferson Davis Hwy., 14300 block, 1:06 a.m. Jan. 12. A grocery store was entered by forcing a front door. Nothing was reported missing.

Jefferson Davis Hwy., 14500 block, 9:20 p.m. Jan. 13 to 6:30 a.m. Jan. 14. Cash was stolen from a restaurant entered by breaking glass in a front door.

Jefferson Davis Hwy., 14500 block, 9 p.m. Jan. 15 to 7 a.m. Jan. 16. Cash was stolen from a business entered by breaking glass in the front door of an adjoining business.

Jefferson Davis Hwy., 14600 block, 2 to 7:20 a.m. Jan. 16. Cash and a laptop computer were stolen from a business entered by breaking glass in a front door.

Jefferson Davis Hwy., 14800 block, 5:50 to 6:30 a.m. Jan. 14. Cash was among property stolen from a business entered by breaking a window.

Kenilworth Ct., 16000 block, noon. Jan. 15 to 10 a.m. Jan. 16. A vacant residence was entered by breaking a rear window. Nothing was reported missing.

Minnieville Rd., 13300 block, 7:15 p.m. Jan. 12. A Bobcat construction vehicle was stolen from university property. It was recovered a short time later. A 39-year-old Manassas man was arrested.

Morrison Ct., 14100 block, 4:30 to 7:38 p.m. Jan. 15. An attempt was made to enter a residence by forcing a back door. Nothing was reported missing.

Tacketts Mill Rd., 2200 block, 10 p.m. Jan. 10 to 7:25 a.m. Jan. 11. Cash was stolen from a restaurant entered by breaking a side window.

Wetherburn Ct., 2900 block, 10 a.m. Oct. 15 to 11:27 a.m. Jan. 13. A residence was entered by forcing a back door. The premises were damaged, but nothing was reported missing.

William & Mary Cir., 12000 block, 5 p.m. Jan. 11 to 12:30 p.m. Jan. 13. An attempt was made to enter a residence by forcing the front door. Nothing was reported missing.

Manassas

These were among incidents reported by Manassas police. For information, call 703-257-8000.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Ballantrae St., 8500 block, 9 a.m. to 5:30 p.m. Jan. 17. Cash and jewelry were stolen from a residence entered through a rear window.

Prescott Ave., 9200 block, 10:30 a.m. Jan. 9. Jewelry was stolen from a store. A man was seen fleeing with the property.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Deblanc Pl., 8700 block, 3 p.m. Jan. 12 to 11:30 a.m. Jan. 13. A 2005 Scion XA was stolen.

Manassas Park

No reports were received from Manassas Park police for this edition of Local Living. For information, call 703-361-1136.

- Compiled by Sarah Lane

Prince William County crime report


SECTION: METRO; Pg. T20


LENGTH: 759 words


Prince William County

These were among incidents reported recently by Prince William County police. For information, call 703-792-7245.

BRISTOW AREA

ROBBERIES

Braemar Village Plaza, 12800 block, 11:56 p.m. June 1. A male robbed a male juvenile acquaintance of cash and fled.

DUMFRIES AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Cardinal Dr., 15000 block, midnight to 5:55 a.m. May 31. Cash was stolen from a business entered by forcing a rear door. 

Purvis Dr., 18000 block, 8 to 9 p.m. June 1. A video game system and games were stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked rear door.

Stone Mountain Ct., 4300 block, 12:30 p.m. May 31. Two males attempted to enter a residence through a front door.

MANASSAS AREA

ASSAULTS

Newton Pl., 8600 block, 3:15 p.m. June 1. A man hit a male juvenile relative in the face. A female relative was aware of the incident and failed to report it. Two 27-year-old Manassas residents, a man and a woman, were arrested and charged with cruelty and injury to a child.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Buttercup Pl., 10800 block, May 31 to June 3. Jewelry was stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked front door.

Centreville Rd., 7300 block, 6 p.m. May 30 to 8 a.m. May 31. Vehicle rims were stolen from a business entered through an unlocked side door.

Coverstone Dr., 10900 block, 8:45 a.m. to 3 p.m. May 30. A video game system and games were stolen from a residence entered by breaking a window.

Coverstone Dr., 10900 block, 8:20 a.m. to 3:21 p.m. A computer, two TVs and jewelry were stolen from a residence entered by forcing a window.

Etheridge Lane, 6300 block, 8 a.m. to 2 p.m. June 1. Cash and a laptop computer were stolen from a residence entered by forcing a door.

TRIANGLE AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Barnette Cir., 18900 block, 4 to 8:30 p.m. June 1. A safe and other items were stolen from a residence entered through an open basement window.

WOODBRIDGE AREA

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Quade Lane, June 5. A man sexually assaulted a female juvenile. An 18-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

ASSAULTS

Foulger Sq., 13800 block, 9:36 p.m. May 30. During an argument, a man hit a male acquaintance several times with a baseball bat. The acquaintance was treated for injuries. A 31-year-old man was arrested.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Allspice Ct., 12000 block, 9:38 p.m. June 1. A man attempted to enter a residence through a front door.

Andorra Dr., 13800 block, 5:15 a.m. to 4:40 p.m. June 4. Someone entered a residence by forcing a rear window. Nothing was reported stolen.

Cavalier Dr., 12000 block, 8 a.m. May 22 to 6 p.m. May 24. A bike was stolen from a residence entered through an open garage door.

Dundee Ct., 14500 block, 10 a.m. to 4 p.m. May 29. Jewelry and other items were stolen from a residence.

Earlham Ct., 14600 block, 9:05 to 9:45 a.m. May 31. Cash was stolen from a residence entered by breaking a rear door.

Neddleton Ave., 5500 block, 11:30 a.m. to 2:11 p.m. May 30. A handgun, two laptop computers and a video game system were stolen from a residence entered by forcing a rear basement door.

Stockholm Way, 3000 block, 3:30 to 8:30 p.m. May 27. A laptop computer, a camera and jewelry were stolen from a residence.

Tuckahoe Ct., 3400 block, noon June 2 to 3 p.m. June 3. Someone entered a vacant residence by breaking a window. Nothing was reported stolen.

Vestal St., 600 block, 1:13 p.m. June 5. Someone entered a residence, then fled empty-handed through a rear door as a resident approached.

Manassas

The following incidents were recently reported by Manassas police. For information, call 703-257-8000.

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Hood Rd. and Calypso Dr. area, 7:20 p.m. May 18. A man had inappropriate relations with a male juvenile. A 27-year-old Manassas man was arrested.

ASSAULTS

Taney Rd., 9400 block, 7:30 p.m. May 31. A man assaulted a female relative and held her against her will. The woman was treated for injuries. A 39-year-old Manassas man was arrested.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Jackson Ave., 8700 block, 7 a.m. to 11:30 p.m. May 29. Someone entered a residence through a rear basement door. Nothing was reported stolen.

Weems Rd., 9000 block, May 26 to May 28. A laptop computer, a backpack and other items were stolen from a vehicle.

Manassas Park

The following incidents were recently reported by Manassas Park police. For information, call 703-361-1136.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Centreville Rd., 8500 block, 2:12 a.m. May 25. A man in a convenience store drank from a gallon of milk and left without paying. A 44-year-old Midland man was arrested.

VANDALISM

Manassas Dr., 9300 block, 6:30 a.m. June 1 to 9:45 a.m. June 3. A vehicle in a parking lot was damaged.

477 of 507 DOCUMENTS




The Washington Post


July 22, 2010 Thursday  
Every Edition


Crime Report


SECTION: EXTRAS; Pg. PW18


LENGTH: 726 words


Prince William

The following incidents were reported by Prince William County police. For information, call 703-792-7245.

Bristow area

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

RUSTIC BREEZE CT., 9300 block, 4:49 p.m. July 8. Someone attempted to enter a residence through a basement door.

Dale City area

ASSAULTS

KURTZ AND DELANEY ROADS, 1:15 a.m. July 10. A large group of people left a residence as a man was walking toward them to attend a party. The man turned to return to his vehicle and heard a bang, then felt pain in his right leg. He drove himself to a hospital, where he was treated for a gunshot wound. 

Gainesville area

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

ROXBOROUGH LOOP, 8200 block, 1 to 3 p.m. July 5. Electronics and other property were stolen from a residence entered through an open garage door.

Lake Ridge area

SEXUAL ASSAULTS 

NEXUS CT., 7:30 p.m. June 30. Three male juveniles allegedly forced a female juvenile acquaintance into a residence and raped her. Three Woodbridge males, two 16-year-olds and a 14-year-old, were arrested.

Manassas area

ASSAULTS

JARVIS CT., 7600 block, 12:09 p.m. July 7. A male juvenile allegedly assaulted two relatives, cutting one on the chin with a knife. A 15-year-old Manassas boy was arrested.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

DUMFRIES RD. AND INDEPENDENT HILL DR., June 3. During an investigation after a traffic stop, officers found three counterfeit $100 bills inside a vehicle. The driver allegedly identified the man who gave the bills to him. A 30-year-old Bealeton man was arrested and charged with driving under the influence, possession of a fictitious employment authorization card and possession of fictitious bank notes. The arresting officer contacted the Secret Service, which said the serial numbers from the bills were linked to 125 other cases that the agency was working on. A search warrant was served at a residence at the 9100 block of Mineola Court in Manassas. Fifty-nine counterfeit $100 bills with the same serial number were allegedly found inside the residence. A 39-year-old Manassas man was arrested and charged with possession of fictitious bank notes, passing of fictitious bank notes and violations relating to driving under the influence.

Triangle area

ROBBERIES

FULLER HEIGHTS RD., 18700 block, 11:44 p.m. July 11. A man outside a convenience store allegedly demanded money from a male juvenile, who refused. The man followed the juvenile, who turned around to confront him. When the man reached for his waistband, the juvenile sprayed him with pepper. A 50-year-old man was arrested.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

GRAHAM PARK RD., 3500 block, 2 to 4:45 p.m. July 12. Two computers were stolen from a residence entered by tampering with a front door.

Woodbridge area

ASSAULTS

GIDEON DR., 14600 block, 1:27 a.m. July 11. A man at a homeless camp allegedly assaulted a male acquaintance, who was treated for injuries. A 42-year-old man was arrested.

POWELL DR., 2800 block, 12:06 a.m. July 11. Three men assaulted a male resident while he was in his back yard. The resident was treated for injuries.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

ARMSTEAD ST., 13000 block, 1:59 a.m. July 10. Someone entered a residence through a side door. A resident woke up and chased the intruder out of the residence. The intruder fled empty-handed in a gray car.

FAIRHOPE RD., 3800 block, 7 to 10 p.m. July 7. Three juveniles allegedly stole property from a residence. The items were recovered.

HYLTON AVE., 1600 block, 2:30 a.m. to 5 p.m. July 10. Electronics were stolen from a residence entered through a basement door.

Manassas

The following incident was reported by Manassas police. For information, call 703-257-8000.

KIDNAPPINGS

KERSHAW CT., 9100 block, July 12. A man allegedly forced a female acquaintance into a vehicle, drove to his residence, assaulted the woman and held her against her will. A 27-year-old Manassas man was arrested.

Manassas Park

The following incidents were reported by Manassas Park police. For information, call 703-361-1136.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

CENTREVILLE RD., 8500 block, 10:56 a.m. July 11. Tools were stolen from a vehicle.

HOLDEN DR., 100 block, 6 p.m. July 9 to 5 p.m. July 10. A pink and purple Mongoose bike was stolen.

MANASSAS AND KENT DRIVES, 10:54 p.m. July 3. A man allegedly stole cheesecakes. A 51-year-old man was arrested.

WALDEN ST., 100 block, July 2 to July 11. A video game system and games were stolen from a residence.

-- Compiled by Sarah Lane

WEAPON OFFENSES

Interstate 66 and Fairfax County Pkwy., 2:05 p.m. March 18. A police officer stopped a vehicle and saw that the driver was wearing a false police badge. The driver possessed other fraudulent law enforcement credentials, a stun gun and a firearm. A Manassas man, 32, was arrested and charged with impersonating a law enforcement officer, possession of fictitious identifications, possession of a firearm by a felon and possession of a stun gun by a felon.

Fairfax City

These were among incidents reported by the Fairfax City Police Department. For information, call 703-385-7809.

ASSAULTS

First St., 10800 block, 3:22 p.m. March 11. During an altercation at a church, a man struck a male. The man fled in a vehicle but was later apprehended when he returned to the church. A 57-year-old man was arrested in connection with assault. The male was treated for injuries at a medical facility.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Fairfax Blvd., 10400 block, 5:56 p.m. March 15. An unattended iPad was stolen at a used car dealership. A 27-year-old Burke man, an employee of the dealership, was arrested in connection with grand larceny.

Fairfax Blvd., 10600 block, 3:45 p.m. March 14. A male attempted to purchase a vehicle online with two fraudulent credit card transactions and had it shipped to Florida. The manager at a local car dealership reported the fraud.

Fairfax Blvd., 10800 block, 8 p.m. to 6 a.m. March 11. A refrigerant line was damaged during an attempt to remove copper pipe from a school. Earlier in February, three copper downspouts were stolen from the school.

Fairfax Sq., 3800 block, 5:09 a.m. An intoxicated man attempted to enter an apartment. A 21-year-old man from the same apartment complex was arrested for unlawful entry and public drunkenness.

Old Lee Hwy., 3200 block, 1:30 p.m. March 15. Prescription medication drugs were stolen from an unattended purse in the restroom of a counseling center.

Sager Ave., 10300 block, 6:31 p.m. March 18. A backpack containing rock-climbing equipment was stolen from an unlocked parked vehicle.

Vanderbilt Ct., 4100 block, midnight to 11:15 a.m. March 18. Two skateboards, a helmet and a winter jacket were stolen from a parked vehicle.

VANDALISM

Copper Lane, 3700 block, 12:30 to 2:15 p.m. March 12. A rear window of a vehicle was smashed.

Lyndhurst Dr., March 8 to March 15. Paint was scratched on a parked vehicle.

Falls Church

These were among incidents reported by the Falls Church Police Department. For information, call 703-248-5056.

ASSAULTS

Meridian St., 500 block, March 15. A 22-year-old man was arrested for assaulting a family member.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

W. Broad St., 100 block, March 11. Batteries were reported stolen from a public messaging board.

N. Maple Ave., 400 block, March 15. An 18-year-old man was arrested for habitual petit larceny and trespassing.

These were among incidents reported by the Herndon Police Department. For information, call 703-435-6846.

ASSAULTS

Bond St., 1200 block, 3:39 p.m. March 10. A simple assault was reported.

Elden St., 1000 block, 3:34 a.m. March 10. A simple assault was reported.

ROBBERIES

Wintrol Ct., 1100 block, 6:21 p.m. March 11. A robbery was reported.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Birch St., 700 block, 1:24 p.m. March 15. A fraud was reported.

Elden St., 100 block, 12:37 p.m. March 15. Shoplifting was reported.

Elden St., 400 block, 6:04 p.m. March 15. A credit card/ATM fraud was reported.

Ferndale Ave., 800 block, 12:41 p.m. March 12. A fraud was reported.

These were among incidents reported by the Vienna Police Department. For information, call 703-255-6396.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Beulah Rd. NE, 500 block, 6 p.m. March 18 to 6 a.m. March 19. Copper downspouts were stolen from the exterior of a church.

Cedar Lane SE, 200 block, 4:34 p.m. March 19. A resident reported that she received a call from someone who said that if she did not come up with money, her son would be harmed. She called her son, who assured her that he wasn't in danger.

Elmar Dr. SE, 100 block, 6:15 p.m. March 14. An IRS fraud was reported.

Moore Ave. SE, 200 block, noon March 6 to 4 p.m. March 12. A bike was reported stolen from a residential garage.

Walker St. SW, 5:09 p.m. March 19. A fraud was reported.

Crime Report


SECTION: EXTRAS; Pg. PW30


LENGTH: 897 words


Prince William

The following incidents were reported by Prince William County police. For information, call 703-792-7245.

Dale City area

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

MAPLEDALE AVE., 14100 block, 12:17 p.m. Sept. 7. Cash and electronics were stolen from a residence.

Dumfries area

INDECENT EXPOSURE

NAPLES AND PLEASANT LANES, 5:23 p.m. Sept. 13. A man in a vehicle was exposing himself when a female pedestrian walked by. When he saw the woman, the man drove away.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

HOPKINS DR., 4700 block, 12:30 to 3 p.m. Sept. 6. A bike and other property were stolen from a residence entered through an open garage door. 

VISTA DR., 15700 block, 9 a.m. to 1 p.m. Sept. 11. Electronics were stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked rear door.

Gainesville area

SEXUAL ASSAULTS 

LYNN FOREST DR., June and July. A man allegedly sexually assaulted a female juvenile acquaintance. A 19-year-old Gainesville man was arrested.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

MANAHOAC PL., 6900 block, Aug. 1 to 31. A TV, furniture and tools were stolen from a residence.

Manassas area

WEAPONS

MICHELLE CT., 7600 block, Sept. 9. Someone fired a gun at a residence, breaking a front living room window.

ROBBERIES

BALLS FORD RD., 11100 block, 6:14 p.m. Sept. 13. A man was forced down to the pavement in a convenience store parking lot and robbed of cash after being approached by three men armed with a machete.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

COMMUNITY DR., 8100 block, 8:30 a.m. to 2 p.m. Sept. 13. Jewelry was stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked rear door.

GAMBRIL DR., 10800 block, 3:31 a.m. Sept. 15. Someone attempted to enter a residence through a side bedroom window, then fled when a dog barked.

GOLDEN OAK DR., 8800 block, 12:45 to 6 p.m. Sept. 12. Documents were stolen from a residence entered through a front door.

MILTON HALL PL., 15400 block, 1:50 a.m. Sept. 11. A sword was stolen from a residence.

PINEVIEW RD., 10600 block, 8:45 a.m. to 10:10 p.m. Sept. 7. Property was stolen from a residence entered by prying open a rear window.

WOODBURY DR., 10100 block, 5:34 p.m. Sept. 12. Cash and a laptop computer were stolen from a residence.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

SUDLEY RD., 8000 block, 9:50 a.m. Sept. 10. A man in a parking lot allegedly demanded car keys from a woman, then drove away in her red 2005 Toyota Camry. A 32-year-old man was arrested.

Nokesville area

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

OLD CHURCH RD., 12400 block, 6:30 a.m. to 5:30 p.m. Sept. 13. Tools were stolen from a shed at a residence.

OLD CHURCH RD., 12400 block, 6:30 a.m. to 5:30 p.m. Sept. 14. Someone entered a residence through a front door. Nothing was reported stolen.

Triangle area

ROBBERIES

JURGENSEN DR., 3600 block, 10:24 p.m. Sept. 13. A gunman demanded money from a man, who attempted to grab the gun. The gunman fled empty-handed. No injuries were reported.

Woodbridge area

WEAPONS

HORNER RD. AND GARFIELD PL., 5:48 p.m. Sept. 7. During a traffic altercation, two males got out of their vehicles. A man who had been driving a Lincoln Town Car pulled out a handgun and pointed it at the other motorist, who fled in his vehicle. No injuries were reported.

ROBBERIES

GIBSON CT., 4200 block, 4:46 p.m. Sept. 9. Two men who were driven to a residence by a female acquaintance allegedly robbed the woman of her purse at knifepoint, then fled. A 21-year-old Dale City man was arrested.

POTOMAC MILLS RD., 14100 block, 9:47 p.m. Sept. 12. A man assaulted a male pedestrian and demanded the bag he was carrying. The assailant fled empty-handed. The pedestrian was treated for injuries.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

ALASKA RD., 14900 block, 12:20 p.m. Sept. 14. Someone attempted to enter a residence by removing a screen from a window and breaking a rear basement window.

ARBOR CT., 3000 block, Sept. 11 to 12. Tools were stolen from a shed at a residence.

CORINTHIA CT., 11400 block, 10:50 to 11:10 p.m. Sept. 10. Someone attempted to enter a residence through a front door.

ESSEX DR., 14100 block, 3:19 a.m. Sept. 10. Someone attempted to enter a residence by removing a screen from a window.

HUNTERBROOK DR., 12700 block, 10 to 11:15 a.m. Sept. 9. Electronics were stolen from a residence entered by breaking a rear sliding-glass door.

KRAMER ESTATE DR., 16300 block, 7 a.m. to 9 p.m. Sept. 11. A recreation center was entered by breaking off a door handle. Nothing was reported stolen.

OLD LANDING WAY, 2100 block, 2 to 2:20 a.m. Sept. 11. Someone attempted to enter a residence through a rear sliding-glass door.

VANDALISM

BENITA FITZGERALD DR., 15500 block, 2:30 to 6:25 p.m. Sept. 9. Someone broke a window pane of a door at a school.

Manassas

The following incidents were reported by Manassas police. For information, call 703-257-8000.

ROBBERIES

BYRD DR., 9200 block, 8 to 9 p.m. Sept 8. Three males demanded money from a male pedestrian, who refused. One of the males hit the pedestrian in the face. The three took cash from his pockets and fled.

BYRD DR. AND TANEY RD., 8 to 9 p.m. Sept. 8. Three males knocked a male pedestrian to the ground, kicked him and took a wallet from his pocket.

Manassas Park

The following incidents were reported by Manassas Park police. For information, call 703-361-1136.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

PARK CENTER CT., 8400 block, 4:23 p.m. Sept. 7. A stereo, a subwoofer and two amplifiers were stolen from a vehicle entered by breaking a window.

VANDALISM

MATTHEWS DR., 9200 block, 12:01 to 12:57 a.m. Sept. 8. A sidewalk light was broken.

The Washington Post


July 15, 2007 Sunday
