Crime Report


SECTION: EXTRAS; Pg. 13


LENGTH: 1054 words


Calvert County 

These were among reports received recently by the Calvert County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. Anyone with information about these crimes should call the Criminal Investigation Division, 410-535-2800 or 301-855-1194, or the Crime Solvers line, 410-535-2880. You can also call the Prince Frederick Barrack of the state police at 410-535-1400.

Lusby Area

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

ROUSBY HALL RD., July 5. A go-kart and an all-terrain vehicle were stolen from a residence. 

North Beach Area

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

ERIE AVE., July 4. A wallet and two cell phones were taken from an unlocked vehicle.

Owings Area

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

LOWER MARLBORO RD., 1 p.m. July 7. A five-gallon gas can filled with gas was stolen from a garage.

Port Republic Area

AUTO THEFTS

PARKERS CREEK RD., 8 p.m. July 4. A motorcycle stopped by police was determined to be stolen. A man, 22, was arrested and charged with motor vehicle theft and driving with a suspended license.

Solomons Area

DISORDERLY CONDUCT

SOLOMONS ISLAND RD., 14000 block, 7:30 p.m. July 4. A man, 46, with injuries to his knees and face was found on the ground next to a sidewalk. Police also smelled alcohol and called for an ambulance. While waiting for it to arrive, the man became disorderly. He was charged with disorderly conduct. After treatment at Calvert Memorial Hospital, he was taken to jail.

Charles County 

The following are among reports received recently by the Charles County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. For further information, call 301-932-2222 or 301-870-3232. Crime Solvers will pay a reward for information leading to an arrest and an indictment in connection with these and other crimes. Call the 24-hour hotline at 866-411-8477. Callers may remain anonymous. The Charles County Sheriff's Office Web site is: http://www.ccso.us. Included at the site are daily news releases, Crime Watch neighborhood statistics, community services, crime prevention programs and career opportunities.

Bryans Road Area

AUTO THEFTS

LIVINGSTON RD., 3000 block, 3:05 a.m. July 10. Officers looking for a stolen vehicle stopped a motorist. The vehicle was determined to be stolen, and further investigation revealed that the driver also was involved in the theft of another vehicle a few hours earlier. A male juvenile, 16, was charged with auto theft and was being held at Cheltenham Youth Facility.

Waldorf Area

HOMICIDES

LEONARDTOWN RD., 3700 block, July 6. A man, 21, was arrested for the shooting death of a girl, 13, on June 29. He was charged with first- and second-degree murder.

ASSAULTS

SILVER SPUR PLACE at ENTERPRISE PLACE, 11:15 p.m. July 8. Six male suspects approached a man who was walking, punched him in the face, knocked him down and attempted to rob him before fleeing.

ARMED ROBBERIES

LEONARDTOWN RD., 3400 block, 9:54 a.m. July 9. A man approached the manager of Pizza Hut as he was getting into his car with the restaurant's bank deposits. The man demanded the money and struck the manager with a metal pipe. The suspect fled with the money.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

CRAIN HWY., 4400 block, 2 a.m. July 7. Three male juveniles were arrested in connection with a break-in and thefts at Mattingly Construction in Waldorf and White Plains Auto Sales, and an attempted break-in at Atlantic Cycle in White Plains. A dump truck and a pickup truck were taken from Mattingly, and a car was taken from White Plains Auto Sales. All three vehicles were recovered, along with a tow truck stolen in Prince George's County. The three juveniles were charged with burglary and auto theft and were being held at Cheltenham Youth Facility. Authorities are seeking up to six additional suspects.

DESTRUCTION OF PROPERTY

GLADDINGS CT., 2100 block, 8:30 p.m. July 4. A smoke bomb was thrown into an unoccupied parked car, causing a fire that damaged the interior.

ST. GEORGE'S DR., 12100 block, July 3 to 5. The windows of construction vehicles were shattered.

DISORDERLY CONDUCT

CRAIN HWY., 2700 block, 12:49 a.m. July 6. Officers observed a group of 20 to 30 people fighting in the parking lot of a restaurant. Six males -- ages 18 and 19 and a juvenile -- were charged with disorderly conduct.

St. Mary's County 

The following are among reports received recently by the St. Mary's County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. For further information, call 301-475-8008, or the Crime Solvers line, 301-475-3333. The Leonardtown Barrack of the Maryland State Police operates a 24-hour crime tip line on which people may anonymously report information about crimes and related matters at 301-475-2936.

Avenue Area

ASSAULTS

AVENUE AREA, 10:41 p.m. July 7. A woman was assaulted at a residence. A man, 47, was charged with domestic assault.

California Area

ASSAULTS

CALIFORNIA, July 9. A woman was assaulted in the parking lot of a business. A man, 46, was arrested. He spit in the face of a deputy during the arrest. He was charged with two counts of second-degree assault and destruction of property.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

THREE NOTCH RD., 12:36 a.m. July 7. A CD player was stolen from a vehicle.

Great Mills Area

SEXUAL ASSAULTS 

GREAT MILLS, 6:45 a.m. July 8. A man, 41, was arrested for having inappropriate contact with an underage child and having child pornography on his computer.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

SCHWARTZKOPF DR., 10:41 a.m. July 7. Two video game consoles were stolen from a residence.

Hollywood Area

ARMED ROBBERIES

THREE NOTCH RD., 5:30 p.m. July 11. An armed man entered St. John's Pharmacy and demanded money and prescription drugs. The man fled with an undisclosed amount of money and drugs.

Leonardtown Area

DESTRUCTION OF PROPERTY

LEONARD HALL DR., 7:50 a.m. July 10. Hydraulic lines on drilling equipment were cut. A man, 26, was arrested.

Lexington Park Area

DESTRUCTION OF PROPERTY

MIDWAY DR., 8:56 a.m. July 2. The windows of a construction trailer were broken.

Loveville Area

ASSAULTS

POINT LOOKOUT RD., 8:13 p.m. July 9. A man was assaulted. Another man, 38, was arrested and charged with second-degree assault, possession of marijuana and driving under the influence.

Mechanicsville Area

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

MECHANICSVILLE, July 6. A woman, 42, forced her way into a residence while she was intoxicated. She was charged with fourth-degree burglary and trespassing. She had been removed from the residence earlier that day.

-- Compiled by BONNIE SMITH

Anne Arundel County and Howard County crime report Anne Arundel County and Howard County crime report


SECTION: METRO; Pg. T22


LENGTH: 1927 words


Anne Arundel

These were among incidents reported by Anne Arundel County police. For information, call 410-222-8050.

ANNAPOLIS AREA

ROBBERIES

Defense Hwy., 100 block, 1:55 a.m. Nov. 10. A man robbed a convenience store of cash at gunpoint.

BROOKLYN PARK AREA

ASSAULTS

Ritchie Hwy., 6000 block, 12:30 p.m. Nov. 12. During an argument in a wooded area, a man dragged a female acquaintance through a bonfire. She was taken to a hospital, where she was reported to be in stable condition. A 29-year-old man of no fixed address was arrested on attempted murder and assault charges.

CROWNSVILLE AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Bacon Ridge Rd., 1200 block, Nov. 9. During the execution of a search-and-seizure warrant, police arrested two Crownsville men, ages 20 and 22, in connection with a Sept. 4 burglary in the 700 block of North Riverside Drive, Crownsville. A TV and a DVD player stolen during that incident were recovered, as was property traced to three other burglaries. Charges against the two men included burglary, theft, possession of an altered shotgun and possession of a firearm by a convicted felon.

EDGEWATER AREA

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Wakefield Rd., 1400 block, Nov. 14. An Edgewater man, 66, was arrested in connection with the sexual assaults of two juveniles from 2000 to 2008. 

GLEN BURNIE AREA

ROBBERIES

Marley and Glen Oak Avenues, 4:15 p.m. Nov. 14. Two male teenagers knocked down a pedestrian and fled with her purse. No serious injuries were reported.

Ritchie Hwy., 6800 block, 8:32 p.m. Nov. 12. Two males robbed a pedestrian of a wallet at gunpoint. During a struggle, the victim was slightly injured. He was taken to a hospital.

LAUREL AREA

ARSON

Barbersville Rd., 400 block, Nov. 10. A man using a Skype video transmission said that he was going to injure himself and others by detonating a bomb that he was constructing. Police traced the computer to a residence, where they confronted a man inside a shed. After explosives experts determined that the alleged bomb was a fake, a 24-year-old Laurel man was arrested on arson-threat and destructive-device charges.

ROBBERIES

Russett Green E., 3500 block, 4:17 a.m. Nov. 14. A male wearing a mask entered a store and robbed it of cash at gunpoint, then forced an employee to accompany him to the parking lot, where he shot him in the upper body. The victim, a 28-year-old man, was taken to a hospital for treatment of injuries that were not considered life-threatening.

LINTHICUM AREA

ASSAULTS

Fourth Ave. SW, 100 block, 7:15 p.m. Nov. 8. During an argument at a residence, a man was stabbed. He was taken to a local hospital for treatment of injuries that were not considered life-threatening. A 30-year-old Linthicum man was charged with first- and second-degree assault and reckless endangerment.

Annapolis

These were among incidents reported by the Annapolis Police Department. For information, call 410-268-9000.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Copeland St., 1900 block, 9:30 p.m. Oct. 31 to 6:30 a.m. Nov. 1. A bag containing a laptop computer, two watches, a camera and a monitor was stolen from an unlocked vehicle.

Forest Dr., 1700 block, 3:30 to 3:40 p.m. Nov. 4. A laptop computer was stolen from an unlocked vehicle.

Harwood Pl., 400 block, 11 p.m. Nov. 6 to 5:30 p.m. Nov. 8 Cash was stolen from a residence entered by forcing a back door.

Madison St., 1200 block, 11 a.m. to 8 p.m. Nov. 9. A video game system was stolen from a residence. A tile floor inside the home was damaged by an unidentified liquid.

Spa View Ave., 100 block, Nov. 14. Responding to a report of a group of people acting suspiciously near houses, police saw four juveniles running from the back of a residence, which had been entered through a door. The four were detained at the scene and charged with burglary.

First St., 300 block, 5:30 p.m. Nov. 13 to 6:30 a.m. Nov. 14. A bicycle was stolen from a back deck, where it had been locked with a cable lock.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Bank St., 900 block, Oct. 8 to Nov. 8. A red 1986 Porsche 911 was stolen.

Newtowne Dr., 700 block, 10 p.m. Nov. 10 to 8 a.m. Nov. 11. A blue 2000 Dodge Intrepid was stolen from a parking lot. It was recovered before it was reported stolen. An arrest was made.

Howard County

These were among incidents reported by the Howard County Police Department. For information, call 410-313-2236.

CLARKSVILLE AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Ballymore Lane, 6500 block, 2 to 6:30 a.m. Nov. 13. Cash and a wallet were stolen from a residence entered through a garage and an unlocked interior door.

Clarksville Pike, 12100 block, 9:36 p.m. Nov. 12 to 8:12 a.m. Nov. 13. Using a skid mover stolen from a church parking lot in the 12100 block of Linden-Linthicum Lane, a safe was stolen from a garden center entered by breaking glass in a front door. The safe, which was slightly damaged during an unsuccessful attempt to open it, was recovered in the 10700 block of Scaggsville Road. Two trucks at the garden center later were found to have been vandalized during the incident.

Linden Chapel Rd., 11800 block, 9:30 a.m. to 1:50 p.m. Nov. 13. Jewelry and a laptop computer were stolen from a residence entered by breaking a kitchen window.

COLUMBIA AREA

INDECENT EXPOSURE INCIDENTS

Snowden Square, 9000 block, 12:58 p.m. Nov. 4. Police responded to a report of a man performing a lewd act in a vehicle in a parking lot. A man was questioned at the scene.

ROBBERIES

Fair Oaks, 10400 block, 6:05 p.m. Nov. 14. Three males near a community mailbox robbed a man of his wallet at gunpoint.

Little Patuxent Pkwy., 10700 block, 8:27 p.m. Nov. 9. Two males armed with guns and wearing ski masks tied up two employees at a dry-cleaning business and robbed them of wallets and the business of cash. One of the wallets was recovered near Broken Land and Snowden River parkways.

Little Patuxent Pkwy., 10200 block, 9 a.m. Nov. 12. Two males threatened a pedestrian on a footbridge and robbed the victim of a cellphone and a wallet.

Monarch Mills Way, 7500 block, 5:43 p.m. Nov. 8. Two teenagers forced their way into an acquaintance's apartment and robbed him of two pairs of shoes at gunpoint. Two Columbia males, ages 16 and 17, were arrested on charges that included armed robbery, assault, use of a firearm in commission of a felony, burglary and theft.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Audubon Dr., 6200 block, 1:58 p.m. Nov. 12. Two juveniles entered a garage at a residence. When confronted by an occupant of a vehicle in the garage, they fled empty-handed. A short time later, two arrests were made.

Blade Green Lane, 8900 block, 9:30 a.m. to 8:20 p.m. Nov. 14. A residence was entered through a sliding-glass door. Nothing was reported missing.

Centre Park Dr., 8800 block, 12:07 a.m. Nov. 5. An attempt was made to enter a restaurant by smashing glass in a front door. Nothing was reported missing.

Daring Prince Way, 6300 block, 4:25 a.m. Nov. 9. An occupied residence was entered through an open garage. Two intruders carrying a flashlight fled empty-handed when confronted.

McGaw Rd., 8900 block, 3:34 a.m. Nov. 11. Ten spools of copper were stolen from an auto-repair shop entered by breaking a front window.

Old Annapolis Rd., 9100 block, 7:30 p.m. Nov. 13. A laptop computer, a tablet computer and cash were stolen from a nail salon entered by breaking a side window.

Swift Stream Pl., 10300 block, 1 a.m. to 6:50 p.m. Nov. 8. Jackets and shoes were stolen from one of two storage lockers entered by force.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Hickory Ridge Rd., 10200 block, 9:12 a.m. Nov. 14. A black 2008 Ford Taurus was stolen. It was recovered in a parking lot a short time later.

DAYTON AREA

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Ten Oaks Rd., 4100 block, 8:59 a.m. Nov. 14. A 2005 Ford F-350 truck was stolen.

ELKRIDGE AREA

ROBBERIES

Autumn Spell, 5900 block, 4:10 p.m. Nov. 13. Two males threatened a motorist they had approached in Baltimore, then forced him to drive them to his home in Elkridge. After robbing him of cash, they fled in the man's vehicle. The victim sustained a minor injury when he was struck in the eye during the incident.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Highland Ave., 6600 block, 6 a.m. to 5:45 p.m. Nov. 8. A residence was entered through the unlocked front door. Nothing was reported missing.

Water Oak Rd., 7100 block, 9:24 p.m. Nov. 11. An attempt was made to enter a residence by removing a screen from a window. Nothing was reported missing.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Rowanberry Dr., 5700 block, 1:36 a.m. Nov. 14. The ignition of a Jeep Cherokee was damaged during an attempted theft.

ELLICOTT CITY AREA

ROBBERIES

Town and Country Blvd., 8700 block, 12:40 a.m. Nov. 11. Two males wearing masks approached a female on the front steps of an apartment building and demanded property at knifepoint. When she refused and ran into the building, the assailants fled empty-handed. No injuries were reported.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Brian Ct., 2800 block, 11 p.m. Nov. 10 to 6 a.m. Nov. 11. Two global positioning system devices and a rechargeable drill were stolen from an open garage.

Stonehouse Dr., 8600 block, 2:30 to 2:40 p.m. Nov. 8. Cash was stolen from a box in a closet at a residence. An occupant of the home said that he was in the residence when the theft occurred.

Town and Country Blvd., 8700 block, 8:23 p.m. Nov. 11. A vacant apartment was entered through an unlocked sliding-glass door. Evidence of drug use was found, but nothing was reported missing.

FULTON AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Reservoir Rd., 8300 block, 5:30 p.m. Nov. 6 to 4:45 p.m. Nov. 8. A window was broken at a residence. Nothing was reported missing.

GLENELG AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Snow Chief Rd.,3500 block, 6:30 a.m. to 10:30 p.m. Nov. 13. An attempt was made to enter a residence by breaking glass in a back door. Nothing was reported missing.

JESSUP AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Twelve Sons Ct., 8900 block, 10:30 a.m. to 1:40 p.m. Nov. 13. An attempt was made to enter a residence by breaking glass in a door. Nothing was reported missing.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Assateague Dr., 7400 block, 4:13 p.m. Nov. 12. A trailer was stolen.

LAUREL AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Canterbury Riding, 9300 block, 9:50 p.m. Nov. 9. An attempt was made to enter a residence by forcing a sliding-glass door. Three people fled empty-handed when they were confronted.

Graeloch Rd., 10600 block, 10:03 p.m. Nov. 12. A residence was entered through an open garage and an unlocked back door. An occupant confronted the intruders, who fled empty-handed.

Light Moon Way, 8500 block, 11:10 p.m. Nov. 8 to 10 a.m. Nov. 10. A bicycle was stolen from an open garage.

Old Scaggsville Rd., 9200 block, 10:40 a.m. Nov. 12. An attempt was made to enter a residence by cutting window screens. An intruder fled empty-handed when confronted by an occupant.

Washington Blvd., 9900 block, 6 p.m. Nov. 3 to 8 a.m. Nov. 4. Two trailers were damaged during attempted break-ins. Nothing was reported missing.

Washington Blvd., 7300 block, 1:54 a.m. Nov. 14. Police responding to an alarm at an electronics company made a traffic stop of a vehicle driving away from the scene. Several spools of copper and communications wire were found in the vehicle. Two Camp Springs men, ages 20 and 25, were charged with several counts of burglary and theft, and with malicious destruction of property.

Woodsong Ct., 9400 block, 2:20 to 6 p.m. Nov. 12. A video game console was stolen from a residence. There was no sign of forced entry.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Bridle Path Lane, 9200 block, 9:59 a.m. Nov. 14. A 2004 Acura was stolen.

Scaggsville Rd., 10500 block, 12:21 a.m. Nov. 14. A motorcycle was stolen from a garage.

WEST FRIENDSHIP AREA

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Old Frederick Rd. and Route 32, 1:46 p.m. Nov. 13. A white Ford F-350 pickup was stolen from a commuter parking lot.

The Washington Post


November 3, 2002 Sunday  
Final Edition


Charles County Crime Report


SECTION: SOUTHERN MARYLAND EXTRA; Pg. T27


LENGTH: 549 words


The following are among reports received recently by the Charles County sheriff's office and the Maryland State Police. For more information, call 301-932-2222 or 301-870-3232.

The Charles County sheriff's office will pay a reward for information leading to an arrest and an indictment in connection with these and any other felony crimes. Call the 24-hour hotline at 800-673-2777. Callers may remain anonymous.  

The Charles County sheriff's office Web site is at www.ccso.us. Included at the site are daily news releases, Crime Watch neighborhood statistics, community services, crime prevention programs and career opportunities.

HOMICIDES

BOOTH PLACE, 8:15 a.m. Oct. 29. A man, 55, shot another man, 32, and his 26-month-old son while they were driving in a vehicle. The father lost control of the vehicle, and it hit a tree. The man was flown to Washington Hospital Center, with a critical gunshot wound in the head. The child was flown to Children's Hospital and died at 11:20 a.m. Oct. 30. The 55-year-old man was charged with one count of first-degree murder and one count of attempted murder.

VEHICLE THEFTS

HEATHER LANE, 11:50 p.m. Oct. 27 to 6 a.m. Oct. 28. A 1997 Suzuki Katana 600 motorcycle was stolen from the back yard of a residence.

ARSON

HAYDEN FLICK PLACE, 8:04 a.m. Aug. 28. A 1972 Chevrolet truck was set on fire.

ARSON

HIGH MOUNTAIN FARM RD., 3:15 a.m. Oct. 24. A 1994 Acura was sent on fire.

SEXUAL OFFENSE

PORPOISE CT., 6400 block, 6:10 p.m. Oct. 23. A man, 35, sexually assaulted a boy, 11. He was charged with second-degree sex offense, two counts of child abuse and child pornography.

ASSAULTS

CRAIN HWY., 2200 block, 12:05 a.m. Oct. 26. A man, 44, assaulted a police officer. He was charged with second-degree assault and disorderly conduct.

HEATHCOTE RD., 2:45 a.m. Oct. 14. A man, 18, stabbed another man, 23, during a fight. The victim's injuries were not life-threatening. The 18-year-old was charged with first- and second-degree assault.

HUNTING CIR., 5:34 p.m. Oct. 21. Two girls, 17, assaulted two others, 16 and 18, with a bottle and a knife. The 17-year-olds were charged with first- and second-degree assault and possession of a deadly weapon with intent to injure.

ROBBERIES

CRAIN HWY., 2300 block, 10:20 p.m. Oct. 27. Two suspects attempted to rob the Bob Evans restaurant at gunpoint. One of the suspects approached employees in the parking lot as they were leaving, demanded money and ordered the employees back into the restaurant. The intrusion alarm was activated and the suspects fled the scene.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

WALDORF, Oct. 30. A man, 32, stole a credit card and driver's license from another man, 24. He used the credit card at more than 15 locations in St. Mary's and Charles counties. He was charged with multiple counts of identity theft, theft of more than $ 500, a theft scheme over $ 500, credit card misuse and receiving stolen property.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

PARK AVE., 4100 block, midnight to 4:30 a.m. Oct. 18. A residence was entered through a back window. A can of brown paint was splashed on the walls and carpet. The kitchen counter and cabinets were ripped out of the wall.

SOUTHWINDS DR., 5:15 p.m. Oct. 24 to 6:30 a.m. Oct. 25. Two duffle bags filled with tools were stolen from a trailer at a construction site.

-- Bonnie Smith


LOAD-DATE: November 3, 2002


LANGUAGE: ENGLISH


DOCUMENT-TYPE: LIST


PUBLICATION-TYPE: Newspaper

Prince William County crime report


SECTION: Metro; Pg. T20


LENGTH: 709 words


Prince William County

These were among incidents reported by Prince William County police. For information, call 703-792-7245.

DUMFRIES AREA ASSAULTS

Whitings Brigade Dr., 3000 block, 10 p.m. April 25. During an argument at a residence, a man armed with a kitchen knife prevented a female acquaintance from leaving. A Dumfries man, 31, was arrested.

WEAPONS  

Jefferson Davis Hwy. and Yost Lane, 10:20 p.m. April 23. Several gunshots were heard. An exterior wall and an interior wall of an apartment were hit. No one was reported injured.

Pointe Center Ct., 3600 block, 6 p.m. April 24 to 8:50 a.m. April 27. Someone fired a weapon, breaking an exterior window of a business. No one was reported injured.

Shell Cast Loop, 17100 block, 10:22 p.m. April 23. Several gunshots were heard. An exterior wall and an interior wall of an apartment were hit. No one was reported injured.

MANASSAS AREA SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Esteppe Dr. area, 11:05 p.m. April 26. During an argument, a man sexually assaulted a female acquaintance. A Manassas man, 60, was arrested.

ASSAULTS

Camfield Ct., 11000 block, 9:08 a.m. April 26. After an argument earlier in the day, a man knocked on a female acquaintance's front door and identified himself as a police officer. When the woman answered, the man assaulted her. A Manassas man, 25, was arrested.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Damascus Dr., 9700 block, 7:45 a.m. to 10 p.m. April 23. Cash, prescription medicine and electronics were stolen from a residence entered through a side door.

Rainwater Cir., 8100 block, 10:37 p.m. April 25. An attempt was made to enter a residence by damaging a front door.

WOODBRIDGE AREA SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Bakersfield St. area, April 24 to 28. A man sexually assaulted a male juvenile acquaintance. A Woodbridge man, 51, was arrested.

ASSAULTS

Bayside Ave., 1400 block, 2:24 a.m. April 30. During an argument, a woman stabbed a male acquaintance in the abdomen with a kitchen knife. A Woodbridge woman, 32, was arrested.

Bronson Ct., 3300 block, 8:53 p.m. April 25. During an argument, a man assaulted a female acquaintance. A Woodbridge man, 34, was arrested.

Fireside Ct., 13200 block, 9:20 a.m. April 28. Two men entered a male acquaintance's residence and stabbed him in the abdomen while he was sleeping. They fled with cash. The acquaintance was transported to a hospital. Two Woodbridge men, 21 and 25, were arrested.

Greenmount Dr., 15000 block, 4:38 p.m. April 25. During an argument, a woman pushed a female acquaintance down a flight of stairs and assaulted her. A Woodbridge woman, 32, was arrested.

CHILD-CARE INCIDENTS

Caton Hill Rd. and Killarney Dr., 12:48 a.m. April 26. Investigating a disabled vehicle, police officers found an intoxicated man transporting three children. An Oxon Hill, Md., man, 29, was arrested.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Blackjack Oak Lane, 16600 block, 5 a.m. to 2 p.m. April 24. A TV and a video game system were stolen from a residence.

Eastbourne Dr., 2400 block, 10 p.m. April 22 to 7 p.m. April 24. A laptop computer was stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked rear door.

Keystone Rd., 13400 block, 6 a.m. to 7 p.m. April 27. A tool and a pair of shoes were stolen from a residence. An interior door was damaged.

Knowles St., 13700 block, 10 a.m. April 28 to 3:30 p.m. April 29. Prescription medicine was stolen from a residence.

Quate Lane, 13500 block, 7:30 a.m. to 7:30 p.m. April 29. A laptop computer, a camera and jewelry were stolen from a residence.

Redwood Ct., 12200 block, April 18 to April 25. An attempt was made to enter a residence by damaging a rear basement door.

Manassas

No reports were received from Manassas police for this edition of Local Living. For information, call 703-257-8000.

Manassas Park

This was among incidents reported by Manassas Park police. For more information, call 703-361-1136.

VANDALISM

Conner Dr. and General Way, 5 p.m. April 24 to 5 a.m. April 25. Vehicle tires were slashed.

- Compiled by Sarah Lane

Crime Report


SECTION: EXTRAS; Pg. PW24


LENGTH: 901 words


Prince William

The following incidents were reported by Prince William County police. For information, call 703-792-7245.

Bristow area

WEAPONS

WELLINGTON RD. AND WILLIAMS WAY, 11:40 p.m. Aug. 20. A man in a parking lot allegedly showed something that looked like a handgun. A 23-year-old Ashland man was arrested and charged with brandishing a firearm. A plastic Airsoft gun was recovered.

Dale City area

ASSAULTS

RIDGEFIELD RD. AND DALE BLVD., 12:30 a.m. Aug. 20. Someone fired a weapon from a vehicle. No injuries were reported. 

ROBBERIES

DALE BLVD., 4100 block, 8:42 p.m. Aug. 22. Three gunmen robbed a grocery store of cash.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

ADAMS ST., 2800 block, 5:45 to 6:15 p.m. Aug. 12. Property was stolen from a residence entered through an open garage door.

Dumfries area

SEXUAL ASSAULTS 

WEXFORD PL., 17200 block, 3:26 a.m. Aug. 21. A man allegedly attempted to sexually assault a female acquaintance, who was treated for injuries. A 23-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

ASSAULTS

GRAHAM PARK DR., 3800 block, 3:15 a.m. Aug. 19. A man allegedly assaulted a female acquaintance, who was treated for injuries. A 52-year-old Dumfries man was arrested.

ROBBERIES

JASPER LOOP, 4000 block, 3:57 p.m. Aug. 19. Two male juveniles snatched a laptop computer from a man sitting on a porch, then fled.

Gainesville area

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

LEE HWY., 15500 block, noon Aug. 12 to 2 p.m. Aug. 17. A motorcycle was stolen from a residence.

Haymarket area

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

SUMNEY DR., 16100 block, 12:01 a.m. Aug. 20 to noon Aug. 21. Someone attempted to enter a residence through a doggy door, damaging the door.

Lake Ridge area

ASSAULTS

OLD BRIDGE RD., 2000 block, 9:25 p.m. Aug. 19. Four people at a gas station assaulted a man and a woman, then fled as police arrived.

Manassas area

ASSAULTS

AARON LANE AND COVERSTONE DR., 11:24 p.m. Aug. 20. A small projectile hit a moving vehicle, breaking a window.

ROBBERIES

COMMUNITY DR., 7900 block, 9:37 p.m. Aug. 19. Two male juveniles allegedly chased a man, who ran to his residence and locked the door. The two kicked open the door and allegedly took the man's phone as he was calling police. Two Manassas boys, 16 and 15, were arrested.

COMMUNITY DR., 8100 block, 10 a.m. to 2:30 p.m. Aug. 19. Cash was stolen from a residence.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

COMMUNITY DR., 8100 block, 10 to 11 a.m. Aug. 19. Jewelry was stolen from a residence entered by prying open a rear sliding-glass door.

KAHNS RD., 12800 block, 7 a.m. Aug. 18 to 6 p.m. Aug. 19. Someone attempted to enter a residence by breaking a living room window.

PORTSMOUTH RD., 10100 block, 10 a.m. July 26 to 12:20 a.m. Aug. 5. Property was stolen from a residence.

SUDLEY RD., 8300 block, 8:40 p.m. Aug. 19 to 7:30 a.m. Aug. 20. Merchandise was stolen from a store entered by forcing open a rear door.

Triangle area

ASSAULTS

JURGENSEN DR., 3600 block, 1:48 a.m. Aug. 21. A man and a male pedestrian argued, and the man allegedly cut the pedestrian's leg. The pedestrian was treated for injuries.

PEEPING TOM INCIDENTS

PURVIS DR., 18100 block, 11:27 p.m. Aug. 22. A male tapped on a bedroom window of a residence and looked at a female resident inside.

Woodbridge area

ASSAULTS

BORDEAUX PL., 2700 block, 11:55 p.m. Aug. 18. During an argument, a man allegedly assaulted a female relative and refused to let her leave. A 37-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

CALEDONIA CIR., 3400 block, 3 p.m. Aug. 18. During an argument, a man allegedly hit a male relative in the face. A 26-year-old Dumfries man was arrested.

FILLARETTE CT., 14400 block, 3:30 p.m. Aug. 17. During an argument, a man allegedly assaulted a woman and held a knife to her neck, cutting her. A 29-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

FLORIDA AVE., 1400 block, 4:22 a.m. Aug. 21. A group of people were involved in a fight. Three Woodbridge women, 18, 19 and 20, an 18-year-old Woodbridge man and an 18-year-old Dumfries man were arrested.

MAPLEDALE PLAZA, 5400 block, 10:23 a.m. Aug. 22. A man with a knife demanded money from a male pedestrian. When the pedestrian refused, the man stabbed him in the abdomen. He was treated for injuries.

OAKWOOD DR. AND SEVILLE CIR., 3:10 a.m. Aug. 21. Someone stabbed a man.

ROBBERIES

BAYSIDE AVE., 1300 block, 10:40 p.m. Aug. 20. A gunman robbed a man of a wallet.

CRONIN DR., 1200 block, 1:38 a.m. Aug. 22. A man sprayed a male motorist with pepper as he was leaving his vehicle. The motorist fled and called police.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

BRANDON CT., 14400 block, 8 p.m. Aug. 21 to 5:30 a.m. Aug. 22. A residence was entered through an unlocked rear door and vandalized.

LAMAR RD., 14400 block, 12:33 p.m. Aug. 18. Three men took electronics from a residence, which was entered through a rear door. They fled in a vehicle when a resident returned home.

VANDALISM

LONG SHALLOWS CT., 1700 block, 12:13 p.m. Aug. 19. Someone wrote graffiti on apartment buildings and a trash bin.

Manassas

The following incident was reported by Manassas police. For information, call 703-257-8000.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

BATTLE ST., 9400 block, 8:30 p.m. Aug. 23 to 8:30 a.m. Aug. 24. Several bottles of alcohol and wine were stolen from a restaurant entered by kicking open a side door.

Manassas Park

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

CENTREVILLE RD., 8500 block, 1:49 a.m. Aug. 17. A wallet and a cellphone were stolen after they were left in a restroom.

Crime Report


SECTION: EXTRAS; Pg. PW10


LENGTH: 1911 words


Prince William

These incidents were reported by Prince William County police. For more information, call 703-792-7245.

Bristow Area

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

RIBBON FALLS LOOP, 9000 block, 7 p.m. June 23 to 8 a.m. June 25. Housing construction materials were stolen from a construction site.

SHARPSHINNED DR., 14200 block, 5 p.m. June 23 to 6 p.m. June 25. Copper wire and tubing were stolen from four houses under construction.

Dale City Area

ROBBERIES

DALE BLVD., 2800 block, 2:20 a.m. June 30. A youth grabbed a purse and a bag from a woman trying to make a deposit in a night drop box at a bank. The deposit was in her purse. A co-worker chased and caught the boy. A 15-year-old boy was arrested.

DARBYDALE AVENUE AND DALE BOULEVARD, 5:10 p.m. June 25. Two males got out of a brown Oldsmobile, assaulted a pedestrian and snatched his gold chain. 

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

BISMARK AVE., 14300 block, 9 p.m. June 26 to 6 a.m. June 28. Jewelry was stolen from a residence.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

BRAZIL CIR., 15200 block, 8 p.m. July 2 to 12:01 a.m. July 3. A green 1996 Ford Crown Victoria was stolen.

Dumfries Area

SEXUAL ASSAULTS 

CHERRY HILL ROAD AND CHESAPEAKE DRIVE, 10:30 p.m. July 2. A man grabbed a pedestrian, threw her to the ground and tried to sexually assault her. The woman was able to get away.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

CABIN RD., 18300 block, 4 p.m. March 1 to 4 a.m. June 3o. A rifle was stolen from a residence.

TALON DR., 4100 block, 11:47 p.m. June 26. Two males who entered a residence through a rear basement door fled when confronted by a resident. Nothing was reported missing.

ASSAULTS

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

LAWNVALE DR., 4500 block, 11:05 p.m. June 25. A male trying to enter a residence through a rear sliding-glass door fled when a confronted by a resident.

MCGRAWS CORNER DR., 14300 block, 7:45 p.m. June 24. Two men took two blood pressure monitors from a store without paying for them.

Haymarket Area

ASSAULTS

WASHINGTON ST., 15300 block, 12:30 a.m. July 4. A man allegedly stabbed two acquaintances, a 32-year-old Haymarket man and a 25-year-old Fairfax woman. The victims were treated for non-life-threatening injuries. The assailant drove to Manassas, where he attempted to elude police before crashing into three utility poles. A 37-year-old New Orleans man was arrested.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

RAINER HEIGHTS CT., 14500 block, midnight to 7 a.m. July 1. A Global Positioning System device and a radio receiver were stolen from an unlocked vehicle. Two other vehicles were entered. Nothing was reported stolen.

Manassas Area

ASSAULTS

ROBBERIES

Alexandria Arlington Crime Watch


SECTION: Alexandria - Arlington Extra; T18


LENGTH: 836 words


The following were among crime reports received recently from the Alexandria Police Department. For more information, call 703-838-4636.

ROBBERIES

WALLESTON CT., 1600 block, 8:40 a.m. Oct. 7. Two men in a car asked a female pedestrian, 53, a question. The passenger then got out and announced a robbery. The woman shouted and ran to a house. The men fled in the gray 1998 Chevrolet.  

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

FORD AVE., 4400 block, 7:30 p.m. Oct. 1 to 8 a.m. Oct. 2. Electronic equipment was stolen from a business.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

NORTH ALFRED AND MONTGOMERY STREETS, 10:40 p.m. Oct. 2 to 8 p.m. Oct. 4. A white 2002 Dodge Dakota was stolen.

BRADDOCK RD. W., 4800 block, 11:30 p.m. Oct. 2 to 7:15 a.m. Oct. 3. A silver 2003 Honda CBR-600 motorcycle was stolen.

DUKE ST., 200 block, 1:20 p.m. Oct. 1. A white 2001 Chevrolet van was stolen.

DUKE ST., 5200 block, 7:15 a.m. Oct. 2 to 8:30 a.m. Oct. 3. A gold 1999 Mazda 626 was stolen.

GLEBE RD. W., 1-100 block, 2 a.m. to 7 p.m. Oct. 7. A gray 1993 Honda Accord was stolen.

GLEBE RD. W., 800 block, 5 p.m. Oct. 2 to 6 a.m. Oct. 3. A black 1993 Honda Civic was stolen.

LEE ST. S., 600 block, 11:50 a.m. to 12:10 p.m. Oct. 8. A white 1996 Chevrolet Astro van was stolen.

MARTHA CUSTIS DR., 1400 block, 11 p.m. Sept. 29 to 8:45 a.m. Sept. 30. A red 2002 Honda motorcycle was stolen.

REYNOLDS ST. S., 300 block, 9:50 p.m. Oct. 1 to 7:50 a.m. Oct. 2. A green 1997 Honda Accord was stolen.

ROYAL ST. S., 700 block, 12:30 to 4 p.m. Oct. 2. A blue 1994 Ford E350 van was stolen.

SANGER AVENUE AND DARBY COURT, 8 p.m. Sept. 25 to 3 p.m. Sept. 30. A yellow 1996 Chevrolet Caprice was stolen.

WYNDHAM CIR., 3300 block, 10 p.m. Oct. 1 to 8:15 a.m. Oct. 2. A blue 1998 Yamaha motorcycle was stolen.

WYNDHAM CIR., 3300 block, 10 p.m. Oct. 1 to 7 a.m. Oct. 2. A yellow and black 2001 Honda motorcycle was stolen.

WYNDHAM CIR., 3300 block, 8 a.m. to 8 p.m. Oct. 2. A yellow and black 2002 Honda motorcycle was stolen.

The following were among crime reports received recently by the Arlington County Police Department. For more information, call 703-228-4050 or visit www.arlingtoncrimesolvers.org.

REWARDS FOR INFORMATION

Arlington County Crime Solvers, a nonprofit community organization, will pay up to $1,000 for information leading to an arrest in connection with felonies and other serious crimes. Call the 24-hour hotline at 800-673-2777. Callers may remain anonymous.

SEXUAL ASSAULTS 

I-66 BIKE PATH, 4900 block, 4:16 p.m. Oct. 5. A man riding a bike inappropriately touched a female pedestrian, 28.

ASSAULTS

CLEVELAND ST. S., 1200 block, 12:13 p.m. Oct. 5. A man hit a 30-year-old male with a wooden paddle and fled.

CLEVELAND ST. S., 1200 block, 2:23 p.m. Oct. 7. A male hit a male resident, 30, while he was sitting in his back yard.

COLUMBIA PIKE S., 2600 block, Oct. 3. A male pulled out a box cutter and began swinging it at an off-duty police officer. A male was arrested.

FAIRFAX DR. N., 4200 block, 12:43 a.m. Oct. 7. A man punched a 36-year-old male pedestrian in the face several times.

ROBBERIES

ARMY NAVY DR. S., 1300 block, 9:02 p.m. Oct. 3. A gunman entered a business, walked behind a cash register counter and demanded money from the owner, who complied.

CARLIN SPRINGS RD. N., 4300 block, 6:24 a.m. Oct. 5. A gunman in a parking lot demanded money from a male motorist, 26, then fled.

COLUMBIA PIKE, 3800 block, 11:45 p.m. Oct. 3. Two males robbed a male pedestrian, 30, at knife point of a wallet.

FOURTH ST. N., 4100 block, 2:15 p.m. Oct. 7. Two men and a female forced a male resident, 30, into his apartment at knife point. The robbers tied the victim and took cash, electronic equipment, jewelry and other property. The robbers fled in a purple car.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

COLUMBIA PIKE S., 1500 block, 3 a.m. Oct. 3. Several vehicle inspection stickers were stolen from a business.

FOUR MILE RUN DR. S., 3800 block, 7 p.m. Sept. 30 to 5:45 a.m. Oct. 1. A business was entered by breaking a front window. Nothing was reported missing.

JEFFERSON DAVIS HWY. S., 2600 block, 5 p.m. Oct. 6 to 7 a.m. Oct. 7. A laptop computer was stolen from a business.

KENSINGTON ST. N., 300 block, 2 p.m. Oct. 6. Two men attempted to enter a residence by prying a sliding glass door. The intruders fled empty-handed when confronted by a resident.

OXFORD ST. N., 400 block, 10:15 a.m. to 1:39 p.m. Oct. 3. A computer, a TV and a DVD player were stolen from a residence.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

COLUMBIA PIKE, 4900 block. A gray 1985 Toyota Camry was stolen.

CRYSTAL DR. S., 2200 block. A dark green 1997 Ford F350 was stolen.

CRYSTAL DR. S., 2600 block. A green 2001 Dodge Ram was stolen.

LINCOLN ST. N., 1200 block. A white 1999 Isuzu Rodeo was stolen.

OXFORD ST. S., 2600 block. A red 1995 Dodge Neon was stolen.

QUEBEC ST. S., 2000 block. A red 203 Tomas Moped was stolen.

SEVENTH RD. S., 5000 block. A silver 1997 Honda Accord was stolen.

EIGHTH ST. S., 5100 block. A green 1994 Dodge Caravan was stolen.

31ST ST. S., 4200 block. A white 1999 Saturn SL1 was stolen.

-- Sarah Lane

SECTION: Metro; Pg. T21

Alexandria

These were among incidents reported by the Alexandria Police Department. For information, call 703-838-4636 or visit www.alexandriava.gov/police.

Montgomery County Crime Watch


SECTION: MONTGOMERY EXTRA; Pg. T12


LENGTH: 1922 words


The following were among crime reports recently received by the Montgomery County Police Department.

REWARDS FOR INFORMATION

Crime Solvers of Montgomery County Inc., a nonprofit community organization, will pay up to $ 1,000 for information leading to an arrest and indictment in connection with these and any other felonies. Call the 24-hour hot line at 800-673-2777. Callers may remain anonymous.

ROBBERIES

TUCKERMAN LANE AND OLD GEORGETOWN ROAD, 12:30 a.m. Oct. 13. A man forced a 22-year-old woman to the ground and tried to grab her purse. When a vehicle approached the area, the robber fled empty-handed.  

UNIVERSITY BLVD. W., 2400 block, 1:45 a.m. Oct. 10. Two males accosted a 53-year-old Silver Spring man and one assailant forced him to the ground while the second attacker searched the man's pockets. Both robbers removed man's jacket. No injuries were reported.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

RAYARD AVE., 4600 block, 5:35 to 6:17 p.m. Oct. 8. Cash, jewelry and trash bags were stolen from a residence.

SHEPHERD ST., 3700 block, 3:30 to 5:30 p.m. Oct. 8. Cash and jewelry were stolen from a residence entered by prying a window.

VENTNOR RD., 5200 block, 10 a.m. to 5:30 p.m. Oct. 9. Jewelry, clothing and camera equipment were stolen from a residence entered by forcing a rear door.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

BANK BARN CT., 23000 block, 8:55 a.m. to 2:35 p.m. Oct. 8. Motorbikes were stolen from a shed at a residence.

CRYSTAL ROCK RD., 20700 block, 10:15 p.m. Oct. 9 to 9:15 a.m. Oct. 10. Property was stolen from a golf park entered by breaking a window.

FISHER AVE., 19600 block, 11:45 p.m. Oct. 11 to 7 a.m. Oct. 12. A front window at a veterinary clinic was broken. Nothing was reported stolen.

FISHER AVE., 19900 block, 7 p.m. Oct. 9 to 8 a.m. Oct. 10. An attempt was made to enter a hardware store by prying a door.

S. MONTGOMERY AVE., 21400 block, 7:30 to 7:45 a.m. Oct. 14. A lawn tractor was stolen from a residence entered by prying doors.

SECRETARIAT CT., 24000 block, 7 p.m. Oct. 8 to 7:30 p.m. Oct. 10. An air-compressor was stolen from a garage at a residence.

WISTERIA DR., 12600 block, 4:50 a.m. Oct. 13. A tobacco business front window was broken. Nothing was reported stolen.

ROBBERIES

GOSHEN RD., 20000 block, 12:30 a.m. Oct. 11. Two men in a parking lot accosted a 41-year-old Rockville man and began to punch and kick him, then demanded cash. The man shouted as the robbers took cash from him and the pair fled on foot.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

APPLERIDGE RD., 19800 block, 8:10 p.m. Oct. 9. A residence was entered.

S. FREDERICK AVE., 500 block, 7 p.m. Oct. 6 to 11:30 a.m. Oct. 7. Property was stolen from a skate park entered by forcing a door.

MANDOLIN CT., 500 block, 11 a.m. to 7 p.m. Oct. 11. A lock was pried at a residence. Nothing was reported stolen.

RUSSELL AVE., 700 block, 6:20 a.m. Oct. 10. Cash and leather jackets were stolen from a department store entered by breaking a glass front door.

SNOUFFER SCHOOL RD., 8300 block, 6 a.m. Oct. 10. A lawn and power-equipment business was entered by breaking a front door. Nothing was reported stolen.

N. SUMMIT AVE., 370 block, 8 p.m. Oct. 9 to 7:30 a.m. Oct. 10. Drills, hammers and putty knives were stolen from a painting company entered by prying a front-door lock.

ROBBERIES

VEIRS MILL RD., 12200 block, 11:10 a.m. Oct. 15. A man in a bank handed a bag to a bank teller and demanded cash. The teller complied and the robber walked away, toward Selfridge Road.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

DUFIEF MILL RD., 14900 block, 8 a.m. Sept. 23 to 8 a.m. Sept. 24. Lawn equipment was stolen from a recreation club entered by prying a rear-door lock.

FALLS RD., 10800 block, 4:25 to 4:35 a.m. Oct. 10. Windows at a golf course building were pried. Nothing was reported stolen.

GARLAND AVE., 8300 block, noon Oct. 6 to 5 a.m. Oct. 10. Clothing and a travel bag were stolen from a residence entered through an open window.

HILLMOOR DR., 200 block, 9 p.m. Oct. 11 to 8:30 a.m. Oct. 12. An attempt was made to enter a residence through a rear door. Nothing was reported stolen.

N. HORNERS LANE, 600 block, 6 a.m. Oct. 12. A VCR and a stereo were stolen at a church from a shed with a broken door.

OAKLYN DR., 10000 block, 1:40 to 5:45 a.m. Oct. 10. Cash was stolen from a golf-course tournament players club, entered by breaking in a front door.

OLD COLUMBIA PIKE, 15500 block, 2 to 6 a.m. Oct. 11. A restaurant was entered by forcing a front door. Nothing was reported stolen.

ROCKVILLE PIKE, 1300 block, 5 to 8:30 a.m. Oct. 13. A bakery was entered. Nothing was reported stolen.

SOUTHLAWN LANE, 14900 block, 11 p.m. Oct. 15. Police officers saw two men throw a piece of concrete through a front window of a rental business. The men stole chain saws, hedge-trimmers, grass-trimmers and concrete-cutters from the business, then fled in a Honda, which had been reported stolen Oct. 5 in the District. Police arrested a 43-year-old Northeast Washington man and a 41-year-old man, of no fixed address, and charged them with burglary and auto theft. The 41-year-old man also was charged with making a false statement to a police officer.

 SEXUAL ASSAULTS 

GEORGIA AVENUE AND THE BELTWAY, 4:30 a.m. Aug. 25. A 44-year-old D.C. man was arrested Oct. 16 and charged with second-degree rape and second-degree assault in connection with the sexual assault by a taxi driver of a 22-year-old Wheaton woman who had been a passenger in the driver's taxi.

ROBBERIES

PINEY BRANCH RD., 9300 block, 9:55 p.m. Oct. 10. Two men drove past a 35-year-old man and a 25-year-old woman in a parking lot, got out of the vehicle, robbed the man and woman of cash at gunpoint and drove away.

OAKLEAF DR., 11200 block, 5 p.m. Oct. 12. A youth accosted an 81-year-old woman as she walked to her apartment door, placed a bag over her head and grabbed her purse from her hand, then fled down a fire-escape stairwell.

CASTLE BLVD., 14100 block, 11:30 p.m. Oct. 13. Two men accosted two pedestrians, a 23-year-old Columbia man and a 24-year-old Greenbelt man, and scuffled with them in an attempt to rob them. One of the pedestrians was cut with an unidentified sharp object. No medical treatment was reported. The robbers took property.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

BLUNDON DR., 9900 block, noon Oct. 14 to 8 a.m. Oct. 15. A padlock on a storage bin at a residence was cut. Nothing was reported stolen.

CASTLE TER., 3700 block, 7:20 a.m. to 4:30 p.m. Oct. 15. Jewelry was stolen from a residence entered by forcing a door.

DALE DR., 1-100 block, 7:15 a.m. to 3:18 p.m. Oct. 8. Cash was stolen from a residence entered by forcing a door.

HAMILTON AVE., 300 block, 10:30 a.m. to 1:45 p.m. Oct. 8. Property was stolen from a residence entered by prying a door lock.

HILDAROSE RD., 2100 block, 3 p.m. Oct. 5 to 8 a.m. Oct. 8. Plumbing equipment was stolen from a residence entered by breaking through a door.

LAMBERTON DR., 2:20 to 3 a.m. Oct. 17. Property was stolen from the residence of an 80-year-old woman.

LOCKWOOD DR., 10900 block, 1:30 p.m. Oct. 8. An attempt was made to enter a residence by prying a basement door frame.

MANCHESTER RD., 9200 block, 8:30 a.m. to 3:30 p.m. Oct. 8. Cash was stolen from a residence entered through a window.

MOFFET RD., 1600 block, 7:30 a.m. to 3:30 p.m. Oct. 15. A video-game system and games were stolen from a residence entered by breaking a door.

NEW HAMPSHIRE AVE., 16600 block, 11:15 a.m. to 5:30 p.m. Oct. 15. A laptop computer, a camera and a video camera were stolen from a residence entered through a rear window.

NORA DR., 1000 block, 1:30 p.m. Oct. 6 to 2 p.m. Oct. 7. A television was stolen from a residence entered by prying a door frame.

OAKLEAF DR., 11200 block, 9 to 10 a.m. Oct. 11. A video-game system was stolen from a residence.

RUPPERT RD., 1200 block, 1 a.m. Oct. 12. A man was seen breaking into a house occupied by an 80-year-old woman. Property was stolen.

SPRING ST., 1300 block, 1 p.m. Oct. 13 to 10 a.m. Oct. 15. Laptop computers were stolen from a business entered by prying a door.

SUTHERLAND RD., 10000 block, 8:45 a.m. to 4:15 p.m. Oct. 9. Cash and stereo equipment was stolen from a residence entered by breaking through a door.

THREE OAKS DR., 9200 block, 8 a.m. Oct. 8 to 12:19 a.m. Oct. 10. Jewelry was stolen from a residence entered by kicking in a door.

THREE OAKS DR., 9200 block, noon to 6:15 p.m. Oct. 8. Cash was stolen from a residence entered by prying a door frame.

WAYNE AVE., 800 block, 4:40 a.m. Oct. 14. Property was stolen from a boutique entered by breaking a window.

WILLINGTON DR., 400 block, 7 p.m. Oct. 5 to 3 p.m. Oct. 7. Camera equipment was stolen from a residence entered through a window.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

BLOOMFIELD RD., 18700 block, 11:50 p.m. Oct. 12. A residence was entered through an unlocked door. Nothing was reported stolen.

ELBY ST., 4100 block, 7:30 a.m. to 5:30 p.m. Oct. 15. A video-game system and games were stolen from a residence entered through a window.

GEORGIA AVE., 11500 block, 1:40 p.m. Oct. 9. An attempt was made to enter a business by prying a door.

GEORGIA AVE., 11700 block, 5:20 p.m. Oct. 12 to 8:50 a.m. Oct. 13. An attempt was made to pry doors at a library. Nothing was reported stolen.

GEORGIAN WOODS PL., 2200 block, 10:40 to 11:10 p.m. Oct. 10. A television was stolen from a residence.

GREENSPAN LANE, 14200 block, 8:30 p.m. Oct. 6 to 7 a.m. Oct. 7. Lawn equipment was stolen from a shed at a residence, entered through an open shed door.

LAYHILL RD., 16400 block, 10 p.m. Oct. 9 to 7:45 a.m. Oct. 10. An attempt was made to enter a country store by cutting a door lock.

NARIN RD., 11400 block, 7:30 to 9 p.m. Oct. 8. TV equipment was stolen from a residence entered by breaking through a door.

NEW HAMPSHIRE AVE., 16900 block, 5 a.m. to 3 p.m. Oct. 8. A camera and jewelry were stolen from a residence entered by forcing a rear door.

NEW HAMPSHIRE AVE., 17700 block, 6:30 a.m. to 5:45 p.m. Oct. 15. A purse was stolen from a residence entered through a door.

UNIVERSITY BLVD., 2400 block, 10 p.m. Oct. 14 to 6:30 a.m. Oct. 15. Cash and a stereo were stolen from a restaurant entered by breaking a door.

The following were among crime reports recently received by the Takoma Park Police Department. For more information, call 301-270-8724.

 SEXUAL ASSAULTS 

MAPLE AVE., 7300-7700 block, Oct. 17. A man with a handgun raped a female acquaintance in his home. The acquaintance was treated for the sexual assault at an area hospital. A man was arrested and charged with first-degree rape, other sexual offenses and weapons charges.

ROBBERIES

CARROLL AVE., 7600 block, 3 to 3:10 p.m. Oct. 12. A man accosted a female bank employee as she was leaving a bank satellite branch, forced her back into the branch and demanded cash. She complied and he fled. No weapons were reported.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

FLOWER AVE., 8600 block, Oct. 13. A woman and two men broke a window of a business, entered the building and stole property. They then fled in a vehicle. Police arrested three people in a residence and charged them with second-degree burglary, conspiracy to commit burglary and theft. Property from the business was recovered from a vehicle.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

BELFORD PL., 500 block, 7 to 8 p.m. Oct. 16. A 1998 Chrysler auto was stolen.

MYRTLE AVE., 1200 block, 2 to 2:15 p.m. Oct. 16. A 1996 Ford Crown Victoria was stolen.

MYRTLE AVE., 1200 block, 8 p.m. Oct. 16 to noon Oct. 17. A 1987 Chevrolet Suburban was stolen.

PARK AVE., 200 block, 12:45 to 9 a.m. Oct. 16. A 1994 Jeep Cherokee was stolen.

-- Christine Swerda

May 28, 2009 Thursday

Crime Report


SECTION: EXTRAS; Pg. VA04


LENGTH: 691 words


Alexandria

These were among incidents reported by the Alexandria Police Department. For information, call 703-838-4636 or visit http://www.alexandriava.gov/police.

SEXUAL ASSAULTS 

KING ST., 1700 block, 6:34 p.m. May 19. A sexual assault was reported.

ASSAULTS

KING AND WEST STREETS, 2 a.m. May 17. A person punched another person. An arrest was made. 

MADISON ST., 1300 block, 10:35 p.m. May 17. A threat to assault several people was made. A person was arrested.

PATRICK ST. N., 800 block, 10:57 p.m. May 14. An assault was reported.

PATRICK ST. N., 900 block, 9:21 p.m. May 16. An assault was reported. An arrest was made.

TAYLOR RUN PKWY. W., 100 block, 8:21 p.m. May 18. Two people were involved in a fight. An arrest was made.

ROBBERIES

ROBBERY EISENHOWER AVE., 2700 block, 3:23 a.m. May 16. A gunman demanded cash from a person, then hit the victim with the gun after the person refused to comply.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

BRADDOCK RD. E., 400 block, 4:10 a.m. May 15. A shoplifting incident was reported.

BRAXTON PL., 500 block, 8:49 p.m. May 18. An MP3 player and a BlackBerry were stolen from a vehicle.

BRAXTON PL., 700 block, 1:40 p.m. May 13. A change purse was stolen from a vehicle.

COLUMBUS ST. N., 100 block, 12:40 p.m. May 16. A purse was stolen from a store.

DUKE ST., 1600 block, 10:14 a.m. May 14. Two laptop computers were stolen from a business.

DUKE ST., 1700 block, 10:57 p.m. May 17. A business was entered.

DUKE ST., 1700 block, 5:08 p.m. May 18. A wallet was stolen from a shopping cart.

DUKE ST., 3200 block, 7:50 p.m. May 15. A man grabbed a cellphone from a table.

EISENHOWER AVE., 2300 block, 11:15 a.m. May 15. A theft was reported.

GLENDALE AVE. W., 1-100 block, 9:13 p.m. May 19. A pair of earrings was stolen from a purse inside a vehicle.

MILL RD., 2600 block, 8:56 a.m. May 16. A debit card was stolen from a wallet at another location and used to make purchases.

OAK ST. E., 200 block, 10:07 a.m. May 18. A baby stroller was stolen from a front porch.

SWAMP FOX RD., 200 block, 10:57 p.m. May 13. A theft was reported.

WASHINGTON ST. S., 1200 block, 8:29 p.m. May 17. Clothing was stolen from a laundry room.

WATERFRONT ST., 200 block, 1:25 a.m. May 16. A theft was reported.

WOLFE ST., 800 block, 11:30 a.m. May 19. Property was stolen from a vehicle in a parking lot.

Arlington

These were among incidents reported by the Arlington County Police Department. For information, call 703-228-4331 or visit http://www.arlingtoncrimesolvers.org.

ASSAULTS

COLUMBIA PIKE, 5200 block, 1 a.m. May 16. A group of men assaulted a male in a parking lot near a bar. Police located one of the men. An Arlington man, 24, was charged with assault.

ROBBERIES

COLUMBIA PIKE, 5500 block, and N. DANIEL ST., 2000 block, 2:45 a.m. May 16. A gunman robbed a male in a parking garage.

LEE HWY., 3500 block, 2:50 p.m. May 18. A man entered a store and asked for change, and then another man displayed a gun and took cash from an open cash register.

LEE HWY., 5200 block, 4:45 a.m. May 16. A gunman entered a convenience store, took cash and assaulted a cashier. The man fled in a vehicle and was located by police. An Arlington man, 22, was charged with robbery and use of a firearm in the commission of a felony.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

THOMAS ST. S., 1100 block, 7:30 a.m. May 16. A man attempted to enter a residence. When the owner locked the front door, the intruder fled in a vehicle.

12TH ST. S., 1500 block, 9:45 p.m. May 16. A man attempted to enter a residence. A man, 61, of no fixed address was charged with burglary.

31ST ST. S., 4200 block, 7 p.m. May 18 to 8:30 a.m. May 19. Attempts were made to steal three vehicles.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

COLUMBIA PIKE, 3500 block, May 17. A tan 2002 Nissan Sentra was stolen.

COLUMBIA PIKE, 5500 block, May 17. A white 1986 Plymouth sedan was stolen.

DANIEL ST. N., 1900 block, May 17. A black 1998 Honda Accord was stolen.

GLEBE RD. S., 2900 block, May 13. A red 1997 Dodge Caravan was stolen.

GLEBE RD. S., 800 block, May 17. A white 1994 Honda Accord was stolen.

LEE HWY., 4000 block, May 13. A blue 2006 Toyota Scion was stolen.

WALTER REED DR. S., 800 block, May 15. A gray 2003 Acura RSX was stolen.

-- Compiled by RIA MANGLAPUS

Alexandria

These were among incidents recorded by the Alexandria Police Department, which provided dates, but not times, in its report. For information, call 703-838-4636 or visit www.alexandriava.gov/police .

Prince William County crime report


SECTION: Metro; Pg. T26


LENGTH: 1046 words


Prince William County crime report Prince William County crime report

Among incidents reported by police in Prince William County, Manassas and Manassas Park.

Prince William

These were among incidents reported by Prince William County police. For information, call 703-792-7245.

DUMFRIES AREA SEXUAL ASSAULTS  

John Robinson Lane, 3200 block, Sept. 6. A man sexually assaulted a male juvenile several times between 1999 and 2002. A 42-year-old man was arrested.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Woodland Dr., 18400 block, 8:30 a.m. to 2:50 p.m. Sept. 10. A safe was stolen from a residence entered by forcing a rear door.

GAINESVILLE AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Lee Hwy., 14600 block, 4:59 a.m. Sept. 11. Two businesses were entered by breaking the front glass doors and cash registers were stolen.

HAYMARKET AREA ASSAULTS

Doe Ridge Rd., 15100 block, 7:59 a.m. Sept. 7. A tripwire and nails were placed in a yard of a residence. A woman and a Social Services case worker were walking to the residence to remove a foster child when the woman stepped on a nail. A male juvenile barricaded himself in a basement room but eventually surrendered to police. A 16-year-old Haymarket male was arrested.

MANASSAS AREA ASSAULTS

Bosbury Ct., 7500 block, 7:31 p.m. Sept. 11. During an argument, a man pulled out a machete and chased a male acquaintance.

ROBBERIES

Battleview Pkwy., 10700 block, 8:37 a.m. Sept. 10. A woman knocked on the door of a hotel room. When the male and female occupants answered, the woman, with a knife, forcibly entered the room, followed by two gunmen. They tied up the male's hands and feet and fled with cash, a laptop computer and two cellphones.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Blandsford Dr., 8100 block, 8:50 p.m. Sept. 10 to 6:50 a.m. Sept. 11. A TV was stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked rear window.

Centreville Rd., 7500 block, 9 p.m. Sept. 10 to 6 a.m. Sept. 11. Cash, a laptop computer and 200 cartons of cigarettes were stolen from a service station entered by forcing a side window.

Stokely Dr., 8500 block, noon Sept. 2 to 2 p.m. Sept. 10. A residence was entered by damaging a front door.

TRIANGLE AREA PROSTITUTION

Locust Shade Dr., 4700 block, Sept. 4 and 5. During an investigation, undercover detectives made contact with several individuals soliciting sexual acts inside a park. A 44-year-old Dumfries man, a 67-year-old Alexandria man, a 56-year-old Waldorf, Md., man, a 43-year-old Stafford man, a 76-year-old Ruther Glen, Va., man, a 44-year-old Woodbridge man and a 25-year-old Stafford woman were arrested.

WOODBRIDGE AREA ASSAULTS

Ironwood Rd., 1300 block, 1:50 a.m. Sept. 5. During an argument, a man assaulted a female acquaintance and attempted to choke her. A 20-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

ROBBERIES

Emberdale Dr. and Ensbrook Lane, 10:42 p.m. Sept. 10. Three men assaulted a male pedestrian and robbed him of a wallet.

Gordon Blvd., 12500 block, 2:18 p.m. Sept. 6. Two men robbed a convenience store of cash at gunpoint.

Harbor Dr., 12800 block, 11:25 a.m. Sept. 5. A former employee broke several windows of a carwash with a metal bar. When he approached a manager with the bar, the manager gave him cash and the man fled. A 46-year-old man was arrested.

Minnieville Rd., 13400 block, 5:31 p.m. Sept. 7. Two males grabbed a cellphone from a male pedestrian at gunpoint.

Minnieville Rd. and Bobcat Ct., 7:28 p.m. Sept. 8. Two men in a vehicle stopped in front of a male pedestrian, exited the vehicle, assaulted the pedestrian and robbed him of cash.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Alabama Ave., 14800 block, 6:15 a.m. to 4 p.m. Sept. 11. A TV was stolen from a residence entered by prying a rear door.

Barksdale St., 14700 block, 7 a.m. to 5 p.m. Sept. 11. Video game systems, jewelry and clothes were stolen from a residence entered by forcing a rear door.

Bronson Dr., 3300 block, 11 a.m. to 2:30 p.m. Sept. 8. Two computers and clothes were stolen from a residence entered by forcing a front door.

Horner Rd., 1400 block, 3:17 a.m. Sept. 8. A man entered a residence through an open window and grabbed a sleeping female juvenile. When she woke up and screamed, the man fled.

Jefferson Davis Hwy., 13300 block, 8 p.m. Sept. 4 to 1:30 p.m. Sept. 5. A business was entered through an unlocked rear window.

Jefferson Davis Hwy., 13600 block, 6 p.m. Sept. 4 to 10 a.m. Sept. 5. Cash and a water pump were stolen from a business entered through an unlocked side door.

Jefferson Davis Hwy., 14600 block, 2:20 a.m. Sept. 8. Cash was stolen from a business entered through a rear door.

Midway Ct., 5200 block, 10:30 a.m. to 10:30 p.m. Sept. 7. A residence was entered by forcing a rear door.

Seminole Rd., 3000 block, 7 a.m. to 11:09 p.m. Sept. 6. Two TVs and two laptop computers were stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked rear window.

Manassas

These were among the incidents reported by Manassas police. For more information, call 703-257-8000.

ROBBERIES

Cavalry Lane, 8500 block, midnight Sept. 6. Four males assaulted a male pedestrian and robbed him of a knife. Two Manassas men, 18 and 19, a 19-year-old Woodbridge man and a male juvenile were arrested.

Digges Rd., 8400 block, 2:25 a.m. Sept. 7. A woman hit a female pedestrian in the head and robbed her of a wallet.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Euclid Ave., 9100 block, 5 p.m. Sept. 6 to 6:30 a.m. Sept. 9. Several truck tires were stolen from a business.

Lake Jackson and Libeau drives, Sept. 2 to 6. Columns and steel beams were stolen from a construction site.

Nikki Pl., 9200 block, 2:50 a.m. Sept. 10. Cash was stolen from a vehicle.

Richmond Ave., 8600 block, 9:25 a.m. Sept. 10. A GPS unit and clothes were stolen from two vehicles.

Manassas Park

No reports were received from Manassas Park police for this edition of Local Living. For information, call 703-361-1136.

Crime Report


SECTION: EXTRAS; Pg. VA27


LENGTH: 497 words


Alexandria

These were among incidents reported by the Alexandria Police Department. For more information, call 703-838-4636.

SEXUAL ASSAULTS 

EDSALL RD., 5700 block, 7;50 p.m. Dec. 3. A male exposed himself to a woman in a parking lot. An Alexandria boy, 16, was charged with indecent exposure. 

DIAGONAL RD., 1800 block, 2:30 a.m. Nov. 30. A man exposed himself in a public place. An Alexandria man, 26, was charged with indecent exposure, obstruction of justice and other charges.

ASSAULTS

NORTH WEST AND MADISON STREETS, 12:30 a.m. Dec. 2. Four males attacked a 25-year-old Alexandria man. The victim refused medical treatment. An Alexandria boy, 15, was charged with felonious assault.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

GUNSTON RD., 3200 block, 3:51 a.m. Nov. 30. A man entered a residence, assaulted a 30-year-old Alexandria woman, and fled. No injuries were reported.

 Arlington

These were among incidents reported by the Arlington County Police Department. For more information, call 703-228-4050 or visit http://www.arlingtoncrimesolvers.org.

ASSAULTS

WILSON BLVD. N., 4200 block, 12:30 a.m. Dec. 1. Four males attacked a 25-year-old man and knocked him to the ground. The victim suffered minor facial injuries.

ROBBERIES

COLUMBIA PIKE, 2700 block, 3:45 p.m. Dec. 4. Four people entered a store, filled up knapsacks and tote bags with merchandise, then tried to leave. Store personnel struggled with them and they had just gotten in a vehicle when police arrived. A District man, 19, and an Alexandria man, 18, were charged with robbery and conspiracy to commit grand larceny. A District woman, 19, and a District man, 22, were charged with conspiracy to commit grand larceny and grand larceny.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

ARLINGTON BLVD. N., 1100 block, 3 to 8:26 p.m. Dec. 3. An attempt was made to enter an apartment by forcing a door.

ARLINGTON BLVD., 1500 block, 1 p.m. Nov. 24 to 11 a.m. Nov. 27. A TV was stolen from a hotel room.

EADS ST. S., 1600 block, 8 p.m. Dec. 3 to 9 a.m. Dec. 4. An attempt was made to enter a residence by damaging a door.

MONROE ST. S., 900 block, 5 p.m. Nov. 27 to 4:30 p.m. Nov. 29. A heater was stolen from a vacant residence.

WILSON BLVD., 3200 block, 5 a.m. Nov. 29. Police responding to a call about a burglary at a business found a man armed with a screwdriver and in possession of cash from one of the registers. An Arlington man, 53, was charged with burglary, grand larceny, and possession of burglar tools.

JOYCE ST. S., 1400 block. A license plate was stolen.

19TH ST. S., 2600 block. A license plate was stolen.

25TH ST. N., 4000 block. A license plate was stolen.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

COLUMBIA PIKE, 5500 block. A green 1996 Honda Accord was stolen.

COURTHOUSE RD. S., 1200 block. A black 1995 Honda Accord was stolen.

LEE HWY., 4000 block. A silver 2001 Toyota MR2 was stolen.

VANDALISM

JEFFERSON DAVIS HWY., 2600 block, 12:15 to 8:15 a.m. Nov. 28. Windows of three vehicles in a garage were damaged. A Global Positioning System unit was stolen.

Crime Report


SECTION: EXTRAS; Pg. PW26


LENGTH: 550 words


Prince William

The following incidents were reported by Prince William County police. For information, call 703-792-7245.

Bristow area

ASSAULTS

NOLTLAND DR. AND LENNICE WAY, 5:30 p.m. April 26. A man attempted to grab a male juvenile. When the boy's older brother pushed the boy out of the way, the man fled. The two boys fled. No injuries were reported.

Dale City area

VANDALISM

FERNDALE RD., 14100 block, Jan. 23, March 27, April 17. Items outside a church were moved and damaged. Three Dale City males, 15, 16 and 17, and a 16-year-old West Virginia male were arrested. 

Dumfries area

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

FISHERMAN'S COVE, 4600 block, April 19 to 25. Cash was stolen from a residence.

FRANCIS WEST LANE, 16800 block, 9:44 p.m. April 23. Someone attempted to enter a residence through a front door.

Montclair area

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

PRESTWICK CT., 16000 block, 6:40 p.m. April 15. A TV was stolen from a residence.

Woodbridge area

SEXUAL ASSAULTS 

JEFFERSON DAVIS HWY., 11:30 p.m. April 21. A man allegedly inappropriately touched a female juvenile. A 19-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

ASSAULTS

JEFFERSON DAVIS HWY., 13900 block, 1 a.m. April 22. A man was injured during a fight. An Alexandria man, 22, a Falls Church man, 25, and a Gaithersburg man, 32, were arrested and charged with assault and gang participation.

WEAPONS

SMOKETOWN RD., 14500 block, 2:13 a.m. April 24. Gunshots were fired during a fight in a parking lot.

ROBBERIES

ENTERPRISE LANE, 14900 block, 10:35 p.m. April 23. Two men and a woman robbed a man of a wallet containing cash.

KOESTER DR., 4700 block, 11:10 p.m. April 24. A person took cash from a man during a fight.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

GUNSMITH TERR., 15300 block, April 17 to 23. Jewelry was stolen from a residence.

RICHMOND AVE., 1900 block, 5 p.m. April 22. Cash and jewelry were stolen from a residence entered through a basement window.

STARLING CT., 4400 block, 4:40 p.m. April 21. A revolver, two laptop computers and jewelry were stolen from a residence entered by breaking a basement window.

VANDALISM

MOHICAN RD., 12300 block, 6:46 p.m. April 14. A woman and a juvenile allegedly wrote on a shed at a school. A 19-year-old woman and a 16-year-old juvenile were arrested.

Manassas

The following incidents were reported by Manassas police. For information, call 703-257-8000.

ROBBERIES

ASPEN PL., 9700 block, 10:20 a.m. April 8. A man allegedly grabbed a purse from a female pedestrian, knocking her to the ground. A 24-year-old Thornburg man was arrested.

LIBERIA AVE. AND WILLOW GLEN CT., 10 p.m. April 20. Two men grabbed a male cyclist, forced him off his bike and tried to grab a wallet from his rear pocket. One of the men hit the cyclist on the head with a handgun. As they struggled, the handgun discharged. No gunshot injuries were reported. The men fled. The cyclist was treated for injuries.

INDECENT EXPOSURE

TANEY RD., 9100 block, 3 p.m. April 19. A man exposed himself to a female pedestrian.

Manassas Park

The following incidents were reported by Manassas Park police. For information, call 703-361-1136.

VANDALISM

CENTREVILLE RD., 8500 block, 4:51 p.m. April 25. Someone broke a vehicle window.

MANASSAS DR., 9100 block, 12:28 to 5 p.m. April 13. A vehicle and several businesses were spray-painted. A 19-year-old Manassas man was arrested.

August 9, 2012 Thursday 8:12 PM EST 


Prince William County crime report Prince William County crime report


SECTION: Metro; Pg. T22


LENGTH: 1857 words


Prince William County

These were among incidents reported by Prince William County police. For information, call 703-792-7245.

DUMFRIES AREA ROBBERIES

Sedgewick Pl., 2500 block, 2:15 a.m. July 29. A man demanded property from a male pedestrian, then hit him on the head with a handgun and robbed him of a cellphone and a wallet containing cash.

Waterway and Country Club drives, 1:45 a.m. July 28. A gunman demanded money from a male pedestrian, who fled.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS  

Chesapeake Dr., 3100 block, 10:52 a.m. July 28. Two men entered a residence by breaking a rear window. Nothing was reported stolen. A 27-year-old Dumfries man and a 20-year-old Fairfax man were arrested.

HAYMARKET AREA ASSAULTS

Heythorpe Ct., 13600 block, 4:10 a.m. July 26. A male intruder was in the back yard of a residence when two residents saw him. The man entered a neighbor's open garage, and the residents confronted and attempted to detain him. The man assaulted them and fled on foot. A 25-year-old man and a 19-year-old Gainesville woman were arrested.

MANASSAS AREA SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Golden Leaf Cir. area, July 24. A man sexually assaulted a female juvenile acquaintance during the past two years. A 31-year-old Manassas man was arrested.

Sharpsburg Ct. area, July 22. Two men sexually assaulted a female juvenile acquaintance over several years. One of the men also sexually assaulted a woman. A 42-year-old Woodbridge man and a 34-year-old Manassas man were arrested.

WEAPONS

Juliet Lane, 8000 block, 3:55 a.m. July 28. Several gunshots were heard.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Automotive Dr., 10600 block, 9 p.m. July 28 to 10:30 a.m. July 29. Cash was stolen from a business entered by forcing a side door and several interior doors.

WOODBRIDGE AREA SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Dillingham Sq., 12400 block, 4:40 p.m. July 28. A man in a parking lot grabbed a woman's chest, then fled in a vehicle.

Lexington Ct. area, July 28. A man sexually assaulted a female acquaintance while she was sleeping. A 25-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

Rainbow Court and Bancroft Lane area, July 25. A man sexually assaulted a female acquaintance when she was a juvenile in the 1990s. A 50-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

ASSAULTS

Belleville Ave., 14300 block, 11 p.m. July 23. During an argument, two women assaulted another woman, who was hit in the face and torso with a metal pipe. The woman was treated for injuries. Two Woodbridge women, 33 and 34, were arrested.

Jefferson Davis Hwy., 13700 block, 2:27 a.m. July 28. During a fight in a parking lot, a man attempted to drive away. Someone fired a weapon at the vehicle, injuring the man in the head. He drove himself to a hospital, where he was treated for injuries.

Potomac Mills Rd., 14300 block, 1:06 a.m. July 29. During a fight, a man stabbed another man with a knife. The injured man was taken to a hospital. A 22-year-old Manassas man was arrested.

Sutton Pl., 16600 block, 7:36 p.m. July 22. A group of men assaulted a male acquaintance and a woman who had attempted to intervene. Two Woodbridge men, 22 and 24, and a 22-year-old Springfield man were arrested.

WEAPONS

Gina Pl., 3200 block, 1:40 a.m. July 26. Someone fired a weapon at a residence, damaging a kitchen cabinet.

INDECENT EXPOSURE

G St., 12:04 a.m. July 31. A man exposed himself to a female juvenile acquaintance.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Aztec Pl., 12300 block, 2:29 a.m. July 29. A man entered a residence through an unlocked front door. He fled with a laptop computer when a resident found him in the kitchen.

Cardin Pl., 15100 block, 3 to 4:30 p.m. July 23. A handgun and a laptop computer were stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked door.

Dyers Mills Ct., 2600 block, 5:30 a.m. to 1:50 p.m. July 30. Items were stolen from a residence entered by prying a front door.

Emberdale Ct., 14800 block, 2 to 8 p.m. July 23. Someone attempted to enter a residence by tampering with a front door.

Island House Loop, 12800 block, 3:57 a.m. July 29. A man attempted to enter a residence by forcing a rear door. He fled when a resident saw him.

Mayflower Dr., 2000 block, 12:45 to 2:30 a.m. July 26. A handgun was stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked rear door.

Rockinghorse Dr., 14100 block, 3 p.m. July 18 to 3:45 p.m. July 23. A video game system and equipment were stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked basement window.

Woodside Dr., 1600 block, 10:13 p.m. July 26. Cash was stolen from a business.

York Dr., 2000 block, 11:30 a.m. July 24. Jewelry was stolen from a residence entered by forcing a rear door. Three men fled from the residence when a resident returned home.

VANDALISM

Darbydale Ave., 14800 block, 3:30 p.m. July 26 to 8 a.m. July 27. A sign in front of a school was damaged.

Manassas

No reports were received from Manassas police for today's Local Living section. For information, call 703-257-8000.

Manassas Park

The following incident was recently reported by Manassas Park police. For more information, call 703-361-1136.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Owens Dr., 9100 block, 5 p.m. July 20 to 1:30 p.m. July 23. Welding equipment was stolen from two vehicles in a fenced area of a business.

- Compiled by Sarah Lane

Prince William County

These were among incidents reported by Prince William County police. For information, call 703-792-7245.

DUMFRIES AREA ROBBERIES

Sedgewick Pl., 2500 block, 2:15 a.m. July 29. A man demanded property from a male pedestrian, then hit him on the head with a handgun and robbed him of a cellphone and a wallet containing cash.

Waterway and Country Club drives, 1:45 a.m. July 28. A gunman demanded money from a male pedestrian, who fled.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Chesapeake Dr., 3100 block, 10:52 a.m. July 28. Two men entered a residence by breaking a rear window. Nothing was reported stolen. A 27-year-old Dumfries man and a 20-year-old Fairfax man were arrested.

HAYMARKET AREA ASSAULTS

Heythorpe Ct., 13600 block, 4:10 a.m. July 26. A male intruder was in the back yard of a residence when two residents saw him. The man entered a neighbor's open garage, and the residents confronted and attempted to detain him. The man assaulted them and fled on foot. A 25-year-old man and a 19-year-old Gainesville woman were arrested.

MANASSAS AREA SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Golden Leaf Cir. area, July 24. A man sexually assaulted a female juvenile acquaintance during the past two years. A 31-year-old Manassas man was arrested.

Sharpsburg Ct. area, July 22. Two men sexually assaulted a female juvenile acquaintance over several years. One of the men also sexually assaulted a woman. A 42-year-old Woodbridge man and a 34-year-old Manassas man were arrested.

WEAPONS

Juliet Lane, 8000 block, 3:55 a.m. July 28. Several gunshots were heard.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Automotive Dr., 10600 block, 9 p.m. July 28 to 10:30 a.m. July 29. Cash was stolen from a business entered by forcing a side door and several interior doors.

WOODBRIDGE AREA SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Dillingham Sq., 12400 block, 4:40 p.m. July 28. A man in a parking lot grabbed a woman's chest, then fled in a vehicle.

Lexington Ct. area, July 28. A man sexually assaulted a female acquaintance while she was sleeping. A 25-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

Rainbow Court and Bancroft Lane area, July 25. A man sexually assaulted a female acquaintance when she was a juvenile in the 1990s. A 50-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

ASSAULTS

Belleville Ave., 14300 block, 11 p.m. July 23. During an argument, two women assaulted another woman, who was hit in the face and torso with a metal pipe. The woman was treated for injuries. Two Woodbridge women, 33 and 34, were arrested.

Jefferson Davis Hwy., 13700 block, 2:27 a.m. July 28. During a fight in a parking lot, a man attempted to drive away. Someone fired a weapon at the vehicle, injuring the man in the head. He drove himself to a hospital, where he was treated for injuries.

Potomac Mills Rd., 14300 block, 1:06 a.m. July 29. During a fight, a man stabbed another man with a knife. The injured man was taken to a hospital. A 22-year-old Manassas man was arrested.

Sutton Pl., 16600 block, 7:36 p.m. July 22. A group of men assaulted a male acquaintance and a woman who had attempted to intervene. Two Woodbridge men, 22 and 24, and a 22-year-old Springfield man were arrested.

WEAPONS

Gina Pl., 3200 block, 1:40 a.m. July 26. Someone fired a weapon at a residence, damaging a kitchen cabinet.

INDECENT EXPOSURE

G St., 12:04 a.m. July 31. A man exposed himself to a female juvenile acquaintance.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Aztec Pl., 12300 block, 2:29 a.m. July 29. A man entered a residence through an unlocked front door. He fled with a laptop computer when a resident found him in the kitchen.

Cardin Pl., 15100 block, 3 to 4:30 p.m. July 23. A handgun and a laptop computer were stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked door.

Dyers Mills Ct., 2600 block, 5:30 a.m. to 1:50 p.m. July 30. Items were stolen from a residence entered by prying a front door.

Emberdale Ct., 14800 block, 2 to 8 p.m. July 23. Someone attempted to enter a residence by tampering with a front door.

Island House Loop, 12800 block, 3:57 a.m. July 29. A man attempted to enter a residence by forcing a rear door. He fled when a resident saw him.

Mayflower Dr., 2000 block, 12:45 to 2:30 a.m. July 26. A handgun was stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked rear door.

Rockinghorse Dr., 14100 block, 3 p.m. July 18 to 3:45 p.m. July 23. A video game system and equipment were stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked basement window.

Woodside Dr., 1600 block, 10:13 p.m. July 26. Cash was stolen from a business.

York Dr., 2000 block, 11:30 a.m. July 24. Jewelry was stolen from a residence entered by forcing a rear door. Three men fled from the residence when a resident returned home.

VANDALISM

Darbydale Ave., 14800 block, 3:30 p.m. July 26 to 8 a.m. July 27. A sign in front of a school was damaged.
