Anne Arundel County and Howard County crime report


SECTION: METRO; Pg. T21


LENGTH: 1558 words


Anne Arundel County

These were among incidents reported by Anne Arundel County police. For information, call 410-222-8050.

Rewards for information

Metro Crime Stoppers will pay up to $2,000 for information leading to arrests and indictments in connection with these and other felonies. Visitmetrocrimestoppers.net, call the hotline at 866-756-2587 or text 274637. For text messages, type the letters "mcs" without the quote marks in the text field, then hit the space key before writing the crime tip. If the text is received, you will receive an acknowledgment.

ANNAPOLIS AREA

ROBBERIES

Annapolis Mall, 5:04 p.m. Feb. 23. Three males threatened a couple in a parking garage and robbed them of a laptop, then fled in a black BMW. On Feb. 29, a District man, 18, was charged with robbery.

ARNOLD AREA

INDECENT EXPOSURE INCIDENTS

College Pkwy., 100 block, Feb. 16 to Feb. 22. After receiving several reports of a male in a silver vehicle exposing himself at different campus locations, police detained a man driving a 2009 Honda. An Annapolis man, 28, was charged with three counts of indecent exposure and two counts of disorderly conduct. 

BROOKLYN PARK AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Charles St., 200 block, 10:08 a.m. March 7. Responding to a report of a break-in, police saw a man jump from the second floor of a residence to the back yard. An Arbutus man, 29, was arrested at the scene. He was charged with several counts of burglary and related violations.

10th Ave., 300 block, 4:45 a.m. March 8. Two males seen carrying property through a yard at a residence were arrested in a nearby area. Two Brooklyn Park men, ages 22 and 25, were charged with first-degree burglary, theft and trespassing.

CROFTON AREA

SEXUAL ASSAULTS 

Crofton Center, 1600 block, 6:28 p.m. March 1. A male displayed sexually explicit cellphone-photos to a minor at a store.

FORT MEADE AREA

ROBBERIES

Clark Rd., 1100 block, 10:48 a.m. Feb. 29. A group of males attacked a teenager in a school hallway and robbed him of a cellphone and a coat. Two Severn men, ages 18 and 19, were charged with first- and second-degree assault, reckless endangerment, robbery, conspiracy to commit robbery and theft. Two Severn males, ages 16 and 17, were charged with robbery, second-degree assault, theft and threatening a student on school property. The victim was treated for his injuries at a hospital.

GLEN BURNIE AREA

PEEPING TOM INCIDENTS

Ritchie Hwy., 6600 block, 6:10 p.m. March 4. A male took photos inside a women's restroom at a restaurant.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Southbridge Dr., 100 block, 10:19 p.m. March 7. While responding to a report of a break-in at a vacant apartment, police received a cellphone report of a robbery at a nearby location. That report was false, and a man found inside the apartment was determined to have made that call to divert police. A man, 32, of no fixed address, was charged with third- and fourth-degree burglary and with telephone misuse.

Annapolis

These were among incidents reported by the Annapolis Police Department. For information, call 410-268-9000. To anonymously report non-emergency crime or suspicious activity, call 410-280-2583.

WEAPONS OFFENSES

President St., 1000 block, March 6. A man wielding a handgun was arrested. A Brooklyn man, 44, was charged with possession of a firearm, possession of a controlled dangerous substance and almost a dozen traffic violations.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Admiral Dr., 200 block, 9:30 p.m. March 2 to 10:30 a.m. March 3. A laptop and four chrome hubcaps were stolen from an unlocked vehicle in a driveway.

Bowman Dr., 1800 block, 7:30 p.m. Feb. 28 to 6:30 a.m. Feb. 29. A green Huffy mountain bike was stolen.

Bywater Rd. and Belle Dr., 1:30 p.m. Feb. 21 to 4:30 a.m. March 4. License plates were among property stolen from an unlocked vehicle.

Mooring Point Ct., unit block, 4:30 p.m. Feb. 26 to 7 a.m. Feb. 27. A digital media player and a Global Positioning System device were stolen from an unlocked vehicle. Three other unlocked vehicles parked nearby were searched, with nothing reported missing.

Ridgely Ave., unit block, 9 a.m. to 3 p.m. Feb. 23. A GPS device was among property stolen from a convertible that had been parked with its top down.

Tyler Ave., 1300 block, 9 p.m. March 3 to 2 a.m. March 4. The contents of a piggybank and a bottle containing coins were stolen from a residence entered by forcing a back door.

Woodlawn Ave., 100 block, 3 p.m. March 5 to 8 a.m. March 6. A GPS device was stolen from a vehicle.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Annapolitan Lane, 500 block, 10:30 to 11:59 p.m. March 3. A green 2002 Ford Explorer was stolen.

Greenbriar Lane, 600 block, 8:30 to 8:40 p.m. March 6. A black 1999 Acura four-door sedan was stolen using keys left in the ignition.

Taylor Ave., 600 block, 6:50 p.m. March 1. A vehicle that had been left with its engine running was stolen from behind a store by a man fleeing from a security guard after being confronted while trying to shoplift a case of vodka. The vehicle was recovered a short time later in the 400 block of Captains Circle. Located nearby, an Annapolis man, 49, was arrested.

Howard County

These were among incidents reported by the Howard County Police Department. For information, call 410-313-2236. To anonymously provide information about these and other crimes, call the Stop Crime tip line: 410-313-7867.

CLARKSVILLE AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Running Fence Lane, 12200 block, Jan. 15. A small refrigerator was stolen from a vacant residence. There was no sign of forced entry.

Silent Sun Pl., 5800 block, 9:01 p.m. March 2 to 6:30 a.m. March 3. Cash was stolen from a wallet at a residence entered through an open garage.

COLUMBIA AREA

ROBBERIES

Little Patuxent Pkwy., 10300 block, 9:30 p.m. March 2. A male teenager demanded cash from a pedestrian outside a restaurant, then pushed the victim into bushes and fled empty-handed with several accomplices. No injuries were reported.

Little Patuxent Pkwy., 10300 block, 7 p.m. March 3. A group of males at a mall robbed a male of cash at knifepoint.

Little Patuxent Pkwy., 10300 block, 9:08 p.m. March 3. Two males robbed a mall security guard of his cellphone at gunpoint.

Little Patuxent Pkwy., 10300 block, 4:11 p.m. March 4. A male teenager in a mall parking lot grabbed a female from behind and tried to take her cellphone. After a struggle, he fled empty-handed. No injuries were reported.

Little Patuxent Pkwy., 7 p.m. March 7. Three males demanded cash from two pedestrians near a bus stop, then fled empty-handed when the victims said that they had none.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Cloudleap Ct., 8700 block, 2:49 a.m. March 2. A safe was stolen from a dry-cleaning business entered by forcing a front door.

Cloudleap Ct., 8700 block, 2:59 a.m. March 2. An attempt was made to enter a store by forcing a front door. Nothing was reported missing.

Columbia Rd., 5400 block, 7:30 a.m. to 3 p.m. March 5. Jewelry was stolen from a residence. There was no sign of forced entry.

Covered Wagon Dr., 9600 block, 10 a.m. to 5:55 p.m. March 2. A flat-screen TV and laptops were stolen from a residence entered by forcing the front door.

Hickory Ridge Rd., 10700 block, 6:30 a.m. to 10 p.m. March 7. Cash was stolen from an apartment.

Little Foxes Run, 6100 block, 5 to 10:15 p.m. March 2. Computers, cash, jewelry and an identification badge were stolen from a residence entered through a door on the second floor.

Minstrel Way, 7000 block, 4 p.m. March 3 to 6 a.m. March 5. Two generators and a cordless drill were stolen from a construction trailer entered by removing a lock.

Route 175, 6600 block, noon Feb. 26 to 9 a.m. March 6. A shed was entered by kicking in a door. Nothing was reported missing.

Swift Stream Pl., 10400 block, 12:24 p.m. March 1. A computer was stolen from a residence.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Little Patuxent Pkwy., 10300 block, 10:09 p.m. March 5. A green 1999 Honda Accord was stolen.

ELKRIDGE AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Race Rd., 6500 block, Feb. 27 to March 1. A stamp collection, a collection of model cars, sports memorabilia and rare coins were stolen from a storage container in a building accessed by cutting a hole in a fence.

Lark Brown Rd., 8400 block, 7:04 p.m. March 3. Jewelry and cash were stolen from a residence entered by kicking in the front door.

ELLICOTT CITY AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Baltimore National Pike, 8300 block, 2:59 a.m. March 8. A display case of cigars was stolen from a gas station entered by breaking a window.

Dorsey Hall Dr., 4900 block, 9:45 a.m. to 4:45 p.m. March 7. Prescription medication, DVDs, CDs and a computer-docking station were stolen from a residence entered by forcing the front door.

Raleigh Tavern Lane, 10200 block, Feb. 20 to Feb. 25. A set of golf clubs was stolen from a garage entered through a side door.

Waterloo Rd., 5600 block, 12:07 p.m. March 6. Responding to a report of people seen inside a house that had been partially burned down, police arrested two Ellicott City men, ages 19 and 23. Charges included first-, third- and fourth-degree burglary, theft, drug possession, destruction of property and with making a false statement to police.

LAUREL AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Barrel House Rd., 9800 block, noon to 2:30 p.m. March 2. Laptops were stolen from a residence entered by kicking in a front door.

Covered Wagon Dr., 9600 block, 10 a.m. to 5:55 p.m. March 2. A flat-screen TV and laptops were stolen from a residence entered by forcing the front door.

Prince William County crime report


SECTION: METRO; Pg. T26


LENGTH: 954 words


Prince William County crime report Prince William County crime reportAmong incidents reported by police in Prince William County, Manassas and Manassas Park.

Prince William

These were among incidents reported by Prince William County police. For information, call 703-792-7245.

DUMFRIES AREA

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

John Robinson Lane, 3200 block, Sept. 6. A man sexually assaulted a male juvenile several times between 1999 and 2002. A 42-year-old man was arrested. 

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Woodland Dr., 18400 block, 8:30 a.m. to 2:50 p.m. Sept. 10. A safe was stolen from a residence entered by forcing a rear door.

GAINESVILLE AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Lee Hwy., 14600 block, 4:59 a.m. Sept. 11. Two businesses were entered by breaking the front glass doors and cash registers were stolen.

HAYMARKET AREA

ASSAULTS

Doe Ridge Rd., 15100 block, 7:59 a.m. Sept. 7. A tripwire and nails were placed in a yard of a residence. A woman and a Social Services case worker were walking to the residence to remove a foster child when the woman stepped on a nail. A male juvenile barricaded himself in a basement room but eventually surrendered to police. A 16-year-old Haymarket male was arrested.

MANASSAS AREA

ASSAULTS

Bosbury Ct., 7500 block, 7:31 p.m. Sept. 11. During an argument, a man pulled out a machete and chased a male acquaintance.

ROBBERIES

Battleview Pkwy., 10700 block, 8:37 a.m. Sept. 10. A woman knocked on the door of a hotel room. When the male and female occupants answered, the woman, with a knife, forcibly entered the room, followed by two gunmen. They tied up the male's hands and feet and fled with cash, a laptop computer and two cellphones.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Blandsford Dr., 8100 block, 8:50 p.m. Sept. 10 to 6:50 a.m. Sept. 11. A TV was stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked rear window.

Centreville Rd., 7500 block, 9 p.m. Sept. 10 to 6 a.m. Sept. 11. Cash, a laptop computer and 200 cartons of cigarettes were stolen from a service station entered by forcing a side window.

Stokely Dr., 8500 block, noon Sept. 2 to 2 p.m. Sept. 10. A residence was entered by damaging a front door.

TRIANGLE AREA

PROSTITUTION

Locust Shade Dr., 4700 block, Sept. 4 and 5. During an investigation, undercover detectives made contact with several individuals soliciting sexual acts inside a park. A 44-year-old Dumfries man, a 67-year-old Alexandria man, a 56-year-old Waldorf, Md., man, a 43-year-old Stafford man, a 76-year-old Ruther Glen, Va., man, a 44-year-old Woodbridge man and a 25-year-old Stafford woman were arrested.

WOODBRIDGE AREA

ASSAULTS

Ironwood Rd., 1300 block, 1:50 a.m. Sept. 5. During an argument, a man assaulted a female acquaintance and attempted to choke her. A 20-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

ROBBERIES

Emberdale Dr. and Ensbrook Lane, 10:42 p.m. Sept. 10. Three men assaulted a male pedestrian and robbed him of a wallet.

Gordon Blvd., 12500 block, 2:18 p.m. Sept. 6. Two men robbed a convenience store of cash at gunpoint.

Harbor Dr., 12800 block, 11:25 a.m. Sept. 5. A former employee broke several windows of a carwash with a metal bar. When he approached a manager with the bar, the manager gave him cash and the man fled. A 46-year-old man was arrested.

Minnieville Rd., 13400 block, 5:31 p.m. Sept. 7. Two males grabbed a cellphone from a male pedestrian at gunpoint.

Minnieville Rd. and Bobcat Ct., 7:28 p.m. Sept. 8. Two men in a vehicle stopped in front of a male pedestrian, exited the vehicle, assaulted the pedestrian and robbed him of cash.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Alabama Ave., 14800 block, 6:15 a.m. to 4 p.m. Sept. 11. A TV was stolen from a residence entered by prying a rear door.

Barksdale St., 14700 block, 7 a.m. to 5 p.m. Sept. 11. Video game systems, jewelry and clothes were stolen from a residence entered by forcing a rear door.

Bronson Dr., 3300 block, 11 a.m. to 2:30 p.m. Sept. 8. Two computers and clothes were stolen from a residence entered by forcing a front door.

Horner Rd., 1400 block, 3:17 a.m. Sept. 8. A man entered a residence through an open window and grabbed a sleeping female juvenile. When she woke up and screamed, the man fled.

Jefferson Davis Hwy., 13300 block, 8 p.m. Sept. 4 to 1:30 p.m. Sept. 5. A business was entered through an unlocked rear window.

Jefferson Davis Hwy., 13600 block, 6 p.m. Sept. 4 to 10 a.m. Sept. 5. Cash and a water pump were stolen from a business entered through an unlocked side door.

Jefferson Davis Hwy., 14600 block, 2:20 a.m. Sept. 8. Cash was stolen from a business entered through a rear door.

Midway Ct., 5200 block, 10:30 a.m. to 10:30 p.m. Sept. 7. A residence was entered by forcing a rear door.

Seminole Rd., 3000 block, 7 a.m. to 11:09 p.m. Sept. 6. Two TVs and two laptop computers were stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked rear window.

Manassas

These were among the incidents reported by Manassas police. For more information, call 703-257-8000.

ROBBERIES

Cavalry Lane, 8500 block, midnight Sept. 6. Four males assaulted a male pedestrian and robbed him of a knife. Two Manassas men, 18 and 19, a 19-year-old Woodbridge man and a male juvenile were arrested.

Digges Rd., 8400 block, 2:25 a.m. Sept. 7. A woman hit a female pedestrian in the head and robbed her of a wallet.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Euclid Ave., 9100 block, 5 p.m. Sept. 6 to 6:30 a.m. Sept. 9. Several truck tires were stolen from a business.

Lake Jackson and Libeau drives, Sept. 2 to 6. Columns and steel beams were stolen from a construction site.

Nikki Pl., 9200 block, 2:50 a.m. Sept. 10. Cash was stolen from a vehicle.

Richmond Ave., 8600 block, 9:25 a.m. Sept. 10. A GPS unit and clothes were stolen from two vehicles.

Manassas Park

No reports were received from Manassas Park police for this edition of Local Living. For information, call 703-361-1136.

November 3, 2011 Thursday 8:11 PM EST 


Prince William County crime report Prince William County crime report


SECTION: Metro; Pg. T33


LENGTH: 1206 words


Prince William County

The following incidents were recently reported by Prince William County police. For information, call 703-792-7245.

DUMFRIES AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Eclipse Dr., 15100 block, 10:30 p.m. Oct. 24 to 4 a.m. Oct. 25. A wallet and a watch were stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked side door.

Lotus Ct., 18400 block, 11 a.m. Oct. 20 to 9 p.m. Oct. 21. A TV and a microwave oven were stolen from a residence.

HAYMARKET AREA ASSAULTS  

Dominion Valley Dr., 15500 block, An unidentified object hit a moving vehicle, breaking a window. No injuries were reported.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Gaines Mill Cir., 15100 block, Oct. 22. A dishwasher and speakers were stolen from a house under construction.

Stoney Creek Ct., 14500 block, Oct. 22. Cabinets were stolen from a house under construction.

MANASSAS AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Bank Beaver Ct., 12000 block, 11 a.m. to 2:30 p.m. Oct. 23. Someone attempted to enter a residence by breaking a rear window.

Lady Jane Loop, 11200 block, 1:43 a.m. Oct. 22. A man opened a front door of a residence and shouted at a resident and her guests. When the resident attempted to close the door, the man blocked it with his foot. The man left, then returned a short time later with a large metal object. A 21-year-old Manassas man was arrested.

Moore Dr., 11300 block, 6:30 a.m. to 5:30 p.m. Oct. 18. Jewelry was stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked window.

Vermont Pl., 8200 block, 10 a.m. to 6:15 p.m. Oct. 21. A laptop, jewelry and coins were stolen from a residence.

NOKESVILLE AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Fitzwater Dr., 12800 block, 10 p.m. Oct. 20 to 6 a.m. Oct. 21. Cash was stolen from a restaurant entered by breaking a front glass door.

TRIANGLE AREA THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Belleau Woods Dr., 19300 block, Oct. 13 to Oct. 23. A video game system and games were stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked rear door.

WOODBRIDGE AREA SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Carter Lane, 12:15 p.m. Oct. 21. A man sexually assaulted two female juvenile relatives. A Woodbridge man was arrested.

ASSAULTS

Georgetown Rd. and Geddy Ct., 9:01 p.m. Oct. 24. A rear passenger in a vehicle fired BBs at a male juvenile pedestrian, who was later treated for injuries.

Kentucky Ave., 1500 block, 2:32 a.m. Oct. 26. During an argument, a woman threw a glass at a male acquaintance, hitting him in the face. The man was treated for injuries. A 31-year-0ld Woodbridge woman was arrested.

Occoquan Rd., 13300 block, 11:14 p.m. Oct. 21. A woman entered a vehicle parked at a convenience store and ordered a female passenger to get out. When the passenger refused, the woman assaulted her. The passenger took the key from the ignition, and the assailant fled with another woman. Two Woodbridge women, ages 28 and 45, were arrested.

Pilgrim Dr., 2000 block, 6:50 a.m. Oct. 19. During an argument, a man assaulted a female acquaintance, knocked her down and kept her in a basement room. A 33-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

WEAPONS

Candlewood Ct., 14700 block, 1:27 a.m. Oct. 23. During an argument, a man pointed a handgun at a male acquaintance. No injuries were reported. A 32-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

Potomac Mills Rd., 2700 block, 3:25 p.m. Oct. 20. During a fight, a man with a knife threatened a male acquaintance. A 19-year-old Silver Spring, Md., man was arrested.

ROBBERIES

Lost Canyon Ct., 15000 block, 8:24 p.m. Oct. 19. Two men robbed a pizza deliveryman of a wallet and pizzas at gunpoint.

Old Bridge Rd., 3500 block, 11:49 p.m. Oct. 21. A man implied he had a handgun and robbed a gas station of cash. He then took off outer clothing he had been wearing and ignited it behind a carwash at the service station. The fire damaged the business. No injuries were reported. A 33-year-old man was arrested in the area.

Prince William Pkwy., 2800 block, 3:09 p.m. Oct. 21. A man implied he had a weapon and robbed a jewelry store of two rings.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Arum Pl., 15000 block, 8 a.m. to 7 p.m. Oct. 17. Someone attempted to enter a residence by breaking a fence door lock and opening a rear door.

Cara Dr., 12800 block, noon to 3 p.m. Oct. 21. A laptop was stolen from a residence.

Delano Dr., 14600 block, 9 a.m. Oct. 15 to 3 p.m. Oct. 18. Copper piping was stolen from a vacant residence entered by forcing open a rear door.

Dillon Ave., 14800 block, 6 p.m. Oct. 7 to 8 a.m. Oct. 16. Copper piping was stolen from two residences.

Fullerton Rd., 14300 block, noon Sept. 20 to 10 a.m. Oct. 18. A refrigerator and copper piping were stolen from a vacant residence entered by breaking a rear window.

Horner Rd., 1700 block, 9 a.m. to 9 p.m. Oct. 21. A cellphone was stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked front door.

Iowa Ct., 1700 block, 12:47 p.m. Oct. 21. Someone attempted to enter a building by forcing a rear door.

Lodge Terr., 15200 block, 8:30 p.m. Oct. 18 to 5:30 a.m. Oct. 19. A purse containing cash and other property was stolen from a residence.

Thenia Pl., 1600 block, 6 a.m. to 4 p.m. Oct. 19. Someone attempted to enter a residence by removing a screen from a front window.

Wentwood Lane, 15200 block, 10:40 a.m. to 10 p.m. Oct. 22. Cash and other property were stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked rear door.

VANDALISM

Welsh Lane, 4400 block, 10:30 p.m. Oct. 22 to 7:42 a.m. Oct. 23. Someone fired BBs at a law enforcement vehicle parked at a residence. A rear window was broken.

Manassas

The following incidents were recently reported by Manassas police. For information, call 703-257-8000.

ROBBERIES

Beech Place and Byrd Drive, 9:15 p.m. Oct. 21. Two men robbed a male pedestrian of cash at gunpoint.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Brackets Ford Cir., 10400 block, 8 p.m. Oct. 21 to 8 p.m. Oct. 23. Cash and jewelry were stolen from a residence.

Cockrell Rd., 9800 block, noon Oct. 9 to 8 a.m. Oct. 10. Property was stolen from a business.

Grant Ave., 10100 block, 3 to 3:40 a.m. Oct. 20. Cash and a wallet were stolen from a vehicle.

Stonewall Rd., 8500 block, 5 p.m. Oct. 17 to 3 p.m. Oct. 19. An MP3 player and a phone-battery charger were stolen from an unlocked vehicle.

Tapok Dr., 9500 block, 6:30 to 11:40 p.m. Oct. 22. Cash, a TV, a laptop, a video game system, an MP3 player and clothes were stolen from a residence.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Mathis Ave., 9100 block, A 2003 Ford truck was stolen.

VANDALISM

Bayberry Ave., 9200 block, 1:25 a.m. Oct. 23. A male hit a vehicle several times with an object, damaging the vehicle.

Manassas Park

The following incident was recently reported by Manassas Park police. For information, call 703-361-1136.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Centreville Rd., 8500 block, 7:22 p.m. Oct. 18. A man stole merchandise from a store. A 23-year-old Manassas Park man was arrested.

- Compiled by Sarah Lane

Alexandria

These were among incidents reported by the Alexandria Police Department. For information, call 703-838-4636 or visit www.alexandriava.gov/police. SEXUAL ASSAULTS King St., 700 block, 12:34 p.m. Aug. 16. A sexual assault was reported. An arrest was made.

ASSAULT

Armistead St. N., 400 block, 10:28 p.m. Aug. 22. An assault was reported. An arrest was made.

Arlington

These were among incidents reported by the Arlington County Police Department. For information, call 703-558-2222 or visit www.arlingtoncrimesolvers.org.

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Custis Rd. N., 2400 block, 2:34 a.m. Aug. 19. A man grabbed a woman from behind and forced her to the ground. She bit the assailant's hand. When she screamed for help, he ran away.

Kemper Rd. S., 3600 block, 4:35 p.m. Aug. 21. During a fight, a person beat a roommate. An Arlington man, 19, was charged with malicious wounding. The roommate was taken to a hospital.

Jefferson Davis Hwy. S., 2600 block, 8:08 p.m. Aug. 19. An Alexandria man, 35, was charged with impersonating a police officer at a car rental business.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Chesterfield Rd. S., 5000 block, 7 a.m. to 3 p.m. Aug. 15. Cash was stolen from a residence entered by forcing a door.

Lee Hwy. N., 2400 block, 12:45 to 1:15 a.m. Aug. 17. Cigarettes were among items stolen from a gas station. After a short pursuit by police, a 25-year-old Arlington man and a 20-year-old man of no fixed address were charged with burglary.

Washington Blvd. N., 6100 block, 8:43 a.m. to 1:30 p.m. Aug. 20. Jewelry and silverware were stolen from a residence entered through a door.

Wilson Blvd., 2700 block, midnight to 9 a.m. Aug. 19. Cash, an iPad and a laptop computer were stolen from a business.

First St. N., 4700 block, 5 p.m. Aug. 16 to 1:15 p.m. Aug. 17. A safe and a computer were stolen from a residence.

The Washington Post


May 31, 2001 Thursday  
Final Edition


CRIME WATCH


SECTION: ALEXANDRIA - ARLINGTON EXTRA; Pg. T12


LENGTH: 1493 words


The following were among crime reports received recently from the Alexandria Police Department. For further information, call 703-838-4636.

SEXUAL ASSAULTS 

KENMORE AVE., 4800 block, 12:01 to 12:40 a.m. May 13. A 23-year-old Springfield man was arrested and charged with the rape of a teenage girl. The girl had been at a party at this location and was waiting in a car nearby. The man got in the car with her, then chased her when she fled. The attack took place after he dragged her into the woods.

ROBBERIES

REED AND WILSON AVENUES, 12:30 a.m. May 18. Two men attacked and took money from a 20-year-old Alexandria pedestrian. The victim was knocked to the ground and, after reporting the incident to police, was hospitalized with a broken jaw.  

MILAN DR., 3800 block, 11:25 p.m. May 21. Two men, one armed with a shotgun, took money from a 36-year-old Alexandria man who had just parked his car near his home. The robbers fled on foot.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

GLEBE RD. W., 800 block, 12:30 to 7:50 p.m. May 21. Four leather coats and a VCR were stolen from a residence entered by forcing a front door.

MANOR RD., 900 block, 7:30 a.m. to 5:30 p.m. May 23. Electronic equipment and jewelry were stolen from a residence entered by forcing a front door.

PICKETT ST. S., 800 block, 3 p.m. May 19 to 10:21 a.m. May 20. A business was entered by forcing two interior doors. Nothing was reported missing.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

ALFRED ST. N., 700 block, 11 a.m. May 16 to 6 a.m. May 17. A tan 1992 Ford Ranger pickup truck was stolen.

BEAUREGARD ST., 1900 block, 9:09 a.m. to 5:45 p.m. May 18. A white 1997 Dodge Intrepid was stolen.

BRUCE ST., 3900 block, 8 p.m. May 14 to 7 a.m. May 15. A gray 1988 Ford Escort was stolen.

KENMORE AVE., 4700 block, 5:34 p.m. May 16 to 7 a.m. May 17. A silver 1991 Toyota Camry DX was stolen.

KENMORE AVE., 4800 block, 5:30 p.m. May 16 to 5:45 a.m. May 18. A red 1994 Plymouth Acclaim was stolen.

MARTHA CUSTIS AVE., 1400 block, 5 p.m. May 19 to 7:30 p.m. May 20. A white 1983 Chevrolet van was stolen.

REYNOLDS ST. S., 200 block, 10 p.m. May 22 to 2 p.m. May 23. A purple 1993 Geo was stolen.

VAN DORN ST. S., 500 block, 5:30 p.m. May 15 to 5:30 p.m. May 17. A yellow 2000 International truck was stolen.

WILSON AVE., 3500 block, 8 to 8:45 p.m. May 21. A white 1992 Chevrolet Caprice was stolen.

The following were among crime reports received recently by the Arlington County Police Department. For further information, call 703-228-4050.

REWARDS FOR INFORMATION

Arlington County Crime Solvers, a nonprofit community organization, will pay up to $ 1,000 for information leading to an arrest in connection with these and other felonies. Call the 24-hour hot line at 703-522-8477 or the Arlington County Police Department at 703-558-2222. Callers may remain anonymous and are not asked to testify in court.

ASSAULTS

GREENBRIER ST. S., 800 block, 7:20 p.m. May 24. A car stopped near two Arlington men standing near their car. After a male occupant of the car hit one of the men in the chest with a bottle, two other males jumped out of the car and chased the victims. They caught them and beat them with a baseball bat, then fled in the car in which they had arrived. The two victims were treated at a hospital for injuries that were not life-threatening.

STAFFORD STREET N. AND FAIRFAX DRIVE N., 7:30 p.m. May 21. Police responding to a report of a man who had fallen in the roadway found a man suffering from injuries consistent with having been assaulted. Although there were several bystanders when police arrived, they all left without speaking with officers. Anyone with information about the incident is asked to contact Detective Viet Nguyen at 703-228-7402.

ROBBERIES

ADAMS ST. N., 1800 block, 4:30 p.m. May 19. Three youths demanded money from a 20-year-old Arlington man standing near his car. When he refused, he was restrained while one of the robbers took his CD player from the car. A short time later, two 17-year-old Arlington youths and a 16-year-old Arlington youth were arrested.

GEORGE MASON DR. N., 300 block, 10:30 p.m. May 22. A 21-year-old Arlington man parking his car was robbed of cash by a gunman who also took the victim's cell phone and car keys before fleeing on foot.

LEE HWY. N., 5400 block, 4:15 p.m. May 16. A man took several bottles of beer from a drugstore cooler and started to leave without paying. A clerk who tried to stop him was punched in the arm.

WILSON BLVD. N., 1600 block, 9:30 p.m. May 22. A man with a knife tried to rob a 43-year-old Arlington man in front of a convenience store. The victim refused and ran across the street. Police said a similar incident took place shortly thereafter in the same area.

SEVENTH RD. S., 5200 block, 11:20 p.m. May 24. Two men came up behind a 38-year-old Arlington man walking toward his apartment and knocked him to the ground. The men fled after taking the victim's car keys, wallet and cash. No injuries were reported.

INDECENT EXPOSURE

FOUR MILE RUN DR. S., 3500 block, 3 p.m. May 24. A male pedestrian stopped near a 52-year-old Arlington woman waiting by her car, unzipped his pants and urinated on the street in front of her. He then walked away.

GLEBE RD. S., 2400 block, 9:47 p.m. May 23. A man exposed himself to a woman in her hotel room. The man, also a guest at the hotel, was asked to leave but was not charged.

RANDOLPH ST. S., 1600 block, 5 p.m. May 21. A man fondled himself in view of a woman and her son in Douglas Park.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

CLARENDON BLVD. N., 2200 block, 7:45 p.m. May 22 to 6 a.m. May 23. Cash was taken from a parking booth entered by force.

COLONIAL TER. N., 1500 block, 8:05 a.m. to noon May 21. A watch and cash were taken from an apartment that was entered by force, then ransacked.

COLONIAL TER. N., 1600 block, 11 a.m. May 17 to 7:30 a.m. May 18. Property was taken from a residence entered by force.

CULPEPER ST., 2200 block, 2:50 a.m. to 4:40 p.m. May 18. A coin collection was taken from a basement storage area in a residence entered by force.

DITTMAR RD. N., 3800 block, 3:30 to 4 p.m. May 16. Cash was taken from a residence entered by force.

FORT SCOTT DR. S., 2800 block, 1:45 a.m. May 23. A 19-year-old Arlington man saw two men tampering with his car. The men had left before police arrived but were located a short time later in Alexandria, driving a stolen vehicle. Two District men, ages 18 and 19, were arrested.

GLEBE RD. N., 1500 block, 2:57 a.m. May 21. Police responding to a report of a break-in at a building found an intruder in the basement. A 31-year-old man of no fixed address was arrested.

INGLEWOOD ST. N., 1600 block, 9:15 to 10:45 a.m. May 22. Cash and a sterling silver flatware set were taken from a residence entered by force.

LEE HWY. N., 3900 block, 5:45 p.m. May 18 to 10 a.m. May 19. Property was taken from a residence entered by force.

PERSHING DR. N., 2200 block, 9:45 p.m. May 20 to 1:26 a.m. May 21. Money was taken from a change machine in a business entered by force.

SCOTT ST. N., 1200 block, 7 to 10 p.m. May 19. A DVD player, CDs and audio tapes were taken from an apartment entered by force.

UTAH ST. N., 1200 block, 4:20 a.m. May 15. Responding to a report of a man trying to break into a house, police stopped a man with several fresh cuts and abrasions. A 26-year-old man of no fixed address was arrested after being identified by a witness to the attempted break-in.

WASHINGTON BLVD. N., 3400 block, 10:25 p.m. May 16. Police responding to an alarm at a business found an open rear window. A box containing cartons of cigarettes was missing.

WILSON BLVD. N., 2100 block, 2 to 5 a.m. May 21. Cash and cartons of cigarettes were taken from a store entered by force.

FIFTH ST. S., 3400 block, 4:30 to 10:40 p.m. May 24. A house being remodeled was entered by force. Tools were taken.

11TH ST. N., 2600 block, 11:45 p.m. May 20 to 7 a.m. May 21. Property was taken from a residence entered by force.

15TH ST. N., 4400 block, 2 to 4 p.m. May 16. A coin collection was taken from a residence entered by force.

15TH ST. N., 4600 block, 8:40 a.m. to 6:20 p.m. May 16. Jewelry and silver were taken from a residence entered by force.

PEEPING-TOM INCIDENTS

FORT MYER DR. N., 1300 block, 10:15 p.m. May 15. A 24-year-old Arlington woman heard a dog barking at her window and saw a man looking in. He fled before police arrived.

WOODLEY ST. S., 2900 block, 11:15 p.m. May 19. A person reported seeing a man looking in a neighbor's window.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

ROUTE 110, 1200 block, 11:45 p.m. May 14. A police officer on patrol near the Sycamore Street exit of Interstate 66 ran a check on a car with defective equipment and learned that it had been stolen in the District. The driver refused to stop and fled on southbound Route 110, leaving the car after crashing into a guardrail in the Pentagon South parking lot. After a foot chase, a 26-year-old District man was arrested.

-- Donna Mackie and Ria Manglapus

Prince William County crime report Prince William County crime report


SECTION: METRO; Pg. T27


LENGTH: 885 words


Prince William County

The following incidents were recently reported by Prince William County police. For information, call 703-792-7245.

BRISTOW AREA

ASSAULTS

Tides View Ct., 12600 block, 12:13 a.m. Aug. 29. A woman attempted to choke a medic who was responding to a person injured in a fall. When police officers attempted to restrain the woman, she kicked one of them on the chin. A 41-year-old Alexandria woman was arrested.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Bristow Center Dr., 10400 block, 10 p.m. Aug. 28 to 10 a.m. Aug. 29. Someone attempted to enter a restaurant by prying a rear door. 

DALE CITY AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Delaney Rd., 13800 block, 10:14 p.m. Sept. 4. A man allegedly attempted to steal a video game system from a residence. A resident detained the man until police arrived. A 19-year-old Dale City man was arrested.

Kerrydale Rd., 13500 block, 1:30 p.m. Sept. 1 to 4 p.m. Sept. 5. Copper piping and a microwave were stolen from a vacant residence entered by prying open a rear door.

DUMFRIES AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Jefferson Davis Hwy., 17000 block, 6:40 p.m. Sept. 1. A woman, with assistance from her children, stole merchandise from a store. A 30-year-old Dumfries woman was arrested and charged with shoplifting and contributing to the delinquency of a minor.

LAKE RIDGE AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Cornice Pl., 3400 block, 7:30 a.m. to 8 p.m. Aug. 30. A laptop and jewelry were stolen from a residence.

MANASSAS AREA

SEXUAL ASSAULTS 

Rosemary Dr. and Sudley Rd., 1:15 p.m. Sept. 3. A man asked a male juvenile if he could use his cellphone. The boy complied, and the man retrieved the boy's cellphone number. Later, the man called the boy's cellphone and reportedly solicited sexual acts. A 32-year-old Manassas man was arrested.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Camfield Ct., 11000 block, Aug. 21 to Aug. 23. A laptop was stolen from a residence.

Cub Run Ct., 10200 block, 2 to 3 p.m. Aug. 21. Electronics were stolen from a residence.

Lomond Dr., 10100 block, noon to 5 p.m. Aug. 26. Electronics were stolen from a residence.

Meadowbrook Woods and Champlain Dr., Aug. 27 to Aug. 29. Graffiti was spray-painted on park benches, sidewalks and other areas.

Pennsylvania Ave., 9800 block, 12:30 to 5 a.m. Aug. 30. An attempt was made to enter a business by prying a front door.

Powhatan St., 7800 block, Aug. 19 to Aug. 20. Electronics were stolen from a residence.

Scenic Point Pl., 6900 block, 7:30 a.m. to 5 p.m. Sept. 2. A TV was stolen from a residence entered by forcing open a side door.

Sudley Rd., 7100 block, 6 p.m. Aug. 27 to 8 a.m. Aug. 28. Tires were stolen from seven vehicles at a car dealership, and windows of each vehicle were broken.

TRIANGLE AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Fuller Heights Rd., 19000 block, 7 a.m. Sept. 2 to 1 p.m. Sept. 5. An attempt was made to enter a residence by prying a front door.

Queen Dr., 19000 block, 1:11 a.m. Sept. 1. Electronics and other items were stolen from a residence entered through a rear window.

WOODBRIDGE AREA

HOMICIDES

Hedgewood Dr., 13900 block, 11:30 p.m. Sept. 1. Kwang Hur, 75, was found dead in his residence. The case was under investigation.

SEXUAL INCIDENTS

Shaw Ct., 14300 block, Sept. 1. A man used the Internet to transmit child pornography. A 54-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested and charged with distribution of child pornography.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Kramer Estate Dr., 16300 block, Aug. 30 to Aug. 31. Electronics were stolen from a business.

Minnieville Rd., 13100 block, 9 a.m. Sept. 2 to 11 p.m. Sept. 5. Cash was stolen from a residence entered by prying open a side window.

VANDALISM

Princedale Dr., 13500 block, 2:30 p.m. Aug. 31 to 8 a.m. Sept. 1. Someone used an iron cover from a water shut-off valve to hit and damage a door at a school.

 Manassas

The following incidents were recently reported by Manassas police. For information, call 703-257-8000.

ROBBERIES

Devonshire Ct., 8600 block, 2 a.m. Aug. 28. Two men who had been involved in a fight were asked to leave a restaurant. The two left. They then entered a vehicle occupied by two men with whom they had talked during the night and forced one occupant to drive to another location. When they arrived, one occupant was hit with a handgun, and both occupants were robbed of cash. Two men were arrested.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Butternut Cir., 10300 block, 6:30 p.m. Sept. 1 to 8:30 a.m. Sept. 2. A Global Positioning System device was stolen from an unlocked vehicle.

McRae Ct., 9000 block, 6:30 to 7 a.m. Sept. 3. A man attempted to enter a residence through a sliding-glass door. He fled when confronted by a resident.

Stonewall Rd., 8400 block, 5 p.m. Sept 2 to 10:15 p.m. Sept. 3. A stereo and a pair of shoes were stolen from a vehicle.

VANDALISM

Dumfries Rd., 10400 block, 3:30 a.m. to 4 p.m. Sept. 4. A vehicle's rear-view mirror was vandalized.

Stevens Ct., 9100 block, 5:30 to 8 p.m. Sept. 3. A rear window of a vehicle was vandalized.

Manassas Park

The following incidents were recently reported by Manassas Park police. For information, call 703-361-1136.

ASSAULTS

Cartwright Ct., 8600 block, 1:49 a.m. Sept. 4. Investigating a report in connection with a vehicle, a police officer was hit by the vehicle. The male motorist fled on foot. The officer was taken to a hospital. A 21-year-old Manassas man was arrested.

VANDALISM

Jessica Dr., 9200 block, 4 p.m. Sept. 1 to 4:53 p.m. Sept. 2. A tire of a vehicle was slashed.

- Compiled by Sarah Lane

Crime Report


SECTION: EXTRAS; Pg. VA28


LENGTH: 1102 words


Alexandria

These were among incidents reported by the Alexandria Police Department. For information, call 703-838-4636 or visit http://www.alexandriava.gov/police.

SEXUAL ASSAULTS 

MOUNT JEFFERSON PARK AREA, 3 p.m. Nov. 20. A sexual assault occurred.

CAMERON RUN AREA, Nov. 21. A sexual assault occurred.

ASSAULTS

COMMONWEALTH AVE., 3200 block, 3:36 p.m. Nov. 21. An arrest was made in connection with an assault.

FAYETTE ST. N., 700 block, 4:56 a.m. Nov. 21. An assault occurred. 

HENRY AND KING STREETS, 10:20 p.m. Nov. 23. An assault occurred.

MONTGOMERY ST., 900 block, 10:40 p.m. Nov. 21. A person who had been in a fight reported an assault.

MOUNT VERNON AVE., 2400 block, 4:56 p.m. Nov. 20. An assault occurred.

ORONOCO ST., 1200 block, 10 p.m. Nov. 23. An assault occurred.

SEMINARY RD., 4600 block, 4:39 p.m. Nov. 19. An assault occurred.

SWAMP FOX RD., 200 block, 10:52 p.m. Nov. 20. An assault occurred.

UNION ST. S., 100 block, 1:43 a.m. Nov. 22. A man attacked a person from behind. The victim reportedly lost consciousness.

ROBBERIES

FRENCH ST. N., 1-100 block, 9:56 p.m. Nov. 23. Two men robbed a man at his residence of a wallet at gunpoint.

PAYNE ST. S., 300 block, 11:12 p.m. Nov. 23. Two men attacked a pedestrian, knocking him to the ground. The assailants robbed him at gunpoint of a briefcase containing cash, credit cards and a cellphone, then fled in a vehicle. The victim refused medical treatment.

TANEY AVE., 4300 block, 9:05 p.m. Nov. 20. Three males grabbed a man and robbed him of a wallet and a cellphone.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

CAMERON ST., 500 block, 10:34 a.m. Nov. 20. An expiration sticker was stolen from a vehicle's license plates.

CLIFF ST. N., 1700 block, 10:28 a.m. Nov. 22. A theft from a vehicle occurred.

COLUMBUS AND QUEEN STREETS, 9:49 a.m. Nov. 23. A theft occurred.

DUKE ST., 1700 block, 7:21 a.m. Nov. 19. A theft occurred.

IVERSON ST. N., 900 block, 1:49 p.m. A theft from a vehicle occurred.

JEFFERSON DAVIS HWY., 3400 block, 4:22 p.m. Nov. 21. Shoplifting occurred. An arrest was made.

KENWOOD AVE., 1500 block, 11 a.m. Nov. 19. Rims and tires were stolen from several vehicles in a parking lot.

KING ST., 1200 block, 1:45 p.m. Nov. 24. A theft occurred.

KING ST., 1200 block, 12:36 p.m. Nov. 20. A wallet and keys were taken from a counter at a business.

KING ST., 1700 block, 12:42 p.m. Nov. 19. A wallet was removed from a purse.

KING ST., 3600 block, 10:07 a.m. Nov. 23. A theft from a vehicle occurred.

MONROE AVE. E., 400 block, 8:59 p.m. Nov. 19. Shoplifting occurred. An arrest was made.

MOUNT VERNON AVE., 3000 block, 5:31 p.m. Nov. 24. A theft occurred.

ORONOCO ST., 700 block, 12:47 p.m. Nov. 21. A theft occurred.

PAYNE ST. S., 300 block, 3:30 p.m. Nov. 21. A theft from a vehicle occurred.

PRESTON RD. AND N. QUAKER LANE, 12:07 p.m. Nov. 23. A theft from a vehicle occurred.

ROYAL ST. S., 100 block, 10:24 a.m. Nov. 24. A theft occurred.

SEMINARY RD., 4900 block, 11:26 a.m. Nov. 23. A theft from a vehicle occurred.

WASHINGTON ST. N., 100 block, 12:39 p.m. Nov. 23. A wallet was stolen.

WASHINGTON ST. N., 700 block, 5:28 p.m. Nov. 19. A wallet was stolen from a vehicle while the motorist was pumping gas.

WASHINGTON ST. S., 800 block, 4:47 a.m. Nov. 24. A theft occurred.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

BRADDOCK RD. W., 4800 block, 8:17 a.m. Nov. 24. A vehicle theft occurred.

KENMORE AVE, 4700 block, 10:45 a.m. Nov. 19. A vehicle theft occurred.

PATRICK ST. N., 300 block, 2:28 p.m. Nov. 20. A TV and a radio were stolen from a vehicle. In an attempt to steal the vehicle, ignition wires were tampered with.

QUINCY ST., 1300 block, 6:02 a.m. Nov. 19. A vehicle theft occurred.

Arlington

These were among incidents reported by the Arlington County Police Department. For information, call 703-228-4331 or visit http://www.arlingtoncrimesolvers.org.

ASSAULTS

CLARENDON BLVD., 1800 block, 3:30 a.m. Nov. 22. After a dispute, a passenger attacked a cab driver.

CLARENDON BLVD., 2500 block, 2 a.m. Nov. 20. A cab driver was attacked. An Arlington man, 34, was charged with assault and battery.

GLEBE RD. S., 2900 block, 7:40 p.m. Nov. 21. A man threatened a male acquaintance at knifepoint. No injuries were reported.

LEE HWY., 6100 block, 12:01 a.m. Nov. 22. A cab driver threatened two people at knifepoint. The victims said they had just left the vehicle.

WILSON BLVD., 3100 block, 1:45 a.m. Nov. 22. During a dispute among a group of men, a fight broke out. A Virginia Beach man, 30, was charged with assault and battery.

ROBBERIES

HAYES ST. S., 1100 block, 2:30 p.m. Nov. 18. A man snatched a diamond bracelet from a store clerk's hand, then fled the premises.

HAYES ST. S., 1100 block, 8 p.m. Nov. 18. A male took a cellphone from a man's hand. A 17-year-old was arrested.

HAYES ST. S., 1100 block, 9:15 p.m. Nov. 18. A man reached over a counter at a jewelry store, then fled with jewelry.

JOYCE ST. S., 1600 block, 9:30 p.m. Nov. 18. A man got out of a vehicle and robbed a pedestrian of her purse at gunpoint.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

ARLINGTON BLVD., 4700 block, 8 p.m. Nov. 21 to 2 a.m. Nov. 22. Property was stolen from a residence.

ARMY NAVY DR., 800 block, 3:15 to 3:45 p.m. Nov. 23. Property was stolen from three vehicles in a parking garage.

GLEBE RD. N., 2800 block, 8 p.m. Nov. 22 to 7:30 a.m. Nov. 23. A laptop computer was stolen from a college office.

GLEBE RD. N., 600 block, 3:30 a.m. Nov. 17. Property was stolen from a business.

JEFFERSON DAVIS HWY., 3100 block, 9 p.m. Nov. 21 to noon Nov. 22. Navigation systems were stolen from two vehicles at a dealership.

JOYCE ST. S., 1200 block, 7 to 7:30 p.m. Nov. 24. Property was stolen from three lockers in a gym.

JOYCE ST. S., 1400 block, 7:45 p.m. Nov. 19. Police investigating a theft from a vehicle saw two men break into a nearby vehicle. A Hyattsville man, 28, and a Capital Heights man, 18, were charged with larceny from an auto.

KEY BLVD., 1400 block, 8:30 a.m. to 6 p.m. Nov. 19. Property was stolen from an apartment.

LOWELL ST. S., 2400 block, 1:40 to 3 a.m. Nov. 21. Property was stolen from a residence.

NINTH ST. N., 4000 block, 7 to 11 a.m. Nov. 24. Several laptop computers were stolen from an apartment.

18TH ST. S., 200 block, 2 p.m. Nov. 15 to 2:20 p.m. Nov. 24. Construction material was stolen from a construction site.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

JEFFERSON ST. S., 1000 block, Nov. 20. A blue 1995 Honda Civic was stolen.

QUINN ST. N., 1800 block, Nov. 24. A gray 1985 Oldsmobile sedan was stolen.

SECOND ST. S., 5700 block, Nov. 24. A silver-colored 2007 Toyota Rav4 was stolen.

EIGHTH RD. S., 5100 block, Nov. 21. A red 2002 Toyota Corolla was stolen.

16TH ST. S., 4200 block, Nov. 22. A gray 1995 Honda Civic was stolen.

-- Compiled by Ria Manglapus

Prince William County crime report


SECTION: METRO; Pg. T27


LENGTH: 637 words


Prince William County

These were among incidents reported by Prince William County police. For information, call 703-792-7245.

BRISTOW AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Diamond Hill Dr., 8700 block, 10:10 p.m. Sept. 21. A man entered a kitchen of a residence through a garage door. He fled empty-handedwhen a resident saw him.

Falcon Glen Ct., 9000 block, Sept. 17. A man entered a residence and was standing in a dining room when a resident saw him. He claimed to be a deliveryman, then left empty-handed. 

DUMFRIES AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Wayside Dr., 17200 block, 12:01 to 8:10 a.m. Sept. 21. Three computers, a video camera, a projector and a safe containing cash were stolen from a religious institution entered by forcing open a rear door.

HAYMARKET AREA

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Waverly Farm Dr., 4500 block, Aug. 20. A church volunteer allegedly used a cellphone to send sexually explicit messages to a female juvenile. A 22-year-old Mills River, N.C., man was arrested.

MANASSAS AREA

ROBBERIES

Clemson Ct., 7500 block, 8:50 p.m. Sept. 21. Three males assaulted a male juvenile pedestrian and robbed him of cash and earphones.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Ashland Ave., 7900 block, 10 a.m. to 1:30 p.m. Sept. 17. Cash was stolen from a residence entered by forcing a basement door.

Balls Ford Rd., 10300 block, 2:48 a.m. Sept. 21. An attempt was made to enter a residence by breaking a side window.

QUANTICO AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Potomac Ave., 300 block, 1:57 a.m. Sept. 21. An attempt was made to enter a business through a rear door.

WOODBRIDGE AREA

ASSAULTS

Meadowbrook Rd., 13800 block, 12:14 p.m. Sept. 21. During an argument, a man hit a female acquaintance, then grabbed her hair, causing her to fall and hit her head on concrete. She lost consciousness and later was treated for injuries. A 25-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

Minnieville Rd. and Hedgewood Dr., 4:36 p.m. Sept. 21. During an argument, a man hit a female acquaintance. A witness saw the man pick up the woman and carry her into a wooded area. A 27-year-old Woodbridge man was arrested.

Staples Mill Plaza, 5400 block, Sept. 11. A teacher reportedly bit a 13-month-old boy after the boy had bitten another teacher. A supervisor at the school allegedly failed to report the incident to Child Protective Services. A Woodbridge woman and a Manassas woman, both 24, were arrested.

WEAPONS

Mohican Rd., 12300 block, 7:28 p.m. Sept. 21. A male juvenile shot a pellet gun near a middle school track area. He fled into a wooded area when police responded. The next day, school personnel detained a male high school student who was near the middle school holding a pellet gun.

BOMB THREAT

Prince William Pkwy., 1600 block, 9:20 a.m. Sept. 19. Someone called a middle school with a bomb threat. The school was evacuated. No weapon was located. The caller was identified as a male juvenile.

ROBBERIES

Occoquan Rd., 13300 block, 1:24 a.m. Sept. 23. A masked gunman robbed a convenience store of cash.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Kinkade Lane, 12900 block, 9 p.m. Sept. 21 to 8:15 a.m. Sept. 22. An attempt was made to enter a residence by damaging a rear door.

Seville Ct., 2600 block, 8:30 p.m. Sept. 20 to 12:15 a.m. Sept. 21. Cash and other property were stolen from a residence entered through an unlocked rear door.

Manassas

No reports were received from Manassas police for this edition of Local Living. For information, call 703-257-8000.

Manassas Park

These were among incidents reported by Manassas Park police. For more information, call 703-361-1136.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Cabbel Dr., 10 p.m. Sept. 20 to 9 a.m. Sept. 21. Property was stolen from the front yard of a residence.

Euclid Ave., 8200 block, 2 p.m. Sept. 15 to 5:45 a.m. Sept. 16. Two collectible model race cars were stolen from an office.

Moseby Ct., Sept. 11 to Sept. 12. A gun was stolen from a residence.

- Compiled by Sarah Lane

Southern Maryland crime report Southern Maryland crime report


SECTION: METRO; Pg. T22


LENGTH: 981 words


Calvert County

These were among reports received by the Calvert County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. Anyone with information about these crimes should call the Criminal Investigation Division, 410-535-2800 or 301-855-1194, or the Crime Solvers line, 410-535-2880. You can also call the Prince Frederick Barrack of the state police at 410-535-1400.

HUNTINGTOWN AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

All Day Rd., 4:44 p.m., Oct. 23. A man and two women attempted to steal a boat from a pond. A man, 30, and two women, 28 and 53, were charged with trespassing and theft. A youth was also charged with trespassing and theft.  

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Spears Rd., Oct. 23. A Polaris Magnum was stolen, and hunting equipment was taken from other vehicles. Three Huntingtown youths ages 13, 13 and 15, and one Owings youth, 15, were arrested. The charges included theft and destruction of property. Police said that most of the property had been recovered but that some of it was damaged.

LUSBY AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

CanyonTrail, Oct. 16 to Oct. 17. A purse, a calculator and a flash drive were stolen from a vehicle.

Chart Ct., Oct. 21. A laptop computer was stolen from a residence.

Club House Dr., Oct. 16 to 17. A handbag was stolen from a vehicle.

Corral Dr., Oct. 16 to 17. A purse was stolen from a vehicle. The purse was recovered nearby. Cash had been removed.

Coyote Ct., 11:46 a.m., Oct. 17. Property was stolen from two vehicles.

Hemlock Rd., Oct. 16 to 17. A vehicle break-in occurred. Nothing was reported missing..

High Sierra Rd., Oct. 16 to 17. A wallet and an MP3 were stolen from a vehicle.

High Sierra Rd., Oct. 16 to 17. A purse was stolen from a vehicle.

Highview Cir., Oct. 16 to 17. A vehicle break-in was reported. Nothing was reported missing.

Pine Trail, Oct. 16 to 17. Tools were stolen from a vehicle.

SOLOMONS AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Clipper Cir., Oct. 16 to 17. A stereo was damaged during a vehicle break-in. Nothing was reported missing.

Holiday Dr., Oct. 16 to 17. A navigator, a cellphone accessory and sunglasses were among property stolen from two vehicles parked at a motel.

Windjammer Ave., Oct. 16 to 17. An MP3 player was stolen from a vehicle.

OWINGS AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Wander Dr., Oct. 14 to 17. During a break-in at a home, property was damaged and paint was poured on a floor. Nothing was reported missing.

Wander Dr., Oct. 14 to 17. A break-in occurred at a storage shed. Nothing was reported missing.

Charles County

These were among reports received by the Charles County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. For information, call 301-932-2222 or 301-870-3232. Crime Solvers will pay a reward for information leading to an arrest and an indictment in connection with these and other crimes. Call the 24-hour hotline at 866-411-8477. Callers may remain anonymous. The Charles County Sheriff's Office Web site iswww.ccso.us. Included at the site are daily news releases, Crime Watch neighborhood statistics, community services, crime prevention programs and career opportunities.

INDIAN HEAD AREA

ROBBERIES

Route 210, Oct. 26. A D.C. resident was arrested in connection with three gas station robberies in early October. The man, 53, was charged with armed robbery and was also charged in connection with the theft of lottery tickets from a Waldorf store.

NEWBURG AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Rock Point Rd., 12:01 to 9:30 a.m., Oct. 25. A dirt bike was stolen from the front porch of a residence.

WALDORF AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Falmouth Rd., 5 a.m. to 4 p.m., Oct. 20. Computers and jewelry were stolen from a residence.

Market Pl., 3000 block, 10:09 p.m., Oct. 24. A purse was stolen from a table outside of a restaurant. A male was seen fleeing with the property towards a wooded area.

Old Washington Rd., 3800 block, 9:18 p.m., Oct. 22. Copper piping was stolen from a home that was for sale.

WELCOME AREA

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Henson Landing Rd., 7000 block, 1 to 2:40 p.m., Oct. 26. Jewelry was stolen from a home.

St. Mary's County

These were among reports received by the St. Mary's County Sheriff's Office and the Maryland State Police. For information, call 301-475-8008, or the Crime Solvers line, 301-475-3333. The Leonardtown Barrack of the Maryland State Police operates a 24-hour anonymous tip line at 301-475-2936.

DAMERON AREA

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Dameron, Oct. 25. A man sexually assaulted two acquaintances. A man, 63, was charged with two counts of child sexual abuse and two counts of fourth-degree sex offense.

GREAT MILLS AREA

ASSAULTS

Iverson Dr., 11:30 p.m., Oct. 22. During an argument, a man grabbed an acquaintance by the hair and threw her to the ground. A man, 34, was charged with second-degree assault.

LEXINGTON PARK AREA

HOMICIDES

Sell Dr., Aug. 24. Police continued to investigate the shooting death of Deandre Agustus Hawkins, 21, of Lexington Park, whose body was found in a vehicle that had crashed into a tree. Anyone with information is asked to contact R. McCoy at 301-475-4200, Ext. 9119.

ASSAULTS

Ritz Dr., 9:30 p.m., Oct. 23. During an argument, a woman scratched an acquaintance. A woman, 41, was charged with second-degree assault.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Enterprise Rd. and N. Essex Dr., 2:10 a.m., Oct. 22. After making a traffic stop on a vehicle displaying a license plate that had been reported stolen, police determined that the vehicle itself had been reported stolen. Two 19-year-old Leonardtown men were arrested. Charges included motor vehicle theft, theft and drug possession.

ARSON

Essex Dr. N., 10:30 p.m., Oct. 26. Police responding to a report of a man standing on the street near a residence and threatening to "shoot the house up and burn it down," arrested a 21-year-old Lexington Park man. He was charged with threat of arson.

MECHANICSVILLE AREA

ASSAULTS

Army-Navy Dr., 7 a.m. Oct. 23. During an argument, a man punched an acquaintance in the face, head and body. A man, 32, was charged with second-degree assault.

- Compiled by Bonnie Smith


LOAD-DATE: November 4, 2011


LANGUAGE: ENGLISH


PUBLICATION-TYPE: Newspaper

Arlington County

These were among incidents reported by the Arlington County Police Department. For information, call 703-228-4331 or visitwww.arlingtoncrimesolvers.org.

SEXUAL ASSAULTS

Orme St. S., 900 block, 2:30 a.m. Feb. 20. A man pressed himself against a woman in an elevator.

ASSAULTS

Clarendon Blvd., 3100 block, 12:45 a.m. Feb. 9. A man in a bar struck a male in the head with a drinking glass. A Springfield man, 38, was arrested.

George Mason Dr. S., 1900 block, 11:30 p.m. Feb. 20. Two men attacked a man who said he had been drinking. No injuries were reported.

ROBBERIES

Highland St. S., 900 block, 3 p.m. Feb. 13. A man robbed a pedestrian of her purse.

Oakland St. N., 900 block, 10 p.m. Feb. 18. Two men attacked a male and robbed him of a wallet.

THEFTS/BREAK-INS

Arlington Ridge Rd. S., 1500 block, 10 a.m. to 12:30 p.m. Feb. 22. Break-ins occurred at two apartments. Nothing was reported missing.

Arlington Ridge Rd. S., 1500 block, 1 p.m. Feb. 22. An attempt was made to break into an apartment. Nothing was reported missing.

Army Navy Dr., 800 block, 12:45 to 10 p.m. Feb. 17. Property was stolen from two vehicles in a parking garage.

Edgewood St. S., 400 block, 9 p.m. Feb. 16 to 8:30 a.m. Feb. 17. Property was stolen from seven vehicles.

Four Mile Run Dr., 4000 block, 11 a.m. Feb. 19. During a traffic stop, it was determined that a vehicle was displaying stolen license plates. An Arlington woman, 29, was charged with possession of stolen property.

Highland St. N., 500 block, 6 p.m. Feb. 19 to 11 a.m. Feb. 20. Tools were stolen from a residence under renovation.

Pershing Dr. N., 3700 block, 6:30 p.m. Feb. 18 to 10 a.m. Feb. 19. Property was stolen from a residence under renovation.

Quincy St. N., 800 block, 5:15 p.m. Feb. 18 to 11 a.m. Feb. 22. A laptop computer was stolen from an office suite.

Quincy St. N., 1000 block, 8 p.m. Feb. 21 to 7 a.m. Feb. 22. Property was stolen from three vehicles.

Quincy St. S., 2800 block, 1 a.m. Feb. 21. Several cartons of cigarettes were stolen from a business entered by breaking a window.

Randolph St. N., 800 block, noon Feb. 18 to 11 a.m. Feb. 19. Property was stolen from eight vehicles in a parking garage.

Rhodes St. N., 1900 block, 1 to 9:30 p.m. Feb. 22. An attempt was made to break into an apartment. Nothing was reported missing.

Wilson Blvd., 3200 block, 6 to 11:30 p.m. Feb. 19. Property was stolen from two vehicles in a parking lot.

Ninth St. S., 2300 block, 4 p.m. Feb. 20 to 10 a.m. Feb. 21. Property was stolen from two vehicles.

20th St. N., 400 block, 9 a.m. to 2:30 p.m. Feb. 20. Property was stolen from two vehicles.

24th St. N., 6400 block, 11 a.m. to 1:30 p.m. Feb. 17. An attempt was made to break into a residence. Nothing was reported missing.

MOTOR VEHICLE THEFTS

Four Mile Run Dr.,3700 block. A blue 2005 Ford Crown Victoria was stolen.

Irving St. N., 600 block. A silver-colored 2000 Honda Accord was stolen.

Meade St. S., 2800 block. A blue 1993 Toyota Camry was stolen.

Oakland St. S., 200 block, 10 p.m. Feb. 16. A motorist fled during a traffic stop of a vehicle that had been reported stolen. After a brief foot chase, an Arlington man, 18, was arrested. He was charged with grand larceny.

Quincy St. N., 800 block. A green 2002 Honda Civic was stolen.

Randolph St. N., 600 block. A black 2010 Dodge Charger was stolen.

13th Rd. S., 3200 block. A blue 1999 Toyota Camry was stolen.

- Compiled by Ria Manglapus
